Reviews.Author: Andrea H.
Reviews.Content: Atmosphere: 5 // Service: 5 // Food: 5 // Price: 5A perfectly executed meal. Came here with a group of four on a Thursday over the July 4 holiday and were seated in about 20 minutes. There were plenty of thrift stores around to browse as we waited, so it wasn't painful at all.Our server was Jason, and he was INCREDIBLE. Attentive, really friendly, welcoming, funny - overall a dude that I think you would imagine is that perfect server in a dream world, but never really can find. One of the key points of breakfast was the place's hot sauce that we low key wanted to steal, and then Jason joked that he would totally understand if he came back to find it missing. He got us. It was also reasonably portioned -- with each of us ordering hour own entrees and the French toast as an appetizer, we were stuffed (and it's hard to get me stuffed). I didn't get to try any of my friends' plates (we were all kind of hoarding our own food because it was SO DELICIOUS) but they each got benedicts they raved about.--Crunchy French Toast (appetizer/side) - I'm going to be honest -- I'm not a fan of French toast, but I LOVED this. The bread was the perfect texture - fluffy and light on the inside with a nice, soft crisp on the outside. The fruits were fresh, and everything combined so well with the dipping sauce. 10/10 would buy each time to split with the party.Kamil's Lunch (entree) - I was in the mood for something ultra filling and was worried that brunch foods wouldn't be enough, so I opted for the first goulash of my life (partially convinced by the word MACARONI shouting EAT ME in my face). Definitely the right choice for me. Savory but not salty, filling but not heavy (you know, when you don't hate yourself for being a person that needed to eat), with the most perfect balance of macaroni pasta with broth with tender, delicious, beautiful meats and vegetables. With the hot sauce too - oh man, this meal was unstoppable. I'm now a proud lover of goulash, and I can't wait to come back and try other new dishes because obviously this is the place to do so!

Reviews.Author: Zoey O.
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of eggs benedict and was told this was a great place to try it! My friend and I came here on a busy Saturday afternoon. We were told it was going to be a 45 minute wait for two, but we were seated within the first 3 minutes of waiting! I was not too impressed by the service. Yes, the restaurant was busy, but it seemed as if they were understaffed. Our server walked past the table at least three times before welcoming us. We asked for water and then told us the water would be right out when he came back to take our order. When the food arrived, we had still not gotten our water. The english muffin was cold, which made it a little less enjoyable. While the food was okay, I will not be returning due to the service.

Reviews.Author: Martha E.
Reviews.Content: The only reason I'm knocking off a star is because the line/wait for this place can get out of control. We're talking 45 minutes to an hour. AND, they don't sit incomplete parties. I can understand that last bit, but the wait.. ooof, it's brutal. Luckily, there's nearby awnings and therefore shade while we wait so it's not too bad. The food is delicious and very well presented. We had their benedict, the risotto, crunchy french toast and a steak/hash sort of situation. All perfection! The eggs were all perfectly poached, too, which is just icing on a very delicious breakfast cake... well done, kitchen staff!The waitstaff is (servers AND bussers) SUCH PERFECTION! My water was never empty and our server, Martin, wasn't hovering over the table but just perfectly present and nearby and had a great sense of timing when it came to check on us. His demeanor, attitude and service was just so refreshing considering it was a busy morning and we were a table of 4. Hooray for none of the  Also, very random, BUT the water here is delicious. I think there's mint and citrus in it, but it's so light of a flavor that you have to really strain your taste buds to find it. IT'S DELICIOUS! I would absolutely drink 8 glasses of water a day if it tasted like this :)I can't wait to come back on a (hopefully) less busy day!

Reviews.Author: Brian S.
Reviews.Content: I lived around the corner for a few years and shockingly never made it in here.  Now I finally had a chance to stop in for brunch after the weekend rush.  The atmosphere is casual and menu expansive.  I can see why this place is so popular!I had their signature crispy french toast, which was like crack, seriously.  It soon became a bit much to take, though, so I wish it ultimately came with less french toast and more (or any) of some sort of side.All said, I'll try and make it back here.  Is it worth the hour and a half wait I hear about?  Eh, not sure.  But if you can make it in quickly, definitely give it a go.

Reviews.Author: Lodanve C.
Reviews.Content: We used to always order their Benedict, but once we got to try their Eggwich, we couldn't go back. Its the best breakfast sandwich ever! If you never tried it, its a must order then. We brought a friend with us, and he finished his plate including the potatoes before us! It basically has over easy eggs, strips of crispy smoked bacon, fresh avocado, sliced tomatoes, arugula, and pistou aioli on ciabatta. Must warn you though, it can get a little messy. So make sure you go with people that you're comfortable with. It also includes their crispy red potatoes. Almost forgot to mention that, if you can eat spiciness then you definitely have to eat it with their tabanero sauce! Another dish that is a must order is their blueberry pancakes. I think their pancakes tasted way better than their crunchy french toast. To me their crunchy french toast was a little bland. There was nothing special about that particular dish. We had their earl grey before, it tasted quite interesting. It smelled and tasted like cupcakes! Their Arnold Palmer are refillable in case you didn't know! I tried a couple of their juices, and they were pretty good and fresh too. Their might be a lot of people here but I noticed that the waits are never too long. So don't let that scare you off!

Reviews.Author: Melody T.
Reviews.Content: Great service. Great food. Three of us girls shared the crunch french toast, florentine scramble and the brunch carbonara. All were great and we were glad we shared to balance the salty and sweet. Plus, just too many things to choose from!We arrived at 10am Sunday and the wait wasn't too bad - 20-30 mins? Much longer when we left at 11:30.

Reviews.Author: Christine T.
Reviews.Content: I've been to Blu Jam Cafe before and was a tad disappointed during a recent visit. Seems like the only thing good on the menu is the french toast. I met some friends for lunch on a Friday, I had the tuscany salad and added grilled chicken. My salad was good and came with this amazing vinaigrette dressing. The chicken though was overcooked and so dry. It was hard to swallow each pieces.I'm in no hurry to be back.

Reviews.Author: Maryam M.
Reviews.Content: Best French Toast EVER!!!!I live in San Francisco aka food paradise but hands down this was the best French toast I've ever had.Also Great Service!

Reviews.Author: Diana L.
Reviews.Content: I've been stupidly stubborn about not going to this place. It's a couple blocks away from my house but the lines are always so long. And the little dogs on their patio are always barking at our husky when we walk innocently by. So we've been avoiding the drama.That is, until the other day, when we happened to be up early and groggily stumbled into Blu Jam, hungry for eggs. Their Migas are off the hook. And that Crunchy French Toast? Forget about it. Get these two things and I promise you'll leave happy.

Reviews.Author: Gwen B.
Reviews.Content: While staying in Beverly Hills, I was looking for some prime brunch places and Blu Jam ended up on practically every list so we decided to give it a go. We waited just over an hour on a Saturday afternoon, it was around 12:30pm when we arrived. It was super packed inside and tons of groups writing so we waited beyond our  predicted wait time of 50 minutes.I had read about the infamous crunchy French toast so of course I had to have it. We ordered a savory dish, the eggs Benedict, to share as our second dish. I highly recommend ordering a savory dish because as amazing as the crunchy French toast is, it's sweet and great to have something to balance this out. We also ordered a side of the apple sausage which in retrospect we didn't need and was just ok.The French toast lived up to the hype, we ate every last bite! The eggs Benedict was good but not the best Benedict I've ever had. It was all very fresh and tasty though, certainly a must try for brunch! Just be prepared to wait for quite a bit on the weekends.

Reviews.Author: Shirley G.
Reviews.Content: Came here for brunch with my cousin since he was in town and I've heard great things about this place. I was torn between the chilaquiles or their infamous crunchy french toast. So, I got the crunchy french toast and it was crunchy for sure! The french toast comes with a vanilla bean milky sauce which made me think of eating a bowl of cereal and milk but deconstructed. The crunch from the french toast and the milky taste from the sauce lol. Anyways, it was delicious and my cousin got the breakfast carbonara and he really enjoyed it. I took a bite and it was flavorful and delicious too!

Reviews.Author: Olfa B.
Reviews.Content: The egg avocado sandwich is to die for... Can't get enough of it. The French toasts are amazing as well. Seriously one of the best breakfast spot in LA. The only bad thing is how long you have to wait but it worth it. Plus, they get your phone number when you arrive then they send you a text when you table is ready, so you can go shopping on melrose while you're getting ready to have an amazing breakfast :)Highly recommend this place

Reviews.Author: Bishop W.
Reviews.Content: I would drive by this place all the darn time wondering why the FRAK were there so many hipsters, yuppies, oldmenwithwhiteblazersandshortswithpinkshirts on; standing in line for??? Ohhh, its a cafe. I said to myself this is PINKs all over again. I must see what its all about. So one bright and spunky Sunday morning (which became afternoon bc of the long a$$ wait) I decided to pack up the Ford with my roomies and head on down to this hyped up cafe. Of course, there was a wait. Of course ppl got a lil antsy and irritated and rude. And of course I saw some nice eye candy (its LA, man). Finally after an hour (AN HOUR+) we go it in. YAYYY!!! One roommate mentioned the interior was a lackluster. He expected something different, something greater. We all agreed but I was more interested in the food. I ordered the BREAKFAST TRIO. The sausage was OK, the french toast was OK, small but thick (ladies), the bacon was very thin but juicy, I could have done without.. But the eggs; my good sir, the eggs were fluffy and bright and beautiful! Best eggs Ive had in LA (so far).Other than the uninspired inside, the staff was cool and cooperative and attentive and understanding. The "hype" and long lines are TOTALLY unnecessary. Its not like one bite and you get super powers or you start using your left brain but the food is alright but overrated. I would go back when the wait isnt a lifetime.

Reviews.Author: Tiana T.
Reviews.Content: Probably the best eggs Benedict I've had in L.A. And I'm a Benedict snob. The only downside is the long lines, but I'm an early bird and don't mind going early and beating the crowd. Its trendy so its a big pricey but worth it. Def going back!Also the coconut cream tea with milk and vanilla French toast omg mmmmmmmmmm

Reviews.Author: Megha M.
Reviews.Content: You have to get their crunchy French toast!! It's absolutely amazing. Friends I went with ordered lunch items and it didn't look like anything special. So if you do go here, just go for breakfast/brunch. It's nice inside and service is good. Oh and they serve mint infused water which is never a bad thing.

Reviews.Author: Suzanne C.
Reviews.Content: Oh yeah. Love this place. I got the oatmeal and it was awesome. Also, I can't tell you how often I order my poached eggs, friend eggs or boiled eggs 'medium' and they NEVER come out that way. They are usually liquid or overdone. It's so frustrating bc I can make them at home  medium. But I asked for medium here for my poached eggs and voila! Medium. So awesome. It sounds stupid, I know. But I like my eggs a certain way. And if I can cook them that way it shouldn't be hard to achieve that. But it usually is. So when a place gets it right. I'm happy. This place is casual and busy! But I would totally go back. My meal was great. Nice service too.

Reviews.Author: Wendy G.
Reviews.Content: We dined at BLU JAM on many occasions. It's our favorite breakfast in the city. Fantastic menu, very eclectic, interesting and tasty. The Czech owner really knows how to put together an amazing menu. It's easy to find there your new favorite dish! On the weekends it gets really busy, so you might probably have to wait, but wait. It's worth it!

Reviews.Author: Kari T.
Reviews.Content: The wait is always so long I def suggest coming on a week day. The wait is a little less.Super cute place. And their food is amazing! And their coffee is delicious! Service is good but the seating is so close to each other it feels cramped. Parking can sometimes be hard to find but try residential areas but be sure there isn't street sweeping.

Reviews.Author: Lola W.
Reviews.Content: Based on their mouth watering French toast alone, I give this place five resounding stars. Covered from crust to crust in a fresh berry blend of strawberries and blueberries, this French toast pairs perfectly with the vanilla dipping sauce that is served on the side.  The chefs have worked a miracle as It's outside layer is crisped to perfection and the inside remains flakey and soft. I am not a huge French toast fan, but this place has converted me.Their menu is vast and with gluten free, vegan, and vegetarian options served alongside the carnivorous creations, Blu Jam caters to all of LAs patrons.

Reviews.Author: Nicole K.
Reviews.Content: After an amazing hike at Runyon (only 1.5 miles away), my friend and I came to Blu Jam café. .. starving. Lol. It was still pretty early when we got there (9am Saturday morning).. but it was packed.  We waited about 15-20 mins to get seated... not too bad, but I cant imagine what the wait is between 11am-1pm. First off... I really like their lemon/mint infused water. Lol random, but it was so refreshing!! I really like how they offer it while you wait as well.We ordered the Crunchy french toast, Florentine benedict, and blueberry pancakes.  The Crunchy french toast is true as yelp describes it.... Amazinggg! Who wouldve thought that corn flakes on french toast would taste so good?? I love how they include some white, vanilla-ish dipping sauce instead of syrup.. reminded me of warm condensed milk... creamy, sweet, and the perfect side for the french toasts!Florentine benedict was also very good... perfectly poached eggs, but I was not a fan of either the sundried tomatoes or sauce on it that gave it a hint of something sour.  I'd probably go with just the regular benedict next time.Blueberry pancakes were nothing special.  I guess im just not a big fan of pancakes or warm berries. Lol, but my friend seemed to enjoy it.  Overall had a great big breakfast and was so glad that I came to try the place.  I think im going to have some insane cravings for that crunchy french toast and probably drive 30 miles just to eat it... lol great stuff!

Reviews.Author: Shima S.
Reviews.Content: OMG! One of the best brunches I have ever had! Although we were a big group ( around 7) we were seated fairly quickly. They don't take reservation. I ordered from their organic fresh juice and it was a glass of awesomeness. We ordred several things and from what I heard from everyone in the group, everyone was happy. We ordered the French Toast, Florentine Benedict ( my order which was yummm) and something with steak and some gluten-free risotto. Highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Author: Vidisha S.
Reviews.Content: Disappointed. Very salty potatoes as well as the Benedict. Less quantities for prices as compared to restaurants in the league. Good ambience. Reminds me of Brooklyn. Good hosts.

Reviews.Author: Khush B.
Reviews.Content: My brother-in-law and I ordered the "Crunchy French Toast" and two of my cousins ordered the Florentine Benedict (with bacon); tried them both and it was pretty amazing. The French toast comes with this vanilla bean sauce (which is good) but I still wanted my maple syrup (with which our kind waitress provided). I'm thinking of coming back one day to try out their healthy/protein/lean menu - looked delicious! :)

Reviews.Author: Shazeen N.
Reviews.Content: I have been at this place several times and love the food. Service is also outstanding BUT there's a HUGE BUT !!!  The wait here is ridiculous... I seriously wish they expand and get some more square footage to accommodate more people cuz every time I brought my friends n family we always have to wait for so long that it gets annoying. I seriously wish the management will consider expanding !!! And try not to use the bathroom FYI they are soooo nasty like gas station restrooms yuck !!!

Reviews.Author: Ameera N.
Reviews.Content: I've finaaaaaally had the best French toast, ever.It's crunchy on the outside, yet perfectly soft and fluffy on the inside. It's not disgustingly sweet or drenched in syrup. It's just... perfect! The vanilla bean sauce they serve it with gets sucked right up by the French toast and it goes together so much better than with syrup. Their French press is actually to die for as well. Servers are always sweet and efficient.If it wasn't such a long drive (and long wait) I'd be having breakfast here way more often.

Reviews.Author: Justin B.
Reviews.Content: Great brunch place for Sunday. But if you go around 11am, you have to wait for at least 30 min. But food is good, so worth it, I think. No complaint for here. Always left with good feeling.

Reviews.Author: Charlie L.
Reviews.Content: Yeah, another "me too," that this is a great breakfast spot, and worth the wait.When we heard that our friends would "go early and stand in line," I thought it might not be worth the trouble. I WAS WRONG. Yes, parking is tough. Yes, it's a line. But it is TOTALLY worth it.There were five of us, and we all had something different. Everybody loved their meals. We had a steak hash, and were concerned it might be too "pureed," as they sometimes are, but nope, nice chunks of steak. They make it "skillet-style," so it came out as a rounded, one inch high steak and stuff to which we added bacon (because, well, BACON) and had the eggs on the side, rather than on top. Others had the Roma Via Paris, Loxex (smoked salmon and eggs), and the Brunch Burger (there's always ONE person in the crowd who doesn't want breakfast). Everybody was pleased with their food preparation and taste.Their juices are excellent, especially the orange and cucumber.We didn't have their signature french toast, but wished we had when the people at the next table got theirs delivered and split it between their entrees. Why didn't WE think of that? We could have split one across the table. Well, next time we're in LA for a wedding, that's on the list.Plan on waiting in line for this special place. Plan on LOVING it.

Reviews.Author: Mrs. R.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved their Argentinian Brunch Steak!There was quite a bit of wait but it was expected as we had a big party.

Reviews.Author: Helen P.
Reviews.Content: Wow, I can see what the hype is about this place!! My friend & I got here on a Saturday around 9am after our tedious hike from Runyon. We waited about 15 minutes or so, wait wasn't too bad. We found street parking right around the corner.We ordered the infamous Crunchy French Toast, Florentine Benedict & a single Blueberry pancake (wish they had banana). The french toast is amazinggggggg!!! It comes with this vanilla bean sauce that tastes like a melted condensed milk. I was wondering why they didn't provide regular maple syrup, but the vanilla bean sauce complements the french toast better. The benedict & pancake were both very good, but definitely doesn't compare to the french toast. Just thinking about the french toast is making my mouth water~I would definitely come back to get their Crunchy French Toast! I recommend going early though because as we were leaving, the line was long & I can only imagine how hard finding parking would be.

Reviews.Author: Kaitlin W.
Reviews.Content: Delicious food, great service. Not the best I've had of either, but worth a visit. It's disappointing that they won't allow dogs on the outdoor patio that's literally on the public sidewalk, but will allow people to smoke cigarettes which is way more disturbing to a dining experience.

Reviews.Author: Jade P.
Reviews.Content: After going to BLD for years, this place just doesn't add up. The wait is long, food wasn't memorable, the only thing I would come back for would be the crunchy French toast.

Reviews.Author: Christine S.
Reviews.Content: Cute place for brunch! After hearing about Blu Jam from friends for months, I finally got to check it out last Saturday. The Crunchy French Toast was delicious. I usually don't enjoy sweets in the morning but I decided to try it since it's Blu Jam's specialty. It was crunchy and not too sweet! DerriciousAlso ordered a side of potatoes. The portions were a lot bigger than I thought, so you could share a side with another person!All in all, food was great and the cafe itself is super cute. BUT we did have to wait for about 30-40 minutes. You're allowed to wander around and look at the shops around the cafe, but if they call your name and you miss it- you have to wait for another 15-20 minutes. If you're not in a rush and looking for a cute place to grab brunch with friends, check out Blu Jam!
Reviews.Author_Location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

Reviews.Author: Shiven G.
Reviews.Content: I was waiting to go to this place for a while, finally got a chance.Let me start with some warnings: Wait time is long and food portions are huge. Of course as it is located on Melrose, parking could be a problem specially over weekend. Be careful as most of the perpendicular street parking is reserved for local people with permit.Now lets go to the food.  To say that this place has the best bf/brunch in LA is an understatement. It does not disappoint your taste buds (apart from your wallet, can get pricey). My recommendation would be the Italian Breakfast, of course the Crunchy French toast (you will see it on every table) and the Breakfast Quesadilla. Accompanied by Mocha coffee will be the perfect start you would get for the day. Don't miss this place and yes, be prepared to wait before you get a table.

Reviews.Author: Sapora B.
Reviews.Content: Been here a few times for breakfast. The food is pretty good. I always try to get something unique, because if I just wanted eggs I would stay home and make them myself. Lol. We usually stop by on a whim when we see that the line has died down. The atmosphere is hip... but loud when crowded. The only negative that stands out would be my observation of the host staff... although they are very friendly some of them seem to be susceptible to flattery and other cut-the-line tactics. Yes, there is a velvet rope but no this isn't a nightclub. Lol. Anyway, kudos to the waitstaff inside, they are very helpful and attentive. They also offer communal seating, which is only annoying if you have to sit with snooty L.A. people. I rather sit with friendly tourists :)

Reviews.Author: Cesar N.
Reviews.Content: Their signature crunchy French toast was amazing! Best I've ever had. I also ordered potatoes and bacon side dishes (they were fine). The wait during weekends is pretty long, especially for a day in summer, but it was worth it. Staff was friendly.

Reviews.Author: Pamela S.
Reviews.Content: Delicious! I went hiking by the Griffith Observatory last Sunday and came here for brunch afterward. We got here at 9:00 something and were lucky to be seated right away for a table of two.Everything sounded so good. I ordered the Cobb Omelet and my friend got the Maui Brunch Sandwich, both off of the Specials menu. Both came in huge portions - mine looked like it could have been split into three meals. It was amazing, and kind of interesting because it's a mix between traditional breakfast and my favorite type of salad, minus the salad greens. The potatoes that both dishes came with was very tasty. We also both had the french press coffee - strong and smooth.Very friendly service, but we noticed that some of the mugs and cups were dirty. My friend's cup had significantly noticeable leftover dried food/sauce on the side of it, which is pretty gross so he did ask for a new cup. Hoping this is not a frequent occurrence.Besides that, this is the perfect place for brunch. Also appreciate that vegan options are available, and that they use nearby farms. Definitely recommend and can't wait to try other options from the breakfast menu.

Reviews.Author: Anna-Marie T.
Reviews.Content: This place does NOT value your time. My friends and I came here for brunch and were told that there would be a 45 minute wait to get a table (which we were fine with because we knew this place is extremely popular) and it ended up being a 2 hour wait!! The host was extremely unorganized and forgetful. After our two hour wait, she called our name and when we went up to the front to be seated she forgot that she had called our name and let us know that our table would be ready in 15 minutes. HORRIBLE service. The food here is good but not worth the wait. You can definitely go to a different breakfast place and get the same foods for much less hassle. I had a Norwegian Benedict (Lox, English muffin, poached egg and hollandaise sauce) and it tasted fine, nothing special. My friend ordered the French toast and the presentation was perfect - it almost looked too pretty to eat. Over all, this place is extremely over-hyped. If you can't arrive right when it opens, I suggest going somewhere else.

Reviews.Author: Al A.
Reviews.Content: This place was pretty cool. I definitely liked the ambiance and young environment. It's one of the trendier places that I've been to for breakfast/brunch. The food I ordered was way too spicy and gave me a bad stomach ache. I felt like I had food poisoning all of the next day. Too bad because the waiter was extremely nice and I would have definitely gone back for the crowd.

Reviews.Author: Karen X.
Reviews.Content: Hipster spot. Wait even on a Thursday brunch. The must try, as mentioned by many is the crunchy French toast! It's French toast with a frosted flakey layer! You'll see it at every table. Other than that, the other breakfast items are of the norm. They don't serve hashbrowns, or fries. Just a side of potatoes. Bummer. Will return only if in the area. Wouldn't drive out if my way to grab a bite.

Reviews.Author: Elaine W.
Reviews.Content: If you live in LA, you gotta have brunch. Blu Jam definitely lives up to the hype for it's amazing food.My friend and I got there on a weekday at 10:30 and waited about 25 minutes. I can't imagine what the wait is like on weekends if it's so crowded during that time! Anyways, we ordered the Norwegian Benedict and of course, the crunchy French toast plus some coffee. Both dishes were amazing. The Benedict was perfect, with plenty of lox, eggs poached to perfection, and a beautifully done dill hollandaise that wasn't too cloying. My stomach is grumbling just thinking about it. The French toast was wonderful as well, not overpoweringly sweet with that amazing crunch from the corn flakes! I loved that vanilla cream is used instead of maple syrup. The coffee was good and I liked that the water was infused with mint. It's quite easy to find street parking but make sure you read the signs! I'll be back to try that risotto next time...

Reviews.Author: Angie M.
Reviews.Content: Semi long wait...but totally worth it!!!Came here with my boyfriend for the first time since my coworker recommended it to me months ago! Definitely the place to go for French toast. So delicious...and very very filling! I got a simple yet amazing breakfast with eggs, toast, potatoes and chicken apple sausage...I normally don't like sausage but I was curious to see what it would taste like and it did not disappoint. All in all, this place was a delight. Good service. Great quality food. Awesome price. And you definitely don't leave there with an empty stomach. I will be coming back for more!!!!

Reviews.Author: Jonathan B.
Reviews.Content: Fucking Amazing! enough said.In fact I may lower the star rating on my other reviews because they do not belong on the same Five Star level as Blu Jam Cafe!

Reviews.Author: Suki W.
Reviews.Content: I love the food here but I feel so sad in the same time because my mom didn't:( admittedly, the breads of the uptown sandwich is too sour and hard for her, but the potato is good the cheese and turkey is good! I had no idea why she hated it:( she only ate a quarter of the half sandwich and stopped:( make me feel so sad. I really wanna do something beautiful for her! My white eggs dish is delicious! It has chicken breast and 6 white eggs with fried veggies inside! I love the sauce especially! The coffee and the juice r all good! And we didn't wait that long. I think about 15mjns we got our table. In all, I give it four stars for the food. the service was a little bit slow tho. Next time I will def come with my friends who appreciate foods !!!

Reviews.Author: Allister D.
Reviews.Content: Today the line was so long! It took me and my friend almost an hour to be seated. The food is worth the wait though!The space inside the cafe is pretty big; great amount of seating and moving-around space. The service is quick and they check on the guests frequently. This was superb. I had to order the famous crunch french toast which was amazing. It's more of a texture thing; it was crunchy and had a fluffy inside bite with a hint of coconut milk (that's what I'm guessing). The portion was just right. The Creme dipping sauce for the toast was fantastic! It soaks the toast up and becomes a sweet milky taste for added flavor. This was $15! Great choice!Blu Jam is a great place to come for brunch and is better with friends! I'll be def coming back for more! Thanks!

Reviews.Author: Jenny N.
Reviews.Content: Really good meal for brunch. Highly recommend Crunch French Toast if you are a sweet food person. It serve with the vanilla bean syrup, tip it with the French Toast it's just so perfect! You won't regret! Eggwish is another must try! It comes with tomato, avocado, baked bacon, and egg. It just taste so good when everything combined together! Me and my friend order 2 things above with 2 soup of the day, the total is $46. Not bad.

Reviews.Author: Karyn S.
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome ! I searched high and low for a brunch place to take my mom for Mother's Day. We only waited about 30 mins and then was seated on the sidewalk patio area. Based on other reviews we ordered the crunchy French toast and the kamil's breakfast. We also got the vanilla lattes blended. The crunchy French toast was to die for, I'm pretty sure the whole patio had ordered it. It was by far the best French toast I have ever had. Kamil's breakfast was just okay. I had greater expectations of it. The eggs weren't all the way cooked and so the whole dish was watery. There was also a spice that was throwing the whole dish off. Probably wouldn't order it again. Only downfall of the restaurant. No alcohol. My mom was pretty upset that she couldn't order a mimosa or a Bloody Mary to go with her brunch.

Reviews.Author: Eileen W.
Reviews.Content: The crunchy French toast is a MUST -- you won't regret!Blu Jam Cafe is my favorite brunch joint for now and so far I've ordered the Migas, CA Omelette, the Eggwich and the Blu Jam Benedict .... all were very good but I've fallen in love with the Benedict and would order the Eggwich again. There's many more items I'm dying to still try so I will def be coming back for more.

Reviews.Author: Sami S.
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I are picky about brunch places and have a great palette for great food. I liked that they had vegan friendly dishes. A little on the greasy side for my preference. My sister enjoyed the popular Crunchy French Toast. The scrambled eggs were a little on the too wet side for daughter, and had a weird bitter taste, but some people like it like that. Our waiter was full of energy and made us smile the whole time. Even our bus boy was so cheerful. I loved that.  I understand that a great diner is worth the wait when you understand and appreciate food as much as I do. One thing put a damper to my morning was that a guy walked up to the front and bribed the host with $50 to put him to the front of the line. She took the bribe by telling him to walk in and buy a coffee wink wink.. Unfortunately, I was standing right there to hear it. So my wait continued. I think that every customer that is waiting should be treated fair and square. There were elderly people in line looking uncomfortable and children that were waiting. That one silly and greedy move of that one host can put a sour taste in anyone's mouth and swear not to go back again. Would I go there again? I enjoyed my food even though it was on the greasy side but, Id be going there a lot less then I normally would. When we find a good spot we become regulars. We are amazing tippers and appreciate good service, food and presentation. I can see how long waits can be a problem especially if there are special line jumps with bribery. It totally threw off my mood and kinda dampened my Mother's Day just a little. I would have given it 4 stars for choice of food and friendly waiter and bus boy regardless of the 1 hour wait but business ethics is important to me. It wasn't professional. So, two it is.

Reviews.Author: Alan B.
Reviews.Content: If you are breakfast lover you will enjoy the great selections from eggs to excellent french toast. The food portions are very large so show hungry. You can find street parking or meter parking. This place as an excellent vegetarian menu to meat items. Overall the food presentation is excellent and well prepared. This place is busy, but worth the wait.Excellent food quality and very fresh.Service 9Food 9Vibe 10

Reviews.Author: Kristy L.
Reviews.Content: Food:We came here with a group of six and we ordered the loxex (eggs scrambled with smoked salmon), brunch burger, Norwegian Benedict, eggwich (was okay), and crunchy toast (a MUST TRY! this was like a taste of heaven!).  Everything was pretty good and as you can tell, my favorite was the crunchy toast.  This was definitely a top-notch item on their menu (it has corn flakes on top along with a vanilla bean dip on the side).  The crunchy toast tasted crunchy of course, sweet, and savory.  This was topped with strawberries (made it even more palatable!).  I ordered juice (mixed with carrot, orange, and ginger) and thought it was pretty good, fresh, and healthy. Service:Our waitress was nice and friendly.  She came to check on us several times and even helped us take a nice group picture.  The food and drinks all came out in a reasonable time, we didn't have to wait too long for everything. Parking:There's meter parking on the street but if you want to save money, you can simply find parking in the neighborhood area (approximately 1-2 blocks).  Cons:No reservations so come early to avoid the crowd!  Also, they won't seat you unless your entire party is present, so make sure they all arrive on time!

Reviews.Author: Em L.
Reviews.Content: o5.11.14Breakfast has always been my favorite meal of the day. Especially when someone offered to treat me (lol) on a loving Sunday morning. I have always wanted to come here and finally! As soon as we arrived, we have been told the wait will be no longer than 20 mins. Yes, it was absolutely accurate because they called my name within 2 minutes, but I didn't get seated right the way as my friend was trying to find a parking. Anyway, it wasn't really what I expected. I have always loved the egg benedict for breakfast but Blu Jam's disappointed me a little. The ham and bacon was way too salty for my taste (Canto people problem?).Anyway, overall, it's a nice little restaurant with delicious french toast. :)

Reviews.Author: Meg G.
Reviews.Content: Dear Blue Jam, you were worth every single minute I waited to try you.My bf and I came for a 2pm breakfast, but decided to order lunch instead. He had a breakfast-style burger (fried or poached egg on the patty) and I a BBQ sandwich. We split and shared that plus 2 sides of bacon, a side of sourdough with butter, and 2 orders of fries. Now I ask him every Saturday if we can trek to Melrose for some more...PS we were seated inside fairly quickly, but decided to wait another 10 minutes for patio seating. Gotta love LA weather :)

Reviews.Author: Yenny D.
Reviews.Content: What can I say that hasn't been said?? Came here on a Friday around 11:30am for brunch. Already a bunch of people waiting but we were seated in 20 minutes or so - yay!FOOD:- chilaquiles - I have a soft spot for chilaquiles and Blu Jam does a damn fine job of making it! Not too soggy, great flavor and lots of toppings.- breakfast quesadilla - my friend got this - HUGE portions and very very good!- CRUNCHY FRENCH TOAST - their signature dish!! Now, I actually am not a french toast person but MY OH MY this was DELICIOUS!! I love brioche and that crunch combined with that sauce = HEAVEN. SERVICE:Friendly! They have a great computerized system to take names of everyone waiting and food came out quickly.VENUE:Small, with a patio area. They have a waiting area off to the side (which should really be used to add more tables!)PARKING:I found free street parking around the corner just fine. Sorry to all the residents who live in this area, you must get random people driving down your neighborhood all the time!YUMMY! Will definitely be back! (Probably not on a weekend haha)

Reviews.Author: Michael K.
Reviews.Content: After recently eating at Toast on 3rd I was inspired to write this review because it reminded me of how amazing Blu was. The Pros!  + 5 starsThe food was hands down best breakfast I have had in LA. Eggs benedict was very good with great side potatoes but wow the crunchy french toast was insane! Better than Toast and better than Larchmont Bungalow. I just can't even think of what to say but go here now! Service is great as well. Cons ) :  - 0 stars- Long wait on weekends. - the atmosphere was ok and seating a little cramped. - can be hard to find parking. (But what do you expect on Melrose)Overall I don't feel the cons were enough to detract from the amazing food and service.

Reviews.Author: Steven M.
Reviews.Content: Went here couple months ago cuz i heard about this place on a magazine talking about like the best breakfast/brunch. Went there about 9ish... super packed!!! but for some reason the wait was only about 10mins... whatever im ok with that! The interior was very cozy, kinda like i was at a farm (cuz the wooden ceiling). Anyways on to the food..So normally i let my gf get the most popular breakfast (usually it's benedict) and i get the second best... so that day, as always, i let her pick the florentine benedict and i went with italian breakfast risotto. HAHHHAAAAH She was jealous of my risotto!! ahahhah who get the last laugh now!!The Italian breakfast risotto was FREAKING INCREDIBLE!!! omggg i don't know what they put in it but it was def wayyyyyyyyyyy better than the Florentine benedict!! Plus that egg on the top just gave an extra kick to the flavor! nicely done!! The Florentine benedict was good too!! very savory  and flavorful! but my risotto was better lololTaste: 4.0Presentation: 4.0Ambiance: 4.0Service: 4.0 (very helpful)Price: 3.8 (reasonable but orange juice was pricey) Chewie'e Rating: 3.96 Risotto thumbs freaking UPPPPP!!!

Reviews.Author: Christopher R.
Reviews.Content: Cannot go wrong w Blu Jam Cafe! Been going here for awhile now and still order something different every time to try and explore the menu. Breakfast served all day is a great option too, not many cafés offer that choice. The signature crunchy French toast is a must for starters, and Kamil's breakfast is my personal favorite...along w a dirty chai latte. See you guys soon blu jam!

Reviews.Author: Kathleen N.
Reviews.Content: Really great breakfast place! The staff is welcoming, the ambience is so cute, and the menu is phenomenal. Service was helpful and friendly. I am already planning my next time here.

Reviews.Author: Tom R.
Reviews.Content: OMG. The eggwich, to die for. The chicken breakfast quesadilla, heavenly. The French toast? Holy cow, gorgeous. I cannot wait to come back, so many things to try. And Dakota Fanning sat next to me. Neener neener. Perfect experience for this picky eater and star-struck San Diegoburger.

Reviews.Author: Andrea B.
Reviews.Content: Been here only once but would definitely go back. Had the crunchy French toast and smoked salmon egg Benedict.Very good Benedict. The French toast was memorable, with a good amount of crunch and softness.

Reviews.Author: C T.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE their corn flake french toast with the berries.  As I am a sweets and dessert person, their french toast is right up my alley for breakfast.  Too bad they are always crowded. :(  I couldn't comment on any other breakfast items as I always get the french toast.  Try it.

Reviews.Author: Brittany L.
Reviews.Content: It's probably a 4.5 for me but it didn't have enough of that extra oomph to push it to 5 stars.PARKING: We got really lucky and found a metered spot RIGHT outside of the restaurant.  It's  2 hour limit but I had plenty of quarters to park there.  I think they also have valet but if you circle the area enough you should find some parking and not pay an arm and a leg.WAIT: Since I heard the wait on weekends was ridiculous my boyfriend and I had a Friday off and decided to try Blu Jam for brunch.  I wanted to get there by 10:30 am because I heard that's when it gets busy but we didn't end up getting there until 11.  The lady said for a party of 2 it would be about a 20 minute wait, not bad! They have a "waiting room" with a few chairs and couches, which is actually pretty nice because the sidewalk area could get super crowded.  We ended up waiting a little longer than 20 minutes, probably close to 30...but I think it might be because we didn't specify that we'd be willing to sit inside OR outside, fail.  But the outside "patio" area seems kind of weird because it's just jutting out on the sidewalk with a little shade separating you from the other patrons waiting for their name to be called.ATMOSPHERE: The inside is fairly small and narrow, so I could see why there is usually a long wait.  The walls have lots of hollywood type pictures and paintings and it has a little of a rustic feel.  One yelper said this place screamed "industry" and I have to agree. We saw so many people who looked important or famous and a group of guys got picked up in a fancy rental car...and the people next to us seemed to be basketball players from out of town.  Too bad I didn't really recognize anyone.  ALSO apparently this is where that famous proposal video was filmed where the guy made a video for his girlfriend and she watched it at their favorite restaurant.  Yup, that's blu jam.Anyway, we got seated and the service was pretty quick.  I could see how the waitress could forget about certain tables and our water came out after another table sat down after us but that's okay.FOOD: We had to get the crunchy french toast of course and the italian breakfast risotto.  Their menu is pretty extensive and they had specials that day (nutella french toast!) but we didn't want to deviate from what they are known for since it was our first time.  Oh yeah, and they serve breakfast all day :)CRUNCHY FRENCH TOAST - It's served with fresh blueberries and strawberries and a vanilla dipping sauce.  The sauce is pretty subtle but my boyfriend said he could definitely taste the vanilla sauce.  I guess some might want syrup but I liked it with just a little bit of vanilla sauce.  The texture was AMAZING.  Usually french toast can be kind of soggy or spongey but the batter was crispy and tasty, the corn flakes maintained their crunchiness despite being dipped in batter and slightly fried.  It wasn't too sweet and was just..GOOD.  It's big enough for two to share but definitely enough for one person to eat the whole thing if you're hungry.ITALIAN BREAKFAST RISOTTO - Debated between this and the steak hash but glad we went with this.  The rice was chewy and delicious. I think of risotto as being super mushy and watery but each grain was perfectly formed still.  It had a pesto type sauce and sundried tomatoes and two perfectly poached eggs.  I could see why they call it "Italian" because all of the flavors together remind me of italian pasta or food.  Mmm, it was also very good.CHICKEN APPLE SAUSAGE - I felt like we needed some protein so we ordered this, about $3.95 for 3 sausages.  They were super  tasty and added that savory meat flavor we needed to complete our brunch.  They weren't shriveled up or like it was all skin and no meat.Overall, I'm not usually a big fan of brunch and feel it's overrated but this crunchy french toast and the rest of the dishes we tried definitely met me expectations and a little more.  I could see why people would be adverse to waiting over an hour for their food but if you come on an off day it's definitely worth it.

Reviews.Author: Jem K.
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend ordered the french toast (and he doesnt like bread) but he finished it! i ordered the Florentine Benedict with the side of mixed veggies (i hate veggies) but i finished it. thats how delicious they are. lol :) very tasty. they were also kind enough to draw something on our latte (mocha and vanilla) even when they said they were busy and not sure if they can decorate it. :)

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth N.
Reviews.Content: Obviously this place is a staple in Los Angeles and there will always be a wait. The French toast speaks for itself. However, I do not think the food is worth the wait and it might be because I am not a breakfast person. Blu jam needs to manage customer wait time expectations better. I got there at 11 and was told the wait would be 20 min...the wait turned into an hour and the only reason why we got seated so quickly was because I spoke to the hostess 4 times...I'm fine waiting an hour but let me know it's an hour wait rather than my party just waiting and checking in every 20 min.

Reviews.Author: Kriz L.
Reviews.Content: Crunchy French Toast!!!! yummmm really good breakfast items as well. parking is metered and be careful because there are certain streets where it is permit parking only.

Reviews.Author: Joe G.
Reviews.Content: I had been wanting to try Blue Jam Cafe for a while but it always seemed packed on the weekends. It seems like a popular spot. Fortunately, I went during the week shortly after they opened and was seated right away. My wife and I really enjoyed it here. The food was good, nice decor, and great coffee. Service was friendly and efficient. Much appreciated! I'd like to come again sometime and try some of the other menu items.

Reviews.Author: Liz V.
Reviews.Content: i've only been here once but i love it and cannot wait to go back.i went for sunday morning breakfast with a group of friends so i got to try several items.Norwegian Benedict - good, exactly what you expectBrunch Carbonnara - SO GOOD, bacon pieces were nice and crispy and the herb pistou was flavorfulItalian Breakfast - another risotto type dish, good but the Brunch Carbonara was betterScrambles - tried two types of scrambles but don't remember which; both were ok, nothing special but the ingredients they use are good CRUNCHY FRENCH TOAST - MUST HAVE! all the praise you read about this on yelp is true. delicious. went at 8:00a so missed the long wait but saw a bunch of people waiting as we left. service was very friendly and attentive.so basically i want to go back and order the brunch carbonnara and crunchy french toast all for myself.

Reviews.Author: Joyce L.
Reviews.Content: This place is one of my favorite brunch places in LA. The venue is large enough to seat many people at once, the decor is cute, and there's a waiting area with sofas attached to the restaurant.The wait time is around 35min for two people on a Saturday or Sunday morning, so expect to wait! The restaurant serves brunch foods all day and also during weekdays. The crunchy French toast is a must- I've never had anything like it before. Brioche bread dipped in egg and corn flakes, then fried to a crispy crunch, then covered in vanilla sauce instead of syrup- yum! My friend and I got the morning hash to balance out the sweetness of the toast and it was good. The potatoes are perfectly seasoned: crunchy and soft at the same time. The prices are reasonable too, around $13 for a dish. I would definitely come here again!

Reviews.Author: Truc T.
Reviews.Content: This place is on my list of favorite brunch places in LA! Blu Jam Cafe has one of the best french toast ever! They were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The dipping sauce compliments it very well. My friend and I decided to split the french toast and we also got an order of the steak and hash and Loxex. The portions were pretty big so you'll definitely be stuffed. The food was phenomenal and service was very friendly and helpful. One of the server help me decided what veggies or fruits I should add to my juice and it turns out pretty good and healthy. The line can be pretty long depends on what time and day it is. Overall, I really enjoyed my visit and will definitely come back here again!

Reviews.Author: Jolene L.
Reviews.Content: OK I have to admit... their French toast really might be the best French toast in LA... It's so crunchy, the vanilla bean sauce is so delicious, and it's just the perfect amount of sweet and flavor to go with your morning coffee. Now if only they drew something on my latte instead of giving me a blob. Seriously was expecting at least a heart or something from the pictures I saw on Yelp. (World, WTF? Talk about a let down..). It's fortunate that the coffee here is very delicious so I guess that makes up for the blob.Anyway, the breakfast/brunch food here is pretty good. I believe my friends got the Florentine Benedict and steak something (it looks like a green blob of eggs with some steak on it). Overall good food, good ambiance, mediocre parking, reasonable wait (30 min), OK service (I'm still annoyed about the blob on my latte), price is MEH. I would come back if it weren't for the fact that there are so many other places to try in LA.

Reviews.Author: Aja B.
Reviews.Content: I couldn't decide between the rancheros or the migas, based on our waiter's recommendation I chose the migas.  And they were delicious. If you like avocado I strongly recommend ordering some on the side, that was the one thing missing from the dish. The portions are pretty large, as hard as I tried to finish the meal, I had to take the rest back to the hotel. They have a nice variety of fresh juices that are good as well. I ordered the grapefruit juice at $4.95 it was a bit over priced.Overall I had a good experience, the staff was friendly and very responsive. I would have loved to comeback for breakfast everyday of my business trip, unfortunately with LA traffic, it took too long to get there. It took me 45 minutes to get there, even though the place was only 15 miles away.  One star for LA traffic!

Reviews.Author: Yunji N.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam is definitely a LA staple. Great food, not so great wait. They have great vegan and vegetarian options and everything that I've tried was very tasty! The crunchy French toast is definitely a mist at Blu Jam.

Reviews.Author: Jeff C.
Reviews.Content: Had the steak and eggs... it was amazing.  The only issue was I asked for the eggs to be done over-medium and they were over-easy (no big deal).Staff was friendly and fast.Dining area was big so we didn't have to wait too long (Sunday morning).  The worst is when you're hungry and you have to wait at a breakfast place because they have limited seating.

Reviews.Author: Cathy G.
Reviews.Content: Driving to West Hollywood from the Valley is always an adventure. I try to limit my excursions to this particular area due to the high density of cars and people. When I do go to this area, do know that it's always for a good reason and I always reward myself with something fantastic(in this case, crispy french toast and vanilla bean syrup) to prepare me for the drive back through the hill.When I came here, it was about 2pm on a Thursday and we didn't have to wait to be seated. Our server was a good looking fellow in denim cutoffs(I swear, are all servers in Hollywood/WeHo  ridiculously good looking or what?) Sheesh! I can't even look you straight in the eye - I have to look at your forehead to order. Anywho, when BF and I ordered - we pretty much cut it down to a science. Drinks:For BF: Coconut creme iced teaFor Me: White peach iced tea Let it steep for about 4-5 mins in the press, then go to town on it. Mine needed about 10mins to get a full flavor going.Entrees : Breakfast(of course! Because everyone knows how much we love BFAST)For BF: Classic eggs benedictFor Me: Crispy french toast with vanilla bean syrup(*drools* liquid awesomeness) w/ a side of red potatoes(mmm fried in bacon fat, can't fool me!!). The french toast came topped w/ strawberries and blueberries.Everything was delicious.  Totally deserving of a wonderful midday nap. Love this place.  Definitely have to try the Sherman Oaks location next time.

Reviews.Author: Tammie C.
Reviews.Content: Crispy French Toast- Everything you thought it'd be, plus more.  Little square sizes of brioche bread dipped in a sweet batter, rolled in corn flakes and cooked to perfection.  Accompanied by fresh berries.  Instead of syrup, they provide an awesome vanilla sauce (pretty thin) to complement this crispy yet soft french toast.  A total winner.Friend got the eggs benedict--it looked pretty awesome too.  Came with a ton of potatoes. $15. Kinda pricey for brunch, but good nonetheless.  Folks next to us got some entrees that looked pretty enticing too.  Servers were nice even though it took a while for someone to get our order in the beginning.Outdoor and indoor seating.  This is a pretty standard hollywood joint...think lots of aspiring actors/actresses/writers/ppl watchers.

Reviews.Author: Jordan O.
Reviews.Content: Went with a large group and the wait actually wasn't too bad for Sunday brunch. Everyone ordered something different and everything was amazing! Kind of a bummer they don't serve alcohol, but it's still worth the trip and the wait for the food.

Reviews.Author: Ashley F.
Reviews.Content: This place is a good hit when you want to go out of your comfort zone for breakfast.Came here with two friends on a Saturday morning and waited a good 45 minutes; which was okay since we got to meet cool people and have a few laughs. We were hungry when we arrived so during the last minutes of waiting, we were a bit antsy. This location is fairly big, with two sides that can probably accommodate maybe a good 40 people at a time I would say?We then ordered:Crunchy French Toast: Fresh berries on top of french toast covered in corn flakes with a side of vanilla bean dip. This dish was DELICIOUS and the side of sauce was seriously SO good. My friend finished all his french toast and you best believe that the dip was gone right along with it.Chilaquiles: House made corn chips with fresh veggies, cheese, chicken and black beans. This was my dish and I was satisfied with it. Having never tried chilaquiles before, this has really inspired me to try it at authentic Mexican places.California Omelette: A three egg omelette made with bacon, avocado, cheese, tomato and sour cream and is served with a side of potatoes and toast. This was my second choice and since I was indecisive, my friend decided to order this. I sort of wish I ordered this dish since it came with SO much food haha. But I did get to try a piece and based on both of our reactions this dish is pleasant!Also, on a side note, when you order coke, it's the bottled coke, which is a certain plus!

Reviews.Author: Lindsey L.
Reviews.Content: Love coming here when I'm in the area. Every time I'm here I'll try something different and l've always loved every dish!! I do always have to get a side of my fav blueberry pancakes though. This place is definitely a very popular brunch destination so prepare for a long wait. The wait doesn't bother me since I usually kill time browsing the shops on Melrose. Whenever I have friends visiting out of town, I always take them here and they love it! The interior space of this restaurant is small so tables are placed very close together. Depending on where you sit you may have to squeeze into your seat. There is meter parking on Melrose but if you can't find parking here, you can find parking on nearby side streets. Overall, this place has great food, a lively ambiance and nice location. One of my fave places to brunch.

Reviews.Author: Romi C.
Reviews.Content: OMG my new favorite breakfast place. I came here for brunch saturday with three of my friends. It's been a while since i've had a good breakfast place and we've been thinking about coming here for a while.What we ordered: The Italian Breakfast Rissoto, Brunch Carbonara (another Risotto with bacon), the Steak Hash, and The Crunch French Toast. Wow. all I could say is wow. I feel like all breakfast places that i've been to  have been all so similar. However with this place I really liked it because not only were the breakfast dishes were so different but the presentation of the food is amazing.  They put a new twist on Risotto and the flavors mixed really well.The only downside here is that meter parking is annoying in Melrose and there is always a wait because of how amazing this restaurant is.  Besides that I loved it! I am  definitely going back to try other things.

Reviews.Author: Corie T.
Reviews.Content: Crunchy french toast is phenomenal

Reviews.Author: dre m.
Reviews.Content: I ate here for the first time on Mother's Day. It was a quick wait for 2 on such a busy day. The service was good. I love the vibe of the place (it wasn't too loud for how crowded it was). We ordered the crunchy french toast and eggwich. Both were very good and anything I could ever ask for in a breakfast! The cups of coffee are tall, and they serve flavored water.

Reviews.Author: Leah S.
Reviews.Content: My friends recommended us to try Blu Jam Cafe while we were on our trip in LA. I ordered their crunchy french toast. It was amazingly good! I love the crunchiness of the toast. Also, the toast was not too sweet, which I really love! I had to minus one star because it's rather pricey. Service was great and the atmosphere of the cafe was awesome!

Reviews.Author: Joe B.
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite spots in LA. Amazing food, great service and atmosphere. The chef/owner is so friendly and greets the guests as they dine, I love that personal touch, so endearing and so rare. My highest recommendation!

Reviews.Author: Bob T.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam Cafe is a casual, comfortable place - with exposed brick veneers and exposed wood beams - it's a warm atmosphere that has some cool musicians pictured on the walls!The name Blu Jam was taken from the location's original history, it was used as an underground blues and jazz club where patrons would enter through a secret entrance to listen to musicians jam.  Love a place with a story!An even better story is that of the Chef/Owner Kamil Majer - read his bio on their website - escaping communism, overcoming many obstacles and succeeding in his chosen field. I noticed he also shares recipes on their website, and does some private dining events. - pretty cool stuff.Our wait on a Saturday - at about 11am was 25 minutes - not bad for the area - they have a small waiting area - some seating available and a big jug of lemon mint water. We were lucky to find a spot on Melrose right away - there are some pretty interesting shops to check out while you wait.I'm not really into sweets - I was hoping my wife would try their famous Crunchy French Toast - so I could steal a bite - oh well. She had the Blu Jam Benedict and enjoyed it, perfect poach and the hollandaise was not overly heavy. My stepson had a fire wrap - which was bigger than I thought it would be - a good portion size. There's a mix of  interesting and basic fare on the menu - I decided to go for something different - Kamil's Breakfast: Pan-roasted macaroni scrambled with eggs, smoked bacon, ham, garlic, chives, and cheddar cheese. The portion was sized perfectly - just enough with out being stuffed! I thought it was even better when I spiced it up with the habanero tabasco that was on the table! Food as a whole averaged 4 stars.Check out Nick H and Lica N's reviews for some of the other dishes.We split a side of smoked bacon and chicken apple sausage - these were both your average, and the potatoes had too much rosemary for my taste - 3 stars.Service was good - we were greeted, waters refilled often - everything was accurate and timely - especially considering they were pretty busy! We were also thanked very warmly on the way out. 4.5 starsThere are quite a few 4 star local cafes in the area to explore - we live pretty far away - I wouldn't travel the hour up there just for breakfast - but if you're in the area - definitely a place to consider!

Reviews.Author: Angela C.
Reviews.Content: Best french toast and I don't even like french toast that much. You have to try their signature Crunchy french toast...we ended up getting 2 orders of it between 3 girls. We also ordered the breakfast quesadilla - so delicious..had eggs it in and the tortilla was nice and crispy, not soggy. We also ordered the norwegian benedict - the salmon was so perfect and the sauce was not overwhelming, just right! We also ordered some mac and cheese breakfast thingy. There was bacon in it and i dont like bacon but my friend loved this order. Minus 1 star for the wait... it was like 1 pm on a Saturday... we wait about 40 minutes. bleh but I guess the french toast made up for it ;) I'll be back!

Reviews.Author: Vy T.
Reviews.Content: Crunchy French Toast! Just get it and join the rest of us in Blu Jam Heaven. Tried the migas and Benedict as well..Super good! There was a 45 minutes wait on a Sunday, which isn't that bad because I've waited longer. Try anything off the menu, and I'm sure you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Widya T.
Reviews.Content: Love the ambience the moment I stepped in. Crazy coffee aroma, nicely decorated cozy place. We came a little after breakfast and a little before lunch, so we didn't have to wait and was immediately seated. But the place was still bustling nevertheless. Ordered the famous signature Crunchy French Toast and Wake Up Call coffee. Now I know why this place is so popular!

Reviews.Author: Hendry H.
Reviews.Content: Nothing special... Crunchy french toast is quite good though. Corn flakes are totally a good combination with the sweetness of the french toast

Reviews.Author: Bella T.
Reviews.Content: Got the Garden Panini. It was average. I don't like goat cheese so perhaps that swayed my opinion but the potatoes that came with it tasted like a dirty greasy unwashed pan and they were clearly accidentally burnt, yet they put it on my plate anyway. For that alone I'm docking a star. Nothing special about this place or the food. Unimpressed.

Reviews.Author: Chelsea R.
Reviews.Content: One of the best brunch's I have ever had. The crunchy french toast (with vanilla bean syrup) and Florentine eggs Benedict are amazing. It was also very affordable.

Reviews.Author: DB S.
Reviews.Content: Went here as a recommendation one day after leaving church... The atmosphere was nice and I ordered some type of mac and cheese breakfast dish. First time I had had a dish like that but it was pretty good.Next time I will try their country french toast.. I hear it's delish!!

Reviews.Author: Hae Y. H.
Reviews.Content: Went at 8:30 Friday morning. No lines, no wait this morning (:French press coffee was awesome! Not so overpowering like other breakfast joints! Italian Risotto and crunchy french toast totally hit the spot! Didnt think benedict florentine was anything noteworthy. (I think toast does a better job at this!).

Reviews.Author: Kat K.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam was a pleasant experience, partly due to visiting in the later afternoon, after the brunch crowd, so very short wait for a table. (Initially was offered communal/shared seating, but we wanted our own table so wait was a little longer.) Service was friendly and the Norwegian Benedict (with smoked salmon) was delicious. Only con was street parking only on Melrose, but that's how it goes in that area. Would visit again!

Reviews.Author: Michael D.
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of Blu Jam! The owner is from Czech Republic which is one of my favorite countries, but that has no influence on my review. The food here is fresh and very tasty. Staff was friendly and efficient, owner came and sat at our table and chatted with us for a bit, he was humble and down to earth! Reminded me of Prague in many ways.The interior has an old Hollywood feel with awesome Rock n Roll photos. These Photo's along with the music complete the vibe while being amongst a cool and eclectic clientele.Food was above average, I tried their breakfast and lunch. Great pancakes and crispy bacon. Love the Roma via Paris Omelets and their signature French toast. Come early on the weekends and be prepared for a wait.

Reviews.Author: Anthony N.
Reviews.Content: I was pretty psyched to try this place only to be disappointed. It's a cute place , parking was a little hard to find. We ordered he Norweigen Benedict, Brunch Carbonara, French Press Coffee, Kamil's  Juice, and the famous Crunchy French toast. I gotta hand it to them, that French toast was the domb! However, the entrée we ordered was a bit disappointing g for it's price and all. I've gad better brunch food at other places for a few dollars cheaper. The coffee was greats and so was the service-the wait wasn't that long. The organic juice we ordered was not that great--too much ginger and it wasn't even cold. I would advise against ordering it.I'm giving this place a two stars for the mediocre food and really for the bleh juice. I would come back and just stick with their French toast which they know how to make and the coffee.

Reviews.Author: Ron R.
Reviews.Content: Was here for the first time last Saturday, and I was glad I came.  The wait time was about 30 minutes at about 11:00AM.  By the time my friend and I were done window shopping a few blocks of Melrose we were able to sit down so it wasn't that big of a deal.  We got the breakfast risotto and the brioche french toast.  I'm not big on eggs so I ate the risotto without the poached egg on top.  I'm sure my friend who did eat it as is enjoyed it more but it wasn't my thing.  I did like the sun dried tomatoes they added to it. The french toast, however, was great!  I certainly haven't had anything like it before.The server was attentive.  Whenever my friend's coffee was getting low, he filled it quickly.  He was also really nice and welcoming.

Reviews.Author: Gilbert G.
Reviews.Content: Wow. I was debating between this and another place... But I'm glad I chose to come to Blu Jam Cafe. First of all, expect the wait. When you go to any popular and delicious place in LA.. There's gonna be a wait, so bring your patience with you. My friend and I waited about 45 minutes to be seated, but it's alright. If you want to kill time, there are many stores and other cafes to visit which makes time pass by pretty quick. Maybe you'll want to get your shop on while you wait. Lol!But when you do get seated.. I highly recommend you consider the crunchy French Toast as your sweet dish and the Blu Jam Benedict to get your eggs and meat. Dude, you will NOT be disappointed. The crunchy French Toast is probably their popular item. It's full of flavor and the crunchy-ness is just amazing. I wanna say it's a cornflake type batter that they use? Whatever it is... Its damn amazing, and I highly recommend it if it's your first time here. French Toast is my favorite breakfast item.. And this gets my stamp of approval. =PThe Blu Jam Benedict was also amazing. Comes with a side of potatoes, too. I don't even know what to say about this dish... It just makes my mouth water thinking about it. It's definitely very flavorful.. From the poached egg, to the ham, to the bread and English muffin... Yum! I'll definitely be getting this again. If you're looking for a great place to have brunch, consider this a great spot. Whether it's with your friends or family.. It's a great place to be in the middle of LA. I noticed a lot of big groups come in too, so bring your clique with ya if you want. Just remember.. Expect a wait. Compliments to the chef.. It was amazing!

Reviews.Author: Ei C.
Reviews.Content: French toast was unlike any french toast I ever had. It was crusted with sweet cereal and the texture was just perfect. It came with this sweet dip that really made it tasty. The risotto was also absolutely delicious. The ice blended latte though delicious, felt a little smaller than I would have liked.Prepare for a minimum 40 minute wait though, as the reviews here speak for itself. Put your name down on a list, and go walk around and check out the boutiques. Parking is fairly ok in the residential area within a 2-3 block radius.

Reviews.Author: Joy K.
Reviews.Content: Quick Funny (okay maybe not that funny) Story: The last time I came here I got into an argument with my partner at the time and totally forgot everything we ate. haha.I came here again on a weekend morning and ordered the Migas. Pretty good, but I couldn't taste any spicy sausage/chorizo...I swear that's on one of the list of ingredients but maybe I'm tripping. I did like the crunchy tortilla that was in it and kind of ended up dousing everything in hot sauce. The portion was also HUGE.I took a few bites of K's ..it was like a breakfast carbonara risotto w/ two poached eggs. It was actually really delicious. I loved the pesto. Gah I actually really loved it and wished I stole more bites.It was Blu Jam's anniversary so they also gave us fresh lemon crepes. Again, pretty good, loved the lemony taste. Service was great, and I do recommend anyone to come here if they are on the fence. Just hop on over dude.

Reviews.Author: Chuck S.
Reviews.Content: I dislike waiting, but a date and a promise of romance has a way of making you forget such things.  Arrived on Sunday, at around 1030 hours, wait was estimated to be about 40 minutes.  A crowd gathers, all lined up, awaiting for their name to be shouted out.  Shitty parking arrangements does nothing to deter people from swarming.  Pretty, young, trendy folk, as you would suspect.  The noise-level is loud from the crowd and chatter, no doubt in part of folk being energized by the well prepped meals.We split the crunchy French toast and the Paris omelette between us.  I was never a fan of French toast. To me, it always reminded me of $1 elementary school cafeteria lunches, complete with imitation potatoes, soggy "toast," and that plastic, high corn fructose laden syrup.  But this French toast is winning in all aspects.  Mostly because of the genius idea to crust it in corn flakes.  It mellows out the sweetness while adding that lovely crunchy texture.  The fresh berries topped just add those occasionally welcome bites of tartness. Just don't eat too many, or you'll end up like this guy:  cdn.trendhunterstatic.co…The omelette? Well, it's a good omelette, made with fresh quality ingredients.  Do I care for a $13 omelette, of eggs and some veges? Not really.  I would've preferred one of the poached egg dishes, but it was her choice after all.  I will say, the rosemary seasoned potatoes are just comfortingly fragrant, and the most impressive part for me of that offering.  I suppose the prize produce does justify the price to a point.Charming stuff, if you're in the area. And try to beat the crowd.  Preferably with a pimp cane and Wong Fei-Hong's "No-Shadow Kick" if you're nasty.

Reviews.Author: Karen B.
Reviews.Content: WOW! This place is gooooooooood.Service is friendly, every single person I walked by had a smile on their face. I ordered a mocha latte & it was tummy. I like that they offer almond milk because I feel like getting a latte nonfat tastes no bueno. I also ordered the brunch carbonara... One of my favorite brunch items as of today!! I try new brunch places all the time but I will definitely save a visit for this place everytime I come down. The carbonara tasted like a breakfast arroz valenciana, which is one of my favorite things and quite impossible to find. (A good one, that is). Anyway, I can go on forever about it but try this dish!! With rice, it's a bit heavy for breakfast but it's worth it. Overall, this place was very clean. Bathrooms are single person use but men & women are separated. We sat on the patio and the hostess wiped our table as she sat us. Felt like all the salt was falling on me. Then with the rag still on the table she set silver wear down. My knife had rag cloth attached to it. If I had to complain about anything, it would be this... But I didn't use the knife so yeah it's okay. For all you severe germaphobes, don't sit on the patio.

Reviews.Author: Annie N.
Reviews.Content: This is by far my favorite breakfast place in LA!It is economically friendly (okay, it is not the cheapest place, but you are definitely getting your moneys worth) and the quality is top notch.Their steak hash is amazing and worth every penny. The meat was tender, and the added pesto sauce goes perfectly with the meat and eggs. ALSO, their CRUNCHY FRENCH TOAST is to die for...at most places that serve french toast, it always comes out soggy making it very difficult to finish the entire entree. However, Blu Jam takes your classic french toast and dips it into a cornflake  batter giving it this crunch that prevents it from being soggy. On top of that, the french toast was soft and flaky, it was just perfection, really it was.

Reviews.Author: Sisi H.
Reviews.Content: I was beyond excited to try this place. I heard nothing but good stuff about it. Well, my experience did not blow me away.First, the wait. Of course there is a wait. There is always a wait at a brunch place. We waited an hour and half. As my patience was running out, our table was ready.Communal table, fine. This better be good if I just waited an 1.5 hours to eat. I ordered a sandwich. It had an egg, avo, bacon, and cheese. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing but It obviously doesn't sound too exciting. My friend ordered the smoked salmon egg benedict. She said Larchmont is better. I didn't really like it either. Our "dessert" was the french toast. If you come here, you have to order the french toast. It may be the only good thing on the menu.Ill prob come here order the french toast to go next time. I rather eat it at a park or in my car.

Reviews.Author: Doug P.
Reviews.Content: I had always heard great things about Blu Jam and finally gave it a try this weekend. The other reviews referenced a really long wait, but at 10:30AM on a Sunday  the wait was only 15-20 minutes.  I didn't really get to check out the decor since I ate on the patio, but the staff was very friendly and attentive. The breakfast menu is expansive and has a section for more health conscious eaters (which looked delicious). I, as a recovering French toast addict, decided to go all out though for my first time:- Crunchy french toast...delicious! The toast was well cooked with a slightly buttery overtone and a crunchy , satisfying texture from the corn flake coating. The vanilla sauce (ie looked like butter with vanilla) was awesome and did not need too much of it to give a great flavor. Definitely the best french toast i have had in LA in the last 2 years. - Migas..delicious but salty.   The ingredients were fresh and highly satisfying. the problem was the salt rebound after the meal. I felt like I was chugging water for the next hour (and I am not  salt sensitive person). - Early grey tea was well above the average early grey. Wit a mixed hint of lavender and vanilla to it, it hit the spot with my meal.   I can't wait to come back and try more at Blue Jam.

Reviews.Author: Nina B.
Reviews.Content: Amazing florentine Benedict and crunchy French toast!! We went on a Saturday around 12 and waited about and hour for a table..

Reviews.Author: Kim V.
Reviews.Content: I'm a big brunch person, and so far, Blu Jam's got my vote with their crunchy french toast. I would suggest coming here before you're actually hungry because there tends to be a wait.My first time there, I was skeptical about ordering a sweet dish that was going to be served to me in "crunchy corn flakes and grilled to perfection", but.. wow. The contrast in flavors worked just perfectly. This dish is slightly overwhelming on the sweet side, but you've got the cream dip and all the tangy fruit to balance things out.If you're more of a savory person at brunch, I would order this dish to split and get something else for yourself! I had a taste of the Steak Hash and Florentine Benedict-- both were delicious!Overall, great presentation and attentive service all throughout.

Reviews.Author: roger l.
Reviews.Content: I really like it when something you have had for a long time suddenly has a new taste/texture/twist to it but just by looking at it you can't tell the different, well the french toast surprised me, of course other stuff on the menu are pretty good too, but WOW is the word for the french toast, try it!

Reviews.Author: Nicole B.
Reviews.Content: Blue Jam Café... My friend posted a lovely Instagram photo of the crunchy French toast that she had here and I told her she had to take me! Two days later we went together, it was a Sunday afternoon. We waited about a good 25 minutes before being seated, which was relatively fast because there were a lot of people waiting to be seated.The food was okay, the service was okay, I just did not dig the vibe here. It was weird and I didn't feel welcome. Furthermore, the French toast was not all that appetizing. Would give it another chance.

Reviews.Author: Nathalie R.
Reviews.Content: Tofu tex-mex hash is fantastic!!

Reviews.Author: Katie H.
Reviews.Content: Arrive expecting a wait but leave feeling incredibly satisfied!I surprisingly only had to wait for about 30 minutes on a Sunday, though it was past the rush of the 10am-noon crowd. The place is very small, which is why the wait is so long! Many small tables too so I would suggest only coming with 1-3 other people at most. Also, parking is definitely an issue so be prepared to drive around the surrounding neighborhood for a parking spot!Onto the food...FRENCH TOASTTTT!
