And not just any regular French Toast, but Crunchy French Toast!!! Something very unique that I've never heard of anywhere else and Blu Jam executed it perfectly. The corn flakes were nice and crunchy and the bread itself was so soft. The Vanilla Bean Sauce on the side was a great addition. It had a strong vanilla taste but not in an overpowering way. Also, not too sweet and way better than regular maple syrup!The other spectacular dish was the Florentine Benedict. Another great option, especially if you're leaning toward the savory side! I felt pretty healthy eating this version of a benedict since the ham was replaced with large heapings of sauteed spinach! All the extra toppings like the brie cheese and sundried tomatoes added a nice savory, rich flavor. Either one of these two options would be sure to make your stomach feel happy and I can't wait to go back sometime and try other dishes!!

Reviews.Author: Peo H.
Reviews.Content: Excellent breakfast here. Very well put together.... ! Good service also. I go here a lot!!! Blta sandwich is awesome, so is the Benedict and some of their vegetarian options.Weekends are unfortunately not an option as wait is over an hour for a table. I would have given it a 5 star if it wasn't for the coffee. The lady in the coffee bar surely has nice boobies and tattoos but she also burns the milk in the cappuccino to 200 degrees which is a no no. I'll be back very soon again!!

Reviews.Author: Michelle C.
Reviews.Content: Maybe I had too high expectations of this place, but I don't think the wait is worth it. The food quality to wait time proportion is off! Their system for calling for waiting parties, while okay, could be improved.Other than that, the food was good (but not great). Regretted not getting the eggs benedict. But that's my fault :c- Breakfast quesadilla [4 stars] - filling, would have liked more avocado. liked that it came with sour cream and pico de gallo on the side.- California omelette [3 stars] - kinda boring.Ambiance is really nice, though the tables too close to each other.With the abundance of brunch places nearby, probably wouldn't take the drive out from Westwood any time soon.

Reviews.Author: Maisha R.
Reviews.Content: Now I understand why people wait for ridiculous amounts of time to get some grub at Blu Jam. We went late on a holiday morning and waited about 45 minutes for a table. As we waited, the line just kept growing. Once inside, I looked around at the plates of food on the tables near us and everything looked great.We ordered the famous crunchy french toast, Kamil's breakfast and chicken apple sausage and we weren't dissapointed. As one who doesn't really like french toast, I was indeed skeptical but after one bite of the sweet, crunchy toast, I was completely sold. The vanilla bean "syrup" really elevated the meal. Kamil's breakfast was the perfect addition to the french toast. It was like an embellished version of mac and cheese with ham, bacon, eggs, chives and garlic. Genius! Not to be outdone, the chicken apple sausage was flavorful. I'm not a stickler about hot food but if you like your food warm, you may want to specifically request that because despite the fact that the food took a while to come to the table, nothing was much warmer than room temperature. But don't let that, the wait or the hippie vibe detour you from getting a wonderful breakfast at Blu Jam.

Reviews.Author: Jin L.
Reviews.Content: the only thing that really stood out about blu jam cafe was the crunchy french toast with vanilla bean sauce.  so glad we ordered that for the table.  would have been sad had i left without tasting its deliciousness.with that said, blu jam cafe is cute.  and in a great spot.  after hiking at runyon canyon we made our way over to blu jam.  upon getting seated, we asked if it would be possible to do split checks amongst the 3 couples, but they let us know that it wasn't possible.  instead they could take multiple cards.  this way they can tack on the automatic 18% gratuity for our party of 6.  we all ordered a variety of dishes.  the breakfast burger, the risotto, the omelette, the quesadilla, a regular breakfast plate.  nothing really stood out considering our bill was over 130.the restaurant is split into two sides, and luckily we got there early enough to be able to get seated right away in the quieter side of the place.  unfortunately, our side was for all the bigger parties, and only one guy working the section.  needless to say, service was a bit slow.  our guy was super nice, and as attentive as could be, but could have definitely used some help.all in all, an okay experience, but definitely a bit pricey for breakfast.  not sure that i would go out of my way to return.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie G.
Reviews.Content: If you decide to have brunch here, you MUST order the crunchy french toast! Otherwise, it just won't be worth the wait imo. Don't get me wrong though- the other food, like the steak hash we ordered is really good! The steak, poached eggs, and potatoes were perfectly cooked and tasted delicious, but worth a 1+ hour wait? Not really. But their unique french toast definitely made waiting in the sun for over an hour worth it. I loved how it had a crunchy cornflake texture on the outside but was soft on the inside at the same time and that vanilla bean sauce was amazing with it! It's also served with strawberries and blueberries. It tasted like I was eating a bowl of cereal and milk in the form of french toast. I wonder if that's what they were going for. If it is, they nailed it perfectly. I'd recommend sharing the crunchy french toast along with a savory dish like the steak hash between 2 people. It was the perfect amount for us and it was nice to have a balance between sweet and savory. The only downside to this place is the super long wait, but they do have a shaded waiting area which is nice. My bf and I arrived around 12pm and were told that the wait would be around 40-45 mins and to stick around because it would probably be earlier, but we weren't even called in until 1 hour and 10 minutes later. That was kind of annoying, but in the end, I'm glad that I got to experience that french toast!

Reviews.Author: John M.
Reviews.Content: The signature Crunchy French Toast was everything it's reported to be and more, with a price to match. It's a great play with the moist center and crunchy exterior - you can just fold it around in your mouth with the fruit and allow the sweet, jammy textures to erupt all over your tongue. I look forward to returning when my wallet allows.

Reviews.Author: Wenqi C.
Reviews.Content: Food is good, service is always good, and the art  display is really good! Enjoy the energy here~

Reviews.Author: Jessica Y.
Reviews.Content: Round 2! Once again, was not disappointed! Service is great, super courteous! Tried their Cobb Omelette and of course their Crunchy French Toast! My stomach and I left a happy camper! What a great way to start the day!

Reviews.Author: Vivian L.
Reviews.Content: I came here because of the high ratings on yelp. Oh boy, it did not disappoint me. This place is great! The wait is pretty long, 30+ minutes around 1pm, but there are plenty of shops around to kill time. Food:1. Crunchy French Toast: 5, the best french toast that I've ever tasted! It's on the sweeter side, but wow.. it lives up to its hype.2. Norwegian Benedict: 5, this was deliciousI also tried a bite of my friends' Kamil's breakfast and turkey pesto panini. Both of them were good. I doubt they have any bad items on their menu. I was very pleased with the food. They also have habanero tabasco sauce!! Omg, I never knew that existed until I ate here. I love spicy food and I love that sauce to go with my meal. Service: 5, the servers are very attentive and nice. My waiter gave me the recommendation for Norwegian Benedict and I'm glad he did. I just hate it when you ask for a recommendation and you end up hating the food, but this wasn't the case. I loved it.

Reviews.Author: Kevin N.
Reviews.Content: Solid brunch place! Came here on a Monday morning right when it opened, I think we were 1 of 2 parties in the place at that time. I ordered the steak hash which was excellent, although the gorgonzola was a bit too prominent in the dish for my tastes. The rest of the hash included grilled beef tenderloin, spinach, caramelized onions, mushrooms, and potatoes. This was topped off with two poached and a herb-chive hollandaise sauce.I also helped my friend finish her crispy french toast which was delicious and definitely something original that I've never had before. They take brioche, dip it in batter and smother it corn flakes to give it that crispy crunch and then grill it. Perfect with the berries it comes served with and the vanilla bean sauce. Definitely worth a try if you're feeling something sweet.Service was helpful and friendly. I think the place in general is a bit pricier for brunch but it was definitely a great experience and I wouldn't mind coming back.

Reviews.Author: Guillermo S.
Reviews.Content: They have not just great, but  "above and beyond" service.  Amazingly attentive. GF had the smoked salmon and I the goat cheese & spinach omelet, both were amazingly tasty and very obviously had freshest ingredients.  The ambiance casual and trendy yet not pretentious.  I hope my subsequent visits to this place are as '5-star' as my first!

Reviews.Author: Jenny M.
Reviews.Content: Both locations are great! Yes, you'll wait but it'll be worth it. They have French press and a ton of drinks to offer at the coffee bar... Or perhaps something from the juice bar. When it's time to get down and dirty you can't go wrong with the breakfast there. My go to is the Migas a spicy tofu Chipolte egg dish with tortillas on the side with the famous and unforgettable crunchy corn flake French toast. Con:Obligatory parking comment

Reviews.Author: Jane K.
Reviews.Content: I came here for brunch on one of those rare days when it pours for the first in a while in LA. It's kinda romantic to go to on a rainy day when it's all gloomy outside. The place has a very warm and cozy vibe to it and with tables rather close to each other. There was a wait for near I think 20 minutes. I wish I had thought to walk around and explore the shops around before fifteen minutes had already passed. Oh well. Parking- there's plenty of street parking. If you're willing to walk from the residential area. Eggs Benedict- delicious but people kept on ordering the French toast with berries on top. And I could not stop staring it looked so good or the presentation made it look so good. If I ever come back it will be to try those. Service- everyone here is super nice and friendly. And attend to your needs immediately. There's also a waiting area with seats for people to wait comfortably. It looked like there was seating outside except everything was wet from the rain.

Reviews.Author: Angela C.
Reviews.Content: You GUYS!  You guys.  Italian Breakfast Risotto, all day, every day.Also!Service:  lovely.Ambiance:  lovely.Coffee:  lovely.I'm moving to LA this summer, and I can assure you that I will be frequenting this place.  With bells on.

Reviews.Author: James M.
Reviews.Content: I feel so bad that I only found this place now that I'm leaving L.A. in a week. Had a CLEAN highchair for the lil dude (rarer than you'd think). Not crowded when we came in, 9am on a Monday. But packed when we left an hour later. Service was stellar. Our guy made 2 recommendations that were killer. There was a breakfast sandwich that the Missus was in love with. And the chilaquiles were so, so good. Coffee drinks were very tasty. And the experience was just very relaxed and peaceful, even when it got crowded later. Never felt rushed. Really don't have one complaint about this place. Hope we get another chance to eat here before we leave.

Reviews.Author: Diana A.
Reviews.Content: Really really good crunchy french toast--I'd go back just for that (but pricey, like $12). My vegetarian omelet was also really flavorful, filled with goat cheese and spinach. Always park in the side streets-- it's free and 2-hour free parking! Be careful with the street cleaning signs though and expect a 30-minute wait on the weekends (it's  a big space inside however, so no stress about being crowded! :)).

Reviews.Author: Candace C.
Reviews.Content: Had a very "LA" day with my girlies-- We went hiking at Runyon Canyon in the morning (#fitspo) and then decided to get brunch (#fatspo).The worst part of this place is that it's really hard to choose what you want because everything looks good.  While we were waiting for our food, I saw other dishes come out for other tables and wanted to change my order like 5 times because everything looked delicious.Luckily, my friends and I like to share everything, so we all got different dishes.  I got the breakfast burger (fried egg + bacon + breakfast potatoes?... how could I not order that..).  My friends got the breakfast quesadilla and the steak hash.  The steak hash had this amazing green sauce on it and the steak was tender.    The portions are huge, the service was great.  All-in-all, this brunch was the cherry on top my Sunday. =PI would suggest parking in the residential areas off Melrose.  I've always found parking there pretty easy.

Reviews.Author: Yvonne L.
Reviews.Content: Good things come to those that wait. That being said, wake up in the morning, brush your teeth. Head down to Blu Jam and put your name down on the list. Then go and run some errands! Feed your cat, deposit your paycheck, pick up some non perishable groceries!By the time you're done, your table will be ready. Make sure your whole party is there or else they won't seat ya!You must have the crunchy French toast!!! If absolutely nothing else, get that and then get another order to bring home to your cat. The items on the specials list were okay, tried the: -orzo&eggs and it's better than it looks although super cheesy, -asparagus salad I will make for you, -Maui brunch sandwich was super soggy and not enough meat.Stick with the good old staples of hash and omelettes. Will not disappoint!

Reviews.Author: Lisseth R.
Reviews.Content: First time here. 20 minute wait they said and that meant it :) got seated inside and it was a nice vibe.. Our waitress I believe her name was Alyssa , very nice girl. Ordered the Migas and it was exquisite ! First time here in LA and I definitely will come back here when I return.

Reviews.Author: Jamie C.
Reviews.Content: My friend insisted, in as L.A. and gay fashion as possible, that we have brunch during my stay, and he insisted it should be at Blu Jam.  He was right!  Everything on the menu looked amazing, and I can confirm that both of our dishes were.  The French press coffee was to die for, and although it was a forty minute wait (eek!), the lovely staff cooked up some of their famous French toast and offered us unlimited samples as we milled about  ("This is the crack that keeps you on my sidewalk!").  Our waiter was attentive and the space is elegant and interesting.  Also it is SO.  MUCH.  FOOD.  I could keep talking.  But you should just go ahead and go get your spot in line.

Reviews.Author: Shannon H.
Reviews.Content: Five stars!!! I RARELY give 5 stars. In spite of waiting about 15-20 minutes on Sunday, the crunchy French Toast was EXCELLENT! My boyfriend wasn't crazy about his quesadilla. And yes, it was loud and packed, and understandably so. I'll go back later and try something else but for now, definitely one of my new faves! OH! I loved the waiter Dave! I'm not his sister or relative or anybody trying to help him out. Don't know him from the man on the moon. But that guy didn't forget ANYTHING. Was very attentive, and made it seem so effortless, with a genuine smile and ease. Made the experience even better!

Reviews.Author: Kimi R.
Reviews.Content: I came because of the yelp reviews, regular great stop on Melrose. Really popular, 40+ minute wait on a Friday morning. Weekends are worse, no reservations so be prepared to wait on the sidewalk or in the waiting room (wish this was now table space)Longwait but omg the food is amazing! Stake hash, omg stake hash.And crunchy french toast omg, so good. Worth the wait

Reviews.Author: Tanda M.
Reviews.Content: Sadly, I do not think Blu Jam and I can be friends. Visited this location after trying the Studio City/Sherman Oaks location a few weeks ago.I ordered the crunchy french toast. Heard and read so many good things about it couldnt wait, especially after my less than stellar experience at the other locale.My cousin ordered something with poached eggs and loved it.My french toast was dry, half burnt and OVERLY crunchy. Sadly, I was not happy. Had I not had my chicken sausage and fruit, I would've starved.I even asked if we could "minimize" the crunch before ordering it and the waiter told me they wont modify it since its a pre-made batter. Hmmm...made no sense to me, but OK, I went with it. It was just WAY TOO MUCH CRUNCH for already dry french toast with burnt edges.We had a pretty hot waiter and he was nice too. We waited for like 30 mins to be seated. Typical with brunch spots in LA. Long ass wait times. We got our food pretty quickly considering how crowded it was. The service was pretty good. Long bathroom wait. Hope you don't have to go or wash your hands. One bathroom per gender. The tables were like on top of each other, just like the valley location so prepare to know what your neighbors are eating. Looked like the guys sitting next to us did not like their crunchy french toast either. Left the whole plate of it on the table as they checked out to leave. Next time, I will just have some corn flakes before I leave home if I want any "crunch" with my food.

Reviews.Author: Bruce N.
Reviews.Content: What a delightful find, just a few blocks east of my old high school.  This is my new ,must go spot for breakfast. Staff friendly and fast, ambiance excellent. Check out the crispy french toast with vanilla sauce..worth every calorie. Long dinning area so wiat( except weekends) is never to long..the place has an excellent vegetarian menu and vegan choices too. The food was fresh and of high quality.

Reviews.Author: Kyle Y.
Reviews.Content: Saturday brunch here was great! We tried a breakfast risotto and steak hash were my favorites. They were delicious and the presentation was cool. The dishes were pressed into rounds before plating so they were perfect circles. Loved the clean presentation for these dishes...they were of course destroyed the minute the plates hit the table! The risotto was a new twist on breakfast for me which I loved...and the steak hash was a classic. Be ready to wait in the a.m. But it moved pretty quickly!

Reviews.Author: Diana M.
Reviews.Content: SO DELICIOUS. My friend and I went today around 3pm and waited maybe 5 minutes. The staff is nice and friendly! The food is SO SO SO delicious. Who doesn't love breakfast?! I ordered the eggwich and my friend got the California omelette! We were both very happy with our choices! We will definitely be back! Awesome place!

Reviews.Author: Hao T.
Reviews.Content: The crunchy french toast sent me to the moon! I was not a fan of French toast but this one is amazing! Texture and flavors were so complimentary of each other and the vanilla bean sauce was a great balance. You have to order this guys. Me and my boyfriend also got the chilaquiles and that was a unique fish but I couldn't stop eating the French toast. If only I lived closer I would frequent way more. But for now I shall try to remake this amazing dish!

Reviews.Author: Angela H.
Reviews.Content: Brunch line sucks. We waited about 1.5 hours, but luckily there are a bunch of stores and a cafe across the street where you can check out stuff/grab something. I think this place would really benefit from implementing a text reservation system. The server just told us to keep coming back (first 40-50 mins, then 20 mins). We just took our time and got back around the 1.5 mark and was actually called in to go right away. A text message would've simplified things.I got the crunchy french toast and my friend got the migas. The crunchy french toast was delicious. I love french toast in general, but to roll it around in cornflakes made it 10x better. I wasn't really digging the vanilla sauce, is it supposed to be runny and watery; I thought it'd be thicker like syrup or something, but still, a very dunkable sauce. The migas were ok; the different egg benedicts they were bringing out looked good though. If the line/wait wasn't so bad, I'd probably want to come back. I kind of want to check the place out for dinner.

Reviews.Author: Krystle C.
Reviews.Content: AMAZING.  This is byfar the best breakfast place I have been to. Came here yesterday with my cousin.  I read on the yelp reviews that the wait can be long for brunch on a weekend so we arrived early at about 9:15am ish on a Saturday morning.  We were lucky enough to get seated right away.  30 minutes later I asked our waiter what the wait was like and she said they were up to 55 minutes on wait times.  So glad we beat the rush.Our waiter was nice and friendly.  Very knowledgeable of the menu and prompt with taking our orders and checking up on us if we needed anything.  Onto the food:  I ordered the Blu Jam Benedict, my cousin had the Roma via Paris, and we ordered the signature Crunchy French Toast on the side.  Everything was to die for.  The Blu Jam Benedict was excellent.  I am an eggs benedict lover and it's my favorite thing to order for breakfast.  Loved how they put bacon and ham with green onions and with just the right amount of hollandaise sauce.  If you want a classic eggs benedict, you cannot go wrong with this order because every bite was delicious.  The Crunchy French Toast was like heaven in my mouth.  Such a smart and simple take on making french toast different.  It is so flavorful and crunchy and with vanilla bean sauce they give you to pour over the entree - it is perfection.  Only thing that bothered me:  I ordered orange juice and although it was nice and pulpy, what I didn't enjoy was that when I would take a sip, each time I would find orange seeds in my drink.Other than that, you must try this place if you're in the area.  Definitely worth the drive and the wait!

Reviews.Author: Todd N.
Reviews.Content: Not much of a breakfast fan but WHOA, who knew Breakfast could be taken to the next level??? Especially with French Toast.I heard about this place via a friend as I was looking for a good breakfast/brunch place that has a casual feel but amazing food.  I speculate a little bit when it comes to "amazing breakfast" places because I can't imagine how they can change up such a simple dish.I was prove wrong very quickly.  I ordered their signature french toast, and that first bite was just AMAZING!  The secret is that crunch taste from the corn flakes as well as the buttermilk topping; the fresh fruits were definitely a great touch as well.  The portions were a good size and at the end I couldn't eat anymore.  I almost didn't finish it but each bite was orgasmic.  I usually try not to go to the same place twice, but this one I will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Author: Adrienne V.
Reviews.Content: Breakfast, breakfast, and more breakfast. I love breakfast!This is one of the best breakfast places I've been to in life, and I've been to plenty if you've seen my yelp account. The staff is welcoming, the ambience is so cute, and the menu is phenomenal. Both my friend and I got the salmon benedict. I think I inhaled it because not even 20 minutes into her story, I was just staring at her without anything to pick at on my plate anymore ): We also shared the crunchy french toast! It was pretty good, I think they crust it with frosted flakes? Not sure, and then they give you milk as a syrup. Clever (; ! I loved it. Also, this is that spot in that viral proposal video on youtube. If you really want to watch it, look up 'The Proposal' and it should be one of the first few videos. Parking is kinda a bust, but that's LA for you, so you can't even dock them down on that cause if you do, then you're just an ass.

Reviews.Author: Cindy T.
Reviews.Content: French toast with vanilla bean sauce!! We came right at opening and requested outdoor seating since we had Ninja with us and there was next to zero wait. Great spot for breakfast.

Reviews.Author: Jared M.
Reviews.Content: VERY RARE TASTE THAT I ENJOY WILL BE BACK! Very Nice and Welcoming staff I must say and the atmosphere is very Wholesome!

Reviews.Author: Amanda C.
Reviews.Content: Go with your gut - order the Crunchy French Toast!You will hate yourself if you pass up the brioche rolled in corn flakes which is topped with fresh fruit and served with a light tasting vanilla bean sauce.DO IT! Oh, and get there early!

Reviews.Author: Carolina P.
Reviews.Content: First time trying Blu Jam and I loved it 'Yes , the wait is annoying but the food is great! I got the eggwich and of course had to try the crunchy French toast ... Delicious !It was really sunny though and the line to wait is just a mass of people trying to fit under one umbrella / waiting area that only fits about ten people... Add another umbrella?

Reviews.Author: Shannon R.
Reviews.Content: We had every intention of leaving early, I swear, but brunch snuck up on us and we were confronted with an hour wait at Blu Jam.  Starving, we pondered the meaning of life and whether or not it would be worth sticking it out.  Conclusion?  WORTH IT.I love their easy to navigate menu, with symbols indicating what's vegan or what can be made vegan.  My eyes went straight to the Spicy Tex Mex Tofu Hash and it was the perfect brunch item.  No other veggie hash I've had has even come close to this dish.  It was healthy, savory, and so filling.  I think I got 2/3rds through before I had to cry mercy, but I wanted to lick my plate clean.I had a lovely iced coffee with almond milk that was a great brew, not acidic at all.  My friends were tempted by the affordable and customizable juices, and said they were fantastic.The atmosphere is so cool, it reminds me of Philly breakfast joints and makes LA fade away for a minute (you know, once you get past the absurd wait time).  While I have no patience when I'm hungry, I'd be willing to brave the storm again, and that's saying something.

Reviews.Author: Jane K.
Reviews.Content: I'm sure there is many review s about their french crunchy toast. I always ask for maple syrup for a extra dollar.   Worth it!All my family loves the split pea soup too!!

Reviews.Author: Jason L.
Reviews.Content: First off the loose leaf green tea is the best tea I have had anywhere. Do I get the gun powder is my favorite - no wait the Jasmine is my favorite - but wait there coffee is so good do I get drip or brewed umm ... the one in the French press is the one. Today I was greeted by a smiley host and then a handsome waiter who helped us with our order right away. It's been a while since I have been here and it's good to be back, I usually don't like to wait in line for breakfast but no line since it's during the week. Can't wait to try there new organic steel cut oatmeal and u will be having a bite of my boyfriends French toast!!!

Reviews.Author: Ashley R.
Reviews.Content: So. Flipping. Delicious. I'm obsessed with the eggs Benedict and crunchy French toast with vanilla sauce! Love the fact that it's small and service has always been very good and attentive. The water is even good! Yummmmm.

Reviews.Author: Ang S.
Reviews.Content: Out of the world  crunchy French toast!!Coconut/cereal crust (?) and vanilla milk dip  are heavenly made for the soft French toast. Breakfast quesadilla was equally delish (okay... Slightly less so than the sacred CFT)The wait was annoying. 45 mins on a rainy Sunday morning. Nothing seems to stop the Angelenos from waiting for their bite of the famous crunchy toast. Sucks for me, or everyone else with the same ambition. I'll be back lining up again in no time for sure.

Reviews.Author: Amanda L.
Reviews.Content: I'm an avid follower of Aimee's blog, Songofstyle, and when I read an article that states this is one of her favorite brunch spots, I HAD to pay a visit! Blu Jam was my first stop in L.A; I arrived around 11-12ish, and I waited approximately 10 min, which wasn't bad at all! Now onto the food...pretty much EVERYONE on yelp raved on and on about how ahhhmazing their french toast. From what I remember, their french toast is fried with butter with an added flair of crusted coconut flakes.  Topped with your favorite assortment of berries, they were paired with a vanilla bean sauce.  I'm not a big fan of coconut, but I DO love vanilla bean; they complimented each other all to well.  If you're like me and isn't particularly crazy about maple syrup, especially due to its sticky nature, you would loveee this.  I know I did, and I'm pretty picky with food. hehe.I also ordered the vegan tex mex.  they gave you tortilla so you can make your own tacos.  Sounds very ordinary, but the food was so flavorful.  Everything just melts into your mouth. The bf ordered egg benedict, and it was one of the best egg benedicts I've had in my life, if not the best.  Same goes for the french toast.Final verdict? GO TO BLU JAM and prepare to be mind blown.  If you are able to avoid the rush like me, I'm sure your experience would be nothing less than phenomenal. :D

Reviews.Author: Tina M.
Reviews.Content: I love breakfast and Blu Jam Cafe is a great place for breakfast lovers to enjoy a good meal! We tried the florentine benedict and of course the crunch french toast. Usually I'm more of an eggs and bacon kind of girl so I'm not one to get a whole plate of french toast for myself. I usually end up nibbling off of someone else's plate...BUT...man I could've finished a whole plate of their crunchy french toast on my own. It was so good! A must try if you come here.All the food here looks and smells amazing. I kept staring at the food on all the other tables. We'll have to come back to try some other dishes!This place is a very popular dining spot so it gets crowded. Also, as you can imagine, the parking situation isn't the best in this area. Luckily when I came here I found street parking very easily!

Reviews.Author: Anthony N.
Reviews.Content: ***Blu Jam Cafe is a very popular breakfast spot and their signature crunchy French toast is a generous portion and definitely tasty***Blu Jam Cafe is located on Melrose just east of Fairfax.  It is a very popular breakfast and brunch spot.  Their breakfast menu features a wide range of offerings from traditional breakfast items and indulgent sweets to more healthy and low carb options.  They also feature a few weekly specials and some of them sounded interesting like the breakfast burrito with chipotle peppers.I had their signature crunchy French toast and it was a very generous portion.  The French toast consisted of good brioche dipped in batter and then rolled in corn flakes that gave the French toast its crunchy exterior to contrast its soft interior.  The French toast was good.  It had a lightly sweet flavor (it definitely needed additional sweet toppings to make it work).  The crunchy crust was very addictive and while the inside was not really moist, it was not dry either.The garnishes included a very large amount of strawberries and blueberries (I really liked the blueberries here).  There was also a light and thin vanilla bean sauce, which was just okay.  The flavor was not that strong, but it did combine with the corn flakes covered French toast to create kind of a new take on cereal with milk.Real maple syrup is available at a small supplemental charge and the maple syrup is good and goes great with their French toast.I also ordered the chicken apple sausage and a scrambled egg on the side.  The chicken apple sausage was hearty and had a good maple flavor.  Unfortunately, it was not that juicy and kind of lukewarm.  The scrambled egg was good (and a good portion too)--good quality egg and nicely fluffy.For drinks, they do all kinds of freshly squeezed juices and you can mix them; many options are available including orange, grapefruit, ginger, beet, carrot, cucumber, and so on.Service was very friendly and quick.Blu Jam Cafe has a small but nice dining room.  They have a great brick wall and there is a nice casual and rustic approach that works perfectly for a relaxed brunch in a big city.Prices are just north of $12 per entree, but the entrees are filling.I thought the crunchy French toast was good.  It was on par with the Cap'n Crunch French toast at The Blue Moon Cafe in Baltimore (I think I might like Blue Moon's Cafe French toast just a little bit more).  Where Blu Jam Cafe falls short compared to that Baltimore breakfast spot or the very good Matt's Big Breakfast in Phoenix is the sausage, which had a good flavor but did not have that freshly cooked and right out of the pan snap and juiciness as the sausages at those other two popular breakfast spots.  Still, Blu Jam Cafe is a good breakfast spot in Los Angeles and there might be other entrees here worth trying.Metered street parking is available.

Reviews.Author: Kimberly F.
Reviews.Content: the crunchy french toast. get it.

Reviews.Author: Jess L.
Reviews.Content: This place is seriously overrated. Came here for lunch with a friend. She ordered the am rice bowl & I ordered the salmon eggs benedict. The am rice bowl was way too salty. The eggs benedict was just alright. Don't know about the other dishes but don't think I would come back here.

Reviews.Author: Marianne C.
Reviews.Content: This place is poppin! Me and my friend went her after trying to get some free concert tickets, but that line was way too long so we came here and had our world rocked.    We ordered the nutella and Banana crunchy french toast (HEAVEN ON A PLATTER) kamils breakfast for me and the california omelette for her. My meal was delicious and perfect if you want a substantial breakfast without feeling like you'll throw up after. My friend also said amazings things about her food as well.      The service was amazing for how packed it was, and the waitress was bright and attentive the whole time. The wait was 35-45 minutes on a saturday morning and I would say thats pretty damn good! We did some shopping for the time in betweeen and now we have cute clothes AND stomachs filled with delicious food.

Reviews.Author: Alyssa T.
Reviews.Content: As a full-fledged BREAKFAST LOVER, let me just say that I've never encountered a BREAKFAST place with such a UNIQUE yet EXTENSIVE menu. Everything on the menu sounds AMAZING and before I even ordered, I was POSITIVE that I would return to try the other eats! BLU JAM BENEDICT--met my standards but didn't blow me away.However...CRUNCHY FRENCH TOAST--SIGNATURE and MUST-GET dish! It made me become a fan of french toast. That says a lot. Everything about it was awesome--crunchy texture, light, and the vanilla bean sauce! The wait was about 20-25mins on a Sunday during prime BRUNCH time, surprisingly not that bad. There's a lot of seating inside and our waiter was a doll.

Reviews.Author: Carlos Z.
Reviews.Content: I must say, very impressed by this location. Perfect for those who are looking to get breakfast, brunch, or lunch. On our visit we had the Blu Jam Benedict and the Crunchy French. Best Breakfast in town! -Friendly Service-Delicious Food-Waiting Room-Long WaitStrongly suggest to arrive 30 minutes early, the wait is usually 30-40 minutes.Visit the two local thrift stores/clothing boutiques while you wait. Well worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: M B.
Reviews.Content: Great ambience. Nice staff. We were seated right away. The server gave us suggestions.  Ordered the French toast- very good.

Reviews.Author: Sofia M.
Reviews.Content: Everything from the Crunchy French Toast, Designer Omelette and the Power House Breakfast is flawless and extremely well-executed dishes!  This place will leave you speechless after your first bite of just about anything on the menu.  (Wasn't a fan of the Turkey Burger though - but it still doesn't take away from their 5-star rating)Just a tip for first-time customers: arrive early before 9am on weekends for minimal wait or expect to exercise your patience while you order and sip on a coffee, tea or freshly-prepared juice during a 45-90 minute wait on the weekends.If Yelp allowed to give stars on customers, I'd give 1-star to the impatient/irate/hangry (hungry+angry=hangry) customers that come at 12:30-pmish and spread negative energy across those that are simply trying to enjoy their weekend...eat an apple or something before you come for goodness sakes!  Leave the hangryness at home!

Reviews.Author: Elyssa R.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE BLU JAM CAFE. I love breakfast foods sooo much and the food here is one of the best that I've ever tasted. My friends and I have come here a few times and we have enjoyed every single thing that we've ordered. I am completely obsessed with the crunchy french toast- I think I have posted pictures of it on my Instagram multiple times (yes, I'm THAT person on IG). This place is a definite MUST if you are in the area! You won't regret it! Just a couple downfalls: since it is positively delightful and not a huge restaurant, there may be long waits on the weekends. I've always come on weekdays and never had an issue getting a table and was seated right away. Also, since it's along Melrose, parking is blegh. Street parking with meters all the way!

Reviews.Author: Jane L.
Reviews.Content: We came to get a late brunch on Sunday because we knew the wait was crazy during lunch or late breakfast time. Unfortunately it was still really packed and we ended up waiting 40 ish minutes. I definitely would come back on a weekday to avoid the crowd. The food was great. I got the Norwegian eggs Benedict. The muffin and spinach didn't get soggy like other eggs Benedict I've had. The egg was poached perfectly which I really picky about since I don't like solid yolk. The salmon was okay, not the freshest. The dish also came with a side of potatoes. They were perfectly seasoned and not too salty. My sister ordered a Cobb salad with pea soup. We shared the soup but I basically ate it all because it was so good. Perfect for dipping bread in. If you ask for bread, they'll bring a basket of fresh bread out so I recommend asking for some. My boyfriend got a burger. He always orders burgers where ever he goes and he really enjoyed his. Overall I enjoyed this place. They make really great food and I'll be returning for sure to try more dishes. Also, the staff was wonderful: friendly, attentive, and polite. Our waiter was incredibly nice so we tipped generously. He definitely deserves it from working so hard in a busy restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Ruth T.
Reviews.Content: You can tell that this place is trendy by the amount of people that accumulate there in the morning!  I had a few qualms about how bad the parking would be and how long I would have to wait, but luckily there was a good amount of 2 hour spots.  The wait, however, turned out to be around an hour when I was told 30-45 minutes.  It didn't turn out to be a huge deal since there were a few shops in the area I could poke around in, and a tray of crispy french toast samples was passed around.  We were told that if we waited another 15 minutes we could be seated inside, but we were ravenous.  Now on to the food...I ordered the Norwegian Benedict (yum, salmon), which came with potatoes on the side.  Presented beautifully, and tasted just as good! Eggs were perfectly soft boiled, and the salmon was a nice twist on the traditional.  The potatoes were kind of a letdown though, not that well seasoned, and some was burnt.  I love potatoes :( Overall though, nice dish.Service was friendly, but nothing out of the ordinary.  Prices are typical for restaurants of this caliber.  I was surprised to see that there were no mimosas on the menu, though.Every direction I turned, there were other plates of food that looked extremely delicious.  I need to come back here to try the carbonara! Very good place to go for brunch with a friend or two, but you might want to hold off on bringing a large group during the weekend.  Food: 5, Service: 4, Ambiance: 4, Price: 3

Reviews.Author: Jimmy C.
Reviews.Content: I've been meaning to come here for awhile but there is usually always a hour wait time. Finally got to come on a Saturday morning around 10 am and was kind of shocked we were seated right away. I guess the rush is a bit later during lunch.We tried to go for the signature items for the first time. Our waiter was absolutely super nice and service was great.Crispy French Toast - I think they layer it in crack or something because it is absolutely amazing. TOP 3 best french toast I've ever placed in my mouth. It is so buttery and top it off with the white buttermilk? omg... orgasmic. I think it's a little too much for one person to eat as an entire meal, it's best to split this with someone.Blu Jam Benedict - Pretty amazing balance, the bacon tasted amazing while the egg yolk kept everything juicy.It is definitely on the expensive side but I think it's worth trying for the first time or if you happen to be in the neighborhood. They really have it together on these brunch items. One hour wait, worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Alex D.
Reviews.Content: This place does not need my review. It has established itself as a front runner for anyone looking to have a delicious breakfast, a nice lunch, and for a while there even a hardy dinner. Even though the dinner service has been discontinued and the alcohol is no longer served, I still find Blu to be one of the best places in the neighborhood and thus, as a long time patron, I must pay tribute by writing a few short lines. Speaking of being a force to be reckoned with for breakfast and lunch, the Blue Jam Cafe has lines to prove it, but the good news is they are masters at turning tables and making you feel like part of their family at the same time. Friendly servers treat everyone like long terms customer while delivering delicious French Press coffees or espresso drinks of your choosing. My personal favorite, the Crunchy French Toast is a one of a king creation that is definitely worth the wait. As a matter of fact, the entire menu is full of hidden gems, from the Breakfast Risotto to the Caprese Sandwich for lunch. Regardless of what you are craving, I am certain that Blu can do!

Reviews.Author: Sophie P.
Reviews.Content: I don't really give 5 star reviews. This little cafe is so great! What to get:Crunchy French toast - share it! It can get heavy for one person. I'm not a huge fan of French toast because it's really syrupy and heavy. But this was perfect with corn flakes that made it crunchy with fresh strawberries and blueberries. MY FAVORITE! Norwegian Benedict - eggs Benedict and smoked salmonOur server was great and very accommodating with our waters. Living on the east coast, I'm used to tap water that tastes... Like water. The iced water tastes like it came from the sink, so if that's not your cup of tea order a good drink!A great place for a brunch, which better accommodates a party of 2 because of it's small size.

Reviews.Author: Gavin P.
Reviews.Content: Amazing! Worth the wait! Must go! Get the French Toast!It was super annoying having to wait to get a seat here, but the food was absolutely worth it!!! SERIOUSLY! I got the french toast which was served slightly caramelized with fresh fruit, and a cup of melted vanilla ice creme to dip it all in for extra flavor. Seriously, was I getting breakfast or dessert? WHO CARES! As popular as this place is, once you get a table, it is very comfortable and intimate inside. Good place for a date or a friendly meet up.

Reviews.Author: Stella M.
Reviews.Content: I love this little restaurant on Melrose for brunch.My favoite has to be the Crunchy French Toast, which is coated with corn flakes to give it that crunch. It is also topped with strawberries, blueberries, and bananas, and the vanilla bean sauce... yummy! I also love their Blu Jam Benedict... I always judge egg benedicts by their hollandaise sauce and I loved the hollandaise sauce at Blu Jam. As a bonus, I also loved their French Press Coffee! :)

Reviews.Author: Mandi T.
Reviews.Content: **Review #400** woot another milestone!!! But enough about me.7 words sum up my experience - I cannot wait to come back here. There I said it. Hands down one of the better brunches around the area. However the wait sucks, the parking situation sucks.Park around the neighborhood - it's a 2 hour parking until 8pm (if you read the signs) There are different signages, yes, even across the street. So make sure you're reading ALL the signs before you leave your car. You might come back to a terrible surprise in the form of a $$$ parking ticket.What I had - Coffee. Yes. In a HUGE mug. Just right up my alley.Norwegian Benedict  (Toasted English muffin, smoked salmon, poached eggs, sautéed spinach, tomato and dill hollandaise, served with potatoes). Instead of potatoes I opted for a side salad instead. A girls' gotta watch her figure right? SO delicious. Has to be one of the best tasting Benedicts I have had in a LONG time. num num num num.Friend had - Migas (gluten free) eggs scrambled with jalapeños, chipotle, beef chorizo sausage, red bell peppers, tortilla chips and mozzarella, topped with homemade tomato salsa, served with corn tortillas and potatoes. It was pretty spicy, but it tasted sooooooo good. It's a nice scramble with a kick. Yessss. May be what I order next.We came around 2ish and the wasn't too bad nor long. I think if you pass the 1ish, noonish rush, they're not as busy, plus they have time to devote to you. Btw, this place is open til 4, 7 days a week. Not sure about holidays and what not... since you should be home! Not at work or having brunch. hahI haven't been back for the lunches, but they looks sooo yummy. They have many alternatives for people with special diets, gluten free, etc. and it's indicated on the menu.We shall meet again! Apparently there's another location in Sherman Oaks. Anyone wanna go? :)

Reviews.Author: Stella K.
Reviews.Content: Steak hash tasted like the grill. Ok maybe not the grill. But it tasted so....burnt :/California omelette was aite. The only thing that really had flavor was the bacon. Duh. BUT THE CRUNCHY FRENCH TOAST WAS BOMB DOT COM. That was the best dish out of the three we ordered. Today was the first time I heard my boyfriend use the word "best" to describe food. He was describing the French toast. Service was ok. Not too great but also not terrible. We might be back.

Reviews.Author: Regina H.
Reviews.Content: I was lucky and came on a day that wasn't that busy so I just waited about 10 minutes!I tried the crunchy french toast and steak hash and they are to die for!!The food was amazing but it is on the pricey level compared to other brunch places I've been to.

Reviews.Author: Valerie O.
Reviews.Content: The food is really good. BEST EGGS BENEDICT IN LA. Its always packed and there is always a wait. Most likely 15 min. Weekends a really long wait. The place is small but cozy. Not a fan of the tables being so close to each other. The service is really good and waiters are nice. No alcohol.

Reviews.Author: Kevin C.
Reviews.Content: A touch overrated. The crunchy French toast was just French toast covered with corn flakes. Not exactly high brow. The Benedicts got the job done in an aggressively average manner. And most peculiarly was the random sprig of mint in my dining partner's water glass. At first we thought it was an elegant flourish, but no other diners -including myself - had it, which makes it more seem like a victim of garnish gravity rather than deliberate design. Either way, the menu is expansive, so lots of other reasons to come back...just BYOwater.

Reviews.Author: Dan K.
Reviews.Content: To be fair, the service was excellent. Quick, prompt, attentive. Maybe if the food had more meat & cheese... Jk.

Reviews.Author: B S.
Reviews.Content: I've been wanting to try this place...so today we finally did. I must say I was def impressed. We both had the breakfast quesadillas...mine without chicken of course...and they were fantastic! The tortillas were def fresh and not the ones I personally buy in the store. Lol. I would prefer a little more seasoning on the potatoes..but hey...that's just me. Oh yes...and because it's a MUST @ this place...we split the famous crunchy french toast. Yummy goodness all in my mouth! This has def been added to the fav list!

Reviews.Author: Daunielle R.
Reviews.Content: As an avid brunch eater I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at Blue Jam Cafe. The bench options were vast, but not overwhelming. The choices went beyond your standard brunch meals, venturing in many eclectic, delectable dishes that we're both healthy with a satisfying selection of bacon. Or waiter, Spencer was personable with great recommendationswith a handsome smile! This place had made the top of my brunch lists!

Reviews.Author: Reg E.
Reviews.Content: There's probably nothing I can say that already hasn't been said so I'm going to keep this short and simple.Service was really friendly, the wait was about 15mins.  It's loud and busy, but not overly disturbing- I enjoy the sound of life happening.I recommend the crunchy French toast, as most yelpers already have.  I liked the texture of it, even better than your standard French toast.  It's definitely a dish to be shared!Norwegian Benedict is something that I cannot recommend, and at $15 it really made me regret ordering this.  I've had salmon Benedict's before but there was something off about this dish.  I don't know, it just didn't do it for me.  This restaurant has a lot of food to choose from.  I'll be back to try something else.

Reviews.Author: Christina C.
Reviews.Content: Great brunch spot. Blu Jam is not a secret hidden gem - this place is heavily packed on the weekends (just drive by and see). I wish they served mimosas though.Steak Hash  - this dish is not for the weak. Huge, heavy, salty - the hollandaise is actually dill-based. you can taste the dill.Crunchy French toast - oh my domo this was so good. Perfectly battered french toast that was crunch with this amazing vanilla bean sauce. Really good.Blu Jam benedict - tasty, nothing extraordinary.For sides, bacon was ok. So were the potatoes.Pro-tip - Get on the waiting list and go nearby to Village Idiot to share a bottle of champagne with mixers while you wait.

Reviews.Author: Priyanka K.
Reviews.Content: Everything is delicious! The Crunchy French toast and the Breakfast Quesadillas are out of this world!!! The wait times are justified, don't give up yet!
Reviews.Author_Location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

Reviews.Author: Jacqueline C.
Reviews.Content: I think I completely ordered the wrong thing because everyone else seemed to have better looking (and tasting) dishes than me.I ordered an omelette and it was bland. My boyfriend ordered an egg white scramble...it was bland. I think the best thing I had was the cucumber and lemon infused water they gave us. The place was real cute and the service was good and they even were responsive to fixing the bathroom light as promptly as possible when I tried to go in and it was pitch black in there.If I ever go back there again I am determined to ordered something awesome in hopes that this review will be edited to 4-5 stars.

Reviews.Author: Debbie B.
Reviews.Content: The food was good, wait time was really long.  I got a Parisian scramble and everyone else got the Benedict which looked really good.  It's sorta a group seating which also meant our food came out cold.  I liked it but not sure if I'd go back.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany L.
Reviews.Content: My review is clouded by the fact that my friend had food poisoning from the Eggwich... Disregarding that, i thought BJC was amazing! I think we got lucky because we didn't have much of a wait. The waiters were so friendly. We had just finished a hike at Runyon Canyon and came straight here, super thirsty. They kept re-filling our waters and even let us fill our own bottles! Their water has lemon and mint in it, although I couldn't really taste the mint. Still a nice touch. Everyone I've met in LA has been so nice. We left a generous tip. Food: We each ordered our own dishes and shared the Crunchy French Toast. They have large portions, basically enough for 2 people per entree. According to my friends, Roma via Paris - just OK. Vegan Burger - good flavor. As I said, V had the Eggwich, and there's literally nothing else that could have given her food poisoning. It must have been from the egg. She's been sick and unable to hold down anything she eats for the last 3 days, and I'm not sure how long this will last - kinda puts a damper on her vacation. It's like she's unintentionally bulimic right now. Crunchy French Toast - 8 pieces, good for sharing. As the name says, crunchy. I'm not sure it would be good without the vanilla bean sauce, which I used for each bite. My review would have probably been 5 stars if it weren't for the eggwich situation.

Reviews.Author: T G.
Reviews.Content: I expected it to be better. I order Norwegian egg Benedict. My friends ordered BBQ chicken sandwich, tofu hash, and omelet. The food was ok. But the service was too slow. We waited for a long time to get our dishes. I might not go there for brunch any more, but I am still curious about their French toast. It seems to be the star of the cafe.
Reviews.Author_Location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

Reviews.Author: Amy P.
Reviews.Content: Crunchy French toast here is to die for! Blue Jam makes it luscious with fresh fruits and a vanilla bean dipping sauce. Like, it's seriously the best thing I have ever tasted in my life - so healthy and so very eclectic on taste buds. Their House-Made Vegan Organic Granola tastes equally scrumptious - blended with healthy oven baked oats, bran oats, almonds, dried cranberries, raisins, shaved coconut, and maple syrup. Ah, heaven!Guys who work for Blu Jam are awesome buddies actually. Never short of a generous smile! Pop in here and you'll just not have a reason to leave this amazing café. Beverages - were too refreshing! Try to be little patient while you wait for your table - this one gets crammed really very easily. Else, all cool. Kudos to this spot in LA!

Reviews.Author: Bita P.
Reviews.Content: The food is great, many vegetarian and gluten free options. The crispy Nutella French toast was a must try. Chilaquiles and chipotle omelet were very flavorful. Where did I get disappointed? They told us 25-30 min for party of 8 and they have 4 farm tables that fit 8 and only 2 people were sat at 2 of then. We were not called until 50 min later. Managers explanation: it is too many of u. Really? If u are a busy business, get a manager with people skills. Also one person got his food 30 min after every one.

Reviews.Author: Luis P.
Reviews.Content: Came to eat brunch with a friend here. The wait was typical for a Saturday brunch place it ended up being about an hour but the food was well worth the wait. I was pleasantly surprised to find a ton of parking spots in the nearby area which was completely surprising to me given it is LA. I started off with water but was confused by the speckles floating in the water but the waiter laughed and  showed is the mint and lemon infused water which was refreshing. I was convinced to try the fresh squeezed juice and I got a boring mix of orange and apple which was tasty as expected. I ordered the Loxux? (i believe) It was a delicious mix of eggs and smoked salmon. drooool. It also came with a side of potatoes and toast. Everything was amazingly delicious. The eggs were perfect and the salmon was a nice addition. The food came out in a decent amount of time and I had my juice to keep my growling stomach at bay. I want to come back here and try all of the other items since they all looked delicious. Would have gave 5 stars if the wait wasn't so long.

Reviews.Author: Marlaena L.
Reviews.Content: I would EASILY give this place five stars if it had not been for a few things.All the waits were at MINIMUM 55minutes whether it was for 2-5+ people. That's the longest wait I've ever endured for some food, but some girls and I drove all the way from San Diego specifically to try this place out. It came highly recommended, so we waited! I would have at least liked more shaded areas to stand under while waiting. Or I noticed another room AFTER we were seated where people seemed to be just waiting?? I wish someone told us about that before we sat out in the sun! I thought it was part of the dining area. Then, while we were already seated AFTER waiting approx 45-50 minutes, we noticed the wait staff bringing out samples to the people waiting...dang, why didn't they do that when WE were outside? It wasn't JUST us, there were at least 30 people waiting for a seat as well.BUT-the staff was EXTREMEEELY nice once we were seated. I remember one of my girlfriends dropping her knife, and literally .2 seconds later one of the staff picked it up and replaced it for her! QUICK!! The food was BEYOND delicious and made me forget about the wait (for the most part!) and then...the OWNER of the restaurant was working with her staff and chatting it up and laughing with everyone in the restaurant! You don't see that often! It really impressed us that she was such a hard worker and such a friendly person! If I'm ever in la, I'm DEF going again!

Reviews.Author: Rich S.
Reviews.Content: When I wake up early, this is the best brunch this side of town. Good portions, variety, and all the buzzwords found in an organic restaurant.When I wake up late, this is the worst brunch this side of town.UNLESS you are a person that loves to wait in lines.That being said, I will wait in said eternal lines for the 5 minutes of heaven you call crunchy French Toast.I hate you.

Reviews.Author: Sean B.
Reviews.Content: Not being a huge brunch person, my choice of Blu Jam came from my date having heard a recommendation, and his being excited to give it a try. I had a few other places in mind that I'd endorsed to him... but he seemed determined to go somewhere new with me even though I was playing tour guide to him in LA for the weekend. So I went with the flow.We arrived and were seated. A little cramped, but I'm 6'6 and realize that I'm an outlier. I read on Yelp that some of the servers seemed a little "uppity" and frankly felt I could tell that from a distance, but our server, a Caucasian man in his late twenties - early thirties or so with a full beard, couldn't have been nicer from start to finish.I read that the French toast was to die for... but funny thing, I'm not really a fan of French toast. It always feels a bit too doughy, a bit too sweet, a bit too much. I saw the brunch burger and decided that would have my attention this afternoon. My aforementioned dining companion ordered to French toast so my mild curiosity would have to be piqued that way.The coffee came, and it was delicious. The burger came, and it was outstanding. The French toast came, and it looked like something from the cover of a magazine and tasted even better. I never order French toast out... but I'll tell you what, when I go back here, and I will, I think that's exactly what I'll order... just... spectacular.

Reviews.Author: Samantha C.
Reviews.Content: 3.5 stars.I had really high expectations...We arrived around 12ish and the wait time was around 30 minutes which is surprisingly fast. Once we got seated, we took forever to order because everything sounded so good.But the waiter was very accommodating recommending dishes for us to try and quite patient because he came twice and we still weren't ready. Sorry! But the third time he came around, we were ready to order. Norwegian BenedictToasted English muffin, smoked salmon, poached eggs, sautéed spinach, tomato and dill hollandaise, served with potatoes (14.95)It was a good solid benedict. But the hollandaise sauce was too rich for me. Also, the potatoes were burnt!!! My friends were burnt too so it wasn't only mine. So disappointed in the potatoes. Florentine BenedictPoached eggs on a toasted English muffin with sautéed fresh spinach, mushrooms, sun-dried tomatoes, and brie cheese, topped with hollandaise sauce, served with potatoes (12.95)Best friend said it was good too, but the potatoes man...Crunchy French ToastEgg brioche dipped in batter, rolled in crunchy corn flakes and grilled to perfection, topped with fresh fruit, served with vanilla bean sauce (12.95)Alright. I gotta give you props. Rolling this in cereal is absolutely brilliant. Who would have thought it. And it was so good too. The vanilla bean sauce complimented the french toast so well. Italian Breakfast Risotto GfArborio rice with fresh mushrooms, sun dried tomatoes, baby spinach, fresh basil, fresh tarragon, and parmesan reggiano, topped with two poached eggs and drizzled with herb pistou (12.95)The scent of the risotto was so decadent. I took a bite and it was sooo goodd. First time eating risotto and I love it! Everything worked so well together. The only downside was that the dish was a bit small. yelp.com/biz_photos/blu-…Maybe it's a 3 star because people hyped it up soo much. I'll be back and give it a second chance!

Reviews.Author: May Y.
Reviews.Content: Oh em gee. So good. Truly a breakfast for champions. Everything was so amazing. No words could be said that would do any of the food justice. If I could have fit it all in my mouth at the same time, I would have.

Reviews.Author: Lakar K.
Reviews.Content: The service is outstanding and the portions are huge! The breakfast Burrito was amazing! The freshly squeezed orange juice was great too. Quality brunch place in the center of town.

Reviews.Author: Gabriela G.
Reviews.Content: "Is this another hyped up LA brunch place with mediocre food and shitty service that gets by on word of mouth?" - i thought begrudgingly as the hostess quoted us 40-45 minute wait time for a table. "Maybe we should just eat at The Village Idiot just a few doors down"- i suggested, though my roommate insisted "Gabs, you are such a Yelper and you've never eaten here? That's insane! We gotta do it" Peer pressured into the "ultimate" LA brunch experience i said "Alright, Alright"Finally our group was seated (more like an hour later), but the hostess always kept us informed and with a smile on her face, though the environment was conducive to bad attitudes and short tempers because of the large crowds and busy influx of hungry humans.The inside though jam-packed with people, did not feel claustrophobic or cluttered. The tables were spaced out enough that the floor plan, did not feel crowded, there was plenty of room for the server and bussers to comfortably move around with ease around the tables.I ordered the huevos rancheros which were delicious though very spicy. If you don't like spicy food i don't recommend them but otherwise they were fantastic. My eggs were over easy. The tortilla layer at the bottom was just the right amount of crispy and soggy from soaking up the sauces and the yolk.My friend ordered the Mac n' Cheese which was also exquisite though so rich in flavors and textures that i recommend you order the dish to share. Maybe too much for one person, as well as one note when it comes to flavor palette. But don't get me wrong- that one flavor of cheese and ham and bacon was delicious! It just became repetitive after the fourth bite. No new notes or textures, but still extremely well made, well put together and very tasty. Just not too complex as far as technique.And now to the best dishes, and the main reason Blue Jam Cafe deserves FIVE stars:1) the Breakfast Burger. Has to be one if he best burgers i have ever had. The depth of flavors, the complexity of textures, the bun, the quality of the meat! The only thing i could do without is the side of roasted potatoes. The roasted potatoes are really nothing special. Maybe a good side of French style Frittes would accompany this beast of flavors quite well.2) the corn flakes French toast. One of our friends tasted it before i did and i watched her face and thought "she's gotta be bullshitting at least 10%. There's no way that this dish could make anyone make such exaggerated facial features. I mean, it can be good, but how good can it really be?" HOLY SH*T! It was incredible!!!! The perfect amount of crunch, the perfect amount of sweetness. the perfect amount of tart from the confit fruit. the perfect amount of creamy (from the milky sweet substance it is served with instead of syrup-sort of like a condensed milk but much lighter in flavor and density). MY SUGGESTION: Come with a friend and each order the Breakfast burger and the French Toast. Split the Savory and the Sweet Dish between the two of you and leave a happy camper! and YES, both of these menu items are worth the 40-60 minute wait time!

Reviews.Author: Nick H.
Reviews.Content: ***Eat Breakfast Here!***Steak Hash with Poached Eggs, Blueberry Pancakes and Fresh Squeezed OJ!We came early on Sunday. There was no wait, we were seated right away and service was great.~Steak Hash-4 Stars (An AMAZING Dish!)Steak, potato, spinach and I asked them to hold the mushrooms. This dish was prepared, seasoned and presented perfectly. ..except the steak was extremely dry. I think my only issue with this dish is that the meat was  dry and seemed to be over cooked. If the steak would have been more juicy and less dry, this easily would have been a five-star dish. I would, however, totally order this dish again. It was soo delicious that I shouldn't complain about anything! Absolutely delish!Fresh OJ and Blueberry Pancakes were excellent additions to the meal.I am a total fan of this place and their food and will be back many times in the future..That's A Fact!Tip-Come early.,,like when they open to avoid a waitI am a fan!

Reviews.Author: Wendy A.
Reviews.Content: I came here for lunch on Valentine's Day with my boyfriend who came to visit me from Vegas. Wanted to remind him what LA was all about... Finding great, amazing food with even better service, especially considering the date.We arrived around noon, & since it was a Friday, there was only a 20 min wait. A great wait in comparison to peak hours. When we were seated and the place was packed! But I did notice the bright cheery atmosphere, lots of natural light coming from the ceilings. The host was polite & the waitress attentive.We had split on order of the Blu Jam Benedict, eggs benedict with poached eggs, Ham, Bacon & hollandase w/ side of patios. And an order of their signature dish, Crunchy French Toast. It was delicious, and well worth the wait. The French toast was Crunchy and still had it's softer consistency. The vanilla syrup you pour instead of the traditional syrup gave it a Nice sweet kick. Also enjoyed the plating of this dish. The toast was precut into hearts to accampany the holiday. I enjoyed it immensely. The eggs benedict were made with care & attention. No restroom visit, the place was very clean from what I can tell. The place was a full house. Every table was full.

Reviews.Author: Felisha E.
Reviews.Content: For years I've wanted to try Blu Jam, and I'm so happy that I finally have! The atmosphere is very much akin to the kind of LA you see in movies nowadays--jam packed with diverse, artsy customers and eclectic decor. The wait on a Monday morning was ~15 minutes, with ample street parking that has a 2-hr limit. I ordered the Florentine Benedict--"sautéed fresh spinach, mushrooms, sun-dried tomatoes, and brie cheese, topped with hollandaise sauce, served with potatoes". It was very tasty, but very filling. (Also, if you have a low tolerance for salty foods, this might not be your type.) I also ordered white peach tea--for $4.95, I got an entire french press of tea! I was so excited!  There are tons of other unique items on the menu, and I can't wait to go back and try more.As I previously mentioned, the one turn off was the incredibly tight spacing indoors. I could barely carry on a conversation with my friend because both tables on either sides of us were obnoxiously loud.  Other than that, Blu Jam was completely worth the accolade!

Reviews.Author: mana a.
Reviews.Content: Wow! The italian arborio paoched sumtin sumtin was off the chain!  I am crawling home so full, so content,  so in love!  #bluejambaby

Reviews.Author: Erin H.
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations for Blu Jam and was NOT disappointed! We got here around 9:45am or so on a Sunday because my date said that this place is really popular and gets super busy on the weekends. I believed him, so despite both of us having rough nights the previous night, we managed to get over to Melrose and only wait about 15-20min. Amazing!I like that there's outdoor seating, but it was really hot that day (in November!) so I was glad to sit inside. I'm usually one for sharing so we can try numerous things, I got a bit carried away on the drinks.. but anyway, here's what we got:- coffees: simple, good. Comes in a huge cup, so it'll start taking some up some valuable real estate:- plum oolong tea: I really enjoy oolong, so I ordered this as well and somehow thought that it was an iced tea.. it's not. It comes out in a teapot thing with its equally huge cup (now we have 3 cups on the tiny table).- florentine benedict: I love eggs benedict, and these florentine benedict eggs were so good. They had spinach, mushrooms, sun-dried tomatoes, and brie cheese along with a generous side of potatoes (also very well seasoned). It tasted very fresh and the eggs were runny (which I love)!- orante risotto: I never knew you could eat risotto for brunch, but this was delicious. I think this was on the special menu for that day. It was soft, cheesy, filled with chicken.  I'm craving this right now!Service was great, and as I mentioned before, the wait wasn't long if you come early! Street parking isn't great but not a surprise for this area.P.S. No mimosas here!

Reviews.Author: Clare-Alana F.
Reviews.Content: Now this is a brunch people. May I just confirm their french toast IS definitely the best thing since fried sliced bread topped with powdered sugar, coated with a cornflake crust and covered in fresh berries. Their eggs benedict is absolute, served with moreish breakfast potatoes. They have a vast selection of breakfast items as well as some original creations of their own (macaroni for breakfast? Don't mind if I do!) Lunch/entrees are also severved but I feel like the breakfast items are the star of this place- not to mention they have a healthy menu too packed with protein & low fat options. They also do fresh juices here which is always great! If you're feeling like you want to indulge yourself for the afternoon (and so you should!) just stop by here, and to top it all off, shopping on Melrose afterwards!

Reviews.Author: Brenda R.
Reviews.Content: This is the best breakfast restaurant around, no matter which branch you go to. The eggs are fresh and tender, the french toast is like dessert, and the fresh squeezed orange juice tastes like it came out of your own orchard.  Unfortunately, the word is out and the wait can be long. I guess that's the price of success. This place is 5 Star and no less!!!

Reviews.Author: Nida K.
Reviews.Content: I thought I was in the clear coming to Blu Jam at 10AM on a Sunday. I figured all the people would still be in bed from spending the entire night out in Hollywood. Boy, was I WRONG. People were up and crowding all over the entrance at BJC. My party of 2 probably waited around 30 min. Although this place isn't very big, turnover seems to be pretty frequent. You shouldn't have to wait long if your party is 4 or less.Since my friend brought her pooch, we sat outside on the patio. They have a ton of breakfast items and I love how they even have a healthy and fit menu for the people who are watching what they're eating. One thing stood out to me and it was the steak hash which had steak, potatoes, mushroom, gorgonzola, poached eggs and hollandaise. When my order came, it was a very generous portion with a bright green hollandaise sauce. It was purrrrrdyyy and delicious! I added some dashes of the Tabanero sauce they had at the table which added a bit more tang. It was tasty and filling. I took about half of it home to save someone the trouble of rolling me out to my car. BJC is right in the heart of Melrose and it's very well known. It's BUSY so be prepared to wait. The menu is pretty extensive, the food is good, and I didn't have a single complaint about the service. Everyone who worked there was very friendly. Overall a very lovely brunch spot, as long as you don't mind crowds.

Reviews.Author: Mary L.
Reviews.Content: Boyfriend and I decided to get brunch at the griddle Café, but that line was ridiculous! I quickly looked up another restaurant and found the blue jam Café. I must say, I'm so thankful that we decided to find another restaurant because this place rocks!! Three words, CRUNCHY FRENCH TOAST. Bomb dot com.The staff was super friendly, and it was great to see you them may recall names over and over just to make sure everyone on the list got a seat. Definitely will be coming back!!

Reviews.Author: Carlo T.
Reviews.Content: This place is AWESOME!!! Only thing is get there early because it gets busy and the parking.  Our server was Alyssa when I went and she was great and the Salmon Scramble is DELICIOUS!! Great amount of Salmon and also tried the French Toast, great too!!  Get here early and you're good. Otherwise, its a gamble to get there later.

Reviews.Author: Kenya S.
Reviews.Content: Omg this place is so freaking good. The crunchy french toast alone will make you want to slap somebody lol. Seriously though do yourself a favor and check this place out. We waited about 10 minutes and were seated inside. My sister had the California Omelet which came with different meats, cheese, avocado and a side of potatoes. I had the Crunchy French Toast that was topped with fresh berries, powdered sugar and a side of vanilla bean sauce. My mouth is watering at the thought of it. Might I add our server was very attentive and very helpful with the menu. I'm very big on service and this place is on top of it. The inside of the establishment is very quaint and cute. This would be the perfect spot for a baby shower or bridal shower. Next time i'm in LA I will be sure to stop by again!!

Reviews.Author: Ismael R.
Reviews.Content: Great Food, had a good time, the only bad thing they needed more space for more people to enjoy

Reviews.Author: Michelle N.
Reviews.Content: If I could have breakfast here every morning...I would.Food quality is amazlng, atmosphere is amazing, everything is amazing!!! I have no other words. Just go

Reviews.Author: Elinor F.
Reviews.Content: I've been here 2x this month already & it was *two thumbs up* grrrrreat! 1st visit: I ordered the breakfast trio which came with your choice of pancakes or French toast (I got the FT), eggs (I ordered them poached), & bacon :) I do wish that they made the bacon extra crispy, but that disappointment went away when I tried the French toast. Lawdddd, that FT gave me life that morning! There was this crispy, cross-hatched layer, which gave it the right amount of crunchiness. It tasted delicious by itself, but was even better when I dipped it into the pure maple syrup. Mmmmmm. 2nd visit: A friend told me to try their CRUNCHY FRENCH TOAST. I hit the French Toast jackpot! I thought the regular FT was delish, THISSSS was AMAAAAAAAAAZEBALLSSSS!!! This has been missing in my life. The FT was brought out on a rectangular dish & I think I had 4 slices that were halved. Strawberries that were diced were thrown on top of it, which made it warm and surprisingly, it was delicious. The FT after being soaked in egg batter was rolled in corn flakes which obviously made it crunchy. The dish comes with vanilla bean sauce, but I asked for the maple syrup. I don't even know what to say anymore, but I. NEED. TO. GO. BACK.

Reviews.Author: Grace A.
Reviews.Content: Really great breakfast place! I ordered the salmon benedict and my friend ordered the french toast with fruit. It was well-made, fresh and fast (eventhough it was full that day). Servers were friendly and our waitress even suggested an option for coffee that made us save money. I really appreciate honest servers.Great experience

Reviews.Author: Antho L.
Reviews.Content: I had some business to take care of in this neck of the woods so I decided I'd try to grab breakfast somewhere close by and found this café.It's in the heart of the trendy area on Melrose Avenue and walking in, I just sensed I was going to enjoy the experience and I did.It's got a comfortable ambiance and the vibe certainly shouts "Industry" which was proven correct as I overheard two patrons a few tables over discussing aspects of movie production.  Then too, a group of three sat next to me and the conversation went something like this:Pretty young girl: Don't worry about the ticket...Mother: Well, I don't see how you could drive with all this traffic...Pretty young girl: It's fine, I just want you to have a good time on your visit here...Mother: Well, I wouldn't know how to drive a car with that stick thing...Pretty young girl: Let's just enjoy ourselves before my audition.  Let's order a French Press...Mother: What's that?Great items on the menu and I ordered the Muscleman Plate which was a turkey scramble using 6 egg whites and a salad on the side along with toast.  Awesome meal!  Although, it is a little on the pricey side, they use quality and organic ingredients.Servers were friendly especially one young lady who kept asking if everything was alright.I can't wait to come back and try some of the pancake plates which look amazing!Ambiance: 5/5Food: 5/5Service: 5/5Value: 4/5

Reviews.Author: Dian W.
Reviews.Content: Soooooo good I've never had brunch like this. So delicious... Love the food love this restaurant people all should check it out!!!

Reviews.Author: Tracey L.
Reviews.Content: Yum! This place is amazing. I got the smoked salmon platter and it was definitely on point. The bagel was nice and crispy and when you put everything together, it tastes like heaven in your mouth. I came on a Thursday so it wasn't busy, no wait whatsoever. And today's weather is perfect! Good way to start my early weekend. Good food, good day.

Reviews.Author: Dave S.
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's hipster. Painfully. You'll need a pain killer and therapy to get over the tragically hip, but suck it up and go.  Keep your group to about 4 or 5 max, that way you can follow everyone. Now, this is Melrose. So it's gotta make a good impression or else it's going to be a storefront like so many others selling items like a Hello Kitty machine gun or a Quicky. These guys pull though. Everything from breakfasty to salad-y was just PDT - Pretty Damn Tasty. And these guys were on the ball. Service was like a well oiled machine. You have to go.. though get ready for a wait. Sometimes 20 minutes, but if it's a sunday, look for hour to 2 hour waits that might make you batty enough to go punch a nun. But see if you can stick it out and grab a BAM (Big @$$ mug of joe)

Reviews.Author: DeeDee D.
Reviews.Content: I tried this place for the first time because a good friend recommended it - I'm happy to say it did not disappoint! We got there around noon on a Thursday and the wait was about 10 minutes or so. There was a cute little waiting area with games and seating.
