I ordered the crunchy French toast and my friend ordered the steak hash. Both were amazing! The French toast came with a vanilla dip which was unique and I loved it! The steak was cooked to perfection and the potatoes were delicious too. Coming from the Long Beach area, I wish it was closer, but if I'm ever in the LA area again and craving brunch, Blu Jam would be definitely be my go-to. The only downside is the traffic and parking around the area.

Reviews.Author: Karl K.
Reviews.Content: 3.5 stars - GET THE CAP'N CRUNCH FRENCH TOAST----------We met a few friends from out of town for brunch this morning.  We got here at 9, which was perfect timing... plenty of parking and no wait for a table for four.Atmosphere--------------The atmosphere was warm and inviting.  We were ensconced in the corner catty, seated on soft benches and surrounded by old-school coffee grinders, chess set, and various cookbooks.A bit on the cozy side, but it was perfect setting to catch up with friends.  As an added bonus, the bathroom was quite clean and citrusy (Lysol spray).  As Anthony Bourdain would say, the cleanliness of a bathroom is reflective of the cleanliness of the kitchen.  Food------My better half got the Cap'n Crunch-coated French toast.  I got the Migas (scrambled egg, huevos rancheros style with chorizo, bell peppers, potato hash home fry style with ?rosemary, and corn tortillas with chips).  Our friends got the eggs Benedict and kale salad.- French toast: GET THIS!  The addition of the Cap'n Crunch crust added a lot to the dish.  fresh berries and vanilla bean cream helped round out the dish.- Eggs Benedict: I probably should have gotten this. this looked absolutely amazing.  - Kale salad: light and refreshing, and topped with a perfectly poached egg. The yolk was perfectly runny, which if you watch the various cooking shows (like MasterChef), is harder to accomplish than it seems!  - Migas: I didn't "get it." Sorry.  The eggs somehow lacked flavor.  The Tabañero condiment helped add some depth to the eggs, but honestly was lacking some "oomph".  That being said, the roasted potatoes were perfectly crisped and were full of herb essence.  Summary-----------This is a decent place.  I would probably come back, and try Kamil's breakfast next time.

Reviews.Author: Andre N.
Reviews.Content: What a shame about this place.The food is outstanding (egg whites with chicken and marinara sauce most recently) and the service is excellent.The energy is good among workers and patrons alike.The snotty little man in the front who made us wait and then gave us attitude when we inquired about the overly long wait while people were seated before us is NOT ACCEPTABLE.  Get rid of that clown. You take an otherwise excellent experience and ruin it by hiring a tosser like that?  Just a note - PEOPLE DON'T LIKE TO ARGUE WITH THE FRONT OF HOUSE.  Your job is to apologize about the wait and come up with a solution, not to challenge the patron's recollection about how long his party has been waiting.  ARE YOU SERIOUS?GET RID OF THAT CLOWN. Or else I won't ever return to your place.

Reviews.Author: Gloria K.
Reviews.Content: I came here for brunch and thoroughly enjoyed everything I had. All the dishes were big and filling. And it was very good for sharing.I had the French pressed coffee and crunchy French toast, Blu Jam Benedict, and the huevos rancheros. Everything was delicious! I have always thought Marston's (in Pasadena) had the best crunchy French toast, but now Blu Jam's French toast supersedes as the best! The French toast doesn't come with the traditional maple syrup, rather it comes with a creamy vanilla (I think) white sauce that isn't too sweet but compliments the berry toppings well. The Blu Jam Benedict is a more standard Benedict with ham. It's not anything special but it was yummy and I'd definitely order it again! :) The huevos rancheros was a little different. It was on top of this crunchy tortilla and the toppings (on top of the eggs) were tasty! I tasted a bit of ginger in it and that added a refreshing twist to the dish. I love this place but the wait can be a little long. My party of 3 waited an hour :/ Parties of 2 had a shorter wait, and people arriving later in the morning and during prime weekend brunch time were waiting longer. I'd say go early if you don't want to wait long. Regardless of the long the wait, the food was definitely worth it.

Reviews.Author: Rachel R.
Reviews.Content: thank goodness for a random tip from a local because I would have never come across this amazing spot. By far the best food I had in LA, from breakfast food to burgers nothing is short of perfection. The first time my bf and I went I had the hash with potatoes and eggs and ham and cheese and omg i can't even describe how good this was...and the portion..I felt like I ate and ate and when I looked down at my plate i didn't even seem to put a dent in the amount of food on the plate. Fresh juice is available with any amount of fruit/vegetable combination for 4.95! amazee. Coffee...organic and perfect. French toast yes! Gourmet burger, with avocado...i died! try it all!

Reviews.Author: Nitin Y.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam Café was great. The only reason I am not giving it 5 stars is because the wait was close to 90 minutes - to note it was a Sunday and the wait time is out of their control.The food here was unbelievable though, and I definitely will be going back to try more items on their menu. I had the Norwegian Benedict which comes is served on a toasted english muffin with smoked salmon, eggs, spinach, tomato and dill hollandaise with a side of potatoes.

Reviews.Author: Samantha S.
Reviews.Content: I must say, blu jam cafe has earned its ranks in my list of favorite restaurants. The ambiance is perfect for any occasion whether catching up with an old friend, get  together with a group or a date. The food is excellent I love how the dishes are served in a tapas style so you can try more than one thing! Definitely a place to try out.

Reviews.Author: Warren T.
Reviews.Content: Came on a Saturday and street parking is hard to find on weekends. The estimated wait time during prime lunch hours is 30 minutes. We came at 11:30 and got a seat around 12:15 for a party of two.I liked their menu. It featured a good number of gluten-free options. I ordered the latte, which was soft and fluffy! My main entree was the burgundy omelet. It also came with purple potatoes as well and toast. I really enjoyed the potatoes, but the omelet was a bit large in portios. I would say it were good for two people if you're a light eater. For the toast, you can choose between rye or sourdough toast. And I must say, there was something about their jelly that was amazingly good. I normally don't like jam/jelly with my toast, but this here was done really well. Not too sweet or sticky at all.

Reviews.Author: Arman M.
Reviews.Content: The cons first: Silverware came coated with dried food debris from a poor wash, and the food arrived a little cold. We ordered French press coffee and French Toast. The French Toast is famous here and for good reason, it was delicious. Then we ordered a burger, classic. It was still very good despite being slightly cold. The server was super competent and friendly. Overall, I'd definitely come back.

Reviews.Author: Kristen C.
Reviews.Content: All their breakfast/brunch items are amazinggggggg. This review is long overdue, as I'm realizing I came here back in 2011! However it is one of the few breakfast spots that has stayed vividly on my mind. I wouldn't be writing this review if my friends didn't attest to how good their food is still. Food was amazing. Service was great. What more can you ask for?Can't wait to go when I'm back in LA!TIP: be prepared to wait awhile

Reviews.Author: Jade L.
Reviews.Content: More like 3.5 stars... LA has a lot of amazing brunch places. I can't say that Blu Jam Cafe really stick out from the crowd though. Sure the food is really good, but I think it's comparable to Doughboys, BLD, and Alcove, but the wait at Blue Jam is much longer. Be prepared for the long wait and my group of four ended up waiting about two hours, but we went on a Sunday at like 11am, so I'm not surprised. I ordered the California Omelette, which was huge and hit the spot. It had fresh ingredients like tomatoes and avocados. To share, our table ordered the famous crunchy french toast. It really was delicious and I would say, even if you are a savory fan, I would suggest ordering the crunchy french toast. Overall, I think Blue Jam is delicious, but even if there was no wait at all, I'm not sure it's worth a repeat visit, knowing that there are so many brunch places out there in LA to try.

Reviews.Author: Jeremy V.
Reviews.Content: It's all about the crunchy french toast and fresh juices... seriously, get it.

Reviews.Author: Eder C.
Reviews.Content: Had breakfast with the babe and I was so pleasantly surprised! We are vegetarians and they have an amazing amount of vegetarian and vegan options. I had some tofu with potatoes and one of the TASTIEST MOCHAS EVER! The server was great and the atmosphere was nice. I really enjoyed my food and the customer service. I'd give this place 6 stars if I could! Happy Eating!

Reviews.Author: Linda T.
Reviews.Content: this is definitely the jam!  in the middle of LA in the middle of the street, this cafe serves up some good food.  outside and inside seatings available, but be with your whole party or else you cant be seated.  came for brunch on a thurs late morning.  no wait at all and parking is plentiful around the corners in the residential areas.  got seated right away in a cushiony comfortable corner.shared the crunchy french toast and the italian breakfast risotto.french toast were crunchy from the cornflakes coating.  it was too greasy but was very rich from the brioche.  loaded with berries on top and a side of vanilla sweet sauce.  it wouldve been perfect if the sauce was a bit thicker since it was sort of breaking apart sitting in the cup it was in.  the french toast was subtly sweet that i didnt need the sauce as well.italian bfast risotto was filling and rich.  a lot of rice and cheese mixed with spinach and sun dried tomatoes.  love the acidity the tomatoes brought which cut thru the richness of the risotto.  topped with 2 perfectly soft poached eggs, spilling their contents over the risotto.nice place to meet up with friends and to have a blast with food!

Reviews.Author: Nina C.
Reviews.Content: After my poor review and the owner comment, I decided to give Blu Jam another shot. I got the same scramble again (with tofu instead of eggs), and they definitely got it right this time.The French Toast was amazing as well. Juice was good, service was much, much better. I'm giving three stars to average out my 4 star experience with my first 2 star experience.

Reviews.Author: Farah D.
Reviews.Content: Great for everyone...wait wasn't too long, staff was friendly,, service was great! The best part was the French toast. It was like pillows of soft, sweet brooch heaven. Will definitely return if I'm ever in LA.

Reviews.Author: Eugenia L.
Reviews.Content: The wait here was ridiculous. The host/hostess had really bad time judgement and told us it would only be a 45 minute wait. We were already exhausted and hungry after taking a hike to the Hollywood sign. The day was extremely hot that day also. However, we decided to wait because i've seen many delicious looking pictures of the food here. 45 minutes passed and we asked the host when we would get seated. They kept telling us soon.. like 15 more minutes.. but in the end... we waited for 2 hours. It was ridiculous and there isn't really a waiting area so we were standing outside in the hot sun for that amount of period. I felt the host/hostess was really unorganized since many people were asking when they would be seated. No one was given an accurate approximation of time. When we were called, the only table available was an outside table. There is shade but we preferred the inside where the ac is. They told us if we wanted to wait for the inside tables it would only be 5 more minutes. We looked inside the restaurant.. and no one looked like they were about to be finished with their meal so we settled with the outdoor table. We didn't trust their given times based on their saying, we only had 15 more minutes to wait. They told us this at least 3 times after each 15 minute period was over. Foodwise, I thought it was just ok. I could go somewhere else for some brunch type of food without the long wait. It was good but I would not wait this long for this.

Reviews.Author: Richard A.
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment!  Seemed the server felt like he was doing us a favor?????  Food was mediocre at best, I had the Salmon Benedict which was very light on Salmon and the spinach was way over powering and under cooked! It should have been called Spinach Benedict.  Friend had the California omelette which had very little contents other than eggs.  We shared the French Toast, it was good, but not better than any other Cereal encrusted French Toast I have ever had.  All in all, I wouldn't waste my time or money on going back as there are way to many good places to go.  Shame!

Reviews.Author: Robyn L.
Reviews.Content: We had the blu jam benedict and BLTA. Both were delicious and satisfying. We had a french press coffee and an arnold palmer to drink- also very good. Everyone seated near us had food that looked delicious. We went for lunch on a Wednesday and were seated immediately.Entrees were between $10-15 and drinks were from $2-$5. Staff was very friendly and attentive! Everyone who came up to us had a smile on their face. Would definitely go again, especially after seeing the many rave reviews of their french toast, and also this lady near us had this creamy-tomato-looking-panini sandwich that looked so delicious and I want to taste it.

Reviews.Author: Jenny I.
Reviews.Content: I've been meaning to check this place out... and there's always a long line or a wait~ and yesterday was perfect timing we were seated within 10min! yay got a cute table in the corner!!! Loved it...I got a Beets and Greens with beef~! The meat was amazing and soft and tender~! Loved my salad would def order it again!!!! Over all ... really cute place for brunch! Service was great and friendly!

Reviews.Author: Stephanie M.
Reviews.Content: Perfect spot for a weekday brunch! They have delicious breakfast and lunch options and they have FRESH SQUEEZED juices. My friend ordered their fresh carrot juice and the barbecue chicken sandwich and I had the fresh grapefruit juice, lox and cream cheese bagel w/cucumber, dill and tomato and a single pancake. Yum!

Reviews.Author: Shawn T.
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best breakfast place I've ever went to!!!!!!! Not only does the food look good but it tastes amazing! Expect atleast a 30 mins wait. I ordered the Brunch Burger. The burger was HUGE! It has a Wagyu beef patty with an egg, avocado, and some other goodness. Be prepared to get messy. Tasted amazing! The fresh squeezed orange juice was also great!!!!!!!! A must if you're around the area! :)

Reviews.Author: Felicia G.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam tends to be crowded ( and tight on space )but the food is marvelous! I had the chicken panini here and sampled some other dishes from my party's order. We all loved our food. You don't need to add anything to the food, the way I like it. The service is also very good too. Our waitress was also very kind and helped "the indecisive one" (that would be me) pick something on the menu. The only major deal breaker is the line. Not everybody I go out to eat with is willing to A. Get up at the butt crack of dawn to go to breakfast to avoid the wait  or B. Wait for 45 minutes or C. Find a park on or near Melrose. :/I guess the long wait is a good indicator that  food is good. If you get a chance to eat here you should.

Reviews.Author: SoCal C.
Reviews.Content: 27 Oct 2013, 09:00aWe've been coming here for years before it actually got overly popular, but it's good to see business is booming.  This was our second attempt coming within the past few months.  I mistakenly believed 10a would be sufficient to beat the crowds, so when we arrived the last time to a 1:15 hour wait, we left and decided to come earlier the next time.This trip, we only waited about 10 minutes after our party of four arrived to be seated.  Wait staff was very friendly and informative, especially to our two friends who had never been.  We ordered:Kamil's Breakfast (2 orders)Norwegian BenedictMigasI usually order the Migas, so I knew that was good.  It's spicy, but has all kinds of goodness in it.  I love the Mexican spin on breakfast.  Our friend who had the benedict was very pleased with his order.  He originally was going to order something else before asking our waitress what was best on the menu.Kamil's Breakfast, which is what I ordered, was good but I thought it could use a few modifications to make it spectacular.  It's basically macaroni scrambled with eggs, ham, bacon and some chives.  If you're familiar with Chef Mark Peel's Campanile, there was an item on their menu called Trenne which was essentially triangular penne that was pan-fried to give it some texture.  Had the macaroni been pan-fried to give it some chew, I think this dish would have been SO much better.  The macaroni was not overcooked, but neither was it al dente, so everything in the bowl was very almost "mushy".  I believe pan-frying could have added some additional texture to the dish.  Regardless, it was still good and definitely a large portion.Blu Jam has proven that it can last through the years with good, solid food and great service.  The lines prove that.  I'll definitely be back, although not sure when, and I'll venture to try other selections on the menu.

Reviews.Author: Cookie N.
Reviews.Content: Bad food day :(Service was super attentive... BUT the burgers were recommended because they were "the best burgers I've ever had" per unnamed waitstaff member. WRONG (at least today)*Turkey burger w caramelized onions - brioche bun was dry (old) and the turkey patty reallllly dry and flavorLESS. *Gourmet burger w bacon - brioche bun was also old/dry tasting and the beef party also so bland that even the bacon couldn't save it GO FOR THE BREAKFAST ITEMS - they looked way better Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Caroline S.
Reviews.Content: Fellow vegetarians: I loved the split pea soup and the warm mushroom salad, but I was really spoiled for choice and will definitely go back to try lots of other menu items. Also a nice variety of fresh juices/combinations. There was no wait and the ambiance was lovely and quiet during the late lunch hour on a Thursday. They had no problem with my friend and I chatting over a pot of tea for a while after our meal.

Reviews.Author: Hubert C.
Reviews.Content: Excellent place for breakfast. We had the pork and potatos hash with a green sauce. The pork was cooked just right. We also had their all famous crunchy french toast.  I didny even need to use their sweet milk sauce. It had just the right amount of sugar in it.We did have to wait there for an hour before we were seated, so get there early for brunch on the weekend.

Reviews.Author: fritz g.
Reviews.Content: After do over sundays, do yourself a favor and sober up with the steak n eggs here. Medium rare lets go!

Reviews.Author: Matt M.
Reviews.Content: Rating downgraded because the owner is a semi-hysterical goofball.  I didn't say it was your fault that I live in Venice, nor did I "blame" you for your lack of a liquor license.  I simply stated my opinion:  It's not worth it to me, personally, to drive across town for your very average breakfast/brunch.  I'd rather go to a place with bloody marys, and, more importantly, better food.  And, actually, you could help the wait by hiring better servers (take some responsibility for something).  I should have mentioned in my previous review that they were lazy and inattentive.  Thanks for reminding me, however, neither I nor other readers needed a reaction from you.  You're making yourself look silly.  Next time, do what smart business owners do and say, "I'm sorry you didn't like your breakfast.  How about a coupon?"  I'll never give you a second chance now.

Reviews.Author: Burcu BB B.
Reviews.Content: Good food, great servers, good location! Loved the all day breakfast option with great omelettes! Wifi doesn't work all the time :( not a quiet place to work anyways...

Reviews.Author: Eleanor G.
Reviews.Content: Came here on an early weekend morning to beat the crowds.Service was friendly and attentive. Ambiance was hip and trendy as expected for the Hollywood area. I wish there was a little bit more space since I felt too close to the table next to us. We were in each others bubbles, but I guess we got to take a peek and admire the different dishes they had.Food was very good! I had the Blu Jam Benedict, he had the Roma via Paris, and we shared the Crunchy French Toast. The side of rosemary potatoes were perfect. I would recommend and order any of these items again, but having a sweet tooth, I would say the french toast was my favorite.Price point is high, but expected in this area. Looking around, I noticed many enjoying the French Press. I would like to try it some day, but feel I would be too much to handle afterwards.

Reviews.Author: Mia F.
Reviews.Content: I'm an LA local and I visit Blu Jam at least once a month and I've NEVER been disappointed. The food is amazing and service is always great. I usually go on the weekends, when it's extremely busy but it's well worth the wait. Moderately priced, it's the perfect place for brunch or early dinner. My menu favorites:Crunchy French Toast: french toast with a twist, served with fruit and buttery milk syrup. California Omelette: cheddar cheese, bacon and tomato topped with avocado and sour cream.

Reviews.Author: Frankie L.
Reviews.Content: Love this place!

Reviews.Author: Gibson P.
Reviews.Content: Sooooo delicious! I went here for a late lunch. Definitely get the:-Crunchy French toast-Norwegian eggs benedict-Risotto carbonaraEverything was amazing. Our waiter, Jason recommended all of these to us and we left with a happy tummy. Jason was an amazing server and had a cool beard too.

Reviews.Author: C L.
Reviews.Content: Come early this place is a bit of a wait, but oh my it is worth it. The French Toast is really special. Service is what you will expect on Melrose... Great. Can't go wrong here for

Reviews.Author: Jessica J.
Reviews.Content: Long wait. Decent food. Probably a better choice going next door to the Village Idiot. Came here on a Sunday on a friend's recommendation. I love cooking breakfast so this review might be a little biast. (I could've made any of our plates at home.) The food was good and the atmosphere was chill. Just too long to wait for a seat when there are cafés all around on Melrose.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie T.
Reviews.Content: This place is more deserving of 3.5 stars.  Came here for a Sunday brunch with the bf.  It seemed fairly busy; we were told the wait would be around 35-45 minute.  But we ended waiting longer (over an hour).  It seemed that no matter how many people came to put their names on the waiting list, everyone was given the same "it'll around a 45 minute wait."  My mild gripe with the inaccurate approximation is because we had parked in the residential area and it's only a 2 hour parking (we didn't want to have to go move the car before we got a ticket).It was nice that while we were waiting, one of the employees came around with a plate of their crunchy french toast for everyone to sample.  It was pretty tasty.  Sweet, slight crunch from the corn flakes, and not uuber sweet.On to the food. I ordered the Florentine Benedict and the bf ordered the Migas.  I'm an eggs benedict for brunch type of gal and one of the reasons we picked Blue Jam was because everyone raved about how delicious the eggs benedict were.  I wasn't too impressed with the Florentine; that's not to say it wasn't good but it was on the blander side.  The Migas, on the other hand, was delicious!  Definitely would recommend that dish.Service is decent.  It's busy so don't expect your waiters to be waiting on you.  It took me a while to get an extra cup of ice for my hot tea.  And on a side note:  They don't text anymore when you put your name on the wait list. (at least that's what I overheard the woman taking names for the list telling a customer) So be sure to wait close by for your name to be called or get skipped over.

Reviews.Author: Victoria J.
Reviews.Content: This is one of those places that I've heard about for years. I'm always skeptical of a place with so much resounding praise, but if the praise persists there has to be a reason, right? Finally, we sucked it up and came on a Sunday morning to try brunch at the famous Blu Jam Cafe.The wait was quoted as being 35-40 minutes. They have a good system where they ask for a phone number and text you when your table is ready, that way you're not just stuck sitting there. Melrose is a great place to walk around, so you don't have to die of boredom while waiting. Because it was a Sunday, Melrose Trading Post goes on up the street, so we drove there, looked around for a while, and came back before we received our text. Also, on Sundays, you do have to pay for the meters, but only after 11:00. I didn't have a bad meal here, but it wasn't spectacularly blow your mind amazing like I would have expected. Now maybe this is an issue of expectations and anticipation because of all the hype and the wait. I thought the ingredients were good, but sometimes you eat a meal and you keep wandering around from dish to dish looking for that last bit of satisfaction and that definitely happened to me at Blu Jam. I'm definitely glad I tried this place out and maybe I'd come again if the wait were shorter (but of course I knew I was going to wait a long time for Sunday Brunch). I'm not totally writing it off, but I know LA has a ton of great cafe and breakfast options otherwise.

Reviews.Author: Trisa T.
Reviews.Content: I've been dying to come here for brunch for the longest time because of the great reviews. But it definitely didn't hold up to the hype - it was good but not the best. We got here around 8:30am so the crowd hadn't yet showed up so we were able to sit right away. + Food: Big menu with a lot of selection, including all the classic breakfast/brunch items. I had the Corn Flake Crusted French Toast - which was tasty! Decent portion size. But, I think the food is pricey for what you get. + Atmosphere: The cafe has a homey feel inside with a small 'patio' area with a few tables outside. The definite downside to the outdoor seating is that its right on the side walk so you constantly get people walking by looking at your food (which is extra bad when the crowd starts to gather and wait outside) and the noise/pollution from the cars driving by isn't great either. + Service: our waitress was friendly and very attentive. Plus the food came quickly.Bottom line: Its good but its not worth the long wait! There are definitely better brunch places in LA.

Reviews.Author: Rosemarie R.
Reviews.Content: Okay ladies and gents. Went to the Saturday night dinner . Reservations only . One word . Amazing .Oh my goodness .Drove from Agoura Hills.  Two hour drive . Didn't show up , due to traffic, an hour later. So embarrassed , was so mad at myself for not having checked Traffic . But once we showed up , nothing but warm welcoming and superb customer service . My girls and I brought our bottles of wine and champagne . Great conversation , atmosphere , FOOD ( of course ) what more can you ask for of LA. I am coming back next month ! Make reservations ASAP  . Word spreads quick around here and no doubt they will be booked soon . Xoxo Thanks Kamil and Frankie for a beautiful night .

Reviews.Author: Seth G.
Reviews.Content: I've been hearing about this place for awhile, and it seriously lives up to the hype. I've tried a few of the breakfast/ brunch entrees and dug the heck out of them. The Huevos Rancheros are spectacular and the Chilaqueles were almost as amazing. The Turkey Burger is spot on as well. Everything I've eaten there has been fresh and perfectly made, and I haven't even tried their famous French Toast yet.This place is not exactly cheap, but it's not too expensive either. The vibe is chill, with a bit of a hipster/ yuppie edge, but nothing too obnoxious. Really fast and friendly service as well. Blu Jam lives up to the hype. It's worth waiting in the monster lines when you're trying to find the perfect weekend brunch spot.

Reviews.Author: Aug K.
Reviews.Content: Went with 6 people (4 adults 2 kids). Were told the wait would be about 35 min. Ater 30 min, when asked how much longer, hostess states "theres only a couple of tables that accomodate ur party size and both tables just got their food."  Ok. Why would u not tell me this from the beginning? So i was like "so at least 30 more min? You guys shouldnt have lied to us to get us to wait." Manager then states a party that sits 5 just paid and would give us that table. 20 min has gone by and we're still waiting to get seated. I dont care how good the food is here. It comes down to service. Safe to say I Wont be coming back

Reviews.Author: Tiffani M.
Reviews.Content: My favorite breakfast/brunch spot! Great staff, great service, good and consistently clean food. The single origin costa rica terrazu coffee is really good. It comes in a french press. Parking is tricky but I usually park two blocks west where wasteland is. The wait is always a bit long but I don't mind for the quality and service. Had their muscle beach omlettes today. Comes with egg whites spinach and ground turkey. Nahhhhhhmzzzz.

Reviews.Author: Stormy W.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars in spite of the wait. I used to go there when there was no wait. I miss those days.I go there often.  I love their bus boy, hispanic guy, super friendly,  that guy always makes my day.  He's the reason I go there really. The owner is always there with a warmSmile.  It's like Cheers but a restaurant with great attention to quality of food. Crunchy French toast is decadent but amust,  share it with someone andDon't makeIt a habit.  I had wild arugula salad today with asparagus, and strawberries, somekind of nuts were in there.    Extremely small Portion,  (I like a lot of salad) but delicious.They have organic grass fed steakAnd eggs which I never tried but I love that they have it. Their eggs are organic,  noWonder they taste goodBest eggs Benedict in LA,  the Norwegian Benedict is to die for.  Best hollandaise sauce I've had in this city.  The eggwhich is awesome,  if you love avocado,  go forIt,  killer pesto.The place is for peopleWith a discerning palate who can actually taste their food and can tell the difference between quality, freshness and creativity in recipes, If you don't mind the wait, you will eat well. Ask questions because often times things will be grass-fed and organic but you have to ask.There are times when there is no wait. Trendy crowd.Cool photographs of rock stars on the walls.

Reviews.Author: Philip L.
Reviews.Content: I wrote this review, and got an immediate response from the owner.  Thank you for your note--and, actually, i did not HATE your restaurant.  I apologize if it came across that way.  I think after reading all the yelp love, I was surprised at my own personal experience--so I tried to be very specific about it.  I thought that would be most helpful to the restaurant and other yelpers. No matter the issue, I respect that you responded (unlike most restaurants), so best wishes in continued success!***Why might I call this place a chick brunch spot?  (Don't hate me!)  Well, normally a chick place has modest portion sizes of very tasty food.  I know I know--the food here is actually mediocre, and a bit sizable too.  Crispy french toast--not very light and a bit too sweet--no magic despite all the reviews.  Loxex--overcooked eggs, small bits of low quality smoked salmon (If you think Costco lox is good, you may not like this scramble).  Breakfast carbonara--too much rice for the proportion of other items.  In general, all the flavorings (berries, salmon, bacon) were a bit on the stingy side--and that left us with a feeling of sparseness or not being quite satiated.So, even though the food is, as many have said--over rated... it's a cool scene with lots of pretty women standing in line.  Some with their guys in tow.  Most of the servers are hunky dudes (I guess the manager knows who their key brunch demographic is!)  So, how does hunkiness translate to service?  Actually, our server (DAVID) was really awesome.  We sat in an awkward outdoor table, and we never once had to look for him or any help.  The service anticipated our every need and was really friendly, nice, welcoming.  The hostess has a tough job, with the long lines--but the texting system works well.  And well, Sunday morning on Melrose is really actually a nice place to browse around.  Five stars on the service.  But really, I'd rather go to Proof Bakery to have a delicious breakfast, than Blu Jam.At Sunday at 10 am, it seems like most of the people waiting around us that we talked with were first time goers as well--many tables of people taking pictures of their food.  So I didn't get a strong "repeat customer" vibe from the Sunday brunch crowd.Note to owner: If you get a chance to ghost eat your food, see if you think the kitchen might be skimping on key expensive ingredients at the expense of overall dish taste?  I do think eaters notice.  But then again, with 1 hour wait, maybe it's just me.  Clearly people love this place.

Reviews.Author: Sarah M.
Reviews.Content: Brunch in Los Angeles is one of my favorite weekend hobbies. Add a shaded outdoor table and a summer breeze, and I'm sold. We were seated and promptly served a cold flask of yummy lemon/mint water. To no one's surprise, I went for the crunchy French toast. I was expecting something that would rip the roof of my mouth, but it was much more delicate - just sturdy enough to chew on happily, and definitely not soggy, the way lesser places tend to make French toast. Delicious! It came with fresh berries, a few sprigs of mint, and a nicely milky vanilla sauce that I dribbled over everything. Talk about a hot, carb-y mess.Shared a few bites of the lox omelette, which was flavorful without being salty. The hollandaise on top was smooth and chive-y, and the cheese bound everything together well. Still, we eventually shoved aside the eggs in favor of the sweet French toast. I didn't order any caffeine on this visit (gasp, I know), but other patrons around us ordered some tasty-looking iced coffees and foamy lattes. I secretly cursed myself for foolishly attempting a coffee cleanse and vowed to get something on my next trip. Until we meet again, Blu Jam!

Reviews.Author: Ev C.
Reviews.Content: I've eaten here three times and each time the food has been delicious. However, the service sometimes seems a little too casual (aka slow).

Reviews.Author: Gabi-Song Yi K.
Reviews.Content: If you love egg sandwich, you need toTry the Eggwich here. It is best egg sandwich in LA! Fresh avocado and crispy bacons on it. Love love it.Blueberry pancake is just mediocre.I can find better place for pancakes.Egg Benedict is fantastic too! Def I will comeback for brunch soon.

Reviews.Author: Patricia N.
Reviews.Content: Perfect little spot for amazing food & people watching on Melrose ave!Had the Norwegian Benedict (smoked salmon) and oh my goodness, the dill hollandaise sauce was so unexpected yet so perfect! Why hadn't I had this before!Had a bite of my dates Brunch Burger and needless to say, I ended up taking his leftovers home! The Gorgonzola cheese over arugula gave it that mouthwatering bite.Rustic potatoes that came alongside both were the best potatoes I've EVER had. Seasoned to perfection w/plenty of rosemary!Thoroughly loved my dining experience here - sophisticated yet casual spot amidst the bustling streets of LA.

Reviews.Author: Td L.
Reviews.Content: This spot was busy! Luckily we got in before it got super busy. I had the Italian risotto and the boyfriend got the Benedict. Eggs were cooked perfectly and the risotto was perfectly "moist".

Reviews.Author: VanLam N.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went here a couple weeks ago and decided to try it out since there were so many great reviews.The wait is ridiculous, especially on the weekend. At least there are plenty of shops to check out while we waited. And it's great that they serve samples for waiting patrons. When we were finally seated, boyfriend ordered the iced peach tea? That was very refreshing, especially for a hot summer day. He ordered the Crunchy French Toast which I think they're known for. The dish itself is very delicious, a little on the sweet side but served with semi-tart strawberries so it balanced out well. I had the Steak Hash which was a little too heavy for breakfast. The dish itself was pretty good, I wouldn't say great because I felt like it was missing something but I just don't know what. I think I might have liked it better with regular hollandaise sauce. The food was OK, nothing special so it would probably be a long time if I ever come here again.

Reviews.Author: Woobin C.
Reviews.Content: I love this place!When I first experienced French Crunch Toast, i was amazed at its texture and taste.I used to come here three times a week for French Crunch Toast.I always come here with my girlfriend, so we need to order one more order besides the toast. Everyday was an adventure.And no matter what we ordered, we were satisfied.This cafe is good for private events and parties too because the cafe has artistic and gorgeous interior design.The owner Kamil is an amazing man who is committed to providing best quality foods. He uses the best ingredients in each food. I admire his passionate belief in what he is doing.My wedding reception takes place here!!

Reviews.Author: Jae G.
Reviews.Content: Surely expect a wait.  1 hour for us on a sunday.  Felt like food was rushed. Thinking of going on a day when its slow. I got the blue jam benedict.  It was so salty I had to stop eating it.  I did like the French Toast covered in corn flakes.  Surely I would try it again.

Reviews.Author: Hiep N.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam is well known for being the "Best Breakfast in LA" and from experience, it was well earned. We waited 45 mins for a table, but they text/call you when your table is ready. You can also check to see how many people are ahead of you by visiting the URL provided on the wait list text. This gives you plenty of time to check out Melrose and wander around the stores nearby.Food took a little longer than expected but it was worth the wait. We ordered the crunchy french toast and eggs Benedict. They were both ridiculously delicious and perfectly cooked. The atmosphere is laid back and casual. The waiters here are attentive and helpful, I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Author: S. H.
Reviews.Content: No need to say anything, best ever brunch place. Must order French toast /egg Benedict /breakfast chicken quasadilla . Only bad thing is need to wait for one hour on the weekend

Reviews.Author: Ali Z.
Reviews.Content: After hearing about this restaurant from a YouTube video of a marriage proposal (see: youtube.com/watch?v=hVTr…), I bookmarked this eatery as a place to try. And am I glad I did!This is a great place for breakfast and healthy food options! I ordered the Florentine Benedict and Kamil's Juice. It was delish!Great service is to be expected here. Manager Frankie and waiter Alex were awesome! They were very accommodating and helpful. I will definitely be making my way back here and bringing others to partake in the scrumptious servings Blu Jam Café has to offer.

Reviews.Author: Michael U.
Reviews.Content: Items Selected:Blueberry Pancake with $1 Pure Maple Syrup SupplementCrunchy French Toast - Brioche rolled in corn flakes, topped with fresh fruit, served with vanilla bean sauceCoffeePraised by some as the reference standard for French Toast in Southern California, Blu Jam Café on Melrose had long been on my 'to visit' list and with two disappointing stops already behind me on my last day in town I decided to finally take the bait; an 8:05am arrival nabbing me a seat without the typical 1+ hour wait as the surprisingly sizable restaurant filled to capacity by 8:30, a small line extending to the sidewalk on an atypical grey morning.  Largely there with a singular purpose in mind but happy to entertain other options it would not be long before my server greeted me with a menu and after a short delay an order were placed, the young man subsequently disappearing to the back and leaving my coffee mug dependant on me begging back servers for refills more than once during the course of my forty-five minute wait.  Service issues and a particularly loud table to my left aside, when my plates finally did arrive it was admittedly to high expectations and with a fluffy blueberry pancake kicking things off the fabled French Toast that followed was merely decent, the brioche not particularly memorable and still slightly doughy beneath inconsequential cornflakes - the vanilla cream, remaining pure maple syrup, and superlative So.Cal berries all helping to buoy a plate whose critical acclaim I simply fail to comprehend.

Reviews.Author: Leo D.
Reviews.Content: I'm not much of a breakfast person but hands down this is by far the best place I've ever eaten breakfast.  I've only been here twice and each of those times I have walk away satisfied! Food is outstanding you can definitely tell they use the freshest ingredients. The only draw back is that the place is small and there is always a wait. Which I find worth it.

Reviews.Author: Daniele S.
Reviews.Content: What can I say that hasn't been said already?  If you're coming in here for an experience you're here for the wrong reasons.  You come for the food.  The phenomenal food.  Om nom.  Seriously.  I am a foodie through and through and the steak hash and crunchy french toast here hit breakfast notes that make opera singer's shatter glass in my soul.  Okay maybe it's not THAT epic but honestly I'm not a breakfast person and this has me coming back for more.  With that being said let us discuss service.  Service here is great.  I have yet to have a waiter/ waitress that is not mostly upbeat and you actually feel like they want to be there and serve you.  Service with a smile, literally.  If you want coffee I suggest staying away from the more expensive french press alternative they may offer you.  We've had it a few times and each time, regardless of what type of coffee was the flavor of the month/ week, the plain ol' cup o joe has been much more tantalizing.One thing to note:  At my last visit they had lost their liquor license so no mimosas... sad panda... This place is a must go and try.  The waits may be longer than you expect, especially if you are a large party on a weekend and they will not seat you until your entire party is present so anticipate and prepare and enjoy.

Reviews.Author: Amanda N.
Reviews.Content: Late review, but better late than never right? I went here in February and this place is sooo good. My friend and I went on a Wednesday around 11am. Parking was easy to find and there was no wait. My friend and I both ordered the crunchy french toast. It was soooo good. I would definitely come again when I'm in LA.

Reviews.Author: Margaret N.
Reviews.Content: Great place for brunch! Ample metered parking next to 7-11, to the right of the restaurant.Restaurant is a bit smaller, so you end up sitting really closely next to different parties, but they offer outdoor seating as well.Got their crunchy french toast with vanilla bean sauce on the side and it was amazing! French toast was crispy, berries were fresh and sauce wasn't overbearingly sweet! Also, got an over medium egg, which was a tad but over cooked and chicken sausages, which didn't really taste like chicken, so I don't recommend that.Had an iced vanilla latte and it was yummy! So glad that they offer almond milk! Definitely check this place out for brunch/breakfast with friends!

Reviews.Author: Jane K.
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a brunch spot in LA with amazing, friendly service and delicious food, then you must come here! We ordered the popular crunchy French toast and it was out of this world. I don't even like French toast!! I was also excited to see a "health and fitness" section of the menu for picky healthy eaters like me! I got the "muscle beach" which is egg whites with fresh veggies with cottage cheese and toast. Very generous portions and I couldn't even finish everything! GREAT food, GREAT service!I will definitely be back here!

Reviews.Author: Philip L.
Reviews.Content: Food was pretty good as you can see through all the reviews. The one thing I wanted to mention was the service. First off we ordered from a different server, he said our server's name was Irene. We literally saw her one time during our whole meal. She didn't bring out any of our food/drinks/check. We had to ask the bus boy for an extra orange juice. He was really nice and took our orders even though I don't think he's supposed to. We didn't want to tip lower since we weren't sure if the tip is pooled or not. But, if the management is reading this, I just wanted to let you know that our server did not help us at all. However, thankfully you hired other great staff that made up for it and did her job. The wait was pretty bad, but understandable. Idea: maybe take down cell phones and call people when their table is up? I notice that the hostess was repeating names literally for 10 minutes straight.

Reviews.Author: E R.
Reviews.Content: NOT DOG FRIENDLY AS OF 1/2014.I gave one star because I really wanted to try their food, but had my 5 lb Pomeranian with me so they would not allow me to sit at their OUTDOOR tables.  I asked if I could do take-out? They said no take-out either.  Bummer.

Reviews.Author: Johnny B.
Reviews.Content: Light jazz and warm atmosphere. . The service is quick. Wooden ceiling, exposed brick- gives a sense of warmth at the start of your day. Mint-infused table water is a very nice touch. Many healthy options in the menu including vegan and gluten free options clearly marked. Ordered the "muscle beach" breakfast. Very satisfied . Thank you Irene for the pleasant demeanor and Impeccable service and to the rest of the staff for continuously topping my glass of water and coffee for me. Over all, an amazing experience. My jam wasn't blue though...........

Reviews.Author: Catie T.
Reviews.Content: Finally made it to Blu Jam even though work is just 2 blocks away since it wasn't crowded for once. We were seated right away at a table for 5!I had the Norwegian Benedict which was really good, perfect amount of everything. I got it with the side salad. The greens were good but the balsamic vinaigrette was really light, I prefer more. Next time I'd get it with potatoes which were quite tasty or the fruit which the cup my friend had was particularly sweet. My friends split a Benedict and the crunchy french toast which I would recommend so you can have a taste of savory and sweet, the best of both worlds! Overall, a bit pricey but definitely worth it if there is no wait!

Reviews.Author: Hannah H.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE the Blue Jam Cafe!The staff was extremely friendly and efficient. I've been a few times, always bringing my small dog in my purse, and everyone was very welcoming to him. I can't say enough about the iced almond-milk mochas...they are simply AMAZING! Me and my friend came once just to get mochas to go. My favorite thing on the menu is the Crunchy French Toast. It is very unique, and the vanilla sauce served with it is subtly sweet and very tasty.I will definitely be coming back! (After my next pay check) ;)

Reviews.Author: Tony L.
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I wanted to have brunch today and so we drove out to give Blu Jam a try after reading all the awesome reviews.  We arrived around 10:40am and waited for about 10min before being seated.  The restaurant was pretty cramped but had a nice cozy feel to it.  We ordered the norwegian benedict and breakfast risotto along with an organic latte with soy milk.  Both dishes were delicious.  The eggs were perrrfect. mmmm yolk... The potatoes that came with the benedict were also very crunchy and tastey.  We thought the latte would have an image in it but it came with jus a big blob of cream. Bummer haha, but maybe that's how it is here. NBD.This place had good food and a good atmosphere and I would come back if I ever have other things planned around the area.  I don't think I would drive all the way out here just to eat though.

Reviews.Author: Miracle M.
Reviews.Content: french toast & Eggwhich! Amazing. No idea why they don't serve alcohol. #justsaying

Reviews.Author: Scott M.
Reviews.Content: Fresh juice was good although not sure if the beet I ordered made it in. Ordered their special, rizzoto with beans chicken cilantro and two poached eggs. Delicious although I wouldn't call it a rizzoto. Def caf coffee was some of the best ive had. Jen ordered French press which made my amazing decaf taste like nothing much in comparison. She ordered chilaqueles  I've had better. Not true authentic chilaqueles but still tasty.

Reviews.Author: Lisa C.
Reviews.Content: Nice little spot on Melrose.The food was very good.  I got the Norwegian breakfast (benedict with smoked salmon).  The eggs were poached perfectly and everything was put together really nicely.  The dill hollandaise was really tasty, but there was not quite enough of it.We did have a small child in our party and the server was absolutely wonderful with her.  Even brought out her food first without being asked.Everyone seemed to enjoy their food and the prices were pretty reasonable.

Reviews.Author: Christine D.
Reviews.Content: Great place for breakfast!  Had to wait about 45 mins to get a table but if you can manage to pass the time away it's worth the wait.  Highly recommend the breakfast risotto carbonara which is basically risotto with crispy bacon, peas, 2 poached eggs on top surrounded by pesto sauce.  Interesting take on risotto and never had it before as a breakfast dish.  The crispy french toast is awesome too - has crisp corn flakes on the outside - recommend sharing this dish as it's a bit much if that was your only entree.  The Kamil's breakfast is also good which is mac & cheese with ham and bacon....and the eggs benedict was great too!  Loved all the dishes!Parking is on the street....Melrose was blocked that day for the AIDS walk but you should be able to find parking on the side streets as well.

Reviews.Author: Jackie K.
Reviews.Content: I love this place! I'm not so sure I'll be coming back for an entire brunch, but I'll definitely be coming back for their oh so famous Crunchy French Toast! My recommendation is that you come here JUST FOR THAT! Food: I shared with a friend & got the California omelet. I'm not sure I'll be ordering that again. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't great either. But let me go on about the Crunchy French Toast. I couldn't keep my hands off of it. They serve it with a vanilla bean sauce that is SO MUCH BETTER than using regular syrup. i wish I could order just the vanilla bean sauce & take it home with me to put on top of everything! The French Toast was ... CRUNCHY--hence, the name. Service: I love the staff here. They're incredibly friendly & helpful with the menu. I've heard some people having to wait up to 2 hours to be seated here. I think my friend & I lucked out & went at an off time. Try to avoid going here during the weekends. It gets incredibly crowded. We went on a Wednesday at 1PM & there was absolutely no wait!

Reviews.Author: Nicole S.
Reviews.Content: Took a few friends here for breakfast who were visiting and we had a really good experience. We only waited about 5 mins to be seated. I had the burgundy omelet and it was delicious--really flavorful and I could really taste the spices in it so it kicked it up a notch. Way better than your average omelet. I like that they substitute the potatoes for fruit without a problem that's a nice touch as well. Would definitely come back and recommend if you're in the area.

Reviews.Author: Nancy H.
Reviews.Content: The food was excellent but the best thing was the manager, Frankie!  Frankie constantly was walking around all of the tables to make sure everything was as expected and too make sure we had everything we needed.  Frankie provides a fun atmosphere to the establishment and I hope he is there the next time we get back there.  Thanks Frankie for making sure we had a great meal.Love the green apple juice!

Reviews.Author: Kaylee L.
Reviews.Content: Breakfast all day, my favorite!I love the Florentine Benedict which has Spinach, Mushrooms, Sun Dried Tomatoes and Brie Cheese, mmmm! Then of course a poached egg and delicious hollandaise sauce.Their famous Crunchy French Toast is also amazing. I actually love Corn Flakes added to anything they're not normally on. Pancakes, Mac & Cheese, etc. I love the crunch!They also have really delicious lattes/espresso drinks. The vanilla latte is so creamy and good! People have been telling me to check out the Sherman Oaks location since it's closer to me but I know it doesn't have the same rustic/cabin feel inside. I love the interior here. Any way, I recommend it but expect to wait a while, it's a popular place.

Reviews.Author: Hye-Min O.
Reviews.Content: I love the interior and the quaintness of this place.Probably one of my favorite brunch places!There can also be a longgg wait, but it depends what day/time you go. Try to avoid peak meal times and go earlier if you can.The food is a little on the pricier end, but definitely worth it. The Crunchy French Toast is SO GOOOD!! We also tried a Pesto Chicken Sandwich, but the french toast was my favorite.Overall, good service, friendly workers, and good food! The only thing that sucks is finding street parking, but that's expected in LA. Would definitely recommend this place!

Reviews.Author: Mike K.
Reviews.Content: Overall good food but I don't like to wait.  Brunch line was long so if you're hungry in the morning, don't come here.

Reviews.Author: Erin W.
Reviews.Content: Fresh and delicious! A good place to go for breakfast or brunch. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Author: Stephen K.
Reviews.Content: This place rocks! Great service and yummy food--the French toast is delicious. It's def worth the wait. I've been back multiple times and recommend it to friends frequently.

Reviews.Author: Emily S.
Reviews.Content: Despite the wait, this place is pretty good. If I were to recommend two items on their menu, it would be the crispy French toast and Kamil's breakfast.  Although, ask for Kamil's breakfast with crispy bacon instead of with ham.The service here was great and the food we all got was pretty good.  I enjoyed my omelette with bacon, mushrooms, zucchini, and cheese.  The only thing we all didn't care too much for were the potatoes here.  Parking for the area was okay.  They only have metered parking with a two hour time limit, but we waited for an hour after arriving here at 10:15 on a Saturday.  So, another tip; try to arrive early so you don't have to wait too long.I would be back!BTW, Breakfast and Lunch is served ALL DAY here!

Reviews.Author: Bonnie Y.
Reviews.Content: the wait was OK - about 30 mins still on a rainy weekend, the hostess upfront was very nice and friendly. we had the blu jame egg benedict and their famous crunchy french toast - it's a perfect combination! both were very good! spiced chai latte was really yummy too.it's a relatively small and cozy place, everything is awesome and would definitely recommend and come back - but the waiters attitudes could be improve? they were not rude or anything, just... cold.

Reviews.Author: Ebony S.
Reviews.Content: Three words, crunchy french toast!!! Do yourself a favor and head over to Melrose for Blue Jam's brunch. I wouldn't recommend sharing the french toast because once you take your first bite you will want to eat it all by yourself. Be prepared for at least a 30-45 minute wait for a table on a Saturday or Sunday.

Reviews.Author: Helen V.
Reviews.Content: WOW! This is a great breakfast place! I had the Italian breakfast risotto with poached eggs on top. The risotto had safe and thyme, mushrooms, and the eggs on top. It was delicious, and not so traditional. I want to try and make this dish at home. The wait time was long, about 40 min for breakfast on a saturday which is to be expected, and very worth it. They have a juice bar, delicious coffee, and fresh Basil water while you wait. Did I mention the delicious coffee. The service was very good to include the hostess who had a sense of humor and was very entertaining. I wanted to share my experience because this place is really unique. I also had a bite of the "signature dish" the french toast and what can I say it was perfect.....The food is super fresh and the quality is excellent........

Reviews.Author: Nicki L.
Reviews.Content: So my cousin and I like to try new breakfast places at least once a month and Blu Jam Cafe made the list last month. We were drawn in by the picture of their crunchy french toast on their website. We got there and had a very short wait time and the young lady that took our order was very friendly. (Almost too friendly but I liked her)I ordered the Loxex, my cousin had the Chilaquilas and we shared an order of the Crunchy French Toast (which is essentially french toast rolled in frosted flakes). The portions were more than enough for us both to take home and tasted just as good reheated. The french toast was a big win and I actually wish I had gotten my own. Overall, I would definitely recommend this place to friends and we will be back for some more of that french toast,

Reviews.Author: Sen S.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam definitely doesn't need another review, especially because I'm just going to reiterate how delicious the Crunchy French Toast and Chilaquiles are, but I'm just going to do it anyway. I mean, I live all the way out in Venice and I make the trek out there just for those dishes. In fact, I call to make sure they have enough chicken for the Chilaquiles before I head out (one time they didn't and I almost cried). Just go get some, it's delicious.

Reviews.Author: Nitar L.
Reviews.Content: Crunchy, sweet, light, fluffy FRENCH TOAST!The best french toast that I ever forked and dipped into some heaven-given vanilla bean sauce! Topped with some blueberries and strawberries, I couldn't ask for anything more other than an over-medium egg and some bacon! A breakfast is never complete unless there's bacon :)You haven't seen the last of me Blu Jam!

Reviews.Author: Adriana F.
Reviews.Content: All-time-favorite brunch place.  Crunchy French Toast and Burgundy Omelette are the best.  If you get something that comes without the potatoes, order them as a side cause they're amazing - perfectly spiced with rosemary and salt.  Very decently priced for quality and portions.Wait to get a table can be long, but there's a reason for that (it's amazing food) - just walk around the block and check out cute shops if you don't want to stand out front too long.

Reviews.Author: Anastasia D.
Reviews.Content: Yummy. Love getting the half soup half salad combo. Alway delicious.

Reviews.Author: A. L.
Reviews.Content: Yum! I enjoyed the creative brunch menu and am especially grateful that all the gluten free menu items are clearly indicated as such. It was easy to order something delicious, a breakfast risotto (trust me, it works) full of veggies and flavor. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Author: Steven M.
Reviews.Content: The food is exceptional.  I have dreams about their Wrap On Fire.  It's on a trendy stretch of Melrose.  Yes the wait is long.  Call ahead and take it to go.  Except there is no take-out on the weekend.  Then you're on your own.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie Y.
Reviews.Content: Note to self: Bring a snack next time I go between the hours of 10am and 1pm. The wait is pretty ridiculous, but service is pretty fast so there is a pretty good chance you will end up spending more time waiting than eating. At least they have mint-infused water and plenty of chairs and shade while you're waiting! It also helps that you can see your place on the waitlist and how incredibly long the people ahead of you have been waiting. Don't go with a group of 8 - I think it took almost 90 minutes for them to get seatedThe food was good, but I didn't think it was worth the hour wait. I had the steak hash, which I really liked. There was a lot of good quality, tender steak and gooey egg yolk was the cherry on top of my potato sundae. The portion size was ok. I heard the girls at the table next to me say the portions were too big but they ate about as much as I would have eaten if I'd come straight from another brunch date when I was 9. I was mildly full when I finished my hash (I probably could've eaten a whole second order if I exerted myself) and followed it up with a trip to Milk, where I finished off a nutella tartine and a chocolate croissant bread pudding, both a la mode, on my own.Service was great. Our order was taken quickly, the water came quickly, the food came out quickly, the plates were cleared quickly, and the check was brought and taken care of quickly. Basically the service is designed for fast turnover and they are very good at it.

Reviews.Author: Sam C.
Reviews.Content: Before i start ill preface this review by saying the food is good.  French toast has that amazing crunch to it.  The benedicts are all really well made.  They have some many different interesting things on the menu that make this place unique.  Now after reading that opening you maybe be wondering.  "Well if you like it so much why only 2 stars".  Well the reason is very simple.  The wait.  I came here on a Sunday morning looking forward to my meal.  When i was told my table would take 55 mins to be ready i thought that sounds about right.  Ill just walk around a but to pass the time.  55 mins passed and i returned.  Then waited another 30 minutes.  In total I ended up waiting a hour and a half.  After that we got out table and everything proceeded nicely from then on.  And by nicely i mean me and my friends were starving and tired from standing around.  Yes the food is good.  But after that kind of wait i was of the mind that just about anything would have been awesome.  I could have gone to the diner down the street and the quality wouldn't be so different that waiting a hour 30 would make sense.  I think this is one of the few places in La where they say your waits gonna be over a hour and people say.  Great put my name down.  With the amount of brunch places springing up all over the place I just cant justify going here.  2 stars for the service and the food.  Minus three for the wait time and the lack of parking.

Reviews.Author: Josh H.
Reviews.Content: The food is awesome. But the service is even better. Doug the host is a gem.Steak and eggs really rocked.  Ice coffee was delish. I don't really have much more to say because I'm not a pretentious yelper, but I'm gonna keep typing so my review isn't sent as a tip. Think I'm good now.

Reviews.Author: Sara H.
Reviews.Content: Went on a Sunday at 1pm, wait for two was 47 minutes. I got the crunchy French toast and Kamil breakfast.Crunchy French toast was very mediocre. The corn flakes had a slightly stale feel/taste to it. It's not something I would pay for. Nothing unique about it, it taste like something I would make with my kids one morning messing around. The Kamil breakfast flat out taste like Mac and cheese with eggs. Edible, but lacking umami and complex flavors.I will be back to try other dishes. Everyone was very nice.

Reviews.Author: Elle Y.
Reviews.Content: This place is my jam.... like strawberry jam. The wait sucks but it's so worth it. Their coffee is amazing, their food is amazing, the people are amazing. There's nothing not amazing about this place. I usually get the loxex, which satisfies the most extreme of my smoke salmon cravings because smoked salmon + brie = heaven. Another great thing about this place... I'm not a huge fan of breakfast foods (eggs). The only eggs I like are the ones I make myself. And at Blu Jam, they let you substitute tofu for eggs. Color me happy! On another occasion, I ordered the seared tuna sandwich and that shizz was the shizz. Tip: Make sure one of your friends that you're dining with order the french toast that way you don't miss out on the sweet gooey goodness of their famous sweet breakfast items.

Reviews.Author: Drew E.
Reviews.Content: Good food, great juice, but overall atmosphere gets a mixed review- still on the options list though.

Reviews.Author: Tina T.
Reviews.Content: From what I've seen in past posts, it looks like the waiting time here is the biggest problem?? Well if that's the case, I didn't wait at all. Ha. We went in on a Friday around 3 PM, and yes there were some people there but there were also a good amount of empty tables as well.  Just go to Blu Jam around 3 PM then, yea? Not so hard. We ordered the Crunchy French Toast and the Chilaquiles (I'll never know how to correctly say Chilaquiles), but I recommend ordering in this type of similar set! One sweet and one savory dish so you can take full advantage of this joint.  Personally I enjoyed the Crunchy French Toast more because I've never had anything like it before.  The reason why it's crunchy is because of the Corn flakes sprinkled on the crust. If it sounds weird right now then ignore what I just said and try it for yourself.  Chilaquiles were of course amazing as well, except I am lactose intolerant so I had to ask for a lot of things on the side :/ I'm pretty sure it would taste more than amazing with the full package.  From what I know, Blue Jam is mainly popular for their wide array of French Toast dishes.  I agree.  The list of French Toasts on their menu looked too good to just try one.  Until then...I will be back very soon for more.

Reviews.Author: Nancy L.
Reviews.Content: Pretty good place for breakfast. The neighborhood is a little sketchy. They had a homeless guy hanging around but I give the host major props for doing his best to handle the situation. He did his best to get everyone seated and notified the manager. So I give them an A+ for customer service. The wait time went by fairly quickly but it was a holiday so maybe there were less people than usual?I had the morning hash which was really good. The serving portion is GIGANTIC! The boyfriend had the Brunch Burger, which was also pretty good. It was also quite large but I think it's a good portion for a man. It came with a side of potatoes which were quite tasty.  I also had an ice coffee which was delicious. I take my coffee pretty seriously, as in I MUST have a cup every day in order not to kill my coworkers :)Overall, I enjoyed this place.

Reviews.Author: Sabrina M.
Reviews.Content: Delicious, Delicious, Delicious! This place really exceeded my expectations. I was in the mood for some good & hearty breakfast. So I stopped at Blu Jam Cafe and left there feeling everything but Blu!I recommend the  Steak Hash (GF) & made with real Filet Minion, the most delicious breakfast I've had in a while. I also recommend the Crunchy French Toast, crispy topped with fresh berries and accompanied by a creamy vanilla syrup, yum! The service was just as great, my waiter Spencer was super nice and really made me feel welcomed! Thanks Spencer:)

Reviews.Author: Ryan W.
Reviews.Content: I had to check out Blu Jam Cafe since I was down the street. I came a little after 2pm on a weekday, but it was still pretty busy. We chose to sit outside since it was a beautiful day. ===Parking===Meter parking along Melrose. $1 per hour and a 2 hour max. ===Service===The service was pretty good. I feel like the staff wasn't as attentive towards us since we were seated outside. ===Food===Migas: Spicy combination of scrambled eggs, jalapeños, chipotle, beef chorizo sausage, red bell peppers, tortilla chips and mozzarella, topped with homemade salsa and server with potatoes and corn tortillas. I was expecting something spicy. The dish was definitely not spicy and I had to use some habanero sauce to give it that kick. Decent, but not excellent. 3/5Even though I just thought this dish was just okay, I'll be back to try out the crunchy French toast. I'll write an updated review when I come back here again!

Reviews.Author: Fernando R.
Reviews.Content: There will be a wait... but well worth it!The food is amazing with various options...Migas and Roma via Paris are two of my favorite breakfast dishes. Crispy French toast plate is delicious! You can now check in and they will take your number and call you when your table is ready meanwhile you can browse some Melrose shops...Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Beverly T.
Reviews.Content: I looooove breakfast food!Must have:Migas - Chorizo, eggs, sauce. Whats not to love?Carnitas - These are yuppy style carnitas but they're damn delicious. Very juicy.FRENCH TOAST! Cornflake crusted french toast with some sort of coconut milk sauce to dip in topped with sweet and tart strawberries and blueberries. The perfect combination without being overly sweet. I love how crunchy the french toast is!Side note: I see other peoples pictures and they got bananas on their french toast. I didn't. Why'd you cheat me Blu Jam? WHY?

Reviews.Author: Kyle G.
Reviews.Content: Nice cafe with great patio seats IF you're lucky enough to grab a table without the sun on top of you.  Service was good. We asked to switch table because the umbrella didn't cover our table and they didn't give us much hassle about it (hostess almost always say "naw" to table switching request when it's busy).Food took a little longer than expected but it was worth the wait. I ordered the carbonera risotto and it was delicious! The portion was good and filled my calories for the morning. Tip for first timer and driving, there's free parking in the back.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan C.
Reviews.Content: Had this place booked marked for so long I forgot I had it.  This place comes up on several top 10 list for best breakfast/brunch in LA.  The fact that they serve breakfast till 5:00pm is what made it the obvious choice for me.  I love brunch but can never find the time on the weekend to get to it.Decided to go on Labor Day morning and at 9:00am on a holiday there was a line and a 15min wait already.  Was a little disappointed that the hostess didn't really even acknowledge us for like 2-3 minutes when we got there which is really what takes the review down one star.  She seemed busy but she didn't even bother to let us know she'd be with us in a minute. :(  I had to wait for another  another host came by to take our name.  I did like the fact that they take your number to page you so walk around Melrose and just get a text or voice mail when your table is ready.The food is solid.  While they're known for the Crunchy French Toast, there are just so many other great options.  Had to try the Crunchy French Toast since it's what they're known for.  It's good, light brioche yet crisp corn flakes, but having had it else where I wouldn't say it's a must have.  Also, would have been nice if the waitress could have explained the vanilla dipping sauce.  I know, I probably should have read the menu closer and maybe my palate is not as developed as I'd like to think (or the vanilla is just a bit  on subtle side) but when it comes to a restaurant's signature dish it doesn't hurt to sell it a little bit more and make people think they've really got something special.On the other hand, I've seen very few people comment about the Brunch Carbonnara yelp.com/biz_photos/blu-… which we had.  Risotto for Breakfast/Brunch?!  Awesome!!!  I'd rarely have the time or patience to make something like this at home so it's great to see it on the menu and it's a very well put together dish.  The portion is generous and the pistou (pesto without the nuts) sauce is AMAZING.  Light and refreshing, a perfect accompaniment to the creamy rich risotto.  Topped with two poached eggs, perfect to split for two.  I love spice and this was so good I totally forgot to add the Tabenaro Hot Sauce they have right on the table yelp.com/biz_photos/blu-…  (/)_0 {-- Facepalm... oh, well. maybe next time. With so many great nontraditional breakfast items, including gluten free and vegan will definitely try to come back to try more.

Reviews.Author: Michelle L.
Reviews.Content: Great place for brunch!! Blujam Benny was delicious, the muffin is kind of hard though, maybe a little too long in the toaster, and my potatoes were too salty..Crunchy French toast is what they're known for, it's on every single table! Yummy!Next time I wanna try their breakfast Mac & cheese/ breakfast risotto!

Reviews.Author: Melissa A.
Reviews.Content: YES for BREAKFAST! We were in the area for a week and wanted to cram as much food into our visit as possible :). After seeing the good reviews in Yelp, The Blu Jam Cafe made it onto the list. And I am so glad we did!We had the eggwich and the Roma via Paris scramble. Both items tasted great but we were delightfully surprised by the eggwich. The pesto aioli, arugula and avocado made the sandwich incredibly tasty. The scramble was a good solid breakfast. The veggies were definitely nice and fresh. The service was great. They didn't mind helping us out with our multiple requests for stuff because  of the baby and they even gave us a few solid suggestions of places to visit while we were in town.

Reviews.Author: Janel P.
Reviews.Content: This place had the best Arnold Palmer I have ever tasted! And the food...Mmmm! Went around 3:00 on a weekend and didn't have to wait. I'll totally be back to try more of the menu. So far, I have tasted the Brunch Carbonara and the Crunchy French Toast. Mmm!

Reviews.Author: Jing H.
Reviews.Content: That French toast...Wow.

Reviews.Author: Hennie N.
Reviews.Content: I actually visited Blu Jam, once upon a time ago, with my sister when I was younger. I ALWAYS remembered how delicious their eggs benedict & French toast were, but could never remember the name. However, after some detective work, Yelping, and Googling, I found Blu Jam at long last!- FIRST IMPRESSIONS/PARKING: Blu Jam is ALWAYS bustling, kind of cramped, and definitely loud. However, I love  the charming atmosphere because 1. it feels like I'm over at a friend's apartment and we're all making/eating brunch (if we could cook half as decently as the cooks here) together and 2. the place itself is decorated in a way that makes it feel intimate, yet trendy and casual. Parking can be pretty bad, but if you search around for street parking, you should be able to find available spots (or at least cars that are leaving)- SERVICE: We came here this past Saturday for brunch before we went shopping at The Grove (party of four around 215pm). Our host was very charming, friendly, and funny and quickly greeted us (despite having so many tables to attend to) and gave us an estimated waiting time of about 15 minutes (surprisingly short wait time even though they were bustling). We walked around and explored some shops while waiting, until they called, well actually texted, us that our table was ready (trendy, easier way of telling us when to come back instead of making us wait there). Also, they give your party about 3 minutes to respond to the text before they give your table away (unless you tell them you need some extra time, then they're happy to oblige)- FOOD: AMAZING. I ordered the Crunchy French Toast, my boyfriend ordered the Blu Jam Benedict, aaaaaand I can't remember what my other two friends ordered but I'm 100% sure they loved it. As soon as our food came (really fast by the way) everyone whipped out their phones to take photos because everything looked SO good. As we started eating, conversation died down and was replaced by a chorus of "mmmMMMMMmmm" as everyone indulged in their slice of heavenly delight.My french toast was PERFECT and tasted even better as I drizzled the warm, melted condensed milk on it. (my mouth is actually watering as I'm writing this). My boyfriend, who hates poached eggs because of the yolk, LOVED his eggs benedict. Upon his first bite, he exclaimed, "holy sh*t this is GOOD" and continued to eat until his belly burst.- OVERALL: Blu Jam is AMAZING (not surprising how many awards they have). Their entire staff is GENUINELY dedicated to making your dining experience fun and the food is PERFECTLY SCRUMPTIOUS. This is definitely somewhere everyone who comes to LA should try (definitely better than the hyped up Urth Caffe), because you can't beat amazing brunch food for reasonable prices with a friendly staff!

Reviews.Author: Dave G.
Reviews.Content: Okay but overrated. The staff refuse to split the bill

Reviews.Author: Hillary C.
Reviews.Content: While working on a small production, 14 of us attempted to place a very large but organized to-go lunch order. One of us called repeatedly and received no answer, so she got in the car and drove down there with the list of our orders. The manager on duty was a complete ass to her from the moment she walked in. After asking "how many people" would be served and she answered, he said, "No. We're not taking to-go orders right now." There was no line. They weren't packed. They totally could have filled the order. Besides, if you advertise that you take to-go orders... honor that, dammit!Kinda stupid. No, A LOT stupid. What kind of business doesn't take a to-go lunch order of ANY size after 1:30PM? Methinks the owner would like to know how much money he just lost out on, and how much business he has permanently lost because of this. We turned around and spent over $250 at Grub instead, and I will never again attempt to patronize Blu Jam Cafe.

Reviews.Author: Eunice L.
Reviews.Content: I love everything about brunch -- sleeping in and heading over to a restaurant, the sweet and savory dishes, and taking your time to enjoy the food and company you're with because you have nothing else planned for the day. Brunch = bliss. That said, Blu Jam Cafe does brunch right -- heck, they're only open until 4PM because they only serve brunch!PARKING -- There's plenty of metered street parking on Melrose and in the residential areas.WAITING -- On a Sunday morning at 11:40AM, there was a long line formed outside the restaurant just to put their names down on the waiting list. It turned out to be a 45 minute wait but you're free to browse the cute boutiques on Melrose while you wait because the restaurant notifies you via text when your table is ready! If you decided to go elsewhere by then, you just reply back to the text with a "3" and they'll give your table to the next party. Just remember to be in a 3 minute radius to claim your reservation.SEATING -- When putting your name down on the waiting list, the employee will ask you if you prefer outdoor, inside, or first available seating. We said first available and was seated outside and I'm so glad!!! I love natural light and the summer morning was perfect for the al fresco dining! When I went inside the restaurant to use the restroom, it was cute and homey but I would still prefer outdoor seating any day... so if you're not in a hurry, choose outdoor dining :)FOOD -- Amazeballs.
