We had the Crispy French Toast, Norwegian Benedict, and mocha lattes. The Crispy French Toast was nothing like I've ever tasted and perfect complement of crispiness on the outside with the cornflakes and softness on the inside with the brioche bread. I substituted the potatoes for a fresh fruit cup for free! The Norwegian Benedict was too salty for my liking and my poached egg was on the firmer side. If you're a fan of eggs benedict with smoked salmon, try Poach di Parma at Urth Caffe! The mocha lattes are good here too and come with latte art!SERVICE -- The employees here are so helpful and friendly! The moment I stepped inside the restaurant to use the restroom, I was scanning the perimeter for not even 2 seconds when an employee asked me if I needed any help! Likewise, I saw on Yelp that the lattes came with designs so I asked the waiter if they still did that. He replied that they might depending on how busy they are, but he'll ask. When our lattes came out, they had the prettiest designs on them! I was a happy camper :)Overall, I might be biased because I love brunch but the fabulous food and service was definitely worth the 45 minute wait!

Reviews.Author: Davaun C.
Reviews.Content: It's a busy but for a good reason. Even though it's packed service is extremely quick and they have one of the vegan burgers in the world!

Reviews.Author: margs k.
Reviews.Content: Usually, I'm wary of brunch places that have crowds waiting on the sidewalk to get in - Are they really that good or just overhyped? In Blu Jam's case, the food really IS that amazing. I appreciate that there are so many options - including a dozen low-calorie (with the calories listed) and vegan entrees.

Reviews.Author: Josephine J.
Reviews.Content: FIRST REVIEW, YESSS!! And so it begins...Boyfriend: "What are you doing?"Me: "Setting up a Yelp account."BF: "YOU don't have a Yelp account?? That should be illegal!"Me: "Awww, thanks babe! You're so sweet."BF: "You're so judgmental!"Me: *straight face* *blink, blink* "...would you like to try that again?"BF: "....I mean...you're so intelligent and a great judge of character!"Me: "Awww, thanks babe! You're so sweet."And here we are...BLU JAM. Like it. Like it a lot. I lived in L.A. for a few years and return for work frequently and this is a regular spot. I only go for breakfast/brunch so I can't really comment on the lunch food. Food isn't spectacular but is consistently good, which is important to me and is what keeps me coming back. I'm an egg gal and the scrambles are delish. I ask for salsa with pretty much anything and everything. I'd probably eat a side table if it came with a good side of salsa. They provide me with said salsa. THE ICED ALMOND MILK MOCHA IS TO DIE FOR!! Another Yelper mentioned it and I've been hooked ever since. I am the slowest drinker known to mankind (literally, hours on one drink) and I will down 2 of those bad boys in A sitting. The main downfall to this place is (wait for it, this will be something you have not seen in ANY other review!) is the wait. (No? Tricked ya? *sad face*) I loathe going anywhere during prime time on the weekends so I will avoid it at all costs. Alas, not everyone feels that way or wakes up at the crack of dawn like me so I sometimes have to venture here at 11am on a Sunday and let me tell you....I want to slap someone, wait for it to numb, then slap them again. It can easily be an hour and a half wait. The icing on the cake is the lack of parking (meter, some neighborhood) in that area at that time, also, so it's just a freakin hoot.My suggestion would be to come and enjoy this good spot during an off time where you can easily grab parking, people watch, and enjoy your eggs and latte without the hunger-crazed eyes of all of those waiting for you to shove your last bite into your mouth and get your ass out of their soon-to-be seat.

Reviews.Author: Brooke R.
Reviews.Content: The best French toast. I would give them give stars because I honestly think everything I've tried on the menu is delicious. They are just extremely slow. So be prepared to wait forever to get your order. It's extremely packed on the weekends. You're looking at wait times up to 2 hours. I come usually right when they open or no more then 30 mins after they open. Even during the week the spot is packed. It's worth the wait if you do happen to come at a peak hour.

Reviews.Author: Ryan R.
Reviews.Content: This place has restored my faith in breakfast. Lately, i've been eating these mediocre breakfast places in SF and i've stop going cause they dont seem to do it for me anymore. I came down to LA to consult on a new pizza venture that is going to be opening in the bay area and i was recommended to check this place out. LIke SF there are long waits outside at 10am. We got in after a 30 min wait on a sat morning. I ordered a eggs Benedict - i wanted to keep it basic, nothing fancy. When it came, it looked like an ordinary eggs Benedict...until i tasted it. This is the first time i had it with real AMERICAN bacon and not traditional Canadian bacon. It was also accompanied by a slice of ham. The egg was poached to perfection, no egg whites. The potatoes were the kicker for me. Normally i had the side of potatoes that come with breakfast dishes, but this place had it seasoned well! I wish they added a little bit more acidity to the hollandaise sauce, but still very good.I love this place and i would recommend it to any breakfast lover. Now i just need another reason to go back to LA.

Reviews.Author: Lan L.
Reviews.Content: I'm obsessed with brunch and have been trying places all over LA, but this is def my favorite spot now!I was trying to go early to avoid the wait but ended up oversleeping and arrived around noon on a Saturday. I was scared of a long wait but it ended up being only 30 minutes for a party of two. I had time to examine the menu during our wait and I ordered the breakfast quesadilla and crunchy french toast to share with my boyfriend. I also ordered the white peach tea and am in love with the taste! My quesadilla was hearty and filled with chicken and lots of cheese served with potatoes, avocado, and salsa. The portions are hearty and I could barely get through half of it. Of course the main event was the crunchy french toast, which definitely didn't not disappoint! So crispy on the outside and so incredibly soft on the inside. Served with fresh bananas, strawberries, and blueberries and a vanilla sauce, which was so good!! Everything lived up to the hype.I also love the atmosphere of the place and our waiter was extremely helpful and nice. There is always someone checking up on you to make sure everything is up to par. I can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Author: Ying-Hsuan L.
Reviews.Content: Their crispy french toast is a MUST try. That was what brought me to Blu Jam Cafe and I'm glad I went. As a huge brunch fan, this place hit the spot. The first time I went I only got the crispy french toast. The crispiness on the outside is a delicious twist on the classic french toast. I almost forgot I was even eating french toast!The second time I went, I tried the Burgundy Omelette. This was also a good choice. Very filling and a healthier choice. My favorite part about this dish has to be the side of potatoes though. I am a big fan of all sorts of potatoes and their crispy red potatoes were absolutely mouth-watering.

Reviews.Author: Lola C.
Reviews.Content: Always a pleasure to spend time and eat great food. Not once have I left without being full and happy.

Reviews.Author: Ian H.
Reviews.Content: Nice atmosphere and food! The only thing I could complain was the waiting, it really depends on the day & time, so good luck!Came here a while ago with besties and they had the French toast and Benedict, which were okay to me. However, I'm more an egg-scramble person and I enjoyed my Olympian! It was healthy and yummy too, definitely recommend it for those weight-watchers. On top of that, the staffs were helpful and the drinks were nice as well. It is a place I'd like to revisit if I was in the area, because I would like to try out other scrambles!

Reviews.Author: Sara S.
Reviews.Content: Wow. If you are looking for the perfect brunch place and you find yourself in LA, on Melrose, look no further than Blu Jam Cafe. My boyfriend and I are in Orange County, but try to go up to LA every so often to trek Runyon Canyon. Every time, we opt to try a new brunch spot in the city after our hike. This time, we came across the Blu Jam Cafe. We were reading online that the wait can be very long, but we had nothing to do all day, so we figured we would deal with it. I am SO glad we did. Honestly, we waited 40-45 minutes, and there was a ton to do nearby - lots of second hand clothing stores, and other little boutiques to look at. I guess I was probably more excited to explore those places than my boyfriend...But he tagged along and was a good sport about it. When our name was called, we were seated and brought fresh water right away. They stuck some cucumbers in our water, so it was like having some fresh spa water, at no cost. That was an added bonus. Our server(s) were both extremely nice and helpful when it came time to finding something to eat. At the time, I was counting macros, and I LOVED that they had a "get fit" section, where they included the macro count of the dishes on that side (P, C, F, Cal). I didn't have to guesstimate as to what was in what, how much, etc. It was also nice as we had just done the hour hike in the heat, so we wanted to be semi-conscious of what we were eating. I got the Far East Tofu Scramble, and my boyfriend got the Muscle Beach. Mine was...heaven. It was definitely an interesting combination of flavors (eggs with curry, and dried chile, etc.) but the flavors blended so well together. It was a perfect ratio of tofu, rice, and all the fun veggies. MY boyfriends was pretty simple -- egg whites, toast, cottage cheese -- can't go wrong with that. He also ordered a coffee at the end, which he said was pretty d*mn good. I don't drink coffee, so I have to trust his opinion. Protip: don't wait until you REALLY have to use the restroom, because there is only one for girls, and I waited in line, doing my dance, for about 20 minutes for that girl to get out of there. Just go. The wait IS worth it. Trust me.

Reviews.Author: Cameron H.
Reviews.Content: After all the hubbub about this place, I had to try it out! A fine experience, but not terrific. Food was good, service was sub-par. Luckily my friends and I arrived at an off hour so didn't have to wait long. I enjoyed my salmon and spinach entree, though a bit oily. Our server was not very attentive and it took a while just to start with a glass of water, and our lattes did not arrive until our food did. Not sure I'll go back.

Reviews.Author: Gigi D.
Reviews.Content: Meh, things have gone down hill since the days I used to frequent Blu Jam almost weekly. Clearly they needed me to keep things in order. The host, meh, not so great - he seems to accept his friends before accepting people who have been waiting a while for tables. The service is okay, nothing CRAZY amazing, just okay. And the food, not as great as I remembered. I don't really think I will be going back to Blu Jam on my own free will anymore. I have found far more delicious places.

Reviews.Author: Shane V.
Reviews.Content: I have only tried this place once, and I was not pleased with the food or the feeling of sitting on someone's lap. The service was great but besides that, there's too much hype around it.

Reviews.Author: Yara G.
Reviews.Content: A while ago, my boyfriend and I were looking for a good brunch spot. I yelped this place and saw a good rating... so we figured why not give it a go. I am SO happy we went... the service was great and the food was phenomenal! I had the Egg's Florentine (my favorite brunch dish) and it did not disappoint! My boyfriends dish was just as delish! We have gone again several times. I took my cousin and she had the Huevos Rancheros which were very tasty. She loved it so much she began bringing her husband! My best experience was just a week ago when I took my other cousins and a friend. They had the french toast and again, so so good. I loved that the manager Frankie came down to the floor and spoke with us making sure our service was well done. He was extremely friendly and talkative and we let him know how much we appreciated the food and the service. I always recommend this place! If you go on a weekend you might have a bit of a wait because it gets pretty busy... but BELIEVE me it is worth it!

Reviews.Author: Jordyn P.
Reviews.Content: This is the best breakfast spot I've had in LA so far. Everything we ordered was excellent (blu benedict, blu breakfast burger, Cobb salad, crispy french toast and lattes). Ambiance reminded me of a trendy little spot in San Francisco. Service was quick and the waiters were super friendly. I could eat here everyday. First time but definitely not the last. I'm still raving about this place. If you're in the Melrose area, it's a must try.

Reviews.Author: Krystle W.
Reviews.Content: Yuuuum!!I had the signature french toast and it was so so yummy to the tummy! I also ordered the apple chicken sausage with is never truly awesome but the quality was pretty darn good. It was also a lot of food. I ate about 3/4 of the french toast and half of the sausage and was more than full.My friend had one of the egg scrambles that was HUGH and only 350ish calories and looked so good. I don't like eggs but tried it and actually could stomach it all ;) The eggs weren't all eggy and gummy if you know what I mean. Soo aah there's that to try too!The staff are super friendly and even though there was a line, non-stop from the time I got there to the time I left, it seemed they got folks in and out pretty quickly. I think we waited about 20 minutes for a table for two around 11AM on a Saturday.I recommend!!

Reviews.Author: Ryan R.
Reviews.Content: Made a trip to LA to visit and we decided to eat at this yummy place. Due to the popularity of this joint, the wait was a little long. Luckily, a friend came before us and put our name in so it wasn't too bad. The food, however, was worth the wait! I decided on the Brunch Burger and it was delicious! Not really a fan of arugula and I forgot to swap that out for regular lettuce. The egg really makes the burger. I love me a burger with an egg in it. If I lived in LA I would definitely make a trip back to try out some of their other items. Some people next to our table got the risotto and it looked yummy!

Reviews.Author: Christine K.
Reviews.Content: Warning: the wait at Blu Jam on weekends is on average 40 minutes.I ordered the crunchy french toast with vanilla bean sauce.  I'm not keen on sweet things, so I ate it without the sauce.  Even so, the french toast was still sweet!  I love it when I can experience the food, and this dish delivered with its crunchy corn flakes, soft brioche bread, golden ends, and sweetness from the batter. The brioche slices weren't too thickly coated with the batter, so you could actually taste the bread!  Topped with blueberries and strawberries, the french toast ends on a calmer note with the natural sweetness and acidity taming the flavors of the batter.I would not mind coming here, again, for the french toast.  I do want to try the eggwich, too, though.

Reviews.Author: Morgan S.
Reviews.Content: Have to say one of the best brunches I've had in a long time.... And the best in LA!  Of course it's a long wait on the weekend especially a Sunday afternoon but soooo worth it.  I had the Breakfast Trio - two eggs any style, two pancakes or two slices of French Toast (I got the French toast delish!), bacon or chicken sausage (got the bacon)... I got the crispy red potatoes on the side.  It's was amazingly good, the crispy French toast was my favorite!!  My friend got the Florentine Benedict - Poached eggs on a toasted English muffin w/ sautéed spinach, mushrooms, sun-dried tomatoes, Brie cheese, topped w/ hollandaise sauce, severed w/ potatoes (he substituted them for a cup of fruit) "why?" Lol... I asked him if he LOVED it... He said he "loved" it, not all caps but it was still awesome.  Can't wait till the next time I'm here to indulge myself again!!

Reviews.Author: Alma V.
Reviews.Content: This place was soo GOOD that I will be back when we visit LA again. Wow my coffee was amazing and they have almond milk wish no one ever has. The crunchy French toast was beautiful and perfect in every way. They also have GF options and vegan. You really won't regret it. The only thing is that it was pricey. We spend $45. The food was a lot you will have enough food to share if you need to;) it's worth every Penny

Reviews.Author: David W.
Reviews.Content: Sometimes we are tempted to give biased ratings based on how great/bad a restaurant already is. Knowing how popular Blu Jam was, I had high expectations. And these expectations were only rattled by how long the wait was. Expect to wait at least an hour during the weekends (or come before 9AM as the waiter would tell you).Having sat through LA traffic in addition to an hour wait, I was not a happy camper when we were finally seated. In fact, our party of 5 got stuck in a table that only accommodated 4...but whatevers, we were HUNGARY.We kind of already had an idea of what we wanted to hour before we were seated...FRENCH TOAST...OH THAT FAMOUS FRENCH TOAST! So I shared a French Toast and a bacon macaroni dish with my gf...and the verdict is...definitely not the best french toast I've ever had. HOWEVER...it was not the best french toast in terms of PRESENTATION (coated with corn flakes & topped with fresh fruit). We thought that the bacon macaroni was of equal or better taste quality than the French Toast. Not to bash the French Toast because it was good...but did not live up to my high expectations.I'd definitely come back if I knew the line was shorter because it's a great cafe to spend a weekend brunch but be prepared to wait!

Reviews.Author: Jacqueline C.
Reviews.Content: BEST FRENCH TOAST EVER!Yes I know I am gluten intolerant but when I want to have a cheat day this would be the first place I would go. The french toast is made with brioche bread and it is then covered with a corn flake like surface. As if that weren't delicious enough they also top it off with some berries and some steamy white chocolate sauce. My mouth is literally drooling as a write this review. The combination of chewy, crunchy, sweet and savory still taints my memory. It is worth the wait and I can guarantee you will be anything but disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Lu R.
Reviews.Content: Amazing Benedict, French toast! The salad is good as well. Great place! But it's a little hard to find parking lot. Best brunch in LA!!!!

Reviews.Author: Jaime W.
Reviews.Content: Came for the first time with the boyfriend expectating some good food. Ordered their power house entree and not what I expected. Basically a plate full of egg whites with spinach - tasteless and 2 chicken breasts with marinara sauce - chicken was super dry. maybe I ordered the wrong thing. My boyfriend had their burgundy omelette which was actually tasteful. Good combo with spinach, sun dried tomatoes and goat cheese. Rosemary hash potatoes were good. Sourdough toast that came with it was also good. The place is busy during lunch hour and i felt kinda cramped due to the lack of space.  Would I come again? Probably not.

Reviews.Author: Monica B.
Reviews.Content: Excellent food, and fantastic service. This is my go-to spot for brunch when I am in town!

Reviews.Author: Nicki M.
Reviews.Content: The wait to get in for brunch on the weekends is quite long, but it is totally worth it! The service was quick and very friendly, and the food and coffee are phenomenal! This was my very first meal upon arriving in L.A. and has yet to be beat after an entire month of living here.

Reviews.Author: Bella T.
Reviews.Content: The staff is always stellar and friendly.  Their Brunch Carbonara is so nummy!   Lots of Gluten-Free options.Definitely one of my new favorite weekend places.

Reviews.Author: Christine K.
Reviews.Content: my sister, my friend and i came here on a Saturday morning around 11:30 AM--we could see the longgg lines as we were driving closer! We put our names down on the waitlist (we were told it would be a 1-1.5 hour wait), and drove over to Coffee Commissary to hang out for a bit... they called to tell us our table was ready about 40 min later, so the wait ended up not being too bad at all! (time went by quickly once we got our iced cup of jo ;) parking was much easier than expected! found free 2-hr parking in a residential area just across the street. of course we had to try the popular Crunchy French Toast (french toast crusted w/corn flakes)! it was served with a creme anglaise type of sauce (like a milky vanilla cream), which was the perfect compliment! i commented that it tasted kind of like crunchy beignets... definitely more of a dessert than a dessert, but i'm okay with eating dessert for breakfast sometimes :Dwe also shared the steak hash--potatoes, onions, steak, spinach, mushrooms, 2 poached eggs on top...yummy! the steak was tender, eggs were poached perfectly (always bonus points in my book :) , everything was really flavorful. my only complaint was that it was much too salty... but it was still delicious!service was very attentive and friendly -- they came back several times to refill our waters, and overall it was a very pleasant experience :) i'm not dying to go back already or anything, but i would definitely go back again sometime if i was in the area :)

Reviews.Author: Angelique G.
Reviews.Content: Great food, staff, and customer service.  Expect long wait times after 9am on weekends.  Get the Crunchy French Toast or the Blue Jam Benedict.  Both are amazing.

Reviews.Author: Amanda P.
Reviews.Content: My friend and I always try to stop by Blu Jam whenever we are in LA. There is usually a pretty long wait but it is actually worth it. I would definitely come early to avoid it. The crunchy french toast is one of the most delicious and ingenious things I have ever tasted! I always order that along with the Burgundy Omelet which is also amazing. The prices are a little high but like I said the food is so tasty that they can get away with it. The only reason I took off a star is because of the wait times and prices. Other than that, no complaints!

Reviews.Author: Saya V.
Reviews.Content: Yes, the French toast is all that they say. I know! That hardly ever happens. I was skeptical (how can you not be about anything that's been hyped over and over...) but it really did live up to expectations. Apparently corn flakes has the ability to turn regular French toast into amazingly awesome fancy French toast.Blu Jam is pretty trendy..pretty hipster..and the wait can be so long you start to wonder if you'll perish from starvation before they ever call your name. But even so, it's mostly worth it. Their eponymous benedict and crunchy French toast make one near unbeatable brunch combo.

Reviews.Author: Anne R.
Reviews.Content: Very standard breakfast. The coffee was great, the poached eggs were good, and the potatoes and toast were lukewarm. The inside was not heated, so it turned out to be warmer outside by the heat lamps. Not a great brunch experience, but great coffee.

Reviews.Author: Alfredo G.
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were in the Los Angeles area and stopped by this place for brunch. The wait was not too bad and they even had a waiting/sitting area. I had the breakfast trio eggs, French toast, bacon. I ordered a side of potatoes.French toast was yummy! Potatoes were cooked with rosemary it gave them a nice flavor. I definitely plan on visiting again when in LA area.

Reviews.Author: Diana H.
Reviews.Content: This place is definitely worth the wait (they don't take reservations).We ordered the Crunchy French Toast and the Piedmonte Brunch Risotto. Both were AHMAZING. What makes the French Toast is the crunchy part and the soft insides and the MAGIC SAUCE they give you along with it! (I think it's a vanilla bean sauce.)The brunch risotto was fabulous. Great flavor, with mushrooms and sun dried tomatoes, topped with a poached egg. I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Grace H.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE Blu Jam! I don't recommend going on a weekend though, it gets pretty packed.I went on a random Tuesday for brunch and it was perfect. Free street parking two blocks down and to the right. (Sorry forgot the street name)Everyone talks about the Crunchy French Toast and Blu Jam Benedict, but for the meat lovers I recommend the Steak Hash. It is a bit pricey, but Blue Jam is worth it! Breakfast is served all day which is also a plus. The waiters are always very helpful and they have a really clean taste to their food.

Reviews.Author: Catharine S.
Reviews.Content: I love finding a good place to eat on Melrose. Especially when the place offers vegan options. My best friend is vegan and she loves the tofu hash! The only downside to the mix is that they stopped serving mimosas.

Reviews.Author: Benjamin A.
Reviews.Content: It's been a while since I have visited Blu Jam, but this afternoon while discussing my favorite places to eat in LA, I had a flashback to Crunchy French Toast and immediately recommended this place to friends.Aside from having an extensive menu with some really unique dishes, I have to say the 5th star comes from the staff and ownership. In my experiences, the hostesses have always been considerate, the servers always enthusiastic, and the management always passionate. It's nice to dine at places where everyone cares about the food and the experience. I recommend the Crunchy French Toast obviously, but also the Migas, Breakfast Quesadilla and Salmon Benedict. No matter your tastes, you'll find something you like, and it will be worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: Alexandra J.
Reviews.Content: The Crunchy French Toast was crunchy.. and French.... OH.. & so delicious! Love this place. Friendly staff, yummy coffee!

Reviews.Author: Gary L.
Reviews.Content: Our waitress Lauren was exceptional the food was great . The free french toast samples while waiting was a pleasent suprise

Reviews.Author: Roxanne G.
Reviews.Content: Ordered the migas and added avocado with sour cream on the side. AMAZING. One of the best breakfasts I've ever had. If you like mexican style breakfasts, this dish is relatively basic but tastes fantastic!!Everything everyone ordered around us looked good. I cannot wait to go back and try more things on their menu. Only negative thing about this place is the wait. I waited over an hour for a table but it was ultimately more than worth it!

Reviews.Author: Elmira R.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went here two days ago for breakfast and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Everything from the food to the service was impeccable!We arrived pretty early in the morning and were seated right away. We were immediately greeted by our server Lauren who recommended we get the French Press coffee. We also ordered the California Omelet and Muscle Beach Omelet. The coffee was perfectly rich and smooth; we opted for a side of almond milk instead of regular milk or creamer. The Muscle Beach Omelet is healthy yet very tasty and comes in a big portion so be hungry! The California Omelet was really good as well. The bacon comes well done/crispy which is exactly how my boyfriend loves it and I must say that I will start requesting my bacon the same way. Amazeballs!Another thing we noticed was that the servers would greet regulars with hugs and even the busboys would greet the regulars which we thought made the restaurant that much more welcoming. You can tell right from the start that the entire staff is dedicated to providing the best customer service.Another recommendation made by our server was the carrot, ginger and cucumber juice. They have different ingredients and you have the option to choose your own combination. Definitely a must try. We loved this place and we will definitely be back, it's a perfect breakfast place. Shout out to our wonderful server Lauren for the amazing first impression and fantastic recommendations!

Reviews.Author: Kristine K.
Reviews.Content: I'm a little mixed about this place... but here's the story. My roomie and I came here around 10:00 am to avoid the Saturday brunch crowd. We only waited around 15 minutes which is FANTASTIC compared to 2 hours.I ordered a hot Vanilla Latte and we shared a Crunchy French Toast and a Breakfast Omelette. I was kind bothered that the latte took quite a while to come. I didn't mind but I just felt like it could have been faster. It also tasted a little watered down and didn't have the rich espresso taste so I wouldn't recommend it :(The french toast was SPECTACULAR! Absolutely delicious. It didn't come with maple syrup but with a vanilla sauce that was SO GOOD. Great for all you vanilla fans out there! The omelette was also good but the only thing that bothered me was the tomatoes made the inside a little soggy as the juices came out. But I can't complain about them using fresh produce haha It was still delicious and they didn't hold back on the bacon! ;)The service was the thing that pushed my review to 4 stars. The waiter was extremely attentive, even though my roomie dropped her knife twice haha They got the order wrong for the person next to us and instead of snapping back at them or rolling their eyes, the waiter kindly apologized and changed it right away. This left a good impression on me :)Definitely a place I've been wanting to try for a LONG time and I'm glad I did. Big tip- COME EARLY TO AVOID THE CROWD. The extra 30 minutes of sleep isn't worth a 2 hour wait...

Reviews.Author: Cathy J.
Reviews.Content: YUMMMMMM!!One of my top 5 BEST Breakfast & Brunch Cafes in LA!DOWN SIDE IS THE WAIT!!! but the cute little boutique next door helps:)

Reviews.Author: Bonnie L.
Reviews.Content: We were a group of five visiting around 3pm. The waiter informed us that there was no 5-seat-table available and we were divided into 2&3. He also friendly told us that the kitchen would be closed at 4pm. Needless to say the good weather and adequate service, their Piedmonte Brunch Risotto is beyond imagination !! All my friends who took a bite of my course wanted to  order it next time! It's a weekly special thus not guaranteed available all the time. If they happen to offer this, order it and you will not regret (unless you dislike rice and cheese, hmmmm)I also enjoyed their Iced Mocha Latte :)

Reviews.Author: Craig S.
Reviews.Content: The food is excellent but definitely not worth waiting over an hour for brunch just to get seated! This place got way too popular!

Reviews.Author: Jason T.
Reviews.Content: No complaints about this place, everything was very good the coffee espresso cappuccino omelettes the French toast. Everything, and the service was good too!!!!

Reviews.Author: Aurelius R.
Reviews.Content: Incredibly delicious, unique breakfast risotto plates that were divine! Latte was perfect!! Will definitely come back again when in the area

Reviews.Author: Michael C.
Reviews.Content: I came here hungover and was not in the mood to eat... And yet I still found this place delicious! Had to wait over an hour to be seated to eat, but the wait was worth it. Had the crunchy French toast, the egg Benedict, and the migas. All tasted delicious.

Reviews.Author: Shari H.
Reviews.Content: Their menu offers a great selection of breakfast options.  I really enjoyed the crunchy french toast, though was disappointed that when I asked for maple syrup to go with it they brought the fake stuff.  And they forgot the bacon I ordered.  Those mistakes overlooked, the coffee was great and I would go back.-

Reviews.Author: Andrew V.
Reviews.Content: The rancheros eggs are incredible

Reviews.Author: Alyxandra S.
Reviews.Content: Errrr merrr geerrd. This place was bomb! Came here around 2 on a Saturday and only had to wait 10 minutes. Not too shabby if I say so myself. My friends and I ordered the steak hash, the breakfast burrito, and the breakfast quesadilla. All super delicious and giant portions! It is a bit pricey $13-20 for breakfast but the portions, like I said,  are huge! They serve breakfast all day, but they  have lunch items too. On a sidenote, shoutout to the super nice host in the sweet leather overalls! You da you da best!

Reviews.Author: Jessica A.
Reviews.Content: Generous portions. Tasty dishes.  Amazing lattes & teas.I absolutely crave this place most weekend mornings.  I do wish they were open later than 5.I recommend:Breakfast Carbonara-I dream about thisFrench toast-At least get one for the table to shareEggs BenedictTurkey BurgerAny of their soupsThe wait staff is super helpful and friendly.  Very much a great atmosphere.Hmmm... complaints? For one, I wish they took reservations and/or expanded.  There is usually a horrible wait most weekends.  Luckily I don't work on Fridays so I try to squeeze a Blu Jam visit in on Friday mornings to avoid that weekend Sat/Sun crowd.  Also, I wish they served mimosas.

Reviews.Author: Cesca F.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I are here once a week! Its our Thursday morning date and we SO look forward to it!!!! Every time we walk in we are showed so much love, it makes the experience beyond awesome! The menu is delectable (build your own, tex mex, eggwich, mijas...and so on!) Love our bearded vegan server (cant believe i forgot his name) AND Lauren and all the other amazing servers, bussers, runners, cooks etc. Thank you for all the awesomeness!!!!

Reviews.Author: SHIRLE Y L.
Reviews.Content: Long wait....food is like other brunch restaurantsbut their pancake is the best compare with other brunch restaurants

Reviews.Author: Nina W.
Reviews.Content: Yummy...!!!Yummy....!!!Vanilla latte WITH whipped cream!!! Sooo yummy... Service was excellent. Waiters were really friendly when they first sat us. Very attentive and funny. would def come back.This is a spot recommended by a friend of mine. I was thoroughly impressed and it was a mighty fine burger with all the fixings. Highly suggested.

Reviews.Author: Candice F.
Reviews.Content: First time coming to Blu Jam today. Monday at noon and it was packed, which isn't surprising. The waiter was very friendly and cool. The food was so damn good. My boyfriend got the crunchy French toast which we both agreed was the best we have had. I got the egg sandwich which was delicious. So satisfied. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Author: Justin Y.
Reviews.Content: The trendiest of the trendy of LA Breakfasts. Though, not gonna lie Blu Jam Cafe might be the undisputed Hipster Breakfast joint for all Angelinos and let me tell you why I'd only come here once in a blue moon..Patrons: It's in Hollywood. Actually Hollyweird.. (Wannabe actors, Transplants, Pretentious and Elitist HOT Asian girls, Asian tourists, and couples) *No reservations by way* (I'm not talking about the Anthony Bourdain show by the way) The Wait: Fuckin' long. As in "Disneyland 45 mins long but without a fast-pass" long. Prices: If you're a poor ass college student or only have a $20 on you. You might want to re-think where you want to eat this morning. The majority of their menu items are over $10 for breakfast. It's decent for the working class though if your MAMA taught you how to be frugal then I suggest Norms or Dennys. Ambiance won't be the same FYI. Food: Amazing. Blu Jam Benedict: I'm like an Eggs Benedict Snob. Had extremely high expectations. Extremely tasty. A bit skimpy in size but it made up for it with the crispy pieces of bacon, perfectly poached egg, and amazing Hollandise Sauce. Jessica Y. and I are very critical when it comes to Hollandise sauce and it lived up to the hype. Kudos. Brunch Burger: Good sized burger with great taste and very Taiwanese in the sense that they put an Egg in it. I was thoroughly impressed and it was a mighty fine burger with all the fixings. Highly suggested.Service: Not bad. This place is always slammed with either the wait or even when you're at the table. Overall, this place is pretty good. The only thing I don't like about it is the wait and the size of the Eggs Benedict cause I like my shit HUGE. If you're not down for waiting but want to try a similar style breakfast place I recommend Square One dining. It's AMAZING. Similar breakfast items, 1/2 the wait, and none of the LA Transplant douchery. yelp.com/biz/square-one-…Thanks for reading! Sincerely the guy who wrote you a secret love letter in the 4th grade that you never received, JBY.

Reviews.Author: Celeste C.
Reviews.Content: Came here for brunch on a weekday morning. After finally finding parking (a huge pain), we were seated outside (no wait!) under an awning type thing. It was a little windy and loud, but not too bad, and the weather was nice that day.We both ordered French toast--I had the famed crunchy French toast and she had one with strawberry yogurt. When I tried the yogurt French toast, the sensation of warm yogurt was weird to me, though taste-wise it was good. I loved the textural contrast of the crunchy French toast, as well as the vanilla sauce it came with. Just be warned that it doesn't make good leftovers, despite my many attempts to reheat it using different methods :(

Reviews.Author: John-Michael C.
Reviews.Content: Best Mutha F-N Pancake ever!  You eat it and you understand why they named it a pancake.  Phenomenal!

Reviews.Author: Denise K.
Reviews.Content: They quoted me a 35 minute wait and we actually only waited 15 minutes. I like that they under-promise and over-deliver. I really, really liked my crunchy french toast. They were generous with the blueberries, strawberries and bananas. The vanilla bean sauce was a nice compliment and substitute for maple syrup - not too sweet. And my french toast came out hot. I spread a little butter all over my french toast triangles and it melted perfectly. I also enjoyed my green tea and honey.Service was friendly, albeit a little slow or non-existent. But... still enjoyable. Metered parking, pay via credit card.

Reviews.Author: Michael C.
Reviews.Content: Arrived early ish (9am on a sat) and waited 10 minutes on a peaceful LA street.I sat, I ate and loved.I would definitely go back. Loved the vibe and food.I had a typical breakfast but got a side of their crispy French toast which was pretty amazing. I don't normally like the cornflake French toast thing either!

Reviews.Author: Kimberly M.
Reviews.Content: My first visit, wasn't the best, but I'll still give them a five star rating. I honestly didn't like the first dish I ordered. Something that started with an "L", omelette with salmon and cheese, paired with toast, and home fries. It wasn't bad, just wasn't exceptionally great. However I did order the crunchy French toast after, an was very pleased. The server seemed really nice...to other tables,  but I guess being alone there wasn't much to say to me? I also saw he was repeatedly triple sat, so I didn't take his lack of interaction to heart, after all he did get my order right, and being a server in the past, I understood being "in the weeds". The only thing I wish they had is alcohol, solely for the purpose of pairing an entree with a mimosa, but the fresh squeezed orange juice is pretty refreshing and good enough. All in all, definitely do recommend this place.

Reviews.Author: Alex T.
Reviews.Content: I came across Blu Jam Cafe completely by chance but it's now one of my favorite breakfast/brunch spots in LA.  The location is in the heart of Melrose and I love stopping by whenever I'm in the area.  I rarely have any parking or lines issues for that matter.  I guess I've either been lucky or been coming off peak times because I've had very pleasant seating experiences here.For a Cafe that has such high reviews, awards, & glowing public opinion; I find Blu Jam to be unpretentious and eager to please.  The food usually tastes divine.  I'm serious when I say I've enjoyed everything I've ordered here from their french toast to their salads.  Their offerings feature creative presentation, good portions, and fresh ingredients.  The menu provides a lot of choices, especially for vegetarians & the health conscious.  The service can be a mixed bag, especially when they are busy or if you're seated on the patio.  Still, servers are quite good at attending to your needs when they do get to you.  Coffee choices are also great here which is a make or break for cafes.  If you're in the mood for delicious breakfast/brunch around this area then look no further than Blu Jam Cafe!

Reviews.Author: Maxie A.
Reviews.Content: Amazing breakfast spot! Must try the florentine benedict & crunchy French toast! Their coffee is also great! Only downside is parking is difficult unless you valet & the wait can be long since you get a flow of people around 9am.

Reviews.Author: Lucy Z.
Reviews.Content: You can definitely distinguish a superb restaurant when they seasonally switch up their menu!  Sally Z. recommended the salmon hash, which I really intended to order, but it was not on their menu. Womp Womp.My wait was about 20 minutes, at around 1pm, which was just enough time to stroll around Melrose.What we ordered: Blu Jam Benedict & Steak Hash.I think celebrities come here too.. I think we sat next to one, but I had no idea who he was. LOLLLL

Reviews.Author: Jamie K.
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed eating here with all my heart. My friend and I ordered the French Toast and the Spicy Tex Mex Tofu Hash. Both were a good combination of sweet and savory. The French Toast had a very unique taste to it. It was crunchy, as if it was coated with frosted corn flakes. It also had a bits of freshly cut strawberries, blue berries and bananas. The Tex Mex was well...a mix of tofu, onions potatoes, salsa and tasted like a stir fry. I recommend you come here during the weekdays so you don't have to wait to be seated for hours. The weekends are packed and you won't get seated until your entire party is there. Overall, this was a great experience and a gem in Melrose!

Reviews.Author: Justin B.
Reviews.Content: Slightly overrated but enjoyable brunch experience. We orderedFrench toast:  crispy coating and light, probably our favorite dishBreakfast carbonara:  poached eggs over risotto. Risotto was a little dry and ratio of egg to risotto a little off. Pretty good though. Breakfast sandwich:  too much going on here, no one really loved itBreakfast quesadilla:  remarkably greasy and soggy, also not everyone's favorite. Overall a solid place for brunch but with so many surrounding options and no bloody marys or mimosas I'm not sure it's worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Ambar C.
Reviews.Content: Three words: worth the wait! Yes, you will wait, but you will love it. It's a very small establishment, with seating for (I'm guessing) no more than 50 people. I rather enjoy the size, though. It's intimate. It's cozy. You get a lot of attention from the staff because they don't have as many people to attend to.They have a full juice bar, and they are famous for their French toast and their eggs benedict. As I'm not a fan of cinnamon, I rarely ever try French toast, though I was really tempted this time. My friends ordered the "crunchy" French toast with cornflakes on the outside and fresh berries. It made me want to take a huge bite, but I had to save room for my eggs benedict! So glad I did.The Blu Jam eggs benedict has ham and bacon on an English muffin, and it is seriously delicious. Dare I say it? Phenomenal. Quite possibly one of the best benedicts ever. Yes, both ham AND bacon. The bacon is crispy, but not too think and not burnt. It's the kind of bacon I have dreams about. The hollandaise is fantastic; it has the perfect consistency and flavor. Every aspect of that benedict was spot on. I will most definitely be back here!I got super lucky with parking. I nabbed a spot on the street, directly in front of BJC. The meters don't turn on until 11am on Sunday, so I got my first 40 or so minutes for free before I had to run outside and make sure I didn't get yet another LA parking ticket (so ruthless!). There was plenty of parking along Melrose and the nearby side streets. We waited quite some time to be seated, but the staff was very nice about it and kept us posted as to where we were in line. Our waiter was very friendly and welcomed us very warmly. He was attentive and, at the same time, let us eat. Overall, I am very very happy with Blu Jam Cafe.

Reviews.Author: Big Baby Jesus C.
Reviews.Content: Brunch day after Thanksgiving.  Best chilaquiles I've ever had really hit the spot.  Service was spotty.  Way too much time went by between first and second cup of coffee.

Reviews.Author: Brittany M.
Reviews.Content: The best breakfast experience I've ever had.  Being a big foodie, I love trying new restaurants. However my boyfriend and I being indecisive people usually end up going to the same ones (Toast and the Griddle which are both awesome).  But I had seen this under "LA's best breakfast" and who wouldn't want to try the best breakfast in LA?The man out front (not sure if he was a host or the owner) was incredible. I told him it was our first time and he was so excited about it and treated us like royalty. Even though it was a full restaurant, it felt like we were the only people there. His passion for the food was incredible. Then he gave us an amazing waitress who recommended jalapenos with my order. It was fantastic. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Megan R.
Reviews.Content: I recently came here with an out-of-town friend. I read several Yelp reviews looking for an amazing Sunday brunch experience for us. When we arrived at Blu Jam Cafe at10:30m on a Sunday we immediately put our party of 2 on the list and were told it would be 20-30 minutes- or less. No problem.  We stood and waited for 40 minutes- which is fine, people tend to take their time on Sunday. We were seated by a friendly waitress out on the front patio which faces the long line of folks still waiting to be seated. We each ordered the California Omelet (avocado/bacon etc.) and an order of their signature crunchy french toast to share. I also ordered a fresh squeezed grapefruit/cucumber/ginger juice. The juice came out quickly and was delicious, I gulped it down immediately. The omelet came next and was tasty and fluffy. We were very excited to try our order of Crunchy French Toast since so many yelpers raved about it. When it came out, it looked dry. We drizzled a little of the oily looking whitish yellow (vanilla/butter?) syrup that comes with the toast, on top of the toast. This didn't do much to improve the moistness. It wasn't "crunchy" as much as it was "dry," "rubbery", and pretty darn "unimpressive" And frankly, the white/yellow syrup got a little more gross looking the longer we sat there. Three stars for Blu Jam because it was fine, but not amazing.

Reviews.Author: Awakened S.
Reviews.Content: Not good. At all. 1. Food- typical. Granola from a box--as per the waiter who said he saw them pouring it from a box.  Not fresh or homemade. Meh. Same with the oatmeal. Green juices- lackluster. 2. Service- waits for life. Granola served without milk. 10 minute wait for missing items, etc. Oh, and the server yelled at me when I tapped him on the back (his back was turned from me, super light tap just to let him know I needed something when he was finished). He turned and said, "Can't you see I'm answering HER question?!" Totally rude-- I wasn't trying to interrupt, I just didn't want him to miss me and wait another 10-15 minutes. Ugh.  Server never checked up on us to bring the check. LOOOOONNNNGGGG waits. 3. Ambiance- whatever. Typical Melrose. Nothing special. No magic. Bleh.  Nope.

Reviews.Author: Kwon C.
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite breakfast spots in Los Angeles. If you're in the area, definitely check this place out. You have to wait a little because this place gets packed usually, but it is definitely worth the wait. They're known for their fluffy French toast, but other food are pretty good as well. Everything we ordered were delicious, I don't recall anything being bland. People here were really friendly and service was great. I highly recommend this place if you're searching for nice breakfast restaurant near Melrose.

Reviews.Author: Ngoc V.
Reviews.Content: Not sure what the hype is about this place. Food didn't amaze me, it was not better than Hugo's, and more importantly I could not enjoy my usual Bloody Mary with brunch since they don't serve alcohol!  No parking lot available and definitely not worth the hour long wait!!

Reviews.Author: Kenneth M.
Reviews.Content: One of the top 3 breakfast spots in LA PERIOD! Crunchy french toast served w/vanilla bean sauce instead of syrup! Their scrambles are amazing. Kind of a wait which is the only drawback I have about this spot and it almost made me drop them down to 4 stars but after eating here a half a dozen times it's worth the wait. When family or friends visit this is where my wife & I take them for breakfast. They actually have an a la carte tapas style dinner that's also great. My wife and I have been for dinner once and loved it. I'd recommend breakfast because that's why we first fell in love w/them but they're a great option for dinner as well.

Reviews.Author: Necey T.
Reviews.Content: Food: The Crunchy French Toast w/fresh fruit on top was fantastic! I typically prefer syrup, but the vanilla sauce that came with it was very tasty. (you are able to ask for syrup if you are not a fan of vanilla). The bacon was cooked perfectly (I like the fact it was a little well done). The person I was with ordered a custom fresh juice and coffee, and she enjoyed both.Menu: The menu had a variety of different brunch and lunch options (ie sandwiches, egg variations, etc), I cannot wait to come back and try some of the egg plates (ie mac and cheese mixed with eggs and bacon) Host/Waiting Time: It was two of us and we went on a Sunday around 1:30p and there was a 50-60 minute wait. We checked with the hosts a few times about the seating time, and they were very nice and patient with our questions. We ended up browsing the variety of clothing shops within a block of this cafe and time flew right by.Service: The service was not the best, but was good. It was pretty busy so we had to track down our waiter a couple times, but he was nice and helpful. They had plenty of staff on hand which was convenient since the waiter had his hands full (typical for popular brunch spots).Ambiance: You have the option of sitting outside or inside. My party sat inside and it wasn't too loud and was a nice setting to catch up with friends. They also have some cool posters/art work for sale on the walls.Pricing: We spent $20-25 each (including tax & tip) to get food, a side of meat, and a fresh squeezed drink.Overall: I will be back to try another plate...I just might bring a pre-meal snack to hold me over for the long wait.

Reviews.Author: Sara S.
Reviews.Content: I feel bad, because once I saw the giant line/wait for Blu Jam at Sunday Brunch, I got my hopes way up. I thought, this place must be AMAZING if all these people are willing to wait. Well, like all hype, it didn't really live up to it. The food was good, and the service was great, but for over an hour wait, I was expecting some fireworks. (The wait was long because I was with a group of six people. Don't go with a group, they only appeared to have two tables to accommodate larger parties)The drip coffee is strong (yay!) and the servings are huge. I had a pile of eggs that lasted me for two extra meals! No alcohol. So keep that in mind when deciding on standing in that line. You won't get rewarded with a bloody mary or mimosa here.

Reviews.Author: Nicole B.
Reviews.Content: Came to this place on a Saturday morning to have brunch with a couple of friends and there was a pretty long line to eat here. We waited about 30 minutes but we just browsed the thrift shops while waiting and it didn't take that long. I appreciated that they had water outside to give to thirsty customers since it was hot out!The service was okay. I went when it was packed, so it was kind of loud and hard to hear my friends talking. The server was nice, but forgettable. Either I was too engrossed in my food, or I only saw the server when we ordered, got our food, and paid for the check. I don't remember being asked if my food was okay and I think I had to catch someone to refill my water. Maybe it was because it was so busy, but I think their servers could have been a little more friendly and attentive.On to the food, I ordered a smoked salmon eggs benedict with their signature french toast to split with my friend. It was plenty of food for both of us. The smoked salmon eggs benedict was perfectly cooked! However, the french toast was definitely the hero. I actually don't like breakfast food, but this place has changed me into a believer. The french toast was warm, crispy, flakey, and the vanilla bean dip that came with it was lovely. It wasn't too sweet which I liked and the fresh berries that came with it really brought the plate together. The food itself deservers 5 stars!Overall, this place is definitely a gem on melrose for breakfast foods! Since I'm on a college budget, I'd probably only come here with good company instead of being a regular, but I would recommend it to people looking for a good brunch place (:

Reviews.Author: Kennedy T.
Reviews.Content: Delicious breakfast and awesome service. I ordered the eggs Benedict and I couldn't even finish my plate. Food came out pretty quick. All of my friends that I came with had also ordered some amazing food that I got to try. Crunchy French toast was super legit!!!! Can't wait to go back. They also have a small patio out front and you can bring your 4 legged friend. My only small complaint is they only have 2 one person restrooms and the place is busy so use the restroom and wash your hands before arrival.

Reviews.Author: Michelle C.
Reviews.Content: YUM. The coffee alone is delicious. Everything else is bonus.

Reviews.Author: laura lee l.
Reviews.Content: Went there for brunch, the "crispy french toast" seemed to be the item to get. Everyone around me was at least sharing an order. I am currently on a mission to eat healthy, so I had the protein scramble, it was yummy, but easily enough for 2. I would recommend sharing as the portions are HUGE. Service was friendly and the crowd young and hip.

Reviews.Author: Jenny C.
Reviews.Content: This place has been bookmarked for a while, and I FINALLY got to try it over the weekend.Got their crunchy french toast and blu jam benedict. Crunchy french toast is really good, has that soft crunch too it. I think it would be better if it was crunchier. Also, I wish there were more fruits on top. Vanilla bean sauce is delicious. Not overly sweet. You can just drink it. This would make a good appetizer with a group of people, I thought it was a little too much for two people.Blu jam benedict was delicious. The eggs were perfectly poached and I love their hollandaise sauce. This with the Tabanero sauce....perfect!Overall, food and service is good. Wait wasn't too bad, and parking isn't bad if you go in the morning. One thing I didn't like was that it was a bit crowded where I was sitting. I felt bad because I elbowed the waiter's butt like twice haha.

Reviews.Author: Alex H.
Reviews.Content: Licked my plate clean! Service was so friendly and attentive. Great healthy protein options, but the real star is their corn flake crusted French toast. It comes with a vanilla bean dipping sauce and just melts in your mouth. Get here early so you don't have to wait too long.

Reviews.Author: Tina P.
Reviews.Content: I came here with a coworker after our hike at Runyon Canyon. It was fairly crowded at 9am on a Saturday, come after 10 you'll be waiting for awhile. This was a cute little place with a few outdoor seating, perfect if you want to take your dog. I ordered the Blu Jam eggs benedict which came with roasted potatoes. It was quite good, I just wish there was more hollandaise sauce! But the potatoes were excellent!! Really really good!! It was reasonably prices and service was great! What more can you ask for??Overall: I would definitely come back, great food and even better service! meter parking only which is a bummer.

Reviews.Author: Chris M.
Reviews.Content: Delicious food! Distinct high quality. Good vanilla latte. You can't go wrong. Blue Jam Bendedict and a must.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer S.
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast/brunch place!I came on a weekday afternoon around 1:30 pm, and was seated right away. Which is great, since my friend and I were starving! The inside decor has a nice vibe to it, and the location was definitely bigger than I expected based on other reviewers. Maybe I'm too used to super tiny small establishments over in Little Tokyo. Definitely count on being almost entirely too close to the tables next to you, but that's pretty much expected in LA and didn't bother me really.I got the Loxex (scrambled eggs with smoked salmon, chives, onions, tomatoes, and brie cheese). It was super good and a huge portion that I almost didn't finish it all. And, they definitely don't skimp on the salmon. My friend got the french toast (how could we not?!) and I managed to snag a bite of it. Delicious and definitely worth all the hype.Service was great and we didn't feel rushed out like how it is at some other restaurants. Overall, definitely someplace I'd come back to have a nice brunch and chat with friends. Oh, and there's plenty of (free!) street parking, which is always a bonus.

Reviews.Author: Bryan B.
Reviews.Content: Always packed and always good. Make sure you come at off hours if you don't want to wait too long. The French toast is impeccable and the rest of the food is good as well. The service is great and it's pretty inexpensive.

Reviews.Author: Victor L.
Reviews.Content: Like most breakfast and brunch only places Blu Jam is only open until 4pm. I was lucky enough to get here in time to try their popular Crunchy French Toast.Wowzers they give you a lot of food. I could only finish half of my french toast, but what I ate was pretty spectacular. It had fresh fruit, the french toast was crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside, and the vanilla sauce combined everything together with the perfect amount of sweetness. The only problem was that I found parts of the cereal crust was kind of chewy. Probably overcooked. Not a big deal though.Next time I want to come back and try the breakfast. Lots of healthy options here.

Reviews.Author: Jessabelle R.
Reviews.Content: 4.5 stars. Chocolate banana iced tea!French toast sensational! Crunchy cornflake batter, custard like moist bread inside, dusted powdered sugar & finished juicy heavenly berries and accompanied with vanilla creme anglaise. Bacon cheesy carbonara risotto with sweet peas, extra cheesy, pouched egg on top and green basil oil drizzle. Only complaint was it needed more of green basil oil, as it sent it to euphoric sexual levels of pleasure.

Reviews.Author: Bethany S.
Reviews.Content: Came to Blu Jam for a breakfast date with the bf around 10:30 on a friday morning. The wait was shorter than I expected; about 20 min. Breakfast quesadilla was AWESOME! So much cheesy goodness. The salsa and  sour cream went so well with this dish. The ingredients were super fresh. It was my first time having a breakfast quesadilla and I just sdkfj;sadfkj;nomnomnom. Smoked Salmon eggs benedict were very good too. The potatoes that came with our dishes were really salty in some areas though.Servers were friendly and efficient. Seating's a bit crowded. I'd probably come back to try their famous french toast!

Reviews.Author: Arie K.
Reviews.Content: Quaint little cafe with good eatery. We had the french toast and the risotto. The french toast came with a vanilla bean dipping sauce and fresh fruits, all of which were the perfect amount of sweet; no sugary overload. The risotto boasted a lot of flavor with the pesto and cream going on. I would definitely recommend the dish! Service was alright, however. I felt like the waitress was a little overbearing at times, and we were seated right in front of the counter/register which was a bit awkward and dampened the ambiance. Otherwise, everything was good. Interior was very decorated with plants and pictures, so if you're a person who doesn't like a lot on or along the walls, this isn't the place for you. Street parking is a little difficult.

Reviews.Author: Steve X.
Reviews.Content: Great french press, great breakfast wrap, great service and food overall.  The problem is that they are always busy and you will have to WAIT a long time.  The place inside is average for a cafe, which means it can NOT handle crowds.  Personally, I'm not a 'wait' type so I doubt I'll be back during lunch or weekends but I don't want to hold it against the business.  They were excellent when they could have been stuck up, like many businesses that get big-headed once a second location opens.

Reviews.Author: Susie C.
Reviews.Content: Great food. Minus 2 stars because of the parking and a long wait.Ok... so I went to Blu Jam again today. Great great food. Parking wasn't that bad. And I only waited for 15 minutes. Four stars.

Reviews.Author: Travis W.
Reviews.Content: I had their flagship dish The Crunchy French Toast and I was greeted by a lackluster flavor. Maybe they could use Capt'n Crunch instead of Corn Flakes as their batter. The grilled cheese packed a pound and a half of cheese so it overpowered the bread.The location is quite a trip from the freeway, so if you are not in the area plan on packing your GPS and a movie for the car- you'll also need it as you wait to get seated, for the wait can get long.The establishment is beautiful with the dark brick walls, the vaulted wooden ceilng, and the earth tone paint.

Reviews.Author: Tram D.
Reviews.Content: Long wait for two . 1.5 hrs on a Sunday. :/:/ not worth it. First and last time.By the time we got to our table, we both were very HANGRY (combination of hungry and angry) and it was way too crowded. BF and I ordered a blu jam benedict, steak hash, and a vanilla latte. My eggs benedict was not oozing, as it should be. I didn't want to send it back because I didn't want to wait any longer.  The tables were way too close to each other, and not enough table space for the plates we ordered.. Never EVER going back. It wasn't even that good. -_-

Reviews.Author: Phil B.
Reviews.Content: I had been wanting to come here for a while and finally got a chance to try this place. Luckily I didn't come during peak hours so I didn't have to wait.  I ordered the steak hash.  It was pretty tasty although a little pricey ($18).  My friend ordered the Rancheros which was also pretty good.The service here was prompt and friendly.  I'd definitely like to come back and try some other items on the menu as there appeared to be a lot of tempting options.

Reviews.Author: Wendy C.
Reviews.Content: One word: PERFECT.Many words:Boy, am I glad the line at Griddle Cafe (yelp.com/biz/griddle-caf…) brought me here instead! My friend and I called BJC to check how long the wait for two would be (this was at noon), and the host said about 20 minutes. We got there in five minutes, parked on a residential street around the corner, and were seated immediately! No wait at all? Already off to a great start.The friendly waiter immediately served us iced water and handed us some menus. He graciously returned in a few minutes and asked whether we were ready. We were still deciding amongst the many, many options, though. So when I signaled for his attention a few minutes later, he immediately caught it and came over, ready to take our order. I liked this guy! So prompt, so friendly, and so prepared. We chose the California omelet with a side of fruit salad (can choose between mixed greens salad and fruit salad; also choice of rye, sourdough, or whole wheat toast) and the crunchy French toast (per Yelpers' recommendations). In under 10 minutes, our food came out. Immediately, I was stunned by the beautiful presentation of the French toast (cut into triangles, each piece separated from the next by banana and strawberry slices and a handful of blueberries) and the neat (there's really no other word for it) presentation of the omelet and its accompaniment. At this point, we asked the waiter to just leave both dishes in the middle (so friend and I could share), and he already knew to bring us extra plates! So on top of everything.For the next half hour, we indulged in breakfast/ brunch heaven. Famished and excited, I dug into the golden omelet and ravished in the wonderful bits of bacon and chunks of avocado as well as the oozing tomato basil and other sauces within this piece of, well, heaven. Then I tried the crunchy French toast, which is kind of like fried French toast, really, but considerably less oily than one would expect! I'm proud to confirm that the taste of the dish did not betray the looks of it. The crunchy French toast was beautiful--inside and out. I loved that the egg wasn't overdone, that the French toast wasn't oily, that the fruit was fresh; that the wait was short to nonexistent, that the service was awesome, that the prices were decent. For a total of $28 (excluding tip), the two of us attained total satisfaction in both food and service departments. I was so happy that I didn't even mind being 50 minutes late for work and paying $11 for parking afterward. I absolutely cannot wait to come back! Everything about this experience was just plain perfect.

Reviews.Author: Nicole U.
Reviews.Content: I love their Crunchy French Toast! Outside is crispy & the inside is super soft & warm. I need to get it again.This place is very popular so expect a wait, especially during breakfast/lunch..

Reviews.Author: Kimberly H.
Reviews.Content: You have to find street parking, which can be especially difficult on weekends. During the week, be careful of streets where parking is restricted due to street cleaning. The restaurant itself is easy to find. The interior is quaint. Their unique blend of coffees are really good. But if you don't like your coffee to be too sweet, the organic coffee is worth trying. Service can be good or bad, depending. I had to wait quite a bit for a refill of my coffee and didn't really appreciate the server telling me he hadn't forgotten with an attitude that I should chill when my mug had been empty for quite a while.I had the Rancheros, which was amazing. The display of the crispy french toast was more impressive than the actual taste. It came in a heated plate with butter and sauce. It was just okay. A bit on the crispy side, but not one of the best and definitely nothing to crave. My friend had the European, which is a sandwich with black forest ham and melted brie. I felt there was too much bread and not enough ham.I'd definitely go back for the Rancheros and the coffee.

Reviews.Author: Abban L.
Reviews.Content: Been trying to make it here while avoiding a 1.5+ hour wait for the past year, finally succeeded. The secret: Fridays at 10:52 am. The pesto bacon risotto topped with two eggs -- can we just have a moment of appreciative silence for the ingenuity of this culinary invention? :) -- was good, as expected. Good, but not sumptuous. The rice was distractingly overcooked, which made for very hard and dry grains. Nevertheless, the concept and saucing deserves applause. Service approached ... appalling. We witnessed a service staff yell at the top of his lungs hateful, judgmental profanities against a homeless person who came near the patrons outside. Maybe he (the server) was trying to demonstrate superior service by "protecting" customers, but the way he did it was so unkind it put a huge damper on my image of Blue Jam Cafe.

Reviews.Author: Beatriz U.
Reviews.Content: If you're coming on a Sunday (probably Saturday too) after 10am, be prepared to wait about an hour! This place gets PACKED, and even if you only have a party of 2, you're still gonna have to wait. My friend and I ended up waiting for a while, but there are some cool shops (some closed on Sundays) along the same block.I got the Florentine eggs benedict which comes with spinach, sun-dried tomatoes, mushrooms and brie and hollandaise. It was delicious! I almost always order some type of eggs benedict when I come to a breakfast place and I especially love it when restaurants have variations of it! The sun-dried tomatoes added a wonderful tangy contrast to the creaminess of the cheese and hollandaise. I thought there was a bit too much hollandaise, but I easily scraped some of it off. The english muffin was good and the runny yolk was perfect. The "crispy" potatoes that it came with was also delicious, though some were not crispy at all.  My friend got some omelette that was also good, but we both decided it was nothing special and something we could make at home. Service was great - I got my constant water refills and our server was very attentive. They did forget my friend's toast and jam and gave it to us halfway through the meal, though it was understandable since the place was PACKED. It has a bit of a hipster vibe and there were lots of foreigners there, which means it must be quite the hip spot to be on a Sunday morning. I'll definitely come again (though on a weekday or before 9am to avoid the long wait) and try the crunchy french toast but I' not sure I can become a regular.

Reviews.Author: Jamie E.
Reviews.Content: pretty good for a breakfast-brunch kinda place!2 people, saturday 2pm.before you head out this way, be prepared - parking and traffic on a saturday in this area can suck huge donkey balls.  so if you're not up to the task and you're going to be in a bad mood by the time you get here, just stay in.  this place is worth the effort so put your adult pants on.  there is usually good street parking north and south of melrose in the residential areas, so just check those out. the wait at 2pm was quoted to be 45-50 min.  it took about 35 minutes.  but they are good about cleaning up tables and getting people seated.  this is what we've ordered:- vanilla latte: comes with whipped cream.  very sweet, so beware if you're not into sweet coffee.- french press coffee- brunch carbonara: risotto with bacon, peas and parmesan topped with 2 perfectly poached eggs.  delicious, large portion, filling, and a different take on breakfast!  $13- crunchy french toast: it's like a dessert.  delicious.  they should have a patent on it.  i think marston's in pasadena does something similar. $13- brunch burger: SUPER GIANT burger.  it's pretty amazing, comes with potatoes.  be hungry if you're going to order this one.  $15service was prompt and friendly.  waters were refilled without us asking, which is always nice.  it's in a great area, very walkable and tons of unique shops on that stretch of melrose.  definitely make a few hours out of it.

Reviews.Author: Kate H.
Reviews.Content: Oh. My. Gracious.    Uh. Mazing.  Food is unreal.  I got the "Signature DishCrunchy French Toast"  which is French Toast with crunchy corn flakes all over and they served it with fresh strawberries and vanilla bean sauce for $13.  It melted in my mouth.  My boyfriend got the California Omelette with chicken sausage instead of bacon-sacrilegious, I know- but it was delicious.  If I were a savory breakfast eater, I would definitely get that next time.  The vanilla lattes were good too, not amazing but definitely tasty.  The atmosphere is laid back too, so I didn't feel like a loser coming in with my running clothes on still.  Amazing food that came out quickly and hot and delicious.  Nice service and atmosphere.  Will absolutely go back.

Reviews.Author: Paolo M.
Reviews.Content: hands down the best EGG SANDWICH I have ever had in my life. service rocks!!! shall return....

Reviews.Author: Victoria M.
Reviews.Content: Love Love Love the food and fresh juice! Always clean and service is great. The only reason why I didn't give it 5 stats is because the wait is a bit long.

Reviews.Author: Michelle L.
Reviews.Content: Brunch is a great thing. I've heard a lot of good things about this breakfast joint and was looking forward to eating here quite a bit. I've heard things about the line being long and when my boyfriend and I came here, the line was a good 45 minutes. After eating here, I think I can say that the line is so long because the service here is SUPER slow.I ordered the Mocha latte which came with a really cute coffee art and their drinks didn't disappoint. We ordered the Blu Jam Benedict, Kamil's Famous Goulash Soup, and the Gourmet Burger. Our orders took FOREVER to come out and they forgot about our soup so we had to ask for that later. The soup itself was pretty good though. I appreciated the fact that the poached egg was perfect on my eggs benedict and the potatoes that came out with them were perfect. I found the bacon to be just OVER THE TOP salty. Not good. My boyfriend's burger was good too and his also came with some potatoes. I think this place is seriously overhyped. Everything tasted good but everything was also very forgettable. 3/5

Reviews.Author: Andy K.
Reviews.Content: French toast. What more is there to add? It's been too long since I've been so I will need to go back soon. Parking and the wait sucks but that's to be expected.

Reviews.Author: Kimberly K.
Reviews.Content: I came here a couple times for brunch with some girl friends. Both times I've gotten the crunch french toast - which btw is delicious. The toast is not soggy, I love the fresh fruit,  and the added corn flakes add a pleasant contrast of texture. Not sure why, but the second time I ordered it was soggier, so I took a star off for inconsistency. Love their fresh squeezed juices. I really enjoy their flavor profiles and freshness of their ingredients. Overall one of my favorite brunch places in the LA area!

Reviews.Author: R C.
Reviews.Content: Food is 5 starsLine is -1 star

Reviews.Author: Eileen K.
Reviews.Content: I love Melrose. The goal was to get here by 10am. of course, things like that dont always go according to plan, especially in the morning..but i was able to make it out by a little after 10:30, and there was already a line! the wait for 2 people was 30-40min, but with all the cute vintage stores around the cafe, time goes by pretty quick! i was hungry so i had a scoop of ice cream at Neveux Artisan Creamery a few doors down (review to follow) and by the time i was done browsing and made my way over, there was only 10 min left!You Must Get: Crunchy French Toast. thank you yelpers, this was definitely one of the best french toasts ive ever tasted!! Usually, i dont really even like french toast bc its usually really thick, heavy...but this one was actually really really light, crunchy, thin, and with the fresh strawberries, bananas, and blueberries, made a great light brunch with my coffee!! I don't usually eat my breakfast with syrup, but the vanilla bean sauce was really good too, not too sweet and heavy. I would so go back for this!!! we also got the Migas: "Spicy combination of eggs scrambled with jalapeños, chipotle, beef chorizo sausage, red bell peppers, tortilla chips and mozzarella, topped with homemade tomato salsa, served with corn tortillas and potatoes" (straight from their menu lol) This one was good, but it could have been more spicy! and more salsa would have really freshened it up. I really liked the presentation and the flavors, not too heavy so great for brunch. Ah....im thinking about the french toast again....

Reviews.Author: Jennifer H.
Reviews.Content: This is my all time favorite cafe!! They're able to make all the foods I don't normally like taste good! I always leave wanting more!!I came here for my birthday brunch. I ordered a mocha latte, even though I don't drink coffee, because i've been really into coffee art. After seeing all the creative and exquisite coffee art in yelp photos, I was intrigued with what icon my mocha latte would come out with. Alas, it was a detailed, radiant sun smiling at me! What a perfect gift for my birthday, this totally brightened up my day! I don't know who that barista was, but he/she is very talented! It's the most detailed coffee art i've seen! Take a look! (s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com…)I'm normally not a French toast fan, but after trying their crunchy French toast (only available on wknds), I'm hooked! It's coated with corn flakes and served with fresh fruit and vanilla sauce on the side so it doesn't get soggy. Brilliance! Every time I visit, it's hard not to order this because it's just THAT good.On my second visit, I tried the Mazatlan Shrimp Scramble. There was juicy, succulent shrimps scrambled with egg, chives, avocado, peppers, tomatoes. What made this dish was the spicy chipotle kick! KA-POW to my taste buds and I keep eating until I finish to get my revenge. muahahah! Sadly, this dish is no longer on the menu. Please put it back!!!My friend's order of Kamil's breakfast also blew me away! The description on the menu did not sound good to me at all since I don't like bacon, macaroni and ham. This dish was practically that with egg, chives and cheddar. The cheddar macaroni was baked just right: not hard and not soupy. I also liked that the bacon bits weren't hard and the flavor wasn't overpowering. I can't stop thinking about this dish for months! I will definitely be ordering this when I return!! Wait for me!!!Blu jam now serves their all day breakfast and lunch menu during dinner hours!! HIP-HIP-HOORAY!!!

Reviews.Author: Nicole B.
Reviews.Content: I think Blu Jam is probably my favorite breakfast spot in the West Hollywood/Mid City area.  ALTHOUGH I am really sad that they no longer serve mimosas.  (Why Blue Jam, WHY?!?!?)I know, I know....the wait can be pretty long after 10 am on the weekends, but there is a reason folks.  Their food is top notch.  I always finish my plate clean.  My favorite is the eggs benedict with the mushrooms, spinach, sun dried tomatoes and brie.  UGH.  It's so incredible.  They always poach the eggs perfectly, the hollandaise sauce is on point and the side salad I always get with it has the perfect amount of dressing.I love you Blu Jam, please bring back your beer and wine so I may love you harder.

Reviews.Author: asuzak H.
Reviews.Content: Great place for breakfast! Must have Steak & Eggs.... my favorite. Quality of steak is very good and very flavorful.Crape with Berries is also good but so big! It is good for 4 people to share as a dessert after your meal.Service is quick and friendly. Go early because this place gets busy after 10am.

Reviews.Author: Sally Z.
Reviews.Content: A hearty breakfast from Blu Jam really gets you going!I ordered their Salmon hash, which was huge!! And so, so, so, soooo good!!Oh my ancestors, be ready for a wait..

Reviews.Author: Breanne T.
Reviews.Content: BluJam is my FAVORITE brunch place in Los Angeles!  (That's saying a lot because brunch is my absolute favorite meal!)  My two favorite dishes are the Norwegian Benedict and the Crunch French Toast.  If you're a big salty sweet balance kind of person, order one of each with a friend and share!  It can get a little crowded on the weekends, so either go early or plan to wait at least 30-45 minutes.  It's worth it though, I promise!

Reviews.Author: Jocelyn Y.
