Reviews.Content: One of my favorite places to go for breakfast!& we sat right next to Steven Yeun from the Walking Dead! If he likes it, it has to be good! Haha.But seriously, the chilaqueles & crunchy french toast were both amazing (:

Reviews.Author: J.G. J.
Reviews.Content: A MUST, MUST, MUST IS THE FRENCH TOAST! Delicious!I have no idea what everyone is talking about, do NOT get the Roma Via Paris. It was bland. Not much flavor, I do like flavorful food and this was not. The toast was also very hard, but the environment was trendy and the servers were really attentive and everyone in my party enjoyed their food. Don't leave without eating the French toast, a table can share one. Enjoy and a must go!

Reviews.Author: Ellen C.
Reviews.Content: I don't think this place is overhyped at all. I love how they have multiple breakfast selections..would definitely come back to try the other stuff. I like how it's a bit more modern than say..griddle cafe, less contemporary than BLD. Came here Saturday morning at 8am right when it opened. By the time we left, it was 9:30am and it was maybe at 75% capacity. The service was attentive and friendly. Got 2 entrees, side of bacon, 2 vanilla lattes (which were delicious) and the total was about $40. A bit on the steeper side but expected as it's in west LA. I think my favorite brunch spot is still BLD. It was definitely easy to find street parking right in front (because we arrived so early) or even on the side streets.

Reviews.Author: Allen K.
Reviews.Content: Very popular because a lot of people know how good it is. Usually have to wait around 25 minutes for a table, but it's worth the wait.The florentine benedict is something worth trying, as well as the french toast. The food really hits the spot and provides for an excellent brunch. Service is very prompt as well. Can get very crowded inside, but I recommend sitting outside on a nice sunny day if possible.

Reviews.Author: Kathryn E.
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best breakfast I have ever had (trust me, I am not exaggerating). The eggs benedict and crunchy french toast were both to die for. How I wish I didn't live so far away.

Reviews.Author: Kat Z.
Reviews.Content: I really don't understand why this place is always packed. Their food is waaay overpriced for the quality and flavor of what you're getting. There are better brunch spots just a few doors down from this place, with much better prices.The food here isn't bad, but for the amount of people you see fighting to get into this place and for all it's rave reviews, it's a bit disappointing.

Reviews.Author: Alison P.
Reviews.Content: I'm a HUGE breakfast lover so when i know i'm in the LA area, i love yelping for breakfast spots. This is a spot recommended by a friend of mine. We ordered: Love their Crunchy French Toast to share: Egg brioche dipped in batter, rolled in crunchy corn flakes and grilled to perfection, topped with fresh bananas and berries, served with vanilla bean sauce 12.95Migas: Spicy combination of eggs scrambled with jalapeños, chipotle, beef chorizo sausage, red bell peppers, tortilla chips and mozzarella, topped with homemade tomato salsa, served with corn tortillas and potatoes 12.95 TOTALLY love this dish. it was spicy with just enough of a kick. Simply Eggs: Three eggs fried, scrambled or poached, accompanied by crispy red potatoes and toast 8.95 It was good but didnt stand out. it was just good old classic breakfastService was excellent. Waiters were really friendly when they first sat us. Very attentive and funny. would def come back.

Reviews.Author: Niki A.
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to breakfast at this place.Great ambiance and service, I just wish the food was better! I had the eggs bohemia which was ok. Coffee was good! Next time I will try one of their specialties

Reviews.Author: Rena D.
Reviews.Content: A nice brunch place, however, it can get crowded on the weekends. I usually come during an "off" time such as early in the morning around 9am on a Sunday or late in the afternoon on a weekday such as 2pm.   I recommend the crunchy french toast and eggwich, however, everything on the menu is delicious. Pros:- large portions- yummy breakfast serve all day longCon:- crowdedness- long wait- parking

Reviews.Author: Brandon R.
Reviews.Content: The food is average and now they don't allow dogs outside for some reason never going back.

Reviews.Author: Valerie L.
Reviews.Content: Mmmmm! A great brunch place on Melrose. I didn't have any trouble finding parking, and the wait was about 15 minutes, not bad! I had the vanilla latte, and it was super sweet. So maybe next time I'll get the mocha latte instead. I got the Crunchy French Toast, and it was good but I don't think I would be ordering it next time because there's so many My friend had the Steak Hash and it was delicious!The menu had a few vegan and gluten-free items and they were all labeled.

Reviews.Author: RAAD S.
Reviews.Content: Almost 70% of these reviews are FAKE I mean look at them. They are all worded the same and you can tell. First time. Saturday morning. Asked hostess table for 4. Watched crowds that came after me go in. 20 minutes go by ask hostess when Alex D will be called we've watched crowds of 6 and 4 and 2 go in that came after us, she replies "the difference is they are a party of 6 and 2 and you are 4, I quoted u 40 minutes and it's been 19" the hostess did not even give me a wait time when I checked in I doubt she gave the crowds after us so that's fail #1 and didn't explain how that makes sense and was completely rude. I walked away and they asked "so ur canceling?" I reply "yes thank u" they reply "whew okay great" Wanted to try the food but had trouble seating with a rude hostess and her old boss and bad customer management. Will not be going back and giving my business. 900 other breakfast joints in LA.

Reviews.Author: Mila M.
Reviews.Content: Cranky customer- I arrived extremely hungry and ready for crunchy french toast, but of course for a party of 2 there was a 45 minute wait. After 30 minutes I noticed a group of 5 that came after I arrived being sat before me. I asked the hostess what was going on and she assured me it would only be a few more minutes. I felt bad for her considering it was her second day on the job and it was during sunday brunch. After 20 more minutes my friend and I sat down and had THE BEST FRENCH TOAST EVER!!!!!! it was delicious. it was so good we wanted more and talked about it the entire way home. It was definitely worth the wait and the staff is amazing. Everyone was very helpful and attentive. The food took less than 15 mins to arrive to our table. All in all This place deserves 5 starts. Waiting never hurt anyone :)my first yelp review- ITS THAT GOOD!!

Reviews.Author: Nancy M.
Reviews.Content: Favorite brunch place in LA! Everything I have had here is really good.Their famous French Toast is deliciously sweet and their Steak & Potatoes are really good. The steak is so tender and juicy, and perfectly seasoned. The Blu Jam Benedict is also really good if you like ham and bacon. However, I thought the bacon was a bit too salty. The potatoes that come on the side of many of their dishes is one of my favorites because the outside is crunchy but the inside is nice and soft. In terms of drinks, the Mocha was the best I ever had because it's not too sweet like Starbucks or Coffee Bean, it's pretty perfect.FYI: The wait here for 1pm on a Sunday is about 30 minutes, but there are lots of interesting stores around the place so you can leave your name and shop for maybe 2/3 of that 30 minutes and come back, but be sure to be there when they call your name.

Reviews.Author: Chris D.
Reviews.Content: I'm from Chicago and I just recently moved out to LA. Blu Jam Café has the best crunchy French toast I've ever had. That's what I'll recommend. If you haven't tried Blu Jam, you're missing out! Best spot to get brunch in LA.

Reviews.Author: Juliana C.
Reviews.Content: Been here a few times since I love the crunchy french toast.  It's not overly sweet with a little crunch.  I don't even use syrup since the flavor of the french toast is already so so so good.  This last time I came they actually gave out samples of it as we were waiting for the table.  Since I got my french toast filling from grabbing a bunch of samples I decided to order the Florentine Benedict.  The eggs were cooked perfectly with nice drippy yolk.  I loved the potato on the sides.  Soft with a little crunch.  Besides the wait you really can't go wrong with this place.  Also this place is where the most romantic proposal was done...look it up on buzzfeed.

Reviews.Author: Mario G.
Reviews.Content: Great food. Great service. Worth the wait every time. Signature French Toast is amazing---but I personally love the Migas.

Reviews.Author: Ashleigh C.
Reviews.Content: We visited here on a weekday morning and it was pretty busy! We managed to get a table outside the menu here is vast and if you can't find something you like then you have issues. Despite the calorie count I went for the granola and yogurt which was really tasty though I'm not sure what sort of person could finish the portion, my partner had the salmon bagel which he inhaled every last bite so it must have been good. The fruit juices are so fresh, I would definitely recommend this place for breakfast.

Reviews.Author: Jill P.
Reviews.Content: Thanks yelp for guiding us here. Came for breakfast Friday 1/24/14, and it was delicious!! We all had a little regret from enduring in too much booze the night before and were just hungry and wanting to feel better. I instantly felt better after my first sip of the fresh squeezed orange juice. To eat I had the blu jam Benedict and fell in love. Previously I didn't even like eggs Benedict but it looked so good when other people in the restaurant were eating it that I had to get it. A friend had the crunchy French toast.... I was like an angel had created it in heaven and hand delivered it to the table, literally amazing. The server was great and the icing on the cake was that Brian Wilson was eating breakfast there. We are from SF and were here on a mini vacay so we were happy to see our former SF Giant there (even though he made a bad trade and is now a dirty dodger). Morale of the story: our hangovers were cured, our bellies were full of ridiculously amazing food and we had a great time.

Reviews.Author: Lyn C.
Reviews.Content: AWESOME and delicious.  Came here after work for breakfast and there was no wait, but I did notice it quickly filling up after 8:30.  Order the Crunchy French Toast, the vanilla bean sauce is drool worthy.  The Powerhouse is great too. Celeb sightings have been spotted here as well, so keep your eye out for them!

Reviews.Author: Ellen E.
Reviews.Content: The only thing I really don't love about this place is the wait! If you get there early on Saturday, you may not have to wait more than 10 minutes. We had the delicious french toast & the special breakfast burrito. Both were delicious and so was the coffee. We sat out front and enjoyed a bit of people watching along Melrose. Nice little Saturday morning.

Reviews.Author: John F.
Reviews.Content: Never before seen photos of Mick Jagger, Hendrix, Bowie, Chuck Berry and others make up the spectacular photographic exhibition that line walls of Blu Jam Cafe. If you're into music or can appreciate fine photography,  this alone is enough of a reason for Blu Jam to blow you away.Given the cafe's rating, Blu Jam  Cafe really is all that. I frequent the cafe about 4 times a week-been doing so for about 18 months,  maybe longer and here are a few reasons I go there so often.The ingredients are incredibly fresh,Presentation is creative,Ambience is intimate and yet not over-crowded,Patrons are genuinely friendly and social and the staff- the staff are a remarkable eclectic group of thoughtful, witty and all-round friendly folk. They are what makes it a success. Kamil the owner is a wonderful host and really, get on down and form your own opinion. See what you think.

Reviews.Author: Ken L.
Reviews.Content: Had one of my best burger ever in my life there. By saying that is bold, but I've tried many, many great burgers from McD... (j/k), I meant The Counter Burger, Bachi Burger, GBurger, Grill'm All, and Bugr by Gordan Ramsy plus countless other places out there. I can still say that Blujam's burger is amazing! Maybe its the Sunday Brunch special burger that I had. Don't know if that is on their regular menu or not. Soft egg, flavorful sweet bread buns and beefy/juicy patty. My mouth is watering when typing this. Ahh, good times...

Reviews.Author: R K.
Reviews.Content: Mmmm blu toast, I love you. This place has the fluffiest, most delicious French toast and amazing fresh berries to top it off. Of course it's always busy but every time I've been here it's been pretty fast and service has never been bad

Reviews.Author: brandi g.
Reviews.Content: Just ok. Something just wasn't right, can't really put my finger on it. The service was odd and the host made us wait WAY, WAY longer than necessary. The busser even felt bad for us and just had us sit down with our sleeping baby. The host gave me a hard time about my stroller even though I waited extra time for a table with another stroller who had just left! He asked me to take the kid out?1?just odd.

Reviews.Author: Emily B.
Reviews.Content: Great food , great coffee , great service , love the atmosphere !! Best Benedict's ever !! Yum !!

Reviews.Author: Heidi S.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam Cafe already has a gazillion reviews.Good/Great food + Great Service + good prices = Happy Camper.Go. Enjoy. Be.

Reviews.Author: Erica L.
Reviews.Content: I'd really like to like this place, however, the couple of times I've eaten at Blu Jam Cafe, the food never quite seems up to par, considering its popularity particularly with breakfast enthusiasts, and its queues out front.  The first time I ate here, I ordered the Veneta Risotto with 2 poached eggs goo.gl/5dqY7 , which was a Special nonetheless.  Both poaching the humble egg and making risotto require solid cooking technique, and I was not impressed with Blu Jam's results.  My risotto was cold, flavorless, and glue-like; the eggs were beyond poached (the yolk between medium- to hard-boiled and not runny in the least) and cold as well.  UGH!  I've also ordered their Florentine Benedict: goo.gl/utbUK  This time the eggs were poached, but overall, the cook over-seasoned with salt.  Again, the in-edibility of my meal decreased the overall enjoyment and satisfaction.  Won't return.

Reviews.Author: Janell Y.
Reviews.Content: A brunch place that closes at 5?! HELL YES.Most of the restaurants I've gone to that offer brunch normally closes at 3 and my group of friends and I hardly wake up in time to ever make it. 12 of us came down from the bay to visit a friend for her birthday and this was one of the spots on our list to stop at. Unfortunately they couldn't' accommodate a party that large either at the moment or no longer since it was busy and the venue wasn't large and had to separate the party (bummer but not that big of a deal for us). We were told the wait would be 30-45 mins so we decided to walk around, some of the girls decided to shop while some of us went to the bar next door.20 mins passed and when we checked back we actually missed our call, we didn't think we'd actually be called that early so ended up waiting maybe 10 more minds before a table was ready. Our server was very attentive and checked up on us enough to cater to our needs but not bother us. I ordered the Norwegian Benedict (smoked salmon) and that shit was BOMB! I love love love eggs benedict and this place was on point. They had a hot sauce called Habenero at every table and it was an extra plus to top that on my entire plate, yumm! The others around me ordered a BLTA, Wrap on Fire and the Steak & Eggs. We finished our food relatively fast and each plate was left with no crumb to be found.I really can't wait to come back and eat here again. Too bad they no longer serve alcohol because bottomless mimosas would be cracking!

Reviews.Author: Patty Y.
Reviews.Content: I love brunch!  The boyfriend and I tried Blu Jam because it's close to home and the Yelpers seem to like it.  We got there around 11 and it's already a 25 min wait.  Just like many of the brunch places around here, you find a brick wall and small table surrounding.  Homey, crowded on a Sat morning.We tried the house special eggs Benedict (so we could compare) and got a thumbs up.  My shrimp scramble was slightly over cooked which makes it crumble in small pieces.  But it's well seasoned.  They make an awesome cappuccino here and it was my favorite part.  As busy as they are the service was prompt and friendly.

Reviews.Author: Jody C.
Reviews.Content: The crunchy french toast is phenomenal, along with the vanilla bean sauce!! The wait is ridiculous because it's a small restaurant - FYI not good for big groups. You get seated so much faster if it's a party of 1 or 2. My friend raved about her "Powerhouse" which is a health and fitness option. it's only 410 calories! I couldn't resist my french toast, bring on the carbs. What i like about Blu Jam is that they serve breakfast ALL DAY.. so I can order my crunchy french toast at 1pm :p So, I can't stop raving about the crunchy french toast.. you just gotta try it to believe it!

Reviews.Author: Dominique D.
Reviews.Content: Delicious health conscious food and great service. Our waiter Jason was so awesome and kind. Not only was he just naturally in good spirits but I was having a hard time deciding on spilt pea or white bean soup, so he brought out both for me to sample. Both were so good I still couldn't decide so I asked him to choose for me and he brought out both and only charged me for one. I ordered the veggie sand which as well and it was delicious. Love this place and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: KC T.
Reviews.Content: Yes this is a 4 star restaurant... (or rather 4 star by yelp memers!) But beware, not all breakfast food is equal!Definitely a go-to restaurant in LA! The benedicts are really good - poached eggs are such an art! But, not all the food is great there. I still love it because the inside decor is pretty cool and their poached egg benedicts are super yummy! It comes with an English muffin, hash browns, and meat (depends, either smoked salmon, ham, or just veggie). Don't order the Olympus, not really a good dish..just scrambled eggs w/ chicken,  Tabasco sauce, and salad. not really worth $14 :-(.

Reviews.Author: Rachel R.
Reviews.Content: I consider myself an expert on Florentine Benedict.  I try it everywhere.  So, of course as it was on the menu here, I didn't even have to look at the rest of the menu to decide what I wanted.Verdict: Best Florentine Benedict I've had in LA. Absolutely delicious. If you love Benedict, you will leave happy.I had to take off one star because there is always a long wait.  I have waited for this benedict for almost two hours before. Insane, I know. But its definitely worth the wait. Just don't go when you are so hungry, you are about to pass out.  In the summer, they give you water while you wait. You can also go to the coffee bar or shop around Melrose while you are waiting, but if you aren't there when your name is called, you will give up your spot, so stay close.I've seen a lot of reviews discussing the crepes, but I heard they took the crepes off the menu approximately 5-6 months ago, which kind of blows, because I would've loved to try them.I will always go back there for brunch. They also have a very nice vegan/vegan possible selection.

Reviews.Author: Ford R.
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic place to grab brunch, and their menu is definitely geared to fulfill your brunch desires.  They offer a nice selection of healthy breakfast fare, to more hardy dishes.I had a difficult time choosing between the Migas, Uptown sandwich or the Southwest Burger which was a weekly special of theirs.  I opted to go with the Migas [eggs with spicy beef chorizo] which was a scramble of spicy goodness.  My girlfriend ordered her favorite dish, the Florentine Benedict, which had to be good since she didn't even offer a taste.  Although neither of us ordered a sweet dish, the table next to us ordered french toast complemented with fruit.We waited for 40 minutes or so, and had several parties of three or four which arrived after us be seated first.  Once seated the waitstaff is attentive and courteous.Parking can be difficult, but they do offer valet if you don't feel like hunting down an open meter to park at.  Despite the possible parking issue and wait, I still recommend trying out the Blu Jam Cafe.

Reviews.Author: Al S.
Reviews.Content: I went here in the morning at 8 AM when there wasn't much people. I had the brunch burger, and it was quite tasty. I'm usually picky about breakfast places, but this place was definitely a nice surprise.

Reviews.Author: Ilana Z.
Reviews.Content: Bomb.com. A solid four star breakfast place. The florentine is amazing and extremely filling!!

Reviews.Author: Michael S.
Reviews.Content: Wow.Color me impressed.  While the wait was 15 minutes longer than our host Doug led us to believe "totaling 45 minutes", it turned out to be ridiculously worth it. Between the four of us we had rancheros, loxex, crunchy French toast and the gourmet burger. ALL of them were awesome. The French toast was honestly the best I've ever had in my life and oddly enough I can say the same for my burger. The girls all enjoyed their meals and going with girls to this spot means you are on clean up crew because the portions are huge. To the point where they will definitely be asking you to try their meals. I honestly have nothing bad to say about this spot. Great ambiance. Martin our waiter was fantastic and made great recommendations, and I couldn't ask for more really.The wait just bothered me...hence the one star off.I give the BJC a 4 out of 5 stars

Reviews.Author: Careese K.
Reviews.Content: LET ME JUST SAY THIS NOW. IF YOU ARE NOT A PATIENT PERSON, DONT COME HERE.Literally waited almost 2 hours to be seated on a Saturday morning which turned into afternoon.... It was probably because I came with a group of 6 but STILL. 2 HOURS is a lil ridic...however, once we were seated the service was def ON POINT! we were given water right away and since we had 2 hrs to look at da menu, we all were ready to order ASAP and the servers were ready to accommodate! ALSO, the food came out relatively fast given the crowd so that was a plus as well!I got their spring omelet which was a weekly special and i got it with egg whites! They are also accomodating to any customizations/substitutions you might make so I was happy (:  The omelet was good!! pretty standard and filled with lots of veggies which i enjoyed. It came with your choice of toast as well as potatoes(but you can substitute for fruit or salad). We also got the crunchy french toast to share with the table and it was pretty good as well.... I LOVED the texture and the vanilla sauce so I would say it lived up to its hype!overall, probz wouldnt come here with a big group or on a weekend again... but it was good!

Reviews.Author: Courtney W.
Reviews.Content: Went here last weekend. The staff and the food were wonderful. I was unsure what to get and asked for suggestion. Seemed the fried fried toast was The most popular. I went with a more simple traditional breakfast. Eggs, sausage and French toast. Everything about it was wonderful. I usually don't drink coffee but I tried their vanilla latte and it was wonderful as well. I will be visiting again soon! :)

Reviews.Author: Maruko X.
Reviews.Content: Ambiance: quite popular establishment for weekend brunches, waiting line was always long. They don't take reservations, expect about 20~30 minutes waitService: prompt and friendlyFood: perfect sweet and salty combination.   Blu Jam Benedict - ***** Poached eggs on a toasted English muffin with Black Forest Ham, crispy bacon, topped with hollandaise, served with potatoes. so crispy and tasty, highly recommend  Crunchy French Toast - **** Egg brioche dipped in batter, rolled in crunchy corn flakes and grilled to perfection, topped with fresh bananas and berries, served with vanilla bean sauce. great salty flavor after trying the most famours french toast, recommend  Vanilla Latte - *** very sweet  Machiatto - *** strong espresso Price: very decent, it's about $20~$25 per person for a wonderful brunch

Reviews.Author: Elia E.
Reviews.Content: They have awesome service! All the waiters there are so nice! I had their gourmet burger! it was so fresh and juicy! It took me like 5 minutes to finish it all! My friend and I couldn't even talk when we were eating! lolI do recommend getting there before you're starving. It's small so you can end up waiting for over 20 mins, even more on the weekends.

Reviews.Author: Erin S.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE when eating establishments put their menus online - and they get extra points for linking to said menus from the Yelp page. I can't explain the kind of calm confidence that you feel when you walk into a restaurant and know exactly what you're having. I'm someone who hems & haws over a menu so skipping this pre-meal anxiety made my Morning Hash even more delicious. Eggs, Black Forest ham, spinach, sun-dried tomatoes, red potatoes & mozzerella - you pretty much can't screw that up. It was (predictably) delicious. And I usually just leave the toast on my plate alone but the strawberry jam that came in the little stainless cup was too good to pass up. Also unexpectedly pleasant was the lemony, minty water that arrived in a nice cool carafe on our table. Classy shit, Blu Jam.The half hour wait wasn't so great and our service wasn't what I'd call friendly (more like expedient), but sometimes it's nice to just get in, get brunch, and get out. The juice bar looked great and my gal pal certainly enjoyed her latte. I'd expect that a weekday breakfast or lunch, when they're surely less busy, would be a bit more relaxed. All in all a solid YAY.

Reviews.Author: Ray L.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam Cafe is one of those brunch establishments that makes me wish Yelp included a half point increment for reviewers.  I originally discovered this place through Yelp after seeing its relatively high rating on 2000+ reviews.  Because of its popularity, it's not uncommon to be waiting 45 minutes to get seated but the people there are super friendly. We were 30 minutes into the wait and the waitress brought out pieces of their signature dish to make sure we were happy which was totally unnecessary (Unless you're a complete selfish twat like the jerkface next to me who was talking loudly into his cellphone about how ridiculous a 45 minute wait was. I mean, the restaurant is basically saying, "We apologize that we're so popular that you have to wait". Sod off.). After we got seated though, it was fairly quick and easy to order and get our food.  I came here with my girlfriend and she ordered their signature "Crunchy French Toast" which is a brioche french toast that was battered and covered with corn flakes served with fresh fruit, a little dash of powdered sugar, and a vanilla bean dipping sauce.  I'm not much of a sweets kind of guy so there was definitely a small dilemma in ordering where I ultimately settled on the "Migas", a scramble of eggs, chorizo, and some other stuff.  From the description of the dish, it sounded like it would be pretty spicy but it wasn't at all.  However, they did have this salsa on the table that was unbelievably good.  The tortillas definitely made it so that I could have it in the form of breakfast burritos/tacos and was just the right portion.  The scramble had a side of potatoes that really helped balance out the flavors so it didn't feel too oily or that you had eaten too much eggs. I also ordereed the single origin french press (Columbian for the day), and it wasn't too bad. I didn't stick long enough to find out if they do refills due to the parking situation there (see below).Service was good. The people were super friendly beginning with the free samples of Crunchy French Toast (Note: the samples were a bit soggy because they poured the sauce on it, but are actually really crunchy when you do order it as a meal) all the way to the table service. The guy who served us was very friendly and helpful with suggestions. Parking in the area can be a bit of a hassle though. The surrounding neighborhood on the side streets are a 2 hour parking only so when you include a 45 minute wait during the rush hour, you'll probably only have enough time to kind of leisurely enjoy the meal unless you can find parking on Melrose.Food: 4.5Service: 4.5Price: 4

Reviews.Author: Jennifer P.
Reviews.Content: Key is to arrive as early as 9am to avoid a long wait. This time around, I asked for no salt to be added on all of our dishes and it was a lot better than what I had remembered. Cappuccino is pretty good and the home fries are delish.

Reviews.Author: Kyle M.
Reviews.Content: Came here on a Sunday afternoon and rather hungry which isn't a good idea because there's always a pretty long line. The guy said 45 minutes but surprisingly we were seated in 30. Ordered a vanilla latte which was very good but a little...make that a lot to sweet for me. At almost $5 I drank that diabetes in a cup. Make sure you you stir the coffee so you get an equal amount of sugar in each sip so you're not left with a huge amount at the end. As for the food we ordered the Benedict and steak hash. Both were decent but I didn't think the Benedict was hands down better than others. There was a good amount of thinly sliced Black Forest ham which I liked. The steak hash was a lot of food. The steak was quality Harris ranch beef tenderloin so I ended up picking that out and left a lot of the potatoes in the end. I would try this again since there were a few other items I wanted to try

Reviews.Author: Harby A.
Reviews.Content: This is, so far, one of the best of the best breakfast spot I ever ate in. As usual, I ordered the French toast, they offer 3 types of it, the most recommended one is the "crunchy" one, so I did order it. The presentation of the food was well done, the food accessories such as fruit toppings and vanilla beans extract added a very delicious taste. Overall, the Crunchy French toasts is the best and I recommend it strongly. The waitress who served me was so sweet that I wanted to devour instead of the French toast. The ambiance is cool with out seating especially for pets' owners.

Reviews.Author: Amiee H.
Reviews.Content: Food: 1) Crunchy French Toast: I think they coated the bread with corn flakes because it was really crunchy! It came with buttermilk to dip and it was just so delicious! This is really different type of french toast and it was made really well! I really enjoyed it! It's the featured item here, I really recommend trying it!2) Rancheros: Fried egg on top of black beans, tomatoes, onions, all on top of tostada type crunchy base; and there was an avocado on the side. I didn't really much care for the tostada base, but everything else meshed together really well! Very tasty! It came with fresh fruit (or you can sub it for potatoes or mixed greens). Ambiance: Indoor and outdoor seating available, but it's still not enough because it's pretty small and there are just too many people that want to eat here! There was this huge line out the door and many people waiting to be seated! But the wait still wasn't too awful. We sat inside, it was small but the tables were placed appropriately so you didn't feel too cramped. It was loud, so hard to keep up a conversation, but I guess that's what happens when you have a busy restaurant. Everything was very clean and neat. The decor was very chic. I almost felt like it was a little too dim, but that's just me. Service: Great! Good about refilling water, checked in with us a few times, attentive but not too overwhelming. Very nice!Price: Split the bill between 3 people, I paid $21 (tax and tip included) for splitting the french toast and I had the rancheros to myself. It was decently priced for the quality of food. Overall:I read from other yelp reviews that there are frequent celebrity sightings here, but too bad that didn't happen with me :( I still really liked the food here and would gladly come back just to have the crunchy french toast again! YUM!

Reviews.Author: Sean M.
Reviews.Content: Awesome food, good prices and friendly staff. Gets really busy on weekend mornings. Tiny parking lot and street parking is very inconvenient.

Reviews.Author: Shilpa P.
Reviews.Content: Hands down my favorite brunch place.When I first walked into the restaurant,I fell in love with it. Ambiance is a key feature of restaurants for me, and Blu Jam has an adorable look to it with a cute brick wall and a cozy environment.As for the food, ohhhh mama. Their food is BOMB. They had a very wide brunch selection, and they also have the best chilaquiles that I've had. Their ingredients are fresh and simply amazing. Even their side order of fruit is wonderful. Every single piece of fruit in that bowl was very fresh and delicious. Blu Jam also has an interesting tea selection. Their teas come out in a fancy tea press which makes you feel quite cool using. Aside from its ambiance and food, the staff is very friendly and welcoming. As for parking, there are parking meters on Melrose, or you can find parking on residential streets. Just make sure you read the parking signs to avoid getting one of those unnecessarily overpriced L.A. parking tickets.

Reviews.Author: Julie T.
Reviews.Content: Food:AMAZING. I got Kapil's Breakfast. It's basically a fancy mac&cheese but definitely order it. The chef is Chef Kapil so it is safe to say that the special meal named after them is gonna be bomb. Service. Waiter was nice. Hostess was bit moody. I did go on new year's day for brunch so I guess it's busy but I asked her how long the wait will be after waiting 15mins and she just said "it's only been 15mins." I just wanted to know if the wait was faster since they were calling out names like no other. Tip: go in a small group! A group of 5 arrived before us (me and bf) and sat when we were done with our meal.

Reviews.Author: Kei L.
Reviews.Content: i visited here about two weeks ago, and i do not get people's hype over Blu Jam. there are so many other brunch place that has less/no wait time if you make a reservation (Blu Jam doesn't take a reservation), and with so much better food and ambience. the only thing they have is food decor. average of 1.5 hour wait never worth here. food was mediocre, service was awful. If you go here for Sunday brunch, you will get rushed. but then, your waitress will take forever to bring out your drinks, food, and check. never going back. I prefer The Ivy on Robertson or Larchmont Bungalow so much more.

Reviews.Author: Hannah R.
Reviews.Content: Mehhhhhh. I've had better.Love me some brunch, let's start there. And I get that this place is in Hollywood, right on Melrose, but like...an hour wait? For a bland omelette and a lack of turkey bacon? Seems a little silly.I really didn't mind the wait or the food, because I was with a good friend who I hadn't seen in a while, but that doesn't mean I'd do it again. I had the burgundy omelet, and I was hoping for more sundried tomatoes/goat cheese/flavor. According to a magazine clipping, Jeff Goldblum likes this place, so now I just trust his sophisticated palate less. I did enjoy that they brought me my green tea in a French press. The host was very friendly and helpful, but on an 85 degree day in L.A., I wouldn't mind getting some water while waiting 45-plus minutes. It's the little things.All in all, this place was fine, but it didn't really distinguish itself as a brunch to be reckoned with.

Reviews.Author: S S.
Reviews.Content: Best french toast! U gotta check this place out. Cool vibe, cool customers. They were playing music when we got there. Felt like we were at a party! Which was cool cuz we missed the one from the night before;( Our waiter David served us a delicious summer salad and the best tempenade ive ever had.  The owner Frankie ( or the manager?) stopped at our table and made sure we were happy. He was great. He answered all our questions about the food and sold us on the specials which were amazing. This place rocks!!

Reviews.Author: Karen B.
Reviews.Content: Parking = terrible (only 2 hour parking metered all over the streets)Wait = too long (we waited 60 minutes, mayber more - they seat by # of parties not first come first serve)Service = EXCELLENT (Can't say enough great things)Food = DELISH (Kamil's breakfast, made to order omelet, veggie burger, goulash soup and crunchy french toast)Drinks = FABULOUS (white tea, cappacino and vanilla latte)Defnite place to go and eat and people watch!! Fun place, but beware of the wait... so get there early. OH and this place is ONLY open 8am to 5pm...

Reviews.Author: Laura L.
Reviews.Content: This is my new favorite brunch spot in this area. I normally don't care about organic or free range this and that. However you can really taste the difference here. The staff is friendly, just don't piss them off. Service was pretty fast even though they were crowded. I tried the create your own omelette and was not disappointed. Their chicken was yummy. Their bread is tasty. The burgers look and smelled so good, next time for sure :)

Reviews.Author: Diana W.
Reviews.Content: Ok, I read reviews before coming here and of course had to have the Crunchy French Toast. Amazing! Honestly, the best French toast I have ever had. My friend ordered the same thing and was in agreement. We did have a bit of a wait, as we went for brunch during the weekend. It was expected, so no big deal. Besides, the food is worth the wait. We sat outside so it was nice to people watching during our meal.I will definitely come back. I would like to try other things, but oh man, the French toast... Idk if I can come here and not have it.

Reviews.Author: Eric H.
Reviews.Content: Oh wow, I never reviewed the original Blu Jam?  I've eaten here a million times.This place is awesome.  Great food, great people, great space and great prices.  Plan on a line during peak lunch hours and breakfast on the weekend.

Reviews.Author: Jenny J.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this place!First of all, the food was amazing. I got the Norwegian Benedict which has an english muffin with salmon some veggies, poached egg with a Hollandaise sauce. It comes with a side of potatoes which were a little salty but it was good nonetheless. The egg was cooked to perfection! The portion was pretty big too, I finished everything on my plate (so good that I had to finish) but I was stuffed when I was done! My friend got an omelette and it was HUGE! She only finished half of her omelette and she had to get a box for the left over. Her dish came with a side of either toast or fruit and some other options I think but I forget. She got a side of fruit and it was a good amount of fruit for it being a side and it looked really fresh.  Their service was really good being that there were a TON of people there. I got there later than my meeting time but my friend got there first and the wait was 40 minutes for just two people for brunch! That's how good this place is. The front host was very friendly and accommodating and our waiter was super nice. Came to check up on us every now and then. Parking I have to say is the worst since it is on Melrose so you have to find street parking and I got lucky and found one just around the corner but most of the times you might have to park a bit further and walk which is not too bad. I say that it's so worth it. The price for brunch or lunch is a bit on the pricier side. I paid 20 dollars total with tip and everything and for me personally that's on the high side for brunch. The place is also not too big so that's another reason why there's always usually a wait when you go there for breakfast/brunch/lunch. The tables were tiny too but obviously it was big enough to fit our plates and since it's always crowded there, it's really loud. I had to lean in to hear what my friend was saying because it was a bit loud in there; however that being said, I would still go there again and again because the food and service is so great. All the noise, parking, and crowding issues are worth it. Love this little cafe on Melrose! Definitely a must try.

Reviews.Author: Jimmy P.
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming and homely feel.  We only had 25 minutes before leaving to the airport and the waitress pointed us towards items that would take less time, and gave our bill just before we finished up.  Gotta appreciate a place that cares. All juices are handmade.

Reviews.Author: Ivy W.
Reviews.Content: Came here for Sunday brunch and fell in love. Digging the location and the wait was roughly around 30 minutes, which wasn't too bad -- since it was a hot day, they also provided water outside in front to help cool and hydrate any patrons who needed it.The menu is pretty vast but upon the server's recommendation, we decided to get Kamil's Breakfast ($12.95) and the Breakfast Quesadilla ($14.95). Kamil's Breakfast consisted of macaroni scrambled with eggs, smoked bacon, ham, garlic, chives, and cheddar -- and was delish! I don't normally like breakfast quesadillas, but I really enjoyed it here. While both dishes were tasty, I'd definitely come back to try other dishes as well! I love that breakfast is served all day; definitely a plus.P.S. While we were eating, porn star Evelyn Lin and the "Prince of K-Town" Jowe Lee came in and sat right next to us. Sooooo weird seeing Jowe spoon-feeding Evelyn breakfast...

Reviews.Author: Kimberly T.
Reviews.Content: To be honest, this wasn't one of the restaurants I wanted to try when I visited in LA, but I'm SO glad I did!My boyfriend was craving eggs for breakfast during our trip to SoCal, so I yelped and saw that Blu Jam Cafe had a lot of tasty egg breakfasts options. I decided to go here cause you know a happy stomach = happy boyfriend. LOL.We were fortunate to find good parking in front and nooooo wait on a Friday afternoon! It's a very small cafe. And my boyfriend felt so claustrophobic LOL. Anyways, our waiter was Martin, who's name I got from our receipt. He was super friendly and kept making sure everything was good.I was thinking of ordereing healthy, cause they do have a lot of healthy options. But I was like nope, forget it I'm on vacation! Lol so I ordered their famous crunchy french toast with vanilla bean sauce on the side. I'm more of a pancake and waffle girl, but this was so good! It lives up to the hype. It doesn't come with maple syrup, but I asked for on the side.My boyfriend got the Norwegian Benedict. He enjoyed it and he let me try, and it was really good! My favorite part was the potatoes though haha.Good service and great food. I'm glad I ended up getting breakfast at Blu Jam! And I love how brunch is served all day until 5 so you don't gotta rush to get breakfast lol.

Reviews.Author: Desmond T.
Reviews.Content: Breakfast served all day? I'm down! Service was good. Staff was friendly and attentive. This place gets packed at typical breakfast/lunch hours.Just had to order the Crunchy French Toast. This is definitely not like your typical french toast. Egg brioche dipped in butter with crunchy cornflakes on top with an AMAZING vanilla bean sauce. omg this was SO GOOD. The french toast itself reminded me of eating one of my mom's version of chinese sticky cake [nian gao] [referring to the egg dipped brioche part of it]. The vanilla bean sauce was just perfect and complemented the french toast so well.If i'm back in the area, I'd definitely gonna get this french toast again.

Reviews.Author: Jill C.
Reviews.Content: My favorite brunch place. Delicious food and great service. Huge fan of their breakfast risotto, french toast, and lattes...sooo good! Wait long on weekends but totally worth it!

Reviews.Author: Cindy R.
Reviews.Content: Hands down! The best breakfast place I have ever been to in the city of angels. The brunch burger is heavenly and perfect. What makes it perfect? The fried egg of course. The crunchy french toast are also amazing!

Reviews.Author: Lindsay C.
Reviews.Content: Cornflake french toast oh how I dream about you (and this is coming from someone who doesn't like french toast!) The cornflakes gave this dish the right amount of crunch I usually crave from a waffle and had a delicious vanilla bean sauce to go with it. Yum my mouth is watering just thinking of it. I love sugar for breakfast so this def hits the spot. For my savory dish I had Roma Via Paris which consists of : spinach, zucchini, sun-dried tomatoes, chopped tomatoes, red bell peppers, fresh basil, Montchevre goat cheese and mozzarella. Hold the goat cheese please!! Might seem plain to the ordinary person but I liked it. My sister insisted it needed some meat to it and it would be perfect. I liked it as is, minus weird goat cheese.

Reviews.Author: Vaia S.
Reviews.Content: Great ... I mean excellent food!I went here for breakfast which was around noon hour.  We had to wait 15 minutes and then we sat down.  It took us a while to get served or food  and a couple extra minutes for our coffee  but totally worth it.  The only complaint I have which isn't really it's just my preference is that the coffee is really strong for me but it's definitely better then Starbucks.  I had their hot oatmeal and yum, yum, yum!  Their water was good too!  They serve it from a decanter that has mint in it so it has that crisp fresh taste.  Next time I go ... I want the Crispy French Toast.

Reviews.Author: Robyn T.
Reviews.Content: Breakfast!!! My favorite meal of the day!! Honestly I could eat breakfast at every meal and be completely happy with my life.  Blu Jam brings breakfast to a whole nother level though!  My friend and I headed to Melrose one weekend as we had never been and wanted to experience LA culture.  Well Melrose itself is kind of dissapointing, but we found this gem and now I want one in Orange County ASAP!!The wait long was not long, about 20 minutes or so.  Not bad for a sunday.  We talked to a few people outside and see what was good.  Crunchy french toast they said, crunchy french toast it was!  Inside it was a little cramp, I kind of felt like the people next to us where seated with us but once our food was brought over all surroundings were gone! Heaven in my mouth!! That syrup is delicious! Oh wow.  Can they bottle it up and sell it? A-mazing!! Neither my friend and I were talking at that point anymore, it was orgasmic.  The coffee was great, the staff was a little lacking honestly.  Not too friendly but she might have just been out of it that day which is totally fine.  She was nice enough.  Cannot wait to go back!!  The parking was well, LA parking.  I parked in the residential, just walked a bit but LA is beautiful and it never hurts to walk.  Blue Jam come to Orange County pleeeaaaase!!!

Reviews.Author: Jeff M.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam gets 5 stars for the crispy french toast alone. I thought about giving them 4 stars, but the crispy french toast seriously deserves to be placed on the highest of breakfast pedastals for those with a sweet tooth like me.The hour long wait at 10AM on a Saturday absolutely pushed my limits of how long I'm willing to wait for brunch. My suggestion? Plan on arriving at 9:30 or before. Between our call to ask about the wait at 9:30 and our arrival at 10:00, the wait had quintupled. Ouch. However, the host was very friendly and once we were seated the experience was very pleasant.Most of what I tried here was simply OK. I had a chai latte blend which wasn't too flavorful. Someone else in my party got a latte, and we were excited to see what latte art we would get, only to be served a latte with no pattern at all in the foam :-(. Two in my party got the eggs benedict, and everyone agreed that the hollandaise was definitely not the best around.But oh man, that crispy french toast. Served with fresh fruit and the crown jewel: vanilla sauce. I'm salivating just thinking about it now. Breakfast, lunch, dinner, dessert, I would eat this baby anytime. My sister claimed it was the best breakfast she had ever had. I don't know if I'm ready to make that commitment quite yet, but I can definitely say I'll be back for more of that crispy crunchy vanilla-y goodness.

Reviews.Author: Shaina J.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam is my favorite breakfast place. While the seating space is fairly small, the service is good and the food is delicious! It's my favorite breakfast place because their specialty dishes are the best I've ever had for breakfast. The first time I went I had the Old World which was good, but it didn't stand out from other breakfast places. My friend got the Brunch Carbonnara which I tried. It's out of this world! It's so yummy! The next time I went I had the Kamil's Breakfast. The mac and cheese melted in my mouth. Seriously such a good dish. I can't wait to go back just thinking about this review!

Reviews.Author: Kyle D.
Reviews.Content: Amazing service and amazing food.  What else could you ask for?! My gf and I split the brunch burger and the crunchy french toast.  I would recommend both for sure!  But honestly the service was as impressive as the food.  Thank you Jason!

Reviews.Author: Anthony S.
Reviews.Content: Amazing establishment! The service was both friendly and quick, two things that seem hard to come by together in LA. I tried the burgundy omelette and my friend had brunch burger, coupled with the French roast coffee, this place was exactly what I hoped it'd be!! Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Author: Ziyad A.
Reviews.Content: Great place for breakfast. Their food is carefully cooked. If you are looking for a traditional breakfast (eggs, pancakes and/or french toasts); then this caffe is the right place to visit. I highly recommend their Crunchy French toast it's really delicious!

Reviews.Author: Valerie P.
Reviews.Content: Things I didn't like about Blu Jam: the 45 minute wait to get in the door.Things I loved about Blu Jam: everything else.Where to start?! The Crunchy French Toast was heavenly. Seriously, I will have dreams about that dish. Delicious, delicious dreams. Portion sizes are large, so splitting is completely doable. A friend and I divided the Florentine benedict and crunchy French toast and still managed to have a few pieces left over for later. Yum.The interior of the restaurant is somewhat small. Because there aren't a lot of tables inside the wait can get quite long, but on the upside once seated you can actually hear your dining companions speak without being overpowered by a wall of sound (I'm looking at you, Griddle Cafe).I was also very impressed with how attentive the wait staff was. Although there was a small pitcher of water on our table for self-refills (accentuated with mint!), we never needed to use it because the staff was constantly refilling our glasses themselves. Everyone was nice and even though the restaurant was clearly busy I didn't feel pressured to hurry through my meal for maximum table turnover.I will definitely be back here in the future. French toast, we will meet again!

Reviews.Author: Angel N.
Reviews.Content: THE best (crunchy) FRENCH TOAST I've ever had in my life, no doubt. Nothing comes close to it. I've been back twice this month and addicted. MIGAS is your next best bet for yummy spicy eggs for your protein... And Florentine Benedict; best egg benedict ever.Vanilla latte WITH whipped cream!!! Sooooo yummy... (it's on my profile pic btw, lol)Their chilaquiles is also great, but the 3 items above are my absolute favorite here.

Reviews.Author: Nance L.
Reviews.Content: Service: Horrible!  I've never had so many parties cut me off during my 10 minute-turned-40 minute wait. (**Apparently it's okay to check in early, go wander off, return an hour later after they've made a final call on your party, and get seated right away upon your return. You will be first on the list  -____- )Food: Nothing tasted too special aside from their crunchy french toast. And that'd be the only reason I'd return a second time. The crunchy french toast wasn't too sweet even though I dunked each and every single piece into their vanilla syrup. I devoured the entire plate.

Reviews.Author: Han N.
Reviews.Content: I finally had time to try this place the other day and it was better than I expected.First of all -1 star for the wait, it took 45-60 mins for a table for 2! The upside - I like how its in the middle of melrose so we had lots of time to kill. I am the biggest breakfast person ever, so I was very excited for their menu. I had a few choices in mind but the waiter helped me make the choice of ordering Kami'ls Breakfast. I love how the macroni went very well with the scrambled eggs, bacon, and ham. I also like the bits and pieces of onions and chives that made it more flavorful! Before I rant and rave about the crunchy french toast I have to talk about their red skin potatoes. I don't know what it is but the way it was flavored and cooked made it absolutely perfect and tasty. I definitely want to learn how to make something similar to that! Other than that, the crunchy french toast is like "legal crack" (from a foursquare tip). The cornflakes made the french toast so addicting! I like how it doesn't get soggy like regular french toast. Additionally, their vanilla bean sauce is to die for. I literally drenched the french toast in this heavenly sauce.Gotta go back soon to try other things on their menus + more red skin potatoes & crunchy french toast!

Reviews.Author: Julie Y.
Reviews.Content: I went recently with a girlfriend and was pleasantly surprised by two things. One was that the wait time around lunch time was relatively short for a party of 2 in comparison to the usual 30-40 minute wait during breakfast hours. The second was that they got rid of the small dark cubicle room thing they had at the end of the restaurant and opened up so it looks a lot brighter, a lot cleaner, and yes, there are more tables! :) The french toast was still delicious and I'm still in love with that side of fruit that is indeed made of fresh ripe sweet fruits. They now serve mint-flavored water in a small jug so that you don't have to constantly  flag down a waiter for water so yay! The only disappointment was that my Roma via Paris omelette was oily. Ugh. The flavors were good and there were a lot of yummy vegetables but I had to sop up the excess oil with my napkin. :( I think I'll just stick to the other food options... until next time!

Reviews.Author: Tim B.
Reviews.Content: Amazing tea, and a great place to have breakfast, brunch, or a lunch at. Great busy little cafe for a lazy Sunday escape

Reviews.Author: Derek D.
Reviews.Content: Had an amazing brunch at Blu Jam Cafe yesterday. First time there. A slight wait but well worth it.  Shout out to Lauren (Go Oregon)!!  Amazing service and great suggestion "you must try something sweet The Crunchy French Toast and something savory The Ranchos". What a combination.   A must for breakfast, lunch or brunch.  I'll be back soon! Dd

Reviews.Author: Chloe K.
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for brunch. We had a wait time of 20 minutes before we could be seated inside, but it wasn't too crowded or cramped inside. Service was quick, waiters/waitresses were friendly. And the food... Now I'm not a huge expert on breakfast/brunch foods but it was pretty darn good. I got the Norwegian Benedict and my friend got the quesadilla. Both were delicious, with fresh-tasting ingredients. The sauce hit the spot perfectly, and I really enjoyed that they added spinach to it too. The portions were pretty big (at least for me, I don't usually eat huge amounts). And if you don't like super heavy meals, substitute the side of potatoes for fruit! It was really refreshing to eat after a fulfilling meal. Overall, great experience. The lack of parking is a bit of a bummer, but it's well worth the extra minute or two it takes to find parking.

Reviews.Author: Justin M.
Reviews.Content: This past Sunday morning, I met some friends there for breakfast. I'd never heard of this place before and arrived before my friends; I checked in with the host. I was very hungry that morning, and was looking forward to having coffee, relaxing and eating. I lived shortly in Williamsburg, NYC, and used to frequent a spot called LE BARICOU that had the most amazing French toast. I'm always on the search for French toast in LA to match Le Baricou's, so I was eager to try Blu Jam's crunchy variation. Blu Jam's crunchy French toast is okay, not anything to really write home about. I wasn't a fan of the vanilla syrup because it was very buttery and oily. I asked for some maple syrup and was brought out probably Aunt Jemima's in a metal small bowl - it was cold and thick. I ordered a side of smoked bacon - it was dull, the portion small. My friends had some issues with the server too, but I found him to be okay.All in all, I wasn't too impressed, and probably won't be back, but I feel like my experience was totally subjective, everyone else seems to like this place. Justin

Reviews.Author: Sheffia L.
Reviews.Content: My favorite brunch place! I love the Crunchy French Toast and the Breakfast Quesadilla! The wait can get a little intense sometimes but worth it if you have the time! I've seen people get coffee and snacks from nearby places to tide them over while they wait.

Reviews.Author: Mariana B.
Reviews.Content: Been here several times for breakfast and the quality of the food has been amazing every time. Five stars for the food, drinks, and service! But one star taken off because of the wait time and limited parking. Be prepared to wait if you come during brunch on the weekends. Average wait time 45 min to an hour. But its well worth it once you sit down and taste their amazing dishes. The portions are large so come hungry. Favorite dishes by far are: Vanilla French Toast- get ready for the most amazing experience in your mouth. Buttery, perfectly crisp on the outside, warm and gooey with the vanilla spread and blackberry jam in the middle. It's to die for!!! It's like the feeling you get when you eat freshly baked chocolate chip cookies straight out of the oven with a cold glass of milk. Yum!!Breakfast Quesadilla- Amazing flavors and perfectly cooked. The flour tortilla is crisp, they don't skimp on the chicken and eggs. Salsa and sour cream on the side. Mmmmm so good.I love ordering their latte's here as well. Rich and flavorful espresso with their smooth, perfectly frothed milk. Best part are their cute designs they'll surprise you with.

Reviews.Author: Gina S.
Reviews.Content: 2nd visit to Blu Jam Cafe - arrived around 9am on a Saturday and waited less than 5 minutes.Parking - meters on Melrose don't start charging until 11am on Saturday.  Score! Service was exceptional.  Our server was friendly, efficient, and on his game!The food (a smoked salmon egg scramble) was a generous portion and delicious.... the most unexpected delight, however, was the side salad I chose (in place of potatoes or fruit).  It's served with the most AMAZING balsamic dressing.  I wish I begged for the recipe, because it was the best I've ever had.I ordered hot tea and loved that they served loose tea in a french press.  The quality of the tea was better than some afternoon tea houses I've visited!Blu Jam is not cheap (expect $20/pp before tip), but it has quickly become one of my top b'fast picks in Los Angeles.  I love their service, their large menu offerings, and their commitment to quality coffee and tea.  Thank you, Blu Jam Cafe!  I will see you soon!

Reviews.Author: Jane W.
Reviews.Content: I dropped by this cafe along the way to LACMA after seeing all the positive yelp reviews, and I (along with my stomach) was very sad to see the big crowd of people in front of the building. However, it was mostly a positive experience!Pros: I love how they have healthy options on the menu! I ordered egg white omelette with spinach, ground turkey, tomato, and more, and they were really generous with the ingredients. Prices aren't cheap but they're reasonable, and food was pretty good! Con: I was told that there would be a 45 minute wait, and ended up waiting a little over an hour. I was pretty hangry by then (for those of you who don't know... hungry + angry = hangry.. state of being angry from hunger.. whoever thought of this word is genius).Basically, I would not wait in line for an hour again, but if the wait were shorter, I would stop by again!

Reviews.Author: Ryan R.
Reviews.Content: We went here on New Years morning to get some much needed nourishment after a long night out.We arrived around 10:15am and were seated 45 minutes later. The previous time we had skipped the wait and headed to Vienna Cafe and were disappointed with the food there. This time around we stuck it out and were rewarded.My friend and I ordered the equivalent of the juevos rancheros, along with the crunchy french toast and a bowl of the cauliflower soup of the day.The soup was decent and it came with chives and gorgonzola cheese. I wish there was a bit more cheese, but it was tasty nonetheless.The juevos rancheros, were pretty standard but came with fresh avocados and black beans and salsa and really had a good spice to them.The crunchy french toast, which this place is so famous for, was also tasty, but I wish it was a little less cooked. The warm vanilla bean syrup really made up for it though and it ended up being a delicious and not too heavy dish as well with fresh strawberries, blueberries, and bananas.Overall, the food here is pretty good and doesn't take too long to process, but if you can get there a bit early and beat the crowds, you will be glad you did.

Reviews.Author: Rose V.
Reviews.Content: Lunched here after Runyon and surprisingly, the wait wasn't too bad even though a good amount of people were standing around waiting to be seated. Place is small and quaint with charming decor. Friendly staffs. Food was good/okay. It didn't WOW me but I enjoyed it, especially the French toast. Street parking if you can find any. DO watch for posted signs.

Reviews.Author: Lorrie M.
Reviews.Content: I came here because there was talk of pancakes, and anytime I hear pancakes I pretty much flip out and put this on a MUST VISIT list.I've come here twice now and both times it was a solid, great breakfast place, and yes ... with great pancakes!This is a very interesting spot on Melrose because it really is smack dab in the middle of Melrose inbetween all the awesome shops on Melrose. It's almost across the street from Munky King. There is usually a hefty wait and the parking is likely atrocious. However, the wait, the parking, the people, the starved, hungry browsing of stores you have little to no interest in because your stomach is screaming FEED ME its all worth it once your name has been called. This means you ... you get to feast!And feast I did. Both times I got a full stack of pancakes (hey! I like my pancakes) and some eggy omelette ish dishes. What can I say, I'm greedy ... Either way all of their food is pretty top notch so I would highly recommend it. Seriously. You can also come early to avoid the wait, because usually people don't wake up to come to brunch until  past 12pm.

Reviews.Author: Hahnmade H.
Reviews.Content: i believe the hype--crunch french toast was DELICIOUS. despite how busy and crowded the outside was from people waiting in lines, once inside, the actual restaurant wasn't hectic or cragee busy, i was able enjoy my meal and the company. p.s. ranchero was yummy too.p.p.s. was a bit disappointed w/latte - didn't have a cool foam design like the ones i saw the pix, couldn't really make out of mine.

Reviews.Author: Daniel L.
Reviews.Content: This is my go to for breakfast whenever time allows. The staff is extremely friendly and kind. Coffee is phenomenal especially the French press and even simple eggs taste like they are made with that secret ingredient grandmothers always use: love. Strongly recommend coming early to avoid long lines. Enjoy! And obviously order the crunchy French toast.

Reviews.Author: Julee M.
Reviews.Content: The food is amazing.  I usually like to enjoy sitting outside, but the space inside is way nicer.  Plus what is that canopy/cover thing on the patio?  I can't enjoy BEING outside.  It blocks the view.  The service is pretty... bad.  The hostess is very attentive and sweet, and the bussers were very professional.  But both times I have gone... where is the server?  I may sound cheap, but I thought leaving $4 on a $22 tab was actually too MUCH.  Essentially, the busser deserves that money for being so kind... THAT'S how bad the overall service was.

Reviews.Author: Yi Z.
Reviews.Content: Saturday was a rare day for us.  We rarely spend our weekends west of the SGV and we rarely wake up early enough for brunch. But since we were up and the bf wanted french toast, we made our way to Blu Jam.Even at 9:20am, the place was packed. We ended up waiting about 25 minutes to get seated but luckily, we found parking right in front of the restaurant (with the meter already fed) and there's free minty water for all those who were waiting.After looking at hundreds of photos on Yelp during the wait, I settled on the Norwegian Benedict and the bf got the Crunchy French Toast. The eggs for my benedict were cooked to perfection and I just loved the combo of smoked salmon, spinach and dill.  And the potatoes that came with the benedict were seasoned perfectly.  My bf loved his french toast as well. They are very unique and the crunch from the corn flakes were a nice touch.I'm really not a brunch person but I was impressed by Blu Jam.

Reviews.Author: Jasmine C.
Reviews.Content: So this place has been on my to-try list for awhile, and I finally got to go with my NY roomie. I have to say I wasn't as blown away as I thought I was going to be...but it was good! However, the wait can be kind of ridiculous...I came on a rainy day thinking it would be better, but even then the wait was still an HOUR! Luckily I caught the parking spot RIGHT OUTSIDE of Blu Jam, but I can't say I'd always be so lucky. Parking on Melrose is always a beep.Atmosphere inside was nice enough, but a little dark for me, actually. Maybe because we weren't sitting by the window and it wasn't a sunny day out. It also felt pretty bustling/packed in there but with 1 hours waits, I guess that's no surprised! Food-wise, we really couldn't decide what to order, so we decided to get two breakfast plates and to share the crunchy french toast that everyone raves about. Crunchy French Toast--yes, it really is good like everyone says. It's definitely share worthy for two people and the vanilla sauce it comes with is absolutely heavenly! Florentine--pretty darn good, but I probably love anything with eggs...poached eggs..and fresh veggies. MM i love brunch!Shrimp Scramble--I got to taste a bit of my friend's dish and this was delicious as well! Had a little spicy kick to it.Portions are pretty big, and it's a cute little spot to have breakfast with a good friend. However, would I wait the hour? Maybe not. I think I'd rather go to Toast down the street! :)

Reviews.Author: Jennifer S.
Reviews.Content: A very cute brunch atmosphere with a modern feel. Our waitress was friendly and accommodating. I ordered the Norwegian Benedict. Delicious. Expect a 40-45 minute wait for a party of 2. It's a small place so I wouldn't suggest coming here with a big party.

Reviews.Author: Christen g.
Reviews.Content: I've eaten here twice now in the last year.  The first time our tour manager found it on yelp and I had the best Burrato plate in recent history.  The second time, last week, my colleague was begging to return just for the burrata.  Well -- it's no longer on the menu - - maybe it was a special?  But the juice bar was divine, the espresso was also great.  I got the breakfast risotto and it was perfect.  Everyone else was happy with their various egg dishes.  I look forward to returning!

Reviews.Author: Susan D.
Reviews.Content: Really delicious weekday brunch with friends. Place: Cute and welcoming, not super huge so wouldn't bring a party of more than 8. I've heard that the weekend wait is a pain in the butt, but if you want to avoid that, random Thursday at 11am ftw! Also pretty easily found free residential parking a block over which was awesome :)Service: Server had some good recommendations and service was spot on, friendly and efficient.Food: Shared the crispy french toast, Norwegian benedict and side of chicken apple sausage. I really enjoyed the french toast--the corn flakes and vanilla bean sauce are delicious and memorable, would definitely recommend. The benedict was good but nothing special, LOVED the potatoes that came with it though. Chicken apple sausage was same--good but not crave-worthy. Overall I had a great meal and would recommend this as a cute place for breakfast/brunch anytime, get the crispy french toast!

Reviews.Author: B K.
Reviews.Content: Best brunch in LA.  Wait time is a pain in the ass.

Reviews.Author: Christine L.
Reviews.Content: One of the best Eggs Benedict I've ever had.. and I LOVE Eggs Benedict. There's a place down the street from my home in New Jersey that serves specialty Benedicts and Blu Jam is at par, if not even better. I also got to try their delicious and refreshing juice bar, as well as the Captain Crunch french toast. Everything was fresh, ORGANIC, and spectacular! Excellent brunch spot.

Reviews.Author: Alek I.
Reviews.Content: I love this place and I go here every time I am in LA. This place gets busy but the wait is well worth it. If you enjoy coffee get the French press, their coffee is good. My dish of choice is the Eggs Benedict. Let me point out the positives about the dish:English muffin: never saggy, always just the right about of crunchBacon: Perfect crunch, doesn't just taste like fatHam: I love it, not an overpowering tastePouched Egg: Only way to say it, proper pouched eggHollandaise Sauce: Nice and thick, also my plate in not drenched in it.Overall hands down the best eggs Benedict I have ever had. I have tried getting this dish in other places and it just sucked.

Reviews.Author: Patrick B.
Reviews.Content: I went at 9:15 on a Saturday morning and got sat immediately. By 9:30 there was a crowd forming outside on the sidewalk. So, get there early or wait.I really like the coffee and the food here! The Blu Jam Benedict is excellent. Our server was attentive and friendly.

Reviews.Author: Julia Z.
Reviews.Content: Came here a couple months ago on a Sunday and had an hour wait.The food is as good as all the other good brunch places. I ordered the Norwegien benedict which is good, but i wish they can use some better quality salmon. The one they used, the meat is a bit numb instead of tender as for fish, and tastes plain in the fish part. And my BFF ordered some breakfast carbonnara which is a bit too salty and a bit oily for breakfast.The waiter is kinda slow. And I don't like the ambiance. For brunch, I still wish it's a bit less crowded, and a bit sunshine to enjoy the good weather in LA. However, all tables are close to each other, and you can't help hearing people's chat just beside you. Also, it's a bit dark for brunch imo. Well, these probably are due to my personal love for the sun. :p So the ambiance didn't feel relaxing and satisfying enough for a Sunday brunch.Plus, parking can be found in the small streets nearby.

Reviews.Author: Tammy T.
Reviews.Content: Saturday brunch with my West L.A. friends? Blu Jam Cafe seemed to fit the bill (although I didn't take into account the extensive wait). There were there of us and it took about an hour to get a table! Also, I recommend you staying close by if you want to get a table soon because if you don't hear your name above the noise and chatter when called then it's moved down on the list. This happened to my friend and I even though we were standing write under the shaded area in front of the restaurant! It might be seen as obnoxious sometimes but I recommend checking with the person at the front podium every 10-20 minutes. Breakfast is served all day and it's pretty much what Blu Jam is known for. I ordered their signature crunchy french toast. It's basically toast coated with cornflakes and served with berries, bananas, and an amazing vanilla bean sauce (I really wish they gave more of this stuff!). The sauce is creamy and delicious. I didn't find myself missing syrup or any other sweetener. My friends went savory with Rome Via Paris  and the Migas which were scrambled egg-hash type things. They enjoyed their plates (but I still think my dish was the tastiest). Finally, be careful with street parking and the potential wait time! I had metered parking and there was one point (upon realizing how long the wait would be) that I had to run back and put in some more change.

Reviews.Author: Keith P.
Reviews.Content: Went here for brunch after a night of heavy drinking and even though the place was packed, the excellent service and superb food quickly took my hangover away. The prices were a little steep for me, as I was still in college at the time of visit, but the steak and eggs was worth it!

Reviews.Author: Katie B.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam Café rocks bfast like cracking yolks is a treasured art form, but who knew they also treat an evening meal with respect, too? As of a recent Saturday evening, I now do.The scroll of tapas is impressive and each one is executed with precision and care. We had this tremendous crostini with burrata, strawberries, and balsamic vinegar. It could have been a dessert, it was so rich, and it left you with that feeling as if you were put on this very earth to taste beautiful creations of this caliber. We also had an Argentinean steak dish that was succulent and juicy with a nice pesto-ish glaze.The lighting is rather dim, so make sure to come with someone you already have a good rapport with, as sitting in the dark with a stranger can be sexy, but could also lead to a lot of awkward moments. Luckily they usually have some kind of promotion going on (we scored an entire bottle of red wine for saying 'Bianca' to the waitress in celebration of the owner and his wife's new baby girl) that will score a glass of wine at the very least.It's charming, seductive, and delicious in the am and the pm.

Reviews.Author: Anna M.
Reviews.Content: RING RING RING RING RING!We have a winner!Blu Jam Cafe is officially my absolute favorite brunch establishment. I will even go so far as to hand craft the award from gold, drool, and sugar as sweet as the kind their french toast held. As you all know, Sunday was Mother's Day and as you all should know, mother deserves only the very best. The vibe I got from Mom was that she wanted something delicious yet casual, a place where you can relax over some eggs benedict and finally have conversation with your children that runs longer than "gotta go mom, don't wait up!"Blu Jam doesn't take reservations and we had to wait for a good 20 minutes this Sunday late morning. My little brother growled and snarled at me from hunger like a full on werewolf as we read the large menu posted outside the cafe and stalked around with the 15 other hungry patrons. Thankfully the hostess was gracious and would update me on how much longer we would have to be in this zombie stage.  But once we were in, the gray skies cleared and we were all smiles. First of all, the decor itself is evocatively delicious. The rust-orange color of the walls brings to the hungry mind an image of a juicy blood orange, a perfect mindset right before you dive head first into the menu. What to order, what to order....Me:- A double cappucino: whole milk, lots of foam, rich and smooth flavor in a big white cup. Love. - Crunchy French Toast: One of the top 3 best french toasts I've had, yes ma'am! 4 pieces of thick textured toast, with moist-but-not-soggy insides, crunchy corn flakes fried into the bottom, vanilla bean syrup mixed in, with strawberries on top and a hint of mint. It could have had more strawberries, but I just love my strawberries and my thirst is rarely quenched. Little bro:- Steak and eggs: Medium rare steak cooked to perfection, covered in runny eggs, caramelized onions, and melted gruyere cheese. Comes with a side of roasted potatoes. Mike came in thinking he was going to order multiple plates but he could barely keep from falling over after finishing this thick slab of protein and carbs. Of course I helped ease the pain by eating some :)Mommy:- Chicken schnitzel with a side of mashed potatoes. Oh mom. You're so Ukrainian still. Mashed potatoes at 11:30am? But yes, they were made from scratch, so creamy and lush. I don't like shnitzel or chicken much personally, but mommy dearest greatly enjoyed her order. Papa:- Norwegian Benedict: Ultra flavorful smoked Norwegian salmon atop poached eggs with some spinach and a side of roasted potatoes. Pops had no complaints. AND get this:As Blue Jam's courtesy to Mother's Day, the waitress brought out the the zestiest lemon crepes for my mommy . My heart melted and my taste buds went for a wild ride at the same time. Has that ever happened to you? It's so wonderfully confusing. So not only is the food everything you can ask for on a breakfast, brunch, or lunch plate, but the service is equally superb. Our waitress was so down to Earth, patient, and friendly. I noticed Czech owner and chef, Kamil Majer, walking around the cafe greeting people and I waved him over to our table to personally thank him for the meal. He put his hand on my back and was so gracious thanking me. What a sweetheart! He has that Old World charm and personable-ness I swoon over when I see in chefs and restaurant proprietors. Le sigh. Blu Jam Cafe, you best believe I will be a regular!

Reviews.Author: Melissa J.
Reviews.Content: My review will strictly be on what I ordered:Chilaquiles -  I am a chilaquiles aficionado and the chilaquiles they offer here are fantastic.  I do wish however they didn't allow the dish to sit for too long before serving it because by the time my plate got to me more than half the chips were way too soggy.  I love it when chilaquiles still have a slight crispy and give to eat chip under all that goodness.  The portion was just right and the components they chose to use complimented the dish well.  Crunchy French Toast - I hesitated to order this because I was afraid it would be overwhelming sweet, but to my surprise it was perfect.  It was only sweet if you used the vanilla sauce that came with it.  The cornflake crust added a great textural contrast and flavor for those who are tired of eating mushy french toast.  Carrot, Orange, & Ginger Juice - I make juice all the time at home and well, this pretty much tasted like what I make.  Yummy, zingy, and refreshing!OVERALL:  Came here on a Sunday late afternoon and the way was about 45 minutes.  But don't let the wait time prevent you from dining in because there are so many shops left and right you can kill time at.Like I always say, YOU WON'T KNOW UNLESS YOU TRY IT FOR YOURSELF!

Reviews.Author: Anthony N.
Reviews.Content: The reviews say it all.  The only thing I can add is that I wish they had a few more interesting options.Other than that, they are as solid as a Bro's fist bump.I am a Benedict addict, and they do a nice version.

Reviews.Author: Christina P.
