Reviews.Content: I work a job that has some unusual hours. A 'lifestyle job,' i think they call it. One of the perks that comes along with such a job is that we can take advantage of the hot brunch spots around town and not have to wait in the horrific lines you'd see on weekends. On a lovely Friday late morning, a bunch of us 'lifestyle' workers headed here for a catch up. I had heard so much about the French toast here that I was determined to have it, quickly approaching swimsuit season be damned. I was all set to have the stuffed french toast with blackberry jam and yogurt, when lo and behold what did I see? The place was having a French week, with special items on the menu including a CORN FLAKE CRUSTED french toast! Sacre bleu! I hemmed and hawed between the two delicious sounding french toasts until the waitress came and suggested that I get both in one. So, that's right ladies and gentlemen, that means a stuffed corn flake crusted french toast with syrup and vanilla sauce on the side. I just died. And it really lived up to all of the raving reviews! the brioche was fluffy and yummy, the stuffing not too heavy or sweet, the jam just heavenly, the corn flakes giving it a nice savory crunchy touch. I didn't really touch the vanilla sauce or syrup because I thought that would have made it too sweet, but I appreciated the fact that they were there should I choose to indulge. The other girls had a variety of savory dishes, including this asparagus leek truffle gnocchi thing that was super different tasting - in a really good way. I also had two cups of a really strong and delicious coffee that unfortunately for the rest of the day made me feel like Jesse Spano in that one famous episode of Saved By The Bell. But I don't care because Blu Jam Cafe's got me so excited, I'm so excited.....

Reviews.Author: Daniel L.
Reviews.Content: Proclaiming to be café by day, bistro by night, I came here with fellow Yelpers Anthony N, Maybelline C and her husband Marc for breakfast. It was a little chilly to sit on their sidewalk patio full of umbrellas but the vibe inside was homey with a red brick wall behind the counter that faced a row of local artistry hanging across a vibrant orange backdrop. There were occasional mirrors and indoor plants to give the place a personality, and the large posting but hard to see Czech menu only furthered our intrigue. We each ordered something to share and I was impressed upon receiving my cup of Wake Up Call ($2.95) which consisted a mix of espresso and coffee that arrived pitch black with no amount of soy that could help to lighten its color and taste. It's the best coffee I've had so far in LA but too bad it didn't come with a round of refill or two. The Blu Jam Benedict ($10.95) came with perfectly poached eggs gently laid on top of tender savory black forest ham and thick slices of crispy bacon over toasted croissant that was adorned with sweet golden hollandaise sauce. The plate was presented beautifully with a cup of fresh fruit with the croissant perfectly toasted to couple with a mix of runny yolk and hollandaise sauce. The meat combination became too salty after a while, and a few slices of fresh avocado could have helped the cause. The Florentine Benedict ($10.95) was lighter tasting with hollandaise covering two poached eggs that were served with fresh spinach, mushrooms, sundried tomatoes, brie cheese with toasted English muffin at the bottom. The taste was sweeter than the other Benedict and a dish I would recommend to those who don't want a lot of meat in the morning. Our only Czech dish on the table, Dabelska Omeleta (11.95) had a mix of ground beef, bacon, onions, roasted red bell peppers, spicy red paprika and mozzarella sandwiched between a three egg omelets that came in a crepe-like shape. The eggs were cooked evenly and the fillings were robust and generous.Finally, we shared a Brioche French Toast (10.95) which was impressively decked out with lots of fresh fruit with peaches cooked on the outer layer but still stiff at the center to mix with thick slices of bananas that tasted wonderfully with orange caramel sauce. The plate was glistening with wow factor and it is a dish that I highly recommend.Service was straight to the point but lukewarm and distanced. There were times when our dishes were pushed onto our already crowded table to make room which is not the most pleasant in the morning. Food-wise, this place is not in the league of Brenda's but is still a solid place for breakfast and brunch. I would be interested in coming back to try their French cuisine that is currently listed on their special menu.

Reviews.Author: Lica N.
Reviews.Content: Crunchy French Toast is what called me here and it did not disappoint!Came here on a Friday around 11am and the place was already packed.  I already knew before coming here what I was going to get so when we were seated I barely looked at the menu.  We were both planning to stick with breakfast, which they serve till 5pm but saw the special and they had Chicken Tinga on the menu so we got that to share to make it our own little brunch.Crunchy French Toast ~ yelp.com/biz_photos/ki5S… does this not look mouthwatering goooooood!  Well it was!!!  They are made with egg brioche dipped in batter, rolled in crunchy corn flakes, yup corn flakes!  Grilled and topped with fresh bananas and berries.  The vanilla bean sauce was so tasty.  Everything just all went well together.  I have to say this has topped my list of best french toast!Chicken Tinga ~ yelp.com/biz_photos/ki5S… Great flavor.  The chicken was moist and the feta cheese game it a nice creamy saltiness.  It also came with a small bowl of spicy black beans and they were spicy but good.As busy as this place was the service was steady.  Coffee was kept full. Eyes ~ This looks like it's gonna be a nice grubbing time!Nose ~ Oh the smell of something yummy to come!Mouth ~ Can eat another plate of those crunchy french toast!!Tummy ~ Perfectly satisfied with breakfast and lunch!

Reviews.Author: Max O.
Reviews.Content: Weekend brunch here is AWESOME! The food is tasty and the mimosas are the bomb!Really no negative things to say about Blu Jam except the wait can be 30-40 mins. Truly one of my favorite places to brunch in LA. Does not disappoint.

Reviews.Author: Jessica Y.
Reviews.Content: Kamil, you are thabomb.comBecause I was coincidentally their 900th reviewer for my favorite breakfast spot, I get a free 8-course dinner?Shrimp Ceviche: yelp.com/biz_photos/ki5S…Scallop Sashimi: yelp.com/biz_photos/ki5S…Burrata & strawberry brioche bites: yelp.com/biz_photos/ki5S…Beet Salad: yelp.com/biz_photos/ki5S…Seared Tuna sushi with "faux" paella yelp.com/biz_photos/ki5S…Chipotle Okra: yelp.com/biz_photos/ki5S…Ribs: yelp.com/biz_photos/ki5S…Tres Leches Cake: yelp.com/biz_photos/ki5S…...nope, that's not all! Kamil prepared 4 different kinds of wine to pair with these items.He said he's going to do it BIG for the 1,000th reviewer, so go try Blu Jam Cafe (or Blu Jam "Bistro" for dinner) and review. GET. ON. IT!

Reviews.Author: Cesar R.
Reviews.Content: 3 simple steps to being a real "man's man" in West Hollywood.1.  Go to Blu Jam Cafe2. Order a Vanilla Latte with a pretty butterfly and heart design3.  Raise cup, extend pinky and sip daintily.So...in all honesty I have never claimed to be a "real man" nor do I plan on becoming one in the near future...I am quite content in my girly ways thank you very much! =)WeHo breakfast is the plan...parking on the street is decent for a Monday morning around 11am...no wait for a table...friendly waitress.  My Vanilla Latte ($4.50) is pretty and delicious... yelp.com/biz_photos/ki5S… (excuse the blurry camphone pic please)Order up the Kamil's Breakfast which entails pan-roasted macaroni scrambled with eggs, savory ham, smoked bacon, garlic, chives, and tasty cheddar ($11.95)  yelp.com/biz_photos/ki5S… This thing is an undeniable gut-bomb in the best possible way.  Tasty macaroni with cheddar touching most every bite...delicious black forest ham with sprinkles of garlic and chives garnishing the scrambled eggs and of course complimenting the smoked bacon quite nicely....I could have used a BIT more bacon...but I survived...just barely.  ANYWHO....Mac n Cheese in a breakfast scramble!? genius.Bottom line...I left full and satisfied...now if I could only find a nearby MANLY spot for my long overdue mani/pedi and facial....I'd be FAAABULOUS!

Reviews.Author: John L.
Reviews.Content: On September 12, John L was pulled from the womb and saw light for the first time.  The angels rejoiced, clouds cleared, and all was well in Taipei, Taiwan.  Of his 34 lustrous years, he is the renown founder of the acronym SA and NSA and has create controversial yet breathtaking Asian Pose art.  On this glorious Sunday, my friends invited me to eat breakfast, drink imported beer, and watch American football.  The angels rejoiced, clouds cleared, and all is well in the City of Angels.Service - Excellent - The manager set us up with a private room and constantly updated our party when we can be seated.  Ms. Lauren (our server) was SUPER nice and attended to our every need.Cleanliness - Excellent - very cleanPrice - $203.71 (including tax and tip, 9 people)Seafood - Yes, salmonMeats - Yes, Turkey sausage, bacon, ham, beefVegetables - YesDessert - Yes, ask the server about today's selections of desserts.Fruits - YesOther - (1) Valet is $5.50 + 10% City Tax, (2) Metered parking along the street, (3) Dubbed "The Cities Best Breakfast" in 2008, (4) Per Blu Jam Cafe "We strive to use organic produce, fresh seafood and free range meats with no hormones.  We use nearby farms to support the local economy", (5) 18% gratuity for parties of six or more.What was ordered:Loxex ($13.95) - Good - 3 farmed fresh eggs scrambled with smoked Norwegian salmon, tomatoes, onions, and brie cheese.  The entree was topped off with sour cream and chives and sides of toast and potatoes.  They also provided me with a small packet of Rock View creamy butter and Smucker's strawberry jam.  I felt the smoked Norwegian salmon in the dish was a bit fishy for "my" taste.  However, the eggs were perfect and went well with the sour cream and chives.  I did not taste much of the brie cheese though, perhaps, the smoked salmon flavor masked it.  The potatoes are cooked like how bacon is cooked for baked potato--they have this nice crisp to them.  The whole wheat bread was delicious especially with the Smucker's strawberry jam--they give you other options of bread like white and rosemary as well.Crunchy French Toast ($11.95) - EXCELLENT-2-The-MAX!! - Egg brioche dipped in batter, rolled in crunchy corn flakes and grilled.  It was topped with fresh sliced banana, strawberries, and blue berries--served with vanilla bean sauce.  I actually did not order this, but Ms. F shared the last few bites of this heavenly creation.  The toast was toasted to perfection and had a wonderful crunch on the outside--yet spongy consistency on the inside.  Dip the crunchy French toast in the vanilla bean sauce and have a bite.  I must warn you, after you do this everything else in life ceases to exist.  You are within your own mind.  Your limbs and body become heavy--your body slumps.  Your mind is blown from flavor sense overload.  Please pull out paper and pen and write "I must get the Crunchy French Toast @ Blu Jam Cafe ... and make sure you are sitting down before consumption."The overall consensus at the table was that Yay!  We're fans of Blu Jam Cafe and would love to come back.  Everyone enjoyed the food and Ms. Lauren was very hospitable and displayed excellent customer service.  I can say that Blu Jam Cafe is a nice slice of food heaven.  On this wonderful Sunday, my mouth rejoices, food cleared, and my stomach is well ... and I'm freaking one year older.

Reviews.Author: Matt H.
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying that I have been lukewarm on Blu Jam Cafe from the get-go. It's over-priced, the wait is a joke, and frankly, their food is as ordinary as it gets. Plain and simple. However, today we had one of the WORST EXPERIENCES in food service/hospitality history, and I'm more than happy to tell you all about it. Blu Jam is located in the heart of Hollywood, where there are probably 100+ productions ranging from movies to TV shows of all shapes and sizes. We usually submit an order for 13-14 people on a daily basis to places all over Hollywood. Everyone is happy to accommodate, especially when they learn what TV show we are calling from. I won't namedrop, but sucks to be you, Blu Jam. To be honest, nobody has ever treated us as poorly as Blu Jam Cafe did today. We sent in our order via fax, which we have done as per usual. We were told "Sorry we don't accept orders for over 10 people." Crock of shit. We order from there weekly. What happened was that today they were understaffed and tried to put the onus on us. Sorry we wanted to give you our business. We won't be so stupid as to make that mistake in the future. We split the order in two to accommodate them. When we called the woman on the phone gave us major shit. "You're not too clever are you?" Meaning she thought she was a genius for figuring out that we split the order in two. We weren't exactly hiding it. We did it to be helpful. Everybody needs to eat. We just put the cast members names on a different order and sent it in. No biggie.HERE'S WHERE IT GETS GOOD. We sent our Writers' PA to pick up lunch, as we do on a daily basis. Our Writers' PA is the kindest soul on the planet, and shouldn't be treated so negatively. He takes a lot of shit from studio execs, divas, etc. I draw the line at letting him take shit from some dickbag manager with a Napoleon complex. The owner/manager/fascist that was running the joint today was a complete and total asshole. He screamed at our Writers' PA in front of the other patrons, added an enormous gratuity for "inconveniencing him," and generally acted like the biggest dickhead on the planet. If there's an award for assholery, this guy deserves it. Here's one thing you should know: you don't fuck with a room full of writers. It's our pleasure to take our talents online. Having said that, here are 5 other places just like Blu Jam, but much tastier, cheaper, and friendlier (in no particular order):1. Cafe 101 on Franklin and Gower. Delicious breakfasts, lunch, and dinners. The wait staff is great. Probably never yelled at a customer in their lives. For $11 you can get 2 eggs, 2 pancakes, 2 pieces of bacon, and hash browns. YUM! 2. Fred 62 on Vermont: a true L.A. establishment. Go for the brunch, stay for the hilarious t-shirts the wait staff wears. They're open late for post bar-hopping eats, too! 3. LuLu's on Beverly/Detroit. So much better than Blu Jam. Best omelette around town. We actually go here all the time so we don't have to wait in line with the assholes in Ed Hardy shirts over at Blu Jam on Saturday mornings. 4. Alcove on Hillhurst: A little pricey, but definitely worth it. Great drinks, great food, great atmosphere. This place shits on Blu Jam so hard it's a sick joke.5. The Griddle: Yep, there's going to be a long line on the weekends, but their food is worth the wait. Put your name down and take a stroll down Sunset. You won't be disappointed. All in all, I'd say it's been anything but a pleasure doing business with you. And to the asshole/dickbag manager: don't bother writing me an apology with a coupon on Yelp. Nobody  that works on our lot will be going within a five mile radius of your establishment. Enjoy your miserable life!! *PS: You also forgot one of our soups, geniuses. XOXOGossip GIrl

Reviews.Author: Marti L.
Reviews.Content: We came here for brunch. To stuff our faces with tasty food.The portions were decent. The ingredients were fresh. But it just felt too healthy.Roma Via Paris (yelp.com/biz_photos/ki5S…): Egg scramble with spinach, sun-dried tomatoes, zucchini, tomatoes, bell peppers, basil, goat cheese and mozzarella.  Even with all those ingredients, the scramble felt flat for me. It was lacking in flavor. Nothing that bind the taste of those fresh ingredients together. Similarly with the omelet, the dish failed to impress. Even the bacon didn't do anything. Personally, I didn't understand why everything was in such small pieces. The potatoes, even my scramble. I felt like a child being served already cut food.Full but not satisfied. It's a great place for health-conscious people. But that was far from what we wanted.

Reviews.Author: S K.
Reviews.Content: Thank you, Yelp.  Thank you for introducing to me to a gal that has fast become one of my dearest friends.  It is rare to find anyone these days to even label a "friend" but, Miss Tara M., and I are like long lost sisters from another mister.Sunday afternoon, Girl Day.  Shopping, mimosas, and lunch.  I really can't imagine spending this gorgeous LA day doing anything else.Tho, I don't consider Melrose a shopping destination.  The decline of this once hubbub of creative artists has been overrun by cheap, foreign, tacky shops filled with cheap, foreign, tacky chachkies.  BUT!!!  They do have Wasteland.  Which is, by far, the best used clothing store in LA. This is for another review... Moving on...Blu Jam is jam packed.  Wannabe actors, models, musicians, and "others".  We got lucky...  We were seated only a few minutes after we jotted our name down with the hostess.Our waiter was kind of a dorky but wanting to please, kinda guy.  I liked him.The mimosas are pricy.  $9 per glass.  But, tasty.  Made with fresh squeezed OJ.  Miss Tara had some sort of veggie scrambled egg concoction that was the  size of Stephen Hawking's brain.  It was delicious.  For me?  I felt like having lunch.  A sandwich and salad.  The food is very good.  Very typical but very good.  The salads are fresh, the dressing is light, and the portions are big.  This is a sign of a good Sunday Brunch.  We also had a free glass of mimosa due to a small error from our waiter.  Nothing to even blink an eye about but it was appreciated.Tummies full, warm heads full of champagne, cash in our pockets...  We're ready...."Oh!  Look Tara!  Charles Jourdan Pumps for $45!!!"Tara: "Sunny... put the pumps down... slowly...  that's it..  it's going to be ok..."

Reviews.Author: Jonathan T.
Reviews.Content: Oh daaaammmn.Here we go.I absolutely HATE to do this. Downgrading even LOWER to ONE STAR (I'd go lower if Yelp would let me present a big fat goose-egg).Anyone who's followed my reviews can see that I've NEVER called out a business owner, and although my displeasurely language may pull some powerful punches on a negative 1-2 star review (a relatively small percentage of my total review spew), I believe them all to be fair and in the spirit of subjective foodie-ism. HA! That's my DISCLAIMER and I'm sticking to it.Sooo...ummm...Just when i thought things couldn't get more grim with this joint--they did.I was planning on keeping it to myself, but I just can't contain my exasperation with the patronizing, snotty, insulting message I received today from the owner/chef in response to my TWO STAR review yesterday. His email message was punctuated with so many '??!!??!'  and '?!?'  that I thought my eyes were gonna cross.I'll spare you the blow by blow of every word/symbol that was slung my way today--i'll bury some of my emotion and just present you with the facts in this He Said/He Said faceoff:1) WHERE'S THE HOLLANDAISE?I SAID: 'Doodz, where's this chive-hollandaise sauce you speak of? Huh? it was in hiding.'  (meaning, i did not taste any such chive hollandaise on the egg, in the egg, around the egg, etc...)HE SAID: 'My hollandaise is made from scratch with egg yolks,melted clarified butter,cajun pepper,freshly squezed lemon juice,salt and white pepper.(perhaps you are used to the one from the can?!)I don't have a chive hollandaise on the menu either?!?'I SAY NOW:--WHOA. BIG Whoa. 'perhaps you are used to the one from the can?!'ok, Mr. Condescension, i DO very much know what a good hollandaise is, and i've had countless good hollandaisey dishes over the years at some fine effin' establishments--and I guess they are all from the CAN?!?--methinks NOT.HE SAID:'I don't have a chive hollandaise on the menu either?!?'I SAY NOW:--Wait an effin' minute-- I didn't make this up, Mr. Kamil Majer.I got this chive hollandaise idea from YOU YOURSELF!!!I suggest a) Take a look at your printed menu in the restaurant and you'll see it in black and whiteb) Go online to your OWN WEBSITE, blujamcafe.com, and you'll see that you've clearly identified it there as well.For your convenience, I've cut and pasted it here:Florentine BenedictPoached eggs on an English Muffin with sautéed spinach, fresh thyme, mushrooms,brie cheese, sun-dried tomatoes, and chive-hollandaise, served with potatoes 9.95c) Just a little FYI while we're on the topic of online menus and PRICING.  Many of your prices clearly haven't been updated in some time. The said 'Florentine Benedict' I had is listed as $9.95 on your online menu, when it's now $10.95. More glaringly disparate on the pricing is the 'Norwegian Benedict' I'd intended to order instead but forgot--It's $12.95 on your restaurant menu but THREE DOLLARS cheaper on your online menu at $9.95, and it's called the 'Gourmet Benedict' on your site. Time for a little updatey!2) LA PROVENCE SALAD AND PINE NUT NUTTERIESI SAID: 'Toss some of my fave goodies in a sea of mixed greens-- sun-dried tomatoes, artichoke hearts, 'fire-roasted' red bell peppers, goat cheese and pine nuts with balsamic vinaigrette, and whaddya get?D.O.A.--DRY ON ARRIVAL. :O(  everything, i mean, yea, sun-drieds are, well...dry. but dried out goat cheese? contracting shrinkage of greens and reds in me salad? NO BUENO!'HE SAID: 'We dress our salads very lightly,better then have them swimming in vinaigrette,but that is only my opinion!!You can always ask for more dressing.I don't know where you got pine nuts because i don't carry them at all!'AND I ONCE AGAIN RESPOND:Pine Nuts. Hmmmm. I wonder where I got some hallucinatory idea there were supposed to be PINE NUTS in this here Provence salad.Once again, Mr. Majer, please make sure to re-check your printed restaurant menu AND your online menu, which clearly states it in boldface type, and I cut and paste once again:La ProvenceOrganic mixed greens, sun-dried tomatoes, artichokehearts, fire-roasted red bell peppers, goat cheese andpine nuts with our balsamic vinaigrette 11.95Ok, I've pretty much said all there is to say, Mr. Majer.Good luck with your business....And please remember to get all the facts BEFORE you attack.This has not been fun, but it's something I needed to have said andDONE.

Reviews.Author: judy w.
Reviews.Content: Not sure why this place gets rave reviews. We arrived in the afternoon and the place was pretty empty. I had studied the menu quite fervently the night before and was very much looking forward to the "Blu Toast" - french toast stuffed with cream cheese and blueberry jam topped with bananas. I fracking LOVE anything and all that is blueberry so this was something I had to try. I don't eat out as much as I used to, so this was definitely a treat for me. And with so many great reviews I was very much looking forward to it!After we ordered, I was sitting there sipping and enjoying my organic coffee with free refills. Coffee was good. Then I remembered that the water was supposed to be infused with mint and lemon. I excitedly took a sip and was disappointed when all I tasted was pretty much tap water infused with chlorine - no mint or lemon detected at all. Which we felt was odd since we sat right next to pitchers of the mint/lemon water that had visible mint and lemon wedges in them. Bleh.Our food took a while to arrive and it wasn't even busy. At all. There may have been at most 3 - 4 other tables. I dug into my french toast and once again was disappointed. I had better blueberry jam in my fridge than what was used here! And it was not jam but jelly. There is a difference dangit. My side of bacon was all right. In fact, pretty flimsy and not at all crisp. But it IS bacon, so it was inhaled regardless.My meal was not bad and still edible. But honestly I could make a better breakfast! Three out of four of us felt the same. Jenn's Tex Mex tofu scramble was bland and Caroline's Olympus eggs were good, but not great. Lovey adored her meal though. I think it was the Roma Via Paris. I must mention that service, although sluggish at times, was friendly and I didn't have to ask for refills of my coffee once because I was offered them each time.The damage:  French toast $8.95Side of bacon $2.95Organic endless cup of coffee $1.95OUCH. Boy did that hurt.*sigh*Next time I crave breakfast, I might save myself the pain by making it myself..

Reviews.Author: Eileen E.
Reviews.Content: Important Edit! As noted by Kamil Majer (owner of Blue Jam) in his comment on my review, Blue Jam is going to stop offering their tapas menu on Wednesday, June 6th and is going to start offering their phenomenal cafe / brunch menu all day, from 8 AM to 9 PM instead. ______BLUE JAM IS OPEN FOR DINNER. I feel like more people need to not only know that, but also to *remember* that when it's dinner time! The reviews for BJC's dinner are overwhelmingly positive on yelp and yet, the restaurant was only half full when I came here to eat dinner last week. And that's definitely sayin something given Blue Jam's crazy line out the door during brunch. Blue Jam is also going to start serving their AMAAAAZING and super popular french toast at dinnertime starting in June so hopefully that will start drawing in the crowds!For dinner, BJC serves "medium" sized plates. So note that that's in relation to other places that might serve small plates. For two people, it's recommended that they order around 4 dishes. V and I ordered 5 but I could have stopped at 4 haha :). The menu has like 20 dishes to choose from so V and I took fooreeverr deciding on what to order. But! Never fear. I asked our waiter what were some of their most popular dishes and he was quite helpful.We had (in order from most to least favorite):Herb Crusted Lamb ($15) - omgoodness this was so, so good. The lamb is lightly breaded in a crispy savory crust and the inside is extremely tender and juicy. Perfectly cooked! It's also topped with a mint pesto - some more of that pesto would have been deeply appreciated :). It's also served with a veggie medley which consisted of brussel sprouts, peas, and currants. Beef Goulash ($12) - generous pieces of melt in your mouth beef smothered in a beer and red wine paprika gravy and topped with spatzel. This was quite good. V was eating the beef so daintily. I was wolfing this down haha. I looove this warm and hearty dish. If it had just a taaad bit more sweetness from the tomatoes (I assumed that there was tomatoes in the sauce?), it'd be perfect!Shrimp Ceviche BItes ($9) - shrimp, lime, salsa on a corn tortilla chip, topped with aioli. Very refreshing. Wonderful lime flavor and the texture of the plump shrimp was great. I thought the aioli was a little bit overpowering with the rest of the delicate flavors though. Still, I really enjoyed this and would recommend it. Cauliflower and Gorgonzola Soup for Two ($12) - pureed cauliflower soup with a warm cumin spice, topped with crumbled gorgonzola. The soup was good! I was commenting to V about how relaxed I felt when I was eating this. So warm and fulfilling. Pretty good and the portion was very generous for two people. Barramundi ($13) - seabass in a tarragon chili broth, served with the same veggie medley that accompanied the lamb. Even though seabass is my favorite type of fish, I think this dish was the least memorable out of the rest of the dishes. I also thought the broth was way too salty for me. Oh well. Everything else we had was quite enjoyable :).

Reviews.Author: Diana I.
Reviews.Content: FINALLY, after over a year of wanting to try this place, I finally got to go to Blu Jam Cafe for brunch with my bf!We got there a little after 11 AM and there were alot of people ahead of us waiting outside for a table. But after we put our name on the list, we got seated inside in less than 30 minutes. They also have outdoor seating too which is nice for a sunny day. If you have a long wait time, there's some cute boutiques nearby and across the street you can check out too.We shared two items:Florentine Benedict: "Poached eggs on a toasted English muffin with sautéed fresh spinach, mushrooms, sun-dried tomatoes, and brie cheese, topped with hollandaise, served w/ potatoes." The potatoes were SO good! Perfect amount of crisp in them. I hate when they're too soggy. The eggs were a little too runny for my taste but my bf loved it! I wish they had a little more sundried tomatoes though. I was digging for more! Overall, really good and I'd get this again.Brioche French Toast w/ berries & bananas. It came sprinkled with powdered sugar and maple syrup on the side. I thought this one was just okay... nothing too special about it but it was definitely yummy! I loved the blueberries! So fresh!Service was friendly, attentive and overall really good! But the decor/atmosphere indoors isn't anything super cute or spectacular. It's pretty plain yet cozy, with lots of random photos hung up across the walls. Pretty much just come here expecting some delicious breakfast food!

Reviews.Author: Tiffany N.
Reviews.Content: Every time Katie B picks a place for me to meet her for food we have some sort of celebrity sighting. But, it's never a big one. It's never like, "Oh look! It's Jennifer Aniston!" It's usually more like our table says, "Is that guy famous? I think so. Wasn't he in that one indie film in 2003? Oh yeah! He totally works in all of Judd Apatow's projects." And I still don't recognize him. This happened yet again at Blu Jam Café.Oh well. I'm not here for the celebrities; I'm here for the food. And that is one place where Bu Lam Café totally delivers.I ordered an herb and cheese scramble for brunch with the LA ladies and it came with a side salad and wheat toast. I've mentioned before how I'm so in love with breakfasts that come with side salads so this is another place to add to my ever-growing list that provide this treat. The scramble was quite nice. And although I think this is a hard dish to mess up, sometimes the herbs or the cheese are too strong or non-existent, but not here.The rest of our table had a mixture of savory and sweets and while I didn't try any of them they all looked fantastic. I did however try the coffee and it was seriously strong. I was jittery for hours afterward.So anyway, who was that famous guy we saw again?

Reviews.Author: David B.
Reviews.Content: I ate here (Sherman Oaks location)  for lunch, and had a half-salad and bowl of soup, $11.95.  They have a very interesting menu, and there are a lot of things I would want to try breakfast-wise (served all day).  The chicken cobb salad I had with my soup was delicious.  LOTS of crispy (not soggy) bacon, lots of gorgonzola cheese, delicious greens, avocado, diced tomato.  Even though it was supposedly a "half" it was plenty for me.  The split pea soup was good too, and it was a bowl, not a cup, on a half-and-half.  The waiter was friendly and efficient, and even made a nice suggestion about putting a little of the gorgonzola cheese in the soup, which I tried, and it was delicious.  It is kind of expensive for lunch for many people, I suppose, which would be my only grumble.

Reviews.Author: Barry W.
Reviews.Content: *** Chocolate crepes filled w/ walnuts & banana. ***Price: moderateDecor: moderateFood: GoodService: GoodPrkg: Street*** I would stop again if I'm in the neighborhood. ***

Reviews.Author: Kalyn R.
Reviews.Content: I am so sad that I am about to completely diss the Blue Jam Cafe! I had this cute cafe bookmarked for weeks and finally decided to try it this past weekend. While the staff was super nice/attentive, I had a few major issues that put the nail in the coffin for me to really like this place.Problems:1. We both ordered the eggs benedict with potatoes and expected something amazing (especially since there were 3 different options!). The potatoes were very greasy and the seasoning felt off - I've never met a potato I didn't like until now.2. The hollandaise sauce was very sweet and lemony. Definitely not what you would expect for a savory egg dish. I'm not sure if there are different styles of hollandaise and maybe a few people really like the sweeter taste, but for us, it was unappetizing.3. The eggs were almost hardboiled and not runny. Sad, especially for eggs benedict.4. I ordered a vanilla latte as a last ditch effort to taste something good, and it was overly sweet with a very watery/coffee taste. I drink coffee everyday from a variety of places, so I am used to everything from budget to Urth Caffe. I would not order coffee from here again based on that cup.I'm was hoping to try Blu Jam again and order pancakes or french toast. I saw a few plates pass our way and they looked amazing. Unfortunately, I probably won't be back based on my first experience.

Reviews.Author: Roland L.
Reviews.Content: This place just keeps getting better and better with all the different dishes I try!Dined here for breakfast last Saturday right when Blu Jam opened with my buddies Mark & Rico D. It was both their first time there. I have been wanting to go back since the last time I ate here and was contacted by Kamil.This time I tried the Migas. OMG!!! For a dish containing chorizo, there was little grease. I'm impressed! Awesome flavor with a little kick from the chipotle and jalepeño! Will definitely order this one again!It is evident that Kamil ensures his patrons have an impeccable dining experience. Rico D had a minor incident with his dish and the manager quickly acted, took his meal off the bill and also gave us a complimentary order of Lemon Crepes, which are phenomenal by the way!Make sure you try this charming place out. I think you'll be rapidly and thoroughly impressed!

Reviews.Author: Dave A.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam CafeWas the place Jammin'?  Well, Jam packed perhaps.Blu? I did feel a little bit Blu after leaving.Cafe? Yes, but where was the coffee? The food came before the coffee and I was dying for a cup!Met my Dad here after a silly miscommunication between us. He was waiting for me in the Canters parking lot. Once we got it straight, he arrived before me and got a space out front using his handicap placard. Me, well crap, Melrose Ave has become so bourgeoisie they charge you to park at a meter on SUNDAY.Things started well as we were greeted by the model runway host who I swear could have been Miss Norway. But once seated we became invisible. I must say though that once the food was served we were treated very well. Coffee and water refills were plentiful, we were asked how we were doing, and at the end told to just relax and stay as long as we wanted.I appreciated that muchly, but the residue from the initial lack of attention stuck with me. It reminded me how wait-staff really MUST be mostly actors because they can employ that "invisible wall" technique between themselves and the audience (or customer) so well when they need to.The food looked beautiful. My Dad's Panini sandwich was a work of art. The bread a perfect brown, veggies poking out the sides of the bread tempting one to take a bite. My "Salmon Cake Benny" was a symphony in color, balance, and shape. I substituted home potatoes for the micro greens, the rest being poached eggs over home-made salmon cakes. The eggs were perfectly poached, however the salmon cakes were far too salty and the whole thing was only luke-warm. Although the potatoes were sprinkled with rosemary, there were just too many stems, and they were more of an adornment. They may not have actually been cooked with the potatoes which were strictly average, chopped and fried up potatoes.The prices? Ouch. Had everything tasted as good as it looked, that Ouch might be a Yum, but oh well.As far as ambience, the place is enjoyable. Upscale, dark woods, brick, well dressed tattooed and mohawked wait-staff, lots of smiles, but lots of stress too due to the extreme jamming of tables for two up the middle isle. I'd hate to see the place during a fire, things would get ugly quick. (Although I learned a lesson from George Castanza on how to deal with that situation)Over all, I was left non-plussed and not even curious to try it again. But what a great name this place has, too bad it doesn't quite live up to it.

Reviews.Author: Kristina P.
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite breakfast place in Los Angeles. I try to go here at least every other Sunday.I have tried the California Omelet and the French Toast (always with a side of bacon). Very tasty.

Reviews.Author: Caroline Y.
Reviews.Content: Although my lunch ladies were fabulous...I can't say that about the food. I'm trying to eat healthier and make it a lifestyle because I am getting older, my metabolism is getting slower and because I wanna lose 15 to 20 pounds. So...I ordered from their health and fitness menu. The Olympus scramble. It was very bland but I was hungry so I ate it all with Tapatio. I mean, it wasn't bad but it was just not a party in my mouth. I guess I expected this place to be really good because of the great reviews. But alas...The Larchmont Princess was a bit disappointed. I think Love is the only one who loved her food. Judy and Jenn were on the same page as I was. The prices were reasonable I guess. The service was decent. But you know what? We didn't get the yummy lemon mint water eveyone raved about. We got what tasted like plain tap water. Booooooo....

Reviews.Author: Janine R.
Reviews.Content: "Well, I could've been an actor, but I wound up here. I just have to look good, I don't have to be clear." Okay, maybe that's not what the hostess said, but I was pretty surprised that it actually did take the 20 out of the 15-20 minutes she said it would take to seat us at 1:30, though there were empty tables, not sure how they do things though. No biggie, I expected the wait."People love it when you lose. They love dirty laundry" (thanks Don Henley). This is true sometimes and maybe this is why I've been avoiding writing negative reviews for the past couple of months, I haven't wanted to take part in the schadenfreude of writing a bad review. Actually, I take it back, I really don't like writing bad reviews.The dirty laundry phenom is why Blu Jam Cafe is lucky that my camera didn't have a memory card in it this morning. When my water came (way late on a really hot afternoon) in a glass with rather large pieces of visible dirt caked on it "Dirty Laundry" started thumping away in my head. Both the server and the guy who seemed to be the manager were very concerned about it and fixed it eventually. So that's fine, I guess. It's even better that the song started playing about two minutes later!Our food came, and though room temperature, was presented very attractively. I had hesitated before ordering the French toast with bananas, blackberry jam, and yogurt because I'm a French toast fiend and I cannot stand undercooked FT. With my basic distaste and distrust for the human race, my instinct alarm bell sounded and screamed at me to just get eggs. Sadly, I didn't and wound up with a fluffy sweet mush mess with a side of Mrs. Butterworth syrup. I'm sorry--say what.SAY WHAT?SAY WHAT?Yes, that's right. When I tried to cover up the sickening undercooked mushy egg of the yogurt/blackberry jam smothered French toast (this is the reason I didn't ask them to throw it back on the grill, because they would have to totally remake the dish) with syrup, I realized it was not maple syrup, but imitation maple flavored syrup. Dear god, does anyone have any ipecac? I couldn't even look the waiter in the eye as I left the restaurant. I was eating corn syrup with maple flavoring. Did I fall asleep at the breakfast table in a cafe and wake up in a diner?PS. If you read down to the "sides + extras" the very last item is maple syrup. You can order it for an extra $1.50. I didn't realize this until after after the incident, because I didn't read this part of the menu--what's next, charging more to get my food fully cooked? At least they didn't seat me in the pillow pile this time.

Reviews.Author: Love C.
Reviews.Content: Girly Brunch #2My breakfast during lunch here totally made up for the less than mediocre food from Girly Brunch #1 (Solar de Cahuenga).   The sounds coming out of my mouth on Saturday hadn't been heard by the human ear in a long-ass time!  You know... things like... mmmm... ahhhh... oooohh....  oh-my-GOD, it's soooo good... I want more!  Um... yeah.... moving on... I had the Roma Via Paris - Three farm fresh eggs scrambled with spinach, sun-ripened tomatoes, zucchini, cherry tomatoes, fresh basil, Chevrier goat cheese and mozzarella, served with potatoes and toast - minus the potatoes... I had the mixed baby greens instead, with balsamic vinaigrette - $8.95.  I think that's a totally reasonable price, considering my usual brunch joints are so much more!  I also had 2 pots of the Jasmin-Peach tea, which I couldn't get enough of, it was so goooood!  I think that was $2.95.  If it weren't for my lovely friends helping me with the complicated pot, I wouldn't have had a drop in my mouth!  So thank you, ladies! I thought the service was fine too... every time I asked for something, it came really quickly.  It's unfortunate the other 3 girls didn't enjoy their meals as much as I enjoyed mine!  Maybe it's because I'm still on Weight Watchers... so even the slightest bit of food makes me happy?  Nah.... it really was good!  And for the 15 points that I consumed in just one meal... it better have been!!!!

Reviews.Author: Sharr K.
Reviews.Content: I am ashamed that I have only ordered coffee to go with most of my visits at Blu Jam Cafe. I finally decided to order Veggiewich to go (fresh tomato, argula, basil, avocado, roasted red bell peppers, yellow beets, pesto aioli & provolone on whole wheat).  **Note, the picture does not do any justice (yelp.com/user_local_phot…).I have to tell you....this is probably one of the best sandwiches I have ever tasted. I was not expecting anything spectacular but the explosion of different flavors really took me by surprise. I brought my sandwich in while getting my manicure.  All the girls in the salon were salivating while I ate and asked where I got it.  It was a pretty big-sized sandwich at $11.95 and came with a side of salad, fruit or fries. I ate half and saved the second half for dinner. The service is always spectacular. I went during rush hour and ended up waiting close to 25 mins. However each service staff I connected with was very helpful and friendly. I will definitely be coming back....totally sold on Veggiewich.

Reviews.Author: Natalie M.
Reviews.Content: What else can you say about this place that hasn't already been said?...The food is DAMN good, every SINGLE time...regardless of what you get....I was prompted to write this review for my brunch experience this past Sunday. I recently became a fan of French Toast....yeah, I know....I've been hiding under a rock!....and heard the glowing reviews about Blu Jam's Crunchy French Toast which is only served on weekends so I had no choice but to try it. Literally no choice. And everything those people said about that French toast....was an UNDERSTATEMENT!!!!!....it was......wow....I'm foaming at the mouth as I'm writing this.....spectacular. Friggin SPECTACULAR! I generously coated the toast in some salted butter and lathered it in their white cream sauce and asked for regular maple syrup too....you can never have too much maple syrup....or butter for that matter! The crunchy exterior and the soft interior of the bread and the contrast of the salty butter and sweet syrup combination was Earth shattering! I wiped my plate clean. Ohhhhhhh...HAHA....did I mention I also got the Huevos Rancheros? And killed that plate TOO! The friend I was with knows by now how much food I can put away but it was the WAITER, Jason, that was left speechless "How?...Did you?....::looks under the table::...."Really?....."Yes. Really! And you better believe I'll be back for round two, Jason....I might spring for 3 plates next time...

Reviews.Author: Jinkzz M.
Reviews.Content: Came here with my niece and nephews, tow of whom are visiting from Wales, one Monday morning.  Surprisingly there was no lines so they were able to get a table right away.  Our server was very friendly and attentive.  The interior and decor was tasteful and noise level wasn't too bad.The food was amazing.  Three out of four had Benedict and one had the smoke salmon platter.  We also ordered crunchy french toast to share.  Everything was really good but I was too full from the Benedict that I was only manage to eat one slice of the french toast.  Parking can be a hassle since we had to park in the street but that's to be expected in the area.

Reviews.Author: Yelper X.
Reviews.Content: Do you have any idea how much I struggle with giving any Melrose establishment 5 stars? But sure enough, Blu Jam deserves it.I can't stand crowds. So the only way I can ever do the Blu is to Jam in on a Wednesday morning at 9am... just late enough in the morning for the parking situation to become available on Melrose and just early enough that most people who actually would ever live in and around Melrose would not be up and about.With the place nearly empty at 9, and my date running 45 minutes late, I had plenty of time to surf the net and start on my first cup of tea. Scratch that. Not cup. My first french press of tea, complete with steamed milk. Already winning me over.Order up some of the classic stuffed french toast ($10.95) with a side of bacon ($2.95 for 3 strips), and I'm solidly happy that I crawled out of bed with just 3 hours of sleep. Tender brioche perfectly dressed in egg wash topped with blackberry jam, yogurt (ok, they were a little stingy with the yogurt), strawberries, blue berries and bananas! Who knew the party in my mouth could start so early?And who would have ever thought the service could be so good? Our server was awesome! Between my date and I, we had all sorts of weird food requests, time constraints, spacial issues that even Freud would struggle to work out... but our server stood by us, making sure everything ran smoothly. Seriously, the guy is a stud in my book for handling us the way he did.And bonus of all bonuses for those of us enjoying the fruits of unemployment... every Monday through Friday Blu Jam offers great breakfast specials for under $8. You best believe I will be back to try the eggs bennie at that price!

Reviews.Author: Jenn L.
Reviews.Content: the warm color palette made for a very inviting interior. Just a few minutes prior, a sweet metered spot on Melrose was scored, so lunch was starting off on the right foot. my yelpette companions arrived to do battle, half of them had perused the menu the night before or read the reviews. After noticing several veg options, i decided to go with the tex-mex tofu scramble and potatoes. My request for S*P*I*C*Y prompted the waitress to ask "would you like us to add jalepenos?" yes, please. Breakdown: tofu scramble - kinda blah, for all the ingredients thrown in (bell pepper, black beans, cilantro, 'cado) it was seriously lacking some seasoning. thankfully, a bottle of tapatio gave it some life.potatoes were delish, pretty close to the perfection i've had at Figtree Cafe. you get only one piece of toast cut in half, its a big piece but i'm a hungry hippo and used to two slices of bread. : x  I was looking forward to the infused water and it was such a bummer to get tap water. :(  i'm bitter i admit it. I wouldn't go out of my way to stop by here again but I appreciate veggie items peppered through the menu. The coffee and hot tea are organic (Whoot!). Street parking on Melrose or nearby side streets.

Reviews.Author: Amor L.
Reviews.Content: We came here on a Saturday morning, my Love planned the day for us and it started at the Blu Jam Cafe...I can't remember if he heard about this place in a magazine...but he wanted to try it out. We arrived kinda early, or at least we thought we did...we had to wait a bit, but what my boyfriend really liked was that they text you when your table is ready so you don't have to stand around, you can walk around Melrose and look at the shops for a bit. When we were seated, we looked at the menu, my boyfriend had read that they Kamil's Breakfast and the Crunchy French Toast was really good, so we decided to split that. They have fresh squeezed juices, I went with what I like, fresh squeezed OJ :) and my boyfriend got the orange juice with....grapefruit....if I remember correctly...mine was better =p The food was good, the french toast was really crunchy and the syrup was really sweet, it was a really good combination, I would say that the french toast was better than the pasta, but the pasta was really filling, it had so much going on with the cheese, egg and bacon (I LOVE BACON). The waitress was really nice and the service was really good . I'm glad we were able to try it out :)

Reviews.Author: Jenn C.
Reviews.Content: Parking: Street Decor: Small, simple, and cozyAmbiance: Busy and energeticService: Very friendly and attentive despite the busy crowd.Price: Typical LA brunch prices. $9-$17.Food: Delicious! Try the Rancheros and Migas.Verdict: Def a must try on Melrose!Tip: Sit outside to enjoy the sunny weather and to people watch.

Reviews.Author: Forrest D.
Reviews.Content: Generally with breakfast it's a good idea not to reinvent the wheel, but it's also nice when someone puts a fresh spin on things without insulting the original. Blu Jam Cafe does a good job of balancing that fine line. Located in the trendy part of Melrose, at least trendy once upon a time, it full of hipsters, wanna-be hipsters and never-will be hipsters. There also seems to be a steady flow of C list celebrities whose faces are vaguely familiar but don't seem to warrant much actual attention, so the Midwest tourists flocking the boulevard will be in reality tv heaven here. And there is a line, always a line. The house Benedict is traditionally good here, most eggs are just eggs so it's all in the poaching which they've got pitch perfect here, and the sauce which has a time tested flavor to it. The roasted potatoes are slightly off kilter with a hint of ginger. If there were just the benedicts, this would be a pretty solid breakfast stop, but the French Toast puts this place right over the top into somewhere quite special. Crunchy French Toast is a remarkable combination of brioche French Toast and corn flakes fried on the outside. It's not entirely original, Marstons in Pasadena has had this dish for years, but it's not nearly as successful there. It's also incredibly sweet, more dessert-like than anything, so if that's not your thing you should probably stay far away. Judging by the number of orders coming out of the kitchen, it seems it's by far the most popular dish on the menu, and with good reason. It's quite easily one of the best French Toast in the city, anywhere.There are many other options to choose from, but there's really no reason to wander from these two options. There's some nice but limited outdoor seating in front, and and a cozy interior thats bathed in a warm and inviting orange. Though it's quite busy, the staff is overall organized, quick and friendly and the food comes quickly. The menu is pretty extensive, there's something for most everyone and prices are standard for this type of place.One bite of their French Toast will make hanging out with Pookie, or Snookie or whoevers about at the moment, not only bearable but entirely memorable.Best Plates: Blu Cafe Benedict, Cruncy French ToastPalate: MainstreamFood - AAmbience - BService - A-Value - B+

Reviews.Author: Seung Eun C.
Reviews.Content: My husband wanted to cry =***(His breakfast arrived on a huge plate. Two eggs over easy, two pieces of measley sausage, and 2 smaller pieces of french toast.WTH?Half the plate was empty...  Come on...  Throw in some potatoes or add some parsely to garnish..  The plating was so Norms...  So Dennys!!  So underwhelming!Anyways, the saving grace was my egg sandwich panini. It was toasted beautifully with aioli sauce, egg, bacon, and avocado.  Delicious.I could have eaten the whole thing, but offered half of my sammich to my poor starving husband who was salivating with my every bite..  Sad...  keke.IMO, breakfast is all about big portions and who doesn't want to pig out?Hopefully I can talk my husband to come back here again..  I mean, we live right up the street......

Reviews.Author: Eli G.
Reviews.Content: Burger #168: The Brunch BurgerAfter a fabulous breakfast at Griddle Café the week before, we were hoping to continue our streak of great morning meals. I don't recall if we chose Blu Jam because they had a burger or if something else from the menu oddly called out to me. Regardless, once there the double egg topped burger cried out to me in such a way that I had no hope of saying no.Once the burger arrived, I realized I had been duped. The old bait and switch, it was a Monet, beautiful from afar but once you get your face right up to the meat of it, it loses its appeal. yelp.com/biz_photos/ki5S…The picture doesn't do justice to the impossible mound of discarded, unfertilized chicken remnants and ground up cow. The thing was a behemoth. Too tall to bite properly and with the TWO fried eggs on top, I knew I'd need beach towel to clean myself up afterwards. Yeah yeah, but how was the flavor? Meh. With that much protein, you need a good helping of salt and then a little more after that. This ex-animal meal lacked seasoning in a big way. The players were all there though, the bun was nice, the burger cooked to a nice medium-rare, the bacon was thick and crisp, and both eggs had beautifully runny yolks. I wasn't the biggest fan of the thick slice of cooked tomato, as it stole too much of the show. Making a reasonable breakfast/brunch burger is harder than it would seem apparently. My advice to Blu Jam; 1) you don't need two eggs, that's just silly, 2) don't cook the tomato or use a much thinner slice, I want to taste burger not salad, and most importantly 3) salt is your best friend, don't be afraid to give the meat a good dousing of it, and no the bacon doesn't provide enough for the entire burger. Oh and the wife got some veggie packed BS, it was good;yelp.com/biz_photos/ki5S…

Reviews.Author: Eunice K.
Reviews.Content: I have been dying..... DYING to try Blue Jam Cafe. BF lives walking distance down Melrose... but everytime we go the wait is over 45 minutes. RIDICULOUS! One morning the stars aligned and we both had a weekday off - and we were off to Blu Jam!Now I know why there is a 45 min wait - the service is UTTERLY slow. Our simple breakfast took over an hour.. why? They took their sweet time taking our order, bringing out our food, bringing our check, etc. We literally sat at the restaurant waiting for someone to take our order for 15-20 min. After 30-40 min went by (with still no food) we decided we better refill our parking meter.--Eggwich ($12.95)--Thick sandwich - packed with eggs, bacon, avocado, tomato, arugula, pesto all between 2 thick Focaccia bread. Flavor bomb - BF ate it up! Next time I would sub the Focaccia bread for something else (too thick) and hold the mayo. It was a bit heavy and all the flavor comes from the pesto anyway!--Smoked Salmon Platter ($12.95)--Simple and yet delicious! A make-your-own-platter... came with strips of smoked salmon, red onions, capers, cream cheese, tomatoes, cucumbers and an onion bagel. The salmon made the platter - salty, smokey, DELICIOUS!I appreciated the huge portions, wide menu selection, and outdoor seating. However, the slow service was annoying!

Reviews.Author: Natalie K.
Reviews.Content: All time favorite breakfast spot in LA! wow! You must try their crunchy French toast!! My boyfriend and I always split the French toast and get a plate for ourselves. My fav plate is their blu jam Benedict! YummmOh and we've never had to wait longer than 10 mins to be seated.

Reviews.Author: Sun K.
Reviews.Content: Love the atmosphere here. Great music choices for the time of day (slightly upbeat in the mornings not too slow) and it's not too noisey. The waiter seems to fit in too bc he had a smooth voice so I kind of melted XDI got the crunchy french toast and I think I died for the first couple of minutes savoring the crunchy yet soft fluffiness of the toast. It was kind of orgasmic until it got cold :(

Reviews.Author: Ariane R.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam does dinner these days, and my goodness do they do it well!  From service to flavors, this was one of the best meals I've had in L.A.Everything is tapas style, and there's an excellent range of dishes including plenty of veggie options.  All the sauces were unique and DELICIOUS.  We had five plates between us, and took home the better half of 2-3 of those; then again, we're on the smaller side.  Blu Jam focuses on local ingredients, all the way down to highlighting which farms the produce comes from, and many of the meats are humanely raised/organic.  Of all the dishes we sampled, the only one I wouldn't repeat is the cheese plate, as that was pretty run of the mill.  The stand out dishes were shrimp in a chili/honey/lime sauce and asparagus w/a fried egg and delectable vinegary aioli.  Service was prompt and friendly and courses came at a good pace.Blu Jam will likely establish itself before long as a dinner destination as much as it already is a brunch one, given what an excellent job they're doing.  We'll be back soon- and often.

Reviews.Author: Craig R.
Reviews.Content: Yes, I am a fan! I frequent this spot on a regular basis. I try to grab a bite before the pretentious, want-to-be seen crowd arrives.Blu Jam cafe is one of the best spots in L.A. for breakfast or brunch. It's small and cozy and the food is fantastic. I would recommend the popular Eggwich, Breakfast Quesadilla or the Normandie Omelette. Service can be slow but they are very, very busy here. I also recommend Chef Kami's soups of the day; they are light, healthy and flavorful.Great place to bring friends, family or a date and prices are reasonable. The owner is personable and will treat you like a friend. Visit early on the weekends because the place gets crowded.

Reviews.Author: Rachel M.
Reviews.Content: This review includes two trips since I've dined here that past two Sundays. It's that yummy, and it's my new favorite brunch spot. Mocha Latte (5 stars) - This tasty latte is how I like to start my Sunday morning. I also love the latte art.  Blu Jam Benedict (3.5 stars) - The eggs were poached perfectly with a lovely hollandaise sauce. The addition of bacon was nice touch. The croissant sounded like a good idea but wasn't toasty enough that ended up being a soggy mess.French Toast (5 stars) - This brioche french toast is simple but done right. Crunchy French Toast (4 stars) - I liked the crunchy texture but still prefer the regular french toast. It comes with a vanilla bean sauce, but I requested some maple syrup as well.Steak Hash (4 stars) - There is a good portion of tender steak with poached eggs, potatoes, mushrooms, and onions. It's very filling that I love stealing a few bites from my boyfriend's plate.Service (4 stars) - Service is good especially for a very busy place. Everyone is nice and friendly.A few items such as the Crunchy French Toast and Steak Hash are only offered during the weekends. I'm glad I finally tried this place, and I'll definitely be back very soon to try other menu items.

Reviews.Author: Richard W.
Reviews.Content: Best breakfast in Los AngelesBeen a fan of the Melrose location since 2006 Finally a GREAT place in the Valley, Welcome to Sherman OaksGreat crunchy french toast, Awesome eggs benedict with the best hollandaise west of the Mississippi, take it from a former New Yorker.Try Kamil's  Goulash, your Grandma from Eastern Europe will be looking down at you with a huge smile!!!DickEncino

Reviews.Author: Lolo M.
Reviews.Content: It's certainly not Blu Jam's fault that I was seated next to a 17 year old white rapper that thought I wanted to hear all his thoughts on MSG, but it didn't help their cause. Hey jackass, how bout next time you pump DOWN the volume??My scramble wasn't amazing and my coffee was lukewarm. My fruit salad was good though and generally, that's the fastest way to my heart anyway.I would try again, but I would go for French toast or pancakes instead. The good service and the smell of syrup still gives me faith in this place, but I wouldn't agree they're worthy of  the ol' best breakfast in LA banner proudly hung outside. Plus, isn't it kinda cheesy to hang a banner? Don't brag. Just let the food do the talking. But don't let it talk as loud as Notorious MSG did.

Reviews.Author: Amy K.
Reviews.Content: Oh fuck me, I made the mistake of coming back here with my bf over the weekend and we came at the death hour. 11am on a Saturday, they oh so casually said the wait is TWO AND A HALF HOURS and said we can go do stuff for thirty minutes but we must be back before. I felt like I was 5 again and my teacher was telling me this shit like she was giving me an extra piece of candy. We left and went to Salt's Cure which was amazing. (I also totally ate across from Jeff Goldblum at Salt's so there!!!!!!!!!!!!!!)

Reviews.Author: Pam S.
Reviews.Content: Yesterday my best friend Virginia and I came to enjoy the famous Eggs Benedict... we got here pretty early but there was a wait and it was HOT AS HADES outside! Every year Virg and I do the AIDS Walk so we pass this place and always say hmmm that looks good :) so yesterday was OUR day! Florentine Eggs Benedict with Brie, mushrooms, sun-dried tomatoes and spinach was tasty... I ordered the Blu Jam Benedict which has thinly sliced (flavorful) Black Forest Ham and Bacon their Hollandaise sauce with the poached egg was Fantastic! and the breakfast potatoes were yummy too. They serve the Mimosas in a stemless flute and generously fill it SCORE!! We did table stalk and by "table stalk' I mean look at other patrons plates while they were noshing LOL That Crunchy French Toast (which is what they are known for) is presented beautifully and every guest that ordered it left no trace when handing over their plate to the bussers LMAO!! Tight, cozy spaces. Nice ambiance in the interior. Good AC for a balmy hot "end-of-summer" morning and staff was super cool and not intrusive at all. Respectfully Reviewed

Reviews.Author: Bugs B.
Reviews.Content: Hoorah! LA Bite delivers Blu Jam Cafe! We are definitely going to be ordering from Blu Jam Cafe more --screw Toast and their soggy food. I ordered the Venetian Chicken (Marinated flame-broiled chicken breast, melted mozzarella, pesto, mayo, fire-roasted red bell pepper and fresh tomato), which was so good and filling. I gave my other 1/2 to my colleague Su-poo and she loved it as well; I have good taste. They allowed me to substitute the organic mixed greens with their Caesar Salad.  Another colleague ordered their Cobb Salad, which looked like a master piece- the best looking Cobb Salad ever. I wished I had my camera with me...I'm going to order their Cobb Salad the next time around. The down-side to BJC is that they don't have French Fries...only Home Potato Fries.  Nonetheless, I still love BJC!Update 2/1/09: Ok, here's the pic of the Cobb salad: yelp.com/biz_photos/ki5S…. It's much better than the Chicken Caesar Salad (don't order it -plain)yelp.com/biz_photos/ki5S….  My boss said you should skip the Veggie Burger: yelp.com/biz_photos/ki5S…   It looks heavy...

Reviews.Author: Bonnie W.
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. Good customer service and perfect for brunch. I love the french toast with vanilla dip at the side. And also the Benedict is okay, you can get it elsewhere which taste almost the same. But the french toast is a must try!

Reviews.Author: Victoria T.
Reviews.Content: Their iced mocca with almond milk literally tastes like ice cream churned with the clouds of heaven. The food here is also good, but very pricey!

Reviews.Author: Cici T.
Reviews.Content: A solid breakfast joint that's a cross between homey (think brick walls, orange paint, and small brown tables) and hip (mini bar and young wait staff). I wasn't so convinced that Blu Jam would deliver after perusing their expansive menu. I typically think "less is more".But the first taste of my Roma via Paris sure showed me. Blu Jam isn't necessarily creative in throwing dishes together, but the quality of the ingredients is unmistakable. Take my Roma via Paris - the eggs were bright yellow, soft and billowy, the cheese was fully melted (never rubbery, absolutely creamy). The sundried tomatoes, spinach, zucchini, bell peppers, and tomatoes were vibrant in color and perfect in texture. A taste of farm freshness if you will.And for the carb happy.. the toast was fresh! Warm, soft, and perfect for a smear of jelly and butter.The California omelette is STUFFED with bacon. There will be no skimping on ingredients here. D, a self-proclaimed carnivore said, "Can you believe it? Even I think there's too much bacon in here!" Hey, if there's too much, you can take it out, but you can't work with too little can you?

Reviews.Author: K R.
Reviews.Content: I love the crunchy French toast with vanilla sauce and the organic black tea!! The French toast is best shared. I recommend getting different entrees and splitting them with your friends. The ambiance is nice. Friendly staff. The music isn't loud, so it was nice for conversation or reading. I've been several times over the years since it is one of my neighborhood restaurants in walking distance. Fortunate for the restaurant, but unfortunate for me, it's gained popularity and now gets crowded.

Reviews.Author: Anna S.
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat this place. The food here is GREAT. Kamil really has built an LA institution and it's reputation is well deserved. I'm fortunate enough to be walking distance and I am so thankful a place of this caliber exists in my hood. The Mr and I typically share an order of the Crunchy French Toast & Migas so we have the best of the sweet and the savory covered. Go before 10a to beat the rush.

Reviews.Author: Max W.
Reviews.Content: I had the Blu Toast this morning.  That's french toast with cream cheese and black berry preserve in between 2 slices, and fresh blueberries, strawberries, and banana on top.  Only, they forgot to put the black berry preserve in mine so there was nothing but plain cream cheese inside.  It still tasted pretty good.  This was day one of my quest to find the best french toast.  I have some general ideas of who the contenders are, and a clear favorite in mind that I'm comparing too.  This was a good start with overall very solid FT.  I'll probably stick to the Lost Bread option when I return (which is sans cream cheese).  When done right I believe cream cheese filled FT can be the ultimate, but it wasn't executed here today.  What this had going for it was the nice and thick brioche slices, the high grade fresh fruit, good maple syrup, and proper crusting of the egg batter on the outside.  If I really nit pick, I believe that the inside was a bit underdone due to either the slices being a bit thicker than optimal, or them not being allowed to soak up enough of the egg batter into the inside.This is a really good example of what good french toast should taste like, and a great jumping off point for my journey into french toast-dom.Other things I liked include: The flavored water, the friendly staff, the fair prices(and special pricing before 11am), the egg dish I had in my previous visit, and the outdoor seating on a beautiful day with my dogs.

Reviews.Author: Selena L.
Reviews.Content: Los Angeles is one of the only places in the world where you feel appropriately dressed wearing pajamas in public. I learned my lesson the hard way, after getting dolled up one morning to realize that everyone else in the eatery was sporting workout gear. My murderer did try to warn me, gesturing to his own outfit consisting of track pants and a tee shirt, saying, "In Los Angeles, this is the equivalent of a tuxedo." Message received, killer. From now on, it's camo shorts and bra-free for me.Blu Jam's our joint for Tuesday morning breakfast: a five minute jaunt around the corner from home, and a guaranteed fine meal. Service can be either slow and lacking or timely and effusive. I'll overlook all of this because of a finely crafted California club, and I HATE sandwiches. Well, hated, since I've now taken to pressing anything between two slices of bread and calling it a meal. Since I first tried the California club at Blue Jam, I've been unable to order anything else on repeat visits. Generously portioned to the point of needing to unhinge my jaw to eat, and served with choice of home fries or mixed greens, I can't resist. Slices of cucumber in the water are a nice touch, and I'm a sucker for French pressed tea. If you're one of those odd birds who don't gravitate towards traditional breakfast foods in the morning, their lunch menu is also available. While nothing is particularly innovative or newfangled, the offerings are well-executed and classic. They say breakfast is the most important meal of the day, and if you're starting your morning off at Blu Jam, you'll leave sated and satisfied, knowing that you did at least one thing right. Sometimes, that's all you need to get you through the day. Well, that and another sandwich at lunch.

Reviews.Author: Cal K.
Reviews.Content: I went on a Sunday afternoon and it was about a 35 minute wait for 2 people. It may be a long wait for some, but Sunday brunch is always a wait. Getting the Crunchy French Toast was worth going to this place. Its such a tasty dish with crunchy corn flakes on top. You will see that almost all of the tables had someone getting this dish. I also ordered the Smoked Salmon Platter. The entire plate was fresh and it had a great variety of items on the dish to make a delicious bagel sandwich. This is place is so good and I will definitely go back to this place when I'm in LA for the Crunchy French Toast.

Reviews.Author: Duyhien N.
Reviews.Content: Just dined there.  Honestly one of the worst brunch experiences ever.   Just to skip straight to the details of why and you can decide if you want to actually give this place a shot:- People seated before us who came after us- Magically a table appeared for us when I finally decided to go in and ask where we were on the list and what was taking so long....divine intervention?  merely coincidence?  I doubt it.- Ordered food and lo and behold the table that sat next to us and was seated after us got their food way before us- Waitress only noticed that we didn't have food when we flagged her down and let her know- Service brought out the wrong food for us and after our first bite switched the plates telling us we had the wrong food- For some reason one plate had ketchup for their potatoes but the other didn't- They forgot the toast that was supposed to come with our meal.  When we told the waitress, she brought out plain toast...which seems okay except for the fact that we ordered Sourdough at the start when we placed our orders- When we got the bill, we had ordered a small orange juice and was charged for a large orange juice which obviously we didn't ask for and didn't appreciate the upchargeAnd for those who just care about the food, Roma via paris was not good.  Blu Jam Benedict was tasty but in no way made up for the multiple mistakes made at this place.  Go anywhere else,  Go to Griddle Cafe.  Go to Grub.  Go to Kings Road Cafe.  Or just throw some eggs into a pan and save yourself the hour wasted waiting in line and then being treated badly.

Reviews.Author: Sam P.
Reviews.Content: Dinner isn't a luxury, actually, breakfast is.  Usually I'm rushed in the morning and I'm trying to hurry out the door so I don't get a decent breakfast.  I might have a banana or a bowl of cereal.  I might even go get a bagel at a coffee shop.  But it was nice weather out today and I wanted to sit and enjoy breakfast in the sun.I walked the dogs to Blue Jam Cafe (that I learned about from Valerie C- thanks, girl) and we sat outside on the sidewalk patio.  I got the Blue Jam Benedict which is poached eggs, Hollandaise sauce, sliced Black Forest ham, crispy bacon on a grilled croissant.  Dude.  I have no idea where the Black Forest is, but I know that good ham comes out of there.  The breakfast potatoes weren't just a plate filler, they were seriously good and I ate them all.  I even got a single blueberry pancake that was awesome.  Good coffee too.The service is great- the waitress was very friendly and nice; she maintained a smile even while having to step around my dogs on the sidewalk.

Reviews.Author: Christina S.
Reviews.Content: While walking down Melrose Sunday afternoon we decided to try the new Yelp app and find a place for brunch. Blu Jam came up as we were walking past the outdoor patio. I glanced at the couples plates and saw how good their breakfast looked. We noticed a sign in the window boasting "Winner of best breakfast in Los Angeles". With that and the 4 Star Yelp rating we decided to make this our brunch spot. We walk in and we were warmly greeted and recieved by the owner who chatted us up a bit. I like it when someone is personable with you. Makes you feel like you have known them forever. The decor is rustic. It reminded me of some cafes in Bellingham WA. Dark warm interior. With a brick wall bold reds! Loved it! We were taken to our seats and were introduced to Jason our waiter. Super rad guy with tons of charm! We overlooked the menu and while we were looking we were brought out some of there fresh baked bread and homemade olive tapenade. This is the best tapenade that I have ever had. Not overly oily and has a slight kick of spice to it. (we were told that they had chili pepper flakes). The two dishes that caught our eye was the El Fuego and the Migas. The owner came over and asked us if we liked spicy food.. YES! He then suggested the Migas. (I had the Migas) Scrambled eggs, chorizo, cheese, veggies and jalapenos. He also suggested that we try the fruit cup. Now, usually the fruit cups that I have had in the past suck. You know, melon wedges pineapple but he (the owner) told me that they have the BEST fruit cup! UMMMM, when our plates came out I went straight for the fruit cup. Fresh blueberries, figs, sliced apples, grapes.. They don't skimp out on the good stuff you know. There was plenty of tasty fruit. Nothing boring. In fact it was refreshing and I will be back in specific for the fruit cup. Maybe they can make me a bowl!! Anyhoot. Service was amazing. The bus boys to the other waiters were really friendly. The portions are insanely large! I couldn't finish mine. It could also be due to the fact that I kept on eating that olive tapenade and bread. Prices are reasonable. Not, over priced! Unfortunately, they do not have their liquor license yet. Jason told us that they have been trying to get their liquor license now for 3 years. Originally when the owner bought the establishment it came with a beer/wine licence.. But, the city revoked it due to annoying neighbor's who felt that a restaurant which closes by 4 most of the week and by 10 on Friday's offering beer/wine would yield drunks stumbling out of Blu Jam Cafe. Retarded!! Blu Jam will be returning to City Hall to try to get their license again. Forgot the date but if you are a fan you should phone up find out the date and support these guys! Because brunch kinda sucks sans the Mimosa's or Tinto de Verano!! Jason your rad.. Owner/Chief (forgot your name).. Thank you for sending out those AMAZING crepes to our table! We loved them!  This place is the perfect spot for brunch!OH! 5 EXTRA STARTS FOR THE TAPATIO!!! Tapatio!!!! youtube.com/watch?v=zuw_…

Reviews.Author: Denise K.
Reviews.Content: What better way to start the day than a protein-rich tofu scramble?!This was the only breakfast entree I could order at Blu Jam Cafe, but it was light yet nutritious and not consumed by unnecessary flavorings. The potatoes were very good. In addition to your basic wheat and sourdough toasts (they don't serve white bread here), they offered a yummy rosemary bread! My only complaint was that they didn't make their own jam... but I guess that's a silly complaint.My friend and I came here early Friday morning for a farewell breakfast (Jonathan H. was heading back up to Vallejo....) and he ordered the Loxex, which was scrambled eggs with smoked salmon, onions, tomatoes, Brie, chives, topped with sour cream. He gobbled that up. I like how their menu had such a diverse array of scrambled eggs but in general the menu offered a lot of interesting items (not your typical cafe items--although the basic sandwiches and wraps are there).It wasn't busy at all when we came, and our waitress was very friendly.Definitely would come back for breakfast.... or lunch.

Reviews.Author: Christine N.
Reviews.Content: PREFACE: A friend was in town for the weekend and we really wanted to go to bronche. When deciding between here and another place, we decided to do BOTH (ambitious, we know). Came here first at around 11am after a crazy night of fun and were STARVING. The wait was 90 minutes (to be expected for weekend bronche) and the other's was only 15 so we headed there first. We ate ourselves to death, still up in the air about whether or not we should still do a second bronche/lonche here. Decided at around 1 that we should do it (probably only 30 minutes after we finished bronche #1). Please take this into consideration before reading the rest of my review.THE MUSIC IS SO GOOD HERE. JASON MRAZ, ONEREPUBLIC, COLDPLAY...perfect for BRONCHE!!!!!! It seriously was great song after great song. We mentioned it a few times during our meal.  Got here at 1:30ish, the wait for two was 30 minutes (though it seemed much longer). We were still full from an earlier bronche so decided to order on the lighter side and got the salmon hash and the burrata and strawberries. Also ordered a pot of white tip jasmine to help with digestion.The tea was lovely, my friend drank it hot and I had it iced. Reminded me of my childhood.The burrata and strawberries was plated beautifully. It was fresh with nice color. The burrata was pillowy and the balsamic glazed looked like it could be chocolate syrup. I was extremely excited to try this because I love the mildness of burrata and love the sweetness of balasmic. First bite was interesting. It was not what I expected and the buttered crostini ruined the flavor of the whole bite. Took a second bite and still felt the same way.Moved onto the salmon hash and it was pretty good, though I probably could've appreciated it more on an emptier stomach. Hash was served with two poached eggs and hollandaise sauce. Savory and delicious and didn't need the hollandaise. There were capers (which I usually can't stomach) and they weren't overpowering in flavor. WIN!After trying the salmon hash, we gave the burrata and strawberries another shot. I suggested maybe it just didn't go well with jasmine tea. It definitely tasted different the second time but still not a fan.Staff was friendly. Loved the feel and ambiance of the place. Again, loved the music!!!

Reviews.Author: Kat R.
