Reviews.Content: I came here last Saturday and REALLY wanted to love this place. Breakfast is usually my favorite meal of the day and I'm always on the hunt for the perfect breakfast spot. I absolutely love the location and the feel of this cafe because its adorable!  And the long wait is definitely annoying but I don't mind walking around and shopping a little before (in my party's case, 45 minutes). Everything about this place seems perfect...until you try the food. We had the blueberry pancakes and crispy French toast to share, and my friends both got the salmon Benedict while I had the California omelet. The pancakes were good, but I have had better (jumpin java in studio city). The French toast was ok, but probably not my style (I think I only like brioche French toasts). My friends both loved their Benedict and everything else, and my omelet was good. Not phenomenal like I expected, just good. I did love that the small salad I substituted the potatoes for on the side was very fresh and tasty. Their vanilla latte was also very very good. My friends loved this place, but I can't say I was as impressed with the majority of yelpers.

Reviews.Author: J R.
Reviews.Content: Checked in at 9:51am, was told 40 mins. Specifically told them that we had a party of three plus a dog (for outside). We got called an hour and a half later.Don't come here if you have a party of 3/4 + a dog, it will take a really loooong time to get a table!Our server got 2 out of 3 drink order before going to another table to get their orders, we then had to get her attention to complete our order.Drinks: Got an iced mocha with almond milk.-the iced was melting because the liquid was too hot, when I took a sip, it was too warm. Also, the bottom had a chalky residue(not mixed will).Vanilla latte- too sweet Food: The crunchy French toast was nothing special but just leaving a thirsty feeling in my mouth. Got it with sausage, umm, I would've rather had sausage from Denny's ( no disrespect to Denny's, haha). The breakfast quesadilla was ok, it kinda fell short to fulfill my brunch craving.Conclusion: Go try some place else unless you want to eat a B rated hipster wannabe brunch with rude servers.

Reviews.Author: sarah beth S.
Reviews.Content: Can't get enough of sunday brunch here. Best coffee in LA for me. Best fruit cup ever. peaches. raspberries. FIGS.Best soup.Roma via Paris is my delicious regular:  veggie and cheese (mozzarella and GOAT cheese, lord almighty) Everyone I bring here loves it.

Reviews.Author: Jean L.
Reviews.Content: Impromptu brunch stop last Sunday following a morning running errands and such. I probably would have never tried this place but for literally passing by. It's hard to get to from the westside, parking is difficult, and the wait is usually long. We were seated at a 4 fer table. The mimosas were strong albeit pricey. My crunchy french toast was plated on a long and narrow dish that was too small for its host. I probably lost an entire toast to the table by the end. The cornflakes were certainly novel, but lacked a certain...homegrown goodness you find in french toast. I would hardly say it was very much "dipped in batter" or "grilled to perfection." I'd much rather have mine truly dunked to thoroughly crunchy extremes than be given a flaky one. Sliced strawberries and blackberries were fresh. I most loved the vanilla bean sauce on the side. Also tried their hangover scramble. If I really had a hangover, it would be a most disappointing antidote. It's described as a "spicy combination of eggs, jalapeños, ground Angus beef, tomatoes, onions, cilantro, and cheddar, topped with salsa fresca and sour cream, served with potatoes and corn tortillas."  It ended up being very bland and lacking any spiceness - or spice for that matter - whatsoever. Just a flavorless jumble of everything above sans the dollop of white sour cream on top and tortillas on the side. If I had my way, I would've dumped half a bottle of Tabasco in it. Service was decent. In fact, BJC is an overall decent place. Not out of this world and it tries a bit too much, but in a city with a dearth of adequate brunch options, it offers standard, reasonable fare in a pleasant setting.

Reviews.Author: Will L.
Reviews.Content: I had a late breakfast/early lunch here. Saw the 'Yelp' sticker on the door and figured I'd be safe.First off, wow. It's always nice to have a cute waitress full of personality make a lone diner feel comfy. But then to have a cute, personality-filled waitress also guess exactly what I wanted just by asking me a couple questions? ESP at work?I had... a dish that had a spanish name. I don't remember the name, but it was fucking excellent. EXACTLY what I wanted. Spicy, with scrambled eggs, some sour cream, and a side of really crunchy fruit. The double espresso was as good as I'd expect in the U.S.Best of all they chased after me when I forgot my credit card, instead of just assuming I'd be back.

Reviews.Author: Christine T.
Reviews.Content: LA has food like no other city does. This place is a perfect example of that. Breakfast here is amazing. I wouldn't mind eating breakfast here everyday. I had the brioche french toast with blueberry jam and vanilla yogurt which included fresh fruit all for 10.99. It was amazing. Good service and great food, nothing more you could ask for.

Reviews.Author: Soo H.
Reviews.Content: Love this place!  Super busy but so tasty.I went around 1pm on a Saturday and my friend and I had to wait for about 30 minutes. It wasn't that big of a deal though, because the cafe is on Melrose and so there are some pretty interesting shops nearby.  With that being said, however, when they called our name my friend had gone to get something from his car, so they gave our table away, and we had to wait until another table became available.  That was a little annoying.  It was NYE, so I had to squeeze into an LBD that night and therefore ordered an item off their "health and fitness" menu.  I always get really excited when restaurants have these healthier menu options.  I got the muscle beach here which is an egg white scramble with turkey and spinach - it also comes with mixed greens and some toast.  It was surprisingly very delicious, especially when splashed with some Cholula.My friend got the Norwegian benedict and the flaky french toast.  The Norwegian benedict was good with perfectly runny eggs, but the star of the meal was the flaky french toast for me.  You MUST  try this dish - I don't know what kind of bread they use but it's so soft and chewy and then they roll the french toast in cornflakes, so that it's perfectly crunchy on the outside.  It's sprinkled with powdered sugar and topped with fresh fruits and served with a side of some vanilla sauce.  It's AMAZING.  My friend and I both also got the organic coffee, which came with tons of refills.  The coffee was delicious.  Overall, I'd be happy to come back to this place again despite the wait because the food is so good and it is close to some great shopping.

Reviews.Author: Angelie D.
Reviews.Content: Thank goodness I went on a Monday! I heard the line here is long! This is probably worth the wait! French Toast- I love how they already have the toast in smaller pieces. Easier to cut and and stuff your face with! The toast was nice and fluffy on the inside, crunchy on the outside. Instead of maple syrup, they have a vanilla bean sauce! This was magical! I am still debating whether I like their FT or Griddle's! Oh man! This is a tough one. I enjoyed the different kinds of fruit they put on top of the toast. This definitely balanced out the sweetness of the vanilla bean sauce. Blu Jam Benedict- Overall, the entree was average. I would probably choose another Benedict, but I had to try their standard one so I have something to compare it too. The sauce was very rich, the egg was perfectly poached, and the ham was savory! I do have to commend them on their vast menu. They are open all day, so their menu is huge! They have a nice wooden bar on the side. I'm sure their wine and beer list is worth trying.

Reviews.Author: Maria T.
Reviews.Content: Had a much improved experience at Blu Jam round 2.The stuffed french toast with blackberries and yogurt was light as air and not too sweet.  Loved the mounds of fresh fruit on top... for moments I almost felt like I was eating health food!The green tea served in a french press was really good.  It was such a tough decision to go for tea since the coffee has the most beautiful designs on top!  I swear, their coffee person is the Picasso of frothy milk!The fried egg sandwich my friend ordered can only be described accurately with one word: RIDONKULOUS.  It looked spectacular, HUGE, and wonderfully messy!  I can't imagine that people successfully take any bites out of it without getting pesto all over their faces... and I'm sure they don't care.  It was served with no less than a mountain-sized portion of potatoes on the side.  Awesome!I appreciate that our server was kind and attentive without being overbearing.  She allowed us to finish our work meeting without intruding or pressuring us to leave the table.  The owner also came by to check on us, which was appreciated.

Reviews.Author: Xuan T.
Reviews.Content: I was hankering for a good breakfast this morning because I have a long day ahead of me.  Afterall, breakfast is the most important meal of the day, right?  So I mosey-ed on in here with high hopes of a nutritious and reasonably priced breakfast that's at least one step up from your local Denny's and IHOP.I sat at a corner table and immediately ordered coffee.  For once... the coffee was strong.  Thank-freaking-goodness.  Was it worth $2.50?  I'm not sure... but I suppose I would have to say yes considering the fact you get free refills.I ordered the french toast with bananas and berries with a side of smoked bacon.  I had to have the sweet and savory combination otherwise, the balance would be totally off.  The french toast was light, and fluffy inside with a nice crispness outside.  The fruit was so sweet and fresh that I really didn't need any maple syrup.  The bacon was perfectly cooked.  Not one inch was under or overcooked.Food was good and most satisfactory.  Not greasy, not heavy, but just right.  I think I've been appropriately fueled for the day.My only gripe about this place is the price.  I am accustomed to coupons, 2 for 1 deals, and 33 cent microwavable burritos.  I paid almost 20 bucks (with tip) for a breakfast.  $20 bucks for one meal?  Yikes.  Is there gold in them french toast?!    Geez... $2.95 for 3 strips of bacon.   Could I get a discount if I brought my own and you cooked it for me?4 stars for now.  I will update once I sample more possible deliciousness.

Reviews.Author: Jim D.
Reviews.Content: There's a little feud going on between BJC and the Griddle.  But the only winners are the customers because both places are serving up good food! We came here on an early Saturday morning to beat the rush (and boy were we smart to too).  This place gets packed by 8:30am.  The bistro style interior was relaxed and casual with a perfect touch of hipster.  The breakfast menu (which is served until 5 everyday) had just about something for everyone.  I decided to pass on the popular pancakes and French toasts and set my sights on their enticing scrambles, the migas to be precise.  It was extremely flavorful (thanks to the almighty chorizo and assorted peppers) and generous in size.  My partner's morning hash wasn't quite as delicious but was large nonetheless. Overall, the meal was fine.  Nothing against BJC, their food was tasty it just wasn't as memorable as their competitor over on Sunset.

Reviews.Author: Cindy W.
Reviews.Content: Here's to another good place to add to my fat girl's food journal (Yelp). We were actually here earlier today for their cafe portion of this "cafe by day, bistro by night" restaurant. Regardless of the 45 minutes wait we had to endure on New Years Day, it was definitely worth it. The food was awesome and the service was superb! Our waiter was the best.Their "cafe" menu included an incredible breakfast/brunch/lunch selection with an abundance of egg dishes, pancakes, sandwiches, salads, panini's, etc. Usually any form of eggs benedict is my go-to dish and that's exactly what I did. I had their eggs florentine and very happy with my decision. The sun-dried tomato and brie added that perfect extra kick to the usual eggs florentine. For the table, we split an order of banana pancakes which was basically a stack of 3 fat banana pancakes adorned with strawberries, whip cream and dark chocolate syrup... *drool*I'm definitely coming back here... perhaps even when they change into their "bistro" outfit, but I loved their breakfast so much it might be hard. I tend to be a creature of habit.

Reviews.Author: Moosh L.
Reviews.Content: This is a review on BJC's DINNER only. I have to mention that this place was so delicious that I signed up for Yelp today just to write a review!I think they only recently started serving dinner and they are trying to promote it more since they are usually known for breakfast and brunch. Not only does this place have amazing food, but it also has a great ambiance and REALLY good service!Let me start off by saying that they give you this tuna tartar with bits of avocado on the house that already gave me a great first impression.Ceviche lime marinated shrimp: This was a good appetizer because it was light and flavorful. The shrimp was perfectly paired with the chipotle aioli and the crispy salted cracker was the right finish to it. Seared Ahi Tuna: OMG. THIS WAS MY FAVORITE! Not only was the tuna so well cooked and had a zesty lemon flavor to it, but the "fake" paella just added to the already amazing flavor! It had a sort of tomato flavor, and it just worked. The reason why its "fake" is because paella is usually rice, but instead they used risotto. Please order this!! It's just so good!!Baby back ribs: These were cooked SO WELL that the meat just easily came off the bones with your fork. No need to get your hands messy here! And they were paired with mashed potatoes.Argentinean steak: The steak was very well cooked with a drizzle of chimichuri sauce on top. I HAVE TO comment on the crispy potatoes. I was so amazed on how perfectly cooked they were: soft on the inside and crispy on the outside. I don't think I've ever tasted potatoes like this before.Crunchy brioche "bites":This was the waitresses recommendation. Um...YUM!!!! They reminded me of Belgium waffles. They were sweet, soft, and went well with the fruit and ice cream on top.SERVICE:Our waitress was very, very kind. She asked us occasionally if we needed new plates and she gave us great recommendations for what was good there. While my boyfriend went off to the bathroom for a bit, he left his napkin on the table just crinkled and sloppy. Another waitress just walked by and saw this while he was gone, and just took the napkin and folded it, putting it back on the table! Wth?!! That was realllyy nice of her.  I still have yet to try their famous breakfast, but for now, I am veryyy pleased with their dinner already. :)

Reviews.Author: Sharon K.
Reviews.Content: Came here for the crunchy french toast that everyone has been raving about-- It was good, I enjoyed it but I didn't think it was THEE best french toast I've had...Also ordered the ceviche which was basically just chips and salsa, chicken apple sausages &eggs, the grilled cheese sandwich, and white wine sangria. Overall- food was good, wait wasn't bad (about 40 minutes on a Sunday afternoon), and outdoor seating was a plus!

Reviews.Author: Kevin N.
Reviews.Content: The wait during the weekend is plain terrible. Seating is cramped so you can hear the conversations next to you, unfortunately for me I sat next to 2 talkative girls, one who seemed like she was a machine, talking as much as she did and stopping once or twice for a breath of air and a bite of her food. Oh and they stopped carrying A1 sauce.

Reviews.Author: Carol L.
Reviews.Content: I love having breakfast out on a weekday when everyone else seems to be at work.  It's quiet and peaceful, so I can really enjoy my favorite meal of the day.  Plus parking is so much easier.  In this busy neighborhood that is a big plus (otherwise it's valet which I refuse to pay for for breakfast).After looking over the regular menu and leaning toward their much-hyped about french toast, I spotted something on the specials that piqued my interest instead.  The BLU JAM ENGLISH MUFFIN.  Make that MUFFINS.  You get two English muffins, each with an over easy egg, micro greens, avocado and a fresh tomato, plus a huge portion of crispy diced red potatoes.  It's so much food you can totally share this dish with someone.  The muffins are fine, but imagine if you could have those muffins from Le Grande Orange (what an amazing breakfast sandwich that would be)!  Everything else was quite delicious.  I added a side of BACON and you get four strips.  It's not thick-cut, but it's also not that papery-thin bacon either.  It's very crispy.The fresh squeezed OJ was good that day.Service (thanks Marcela) was very friendly.

Reviews.Author: Smitcha B.
Reviews.Content: This is definitely LA... Getting to a brunch spot @ 10am sharp, still having to wait a bit for a table, eating outside on a nice, warm, and sunny day, watching other patron's dog slurp on some fancy bottled water, and witnessing 2 LAPD squad cars pulling over some poor fool. Thanks to my pal Anna M., I bookmarked Blu Jam Cafe after I read her ROTD on this restaurant. It's an ideal place to meet up some friends and/or take your honey on that brunch date.As mentioned, the four of us got to the restaurant at 10am. I thought it was early enough or at least for my standards. Melrose was still pretty quiet compared to how I usually see it. We waited about 15-20 minutes before we got seated. The place was already pretty packed.From all those pictures posted on Yelp, I really wanted one of those infamous lattes. I don't recall which one the waitress recommended me but it was pretty good n darn sweet. I was hoping the coffee artist would come up with a crazy design for me but I think he/she kept it simple. It was still a great piece of artwork though.Eggs Bohemia - eggs pan-fried with smoked bacon, black forest ham and chives, served w/ crispy red potatoes and toast ($9.95). It's one of em dishes you'd love to have once in a while. One too many will put you over the hill. The bacon and black forest ham makes it a bit salty but that's what the eggs, toast, and potatoes are there for to counter it.Norwegian Benedict - toasted croissant, Norwegian smoked salmon, poached eggs, sautéed spinach, grilled tomato and dill hollandaise, served with potatoes ($13.95). If you don't mind that distinct taste of salmon, then you'll be okay. However, if you're sensitive to it then I'd advise you to stay away. It really is prominent in this dish. My tablemates (two of them) who ordered this seemed just "aiight" with it.Brioche French Toast - served with syrup & powdered sugar with fresh berries and bananas ($9.95).  Awesome, awesome taste and most importantly, texture. Not too soggy, not over cooked. Crispy on the outside and warm n fluffy on the inside just like you. It's a great dish to share.The other dish I didn't get to sample was the Brunch Burger found where else? The seperate brunch menu of course. Since I didn't try it, I can't say anything about it except that it's a darn huge burger especially for brunch. A true American wakes up and orders a big a$$ burger to kick start the day. All in all, Blu Jam Cafe defines what LA dining is all about. From the whole environment to the presentation of the food (which is thumbs up). Unlike many people out here in Hollywood, this restaurant isn't as pretentious and backs up the image is presents with the tasty dishes it pumps out.Arrive early to avoid the wait.

Reviews.Author: Julie F.
Reviews.Content: Don't let the long line of people hanging out outside discourage you...This place is TOTALLY worth the long wait!!I'm not normally a breakfast or brunch person, but this place won me over and made me a fan!!I shared the crunchy French toast with the cornflake topping, strawberries, and blueberries along with "Kamil's Breakfast" which had mac and cheese mixed with scrambled eggs, ham, and bacon.  I LOVED the combination of sweet and savory flavors!!  The dishes came out very attractive and the wait staff was friendly, polite,  and helpful.I highly recommend this place and want to go back!!

Reviews.Author: Mimi C.
Reviews.Content: Great little place for weekend brunch! Be sure to come early as the wait can be over 1/2 hr if you arrive after 10:30AM. We ordered a variety of items including the omelets (a spinach one and a shrimp one), the signature french toast (crunchy flakes), salmon and lox bagel, and a fire wrap. Entrees are HUGE, can't finish it all by one lonesome self. =P In addition, all the items are fairly rich (but they have a lighter menu) ... so be prepared to walk it off after. The favorites were definitely the shrimp omelet and the french toast. The french toasthas an extra crunch to it that we all loved and the shrimp tasted super fresh. =)Overall, great little bfast place on the west side!

Reviews.Author: Dee C.
Reviews.Content: The line is intimidatingly long on the weekends, but fear not.  It moves fairly fast and there is plenty to do in the area.  The breakfast and brunch are good, but I can eat breakfast food for supper so I am not the best critic.  If pressed to quibble, I will say that I have had better eggs Benedict, pancakes, and French toast, but everything is solid at Blu Jam.My favorite is the Roma via Paris, which is three eggs scrambled with mozzarella, chevre, fresh basil, spinach, zucchini, sun-dried tomatoes, and cherry tomatoes.  My other mainstays are the blueberry pancakes, blueberry French toast, Blu Jam Benedict, and the dessert crepes.  I always get a side salad instead of potatoes, and they are always fresh and naturally flavorful.  The organic coffees are nice and they offer a cornucopia of teas.  They also provide lemon-mint infused water, which is cool.The ambience is lively, laid-back, and effortlessly hip.  The ceilings are high and allow the sound of voices to harmoniously coexist with what is always good background music--everything from classic Bob Dylan, Bob Marley, and preternaturally cool Miles, Dizzy, and Coltrane.  Sitting outside on a lazy Sunday is a treat, since the people watching is choice on Melrose.  The service is wonderful, albeit a bit slow, but that is just because it is such a popular morning destination.

Reviews.Author: Shelly J.
Reviews.Content: Went here early on a rainy Sunday morning -- no line! Yay!Such friendly service =)It was great having the restaurant all to ourselves (+ a few other tables..)Roma Via Paris - Three farm fresh eggs scrambled with spinach, sun-dried tomatoes, zucchini, cherry tomatoes, bell peppers, fresh basil, Montchevre goat cheese and mozzarella, served with potatoes and toast 10.95 - I don't know. To me, it felt like all the ingredients were all on their own. Could've been cooked a little more too. Zucchinis were a little too hard. But they were fresh.Crispy French Toast - I got to try this since it was a Sunday (it's a weekend menu I think). But I didn't like it too much. The crispy flakes were not enhancing the toast, but actually slightly reducing the overall taste. I hear the regular French Toast is better.I just don't like the long wait =( But I'll be back!

Reviews.Author: Elsie F.
Reviews.Content: While everyone keeps raving about wanting to go to Griddle Cafe, I'm more interested in trying Blu Jam Cafe... and I finally did after a morning hike.I love French toast & was dying to try their famous Crunchy French Toast ($11.95), but I was craving something savory so I got the Blu Jam Benedict ($11.95), which is poached eggs on a toasted croissant with Black Forest ham, bacon and hollandaise w/ a side of potatoes. It was the best eggs benedict I've ever had. I loved the Black Forest ham and bacon! It was extremely filling... definitely a good choice for breakfast.Service was awesome... our server was helpful and friendly. I really love the look of this place. Definitely need to come back to try the Crunchy French Toast!!

Reviews.Author: Paula L.
Reviews.Content: A great breakfast place that deserves a lot of its hype. Blu Jam seems to be VERY aware of its popularity as the prices reflect this. Breakfast for 2 (no coffee, no other sides) is over $30 after tax & tip.What I Ordered:- California Omelet- Breakfast QuesadillaBoth were large and came with potatoes. The quesadilla was hearty and neither of the dishes were doused in cheese (I hate when restaurants to that!).Everyone else seemed to order the French Toast with berries. Personally, I hate when restaurants serve JUST french toast or JUST waffles without any other side items..but it looked delicious! Next time!I have to admit though that the venue itself was disappointing. Its very small and the tables are kind of cramped together. I imagined this place to be a lot larger.Also, the decor inside is nothing special. I recommend coming after 1pm on Saturdays after the rush. You would probably wait like 10 minutes. There are some stores nearby to browse if you get caught in a long wait.Parking is also a nightmare (street only) and valet is $5 (!!!!!).P.S. is it just me or did the sourdough bread taste....not sourdough like?

Reviews.Author: Chau V.
Reviews.Content: What I love about Blu Jam:- Breakfast menu is served until 5pm. - Such a fun people watching spot. Hippie and colorful.- Cordial customer service.- Free wifiWe had Blu Jam Benedict and Burgundy Omelet. Both have lovely food presentation and taste absolutely delicious.Street parking wasn't as crazy as people talk about in their reviews. I went there on early Saturday afternoon, was able to find a parking spot one block away from the restaurant, and waited only for about 20 minutes to get a table.Tips: If you are having metered parking crisis, try residential parking nearby. Some of them are 2-hour limit.

Reviews.Author: Trissia W.
Reviews.Content: went here with a chef friend who said it ruled. I didn't find that for myself, however at the time I was already stuffed from another restaurant because he failed to mention we were hitting up Blu Jam next.Anyways, I tried the crunchy french toast at the recommendation of the manager running the place that day and it was damn good! even tho my intention was to taste it and take home the rest I was compelled to eat the entire thing.Ok brioche bread dipped in egg and rolled in some kind of crunchy cereal. Served with the most amazing vanilla sauce and then a few strawberries, blueberries and raspberries sprinkled over.Chef guy ordered their famous eggs benedict but I tasted and wasn't feeling that they were SO amazing. Would definitely take my mom here as a treat.they seemed to have a lot of meat choices and some veggie as well. Would really like to go back and try the goulash they are supposed to be famous for.(woo hoo! Chef Kamil sent me a nice message saying thanks for the review)

Reviews.Author: Alissa M.
Reviews.Content: I love you. I want to snuggle between the two perfectly toasted ciabatta slices of the eggwich and smother myself in the hollandaise from your Norwegian benedict. I want to roll around in crunchy cornflakes and bask in the glorious harmony of textures of your devastatingly decadent french toast. I will leggo my eggo in a heartbeat if that means we can be together again. My mouth. Your quesedilla. (if you know what I mean).All the staff are absolutely wonderful; some of the best service I've ever received at any culinary establishment, period.

Reviews.Author: Chanel C.
Reviews.Content: I came with a party of 9 so our wait time was over an hour. They dont have any place to 'wait' besides out on the sidewalk so we walked a few stores down to grab some seats. I'm not a breakfast-food type of gal so I didnt order any of their signature breakfast dishes. Instead I got the Veggiewich and the organic split pea soup. Both were reallly good. I kind of wished that I had gone with a breakfast selection after hearing everyone at my table foodgasming over their food. Our waiter was super dope as well!Definitely going to try the french toast next time around!

Reviews.Author: Russ V.
Reviews.Content: Located in the Heart of Melrose, you know this spot is gonna be poppin'! Well, it definitely was.. Wait was 25-35 minutes but ended up being about an hour! Almost as bad as lining up for a Roller Coaster at Magic Mountain on opening day!! Anyway, I waited because I already walked like 2 1/2 blocks from a residential parking spot that I was barely able to squeeze in between a driveway and another car..Brunch time: Butternut Squash soup (vegan, soup of the day): mildly flavored, mildly creamy and healthy for the most part.Blu Jam Benedict: expected poached eggs, hollandaise sauce but with a toasted croissant, black forest ham and crispy bacon plus served with potatoes. As long as you aren't monitoring your calories then you should be quite delighted with this dish! The ingredients says it all! The hollandaise sauce was doable but it was a bit sour to my liking, other than that everything else was Great! The potatoes were shockingly Delicious!.. They were just unevenly cut potatoes without any real support from onions/peppers.. These were Awesome!! Deep potato flavor, soft but held together and I just savored every bite.. YUMM,YUMM,YUMM!!!Crunchy French Toast: Only served on the weekends and holidays, Besides that French Toast is one of my favs, so this was a no brainer! They used the Brioche bread, corn flakes for the crunch and grill it. Then they top it with fresh banana slices and berries served with a vanilla bean sauce. The flakes weren't teeth shattering crunchy like I've had at other places, the mush from the bread was just right (a couple "brioche" frenchies i've had at other places were spongy = not good) and the sweetness and batter flavoring were quite Impressive! The berries, indeed tasted fresh and the vanilla sauce just rich, creamy and divine.. One of the better 'Gourmet' type French Toasts I've ever had.Vanilla Latte: I'm not a big coffee, latte, espresso person. I was feeling a little drowsy so I went for it and I'm glad I did! Slightly bitter and had a nice roasty and slightly sweet smoothness to it. Maybe if felt like I napped for 15 minutes after downing this?.. Whatever, it was Good!Other than the extra 30min longer wait then expected, the Server and Hostess were Awesome, Very Corteous and Willing, Atmosphere was Internationally Hip and Busy, Food tasted much better than Average and portioned properly for one person (I usually eat for more :)). Prices were fine considering the location, taste and portions. I don't know about waiting this long in the future.. Maybe, but just for the french toast and a side of potatoes!

Reviews.Author: Aaron M.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam is well known for being the "Best Breakfast in LA" and from experience, it was well earned. I enjoyed just about everything in my first visit. It initially reminded me of a fancy Starbucks but its SO much MORE than that. You usually can't go wrong choosing the item with the restaurant's name in it...so I ordered the Blu Jam Benedict. Its a classic Benedict: An English muffin with bacon and black forest ham topped with poached eggs. Its a delicious dish if its made right  and it definitely was right. They finished it off with a great hollandaise sauce. Raisa also got a Blu Jam Benedict. Bullet ordered the vanilla French Toast which reminded me of a breakfasty version of a creme brulee. Kristin ordered the banana pancakes. They were great with candied walnuts on top! So many other things to try!I better make this a regular place to go to because there's so many things to try...and that's just looking at the breakfast! Also, I hear their brunch items are amazing and the dinner menu changes to showcase the owner, Kamil Majer's culinary skills. Just another reason to come back.

Reviews.Author: J M.
Reviews.Content: Came back today to have some brunch.  I was craving their wonderful Brioche French Toast but opted for lunch (it was 1pm) and ordered their Grilled Cheese Sandwich: with melted mozzarella, Montchevre goat cheese, cheddar and sliced tomatoes on sourdough bread.The bread was perfectly toasted in all its buttery goodness and the cheese just ooooooozed in your mouth w/ every bite.  The tomatoes added a wonderful texture.  I had it w/ their fresh fruit and boy was it fresh. I loved everything and ate it within minutes.My buddy ordered : THE BURGERGrilled Angus ground beef, lettuce, tomato, & caramelized onions on a burger bun, served with side of mayo.He loved it.  He said the bun is what made the burger.  Apparently it was nice and soft w/ a hint of sweetness.  I dont know..I didnt get to taste it but it was huge and it looked hella good!*Service was a little lacking at first and the place wasn't even busy.

Reviews.Author: Julia K.
Reviews.Content: I came here on a Saturday morning for brunch and we were expecting to wait awhile to get seated, but I guess 10 was still a bit on the early side because we only waited about 15-20 minutes for our group of 5. We also got seated to the semi-private room at the far end of the cafe, which was really nice since the place is kind of small and gets pretty loud. Anyway, the service was nice and the food was great! I ordered the Roma Via Paris which was delicious because I love sun-dried tomatoes and eggs. Oh and get the potatoes and rosemary toast with it! My sister got the Crunchy French Toast, which was, hands down the best French toast I've ever had in my life. I'm usually not a French toast fan, but this one is special. Go try it. Their pancakes were also pretty good, very fluffy and huge. Most of the portions were fairly large because none of us were able to finish our plates (all girls though). But yes, the food is delicious and the atmosphere is really cute and perfect for brunch! I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Author: RoLee R.
Reviews.Content: I really like the food here and the service is passable, but my issue today was with actually getting sat. We were told 35-45 minutes wait. We waited 1.5 hours!! ...and here is what went down before we were finally sat...We started to check in after about 50-55 minutes, and they told us 10 more min, etc...and then more time would go by, and then we checked in again after 15-20...etc... and then they told us 1 party of four was in front of us.. ok no problem, almost there...Then 5 min later they call a party of 5 that had just arrived.Huh?I asked about it and was told that they were sat at a big table and the owner has a rule that minimum 5 people can sit there.I'm sorry, but when you have a bunch of parties you have massively under quoted a wait to and know are not very happy about it (we kept hearing people grumbling around us), you seat those people first. I've worked in the restaurant industry and we would seat the people in the order they came in, regardless of whether it was a couple next up and we had a booth that fit 10 available. It may not yield the restaurant the most money, but if you want happy customers who feel taken care of and not screwed over, then that's how you should do it.I honestly think that if that's the owner's policy, he probably also tells the host to under quote people and say 45 min when the wait is twice that long so that they stick around instead of going somewhere else.Even though I liked the experience once inside, I would be very wary of coming back here on a weekend.

Reviews.Author: Jess B.
Reviews.Content: This is what my friend declared to me upon eating the lukewarm cup of roasted red pepper soup:"It tastes like the base for Progresso Vegetable Soup."And the more I thought about it -- the more I realized that Soup had been microwaved in the cup because only part of it (the bottom left) was warm -- the more I realized she was right.  My friend is usually right.  It's why she is my very wise friend.We each had a salad afterwards: she the beets and greens and I the warm mushroom.  Overdressed.  And boring.  Her beets tasted like mush.  My warm mushrooms weren't warm.  I liked the pine nuts in mine.  Actually, I ordered it for the pine nuts.  But both of us wish we hadn't ordered either of our overdressed, boring salads.  With all the places in LA -- with the fact that Canters, La Brea Bakery, Urth, and even Toast (though I can't deal with the crowds there) are within spitting distance of Blu Jam -- I'll spit my way by Blu Jam.  Not literally.  Just trying to extend a metaphor, although poorly.  In the same way that Blu Jam advertised vegan soup to me as tasty and it was a sham.  Sham!

Reviews.Author: Jeff C.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam is teh awesomez.Here's a quick, helpful tip- when you roll pas the Blu Jam and the line looks long and all the waif-y chicks and hair-gelled d-bags are slouching out in front, go put your name in, because if there is one problem with the Blu Jam- its that they never estimate time correctly and always seat you five to ten minutes BEFORE they say they can. Its a trick to make you go away.It seems small, but seats a lot of people, the service is fantastic and the food is really top-notch. As someone that doesn't care mcuh about whether or not something is "fresh" or "organic" their presentation and dishes always make me recommend Blu Jam to anyone that wants these things.The coffee is great, with a shot of cream; the scrambles are art compared to another café's mess of eggs and potatoes; and the steak and eggs for brunch is quite a sight to see.All around, good hustle, Blu Jam. Good hustle.

Reviews.Author: Edmund W.
Reviews.Content: My first bad review, albeit happened months ago, its still a bad experience, won't go back, ever. Would have loved to give this place a good review, as i like breakfast food. I passed up 2 other places that serve breakfast on the same street for them. I regret doing that. Too much happened, or rather didn't happen, so I'll just use bullets:- waited an hour for a table- waited another 45 minutes for food, while we only got 1 cup of coffee; everyone else around us was being served. - 20 min into waiting for the food, waitress came by to refill everyone's coffee but ours. - asked for our food twice. - when the order finally came out, it was wrong, completely different than what we ordered!  - The table next to us was just shaking their heads in dis-belief. We just stood up and left after having a cup of sub-par coffee. I figured we'd give up the table for the next poor soul waiting in line.

Reviews.Author: Winston G.
Reviews.Content: Definitely one of LA's best brunch places - the food here was delicious!  My only negative about this place is the fact that they don't freshly squeeze their orange juice, but besides that, the food and service was awesome.Their eggs benedict florentine was pretty much perfect.  Great hollandaise sauce, paired with poached eggs, spinach, sun-dried tomatoes, and mushrooms.  We customized this dish and got it over a croissant, but I'm pretty sure it would have been just as delicious had it been over english muffins.  The one negative about this dish were the potatoes - they were diced too small and were not very tasty. The corn flake french toast with a vanilla bean dipping sauce was awesome.  I've never had vanilla bean dipping sauce, but this should be included with all things sweet and for breakfast.  Simply a great combination - the corn flakes added extra texture, while the fruit provided a good balance to the dish.  No complaints at all.Their latte was also good.  About a 30 minute wait for 2 people on a Sunday at 11am... not bad.  Park on Melrose or a side street around there.  Will be back here again.

Reviews.Author: Eva V.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam Cafe is very ladies-who-lunch. In fact, I was a lady-who-brunches the other day with my mom to celebrate Mother's Day. I work on Sundays so we came on mid-morning on a Monday and there was no wait time. The cafe is a mixture between cozy and modern design. Our waitress was extremely attentive and the food service was prompt. My mom ordered the salmon platter which made her gasp when she saw it; this place as very nice food presentation. She loved her meal and I loved my breakfast choice: vanilla french toast. Good coffee also, so get ready to down a couple cups.Parking isn't great (but that's par for the course in this area) and I don't know how much I would be willing to return if I had to wait in a long line. I'll try this place the next time I've got time to brunch with someone on an off day.

Reviews.Author: Nancy Y.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam, you are just amazing. Your all-egg-white omelettes are so healthy yet delicious, your split pea and borscht soups hit the spot on a cold morning, your organic coffee strong and robust, and ohhhhhhhhhhhhhhh... your fresh strawberry and lightly-caramelized peach crepes, so sweet, and the crepe so thinly stacked, layered, and swirled with sprinkles of powdered sugar...like a lovely, sparkled chiffon haute couture dress you would find in the runways of paris..And the creeper I met here that still won't stop blasting my cell phone for 1 1/2 months, even when my mister picked up and told him to back off..nowhere to be found.. I think I just might have found my true-love-at-first-bite!!

Reviews.Author: Mia K.
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Monday (Veteran's Day) around 2 PM and there was a line outside and a 10 minute wait (total score being LA).  The waiters and staff were excellent and friendly.  We ordered the warm mushroom salad and goulash.  Both were amazing.  The girls next to us ordered french toast with berries which I will definitely order next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Author: Annie C.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam helps to continue my love of brunch!  After passing this cute eatery several times on Melrose, I finally made it in with H.We got to sit outside on a warm, sunny LA mid-day and started off with a standard iced latte, that hit the spot!  Then H. had the breakfast quesadilla (with cheese, eggs, spinach, and chicken!!) and I had the Special with pancakes, 2 eggs, and yummy turkey sausage.  The quesadilla was pretty special and gives me new breakfast ideas for home!The best part of brunch (besides the company and cute atmosphere) was our server who was super friendly and accomodating.  I love great service from down to earth people....and Blu Jam's got that covered!

Reviews.Author: Johnathan J.
Reviews.Content: As I pulled up to the Blu Jam Cafe, I slid into a street spot right in front of the door. Not a bad beginning. On this Sunday morning, as I got out of my car, I heard the soothing sounds of jazz flowing through the open cafe windows and doors, to the four or five tables they had out on Melrose. Walking in, I noticed a tall guy, a waiter, speaking French to some customers. I asked him "Just sit anywhere?" and he said "Yeah, just take a seat". I was greeted soon enough by a waiter who left me my menu of Blu Jam items.. I ended up getting orange juice and the French Toast breakfast, which was good, but nothing to write home about. I enjoyed my meal while Miles, Coltrane, and other popular jazz hits tickled my ears. All told, for the experience I paid $15 including tip. The service was adequate but not impressive.It was quiet enough there that I could read a chapter of "A Brief History of Time", and not be too distracted. I left satisfied, but not full. For what I ordered, I think it was a bit expensive, but Blu Jam was a cool enough spot, and I'd definitely go back again.

Reviews.Author: Bita M.
Reviews.Content: I'm on a mission: To brunch through LA(check out my other brunch reviews)Blu Jam Cafe is without a doubt one of the best brunch spots I've ever been to. I tried coming here a few times and was discouraged by the ridiculously long wait (always over an hour). But once I got in and got my food, it was all worth it. Every dish that went by looked and smelled absolutely delicious.I ordered the steak hash and it was one of the most amazing things I've ever put in my mouth.My bf ordered the breakfast quesadilla and it was great as well. We split an order of the french toast and even though we were stuffed, we licked the plate clean. Pros: THE FOOD!!!! Cons: The wait is always outrageous, and the place is kinda small which makes it difficult to fit a large group

Reviews.Author: Monica C.
Reviews.Content: Too long of a wait, and no empty seats to wait in, so I played the spectator game. And being on Melrose...there's a whole lot of hipster ridiculousness going on! My favorite was the harujuku/sweatpants girl with the chunky glossy pink boots...she was outstanding! Anyway, back to the task at hand...we were finally seated, and greeted by a menu that listed an all-day breakfast selection...yes! We couldn't decide, so we opted to share the Blu jam Benedict and the cornflake French toast. I made certain we established the all important ground rule: Sharing means 50/50, not my dish is better than yours so you can only have a bite. (This is an ongoing problem at times.)Both dishes were beautiful to look at, but the French toast was quite more superior. The Benedict was tasty, you can't go wrong with smoked ham, eggs, and bacon on a croissant. But the French toast, with fresh berries...yummmmm...it was good enough for me to cheat and take a 60/40 share! My real disappointment came from the diet coke...in a can??? It's always a good way to charge one more money, especially from a caffeine fiend like me! Canned diet coke is only acceptable in mom and pop delis and Chinese food restaurants...they obviously didn't get the memo!

Reviews.Author: Tatum B.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam is my go-to brunch destination!! Their goulash is unbeatable. I traveled to Prague and Hungary a couple of years back and have been craving goulash ever since-It seemed no place in America served authentic goulash and then I found Blu Jam!Parking is always tough but if you take one of the side streets a couple of blocks from the restaurant you should be able to find parking.

Reviews.Author: Les S.
Reviews.Content: Man, this place knows how to make breakfast right.  I've never been big on breakfast because most breakfast food (IMO) is boring and bland.  This place changed my mind.  They took some traditional breakfast items and tweaked them just enough to give 'em some kick without making them unrecognizable.  I really like their migas, which is spicy scrambled eggs with chipotle, chorizo, bell peppers, mozzarella, and salsa.  The addition of tortilla chips give a nice crunchy to the usual monotonous texture of eggs.  Also tried their famous vanilla french toast based on so many positive reviews here.  It was excellent but I actually prefer the crunchy french toast which is coated with corn flakes.  Once again the crunchy texture takes the monotony out and the side of vanilla syrup is very unique.  The crunchy french toast is only available on weekends though.  One of these days I will have to try their dinner menu.  Looks promising.Place is always busy. You probably need to get here before 9:30 a.m. if you want to beat the long wait.  They have one large table in the back to accommodate a party of maybe 9 or 10.  All other tables are for two to four people only so it's not a great place for large parties.  Place does seem kid friendly as I saw quite a few people bring their little ones here. Parking sucks.  You will have to park on street.  Just be careful when you park on residential streets.  They have like gazillion signs indicating when you can't park there - no parking on Tuesday, no parking from 8 p.m.-8 a.m., but ok to park up to 2 hours from 9 a.m.- 6 p.m. etc.  It's freakin' annoying.

Reviews.Author: D.C. P.
Reviews.Content: After seeing the reviews on Yelp, me and the GF decided to try this joint before our long drive back home.  We arrived around 12:00pm on a Sunday and of course there was a wait but we weren't surprised.  The hostess gave us an approximate wait time of 1 to 1.5 hours.  Instead of waiting around in the hot sun and watching people eat, we decided to walk around for a bit.  When we got back 45 minutes later, we found out that the hostess over estimated the wait time and now our name was at the bottom of the list.  (yeah, yeah, I know, we shouldn't have left...)By the time we were seated, I'm starving, my glucose level is dropping, and I'm going to pass out soon.  Everything on the menu was looking good.What we ordered:Blu Jam benedict:  The ham and bacon make this a pretty salty dish.  The egg was not poached but more like a medium cooked egg.  The yolk was not oozing at all.  I was a bit bummed.Soup of the day - Mushroom soup:  A thick soup that would go good with some bread or crackers.Rancheros:  Perfectly cooked eggs (how did they get this right but not the poached eggs) along with a generous amounts of black beans, cheddar, salsa, avocado and sour cream.  Everything worked well together.Potatoes:  Grilled which gave it a nice crunchy outside while maintaining a soft inside.German bockwurst pork sausage:  Looked good but was very bland.Mimosa:  Dunno how it tasted.  All I know is that it was served in a small glass which looked a bit skimpy to me.Damage to the pocket was almost $60.  Was it worth it?  I guess. Can't knock it until you try it.

Reviews.Author: Jessica A.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam Cafe was always a place I'd pass by for years on melrose street. I never stopped by until one day my best friends and i were in the mood for something new.We fell in love as soon as we walked in. One of my friends is a photographer so of course he fell in love with the arts and pictures surrounding their dining walls. Another friend of mine is into depth thinking so he was envisioning the present, past and future of the cafe. It was very intriguing.And the food? Cmon now, i saved it for last. Their wraps are yummy and I also ordered a nice mango smoothie from them. I got filled up quickly and didn't feel as though i piged out. We walked out of there with a nice experience and talked about going back numerous times. Spread of mouth is what we did and Blu Jam Cafe is the place to be on melrose!

Reviews.Author: Maryam M.
Reviews.Content: Great! The burgers were absolutely delicious. That crunchy French toast was the best I've ever had. The Eggs Benedict was good but the ham tasted like pure salt. I could totally tell it was lunch meat and when you fry or grill lunch meat it tastes like salt meat. I had to remove it from my sandwich. Chai latte was had no flavor so next time I'll stick to Coke. Otherwise it was very good. The few times I went it was almost empty. One time I went and there was only one server. He held it down like a champ! Bravo to him! (sorry I don't remember his name!)

Reviews.Author: Remy O.
Reviews.Content: I've been here 3 times, and tried 2 egg white omeletes (muscle beach and olympia), their goulash soup and ham sandwich, all very tasty. The olive tapenade that comes with the while-you-wait bread is fantastic, also. The fruit side is fresh and isn't just melon and grapes. Though the omelets were great, they were not omelets. Like Lulu's at Beverly/La Brea, they use the term very liberally. The omelets are actually scrambles.Only complaints are somewhat inattentive staff and lack of substitutes for sides.

Reviews.Author: Kandice C.
Reviews.Content: Dinner Review Only: The only reason why I'm not giving them 5 stars is because their portions are itty-bitty for their prices; this new tapas trend is not working for me. I mean, yes, I did show up here with an appetite of five sumo wrestlers, and yes, I normally do have an appetite of three sumo wrestlers, but tomato-tomatoe, we can't all agree on everything now, can we? But what we can agree on is HOLY SHIT their food is good. Small, but zomg, so good. I had this dish with seared scallops on top of a creamy bed of citrusy risotto, and then a beef goulash with pan roasted dumplings/beer-red wine paprika gravy, and then a side of anger because their portions were so small and I WANTED MOAR!!!!! RAWR!When I become a baller, shot-caller (werd to Lil Troy) or marry a sugar daddy, I will come to dinner here and ask them to give me a mixing bowl full of that risotto and a pound of those scallops, and a baking dish filled to the brim with that beef goulash.Gotta get back here for dat breakfast doe, it seems like all you Yelpers are creaming your panties over it.ferosh.net

Reviews.Author: David T.
Reviews.Content: ITS SO FLUUUUUUFFY!Taste is usually pretty good on most french toast. Texture makes or breaks it for me. This is one of the few places where the french toast doesn't simply look like it was soaked in syrup overnight. Very good texture all the way through. And did I mention fluffy?I was craving a burger... I was really hesitant about getting one at a breakfast place. But, hunger calls for it, so I ordered the Gourmet Burger. Definitely did not go wrong. The angus beef was cooked really well, not dry at all. Only place I would say has better meat is Fathers Office. I also really liked the buns. Great crispy outside texture but just like the french toast, extremely fluffy. Everything else in the burger just added to its greatness.Con: Definitely more willing to get non-breakfast items at these kinds of places, but I know I will be disappointed at other restaurants.

Reviews.Author: Diane T.
Reviews.Content: After months of seeing my friends' pictures on instagram of the famous crunchy french toast, i just had to try it.I went there with my little sis for brunch/lunch on Saturday. As expected, there was a very long wait. We were told by the host that the wait for a party of two would be approx an hour and half.. although hesitant we decided to stick it through.Something interesting about Blu Jam, they're really strict about the list..if they call your name out and you're not there, too bad..buhbye back to the end of the list you go. To give them credit, they do have a nice little sign stating this.However, thanks to that our name got bumped up on the list substantially and our wait time was only around 40mins instead of 90. Atmosphere:quaint outdoor seating area. Inside a bit clumped for space, but just enough elbow room to move around. Quite comfortable.Verdict on the food:-crunch french toast-Amazing as expected! I thought it would be very heavy, but it was actually quite light and delicious. The crunch really makes this unique. I'm not exactly sure whats in the dipping sauce, but it was the perfect amount of sweet. The toppings of strawberries and blueberries made the french toast just the right amount of fresh and sweet breakfast perfection. It was definitely worth the wait. Just the right portion to share! (if you can..)-blu jam egg Benedict-My little sis got this and said it was quite delicious. She normally isn't a fan of egg benedicts so that is a good sign.-Migas-If you are fan of egg, cheese, veggies, all mashed into one, then you would love this dish. Incredibility cheesy and savory. Right amount of veggies to egg proportion. Served with 4 corn tortillas, i would recommend this to counter the sweetness of the french toast if you were to share. Love how you can substitute fresh fruit in place of the potatoes. Why 4 stars and not five?Perhaps because it was a bit busy..it always took forever to flag down our waitress for some water. Maybe it was our location, but no one ever seem to see me waving my hands frantically for a cup of water.Besides that one little bit, the overall experience was amazing. The menu looked great and I can't wait to try all the other yummy items.

Reviews.Author: Angela T.
Reviews.Content: This place is fun! Our cozy group of 8 got our very own semi-private room in the back, complete w/ a flat screen TV to watch Sunday NFL football. Our waitress was super nice, our orders came out fairly quickly, water glasses were refilled and the snazzy coffee drinks were made in a reasonable amount of time. My sis, J., and I shared the Blu Toast - French toast layered with blackberry jam & cream cheese, topped with bananas and powdered sugar . Cream cheese??? Rich, creamy and a little over the top, yes, but it was yummy! We also ordered a salty dish to balance out the Blu Toast... a special that was called "Hangover [something]" or "[something] Hangover", which consisted of a ground beef and jalapeno mixture served w/ tortillas and country-style potatoes. Tasty and SPICY! I needed 2 glasses of water to wolf 1/2 this plate down. My son, C., ordered 1 pancake which was the size of a large plate, but he ended up in the corner of our booth w/ a tub of grape jelly... enough to make him a happy camper. No worries, my other sis, S., finished up that plate of pancake quick! Totally cool ambiance, friendly folks and a large well-rounded menu. Bon appetit!

Reviews.Author: Allison S.
Reviews.Content: Four words: I am a fan!I had the vanilla french toast, the BF had the Norwegian salmon eggs benedict, and we shared a mocha coffee. It was a great brunch. :)The only problem I had with the french toast was that it was a little too sweet (maybe from the vanilla?) And the fact that some parts of the toast were undercooked. But these are definitely nitpicky details because it was the best french toast I've had in LA. The eggs benedict were also delicious too. The salmon had the perfect smokiness and the tomato, spinach, and Hollandaise sauce helped the whole dish come together. The potatoes also got better and better with each bite. The coffee was superb. Next time I want a panda picture though!

Reviews.Author: Sharon L.
Reviews.Content: My favorite breakfast spot in LA. 1000+ reviews don't LIE!!The Vanilla French Toast is probably my fave -- spongey from the vanilla yogurt and sweet because of the blackberry jam filling. It's topped with a generous handful (or maybe two handfuls) of bananas, blueberries and strawberries. I always like to get a side of Chicken Apple Sausage when I get the french toast to bring something savory to the palette as well. I'm determined to try like 10 other items on the menu... doesn't Kamil's Breakfast (pan roasted macaroni scrambled with eggs, bacon, ham, and cheddar) sound amazing? Everything is always cooked to perfection.This area doesn't really liven up until 10am so if you make it there around 9, there shouldn't be a wait.

Reviews.Author: Michele L.
Reviews.Content: One thing I really like about this place is they serve breakfast and lunch until 5pm everyday!My friend and I are health freaks so we ordered:Power House: Six egg whites scrambled with spinach, topped with flamebroiledchicken breast and sautéed tomatoes and basil $13.95Muscle BeachSix egg whites scrambled with fresh thyme, ground turkey,onions, spinach and chopped tomatoes, served with a cup oflow fat cottage cheese and toast  $12.95Both were okay, not great.  Kind of lacking in flavor.  And I've eaten tons of healthy dishes with wonderful, natural flavors with no sodium (I hate sodium).  This dish was definitely lacking.  Probably could have made it at home.We also shared a pot of:Chocolate Monkey Tea:  Chocolate, banana, rooibos and pink peppercorn blended together with apple bits to create an incredible dessert tea.We were fooled by the description of the tea as with the other items ordered.  They have a way of making everything on their menu sound amazingly delicious.  The waitress recommended the tea and said it was sweet.  It actually tasted kind of bitter, like medicine =(.Hmm maybe we just ordered the wrong things.  Will probably come back again if I'm in the area and try some of the other things on the menu.

Reviews.Author: Christina K.
Reviews.Content: I've had this place bookmarked for over 2 months and anticipated eating here. I don't get you Yelpers sometimes. I did not enjoy my meal. The guy next to me kept talking to himself, "Mmm this is why I live, this is so delicious, I'm so happy right now." That just got me all the more excited for my salmon hash, which the guy next to me enthusiastically recommended. I should've stuck with my first choice of the crispy french toast, but I was in the mood for something more savory. The hash had a couple of eggs atop, but they were a tad overcooked and didn't have enough ooze when I broke it. The hollandaise sauce was pretty thick and unappetizing. One brownie point for soft, room temperature butter. I can't stand cold butter that ends up tearing through my bread when I'm trying to spread it. The coffee was enjoyable and comes in a big mug, which I like. I'm giving this place 2 stars because I feel mislead by the 4 star rating that drew me in. I could've taken my chances with a long wait at Griddle Cafe or somewhere else. Also because I don't want to return. The worst thing about a meal like this....knowing half way through that you don't feel it's worth the value, aren't even going to finish it and will be left hungry in a short while, and don't want to pay for it, but must.Parking: street if you luck out or valet. I parked down the side street in a metered spot. 2 hours for $2.

Reviews.Author: Mimi L.
Reviews.Content: I have a penchant for latte art and places that serve breakfast all day, so I knew I had to visit Blu Jam Cafe as soon as I came across it on Yelp. My friend and I went there for breakfast this past Thursday, but thanks to the 5N (traffic at 10:30am? SERIOUSLY?!), breakfast turned into lunch. No worries, though, because, again, they serve breakfast ALL DAY. Genius.The food was delicious. I usually get sick of french toast after a few bites because it gets too heavy, but I loooved Blu Jam's vanilla french toast! The tangy vanilla yogurt and fresh fruit really cuts through the heaviness, and the blackberry jam adds just enough sweetness. My friend really enjoyed his egg dish, and our lattes were nice and strong (and beautiful to look at). Why has LA traffic become so much worse in the past few years? I would like to visit Blu Jam Cafe much more often, but the thought of hundreds of unmoving cars jammed onto the 5 and the 101 kind of ruins my appetite...

Reviews.Author: Jesse G.
Reviews.Content: Huevos Rancheros. The End. (everything here is fantastic)

Reviews.Author: Sarah P.
Reviews.Content: After all I've heard about Blu Jam, I finally got to try it when a friend and I came here for brunch on a Saturday morning around 10am. We chose to sit outside where it's less crowded, but were luckily seated almost immediately (I was expecting there to be a wait since I heard it got crowded on weekends).My friend and I both wanted something sweet AND savory, so we decided to order 1 dish of each and share them. We got the Roma Via Paris (it has tons of stuff i love: spinach, goat cheese, zucchini, sun dried tomatoes, basil and bell peppers!) with rosemary toast and potatoes. We also got the brioche french toast with peaches, bananas, and orange-caramel sauce that was deliciousssss in the perfection of the egg battered bread and the sweet sauce with fruit on it. Compared to it, the eggs weren't that amazing, but satisfying nonetheless. Huge portions, so since we finished half of each we were totally stuffed. I also got a small grapefruit juice that was about $2.50? Really satisfying meal :)Parking was down the street (free!) and places to shop are super closeby. It came out to a little under $20 for each of us so it's definitely not cheap (entree + drink + tax + tip) so I think this is one place I'll definitely be returning for weekend brunches for some hearty, dependable breakfast food on an occasion to catch up with a friend.

Reviews.Author: Fred A.
Reviews.Content: I literally played with "flavorful edible puzzle pieces" today for my 2nd breakfast (home-made oatmeal being my first) and I'll tell you how in just a bit.My mother and I was visiting the LA Convention Center on this gloomy day, and after 2 hours of driving on a hazardous, jam packed freeway, we decided to go to the "Best Breakfast Spot in LA" Blu Jam Cafe. (Ha! That rhymed) Anyways, the place is a real pain to get to since it's in the heart of Melrose but it was sure worth it.When we entered, we were instantly greeted by a waitress who sat us down on some wooden seats and a VERY wobbly table. Ain't nothing like to packets of sugar can't fixed... so problem solved. The place had a Euro Jazz feel to it, even the customers there were fashionably appealing. Obscene paintings were on the wall, lights were dim, everyone was seated next to each other, and the featured colors were dark and soothing. After examining the menu, which was plentiful in variety and suitable for any craving, I decided to stray away from my sweet, pancakey or french toasty wanting side and get something savory for once. I was really wanting the Blu Jam Benedict but since half of these Yelpers got it, I settled for the Salmon Hash. Mama Bear ironically got the Blu Jam Benedict knowing that her son loves Benedicts (aww) so everyone wins!While we were waiting, our very friendly, attentive waitress let us try a Wild Mushroom and Potato Soup since my mother was craving something hot on this cold day. It had a meaty taste from the mushroom and starchy taste from the potato, but it gave you an aftertaste of Mung Bean Stew (which is one of my favorites!) It was delicious but the high temperature affinity taste buds of our tongues were perceiving it as a cold soup... Trust me, to a regular human being it would be steaming hot. Since that didn't suffice our need for heat, she ordered a hot chocolate and I ordered a soy latte as we waited for our entrees.Her hot chocolate was oversatisfying. Not too sweet and not too chocolatey. As for my soy latte, it had the real kick of an espresso with a slight touch of soy in the end. Plus it was a lactose friendly beverage so works for me! Kudos for the latte art as well.When we got our entrees, I (silently) applauded the presentation of my dish. Salmon Hash: Moist, sauteed potatoes with peas, olives, and tomatoes. The majority of the salmon was in between the potatoes and 2 perfectly poached eggs. It came with rosemary toast which had a distinct wheat flavor in it and I had my dill hollandaise on the side. Every single component of this dish could be tasted, especially the tomatoes. It had more a distinct flavor than the olives. The potatoes were seasoned perfectly, a little soggy though, and these poached eggs were amazing. None of the yolks solidified one bit and it made the slightly overcooked salmon have loads more of flavor. The dill hollandaise was just a cherry on top but I swear, the yolk alone will complete the dish. I mentioned about playing with puzzle pieces in the beginning because my salmon hash artwork was ruined by the little kid in me.Blu Jam Benedict: This benedict was one of a kind. In replace of the traditional english muffin, there was a sliced croissant on the bottom. On top of that, 2 different types of pork cuts: ham, then bacon. And on top of that, 2 pillow textured poached eggs, drizzled with hollandaise. It was sooo sinfully good. The sweetness of the croissant complimented the smokey flavorful of the bacon and the saltiness of the ham. The eggs provided that gooey texture from the whites and fat from the yolk and hollandaise topped it all off. I kid you not, you can taste everything! I especially envied my mom's side of potatoes. Unlike mine, hers wasn't moist and soggy. The potatoes had a cotton candy texture, literally melt in your mouth, but the skin was delectably crispy. An interesting texture combination with the same seasoned flavor. I guess it was the veggies in mine that made my potatoes moist.After 4 hours from eating that good meal, I'm still pretty stuffed. Plus my mother didn't finish her benny so I finished it... It was a great experience coming from the "Best Breakfast Joint in LA". For 40 bucks, I gotta say it was slightly unworth it, but 1/4 of the 40 bucks were coming from the drinks alone. So entrees of 10-15 bucks, yes it's worth it. Drinks - i'll just stick with starbucks over priced ones. My taste buds tells me that I will be coming back to this place again because this place definitely got potential.

Reviews.Author: Steven V.
Reviews.Content: I came here with a friend who wanted to try something besides Griddle. This place makes for a great brunch. Not the best I've ever had, but the food was tasty and the presentation was nice. Norwegian salmon eggs benedict were good, although the eggs could have been a little bit more uncooked. Potatoes had rosemary or some kind of herb that made them good. Corn flake-French toast was beautifully presented and it was good but a little too sweet. I still enjoyed the textures of the cereal with the bread crust and the fresh fruit. I also got a regular Mimosa which was not good. I also thought that most of the decor was nice, but the tables were too close together and the place was a little cramped. I know its a restaurant on Melrose but I did not really enjoy the atmosphere. Overall, I thought the food was reasonable for brunch, but still a little pricey. Parking isn't too bad. I recommend that you arrive early, once I got out at 10:45 AM there was a half hour long line.

Reviews.Author: Jenn P.
Reviews.Content: Slightly hurting from a night out, my friend and I found ourselves here on a Sunday morning. There was a bit of a wait but we were happy to walk around Melrose for a bit in the mean time. It was about 15 min and we were called to be seated. The inside of this spot is cute and cozy. They have both indoor and patio seating. While small, it is still nice.Coffee was a must for us so we ordered an iced macchiato and some good old regular coffee. The macchiato was actually strong an tasty. I was surprised. For entrees we ordered the vanilla french toast and the roma paris (eggs, sun dried tomatoes, goat cheese, spinach, w/toast and potatoes) Both were delicious. We had no complaints.The service here was fast and friendly. I will definitely return soon.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan H.
Reviews.Content: I'm not a fan of breakfast. There are only three places in my opinion that toppled my pickiness for breakfast. 1. McDonalds, Lahiana, Maui - Grilled Spam, REAL Overeasy eggs and REAL rice in the morning. Nothing beats that sitting on a seawall starting at Lanai in the morning. 2. U.S. Coast Guard Cutter BOUTWELL (WHEC-719) One of the Food Service Specialists makes a breakfast burrito that's out of this world. 3. Blu Jam CafeWent with Denise K. to this place on a Friday morning before starting a long trip back to the Bay Area. I do not frequent LA, but found this place easily with a GPS and some good ol illegal u-turns. The inside is.. rustic... quaint... simple? The menu is.. extensive, demanding, like a technical manual. I found several items I wanted to try on the menu but went for the Loxex (sp?) which consisted of eggs, smoked salmon, brie, tomatoes, and the such. It was, needless to say, probably one of the best scrambles I've had in awhile. Their potatoes needed some work, but I could work with them. However, their bread was out of this world, rosemary, I believe. Finished and licked my plate clean. Would definitely like to come here again.

Reviews.Author: Jessica C.
Reviews.Content: It's apparent after my Saturday brunch sesh where all the hipsters of LA hang out for brunch and that place is the Blu Jam cafe.  Got there at around 10:30AM and there was a wait for about 20 minutes for a table for two.  We got seats outside which was nice, it was great for people watching especially since we were on Melrose.  I ordered a ice coffee and the Toscana scramble with rosemary toast and my bestie got the iced chai tea and corn flake french toast.  The Toscana scramble was eggs scrambled with pesto, tomato, cheese, and sausage.  It was so good that I had to fend my friend off from sneaking bites off my plate.  I usually am good at sharing but not when sharing leads to less scramble in my belly.  I tried the corn flake french toast which was also very good.  It was the perfect combo of crunchy corn flakes and moist fluffy french toast paired with a vanilla bean sauce.  The Iced chai tea on the other hand was a watered down version of Chai tea, wouldn't recommend that drink.  The only thing I would have to knit pick about would be the service, the service is friendly but it is slow.  Me being hungry and slow service does not mix.  Other than the service the food was good price was reasonable at about 35 for two people and parking is street and metered, to be expected in LA.  Will be brunching here more often.

Reviews.Author: Julia K.
Reviews.Content: Ever since I left LA two years ago, I've wanted to come here to try out their brunch. When I finally come back to visit with some friends, we make our way here early enough that there's no line and we're seated immediately even though the last person in our party hasn't arrived yet - NICE.The menu has a good variety of options that include the standard traditional breakfast items like omelettes and eggs benedict. There's also a menu portion dedicated to healthy items - I was really tempted but Hey, how often am I down in LA to eat? Not too often, so I'm gonna go all out!The menu item verdict:- Cornflake crusted french toast with vanilla bean sauce.This alone filled me up because it was so rich! The cornflakes added a nice crunch factor which usually is missed because whatever else is usually used gets soggy pretty fast - but this was not the case with the cornflakes, so good call :)The french toast was covered with piles of fresh fruit and served with the vanilla bean sauce on the side as per my request.Everything tasted fresh, ambiance was great and we beat the rush, so there was plenty of street parking around! Service was pretty whatever though.

Reviews.Author: Jason S.
Reviews.Content: Marie! Marie! Marie! gave us such great service. We had a wonderful brunch. The food was fast and tasty. The entire staff was friendly and attentive we wanted for nothing....this place is a must.

Reviews.Author: Rico D.
Reviews.Content: 1000th Review!This was my second time having breakfast at Blu Jam Cafe, and it surpassed my standards yet again. My party got there a little before 9am, right before the crowds arrived (thank God). We were seated right away and the staff was very friendly.Blu Jam Cafe has a couple brunch offerings Friday through Sunday. I'm glad we went on Saturday because I found the love of my life. This cute little waitress... jk it was the BRUNCH BURGER!  They also had brunch tacos and a hash that I would love to try next time. You can tell that this place has great quality and freshness as soon as you take your first  bite. They use all natural, locally grown products. The burger I had was cooked to perfection and topped with two over easy eggs, grilled tomatoes, and  chipotle aioli all in a fluffy brioche bun. The last time I was here the potatoes were bland but you can tell they did some work on them. All in all this is a great spot and I would love to come try the lunch and dinner options.

Reviews.Author: Jessica Y.
Reviews.Content: Highly, highly recommend. This is probably #1 on my take-foreign-friends-seeing-around-LA list. One of the motivations behind this is that most friends who will come see me are probably on a tight schedule-- 5 days max, and we want to make sure we make the best out of that time. Blu Jam would make the list since I wouldn't recommend coming at any time BESIDES 9am, or perhaps even earlier. It'll be a good motivation for anyone to start a day super early. The atmosphere is so nice for a chat with a friend. NOT A STUDYING PLACE. I don't see anyone tried, and I'd say people would be pretty audacious for trying: it's DEF a chatting place, and with literally 25 people in line after 10am, I don't see how anyone can overstay their welcome without feeling super bad. Per other Yelpers: definitely get the crunchy french toast. My friend and I also wanted a salty brunch dish, so we got the bacon macaroni dish. SO good. Perfect balance of sweet and salty between the two dishes. (And very filling for two young ladies).

Reviews.Author: Janet O.
Reviews.Content: Breakfast is my favorite time of the day and favorite meal of the day. On a whim, we chose this place and the fiance was very pleased. It wasn't just because we were starving. The food was all about quality. Of course, they could upgrade their bread... I ordered the Roma omelette that came with way too many tomatoes than necessary. I asked for light cheese, and boy was I glad..My only change would have been to have fluffier chunks of egg as it seemed the tomatoes watered it down some. The FI got the Toscana scramble with turkey sausage. Potato O' Brien cooked well, not over seasoned. It was delicious. One minor addition that would propel this place to five stars is the carb selection. Instead of the dry toast options, it would be great to see a fresh baked muffin, scone or something equivalent offered. ----------------------------------Since I wrote this review, I got a nice e-mail from the owner who explained they tried adding muffins and scones, however, people ended up throwing it out! With that said, I take back the previous comment for the restaurant to add more carb selection and have upgraded my review to 5 stars. Nothing is worse than wasted food.Note: no reservations taken, wait may be 20 min or so on popular days.

Reviews.Author: Gino E.
Reviews.Content: Another bad experience for us on the Westside (what a surprise)... -Our "30 minute" wait turned into an hour and a half.-"You guys are next," really meant, "I'm going to sit three other couples before that came after you guys." We had to literally go and stand next to the hostess inside, to not allow her to pull that crap on us a fourth time.-My croissant sandwich was bland. I think I would have preferred a croissan'wich at Burger King. And the potatoes were decent.-The coffee was sad.-Our server was cool, in the sense that she sensed my agitation and left us alone. I really don't know why I keep insisting on hitting the westside, considering that at least 95% experiences have been horrible. The girlfriend has been given strict instructions to no longer allow me to make breakfast suggestions, WEST of the 101 (unless it's The Griddle).

Reviews.Author: Pepper M.
Reviews.Content: Came here for brunch with a group of friends and I have to say that they are pretty ill-equipped to deal with larger parties. The wait was incredibly long, and while they were very accomodating, I probably wouldn't wait that long again if it weren't my friend's birthday choice to go here.The food was quite good, fresh and very well presented. I was pleased to see they had vegan options. I had the tex mex hash or something named similarly, and it was very tasty. The flavors were full and  definitely more than I was expecting. I would love to come back but the wait was just too intense. It would be great if they added a vegan pancake or waffle to the menu.

Reviews.Author: Jackson Y.
Reviews.Content: French Toast!! First place I think about when I crave french toast! Buttery flavors with a crunch! The best in LA? If you are are a hungry man, probably not not the place for you. Must say, their dishes are very creative and somewhat unique! There is a reason why theres always people waiting in line to eat at this trendy little restaurant on sat or sunday mornings. Because the food is good, service is good, and hype.So far, I've had the brioche french toast and the crunchy french toast.
