Everyone say the crunchy ones are a must try, but I say brioche all the way!! Still has a bit of a crunch, and full of that buttery flavor. Literately salivating as I am writing about these crazy delicious toasts! Never knew I was so into it until I've tired it here.Also tried the steak hash. Another dish that just looks absolutely amazing. With So much different ingredients, each fork full is a pleasure of pure foodgasm.The service here is great. Tentative staff that makes you feel welcomed. They are great at giving advice on what to order. Or if you wanna just chitchat, always have something clever/funny to say. Only drawback is the parking. It is Hollywood, finding good parking maybe turn into quite a bit of a walk. There is always the valet service if you are feelin ballin'. But there are residential areas nearby. Usually can find parking if it is far enough from the main street.Blu Jam's food is not just delicious, they are also visually stunning. Even a simple dish of eggs Benedict looks fabulous. It is no surprise that there is constantly a line to get some brunch at this joint.

Reviews.Author: Edison T.
Reviews.Content: Place itself is quite small, very warm colors. Nice hangings of photographs on the walls. The service is decent, food took a while to come out.Vanilla latte was very creamy and light. Just the right amount of sweetness.  The Power House scramble was good, the chicken breast was very juicy and flavorful. Had the perfect crunch from the broil and the tomato sauce ensured that every bite of the chicken would be paired up nicely with enough sauce.Wow, the French toast was amazing! The corn flake coating gave it a superb crunch and I seriously think that this is what makes the whole dish. Berries helped cut through the starchiness (though it wasn't too much starch) and the vanilla bean sauce just provided a happy medium between the sourness of the berries and the sweetness of the French toast. Excellent dish!

Reviews.Author: Andy C.
Reviews.Content: It was a rainy afternoon, really gloomy.  It was a Sunday, maybe a year ago. My friends and I had an hour or so to kill before we had to go to work. We were all starving.  Blu Jam was there, open and had a table ready.  The waitress recommended the goulash. Really? Goulash? Yes. Oh my gosh yes. Hearty, savory, comforting goulash. I think it might actually be made with love. Everybody raves about Blu Jam's brunch, which is indeed amazing.  The steak & eggs are superb, the smoked salmon concoctions are decadent and the greens balance everything out nicely. But if it is a gloomy afternoon...do yourself a favor...GOULASH!

Reviews.Author: Daniel G.
Reviews.Content: Excellent French toast, good service, and a very good location if you enjoy people watching. Would have given it five stars had the sausage and bacon that comes with your breakfast not been so mediocre. Prices are fair with regards to quality, but not quantity. I ate again 2 hours later! Oh and if you still consider Christina Aguilera a relevant celebrity, she was greeted by a pretty large group of paparazzi waiting in front of her Range Rover, which was conveniently and illegally parked directly in front of the restaurant.All in all the place is good, and I think with the right choice from the menu could potentially be excellent? I will be going back for another go at the Blu Jam Cafe, and if you haven't tried it I would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Author: Cleveland B.
Reviews.Content: Go on a Monday, early afternoon and there's no wait at all! :)Great staff, great food, hard to complain about this place. Crunchy french toast is AWESOME. Vanilla sauce makes it a baller dish. Pork sausages are pretty hefty.  Veggie risotto has great flavor. I saw someone else with the benedict and it looks freakin' delicious. Definitely a must try for next time I am here. It's also nice to sit here on a sunny day. Not sure about the parking situation since I just nabbed a meter on the side, but it looks like it could get rough on the weekends. Definitely a new spot for breakfast and brunch in LA. I also love the fact that they have something for everyone on their menu. It's awesome! There's no wonder this place has so many positive reviews.

Reviews.Author: Doah K.
Reviews.Content: Considering this was the very first joint I visited in my Brunch Bunch escapades, I feel more than obliged to write a review. But let me be clear, the obligation stems hardly from need and mostly from want. After hovering over the extensive menu for a good 10 min., I finally settled with the Roma via Paris (three farm fresh eggs scrambled with spinach, sun-ripened tomatoes, zucchini, cherry tomatoes, bell peppers, fresh basil, Chevrier goat cheese, and mozzarella) served with mixed salad and wheat toast, and a glass of freshly squeezed orange juice on the side. It was, to say the least, very tasty.Everything else about this place fared well: fresh atmosphere, super nice servers, cool, but not overly trendy or pretentious patrons (which was rather surprising given it's on Melrose), great locale, and most importantly, delicious food. They even had dog bowls of water for thirsty doggies -- bonus point!

Reviews.Author: elisheva m.
Reviews.Content: I love this place and I eat breakfast here all the time. The food is fantastic and the service is usually also great.However, I went her for lunch today and had the worst experience. Our server, Lauren, seemed completely put out to be serving us, she argued with the bus boys in front of us, our food took nearly an hour to arrive and when it was time for the check, I had to hunt her down so that I could pay and leave. The difference between breakfast and lunch service was really disappointing.I highly recommend this place for breakfast - there's a huge line out front on weekends, but it's worth the wait. However, I wouldn't advise going here for a weekday lunch. I know that I wont do that again!

Reviews.Author: Jessie M.
Reviews.Content: Maybe my second favorite brunch spot in town.so so so so so so so so so good. cheap, delicious, with a nice atmosphere, what more can you ask? Downside: it takes you forever to pick something to order because everything sounds amazing. I guess that's more positive than negative.

Reviews.Author: Vy S.
Reviews.Content: My friends and I hit up Blu Jam Cafe for brunch before heading to the Melrose Trading Post further down Melrose.  When we arrived at 10am, the wait was about 45 minutes - luckily we were seated in around 25.Street parking in LA on Sunday is (usually) free before 11 a.m. - that's when a lot of the meters go into effect, so try your luck in a residential area or get there early!Most of my friends were in an Eggs Benedict kind of me, as was I, so many of us settled for either the classic Benedict (me), the Norwegian Benedict (smoked salmon) or the Blu Jam Benedict (classic with bacon!).  Only one friend ventured outside of the Benedicts and got herself an omelette with chorizo and jalapenos known as the "Migas."The Eggs Benedict was very delicious - I liked the flavor of the hollandaise which wasn't too overpowering - although I will admit that mine came out a bit cold (even though my diced red potatoes came out piping hot).  Everyone was really happy with their meals.I paired my brunch with an organic coffee, which had a smooth taste and was constantly refilled (the mark of great service!)  I also liked that the water came with a hint of lemon and mint.A great brunch outing in LA!

Reviews.Author: Dayae K.
Reviews.Content: I loveeeeee cafes! Perfectly located in the middle of shops on Melrose, Blu Jam is a cute cafe with delicious food.My boyfriend ordered the Migas(?)... I think that's what it was called. It was VERY good. It was spicy beef chorizo with scrambled eggs and cheese with salsa on top with potatoes and tortilla on the side. It wasn't too spicy and it had just the right amount of flavor.I ordered the french toast with corn flake batter. The french toast was very tasty with the vanilla syrup and fruits.I really liked their water... I knew it tasted different. They put mint and lemon in it! It was very delicious.And, the bathroom was very clean... which is always a pluss!!! ^0^

Reviews.Author: CHRISTY L.
Reviews.Content: I saved this special place for my 100th review!I second Nica's love of the crunchy French toast. It was a pretty plate of food that was even tastier than it was pretty. Everyone at my table loved what they ordered for brunch. YELP helped me look like a superstar in the know among my friends for knowing about this spot and recommending it. Our wait was less than 10 minutes for brunch (I think we arrived around 9:30 on a Saturday) but we would have gladly waited longer. It was THAT good.

Reviews.Author: Crystle C.
Reviews.Content: Food was great.  Server was great. Kitchen was a wreck. Owner was an ass. Literally ruined my experience.I love me some brunch and picked this place based on the awesome reviews.  Went on a Tuesday afternoon -  parking was easy, was seated quickly, and the runners brought waters to our table before our server could even ask if we wanted any.  Was great.Turned for the worse when our food had arrived to the table and my potatoes were burnt, my cousins scrambled eggs were served w/ a balsamic salad and my sister got a side of fruit instead of potatoes.  Apparently, when they ran out of potatoes, they opted to put whatever they wanted on our plates, not mention it until we asked, and then proceed to tell us (the OWNER, that is) that they weren't going to bother to cook us fresh potatoes when they were about to close - mind you, we arrived about 3:45 when they close at 5pm.  Only after a bit of eye rolling the owner adjusted our check, but it was still a really horrible first impression. To their credit, the house sent over a complimentary dessert for the table at the end of our meal.  And again, the food was great.  Just steer clear of posted closing time - I'd say 2 to 3 HOURS prior to closing - and avoid the owners snippy moments and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Author: T. R.
Reviews.Content: There is always a wait... usually a good sign right?? Go with it an do enjoy the signature crunchy french toast! Juices are all fresh. Their are not many things ive tried but i will honestly say the menu itemsi have tried are all delish... Its a very impressive spot.  Once your in everything flows well..  Staff is friendly knowledgeable about their food and on top of it. You are in for a sweet treat... Enjoy

Reviews.Author: Chong L.
Reviews.Content: Came for brunch on Sunday and it was great! Good quality food and healthy options. I had the California omelet and it was tasty. The eggs were fluffy, veggies were generous and fresh. Their coffee was good too.I wish they had tabasco instead of chalula. Something about breakfast with tabasco is so awesome.It gets busy here and it's a smaller joint, but I like it!

Reviews.Author: Edward L.
Reviews.Content: SUPER CUTE WAITRESSES!!!!! I've eaten here twice this week, strickly because of the super smoking cutie waitresses.The food is decent, the price is alright, the crowd is hip but the ladies are sooo right.As soon as I get a gf my reviews will be more normal.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie S.
Reviews.Content: Can you tell this weekend was all about the breakfast?This place is very Sunday lunch. Slow, but tasty. You have to have plenty of time to sit around and enjoy the random people wandering around, the puppies licking your toes when they run away from their masters at the neighboring table, the sound of Porsches, Ferraris, and Priuses wandering by. Had the rancheros and they were okay ("Two fried eggs over a crispy corn tortilla, lettuce, bell peppers, cilantro & black beans, topped w/ cheddar, roasted tomato salsa, avocado and sour cream, served with potatoes". ) They would definitely sit nicely in a pita or sandwich of some sort.  It also could have been a bite spicier, but I'll take it. This is definitely more bistro style than the Griddle Cafe. More bring your girlfriend than bring your bros type deal. There are not any televisions near here for you to watch Sunday college football. There are clothing stores and other famous places of Melrose (Melrose is really a yelper's dream come true).

Reviews.Author: Crystal C.
Reviews.Content: Came here for brunch with a friend on a Sunday.I drove by the place and totally passed it and didn't even know! But there wasn't a wait and we got seated quick. My friend ordered a mocha and it took like a good 15 minutes for that to come out. I was thinking, "what's taking so long?!" but I can see why. It came out so pretty! I took a sip, it was so creamy and chocolaty! Best mocha I ever had, EVER!Our food came, she ordered the crepes while I had the breakfast quesadilla. It was packed with spinach and eggs, it was delicious! I tried the crepes, I was a little hesitant since I really don't like cottage cheese but it worked. The sweetness of the strawberries with the cottage cheese was a match for the crepes. The service was good, they kept on refilling my coffee and checked up on us from time to time. On the plus side, I found another breakfast place to hit up after I get off from work.

Reviews.Author: Jon N.
Reviews.Content: This place goes down as one of the best brunch experiences I've had. I stumbled upon this place while looking for a place that could accommodate our group of 7 on a Saturday at around 12:30. I didn't have high hopes but I called blu jam and they said there would be a table available when we got there (I estimated in 45 minutes from when I called). I saw a few people waiting, so was incredibly surprised that when I mentioned I was the one who called they had held a table for our larger party in the back wine room! Incredible, especially since I didn't even leave my name over the phone.From there on out, everything was incredible - from my chai latte to my russian scramble (with fresh wild salmon and caviar). Incredible service. Incredible food. What surprised me the most was the incredible value this place offers as well. In San Francisco, this place would probably be twice as expensive.I'm DEFINITELY returning to blu jam next time I need some breakfast/brunch/lunch around melrose.

Reviews.Author: Jamie N.
Reviews.Content: One thing I love is when my bf takes the initiative to find a new restaurant to try on his day off. He knows me so well...... I love food!We got to Blu Jam Cafe nice and early to try out their breakfast. Now, I'm not a morning person, but for this place.... I will jump out of bed and get ready quick just to have that oh so wonderful Steak and Eggs (Grilled Omaha Prime Beef Tenderloin with gorgonzola cheese, caramelized onions, red potatoes, topped with fresh eggs and hollandaise). OMG!!!!!!!! Sooo good. I'm so glad we went there early. This place gets packed. I have yet to try their dinner and everything else on their breakfast menu.

Reviews.Author: Eric N.
Reviews.Content: Super packed on Sunday at brunch timeWe waited only 15 minutes for a table...sweeet!  The hostess really made an effort to get everyone seated within reasonable time +1 starMint + Lemon iced water? omg +1 starvenetian chicken sandwich, with not one but TWO juicy and flavorful chicken breast pieces with awesome choice of cheese and fresh pesto spread +1 starperfectly baked focaccia (probably not what focaccia is really supposed to be) but it was soft on the inside, had a perfect hardness and crunch all around on the outside +1 starattentitive service +1 staryou do the math.  I'll def be back here again, maybe on a saturday instead of a sunday.  Also plenty of shops up & down Melrose to keep your mind off of food while you wait

Reviews.Author: Lina J.
Reviews.Content: When I think vegan, I usually think bland, boring vegetarian food. But Blu Jam's Spicy Tex Mex Tofu Hash is seriously to DIEEEE for. The vegan hash is a stir-fry with a whole bunch of ingredients (tofu, black beans, onions, cilantro, potatoes, tomatoes) topped with fresh avocados & served with a side of corn tortilla + this AMAZING chipotle sauce. It doesn't sound like much but it may be THE most delicious breakfast dish I've had. EVER. Healthy AND appetizing? It really is as good as it gets.I have also tried their rare tuna sandwich, the steak panini, the Blu Jam Benedict, the Burgundy omelette and their legendary french toast. Everything is absolutely DELICIOUS. And their grapefruit mimosas....SO GOOD!! Super sweet + refreshing even if you don't add the syrup. I love this place and I'll definitely be back the next time I'm in the LA area. The only downside to the restaurant is the parking and the wait. Expect to wait 20+ minutes during peak brunch/lunch hours.

Reviews.Author: Lovey O.
Reviews.Content: I went here recently for brunch on ladies' night out.  The luxury of having breakfast for dinner, outside of my house is something I really appreciate.  I had some oddly sweet ground beef in "Mexican" nachos earlier in the day, so I was definitely on the hunt for savory.  Enter the Blu Jam eggs benedict.  I was feeling particularly gluttonous and ordered the potato and leek soup.  To drink I had their version of a red-eye.  Coffee is by Aroma Coffee in Woodland Hills.  Roaster insists the coffee be served no more than two weeks upon delivery,  if that matters to anyone?Hollandaise sauce was too tart, ham was a bit too salty.  Otherwise, the eggs, bread underneath, and the home fries were all very good.  Portions are huge and every bite is as good as the last.  Soup wasn't amazing but still good.  Their version of the red-eye (coffee with espresso on top) was disappointingly tart.  It brought on flashes of horrible Intelligentsia experiences.  Fortunately for Blu Jam and Aroma Coffee, it was salvageable with loads of half and half.  I got to try the crispy french toast and the vanilla french toast.  Vanilla was too sweet for my tooth.  It was pretty with all the fruits, yogurt, and powdered sugar, and was a hit with the friend that ordered it.  The crispy french toast is something else.  I've never had corn flake crusted french toast.  MMMMM!!!! soo good!  It's only served on the weekends, so I'll have to drive all the way to LA when the craving hits.Service was very attentive.  They did a good job of making all our orders come out around the same time, especially with 1/5 of the party coming a bit later than everyone else.Parking: Metered street or residential.  No permit for residential.  It was pretty easy to find a spot.

Reviews.Author: Rebecca W.
Reviews.Content: You will definitely not leave hungry!The atmosphere is nice, not too loud, with a little open air patio section. Their food is delicious, my friend and I came here for my birthday brunch and we got the french toast (with mixed berries and syrup) and the steak panini (with mushrooms, roasted bell pepper, cheese, and a nice piece of steak). These two dishes was the perfect amount for us to share, both a taste of savory and sweet!The french toast was moist and perfectly sweet and the portion is good too. The steak panini was amazing! They don't skimp out on the meat for sure because there was a nice sized piece of steak inside with the perfect combination of cheeses and vegetables.The service is good and I'll definitely be coming back here again!

Reviews.Author: Edwina S.
Reviews.Content: Do I really need to write a review about this place?!!  I love Blu Jam Cafe.  - I recommend the French Toast or Vegetarian Eggs Benedict.  - The Mimosas are a little too small for me because I like to start my drinking early. So, order a pitcher. - The wait time can be long. - Parking can be a hassle, but they do have valet.- If you go on a weekend, to go before 10am. That is all and Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Tori P.
Reviews.Content: Went on a weekend night a few months ago. Had some glazed shrimp on crusty toast,which was delicious. Do not remember what the guys had,but I really liked my sister's bruschetta too: burrata, strawberries, and sprouts. The bf and I ended up making our version at home later in the week because we thought they were so good. Brought the pup as well,who tangled himself in and out of the patio railing. It was a nice outdoor space to have him at; however,there were lots of passing-by homeless people making a grab for him,and I don't like ANY stranger petting w/o asking. The server was nice enough to bring him some water.Downside: Pretty pricey. The food and beer was good,but don't expect to get full for under $30.

Reviews.Author: Catherine K.
Reviews.Content: Came to Blu Jam after reading Diana I.'s review, and I have to say, the french toast is as good as everyone makes it out to be.I don't like getting thing hyped up, but the french toast was an exception.  After dillydallying between the regular french toast and vanilla french toast, I ordered the VANILLA FRENCH TOAST because it had fruit, jam, and yogurt in between...wow!! so flavorful and sweet!I didn't need to use any of the syrup because it was sweet enough by itself, which is fine by me :)My bf ordered the CALIFORNIA OMELETTE and that was really good too.  Fresh avocado slices on top and potato sides mmmMmmHe also ordered a latte and I guess I have a thing for coffee designs :D His latte had a cute little man with a stache :3Overall, real cute environment and tasty breakfast menu!  I'd love to come here again, if I was in the area!A bit noisy and I could clearly hear every word of gossip on either side of me, but it's all part of the experience haha

Reviews.Author: Remy-Anne V.
Reviews.Content: Breakfast at 230pm..Their Crunchy French toast is to die for! If you don't wanna read my long review, take this away from it-  If you eat here you MUST try this, it is by far the best i've ever had.After a long day before at Disneyland and some drinks at night, some real good hearty food was definitely needed the next day. My friend and i wanted to find a spot that was close to Melrose of course since shopping was a must do on our list for the day. We stumbled on this and decided to check it out...Be prepared to wait! But the wait is worth it! It's popular for a reason because the food is deelish! Our wait was about 20 mins but it was ok, cuz we just window shopped in close by stores. When you first enter its a decent size place. Crowded of course, but not in a bad way. What i really liked about the place was the art that was hung up on the walls- they're also for sale too! Really nice modern and contemporary pieces up.  Our hostess and waiter were super duper nice and friendly. And to top off our visit, our order literally came 2 minutes after we ordered it! Which was a total surprise to us as well as our waiter, but that's nothing to complain about!  My friend and I decided to order and of course share- the Eggs Benedict (this is one of my favorite dishes and I was totally craving it this morning!) and their famous Crunchy French Toast. Their Benedict was OK. not that great. They skimped out on their sauce...However! Their Crunchy French Toast! OMG. Now this was hella good. French toast wtih some type of frosted flakes mixed and on the top. (With fresh fruit and berries on the side too) This was just amazing. Sweet and crunchy and my mouth was just exploding with flavor! It's something I definitely wanna dable in and try and re-create it at home. On my next trip to socal and melrose, I know where I'll be eating my french toast =)(We also had a celebrity sighting!!! Donald Faison was eating there! The black guy from Scrubs, yea that one...lol)

Reviews.Author: Rachel R.
Reviews.Content: Went here on a whim - felt like a brunchy kind of Sunday aka, hungover and tired and I want someone else to make my food for me (will pay big money, too).So I ended up here. And what an absolute perfect spot to end up at. If an alien were to pick me up via spaceship, push me around and drop me back off at Earth, I would kindly give them directions to Blu Jam's front door step (assuming I'm super hungry because they didn't offer me the same french toast Blu Jam would).I ordered the Crunchy French Toast (on their Weekend Brunch Only menu). I read that it came with a side of Vanilla Bean sauce. I was immediately sold. If crack was sold in liquid form, it would amount to this. I triple dipped my french toast in the sauce and almost asked for another one.Onto the french toast.  The crunch was made possible by corn flakes. YUM. It definitely added a nice touch to the traditional french toast and I LIKED IT ALOT, ALOT.  They put banana, strawberry and blueberry slices so no need to order bacon. I did, and it ended up just sitting on the plate, staring at me.  It might've also been because it came out burnt, my only gripe about my entire meal. And it didn't help that it was $3.95 for 4-5 slices. Sigh. Never again. But Crunchy French Toast w. Liquid Crack dipping sauce? YES. I WILL COME AGAIN.In comparison to The Griddle Cafe, this one's better. It's less tourist-y (damn you tourists for coming in parties of 200). Also, my bf co-signed that Blu Jam's quesadilla mexican dish was better than The Griddle's b-fast burrito. My french toast was also better than The Griddle's red velvet pancakes.  It's also easier to find parking @ Blu Jam (they have valet, street parking on Melrose and also neighborhood parking).

Reviews.Author: Ed H.
Reviews.Content: When my friends said this was one of their favorite breakfast places, I thought...ya whatever. Finally went here on a Monday morning to try this place, and man, I was thoroughly impressed! Their sandwiches are absolutely delicious and savory. The most simple sandwich that you'd find at any other diner/restaurant becomes the most amazing version of the same sandwich you've had elsewhere. I can see why there's a wait when I drive by on the weekend. Definitely recommend this place and will be coming back.

Reviews.Author: Isabella L.
Reviews.Content: Their signature crunchy french toast has this terrific texture and taste. The vanilla bean sauce and berries just add to the yummyness ten-fold. I didn't get to look around the place too much - it's kinda dark, even in the middle of a sunny day, but it was definitely busy and crowded with an eclectic bunch.Service was good, but I did get scared a few times when the server plunked down my friend's iced tea hard on the table - basically throwing it. I think they're trying to be hipster cute, but it just seemed rude.I want to come back and try their lunch or dinner - I would imagine dinner time might be more calm.

Reviews.Author: Raechel S.
Reviews.Content: We had to see what the hype was all about, via the massive amount of Yelp reviews.    We waited an hour in the 100 degree weather before being seated, so needless to say, we were hungry and a little cranky.   The service here is speedy and efficient--we never felt crowded out or rushed though!   We ordered the Roma Via Paris omelette...whatever cheese they put in there is what makes this delicious!!! My friends ordered the famous crunchy French toast and then chilaquiles...our favorite was the omelette. While the French toast was simply to die for, I think if we had ordered that s an actual entree and nothing else, it might have  been a little over the top.    Overall, this was a GREAT brunch spot to check out, but be very mindful you will be waiting a very long time.

Reviews.Author: R S.
Reviews.Content: Ever since my favorite neighborhood spot Authentic Cafe closed I have been looking for a new place I enjoy & Blu Jam is up there.  I agree w/ the prior reviewers in that the service here is excellent and not pretentious (Jason & his cronies always seem happy to help).  I love the surroundings - inside you can meet w/ friends & still hear each other & outside you can people watch.  I usually get The Ocean & a soup (1/2 & 1/2 combo) and you can't forget their amazing crepes!  This place stands out amongst the other small restaurants on Melrose & is a nice reprieve when you've been shopping all day.

Reviews.Author: Jenn S.
Reviews.Content: I would like to give this place 4 stars but on the day that I went the service was SOOOOO slow. The restaurant wasn't packed so I don't know why it took so long to get our food. But the food was delicious. So I ordered the French Toast with bananas, strawberries and chocolate syrup. When it came out I was disappointed because it only had a few strawberries, bananas and chocolate syrup drizzled on top. I thought "why did i pay extra for this?" but then when I went to take a bite I noticed that there were strawberries, bananas and chocolate on the inside too! It was a very nice surprise. And I tried my friend's prosciutto, pesto mozzarella panini which was also very good.I will try this place again and hopefully the service is better. if not, then I won't be giving it a third chance.

Reviews.Author: Louisa L.
Reviews.Content: Huge fan of this brunch place!! Love the ambiance. Reminds me of a little village cottage, very antique but cute. LIke somewhere Belle from beauty and the beast would go to read a book and have some coffee and food :) The waiters there are also super nice and friendly. I got the famous latte with the design drawn on top as a drink. It comes in a HUGE cup, so definitely have an empty stomach coming here! My friend and I shared the normal french toast and the blue jam benedict on croissant bread. OMG THEY WERE BOTH DELICIOUS!!! If you're a fan of eggs, u'd love the benedict. I mean, how much better could it get...being on croissant and everything?? The egg was poached perfectly and it was just amazing. The french toast was also simply delicious. Huge fan of both dishes! Will definitely come back for more yummy brunch food in the future =)

Reviews.Author: Jennifer H.
Reviews.Content: One of the reasons I love the weekends is because I'm a big fan of brunch. I usually stay in my hood, but this place is so cute. I met a friend here on Sunday and thought there would be a long wait. I guess the crowd comes a little later because we had no problem getting a table at 11:30.I had the Blu Jam Benedict: a split croissant, black forest ham, bacon, poached eggs, and a drizzle of hollandaise with a side of greens. Eggs Benedict is not a healthy breakfast by any means but I was surprised how light this was. The croissant wasn't oily, the bacon was crisp but not greasy and the whole dish wasn't swimming in hollandaise. It was delicious. My friend had the SImply Eggs plate which was 2 eggs any style, bacon, potatoes, and rosemary toast. It looked good but I'm all about a breakfast I can't make on my own.Service is also great. Street parking is easy; I parked on Fuller and walked over.

Reviews.Author: Amanda C.
Reviews.Content: I'm not a discriminating reviewer that only gives 5 stars to a specific nearly-unreachable echelon of restaurants, but I will say that based on one meal alone I'm usually hesitant to give such a good score. I don't know if it was a fluke, and I don't know if I just chose a menu item that happened to be unusually delicious. However, if that one meal blows me away, then five stars it is.A friend and I visited Blu Jam on a Saturday at around 12:30 for brunch. We waited no longer than 2 minutes to be seated, and the waitstaff was quick in asking us for drinks and our order. The food also came out to us more quickly than I would have expected, which was a pleasant surprise. Throughout the meal, our drinks were refilled in a timely manner and we were asked frequently how everything was and if we needed anything. The atmosphere was comfortable and relaxed, and I liked that (it seemed that) the employees weren't restricted by a rigid dress code. They dressed in their personal style - the majority of which fit in with the ambiance of the Melrose Blvd location - and had small aprons identifying them as employees. It was a nice touch for a chill morning brunch.I ordered the Russian scramble, the likes of which I had not seen on a menu elsewhere. It had lox, which other places do serve, but the ingredient combination was unique and delicious. Topped with sour cream and caviar, I was in heaven. I love me some nicely-cooked eggs, and Blu Jam delivered. The breakfast potatoes I could take or leave, but that's usually the attitude I have with starch on the side of my omelette/scramble, so no love lost for Blu Jam.The only con I could think of would be the lack of parking, but that's a general complaint of mine about a lot of these West/Hollywood-area breakfast/brunch places. Overall the good service, unique and delicious menu options, and casual atmosphere made for an excellent brunch experience. I'd definitely come back and recommend Blu Jam to friends.

Reviews.Author: J. William W.
Reviews.Content: I'll make this short and sweet, it took what seemed like 45 minutes to get pancakes and oatmeal. People were literally being seated after me and getting their meals before us. I specifically asked for no powdered sugar and of course my pancakes arrived all sugar everything. The strange thing was a second batch came to my table in less than two minutes. Too bad they couldn't of done that the first time. For the most part this is not a really big deal, things happen orders get missed and mixed up from time to time.I've came here a few times before and the food has always been pretty good, today was no exception. I like the atmosphere and the decor is solid so I really want to like this place and why this hasn't been my first time.BUT!!!!! (I like butts but not this kind).... But what I can't tolerate and totally pissed me off is a rude or non-functional wait-staff. Looking back I actually feel bad about our waitress because none my issues were actually her fault.On two separate occasions waitresses walk right up to our table and took condiments off our table 1) didn't ask if it was okay 2) reached over us and didn't say excuse me. WTF home-skillets! Wait if I was eating at home I'd see more manors and courtesy. So to compound the food taking forever, order being wrong & wretched waitresses my appetite and mood is bit shot. Thought I was going to have a pleasant meal with the lady then go shopping for camera equipment. Only one of the two happened.[Scratches head] Hey! I said was going to make this short and sweet. Anyways...So the waitress at this point knows I'm pissed and isn't sure what to do so chooses to avoid eye contact at all costs. I'm not sure she knew the full story and I regret not filling here in before I left. At this point is where i whip out my phone and start writing this review. After a few minutes of typing on my phone I think her and a couple of staffers knew i was on Yelp. All of sudden people who weren't even my waitress started asking us if we need anything and if our meal was good. Ya'll should of thought of that before I got to the point of interrupting my conversation with my girlfriend to write this review and better yet before you took the condiments or packets of sugar off the table and never brought back causing my GF to not want another cup of coffee, thank you very much.Anyways I'm not a fan of being irritated so I'm ending this review and continuing on with my day.Too late, Too little is today's theme.

Reviews.Author: funnylady B.
Reviews.Content: oh my goodness oh my goodness, i loooove blu jam!After living in LA for 3 years, I have found the perfect breakfast! The dishes are unique and there is totally something for everyone. I ordered a dish with scrambled eggs, mixed with brie cheese, green onions and smoked salmon and swapped out the potatoes for fruit trying to be healthy....my mom ordered the breakfast deal which comes with pancakes. I HAVE NEVER HAD BETTER PANCAKES! THEY TASTED LIKE GLAZED DOUGHNUTS!!! oh my goodness!the coffee was great, the waitress was so nice and so patient with the table next to us who seemed to find everything wrong with EVERYTHING. the busser was also soooo sweet and helpful and oh it was just such a wonderful way to start the morning! also, the atmosphere is so lovely inside and you wouldn't expect it from the looks of melrose (which I frequent often...gotta see what's on sale at urban!) it is spacious and clean and comfy and oh i can't wait to go back here again!!!

Reviews.Author: Cheryl B.
Reviews.Content: Oh how I love thee.....Vanilla French Toast.  I would eat this every day if my waist would promise not to expand.  The staff is attentive and the food is delicious.  I have also had the Steak and Eggs and it was also very good.  I am not a big fan of the Crunchy French Toast as nothing can take the place of the Vanilla french toast.There is always a long line unless you go during the week or late weekends.  But it is worth it.

Reviews.Author: Hikaru P.
Reviews.Content: 2 stars is harsh, but I have simple tastes...I was hideously hung-over and I just wanted decent coffee and some eggs and bacon...seriously, no excuse on the coffee, if you don't know what proper coffee is, send your staff to intelligentsia to find out...cappuccino cup was freakishly large and overflowing with an uddersful of tepid froth...not even sure what the coffee tasted like as I struggled to overcome my gag-reflex to get to the desperately needed caffeine.My mistake, I ordered the Italian breakfast special which was eggs on risotto...my goodness, is the place sponsored by the dairy council...too much cheese, and butter catalyzing gluggy rice into a monument of indigestability...not even the presence of bacon could save this dish...I picked out the fresh peas, poked at the eggs and left the surrounding untoasted panini slices to the greater forces of entropy.Maybe I ordered bad...maybe I was too hung over to live let alone eat...but that coffee was unforgivable.Surely, there must be better breakfast out there...my search continues.

Reviews.Author: Tom S.
Reviews.Content: An outstanding truffle egg white scramble.  That, along with steel cut oatmeal made when you order, and the best salmon platter west of the Hudson.  A unique dining experience any time of day.Totally different dinner menu when open.

Reviews.Author: Evan Z.
Reviews.Content: Get the spicy southwest burger. It's amazing. I also got bacon and dipped it syrup. The service here was superb. I am already planning my next time here

Reviews.Author: Jennifer J.
Reviews.Content: Mint leaves in their water pitcherPeach white teaOranginaBreakfast all dayWraps, paninis, gourmet sandwiches, yummy salads, variety of entreesGreat serviceNice and cool seating indoors or you can opt to ppl watch outsidePrime location in the midst of all the shopsWhat more can a girl want!

Reviews.Author: Mary C.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam Cafe' is a great brunch spot. It's conveniently located if you're in Hollywood and parking was pretty easy. They have a small, but lovely outdoor seating area. I have to admit I came in for the $7.99 breakfast specials, but ended up ordering off the regular menu because those options were pretty limited. They were offering a special international menu at the time and I had to go with the French Vegetable Scrambler. I was not disappointed. It was full of creamy goat cheese and loaded with veggies. The portions were the perfect size to not leave hungry without feeling over-stuffed. I tried my friend's brioche French toast with blackberries and it was good, but I wouldn't want a whole plate of it. I tend to not like things on the sweeter side. The service was pretty good from our server, but she could have been more engaged. She brought us the check immediately with our food, which I'm not fond of. However, the coffee guy was on it, never letting our cups go half empty. If you don't get one of the breakfast specials prices are on the high side, but not outrageous. Overall, nice atmosphere and really tasty food. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Author: Jenny H.
Reviews.Content: I love this place!! I just wish it were in norcal so I could come here all the time.  I have yet to find the perfect breakfast place in the south bay. My friends and I each ordered a dish and tried a bit of each others.- Florentine Benedict  ($11.95) : Best benedict ever!! Eggs benedict is one of my favorite things to order, and this is the first place where I've seen brie cheese.  The eggs were perfectly cooked and the spinach and mushroom were very juicy. I liked the hollandaise sauce too.- Salmon Hash ($14.95) : Delicious! There were nice big chunks of salmon mixed into the potatoes.  It was perfect to eat with the toast.- Wrap On Fire ($9.95) : This was a great vegetarian option with huge serving size.  It looked like a giant burrito but with eggs inside.  I enjoyed the little bit of spiciness from the chipotle peppers.- Brioche French Toast with blackberry jam and vanilla yogurt ($10.95):  The fruits were very fresh and the french toast was very good with the yogurt.  I can't wait to come back~

Reviews.Author: Stacey K.
Reviews.Content: Not only does BJC live up to their name, but i also love that it's on Melrose! Perfect to walk around and shop to help digest your meal! We got here on a Saturday around 1pm and the wait was only 20-30 minutes, but make sure you stick around because the wait is usually shorter because some people leave for too long and miss their names being called. I ordered the Norwegian Benedict and it was REALLY GOOD! The best Benedict that i've ever tried..the eggs were poached perfectly and the mushroom, spinach, and sundried tomatoes worked so well together, especially with their hollandaise sauce! I'll probably add a couple strips of bacon to the benedict next time to enhance this dish even more, haha. My sister ordered the wrap on fire (breakfast burrito) and it was tasty, but not as good as my benedict! I'm for sure coming back here again when im in Hollywood!

Reviews.Author: Andrea P.
Reviews.Content: I have been to Blu Jam several times and they were ALL great experiences! Staff is friendly and attentive, the atmosphere is chill and jazzy and the food is SUPER yummy.Roma via Paris- very romantic sounding and delicious for goat cheese loversKamil's breakfast - basically like a stir fry scramble with macaroni :) I liked this even though you can probably make a very similar version at home :PCRUNCHY FRENCH TOAST - life changing!!! served with vanilla bean sauce, absolutely delish and now served everyday!!Oatmeal - filled with fresh fruit, LARGE portion, totally shareable between 2 peopleFor your first time, I would definitely recommend the crunchy french toast and picking a savory breakfast dish to balance it out :)If I lived closer or if the wait wasn't so long on weekends, I would totally be a regular here. If you are a morning person, it's best to get here early (especially on wknds) because the wait can get pretty long. Free 2hr street parking in the area!! :)

Reviews.Author: Jing P.
Reviews.Content: Really overrated.Got the specials: the signature Blu Jam Crunchy French Toast and the Blu Jam Benedict. Ugh. The cheap cornflakes really ruined the french toast-- all I could taste was sugar, and then more sugar. Barely half the plate of french toast was finished. Really lackluster. Although the benedict was a better bet than the crunchy french toast, it wasn't better by much. Pretty standard, nothing that wows. Muffin was a little tough, the sauce could have been thicker and richer. Originally pretty stoked for this place--waiting around for 45 minutes should have some payoff--but as per some hypes, it's just shiny without substance. But props to the host. Really gracious and kind, he placed us next on the waitlist after missing our call.

Reviews.Author: Heather T.
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I went around 930am Sunday morning and had a 5 min wait. hooray!We tried to find two dishes to split, but we both wanted the same thing and ended up both getting the Florentine benedict. Sorry crunchy french toast... youll have to be on the lineup next time.I got mine with potatoes, which had a fantastic rosemary smell (I even had a sprig buried in mine), but were way too salty. Hollandaise was delicious but also a bit salty for me (thats why one star is missing).Service was phenomenal - friendly and attentive - my coffee was never low and we were never rushed. I didnt catch my server's name, but he was stellar. Next time I need a spot in WeHo area, I'd come back to just try a few more things on the menu.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie F.
Reviews.Content: Can't say much more than what has already been said in the nearly 1,500 reviews...this is just a fab restaurant. Brunch waits are CRAY on the weekends, but, it's worth it. Just expect a considerable wait on Saturdays and Sundays.Their coffe/tea/etc are stellar. My favorite is the Tofu Hash (vegan) and an Earl Grey tea. My boyfriend usually gets a burger or chicken sandwich is always super satisfied. Make sure you check out their daily specials, as those are often winners, too.

Reviews.Author: Bruce W.
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast place. I've been here about five times over the last year and always get the French Toast. But the last time I got the Crunchy French Toast and was it fabulous! Brioche bread with corn flakes and I think they put in something secret to up the taste up a few notches. Served with berries and sliced bananas plus the vanilla bean sauce. I get some regular syrup as well. Excellent coffee also.If you haven;t been here put it on your list for your next breakfast out.

Reviews.Author: Celeste P.
Reviews.Content: I usually have nothing for breakfast because of my super-fast paced/lazy lifestyle, and I rarely eat breakfast at a restaurant. Breakfast is time consuming and I'm the kind of girl who needs the extra half-hour in the mornings to be presentable! However, when you're in love with a "breakfast connoisseur," breakfast dates become necessary and unavoidable, and that's how I ended up at Blu Jam. I went to Blu Jam for the sixth or seventh time this morning, sleepily ordered coffee-- scratch that, make that an iced mocha latte, no, wait, a hot latte, vanilla-- and had some Loxex. Loxex, for you novice Blu Jammers, is an omelette of lox, sour cream, chives, brie cheese and tomatoes with a side of toast and breakfast potatoes. Delicious. The prices may seem a little high for breakfast food, but the portions here are large and satisfying; I got full before I could even make a dent in my meal.If you like savory breakfasts, BluJam is the place to be. Though I prefer seriously sweet breakfasts like crepes and french toasts, BluJam's hearty offerings have never disappointed me. Just make sure the hostess can put a face to your name, or you may not get seated and you'll have to wait even longer to get your morning nutrition.

Reviews.Author: Karen C.
Reviews.Content: Oh wow...Go Sunday for their Sunday brunch menu and order the cereal flake crusted french toast with vanilla sauce.They offer chai latte blended. I thought that was creative. It was pretty light; not too much of any one flavor but I still enjoyed it. Their burgers are delicious. You can really taste the juicy and tender meat.  I ordered a side of 1 banana pancake. It was topped with strawberries and whipped cream. It was good but nothing really too special.Not a surprise that I coudln't finish all this food. Another case of my eyes being too big for my stomach. I'd probably describe this place as a coffee shop, brunch spot, turned dinner cafe that has a full bar and creative brunch appropriate cocktails. I'd like to come back and try the eggs benedict and drinks next time!

Reviews.Author: Annie Y.
Reviews.Content: My friend and I came here for brunch on Thanksgiving morning. I love the ambiance; it's adorable. We were sat immediately. I got a hot chocolate and a breakfast quesadilla. The hot chocolate was delicious -- thick and chocolatey, but not overly sweet. The quesadilla, on the other hand, was a huge disappointment. It came with egg, spinach, tomato, avocado, salsa, and literally 5 tiny pieces of chicken, which was definitely not what I expected based on the menu description. The abundance of spinach made everything else soggy and unappetizing, and the salsa was waaaay too heavy on the cilantro/onion. The potatoes on the side were well cooked, though, even if they were slightly underseasoned. I tried my friend's turkey benedict and loved it -- it was a mound of turkey, stuffing, and various other Thanksgiving ingredients with the typical poached eggs on top.We shared the french toast with blackberry jam, vanilla yogurt, and mixed berries afterwards. It was good, but not as good as I was hoping based on the reviews. The french toast was a little dry and flat, and I'm not sure the blackberry jam worked with its cinnamonyness (okay, not a word, but hopefully it gets the point across).Service was so-so -- our server was friendly and sweet, but she wasn't as attentive as she could've been.I haven't written this place off yet, but I'll definitely try some of the other great brunch places in LA before I go back.

Reviews.Author: Lizee A.
Reviews.Content: The hubby and I decided to have brunch at the infamous BluJam Cafe. We figured a rainy Sunday, would have small wait time...riiiiiight? We were sooo wrong! It was an hour and 15 minute wait. I decided to spend my next 1 hour and 15 minute, studying EVERY single item in the menu, whereas my husband was to grumpy and hungry to do anything. Finally we get seated, order and take a bite of our breakfast. Then my husband utters with a mouth full of steak and Gorgonzola "omg it was so worth it...." Food: We ordered the Steak Hash and Crunchy French Toast. Both amazingly delicious. The steak hash was hearty. If you love steak, potatoes, eggs and cheese, then you'll love the hash. As for the Crunchy French Toast it was a goodness of berries, bananas and vanilla bean syrup. The french toast melted in my mouth. Definitely a must try. Service: The owner was nice and passed out "complementary wine bottle cards" for Friday /Saturday night, as an apology for the wait. The Hostess is friendly and has an excellent memory.Location: Parking is a pain. It's either street parking or valet.

Reviews.Author: Erin M.
Reviews.Content: Hubby & I stopped by Sunday at around 9am and managed to miss the crowds. We had less than 10 minute wait and were seated inside. Blue Jam Cafe is on the small side, some would call it cozy but when the brunch crowds descend, I'd say it's cramped.The wait staff was really nice, and the ambiance, surprisingly,  not too trendy. Hubby and I both opted for hash entrees, mine Salmon ($15) and his the weekend brunch beef hash special ($18). Both entrees were amazing, so well-crafted and delicious. They were each prepared with a complementary blend of vegetables and flavored holandaise. My entree had a side of rosemary toast, which wasn't all it was hyped up to be, but decent.Although BJC can get pricey ($45 for brunch for 2), it worth the splurge. I really wan to return to try all the items on their extensive breakfast/brunch menus!

Reviews.Author: Eric T.
Reviews.Content: It was my second time here and I finally got to try the much raved about french toast. I would normally go for the straight forward brioche french toast, but I was told to the popular thing to do is to order the one "stuffed" with blackberry jam, vanilla yogurt and topped with bananas and strawberries. I followed the recommendation and was glad I did so. The integrity of the bread itself was not lost with all the extra ingredients, but rather it was enhanced. It was more like two slices sandwiched together, with the spread of yogurt and jam in between. The slices are thick enough that you can get a real sense for the superb quality of the bread. Portions are not too large either. I can imagine the plain fresh toast is outstanding, but I am glad I tried this version. They also serve large salads, sandwiches, other breakfast combos that includes amazing looking pancakes, and solid coffee and tea selections. They play 90's music, which serves as an interesting teleportation device for the mind while you are enjoying your very satisfying meal.

Reviews.Author: dana c.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I treated my brother and his girlfriend to dinner this past weekend to celebrate my brother's birthday. I went to Blue Jam Cafe with my Bloomspot coupon in hand and zero expectations - only the hope that Yelpers got it right and that the food wouldn't suck. When we left Blu Jam Cafe, my tastebuds were elated and I began to think that perhaps this restaurant is worthy of being added to my list of favorite L.A. restaurants. As it turned out, I didn't research the menu enough prior to going, so I was surprised to discover that the restaurant serves tapas. Upon learning this, I wondered how far my coupon would really go. In any case, the food was EXCELLENT! I've already referred several people to this restaurant. We ordered the scallops which are served with a lemon asparagus risotto, We also ordered the salmon with a tomato-caper sauce. The dishes that stood out and left a lasting impression were the whitefish with tropical salsa, the shrimp crostini, and the baked mac 'n cheese which I was really worried about because I loathe creamy mac 'n cheese and prefer a more savory taste. We ordered about 6 tapas, and the total bill for 4 people was about $98. With the help of my $45 coupon, we left the restaurant with no regrets. After reading all of the phenomenal breakfast reviews, the hubs and I have decided that we need to return to try their breakfast sometime very, very soon!

Reviews.Author: Katie M.
Reviews.Content: I really want to like this place...I loved the atmosphere, the super chill yet attentive staff, and the little details like serving water infused with lemon and mint, but I ordered a dish that I really wasn't a fan of in the end.I always check restaurants' eggs Benedict if I'm eating breakfast, and my eyes stopped on the florentine Benedict--poached egg, spinach, roasted red peppers, mushrooms, and Brie cheese in place of meat, served on an English muffin with hollandaise sauce. It looked amazing! I double-checked with the waitress, who said it was really good. It came with potatoes, and looked so delicious, my eyes practically popped out of my head when they brought it. The presentation was superb.The poached eggs were cooked to perfection, and all the elements were delicious, but the hollandaise was really overly tangy, and the vegetables were really rich and overpowering. The potatoes were seasoned with fresh rosemary, but there was so much of it, the potatoes were completely drowned out.I think the dish would have been perfect if it wasn't so overseasoned/flavoured, but it was a real disappointment compared to how good it looked.  I want to come back and try their traditional eggs Benedict before I judge any further.The table next to us had a plate of their French toast, which looked like it was really yummy...before we left, I also noticed that the french toast was so popular, they were going to start serving it all day. I think I know what I want to try for my rematch!

Reviews.Author: Rajiv I.
Reviews.Content: It has been a couple of years since I first visited this place.  I had a hard time getting back year due to the usual wait for a table during the weekends.  I am glad that we went back though as the food was as good as I remember for brunch.The french toast, eggs, omelets, and bacon side was excellent

Reviews.Author: Jason O.
Reviews.Content: What I ordered:- Crunch French Toast (A-)- Seared Tuna sandwich (B)- Brunch Burger (A)All i've heard about Blu Jam Cafe was their crunch french toast and let me tell you... it did not disappoint. Breakfast/brunch is my least favorite meal but the french toast is worth the sugar crash every time. A serving is plenty for two people and comes with that amazing vanilla bean sauce that would make even the dullest of waffles a kick in the pants (in a good way)I was craving the Ahi Tuna sandwich but the ciabatta bread that comes with it is much too hard to enjoy. Ditch the carbs and you've got yourself a fine Ahi Tuna salad - but I don't think it was worth the price.When it comes to gourmet burgers nothing will top Father's Office but the Brunch burger at Blu Jam comes a close second. So delicious i'm salivating about it right now...

Reviews.Author: Melissa L.
Reviews.Content: This place was really good!  We brought the puppy, so we sat outside under the umbrellas.  We had to wait a few minutes, but if we wanted to eat inside, we could have gotten a table right away.  I went with the split pea soup and the caprese sandwich.  Both were awesome.  The boyfriend had the salmon puttanesca.  He LOVED it.  They brought out some bread and some olive spread...really good as well.  There are about 6 tables outside and one server working all of them, so he wasn't as attentive as possible, but he was doing a good enough job.  It's good food, not too down-home, not too fancy.  Not too expensive.  Our total bill w/ an iced tea and a soft drink came to $32.   I'll definitely go back if I'm in the area.

Reviews.Author: Cara C.
Reviews.Content: Obsessed.I am obsessed with this place.It is THE best brunch in LA. The place itself has a great energy and atmosphere. It is cute and small and cozy. The wait staff is SUPER considerate and nice, and the hostess is always smiling and keeping you up to date with the status of your party.There is always a wait on the weekends but it is WELL WORTH the wait!!!! It has the best food ever. I love when people come into town to visit so that I have an excuse to come here!! :-)WHATEVER YOU DO, GET EGGS! YOU CANT GO WRONG

Reviews.Author: Jonathan David T.
Reviews.Content: It is not possible that in the city of Los Angeles there could be too many cafes worth writing home about. And among the most excellent of Angelino cafes, Blu Jam is a prince. I have developed a guiding principle that if I walk in a store or restaurant where the employees seem to detest working there, it is probably indicative of the establishment in general. And the reverse is equally true. Every time I have set foot in Blu Jam (even on their insanely busy weekend brunch shifts) I have been astounded by how much the employees seem to be enjoying themselves, how unpretentious and absolutely attentive they have been. For your review-consumption pleasure, I have pieced together this list praising the elements of Blu Jam which I most love.1. Tom:  Tom is a daily regular who greeted my wife and I upon our first feasting at BluJam. If you have any question as to the beauty and goodness of this cafe, just head in one morning and meet Tom (his table is last on the right before reaching the corner table). Blu Jam is a cafe worth coming to every morning of your life.  2. Eggs Benedict:  This dish is my litmus test for how legitimate a breakfast place is. I have never eaten better eggs benedict than Blu Jam's. It is a work of modern art on a warmed plate. 3. Cappuccino: One does not typically attend breakfast places for the coffee, nor does one head to a coffee place for the breakfast. However, the several cappuccinos I have partaken of at Blu Jam are of the best quality I have enjoyed in LA outside of Intelligentsia or La Mill. 4. Migas: A Mexican-inspired egg dish that seriously amounts to the absolute best tasting eggs I have ever ingested in my life. These are miraculous, life-altering, put-some-spice-in-your-pants eggs. 5. Kamil: The Czech-born owner has been in the cafe on every occasion we have eaten here except during his month-long vacation. Kamil is present, caring, and has crafted not only the menu but the entire culture surrounding it with love and care. I aspire in time to be Kamil's friend. 6. The Bistro: a veritable plethora of tapas inspired European plates are served up on Friday nights. Excepting our wine, four of us shared eight plates for under $100. The beef goulash, baby-back ribs, and tuna tartar were highlights. As always the service was breathtaking--we found ourselves staying nearly an hour past close with the staff laughing and, as my hero, Shel Silverstein wrote, spinning flax-golden tales. 7. The Entire Experience: Blu Jam provides that which few establishments with its marked success can manage--an environment where quality could scarcely get higher and both food and ambiance are crafted with care and delight. On weekends this small cafe serves around seven hundred people between the hours of eight and five, yet those throngs of eaters keep coming back and are know the end is well worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Kari F.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were of the lucky people who were able to get a completely free dinner.  I've never been to this place for breakfast, so my dinner there was my first visit.Why I gave this place 5 stars:1) food was incredibly tasty.  I tried three different dishes and ALL were absolutely amazing.2) food presentation was beautiful3) the wait staff was awesome, we had Jason as our waiter and he was IMPRESSIVE!  the boyfriend wasn't sure which beer he wanted, and Jason was a pro at recommending a specific.  He was also really friendly and straight out awesome.4) the decor is pretty cute, they have some funky art on the walls.5) great wine selection although we didn't have wineWhat we Tasted:- Grilled wild salmon, tomato-olive caper sauce, lemon risotto (BEST SALMON I'VE EVER HAD)- Beets, micro greens, black currants, grapes, gorgonzola, candied walnuts, balsamic (NICE AND LIGHT DISH)- Seared Ahi Tuna, lemon gremolatta, "fake paella" (THE MOST MEMORABLE DISH FOR ME, WON'T DISAPPOINT)- Beef goulash, pan roasted gnocchis, beer "gravy' (BF SAYS: VERY FLAVORFUL, TASTED LIKE THERE WAS A HINT OF HUNGARIAN PAPRIKA. VERY TENDER AND NOT OVERDONE.)- Risotto, pancetta, wild mushrooms, herbs, green peas, parmesan regianno (BF SAYS: NICE AND CREAMY, PANCHETTA GAVE IT A NICE SMOKY FLAVOR)- Niman ranch beef tenderloin, chili-coffee reduction, blue cheese mashed  (BF SAYS: IT FELT LIKE IT WAS FILET MIGNON, PRACTICALLY DIDN'T NEED KNIFE.  THE SAUCE WAS A LITTLE WINE-Y)The only negative I have to mention about this place is that our wait was about 25 minutes after our reservation time--but it was the promotion night and they were super busy.Basically, if you want bomb-ass food and service, GO THERE!

Reviews.Author: Adam C.
Reviews.Content: I can isolate the very best thing to order here: everything. This is the best breakfast in Los Angeles, hands down.The Crispy Corn Flake covered french toast, the egg white scramble, the oatmeal...oh my. Eating "healthy" is no chore here, everything is delicious.

Reviews.Author: Sheenon O.
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to try out Blu Jam.  Be prepared for a long wait.  It took 45mins to get a table.  I was expecting that so no big deal.  We sat down ordered some coffee which is really good.  I forgot to ask them what roast they were using but it met my high standards.Well, we asked the party next to us what they were eating and they practically forced us to try their french toast. (this was the single best thing I had besides the coffee).  They are famous for their french toast.  Sadly our experience pretty much fell flat from there.  I love eggs benny, so i got the traditional with ham and bacon.  My friend ordered the salmon hash, which she regretted as she was going to get the french toast.  The Salmon hash was topped with two poached eggs and Hollandaise sauce.  The Hollandaise sauce pretty much ruined the dish for me.  It was thick, goopy and tasted like I was eating mayo from the jar and lacking flavor.  I actually, didn't even finish my breakfast and neither did my friend.  We were both super disappointed because we had such high hopes and expectations and our dishes were lack luster.  (on a side note, I noticed that they had a help wanted sign in the window for a cook, maybe this explains the poor experience....)I am sure there are some really good items on the menu but I feel to get four stars everything should be good.  I mean I couldn't finish my breakfast!!!  That is after not eating all morning and waiting basically another hour, (needless to say, I was starving and could eat just about anything.....except the Hollandaise sauce.)I don't think I would come back here again which is why I decided to award them two stars.  I feel the food is 3 star quality but I guess my disappointment and the fact that I would not make the effort to come back dropped my score.

Reviews.Author: Joe N.
Reviews.Content: Definitely a fan of this joint! great vegetarian dishes awesome Benedicts.I was slightly warily of places that service breakfast that has a lot of latin influences. migas, chilaquiles,  some other items I cant for the life of me remember... All were pretty decent.I never wait cus I get there very decently early (8:15) or afternoon. so try going around then or you will have at least a 20 min wait.Customer service is worth the higher prices. friendly staff conversational but not intrusive. we were talking the entire time and he would politely wait it was great for us, prob horrible for him but we gave a big tip so no worries.this place is definitely higher priced then a similar joint in sacramento.(tower cafe) but i feel like the menus are similar. all the drinks are pretty good and server was good on water filling.

Reviews.Author: Julie V.
Reviews.Content: Came here a few weeks back ready to get my breakfast foods fix... I checked out the website and it said, "breakfast served all day" Awesome right?! Wrong.... when I actually got to Blu Jam, I was informed by the waitress that breakfast is indeed served all day (during day time hours) but in the evening... family tapas style dinner is served... I was pretty disappointed and was ready to leave but the waitress convinced me to stay and said dinner would be just as good, if not better.We were given an amuse of the Ceviche.  Super yummy with just the right amount of tang from the lemon juice.  Not a bad way to start the meal.  Sunk our teeth into:Pulled Pork Sliders- WOW... so amazing.. tender pulled pork served on brioche with caramelized onions, with a side of the mango salsa and chocolate-chipotle aioli.   Each bite was so yummy and flavorful that I almost had to bite off my bf's hand when he tried stealing my half of the sliders... what a brave soul... White Fish- super yummy pan seared white fish topped with a citrus and caper sauce.. very good... once again... wishing there was more of it..Grilled Niman Ranch steak- served with a coffee-chili sauce and blue cheese mashed potatoes... I thought this was decent but not at the caliber of where the first two dishes were at... Even though I was initially disappointed with not getting my breakfast on, I was happy I stayed.  It's pretty pricey, but worth the experience and intimate atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: J H.
Reviews.Content: Overall: 3Blu jam benedict: 2.75eggs were poached well. Too much bacon. Might try something else next time

Reviews.Author: Adam R.
Reviews.Content: By far the best breakfast / brunch place in Los Angeles I have found. I have been going here for some time and took a bunch of friends here on the weekend that had never been before and they loved it.The Really Good- The Power House (Chicken breast with marinara sauce on top of a bed of spinach and egg whites).- The California Omelette (Huge portion)- Gunpowder Green tea (A must for any tea enthusiast)The Average- The Breakfast deal (Just very boring and doesn't look very appealing on the plate. relatively small portion)I always order the powerhouse. Its the tastiest thing I have had there. What else I love about this place is that there is a health conscious and fitness menu. They are items that are not only tasty but good for you also. Highly recommend you get there early on the weekend though if you don't want to wait for a table.

Reviews.Author: Eimi W.
Reviews.Content: Blue Jam Cafe is  my new favorite place for french toast! My boyfriend and I went on Sunday morning, probably right around 10:30. We literally got there just in time to beat the crowd. We found parking on the street (meter starts at 11am). I ordered the Crispy french toast from the special's menu; their regular menu has regular french toast. The difference were the corn flakes and sauce! They put corn flakes on the outside of the brioche and instead of syrup, you get a side of vanilla bean sauce! Combo of the corn flakes, the vanilla bean, and fresh fruit, it was the best french toast I have ever had. Definitely plan on going back!

Reviews.Author: Deborah K.
Reviews.Content: Ok you know what?  I ordered wrong the first time.  I will admit it.I wasn't TOTALLY AMAZED the first time I went in...but I also ordered pretty generically and conservatively.  And I got a nice email from the owner encouraging me to come back and order a bit more off the beaten path.So...it's a few blocks from my house.  My friend loves it.  So why not?So I went back.  Asked our lovely waitress (who's waited on us every time.  I think her name is Jenna?)  what her favorite menu item was and she reccomended the egg sandwich, with a few mods.  OMG AMAZING.I've actually gone back for it a few times now.  And tried other things. And loved them. Clearly I ordered wrong the first time.  Even the basic stuff..eggs, toast, potatoes are done juuuust right.  Eggs perfectly over-easy.  Just slightly crunch toast.  Excellent flavors.  God the bread.Ok  I admit it.  This place is awesome.

Reviews.Author: T M.
Reviews.Content: Yum! Delicious food...I had a traditional pancake breakfast but my mom had their breakfast risotto dish and it was amazing. The wait was pretty long and parking wasn't easy to find but it was worth it.

Reviews.Author: christopher c.
Reviews.Content: Blue Jam is absolutely terrific.  I live in the area but had yet to go until recently, and I'm glad I finally did.  I've finally found a go to breakfast spot. Everyone's food looked and tasted terrific.  My girlfriend got the vegetable nest, which was amazing.  I got the smoked salmon plate, which was also fantastic.  It came with way more than most smoked salmon plates do.  We went on a rainy day and the streets were closed off for AIDS walk, so basically everyone there was a local because it was impossible to drive in.  The place was packed!  We knew it must be good.  Every other place on the street was completely dead.The wait staff is also awesome.  We seriously wanted to hang out with our waitress the rest of the day, she was great.  The owner Kamil is also super rad.  He came by a couple times to chat and he's incredibly entertaining and sweet and not in your face at all.  We recently went back for dinner, and it changed my life.  The gnocchi was just ridiculous.  We actually ordered a second helping because we couldn't be done with it after just one.  Please do yourself a favor and check this place out.  I can't even imagine a bad time there.  Honestly.

Reviews.Author: Pink K.
Reviews.Content: Food: Crunchy French Toast ALL for myself, Norwegian Benedict for my friend, which I ate half off.  yummmmyService: Below Average. We were given a table, but no one gave us menus until we waved down a server asking for one. Finally, when we ordered, they got our orders mixed up with a table who sat 15 - 20 minutes after us. That table got our food, and so we had to wait yet again.  (That other table must have thought Blu Jam had some super duper service.  For them, food was served within 5 mins of ordering.  Alas, we know that is not true....)Wait Time on a Friday afternoon: 20 minutes.  If it was any longer, I would NOT wait.Hopefully, we will get better service next time, or else I am going to have to start making my own crunchy french toast dammit...... and the benedict too.

Reviews.Author: Kristine U.
Reviews.Content: DAMN. That was one hell of a Crunchy French Toast. I mean, it was "Post-First-Bite-Jaw-Drop" kind of good. That's never happened to me. It was like Leslie Knope eating her beloved waffles but not, because this french toast topples all waffles.A friend brought us here citing as THE spot she takes her guests to when they visit (and while CA is my home, I hardly venture out this far unless it's for something specific when I'm here), and I can't say no when it comes to seeing happy people waiting in queues for food. I just can't.We waited around for about 35 minutes, and while you can wait outside for your name to be called, stumbling over to the vintage store on the side is a great way to kill time. Once inside, our server was attentive and friendly, the atmosphere was cozy, and the coffee was delicious.That Crunchy French Toast, though. With the bits of coconut and the vanilla sauce and the just overall amazingness of it?! I know I'm preaching to the choir, but that french toast is what dreams are made of. I also had a bite of my friend's Migas, which I also really loved because while spicy, it packed a nice heat. It's something I'd definitely order for the next time.There will definitely be a next time.

Reviews.Author: Lorraine P.
Reviews.Content: I do some crazy things for food.  I plan my day around it.  I wait in long lines for it.  And for breakfast, I wake up early for it.... Damn you delicious breakfast food! Look what you do to me!Blu Jam reinforces my obsession for breakfast.  Other than my bed, it's my favorite place to be in the morning. The hubs usually gets the Blu Jam Benny ($12) 2 poached eggs cooked perfectly, over black forest ham and a toasted croissant, and then covered with artery-clogging hollandaise. I get the California Omelet ($12) which puts other omelets to shame. It's AMAZING! Avocado, big chunks of bacon and melted cheddar cheese all wrapped up in one cozy place. Both dishes come with a choice of a fresh fruit or potatoes. And I never pass up their fresh squeezed juices. The grapefruit juice makes my face twist with happiness. Prices are reasonable, service is good and it's definitely worth the wait.  I just gawk at other people's amazing-looking entrees to pass the time and hope I make them uncomfortable enough to leave sooner so I can get down with my breakfast.

Reviews.Author: Katie C.
Reviews.Content: It was my second time there but I couldn't remember in detail of what I ate so I didn't want to review. Came here by chance as two friends and I were exploring Melrose Ave.It's definitely a brunch place that feels "LA" inside and out. Street parking but there are plenty of places to park ($1 cent/hr) If you have to park far, walking down melrose is surely to be amusing so take your time and enjoy it. We were seated as we walked in. Greeted with our menus, which have a plethora of delicious sounding options. Together, we ordered the breakfast quesodilla, crispy french toast, and Florentine Benedict.I can't say much for the other two (other than they were reallly tasty and worth trying out when you go) but my breakfast quesodilla was:1) HUGE! the tortilla was seriously so large2) stuffed with chicken, cheese, cilantro, tomatoes, spinach, and adorned with avocado and sour cream (which i took off bc im picky like that)3) Each bite worth savoring. If it's too large for you, I recommend starting from the middle parts of the slices to get a combination of flavors. yumwhat i found interesting was that I didn't feel gross and heavy after eating. Even though it did it's job in getting me full, I didn't feel as if my hips were expanding which is definitely another plus!can get a bit pricey but worth it!

Reviews.Author: Lisa W.
Reviews.Content: Came here for brunch (finally!) and man oh man oh man, it was delicious brunch food! The best salmon benedict ever. The salmon was plentiful, the hollandise sauce wasn't sour or tarty, and they put it on a croissant bread. They also put spinach on it, it makes it sooo delicious! You can even replace potatoes for fruit (with no extra charge...big plus!) My friend got the Crunchy French Toast--definitely the best genius idea for french toast putting some cornflakes on the bottom. It was delicious with the vanilla bean sauce too. Best brunch place, totally recommend this place.

Reviews.Author: Kathy W.
Reviews.Content: Even on a weekday morning the place was pretty filled - inside and outside.  I really wanted to order the Crunchy French Toast but that is only offered on weekends and holidays.Blu Jam Benedict (Poached eggs on a toasted croissant with Black Forest Ham, crispy bacon, hollandaise, served with potatoes):- very good- lots of ham and 2 strips of bacon- poached eggs were perfectly cooked with just enough ooze in the yolks- potatoes were a little too salty but it actually went well with the "blander" benedictOrganic latte: aromatic coffee smell. The latte is served a bit on the hotter side but not too the point that it's burning my tongue. They use whole milk so let them know if you want an alternative. Not necessary my favorite but the latte art is different from other places.Environment: casual cafe setting with jazz music in the background. Outdoor seating also available. The interior has artwork available for purchase. There is also a small alcove for a more romantic environment. There is limited seating (around 40) so I wouldn't recommend parties larger than 4. I can see why them consider themselves a "cafe by day, bistro by night." At night is probably when all the wine popping begins.Service: great. My waitress, Lauren, checked in with me every once and a while and always had a smile on her face. Seemed like she really enjoyed working there. I definitely felt like an important customer. She also asked to make sure I was done with my dish before taking it away.Side notes: Apparently if you come often enough you can get a table reserved for you. There's a Tom's Table and a Regulars Table. I was sitting next to "Tom" but I have no idea who he is. They also have daily specials to keep the menu options interesting for the regulars.Overall, I really enjoyed my experience and would recommend this to anyone who loves breakfast food. It's unique that their water is served with a hint of mint due to the mint leaves. As a way to promote this as a dinner place as well, they gave me a complimentary bottle of wine, which expires on October 31, 2011. It seems other Yelpers have also enjoyed the dinner, so I'll give it try someday. However, dinner is only offered from Wednesday to Sunday. Give this place a try if your in the Hollywood area!

Reviews.Author: Nicole Q.
Reviews.Content: Back 5-6 years ago, I used to go to Blu Jam every week or two. I lived right down the road. They have a great menu. The food seems very fresh. The waitress was rockin'! I love someone who can give me advice or suggestions and substantiate them with actual information (ex: flavor, taste, weight of the item, complimentary sides, or modifications that might improve the item for an individual). I got the salmon hash, which might have verged on one of the best breakfast items I've ever eaten (but in future I will order with egg whites-- not a fan of the yolk, even in poached eggs). My friend loved the Venetian Chicken Sandwich. He ate the entire thing in a little over 5 minutes. It must have been awesome. I also love that the staff are not pretentious, and though it was slow, the service was still solid. Often lulls tend to bring out the laziness in wait staff (I should know, I have worked in the industry for at over 12 years). Bottom line: It is absolutely worth your time and money to try it out. Do not be afraid to ask the staff for recommendations. They can give you their personal opinions, or they can tell you what other customers seem to like. It always baffles me that patrons never think to use the best resource a restaurant has: their Servers!

Reviews.Author: Candace L.
