Reviews.Content: Had the best brunch at Blu Jam this morning.Parked in the residential neighborhood.We were told the wait was 45min - 60min for four people when we arrived around 12:15P - I think it turned out being more like 30 minutes :) Thank goodness because I was Soooo hungry.This was our first time here so we went all out since we couldn't each settle on just one thing to order.My son had the breakfast trio - 2 pancakes, bacon, 2 eggs - We let him be to enjoy his and did our own thing ;) $12.95We shared the - Blu Jam Benedict : Poached eggs on a toasted English muffin with Black Forest Ham, crispy bacon, topped with hollandaise, served with potatoes $12.95Very Good!- Spicy Tex Mex Tofu Hash (Vegan and Gluten Free): Organic Tofu scrambled with black beans, onion, chipotle, cilantro, potatoes, tomatoes, salsa fresca, and avocado, served with corn tortillas 10.95BEST DISH EVER!!!!! Omg, this is insane good - if you are a fan of tofu, black beans, chilanto, avocado - well all of the above you will LOVE this - it was seriously, ridiculously tasty! - Crunchy French Toast:  Egg brioche dipped in batter, rolled in crunchy corn flakes and grilled to perfection, topped with fresh bananas and berries, served with vanilla bean sauce 11.95If you are looking for sweet vs savory ORDER this french toast OMG it was SOOOO good.Non fat latte was great - barista did some really cute foam art (see pic)We will definitely be back here, wonderful breakfast spot. I'd recommend this spot to anyone looking for something very yummy but beware of the wait time - if you are very hungry grab a coffee or something tiny to hold you over in case you are waiting on a table.

Reviews.Author: Kirby P.
Reviews.Content: Busy...but for a great reason! This place is so cute. It's the perfect LA brunch spot. The service is wonderful. The host was very attentive and welcoming. Our waitress was awesome. It's worth the wait! I love Chilaquiles, so I HAD to order it here once I saw it on the menu. I know everyone raves about their french toast, but I had a craving for something savory. The Chilaquiles dish was good!! I was impressed. I do want to try their famous french toast the next time I visit. I also ordered a freshly sqeezed juice. I was able to pick the combination: carrot, beet, orange, and cucumber. It was so refreshing and now I can't wait to own a juicer. I also tried my friend's vanilla latte, and that was amazing. Gosh, so many good choices in this place. PLEASE VISIT!!

Reviews.Author: Trina T.
Reviews.Content: Wow.  This place is awesome.Blu Jam has crazy good food.  It's quaint, the restaurant is comfortable and the people are great.  The food is wonderful here, and worth trying.  I bet I could eat here daily and never get tired of it.  I love their french toast with orange caramel sauce because it has a bite to it but it's still nicely sweet with fruit.  Their turkey fennel sausage is herby and yummy!  My husband died and went to heaven after eating the Old World there.Love it and I will eat here every time I come back to LA.!

Reviews.Author: Shirley H.
Reviews.Content: Now here is a brunch place I can actually get behind. I came here on Saturday at 12:30ish with my friends and there was a 45 minute wait, but it was worth it. I suggest trying to get to the restaurant earlier in morning if you don't want to wait so long. Service is nothing spectacular, it's really all about the food. I highly recommend: 1. The crunchy French toast if you come on the weekend. They coat the toast in corn flakes to get the crunch, which seems strange, but tastes great. Instead of just two big triangles of toast, this dish comes with 6-8 smaller triangles, so there's a bigger crunchy to soft ratio. 2. Kamil's breakfast - macaroni with scrambled eggs, bacon, cheddar, chives, and garlic. This is one of the best savory brunch items I've ever had at a brunch restaurant. It's perfect with the french toast.We also ordered the Roma via Paris, which I really liked (I like scrambles in general), but I wouldn't put it on my "must" list just because it's more typical. I ordered the goat cheese on the side because my friend doesn't like it. This actually ended up being a really good decision for me too, because they gave me a ton of goat cheese so that I could have some with every bite. If I ordered this again, I would order the goat cheese on the side. In conclusion: do you ever find yourself loving the idea of brunch but being constantly disappointed by nearly every brunch place you go to? Well, just come to blu jam, and your dreams of brunch heaven will become reality.

Reviews.Author: Julia W.
Reviews.Content: We came 11AM on a Sunday morning and waited an hour and a half, which I kind of expected. There isn't a lot of seating and we had a party of 8. We got a nice table though. We were seated in this private room perfect for exactly 8 people. 3 of us shared the Crunchy French Toast, Brunch Carbonnara, and the Blu Jam Benedict. Everythang was SOO GOOD! Crunchy French Toast - coated with corn flakes and served with a vanilla bean sauce... not your typical french toast. Many small pieces, perfect for sharing.Brunch Carbonnara - risotto with two poached eggs on top, the parsley or the herbs in the risotto (not sure which) really brought out the flavor. This dish was really good, especially with the yolky eggs.Blu Jam Benedict - your typical eggs benedict, only not. I can't put my finger on it, but there's just something about it that made it extra delicious.We finished with happy tummies. I was a little surprised by the portions though. They aren't small, but not big either like many other breakfast/brunch places. The 8 of us ordered 11 dishes total and all plates were cleared.

Reviews.Author: Danielle S.
Reviews.Content: My friend took me here for brunch for my birthday. She found it by chance when shopping with a friend a few months ago, and loved it. I loved it too. We both had the peach and strawberry crepes with white chocolate sauce and whipped cream. It was amazingly good. The iced tea was good too. I really wanted the nutella and banana crepes so I'll be going back to get those. They had an extremely large menu, but the people around us ordered completely different items and they looked good as well. Usually menus that have too many items are a bad sign, but not in this case. I wish this place wasn't an hour drive away.

Reviews.Author: geoff l.
Reviews.Content: Is it brunch if it doesn't happen on a Sunday? If I get the french toast and you get tex-mex I think it should qualify as brunch, not lunch. When you're not sure exactly what time it is, but that it's near to noontime and you're considering getting a pasta instead of something with eggs, that's brunch. If you have to think for a second about whether you'd rather have an arnold palmer or a coffee, yup--brunch again. Since the sponsored review raved about the french toast here I had to try it, even though it didn't come with anything else, and appeared more as a side than as a meal in itself. It was really good french toast, but it left me hungry. Serendipitously the manager asked us to move to accommodate a big group outside and offered us dessert for sucking in our bellies and dragging our butts one table over. It was in fact so little effort to move to another table that I felt guilty taking this man's free dessert. My accomplice however felt no such guilt and made sure to get two, which she would later watch me eat out of my own contrition. Since only one (albeit very nice) waitress covered all of the outside tables, service was understandably a little slow at times, but anyways, on sunny summer days on melrose it wouldn't feel right to rush.

Reviews.Author: Natalie A.
Reviews.Content: When a restaurant receives a negative review on Yelp, they do one of three things: 1) Shrug it off, 2) Email unsatisfied Yelper to defend themselves and try to persuade them to remove/modify their review, 3) Email unsatisfied Yelper to sincerely apologize, hear out the issues, and go above and beyond to restore the loyalty of their patron.#3 is exactly what Kamil, the owner and head chef of Blu Jam Cafe, did. Not only was his email reply to me thorough, but I can tell that this was a rare occurrence for him, as he indicated that he personally monitors every meal that comes out of the kitchen door and was shocked that my order slipped through the cracks. He invited me and a friend back to his restaurant for Sunday brunch, on the house. Yesterday I arrived at 1pm sharp to an enthusiastic hostess who had a table waiting  for me and my friend. Almost immediately, Kamil came by and introduced himself, apologized again, and ordered us a round of mimosas. Our waiter, Brady, was also great and will def be my go-to guy the next time I visit. After our drinks, we ordered lunch which came out MUCH faster than last time and tasted super fresh. My friend and I were totally impressed by how attentive everyone was - even if it was amped up a bit due to the nature of our visit. Kamil's sincere concern with my experience made me realize how critical these reviews are to restaurants that truly care about their reputation. And although I appreciated the treat, my intention is never to get a free meal for my criticism, but to call-out restaurants when things aren't right, in hopes that they change their ways for the next guest. And I definitely won't let one bad impression stop me from returning to a specific eatery, especially if the food wasn't the issue. Blu Jam's food was and always has been above-par.Thanks for everything, Kamil!

Reviews.Author: Irena C.
Reviews.Content: Checked out this place this past weekend based on reviews and wasn't disappointed. I had the salmon eggs benedict and my friend had the Blu Toast (their specialty French toast). Both were very good. Orange juice was fresh squeezed and yummy. Potatoes were pretty good and the fruit salad was solid. Wait staff was very attentive to our needs, including the girl at the front taking names and updating on the wait status. The only downside was the 45 minute or so wait after we got there at noon on Sunday. It seemed to get a lot less busy after 1:30pm, so I would recommend getting there around then to avoid the long wait. I'm planning to come back to check out other tasty-looking stuff on the menu. There was a lot of stuff to choose from!

Reviews.Author: Sola S.
Reviews.Content: This place is great for either breakfast or lunch. Their sandwiches are quite good (I recommend the soup+sandwich combo) and the chai tea latte is great as well. It's been awhile since I last ate at this cafe so my memory is somewhat fuzzy, but I remember really enjoying my last meal there. The only thing that deters me from eating at this place more often is the parking situation. Being located on Melrose, parking can potentially be a disaster.

Reviews.Author: Denita W.
Reviews.Content: This place was crazy good. I had brunch here with my meetup group, which includes Stephanie W. First I will say this, that the owner Kamil was very kind to reserve the wine room for my group. The room was so cute and fit my group of 9 perfectly. The staff was also very nice and very attentive.The food was deelish! I had the stuffed french toast with a side of turkey sausage. I was shocked that I got not one but two turkey hotlinks they were large and very good. I like that they were on the spicy side. The stuffed french toast with blueberry jam and cream cheese was really decadent. The fresh fruit was a nice touch indeed.  Oh yes, the spiced chai, now that was some good stuff there. The dishes among the group varied, but everyone was pleased with their food. I will definately host another event there.

Reviews.Author: Nyun K.
Reviews.Content: I went there two brunches in a row last week. I took my cousin that is visiting, and then my two fierce boyfriends the day after. See, cuz when i love something I keep coming for more.1st day: Saturday morning - party of twos very popular, had to wait for seats for 20 minutes. - alot of stylish people are there, i kind of window shopped by looking at all of their clothes..if you know what i mean.. - the VANILLA LATTE is like...mmmmmmmmmmmmm..you got to try itttttt - I got the cali omellete, but not that great...i wish there were more sliced avocados on it..2nd day: Sunday morning - seating was extremely quick - mmmmmmmmm...VANILLA LATTEEEEEE - i didn't share ANY of my migas plate!!! - it has spicy jalapenos, salsa, cheese in this scrambled eggs with potates on the side with corn tortillas and you make yourself a little breakfast taco.. o m g ... i really didn't share any of it....its not too gooey, just right and so warrm...yummmmyythe service is really worth yelping about, from the hostess, to the waiter, to even the barista and the bus boy, EVERYONE was more than helpful, and always had a smile on their face!

Reviews.Author: Angeline G.
Reviews.Content: Took a little mini vacation to LA and had to yelp the best breakfast spot. YELP NEVER fails! This place was go good and I believe it held up to the standards of the Best breakfast spot in LA. (besides the big sign that tells you that on their window).The service was excellent, waitress was cool and the food was awesome. I had the Salmon Benny Cake. Geezzz, the best Benny cake i've ever had for breakfast! This place is highly recommended. I WILL come here again on my trip to LA.

Reviews.Author: Bill P.
Reviews.Content: Trendy little breakfast place that satisfies your brunch desires.   And it keeps the prices in check.  Good food and good value!Be prepared to wait for a table. This place is hot on weekends.

Reviews.Author: Amanda G.
Reviews.Content: I had their eggs Benedict to share with my boyfriend because I was slightly skeptical since we're not that adventurous when it comes to food (we always prefer something tested and tried heh) but boy were we pleasantly surprised. Best eggs Benedict I've had so far! FYI I've had many eggs benedict in this lifetime! We were just dying for more! I practically picked up all the little bits of bacon left on the plate with my fork till the plate was sparkling. People MIGHT find its a little too salty but I am a huge fan of salty so it was absolutely perfect for me! Decided to try their crunchy French toast after this and I'm honestly usually not big on French toast (like I said, salty person) but boy was I pleasantly surprised yet again! It wasn't like the run off the mill French toast cause its coated with corn flakes, something I've yet to see? Was nice and warm with pieces of fruits and I must say I thoroughly enjoyed it. Really liked the English breakfast tea I had as well! This is my first review and I'm writing this because I had so many good things to say about them I felt I had to had to share!

Reviews.Author: Natalie O.
Reviews.Content: Not a local and was looking for a good, non-chain breakfast/brunch place... found Blu Jam and LOVED it!  We went on a Sunday morning and there was no wait in line; looking through the reviews Yelpers were saying to go early.Went with the family with 2 kids and we all enjoyed our meals; I had the healthy menu - the salmon with all the fixins' and it was FRESH!  The kids had the Kamil Special - eggs with macaroni, which was decent and the kids enjoyed it since they never had macaroni with eggs!The service was great!  The owner Kamil was very personable and was a great host! I will definitely go back!  LOVED it!

Reviews.Author: ruby w.
Reviews.Content: The best breakfast items I have ever had in my entire, as Edward Cullen would say, EXISTENCE. Brioche French Toast with black berry jam, vanilla yogurt, fresh berries and bananas. WHOA.... blew me away with how soft and fluffy it tasted. The blackberry jam was not sweet at all, more like just persevered fruit and when smeared along with some vanilla yogurt, the whole french toast seem to be "melt in your mouth" silky smooth. Absolutely delicious. Best French toast in the world.Banana Walnut Pancakes was another home-run as well. Came out as 3 gigantic fluffy pancakes topped with walnuts, fresh bananas and powdered sugar. I thought it stopped there, but NOOO..... when I cut into it, there were actually bananas and walnuts embedded inside too. OMG...... beyond words. Best pancakes I have ever had! The cooked bananas added perfect sweetness  and the nutty taste of walnuts added a whole new dimension to the pancakes. Soft and fluffy and you get full from a few bites. I adore!Organic Latte was nothing special. I feel like just because it is organic they add a few $$ to the price tag. Love the coffee art. It was  beautiful. Went cold pretty quick so I am not a fan.Service was impeccable. Derek was the sweetheart that served us (you deserve raise).

Reviews.Author: Erika C.
Reviews.Content: When this weekend came around... after working too many days and not having anytime to see my girlfriend, i was really excited just to get outside and hang out!Looked this place up after not making it to our reservation down the street at Taste ~ since we over slept after a night of too much wine... margaritas and female emotional bonding =). I definitely think the better choice was made. . . Made it out here around 1130 to find groups of people waiting to be seated... so needless to say we weren't that thrilled to have to wait another 40 mins for our coffee service! but surprisingly... the wait wasn't long at all and we were able to score a table outside. So we immediately ordered our coffees and teas and after our first sips were able to focus and start deciding on what to order. I had the Florentine Benedict - Poached eggs on a toasted English muffin with sautéed fresh spinach, mushrooms, sun-dried tomatoes, and brie cheese, topped with hollandaise, served w/ potatoes ~~~ YUM YUM YUMMY YUM! ...... was that too obvious?the girlies ordered...The Powerhouse (four egg whites scrambled with spinach, topped with flame-broiled chicken breast and sautéed tomatoes and basil)... for healthy was pretty yummy. you already know i pick at other people's food so don't be surprised. =Pand . . .the Mazatlan Scramble (eggs scrambled with wild shrimp, cherry tomatoes, roasted red bell peppers, chipotle, cilantro, chives, avocado, and sour cream, served with potatoes and toast .. yummy too but definitely recommend getting the chipotle on the side... easier to control the taste. Everything was very tasty and decently priced for the amount and quality of food given. i definitely agree that this is one of the top places to have breakfast.... and who doesn't loooove breakfast!??!?! (if you do please don't tell me)so if you're looking for a great breakfast/brunch spot...i definitely recommend this place as they have an extensive menu and it looked like everyone around us was either a regular or a newbie like ourselves and was pretty satisfied with the yummies. =)i will be back and i have my eye on the brioche french toast.....

Reviews.Author: Ada L.
Reviews.Content: I only have good things to say about Blu Jam.I've gone about 5 times for Saturday brunch with my best girlfriends (there are usually 3-5 of us) and we've never been disappointed. They usually tell you that the wait is approximately 20 minutes, but I think I've only waited around 15 minutes max.The hostess is very accommodating, and the servers are extremely nice and attentive. My favorite person, however, is the owner. He makes sure that you get the best possible service, and has even given my girlfriends and I complimentary lemon crepes just because he says he likes seeing happy customers.As for the food, each thing I have tried has been delicious and flavorful. I've tried a few dishes since my girls and I always order something different, we end up trying each other's dishes. I recommend the California omelette and the Eggwich. I love eggs, bacon, and avocado and both dishes utilize all three. I wish the egg yolk in the Eggwich was a little runnier since it's described as over-easy, but other than that, I have nothing bad to say.The side of potatoes that a lot of the dishes come with are really good and crispy. Thrown on some ketchup, and you're good to go. Besides their lemon crepes, which are the right amount of sweet and tangy, I haven't tried any of their sweet menu items, but I'm sure they're fantastic.I definitely recommend Blu Jam Cafe for anyone looking for a great brunch spot in LA.

Reviews.Author: Sonya R.
Reviews.Content: My new Sunday brunch place (sorry, Schooner or Later by the Bay)!In the middle of Melrose and hidden among large buildings, this small cafe will light a firecracker of flavor in your mouth. The Italian Gamibiotta is worth the wait (lines are long on Sundays for people waiting to be seated). The pesto is just so fresh and really brings out the flavor of the dish. I kid you not that on paper it looks like any boring, dull omelette with pasta, but you have to TRY the dish and experience. This is the kind of dish we all sign up on Yelp for to try. And that's just one dish. I do so want to get back this weekend to try the other breakfast dishes, as I overheard the tourists behind me excitedly praise the food and pass it around to one another.I just have to decide if I want to eat here before or after church every weekend.

Reviews.Author: Mari M.
Reviews.Content: It's been almost a year since I've been here.I finally got the french toast that's all the craze at Blu Jam Cafe.I really felt like getting a crepe so I asked the waiter what he recommended between strawberry crepe and french toast. He said, "I LOVE the strawberry crepe but internet tells us thatwe have the best french toast. So I recommend the french toast."And I'm glad I got it. It was delicious!! The brioche it's made with is fluffy and also crisp on outside. I didn't need any syrup or butter to eat it!We went on a weekday but the place was almost full! And it was a pretty gloomy day. My girlfriend also spotted someone who is on "Dr. Who" which I guess goes with the spotting famous people but you can't remember where you've seen them.

Reviews.Author: Joanne C.
Reviews.Content: Huge disappointment. I want to give it less stars for the blandness of their food, but their atmosphere/cleanliness/service makes up for the three stars.Honestly, I was so excited after seeing the reviews on yelp. I LOVE brunch/breakfast places, so when I found out about Blu Jam I definitely wanted to try this place.My friends and I were seated as soon as we arrived (it wasn't too busy on a weekday afternoon). The waitress was nice, and we proceeded to look at the menu.EVERYTHING on the menu was so tantalizing and sounded delicious, and although I heard about the french toast I wanted to get something heartier so I ordered the Blu Jam Eggs Benedict.I was not happy with my meal. I tried really hard to like it, considering that it was such a famous place that was well-liked by so many Yelpers. And considering the price ($12-14). But nope, not possible. It wasn't that the benedict was disgusting, but it simply wasn't good. I had one bite and I knew. I left HALF of my plate, which I usually never do (I usually like to finish what I order, unless it's just not good..as in this case).Don't get your hopes up. Who knows, maybe the french toast is really THAT good. But the Eggs Benedict (and other egg dishes that my friends ordered) are disappointing and not worth the price at all.

Reviews.Author: Katherine V.
Reviews.Content: I came here a few weeks ago with a good friend, with her I always get to pick the restaurants since she knows how much I know and love about food :)This time I decided to pick a place where I always wanted to go but I wouldn't have the grit to go since it's always crowded. First thing that came to my head was "let's go to the place on melrose where I passed at least three times a week, see it and never go in because of the line". Well now I understand why there's always a line, especially morningsWe went on a weekday, lucky us we only waited 5 minutes and we were sitting outdoors on a beautilful sunny day. First thing I notice in the menu was "breakfast serve all day" woww that blew my mind right away. Not many restaurants have that in LA so definitely this place will be one of my favorite near places to have a tasty meal.This time I had a salad however next time I will try something with meat, perhaps chicken.  I had the Sonoma Salad, came with mixed greens, sliced granny smith apples and seedless grapes.... balsamic vinaigrette and added grilled salmon. I think my friend had the Herb Chicken, her plate looked fab. She let me taste her chicken and it was yummy, probably next time I will have what she had.Sadly we were full at the end of our meal and didn't have time to have some dessert but I noticed that they had "Tres Leches" MY FAVORITE.  "THE BEST BREAKFAST PLACE IN LOS ANGELES"Most important they have plenty of Red Wine

Reviews.Author: Matt H.
Reviews.Content: If you have an allergy or food sensitivity, be prepared to be lectured by your waiter on how difficult it is to accommodate requests as daring as "no gorgonzola, please." We were informed that "the ticket comes out like, THIS long" and that "[the wait staff and management have] had meetings about it." Well, f**k you. I just waited 45 minutes to eat, so the line cook can take six extra seconds to read the order. That said, the rest of the service was actually great even though they were busy. The food was pretty tasty and came out precisely as ordered...which is kind of funny, right? After the guilt-trip, they honored all the requests anyway...so what was the point of telling us about the meetings? So they earn one star back for comedy.

Reviews.Author: Trang B.
Reviews.Content: I've been on a 5-star roll lately, and Blu Jam, you are a new fave.At first you tested me- made me sit outside in the rain for 1.5 hours, and then you sat me down in the smallest booth closest to the frequently revolving door, but as soon as that eggs benedict & I met, I was a goner.THE BEST EGGS BENEDICT I have ever had. Seriously, I could eat this every day until I doubled in weight. Ordered the Blu Jam benedict- perfectly poached eggs on top of ham & bacon, on top of a perfect english muffin.. With the best hollandaise sauce ever. Blu jam just does the proportioning RIGHT. Not too heavy on the hollandaise, which is perfectly creamy/tangy, and ugh, the saltiness of the ham/bacon against the creaminess of the egg, next to the chewiness of the muffin? Perfection.Crunchy french toast - not your traditional french toast, but still very delectable. I think the best part of this was the vanilla bean sauce. I wouldn't mind taking a bath in that sauce, seriously. Warm and perfectly vanilla-ed out. Sauce aside, I personally like OG French Toast better, meaning sans the corn flakes, and maybe with a brioche or challah bread instead. Good to try, not a fave.Notes:*organic coffee, lattes, & tea- tasty to boot.*EXPECT A WAIT anywhere from an hour to two hours if you come during prime time brunch hours. I would try going on a week day or off time.*breakfast served all day.*splits bills*parking isn't terrible- just try to find a spot in the neighborhood around the corner.*Pricing wasn't too bad. Expect to spend ~$15-20 per person.TRYMETRYME.

Reviews.Author: stephanie a.
Reviews.Content: Breakfast here is like a dream come true! Wonderful Benedict's with proper hollandaise sauce, amazing blueberry pancakes, and of course the old staple French toast. Mouth watering yet?!! I'm a firm believer in breakfast joints that serve breakfast all day. It's a good thing! Breakfast anytime! Woohoo!! ;-) oh and our servers are always super cool. So breakfast whenever, and cool peeps.... I'mIn ;-) or actually I'm here! Start your day off right, or end it right! You know what they say, breakfast is the most important meal of the day!!! ;-) enjoy!

Reviews.Author: John L.
Reviews.Content: I wanted to try this place for a while, and finally had the opportunity to go for Wednesday breakfast.  The atmosphere of the place was nice, and even though it was a nice day outside we decided to eat indoors.  The waiters were attentive and always came at the right time!My friend got the Olympian while I got the French Toast.  We both enjoyed it.  I think it was the best French Toast I've ever had.  It was so soft and moist and was great with the heated syrup and fresh fruits on top.  My friends been trying to eat healthy so the Olympian with its egg whites, chicken, and mixed greens was perfect for him.I will definitely come again to try the Blu Jam Benedict!

Reviews.Author: Kristine C.
Reviews.Content: Great brunch...and now even more awesome DINNER?!I enjoy Blu Jam Cafe for brunch- they have great variety, big portions, everything is always tasty, and there's the occasional celebrity sighting. The only thing is there's always such a long wait (granted weekends are prob the worst time)...It usually becomes more like awkward afternoon meal vs brunch by the time we eat.Blu Jam just recently started doing dinner 5 nights a week (Wed-Sun) and for those of you who were resourceful enough to snag the Bloomspot deal for dinner...you are in for a treat!Dinner is tapas style, separated into cold, hot, and sweet-- II'd recommend going with a group of 4 since most everything came out with 4 pieces.Cold:- Prosciutto w/ burrata, grilled tomatoes, and olive oilHot: - Seared Ahi Tuna w/ "fake paella" (no shellfish)- Argentinian flank steak w/ potatoes- Brussel sprouts w/ currants, chili, candied walnuts, and balsamicSweet:- Crunchy Brioche bites w/ vanilla cream, ice cream, and strawberriesWas really blown away with dinner. Prosciutto and brussel sprout dishes were AWESOME!! Tuna and steak were good also (bf LOVED them), but I dont really like paella normally and the steak was a little too rare for me. All in all, a great dinner experience. No wait, Twitter scored us free wine, we got an amuse buche, and the food was yummy!Forget brunch...go for dinner! :-)

Reviews.Author: Stefanie B.
Reviews.Content: Brunch is my favorite meal of the day, but due to a cruel turn of fate, I'm normally working at brunch time, even over the weekend.  Which means that I love it when I find a great place that serves breakfast all day.  We stopped by here in the early afternoon and I was able to get one of my favorite brunch items, Huevos Rancheros (I think it's just called Rancheros on the menu).  Now, I'm pretty predictable in that I will pretty much always order Huevos Rancheros if it's on the menu when we go somewhere.  But, I have to say that this was the BEST Huevos Rancheros I think I've had....EVER!  5 stars all around.

Reviews.Author: Antonio S.
Reviews.Content: I went for Friday dinner.  I ordered the Seabass on mushroom orzo ($19) with a side of brussels sprouts which came quartered with bacon and pine nuts.  The fish was well prepared, had a nice crisp sauteed skin, fresh, flaky and moist.  It was perhaps a little too buttery and salty in the seasoning, but it was delicious.  Sprouts were tasty too.  Restaurant decor was pleasant with one brick wall facade, high hangar ceilings with criss cross wood slats, exposed air conditioning vents, earth tone paint colors and cement floor with some stain.  I would call it "modern rustic"... it was a blend.  The clientele was hip and semi-dressy.  There is no booze served here so make sure you bring a bottle.

Reviews.Author: Karen L.
Reviews.Content: Sadness...called the other day because I wanted to take some friends over for their dinner, but they're closed for Friday Bistro Nights =(  Still open during breakfast and brunch hours but probably won't start their Friday bistro nights again until end of august...Damn you recession!

Reviews.Author: Kevin L.
Reviews.Content: Lovely breakfast spot. Went on Sunday morning so totally expected everyone with hangovers to be out around 10ish trying to get that hangover cure. (ps, this place has a hangover burrito). the wait wasn't bad at all, about 10 minutes. a lot of families seem to like it here and i can see why. the decor was pretty awesome and the service was great. our waittress (Lauren) checked in on us a couple of times and cracked jokes with us. Things ordered:Brioche french toast - amaaaazing. i have to sing praises at this dish. it was beautifully presented and it just tasted divine. it was garnished with blackberery jam and spoonfuls of berries and bananas. it made my weekend end with a spectacular note. Norwegian Benedict - pretty awesome twist to have it served atop croissant instead of that muffin thingie. the edges of the croissant were crisp and that was a nice effect. the salmon was crazy delish and the whole dish was yum savory.pancakes with strawberry and dark chocolate -  it looked like a birthday cake. no kidding. 3 giant pieces of pancake stacked with dark chocolate shavings and strawberries on the top layer. totally drool-worthy. muscle beach - didn't try this dish, so no opinion on it. but friend who ordered liked it. he licked his plate clean. so that's saying something, right? *note: lauren entered in one of our orders wrong, so to amend the mistake, a complimentary lemon crepe was sent our way and the order that was entered in wrong was taken off the bill. the owner came out and personally apologized and handed us the yummy lemon crepe. the crepe tasted like lemon bars. such utter good tanginess!

Reviews.Author: Connie J.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars all the way!!! I love Blu Jam. I've been going here with my fiance for a few years now. It's far from us but we make the time to drive out and eat here. The service, food and coffee drinks are delicious.Their goulash is so flavorful and hearty. I haven't had anything that tastes bad. I was told that they change into a Bistro at night and I can't wait to try it out sometime.

Reviews.Author: Foodie Panda S.
Reviews.Content: Had dinner here with friends on the 19th of March before heading over to the Zephyr Theatre for a performance of "Caught," and boy, was this a great place to eat!  A nice cozy cafe with really good food and service, and it was great to see the owner, Kamil Majer, play a hands on roll of welcoming guests and seating them to their tables. It is now April, so they have just sent out an announcement of the new South American themed dishes replacing the Mediterranean themed dishes from their menu, and the one dish I will miss (and wished I had gone back for a 2nd helping) was their Risotto with Pancetta and Wild Mushrooms.  With the pancetta seared with a nice crispy exterior, that crunch and vibrant flavor from the searing just elevated that risotto to a deliciousness that just sent me into a food orgasm.  OMG, I can just eat that all night long!  I certainly hope they will bring that dish back in the near future.Right off the bat at the beginning of our dinner (and you should arrive within 30 minutes of their opening for dinner as this place is small and does get packed quickly), Kamil started us off with a couple of complimentary dishes of caprese skewer appetizers. Very sweet of him!  Since the kitchen is small, and for them to maintain excellent quality standards in the food they serve, it can take some time in between dishes.  That's why they encourage you dine family style.  But once we got going with a few dishes, the pace worked out fine as there was plenty of food for all since we ordered 1 dish per person, and there were 7 of us.  Like I said, the food was amazing here.  The beef goulash with beer gravy was also delicious as the gnocchi was roasted with a nice crispy exterior that provided a wonderful crunch to the large chunks of moist beef.  The grilled salmon with tomato caper sauce over lemon risotto was delicious as well.  And the filet mignon was tender and juicy.  We loved it so much, we had to order a 2nd steak!  Even the brussel spouts were done so well, it took away the bitterness associated with them.  By the end of the meal, I was so full, I could not try the truffled macaroni & cheese but it was visually stimulating enough as you can see the melted cheese bubble on top and it oozing out slowly with every scoop...Can't wait to go back for more, especially when Kamil reintroduces his Czech influenced dishes on his monthly rotational menu, as there are no Czech restaurants in Los Angeles for the last 30 years!  Only negative, when I asked for the check and a pen, explaining to our waitress that I needed to calculate each person's total, her eyes popped out and she advised me she could not take more than 2 credit cards per check.  Honey, my friends and I are with a foodie group.  We've done this many times.  We came prepared and graciously paid in cash.  Boy, was she relieved!Oh, and Jean K.?  If you like regular French toast then you should NOT have gone with the waitress' recommendation.  You CAN read the menu description right?  Corn flakes?  The waitress DID tell you it was topped with corn flakes?  $12 for a cafe style French toast is not overpriced, not ones serve with bananas, berries and a cream sauce.  Where do you think you are, IHOP?  Sorry to sound so snooty, but people, if you know you like certain foods a certain way, then order it that way.  If it's not available, order something else!  If you think the place is too pricey,. then don't eat there!  This NOT Norm's or Denny's!  Heck, I had to pay $6 for a brick they called hash browns at the Griddle Cafe, and the food there wasn't as good here!

Reviews.Author: Jessie H.
Reviews.Content: While waiting in line my friend and I counted the following:4 fedoras2 rompers4 pairs of toms1 pair of vibrams2 pairs of sambasJUST on the people waiting in line with us. Now tell me blu jam isn't for hipsters! ;)Love the crunchy french toast and the california omelet. Would recommend it to anyone. Expect to wait every time you go.The only reason that I give it 4 stars is because the wait estimate is never accurate. Both times I went it was triple the time the hostess estimated and I saw the let a few of their friends and regulars (I assume) through before me when I know they didn't wait at all.

Reviews.Author: Caroline D.
Reviews.Content: One star off for the long wait time. Sometimes it can be over an hour, sometimes you're seated within 20 minutes. It's hard to know. Otherwise, this place is a real delight. I've been here multiple times as it is within walking distant, and I'm always impressed with the service. Incredible friendly, attentive staff. Absolutely no complaints there. The food is excellent. I particularly like the chilaquiles (though for some it might be worth asking for extra sour cream). Also, I am not a french toast fan at all but I do highly recommend the crunchy french toast! We always order it for the whole table, and it's always one of the first things to go. It's divine. Get it - you won't be disappointed. I did try the Florentine Benedict and thought it was only alright - I wouldn't get this again. Their earl grey cream tea is also fantastic!!

Reviews.Author: Anne A.
Reviews.Content: Five stars for the service and the crispy french toast. Service is friendly and prompt. Also, the french toast is out of this world and the best I've ever had.   Crispy and full of sweetness, there's no need to put anything on it.  It comes in a sharable large dish topped with blueberries and strawberries.I read mixed reviews about this place and read that the must eat dish is the french toast. Next time I'm up for french toast, I'll remember to come here for the best french I've had in my life.

Reviews.Author: Erika B.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE BLU JAM!!!!  The food, service, and ambiance are A+.  The waiters and waitresses are the best.  The kind that remember what you order and how you like it.  The owner Kamil is the same way, sooo friendly!  Everything I've ever ordered has been delicious.  If its your first time you MUST try the fruit pancakes (you can even order 1 as a side!).  The banana walnut is AMAZING although if you order a single they tend to leave out the walnuts :( not sure why they do that but who cares they're still delicious.  Strawberry and blueberry are good as well.  Wrap on fire: amazing.  Roma via Paris: amazing. Eggwich: best breakfast sandwich ever (it has pesto!).  Granola with yogurt: biggest bowl of granola ever.   BEST CHAI LATTES EVER, the guys who make them are chai artists!!WARNING, if you go there on a Saturday or Sunday expect to wait at least a few minutes for a table.  This is an amazing cafe.  It is worth the wait.  Please, please, please do not complain.  It is extremely annoying.  If you don't want to wait don't go there during these times!!!

Reviews.Author: Katie W.
Reviews.Content: I went there twice, all gave me good experience.food was good, also french toast was amazing!

Reviews.Author: Rebecca S.
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing! I love the garlic olive spread they give you with bread at lunch! It's out of the world, I'd go there just for that and they're super sweet there and sometimes give it to me at breakfast! Hhaha I'm a fanatic! I also highly recommend their curry chicken wrap, its' rad!Great food, nice wait staff, just gets too crowded from time to time ... so be ware!

Reviews.Author: S. K.
Reviews.Content: Hmm... Where do I start?  Coming to Blu Jam has been an amazing experience in flavor. There's wonderful marriage in sweet, salt, spice and texture. We came as a medium size group and got to order many entrees. Almost every entree comes in twos or three pieces so you're encouraged to share.  There are cold dishes for starters and you cannot pass on the strawberry burrata. Strawberries on creme fresh on a toasted baguette with a wonder balsamic sauce sets the dinner off right.Also the shrimp ceviche has strong flavors as well. The onions and habenero mayo with cilantro and tomatoes with lime and the shrimp undertone followed by the crunch of the crispy tortilla. I would eat that salsa all day long if I could.Now to the entrees. You can't go wrong with the scallop or the bouillabaisse. But my favorites are the duck and argentine steaks. They use the best quality raw materials and everything was cooked to perfection. The salmon was perfectly cooked.  The exterior had a crisp to it and the interior was moist.  The beef goulash with potato gnocchi there is heaven and taste even better the next day.  The menu is quite diverse with influences and spins from around the world. Dining experience was great. Trip is a great server. We got great service from the entire staff. The owner is fantastic and hospitable as well. We felt so welcomed there like no other restaurant I've been to. With a review like this, you might think I'm a shill or get something for writing reviews. There are complaints but its relatively minor. Food wise the seared ahi tuna didn't carry as much flavor as the other dishes. It is a bit dark and hard to read the menu or see the food. Parking at in the neighborhood is difficult. I would recommend coming early while there still sun light.  And they do offer valet parking on certain days. I can you deal that finding parking it is well worth the effort. We came in with a diverse and hard to please group. But, they could not be happier with dinner. When asked to pick a favorite dish they honestly could not. They were not being polite.  They just could not chose one because they liked it all. You can expect to pay about $30-45 per person for dinner. We were stuffed but we kept eating because we wanted "just another taste".   We will be back for more as we have not tried the breakfast or lunch menu.  So much flavor!

Reviews.Author: Lynn K.
Reviews.Content: This place makes very yummy food! I ate something that had scrambled eggs, macaroni and cheese AND bacon! And this is the day after promising the world that I ate too much bacon yesterday and I would change my ways.The only problem was that I forgot my leftovers at the restaurant. Tragic. A boo hoo hoo.

Reviews.Author: Alyssa P.
Reviews.Content: One of my all time favorite places for brunch on the weekend! I usually go in with a friend or two since the wait is always so long. Weekends are that much more packed because it's when they have a special menu out that is not available during the week. I order the Blu Jam Eggs Benedict and the Crunchy French Toast with a Vanilla Latte. Seriously, all of the above are AMAZING! the Benedict is by far the best one I've ever had. The hollandaise sauce is better than any other one I've ever had. The potatoes that come with it are also really good. It's an amazing and hearty meal to say the least. The Crunchy French Toast is literally why I will always go back here. It's not like regular french toast. I'm not sure what they do but I do know they crust the entire piece of bread in what looks like sweet corn flakes and possibly fry it to perfection. It is the BEST thing I've ever had for breakfast. I'm usually not a big fan of french toast and go for the pancakes, but this french toast has no words to describe how amazing it is. The sad part is, you can eat it on its own it's so good, but they serve it with this BOMB vanilla bean sauce that is to DIE FOR! These two in combination are lethal...I can't even string words together to describe how amazing it is. The vanilla latte is the also really good. They do designs in the lattes (sometimes, not all of the time) but the coffee is good just on it's own, no need to add anything to it. If you're in LA or you live in LA and haven't had this place, it is worth the 45 min - 1 hour wait. AMAZING!

Reviews.Author: Jae N.
Reviews.Content: OMG! I could not rave about this place enough! YES- you will have to wait in a little bit of a line each morning.. but thats because its amazing!!! It became our regular sunday funday brunch place! The california omelet is amazing and so is their french toast! The servers are super friendly and always did their best to seat us in our regular table if possible, they make you feel very welcome! And for someone who is healthy conscious as myself, they also have a healthy menu for you! All egg whites but have delicious sides you can add to make it a real tasty meal! I would recommend this place to anyone

Reviews.Author: Vivian L.
Reviews.Content: first off, I don't even drink coffee, but I had to order one of the lattes because I was brainwashed by all the yelp pictures. I really just wanted to see the beautiful artwork, so I got the mocha latte and it was on point! Just the right amount of creamy and sweet, without being too bitter. Also tried the French toast and Norwegian benedict, which has smoked salmon on it. Everything was delish, and the service was super friendly. You know its good when there's a wait at 9am on a Sunday. I thought people would still be in bed at that time, but apparently they awaken for blu jam. 5 stars!

Reviews.Author: Louis V.
Reviews.Content: Blu jam on Melrose Is a great little restaurant, especially if you're looking for that perfect brunch. I went there on a sunday around midday, so of course there was a bit of a wait, but in the end it was worth it. Due to my ridiculous hangover I thought I was not gonna make it through the wait, but the nice southern waitress made it worth while. They have a great and very international selection of foods, that forces you to come back. I highly recommend the St. Petersburg brunch, and their french toast are pretty amazing too. The owner is Czech, and is very friendly, He always personally makes sure that all his costumers are satisfied. The rest of the staff all has a smile on their faces and a bounce in their shoes. Which makes me question their sobriety, but who am I to talk. ;)  I would probably not bring my kids, since it's not so big, and they don't have a liquor license. Which I think is very important when dealing with toddlers. ;) So if you're looking for a good buzz it's clearly not the place to go. They do however host private parties (with booze of course).The inside of the restaurant has a very cozy, casual,  warm, and european feel to it, and I highly recommend it. So if you go be sure to leave a good tip, they deserve it!

Reviews.Author: Dariño H.
Reviews.Content: Wow, my boyfriend and I lucked out here today. The wait for the line was RIDICULOUS! I'm not sure if this place takes reservations, but make one in advance if you can!!! Another couple there asked us if we wanted to dine with them at a table for four, so we took that chance and saved ourselves over an hour of waiting in the hot sun.The interior of this place is wonderful. Wooden setting, clean and open space. Waiters and Waitresses were all extremely friendly! The only complaint is the wait time to get the food. We got our orders about 30 min later, but the taste made up for it. I got the California Omelet and substituted potatoes for fruits. So good! My bf got the same. Nothing to complain about the food. Service is very prompt too. The nice waitress was constantly checking our table to make sure we got everything we need. Parking? Gotta rely on the streets. It's not too bad, there's always spots around in the neighborhood. A good walk wont hurt. This price is a little above average, expect to pay $3-4 more than your average two-star cafe or diners.Crappy wait time, great food and great service. YUM.

Reviews.Author: Ani P.
Reviews.Content: Perfect place for a Sunday brunch.  I found Blu Jam cafe after doing a search for brunch places on trusty good ole Yelp (you have yet to let me down).   The Blu Jam website is very fancy-schmancy.  All of the pics of the food looked uber gourmet.  I worried a bit, gourmet usually means bad things for my wallet.  I was pleasantly surprised to look at the menu and to find the prices to be completely affordable!!We arrived at Blue Jam around 11 AM and the place was packed.  Good sign -- people like the food.  It's very hip and tastefully decorated.  Luckily the wait was only five minutes, another good sign -- the food is brought out promptly!  Our waiter brought us water that was flavored with lemon and mint -- oh my!  I ordered the Le Paris Omelette that came with goat cheese, sun dried tomatoes and mushrooms.  It's hard to f*ck up eggs but it's also hard to make them tasty enough at a restaurant so I don't regret NOT taking the time to whip up an omelette on a skillet at home.  The omelette was perfect. Just the right amount of sun dried tomatoes and the goat cheese was divine.  No regrets here!  The potatoes were a little to healthy.  I like my potatoes crispy, fried, preferably in lots of lard (okay maybe not lard).  I can't really blame Blu Jam, I live in Cali, the land of the health nuts.The bathroom was a bit of a disappointment.  It didn't match the hipness of the restaurant! Not that it was gross or anything just not cool!

Reviews.Author: Joyce H.
Reviews.Content: AMAZING!! I would consider more trips to LA just to eat here more often. My brunch buddy and I split the Norwegian eggs benedict and crispy french toast, and both were unique brunch items you can't get easily elsewhere (at least not in Norcal). The Norweigian consisted of smoked salmon, poached eggs, sautéed spinach, and hollandaise sauce, all on top of a crispy toasted croissant. The combination of the smoked salmon with the spinach and eggs...explosion of awesomeness on my taste buds. The crispy french toast was a syrupy sweet version of a regular french toast with an added crunchy twist. The fruit cocktail garnishing the toast was the perfect touch of flavor to set off the syrup. Best french toast I've ever had.My vanilla latte was also delicious, creamy and rich. The service was prompt and our waitress was extremely friendly and helpful.Only downside is the long wait, but at a restaurant this amazing, of course there will be a line. We waited for around 45 minutes to be seated. We spent that time browsing the cute boutiques nearby, so the time was well spent.I can't wait to go back to LA to eat here. I might order several different meals just to sample everything and then take it to go for the rest of the day...

Reviews.Author: Yasmin C.
Reviews.Content: My experience this weekend at Blu Jam Cafe is the perfect illustration of my love-hate relationship with LA. I LOVE the trendy little breakfast joints sprinkled up and down streets like Melrose, boasting a laid-back ambiance and loyal crowd of enthusiastic followers.I hate that I had to wait for an hour and a half to experience it.I won't take that out on Blu Jam, though. I did show up with a party of seven on a Saturday at 10 am. The hostess was endlessly gracious and kept me updated the entire time we were waiting...and a large portion of our wait time was due to the overindulgence of the party holding onto our table. Apparently they stayed late to get their post-breakfast booze on.Anyway, if you can manage to come early with a big group and avoid the crowd, it's an absolute treat. The table for big parties is curtained off in the back of the place, so it's like your own private room. Oh and then there was the fooooood. I'm rarely wowed by an omelet, but trust me when I say that I was wowed. I chose to build my own, with egg whites, turkey sausage, spinach, tomato, and gorgonzola. I'm not even sure what was IN that turkey sausage but it was fantastic. The spinach and tomato were fresh, the egg whites were light and perfectly cooked, and the gorgonzola...well how can you go wrong? Also, this place doesn't skimp on your side of fruit; no honeydew/cantaloupe mix here, we've got fresh strawberries, kiwi, grapes, blueberries, banana slices, apple slices, and pineapple. DAMN. I did sneak a couple bites of the others' herbed potatoes, and they were rather tasty as well.Sad that I've discovered this place after moving away from LA, but I will make a point to be back. Probably not with such a big party, though, unless I'm able to drag them out of bed before 8 am :D

Reviews.Author: Sara C.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam Cafe is one of those places that everyone seems to know something about. Some people have seen it while driving by. Others have  had friends tell them about it or have eaten there themselves. What I am trying to say is that word of Blu Jam Cafe gets around.So I had to give it a try. We got there at around 2 pm on a Sunday and, more or less surprisingly, the server told us that the wait would be about thirty minutes. We didn't fight all the chaos of street parking in LA for nothing, so we stood outside and waited. Fortunately, many people started to finish up and we were seated in about ten minutes.There is a lot to choose from in the menu, but don't be fooled. My recommendation: get something breakfasty, something along the lines of french toast or eggs benedict. The only reason you would flip to the lunch menu is for their appetizers and some soup. Otherwise, ignore the sandwiches. However, my acquaintances chose to ignore me, saying that eating breakfast in the afternoon is "absurd" and decided to get a half sandwich and a cup of soup combination... but they did not know what kind of soup to get.Our waiter, quirky and goofy but charming, offered to bring samples of the Potato Leek, Split Pea, and Kamil's goulash in order to help them decide. What fantastic service! So after trying the three soups, my acquaintances ordered  LA BLT and turkey with Kamil's goulash and split pea soup, respectively. I decided to get the Florentine eggs benedict with a cup of chai latte. We ordered the shrimp ceviche to split.The shrimp ceviche consists of three large corn chips and freshly chopped red onion, mango, cilantro, and shrimp. Delicious! Citrusy and refreshing, I could have eaten ten more of these loaded chips.My chai latte came next. Unfortunately, I had forgotten to request a drawing in my latte, so I was a little disappointed at first, but once I took a sip, all my troubles melted away. Hands down, the best chai latte I've ever had. Need I say more?Last but not least, my Florentine eggs benedict. The eggs were cooked just so that they were firm but luxuriously runny. The feta cheese, almost-melty spinach, and roasted tomatoes added that Greek-Italian fusion that I've never had but secretly always wanted in my eggs benedict. Not to mention, the herb potatoes were the bomb.Blu Jam Cafe is definitely not the cheapest place to have breakfast, but it is possibly one of the best places to have breakfast in LA. The crowd is young and hip, the ambiance is intimate but classic, and the food speaks for itself. I would battle for parking just to have some more of their chai latte!

Reviews.Author: Jackie M.
Reviews.Content: Super stoked coming here on a nice, sunny, smoggy LA afternoon. Located on Melrose, Blu Jam is a great place to eat! It has both indoor and outdoor seating. The interior is nice, very rich colored wooden walls and floors. We were greetes by this Leona Lewis looking hostess with the accent to match who was super sweet and sat us within 10 minutes of us getting there.My friends and I got to sit in this little private room in the back which was really cool. Our waiter was really attentive and friendly. My friends and I ordered a pitcher of sangria which served 5 people perfectly. I ordered the Kamil grilled cheese. It had 3 different cheeses, tomato, and Bacon. It was DELICIOUS. I'm a sucker for cheese, but damn this was a bomb ass sandwich. Came with a side of potatoes that were also very yummy. I also ordered a vanilla latte because how could I resist a big ass cup of coffee where the foam is transformed into art! I got a pretty snowflake looking design :). Very very pleased with my experience here and I would def. recommend this place to you all and I look forward to coming back!

Reviews.Author: Rebecca F.
Reviews.Content: Crunchy French Toast and the Fried Egg sandwich are my favorites! Between my boyfriend and I, we have tried many of the menu items and they all have been delicious.No matter how many other breakfast places we try, Blue Jam is still our favorite. There is ALWAYS a wait, but I assure you that it is worth it. The prices are very reasonable, and the service has always been very good. There is valet parking and often you can find street parking if you are willing to look around.

Reviews.Author: Lilli I.
Reviews.Content: Um...I'm obsessed.Must-haves here:1. CRUNCHY FRENCH TOAST2. EGGWICH3. WARM MUSHROOM SALAD (I added chicken and it was superb, but I'm sure it would have been great with any of the add-ins or even just as is)Yum yum yum. Recommend!

Reviews.Author: Patricia N.
Reviews.Content: Came here on a Sunday morning with my study group before we got crackin' on the books. Definitely the best way to start off a study session! I came with a group of 5 people, a little before 9am and there was no wait to be seated outside. After we ordered our food, I turned around and there was a huge line! Quick tip: get here early!Anyway, the servers were very attentive, and got our drink orders in quickly. I ordered their vanilla latte. It was absolutely delicious. Rich and creamy, with the right amount of foam and latte art. =) I also tried my friends' mocha latte and chai latte and was blown away. Now on to the food review...I wanted to order everything on the menu. I didn't know what to order for the longest time, but decided to go with their Veneto Risotto off of their brunch menu. Not what I was expecting from a risotto because it was drier than anticipated, but still very flavorful and delicious. They were super generous with the meats and veggies. The two eggs poached on top were beautiful. I wish I could poach like that. LOL! And you cannot dine here without trying their signature crunchy French Toast. My friends and I decided to order our own dishes and to order the french toast for dessert. I'm so glad we did that. One bite of this yummy dish and you wish the feeling you're overcome with won't end. Yeah, it's that good. If anything, please order this dish and you will not be sorry!I definitely want to dine here again and again and again. My goal: to try every dish on their menu. HAHAHA

Reviews.Author: Sara P.
Reviews.Content: We came on a Wednesday mid- morning so it wasn't busy. On weekends and holidays it's packed! I had the Far East -- Organic roasted tofu, fresh mint, chili, carrots, zucchini, spinach... It was great! Not really a breakfast dish though. I also tried the french toast, and it really is as good as other reviewers say. Comes with a lot of fruit and beautifully presented. Fresh squeezed juices too!

Reviews.Author: Batilly H.
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that the food itself gave it the higher rating 3 stars but the service dropped it a star.  The service was lackluster.  Granted we showed up on Sunday for brunch isn't exactly the ideal time since they were SO busy--we waited 35-40 minutes before being seated.  But that wasn't the part that was lacking--it was the slow service and inability to get my order correctly twice.  That made getting my food another 10 minutes later--all on top of the fact that I had to catch a flight.  So finally when I got my food...it was still incorrect but I didn't send it back because I wouldn't have time to enjoy it otherwise.  I would definitely check it out when they're not so busy that no one is making sure that your custom order is not correct the second time around.Other than that, the food was pretty bomb--hearty, healthy and fresh.

Reviews.Author: Katherine P.
Reviews.Content: A french toast heaven. A treat. A must on Melrose. If you could only eat at one place on Melrose, and it had to be for brunch, you have to come here!The cafe is situated perfectly along Melrose, and the seating outside under large umbrellas is perfect for people watching, and very reminiscent of the outdoor seating and dining the fabulous girls of the Hills enjoy in seemingly every episode.The waitstaff is friendly, accommodating, and visible! Despite sitting outside, I never felt like they were missing or hard to flag. The food did take a while to come out, but that's not really the waitstaff's fault. The hostess was very perky and cute. We were seated outside right away - score!Now, the food. The most important part. After seeing pictures of the french toast with berries, we had to order it. Among us three girls, we ordered two plates of the Lost Bread, and I ordered the Blu Toast. We also ordered the fruit salad bowl, which by the way, is huge, great to split among three girls, and had such deliciously fresh and sweet fruit, it made me grateful for living in Cali!The Lost Bread was such a delectable, chewy, soft, eggy, sweet, melty french toast experience. Covered with fruit, it was a sight to behold. The Blu Toast, different with its blackberry jam and cream cheese, was not overly sweet, hot, soft, and decadent. Simply delicious.Must go back!

Reviews.Author: Jenn S.
Reviews.Content: Rundown - Great Breakfast Food! - Great Service - I'll pass on the chai latte next time - Coffee was disappointing First off, the french toast was SO GOOD! I had the crispy french toast and I finished it all. It came with a few berries and a really good cream/milky syrup for the french toast. I'm glad that my boyfriend found this place. Just writing this review is making me crave the french toast.... I couldn't give it 5 stars because I didn't love the coffee. A good breakfast place as great food AND coffee. I think the coffee was sitting on the pot for too long and it wasn't hot. The waiter recommended the Chai Latte and I wasn't a fan. I won't try it again. The atmosphere is nice and the service is excellent. This is one of my favorite breakfast places.

Reviews.Author: Julia W.
Reviews.Content: Finally went back on  a Friday morning. A bit more busy than the last time I went there. And this time...omg the brioche french toast is to DIE for, especially with the blackberry jam. Right now, they're also celebrating South American with a SA-inspired specials menu. Check it out, the chocolate crepes with chili-chocolate dripped over it.

Reviews.Author: Sherry H.
Reviews.Content: FREE FOOD! jk... let's make this long story short!Came here on a sunday afternoon for brunch. My friend and I ordered two different dishes. STEAK HASH- This dish is absolutely fulfilling.  The steak is so tender and juicy! cooked to perfection and pairs so well with the hash brown topped with two soft, poached eggs with basil sauce which makes it look like 2 green eggs! This dish comes with 2 pieces of toast as well! highly recommended!CRUNCHY FRENCH TOAST- I am not a big fan of sweet breakfast but this french toast is so unique ! I've read multiple review on yelp regarding their amazing french toast so decided to try it.  What makes this so different is the crunchiness of the outer coat and the special vanilla syrup that comes with the french toast.  If you think this brioche french toast is too sweet...check this out! they top this dish with a variety of fresh fruits! banana, strawberries, and blueberries adds a "berry fulfilling" flavor to it and makes this dish that much better!The reason why i said is free is because our order got lost so the owner decided to compensate our stomach with a full free meal! they also gave us free LEMON CREPE which is also very delicious as well! Location: This place is right on melrose! very easy to spot because there's normally a bunch of people outside waiting to be seated! They do have an outdoor area for smokers and for those who enjoys eating out with the sun.  The parking though, is very difficult.  Be extra careful if you want to park in the neighborhood, most of them has a meter but some spot might require some sort of permit! read the sign before you park!  Service: is great! since the owner understand how pissed we were...waited 45 min for meal was not cool at all.  If they didn't apologize or anything i think the star rating would go wayyyy down!One of my favorite brunch place in LA.  The portion is perfect even for a person like me who normally eats half of my plate!  Strongly recommend you sit inside if is really hot outside because it only gets hotter! enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Philippe S.
Reviews.Content: Simply put: Great service, great food! Great job Kamil!The only mishap, by the time I got to the last slice of your delicious crunchy French toast, I ran out of vanilla sauce. :( other than that, don't change anything.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie H.
Reviews.Content: A little on the pricey side but they use good quality ingredients so it is worth it. I'm a huge fan of eggs benedict but I don't like ham/canadian bacon and they have great alternatives here. They do get very busy on weekends and they close at 4pm. The service here is always great as well. I have never had a bad dish here.

Reviews.Author: O'Shea J.
Reviews.Content: There's a shitload of these kind of cafes up and down Melrose and after browsing the menu outside (and also because it was the closest one) we decided to give it a try. The staff was super friendly, a pleasant surprise being in West Hollywood. I knew we were in the right place when they served us house water (scoff all you want) from a pitcher full of mint leaves. I ordered the Chicken Curry sandwich and while the description mentioned raisins - a combo I've never had in a sandwich - it turned out to be really good. It's lightness caught me off guard and was the perfect meal before blowing my life savings on clothes. Come here and sit outside if it's a sunny day. All windows stay open so they use very minimal lighting, which is always a cool look and I guess makes them somewhat "green."

Reviews.Author: Iris T.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam Cafe is the quintessential LA brunch spot - long wait, delicious food, and laidback vibe. First things first, parking. There's 2 hr street parking in the neighborhood adjacent to Blu Jam. We got here around 11 am and lucked upon some parking, but by the time we got out around 1:30 pm, the parking was all gone! So def keep that in mind if you feel like going to Blu Jam on a Saturday during the morn/lunch time. Long wait.. loong wait. Maybe the longest I've waited in LA thus far -- about 45 minutes for a table for 2. But it IS worth it. Upon getting seated, our server was attentive and our food came out quickly after we ordered. Loved it!On to the food. My friend and I strategized our ordering - one sweet and one savory. The sweet? The Crunchy French Toast. Egg brioche dipped in cornflakes, topped w/ bananas and berries, with vanilla bean sauce. Oh. My. Goodness. Crunchy, delicious, and just sweet enough. And the vanilla bean sauce? GENIUS. Why don't ALL french toast come with this sauce. The savory? The Roma via Paris. Scrambled eggs with spinach, tomatoes, zucchini, cherry tomatoes, goat cheese and mozzarella. It's supposed to come with bell peppers but we decided to opt out. This was also delicious. Savory and good filling:egg:cheese ratio. I could've gone without the goat cheese but I did like that it came with both potatoes AND toast. Why pick when you can get both! I'm not sure if I'll be back any time soon given my long bucket list of brunch places but if you haven't been yet, definitely check this place out.. it is one of those places that is ACTUALLY worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: Ewa M.
Reviews.Content: Sunny afternoon, lunch with friends, chose Blue Jam because of it's Yelp reviews as well as tempting menu. We sat outside enjoying the sun and spring breeze, both really excited and super hungry. Unfortunately, despite all the potential and excitement, we did not have the best experience due to slow service and not necessarily great waitress. First up, the bread - warm and tasty, but we had to wait for another basket until the end of our meal. Usually water refills are no brainers, but I did not get my refill again, until the end of the meal. We skipped potatoes with our plates, but we did not even get a freakin' side salad, so the plates looked pretty empty and bland. Overall, this is place worth revisiting again, just to see if the service can be improved. Of course parking is always a problem, so whatever...but there is so many other restaurant spots on Melrose, so I feel they should try a little bit harder than this.

Reviews.Author: Michael D.
Reviews.Content: Come here on the weekend AFTER the brunch time rush! otherwise youre gonna wait for HOURS.We got:Kamil's Breakfast: a mish-mash of all things delicious. It's simple, fattening, and carbalicious!Crunchy french toast (Only available on weekend brunch): Has a tasty cornflake crust, plenty of fresh berries, and it comes with a vanilla sauce that tastes just like melted vanilla bean ice cream.Eggs Benny: usually brunch joints mess up the yolk by overcooking it.. but it was PERFECT here!Definitely my favorite spot for brunch.. dishes are simple, fresh, and tasty!

Reviews.Author: Mae R.
Reviews.Content: Love this place! The food is delicious and came out fast! Definitely get the crunchy french toast to share with everyone or eat solo too :-)But I think the restaurant deserves a 5 star also because of the excellent customer service. From the hostess to the waitress, they were all really nice and accommodating to our large party. The scenario last time we went, there were originally only 6 people in our party, but some friends decided to invite last minute guests...which equaled to 12 people and this happened during Sunday Brunch (a very busy time in the day). However, the staff was gracious, always kept a smile and didn't get flustered at all. They were able to squeeze all 12 of us in a back corner table and worked out perfectly. Thank you again for the hostess and our waitress for your patience!!

Reviews.Author: Chris A.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam cafe is a sweet little spot that opened up on Melrose near where Chianti used to be.  We actually went there because they had put one of those "buy one meal, got one free" cards on my car.Boy was I glad we did that.   The food is great and the staff are still amazed enough that people are showing up that they're enthusiastic and attentive.The food itself is standard breakfast fair that does range a little into the adventurous.  Mostly I've gone with omelettes which are all good.  I also had the eggs benedict which was great.  The coffee is great and they're happy to pour it until you start shaking.They don't have a liquor license last I checked (as of 09/23/2006) and I think they're holding off on doing dinners until they get that.  So for right now, the place is a breakfast gem.  I tend to go there from 11:00-12:00 on weekends, so if you could go before or after that time slot and not mess up my favorite breakfast joint, that would be just swell.

Reviews.Author: Sunny D.
Reviews.Content: Although Blu Jam is on Melrose, it is rather unassuming and chill inside. The first thing I noticed was the photography on the wall. It was an African wildlife theme, and there was a stunning picture of a very photogenic giraffe across from my table that distracted me until my friend arrived. My friend and I shared the asparagus scramble and the strawberry/peach crepe, both of which were heavenly. The ingredients in the scramble were fresh and tasty. They used just the right amount of everything, especially the goat cheese, which is easy to overdo. I had a small issue with the peaches on the crepe being canned, since every single other ingredient was fresh, but no matter. It was still delicious. So what earned Blu Jam the elusive 5th star? The lemon-mint infused water. It's a minor detail, but classed up the meal and complemented the whole experience.

Reviews.Author: Gregg F.
Reviews.Content: I can't help but love this restaurant. It's in a fun area downtown and it's pretty much my destination for dinner before shows if I've had enough of Canter's.Blu-Jam is a truly hip little eatery that doesn't have the marble/glass/dark wood look that every "hip" eatery has these days. The waitstaff is always really great and they all seem to really enjoy working there. Our water glasses are always full and the food is always served promptly and (here's the sign of a good restaurant) at the same time. I've eaten here for Breakfast and early dinner and both are really good, but seriously avoid the turkey sausage because it's just the dodgiest, hardest, weirdest flavored sausage I've ever eaten. The turkey bacon is really a better choice in that. I reccommend the Chicken Vesuvius and the pea soup, both are well seasoned and the chicken is not even in the least dry (which is really an accomplishment for any restaurant, let alone one with prices like these.)

Reviews.Author: Lauren K.
Reviews.Content: Very cute breakfast spot.  The owner/ executive chef is very warm and welcomes you kindly to his restaurant.  His staff follows suite and is extrememly helpful and at ease with the pace of the diner.  They have done a wonderful good on the design of the place and make it a cozy- NYish loft feel. We ordered 3 entrees for two people : ) - breakfast pesto sandwich, blu jam benedict and strawberry,banana, chocolate pancakes. Kamil also included a tasting size portion of the brioche french toast with peaches, as the pancakes we ordered had not been prepared with the chocolate chips from the menu description. Needless to say, we had breakfast for the following day.  All of the meals were good- the organic coffee was also very tasty and a good deal at $2.50 with free refills.  I would definitely go back and try more items.  My suggestion is to arrive early, as I am sure this place fills up as the Sunday Brunch crew gathers. There are also plenty of meters at that hour and for free!

Reviews.Author: Kelson H.
Reviews.Content: Probably one of the only shops to be open at the early morning hour at this particular area of  Melrose Ave.  A nice place for small groups very laid back.  The decor surrounding the customers only added to the nice ambiance.  The food was good.  I only had breakfast here, but I could imagine the lunch and dinner being no different in quality and taste. Food:Orange Juice: Very good can't complain here.Roma Via Paris:Three farm fresh eggs scrambled with spinach, sun-dried tomatoes,zucchini, cherry tomatoes, bell peppers, fresh basil, Chevrier goatcheese and mozzarella, served with potatoes and toast $9.95(Very tasty and fresh.  The potatoes were fantastic.)In summary this is a great place for breakfast/brunch/lunch.  I'll have to try it for dinner, sometime.  I'm giving it 4 stars mainly because I want to try it again and if its good all the same, I'll know it wasn't a fluke and give it the full 5.Service:4Food:5Decor:5Would I go back?  You bet your pastrami I would.

Reviews.Author: Paolo P.
Reviews.Content: The 3 stars is a place holder until I return on a regular day and see what service is like then. I came here for Easter brunch and although the place was busy it wasn't overflowing, It was after all 1:30pm. There were only 2 groups ahead of us but it still took about 40 minutes to get us seated. Then it took another 30 minutes for our order to arrive.For a place voted as having the best breakfast I had high expectations. I ordered the Toscana Scramble, which was alright but I won't be ordering it again. The portion of the dish was on the smaller side, I was still hungry afterward. The OJ was too sour, I didn't even drink half of it. The girlfriend had the Salmon which she says was excellent. I didn't try it though.I'm definitely giving this place a second chance and I have my eye on the breakfast quesadilla.Photos uploaded.

Reviews.Author: Chris C.
Reviews.Content: Deserves and earns all the positive reviews.Business associate recommended Blu Jam for a catch up lunch.  I am now paying it forward and taking great pleasure in recommending it for my other lunch excursions.  I even took the foodie MOM for Mothers Day brunch.  Everything I've tried there in 4 visits has been tasty, well portioned and fresh.  The extensive menu ensures something for everyone. The service is breezy yet attentive.  Be extra mindful if you park on a meter on Melrose.  Our perfect lunch ended on a sour note when my friend discovered a ticket for being over by 5 minutes!

Reviews.Author: Twojay D.
Reviews.Content: Great service; beautiful people; amazing food; relatively fast service considering it was noon on a Sunday.Doesn't get better than this.  Their hamburgers/chzbrgrz are AWESOME-O!

Reviews.Author: Glen C.
Reviews.Content: One of the BEST places in LA to grab breakfast food. I've been here twice and enjoyed it each time. I've had the Power House, and the breakfast quesadilla. Both were just awesome. This place provides good quality, "man-sized" portions of food and I can almost guarantee that you will love it. BTW, I had the bite of the Brioche French Toast... I'm not a huge fan of sweet breakfast foods .... but hot damn if that wasn't some of the best french toast I'd ever eaten. Warning: I do hear the place gets packed on the weekends. I enjoyed this place (both times) on a nice and quiet weekday morning. What a better way to enjoy a meal while on Melrose?

Reviews.Author: mae e.
Reviews.Content: Always a pleasure eating at this cute/comfy cafe off Melrose. Great food along with superb service calls for a wonderful time at Blu Jam Cafe! I've eaten here for breakfast/brunch and the food never fails me. From the fresh tasting assorted fruits, to the fluffy pancakes and waffles, to the stuffed flavorful omelets, this place has exceeded my expectations. The iced coffee drinks are also refreshing- get the chai iced latte! I never usually live up to the hype, but the hype definitely lives it up at Blu Jam.

Reviews.Author: Maggie K.
Reviews.Content: PERFECT!I can't come up with one flaw, and any place that pops up in my dreams is worth 5 stars.I went for breakfast, and I can honestly say it's the best breakfast I've had in LA hitherto.
