The Vanilla French toast with blackberry jam, fresh berries, and bananas was to die for! The presentation was beautiful and the flavor was spot on. It was all around crispy, and soft in the center. All the flavors perfectly complimented each other.My friend got the banana pancake with candied walnuts and dark chocolate, and I can say that I've never had such a perfect pancake in my life. I especially loved that it didn't have that overbearing flour taste.My other friend ordered the Blue Jam Benedict, and I never was a fan of eggs benedict until I took a bit of the Blu Jam. Amazing flavor, and paired with their seasoned potatoes...I'm just speechless.I'll be back for their lunch and dinner entrees for sure!Oh, and the water here tasted great...yes...I reviewed about the water, but I hate when my complimentary water tastes like urine (not that I know what that tastes like).

Reviews.Author: keisha w.
Reviews.Content: You know when you look back on old yearbook pictures, and you want to kick your mom for letting you look like that? (i love you still ma, and would never kick you :) ) well thats how i feel about my old blu jam cafe review. by old i mean, like a coupla days ago. but alas, so i happily take my bf to blu jam today. and by take i mean, like into the doorway... we stand there, trying to get our name one the list and stood behind the manager/owner(?) and the hostess. i wont say i was ignored, b/c the hostess did put a palm in my face as acknowledgment. oh you're finished with your long conversation about how to put two tables together? "k, we need a table for..." oh wait, they've both walked away. k we'll wait here. ::old guy comes back and again puts his back to us:: "hello, can we get a table for two, we've been waiti-" oh you're gonna have an attitude old man? after you and your "hostess" did not host, put your back to us, ignored us, walked away, and told me to hold on as she came back to ask you another question? awesome. i literally had to step back so she wouldn't knock me over as she just pushed herself between he and i. and he had a problem with me. great service! here's the kicker...the owner JUST wrote to me in response to my other review about how the service was bad b/c they were all in training that weekend. bull. they're bad b/c you're awful. we just took our business, and our money that wasn't good enough for him to vienna cafe. i got crispy bacon there too. so ha!

Reviews.Author: Anna K.
Reviews.Content: My first re-review! Foodies unite as this one is necessary because Blu Jam Cafe is open for dinner and it's a MUST TRY! They have their beer and wine license, and their selection does not disappoint. Their dinner menu is tapas style but don't think that that means small little dishes, it will definitely fill you up with each delicious bite. Trust me when I say delicious. I was just there the other night and we shared the Argentinean steak (melt-in-your-mouth good), the scallop carpaccio (orgasmic) , truffle mac & cheese (my friend did his happy dance when he tasted this), and brussels sprouts (yes to veggies!) Need I say more? The menu is inspiring and Kamil (chef/owner) is always giving his best when it comes to the ingredients. Come for breakfast/lunch, stay for dinner.

Reviews.Author: Richard P.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam Cafe is a great place for brunch. I bookmarked this place several weeks ago because we were planning to be in the area and were looking for good brunch places. We ended up going to BLD, so this past weekend I decided to finally give it a try.The wait wasn't too bad. A table for two on a Saturday morning took about 20 minutes. While waiting for a table we just looked at the menu. It was difficult to decide on what to order. Everything sounded so great. The breakfast and lunch entrees all sounded delicious. My friend and I settled on each ordering our own entree and splitting an additional item from the griddle. My friend order the seared tuna sandwich with a side salad. He said it was pretty good.I ordered the Brunch Burger. It was awesome. It definitely ranks up there as one of my favorite burgers. It was pretty big and juicy. It was served with bacon and two over easy eggs on brioche bread. I've seen burgers with an egg on top, but I had never tried one. I have to say: I am a fan!We also split the strawberry crepes. These were also very delicious.Blu Jam Cafe is a great place for brunch on the weekend. Parking might be a little hard. They offer valet or you can park on the street. It can get busy, but the food is worth it.

Reviews.Author: Jay V.
Reviews.Content: Been here thrice now.First time, great.Second time, ok.Third time, falling down the hill.The servers are great, however, the consistency in the food quality and way it's prepared is different everytime, and I would know as I am a creature of habit and order the same thing each time.  Caveat is only breakfast for me.  Sometimes breakfast at lunchtime, but that's still breakfast.I will go back, but next time, it better be better, or else...moving on.

Reviews.Author: Topanga S.
Reviews.Content: I had an organic iced cafe late, crunchy french toasts, and egg benedicts.They were good but just not any better than Black Cow, which is my favorite cafe for brunch 10 minutes from my house. So it's not worth driving here really. Hamburger my husband had was awful. He said it was one of the worst he ever had. Nice service cute place.

Reviews.Author: Yuna K.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam is worth all the hype. At first, I was definitely skeptical and wasn't sure if the place would live up to its hype but in all, this place is just fabulous! What can I say?I love the ambience on Melrose. It was such a perfect place to have a sister brunch. My faves were definitely the Roma via Paris and Crunchy French Toast. The Roma Via Paris is just what every breakfast item should be: simple, fresh, and delicious. It really brought up my mood! Also, they MUST have worked magic on that vanilla sauce that goes with the crunchy french toast. The moment I took a bite, my life changed. That is all.

Reviews.Author: Jackie T.
Reviews.Content: I've been here for brunch a couple of times now and I gotta say, the food is on point! The Norwegian Benedict is to die for (I'm a big fan of salmon and eggs for brekkie) as is the fruit bowl. I've had bites of the things my friends have had (unfortunately can't remember the names of the items now) and everything's been delicious.I had to deduct a couple of stars for 2 reasons:- The wait for brunch is ridiculous. I don't know if they take reservations, if they do then I'll be sure to go that route in the future. If you show up at about 11am on any given day, expect to wait 30min - an hour. - The crowd is douche-tastic. I think people come here to see and be seen. I have no qualms with the industry generally... but something happens when you get 50 of these guys in a room together schmoozing and passing around scripts and comparing projects. Too many peacocks squawking about.

Reviews.Author: Clara B.
Reviews.Content: After reading some Yelp reviews I was encouraged to try it, so I was truly delighted by the great atmosphere, lovely service, friendly staff and then meeting really cool customers like Tom who has a table named after him since he is a regular which means he loves the place...I had breakfast, delicious scrambled with feta and veggies and chocolate monkey which had roibos and it was relaxing as well.  I almost forgot to mention baked potatoes were prepared well...Next time I deliver my abstract paintings to my gallery I am going to try their famous French Toast.The other thing that's great is easy access to parking in a residential neighborhood...I am looking forward to going back and perhaps I will see Tom again...

Reviews.Author: Julia H.
Reviews.Content: I came here for brunch on Saturday.  My friend and I did not know where to go so we yelped a brunch place in LA and Blu Jam cafe came up.  We saw that it was in Melrose and new that we were going to have to street park.  Surpisingly it was pretty easy to find street parking.  There was a 15 min wait which was reasonable.  The restaurant itself is pretty small and intimate.  Its one of those restaurants where the tables are so close together you can hear the conversations going on around you.   I was really excited for the food because it got such good reviews but honestly i didn't think it was THHHHAT great.  My friend had the ilonka crepe and i can't remember the name of what i had for the life of me.  But, I had one of the omeletts.  The crepe was reallllyyy sweet.  A little too sweet for morning food and the omelette was like any other decent omelette.  I

Reviews.Author: April B.
Reviews.Content: Ummmm Tasty! I ordered the Migas and it was so delicious, sub'ed the potatoes for fruit which was a good choice since the portion was quite large - however if you're a hungry dude then I'd keep the taters. My husband ordered Kamil's breakfast which is last nights Mac  n' Cheese scrambled with eggs and bacon .. Taste wise this was a major winner. Only down side is that is was on the small side for his taste, he mentioned that a side of something would have been perfect.  I don't get to LA often but when I do I will forsure return the Blu Jam, it's well worth it!

Reviews.Author: Hari W.
Reviews.Content: OK, restaurants shouldn't be as loud as clubs. I'm not sure about other people, but I honestly just want to sit, eat, talk, and enjoy my Saturday mornings. Food left me with "not bad, but I've had better" feelings. Despite not feeling very welcomed until I got seated, my waitress was very attentive (I wish I remembered your name so I can make a shout out to you here).

Reviews.Author: Daniel Y.
Reviews.Content: An amazing little cafe that is super busy even for Saturday brunch. I arrived at 10AM and my group of 5 was seated in about 15 minutes. But by the time we finished eating, there was already a crowd of waiting people starting to form. So, get here early - you've been warned.My friends and I ordered different plates and we shared:Roma Via Paris - the strong flavors of zucchini, spinach and goat cheese competed too much with one another to offer a sense of cohesiveness.Crunchy French Toast - French Toast rolled in corn flakes? Genius! The crunchy outside was a great complement to the soft middle. Pour a little of their vanilla bean sauce on it and you've got a dish worthy of being called Blu Jam's Signature Dish.Mazatlan Shrimp Scramble - Too much sour cream. Everyone ate around the huge glop on top which ended up being scraped to the side. It was okay. Nothing to write home about.Wrap on Fire - This unfortunately was my least favorite. It had lackluster taste and felt uninspired.Smoked Salmon Platter - Light dish that make a pretty good combination of using bright flavors and textures - lemon, cucumber, tomatoes, capers, cream cheese, salmon, fresh dill.Overall, the serving sizes are significant. The next table over ordered the stack of 3 pancakes - thick pancakes the size of the plate!The staff were all very friendly and the waitress came by frequently to refill waters and to check on us.

Reviews.Author: Mark G.
Reviews.Content: This place is great!  The breakfasts here are really amazing and the atmosphere is perfect for a relaxing Sunday meal.  They have really creative combinations and everything is extremely fresh.  There is normally a bit of a wait but they are located in a nice area on Melrose so there are plenty of stores to check out.  They recently expanded but I don't think they've quite finished decorating, so ask to be seated in the main area if you can.  The crispy French toast is a must!!

Reviews.Author: Jeremy B.
Reviews.Content: Can't add too much more than the other 1800 plus reviews. Great food come here and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Linda N.
Reviews.Content: Came here with my boyfriend couple of months ago for the first time and it was delicious. Their French toast was amazing! I had the eggs Benedict. That was great too. We read reviews and some said to come early so we decided to go when they open. We got there 15 mins after they open and there were already customers. The place is small, but it's cozy. They do have some outside seating. The only downfall to this is the parking. There's only street parking. So we park on the street next to the restaurant which wasn't too bad. I recommend going early so you can get parking and a seat when you get there. I would recommend this place!

Reviews.Author: Julia G.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam cafe is a mandatory visit if one is to come within 2 miles of Melrose Avenue. Walk inside to a never full house, and let the cold brick walls cool your body down from intense shopping and walking.  If you pick a spot along the wall, make sure to swoop on the booth side of the table; flamboyant pillows will accompany you and your tushy while you daydream about how to make your apartment somehow similar in decore and ambiance (think hidden Seatle coffee house with a smidget of zen and a pinch of vintage art and posters). Then you get the menu and you need to prepare yourself to think.  and think hard.  Ask those taste-buds if they're for sure for sure.  I say do the menu some dilligence because everything is worth being considered.  It's just that bomb.com.  I mean there are sumptous figs, ripe strawberries, boisenberries, and banana's sliced nickel width in your effing fruit cup.  Not the usual disgusting, recycled melon. I ordered the garden panini, absolutely outstanding.  I highly recommend.Your service is ideal. A knowledgeable, friendly staff that respects your time spent hanging.  The managers spare the staff by letting them wear casual clothes they personally own and forbid them from singing the birthday song. Go impress your friends or your honey by taking them to this charming cafe with exceptional edibles. It is sure to be the highlight of your day

Reviews.Author: Aimee J.
Reviews.Content: Dear God. Thanks to Casey for bringing this place into my life! I went there twice in one day. I mean, that speaks volumes.I've never been disappointed with anything that I've gotten from Blue Jam. I've gotten lox and eggs benedict and soup and burgers and a salad with poached eggs on it. I didn't even know I wanted a salad with poached eggs on it, but sure enough, it was in my face and I was LOVIN' it.The thing I like about Blu Jam is that I am not nervous to try new things on their menu. Other places I dine at I have my favorite meal and I fear trying something else cause it's not as good. Not here. Everything is delicious.Casey always recommends the migas. I believe that I will try that next time I go, which hopefully will be this weekend.The only negative is the wait, but hey, a long wait should let you know that this place is good. They are kind enough to have water available as well.

Reviews.Author: Christina A.
Reviews.Content: I love any place that gives me a crazy amount of options for breakfast. I don't eat beef or pork, and there is a shocking amount of bacon just slipped into breakfast dishes (I know, some of you are thinking that is the best part). But when I took a gander at the BJC menu, I was blown away. We had to ask our waitress to come back twice because we couldn't make up our minds--everything looked SO good! I ended up getting the Olympus and the bf ordered the Old World. Personally I think the old world just tasted like onions, but that is because I don't appreciate anyone slipping onions in to my omelette. My olympus was delish, and completely different from anything else I've had, with the tomato-basil sauce over the scramble. The fruit that comes with it (at no extra charge to sub!!!) is actually really, really good--three types of berries, melons, and kiwi. Oh and don't forget to check out their pancakes--we ordered one on the side and it was divine. Light, fluffy and served with the perfect syrup even though it was one of the few flapjacks I could eat without it (I know!)

Reviews.Author: Maria Z.
Reviews.Content: Thanks to my friend Janet, I have experienced what brunch has always strived to become. I will be speaking in hyperbole, so if that is a problem with you, just tune out now. I love this French toast. The regular French toast, not that vanilla or crunchy kind which I have not tried. The regular one. I want to live in it. I want to die in it. I want to be buried in it. Yes, I do want to marry it and have little French babies. It's delicious.Now to be real, there is going to be a long wait. Maybe an hour? But it's worth it. They have the best wait staff, and the food is bomb. I also had the breakfast quesadilla, which was totally killer. A twist on the breakfast burrito: I approve. And you can go to any number of awesome shops while you wait for your table. It's really a wonderful restaurant and I want it to stay open forever. Great portions, reasonable prices, really nice and knowledgable waiters, and just plain awesome. Go at your earliest convenience.

Reviews.Author: Magdalena C.
Reviews.Content: I can't complain about a place that serves breakfast all day.  The place is very unassuming and casual but I did notice that the crowd was more attractive than usual. The breakfast menu is extensive with brunch specials and a sizable healthy section.  Still feeling a bit hung over after two days, I craved something greasy.  Based on the waitress recommendation, I got the salmon hash--two sunny side up eggs on smoked salmon drizzled with sour cream and salted capers, accompanied by roasted potatoes.  Bf wanted to be healthy just for the day and got the Olympus breakfast--egg white with fire roasted chicken accompanied by a salad.  Despite the lack of fat in his dish, it was surprisingly good;  not as good as mine of course.

Reviews.Author: Courtney K.
Reviews.Content: The organic coffee is great, the fresh orange juice is everything it should be, and the food is very fresh with good flavor.  I ordered the "Roma Via Paris" Omelete (three farm fresh eggs scrambled with spinach, sun-dried tomatoes, zucchini, cherry tomatoes, bell peppers, fresh basil, Chevrier goat cheese and mozzarella, served with potatoes and toast,) and substituted egg whites.  As a side I chose their assorted fresh fruit, and rosemary toast. As for cost, it was exactly what you would expect from a Cafe on Melrose, approx $20/person.I was happy with the service and my breakfast :)  I will be visiting Blu Jam again.

Reviews.Author: Jason M.
Reviews.Content: Good food.  Lame service.  I've been there 3 times and each time the food was good but I felt like I had to keep asking for things like water and napkins...  Once they even brought my food out AFTER they served some folks who were seated 10 min after I ordered..The food is worth it but I just expect lame service.

Reviews.Author: Jessica L.
Reviews.Content: Really really good! Went here for breakfast on a Sunday-- managed to miss the brunch rush that seemed to start at 11. Everything was really tasty and the menu selection is great, I wanted to order 4 different things. I got the fruit plate instead of the potatoes and was pleasantly surprised with the quality and selection of the fruit. Not just melons and a few skimpy grapes, it had pineapple, berries, banana, melon, kiwi...really good! I had the California omelette which was really good. My friend had the special eggs benedict which he said was really good.Just an overall great breakfast place.

Reviews.Author: mishee p.
Reviews.Content: Came here with a friend who'd been once before and enjoyed it enough to go ahead without much time in between. We ordered the brioche french toast with blackberry jam, vanilla yogurt, fresh berries & bananas, as well as the breakfast quesadillas with potatoes. Thought it would be a good mix of sweet and savory. Hot DAMN, it was the perfect balance of sweet and savory! The yogurt in the french toast just added a layer of texture not common to french toast and made it one of the best french toasts I've had. The quesadilla was delicious and the sliced avocado on top made me feel SLIGHTLY less guilty about the fact that i was stuffing massive calories into my mouth since some of them were full of the good fat. :) Their service was great, but we were also 2 of about 8 people in the restaurant at the time. It was a random wednesday after all. Added bonus: One of those 8 customers was Jason Statham! I'm a celebrity whore so anytime I get to combine a celebrity sighting with good food, I will always give the place that elusive 5th star.

Reviews.Author: Ara K.
Reviews.Content: What an adorable adorable name for a cafe. I probably can write paragraphs upon paragraphs about the intricately fascinating details of the name Blu Jam Cafe, but I don't want to.I came here for a Friday morning breakfast and although all the patio seats were taken, there were plenty of tables to seat our party of 2. Service was awesome, but I admit I was so immersed in conversation that I didn't notice the quality of service so much.However, the food was delicious! I have this great affinity for benedicts. I don't think I can appreciate a breakfast restaurant that doesn't offer these scrumptious things.I ordered the florentine benedict, and it was delicious. It consisted of poached eggs on a pair of toasted croissants (correct me if I'm wrong), spinach, sauteed mushrooms, sun-dried tomatoes, and their yummy hollandaise sauce. The hollandaise sauce was very thick, and I liked that it wasn't running all over my plate. I have the egg yolk to do that in its stead.The service was prompt and they were polite. They weren't the friendliest people I've met, but I don't expect every waiter that serves me to come to my table and ask about my mother now do I? All I can say is that they were nice enough to let us stay and chat in there for 2 hours. We went in for breakfast and left at lunch time.But then again, the restaurant wasn't very busy.

Reviews.Author: Ami S.
Reviews.Content: AMAZING!!!!!Not much more to say, the sheer number of reviews speak for itself; CRUNCHY FRENCH TOAST a MUST try!

Reviews.Author: Diane C.
Reviews.Content: Parking was not ideal as there are only meter parking on side streets. However, I found one fairly quickly on Fuller. But keep in mind that there may be a long waitlist so the 2 hour meter limit might have you refeeding in middle of your meal.It is very popular. Expect to wait minimum of 20 minutes for a table. But once you sit down and get some coffee in you...dang...NOT going to lie. WORTH it! St. Petersburg and the Oatmeal...wow goooood. It might be the brunch place I have been to so far.Service was great as well. Ok, the price takes away a star. Bill worked out to be about 21 bucks a person in the end,tax and tip included. A bit much for brunch in my opinion.

Reviews.Author: Erica L.
Reviews.Content: Decided to come hereafter reading the reviews on Yelp. I had the breakfast special that was sort of like a breakfast egg taquito with chorizo. The white peach tea was excellent!Our servers, yes plural, got into  a tiff about who's table it was right in front of us.  The server that won the turf war had an attitude problem. Boooo.

Reviews.Author: Sean L.
Reviews.Content: This place rules. Came here with a bud after a night of drinking and have nothing to complain about. PROS: DELICIOUS.-Excellent service. -French toast was out-of-this-world-Great location-Coffee and water on the spot all the time-Chill and relaxed-Not too hipster. CHECK this place out. Order the French toast and you may never leave. Cya there, Sean

Reviews.Author: Christine C.
Reviews.Content: I don't have anything to say that probably hasn't been said already. This place is pretty great. Swung by for lunch on a Sunday afternoon. It's towards the beginning of Melrose's strip of spots (if you're coming from DTLA) so parking was fairly easy to find. Keep in mind that you have to pay for meters even on Sundays in this area. Check the parking signs!When we got there around 12:45, a handful of people were waiting and the hostess told us the wait was about 30 minutes. However, we ended up only waiting 5 minutes because there was an open spot on the sidewalk patio and no one wanted to sit outside. We sacrificed and sat outside for the sake of our tummies. There are large shades shielding you from the sun but it still gets pretty warm in the spring..summer...or in this case, the fall. Service was awesome. Everyone was nice and on top of the ball. I had the eggwich and boyfriend had a traditional breakfast. The eggwich is deeeelicious. It's such a great brunch item. Over easy egg, arugula, avocado, pesto aioli, tomato on foccacia. MMMMM. It also comes with a side of potatoes (which you can sub out). Definitely more than enough food to satisfy you.This place also has lots of gluten free, vegan and vegan-possible options for those with more dietary restrictions.Definitely worth a stop if you're even remotely near the area!

Reviews.Author: Lauren K.
Reviews.Content: We go here pretty often and I've never been disappointed. Most recently (Sunday) we went for a friend's birthday and had our 9 month old with us. They were so accommodating. The manager brought a toy and suggested we move the highchair out of the walkway. Good point. He was super nice and engaging. Not to mention the most important part, the food! Everyone enjoyed. I got the migas (again), soooo good. They brought lemon crepes for my friend's birthday, very sweet :) The longest we've ever had to wait is 5 minutes, even on a busy weekend. One of our standby breakfast spots.

Reviews.Author: Aaron D.
Reviews.Content: As a frequent eater of Blu Jam, i had a feeling that dinners would be just as good as the brunches and lunches, but i didn't know what i was signing myself up for.I've come to dinner multiple times now, tasting almost every plate, but the executive chef, Kamil, keeps coming up with new creations, and he never fails to impress. Always start with a plate(or 3) of the Ceviche and enjoy perfection on a chip. Then the quirky, yet ingenious, idea of a sunny up egg on asparagus will get your taste buds pumping. Then you MUST have the Black Truffle Mac and cheese, and try no to lick the plate, as it tends to be hot. :/ My personal favorite would be the scallops. There are no words to describe the scallops. Just order them.I've come in for a one on one dinner with a friend, had a double date with the in-laws, and even brought a group of my closest friends, and every time, Blu Jam is just the right atmosphere. The service is prompt, friendly, and the beer selection is not only unique, but mostly local. I love the beer scene in California!Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner; whatever I need, Blu Jam seems to have it. If you're looking for the next big thing, you found it.

Reviews.Author: Esther H.
Reviews.Content: This place has great brunch food.  The crunchy french toast with vanilla bean sauce was SO GOOD that it almost brought tears to my eyes.The florentine benedict was also amazing - perfect for any veggie lover.-minus one star because my water was DIRTY! My glass cup had orange residue on it, which was inevitably from the carrot juice that they did not wash properly.  When I told the waitress, she said it was from the lemon.  I don't think lemon is orange.. #sorryboutit.

Reviews.Author: Brian C.
Reviews.Content: Blu jam is a perpetually busy place on melrose that is renowned for breakfast. I decided to try it to see if it lived up to the hype. Though the food was good, it was not phenomenal. In addition, i dont think that the prices accurately reflect the quality and quantity of the food. I didnt have to wait in line, but if i did, i would have been frustrating to wait for something entirely average.

Reviews.Author: Max C.
Reviews.Content: For the first time ever Yelp has failed me. This is the most overrated cafe in LA. When I  arrived a girl dressed in a club outfit who we thought was a customer turned out to be our hostess. That was the beginning of a bizarre experience. They really need to do something with the seating... sitting at a table so close to other customers that their butts hit our plates when they walked out... let me rewind... my guests and I sit down and we didn't receive good service. Our waitress didn't even give us silverware or menus until after the party who arrived next to us sat down and gave their drink and brunch orders (yes we could hear their orders they were so close).  That was not cool. The food was good but the portions were below average for the price. Overall this is not the best breakfast in Los Angeles. In fact, I like iHop more.

Reviews.Author: Anna R.
Reviews.Content: I think it is a good place in Los Angeles. With my friend went there on the last week and had a nice massage for both of us. It was relaxing and comfort giving style. The  staff were nice and friendly and also pleasing. Though it is a small one, it has all the facilities needed for a spas.

Reviews.Author: Kristine J.
Reviews.Content: First time I came here, it was a Saturday around 1 pm.  It was so packed!  My friend and I waited on a list to be seated for more than an hour!  The woman putting people on the waiting list was kinda rude too. We were right in front of her, and she chose not to acknowledge us. How rude!  -___-  I think she was British by her accent.  Basically, I didn't have a pleasant experience this time.  My friend also had a tight schedule, so we couldn't wait any longer since she had to work.  I honestly wanted to give this place a 2, but since I hadn't tried this place yet.  I gave it the benefit of a doubt.I came back here again last Saturday.  This time around 5 pm.  Found out they've started closing earlier now, cuz it's the end of Summer hours.  Closes at 6 =/  But anywhos, this time going here was a heck of a lot better!  Less people, and they had 2 pages of "breakfast served all day" to choose from!  I got the Florentine Benedict while my friend got a turkey sandwich.  She really liked her food, as did I.  The best part of the meal was the side order of crunchy french toast.  The presentation was cute!  They had corn flakes cooked into the toast with a bunch of berries & bananas on top. Plus the vanilla bean sauce! Wish they gave more sauce though!I'll come back here anytime except for the busiest peak hours, which I'm assuming are on weekend mornings.  Cuz I don't wanna be dissapointed again! And I don't wanna see that British woman workin' the waiting list! (BTW, I have nothing against British people...well, maybe just this girl lol =P) Ya'll have to hire a more attentive, less rude person for the job!

Reviews.Author: Mike W.
Reviews.Content: Since I wrote this review, the owner / chef emailed me and asked about what happened and I told him the details.  I can appreciate people who care about their customers and the integrity of the business so I'm bumping this to a 4 star. --------------------If this review was solely based on my dish / experience it'd be a 1 star but my fellow food compatriots dishes were ranging from good to GREAT (LOVED the Florentine) so I'll give this a 3 star (since the service ... for lack of a better word - sucked).Anyway, nothing we ordered was bad, even my severely undercooked St Petersburg scramble was edible, however - here's what gripes me:1. We ordered at 10:20, the food came out at 11:14, it took almost an hour to get our food - dood, how can it take an hour to cook some eggs, toast some bread and whip up some home fries? I know it's crowded, this place ain't that big.2. Our waitress was awful... next time you go there avoid that little stout Latina looking lady with the frizzy hair - she's rather rude, definitely forgetful and never once checked up on us or apologized for the wait... I know it's busy, but dood, I was a waiter in college for a year and there's busy and then there's our server.Anyway, it's a nice joint, worth checking out, but I'd rather go to Griddle Cafe.

Reviews.Author: Sarah K.
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went during 1 PM on a weekday and were promptly seated.   Although this does appear to be a place known for breakfast, we both ordered the hamburger.1. The waitress talked so quietly I had to have her repeat herself numerous times. It's a loud restaurant - speak up, honey!2. I foolishly asked for my burger to be medium rare. I got raw. Aside from the edges, the burger was literally raw meat. I sent it back, and got a very tasty burger back.What I really liked was that the fruit is not just melon and grapes. You get strawberries, blackberries, bananas, etc. The burger (when cooked, hah) was extremely delicious.and their coffee is hella good. Aside from the overly quiet (and not very attentive waitress) and raw burger, I am actually giving this place four stars because the food really is that good.

Reviews.Author: Jin N.
Reviews.Content: Crepe with Girardeli dark chocolate, banana, and candied walnuts-  3.5 star.  I think I coulda used 1 extra cup of chocolate or added some maple syrup, but that's cuz I was probably PMSing or something.Brioche French Toast with peaces, banana and orange caramel sauce - 5 star.  HOLY CRAP.  I took a bite, and apparently I had the expression of someone who was in horror.  I think my facial expressions get misunderstood: I was experiencing 3-different phases of flavors.  First, the orange, then the syrup, then the buttery flavor on the french toast.  I was thrown off guard, and quite confused because it was unexpected.  But, in an orgasmic way. Brockwurst-  3.5 star.  This might be personal preference, cuz I like polska keilbasa, and this sausage was too pure.  Veal, a.k.a. clean and pure.

Reviews.Author: Sara W.
Reviews.Content: Yum. I don't just throw away 5 stars... especially when I've only eaten at a place once and only tried one item on the menu. I usually want to get a little more experience at a place before I review it. However I came here months ago and still remember (and crave!) my delicious Eggwich!I didn't even order it right. It's supposed to come with two eggs over easy, crispy bacon, avocado, tomatoes, lettuce, pesto and mayo... But I got on mine with egg whites and no mayo - which turns it into the quintessential breakfast sandwich IMHO. Yum! And they put it on this ciabatta bread that holds the sandwich together perfectly. Definitely the best breakfast sandwich I've ever had. It sounds so simple, but it's just sooo good.We did have a long wait - but it was Saturday for brunch, so we should have known better. Still, the Eggwich was completely worth it. Next time I go, I know I should try something else on their fabulous looking menu... but I'm 100% positive I'll be craving my 'wich.

Reviews.Author: Ticha B.
Reviews.Content: No hostess this time and we went after the lunch hour on a weekday. We were seated right away.Props once again to the waitress who served us again on my 2nd visit(shorter young lady with the cutest smile and friendly service). She's always friendly and attentive (Sara?). The food is always good here at Blu Jam Cafe' and the coffee is always really good. 5-stars..thanks Mr.Kamil.

Reviews.Author: Rachel S.
Reviews.Content: This place is FANTASTIC for breakfast! I came in at 10am, and really liked the look and feel of the place. Modern but not pretentious, with enough warmth to feel cozy but not coffeeshop-y. I got their Norwegian Benedict (with Lox, on a croissant). It was DELICIOUS, and came with giant roasted potatoes. I washed it down with one of the best chai latte's I've ever had.I wouldn't call this a cheap breakfast place, but everything was worth what I paid, and I'd definitely come back for more.

Reviews.Author: Hannah E.
Reviews.Content: Two words.Salmon. Hash.Despite having two things prominently featured that I normally avoid (tomatoes and olives) this dish is PERFECT.  Just the right amount of perfectly flaky salmon.  Enough capers to add a pickly tang, but not so many that you get sick of capers (there is a very delicate caper balance in life!).  Tomatoes for the fresh sour kick, perfectly poached eggs, lemony rich hollandaise, and red potatoes with skins left on for the extra chewing work needed to get all the taste out of each bite!Even though it's $14 and yeah, I know intellectually that's just crazy, I never feel ripped off after eating this wonderful hash.

Reviews.Author: Sharon H.
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a busy Saturday for brunch with the girls (advice: party size 3-4 max)Free residential parking on N Fuller St. (drive past Blu Jam) or Vista St (the street before Blu Jam). *Directions from UCLA to WeHoThe wait was ridiculous.. up to 30 mins.. but totally worth it..!LOVED the Norwegian Benedict ($14.95) and Crunchy French Toast ($11.95). Cooked to perfection. Nothing to complain about.Service was great, ambiance was completely chill, smiles everywhere. Would definitely return :)  (possibly for dinner as well, the menu looked enticing-- "Cafe by day.. bistro by night")

Reviews.Author: Diana T.
Reviews.Content: Came mid afternoon on a Tuesday...Macchiato is delish...5 starsCoffee was blah...2 starsBenedict overrated...2 stars Hollandaise was weak and odd in color, consistency not smooth and silky. Potatoes were hearty and good. Poached eggs overcooked.Salmon plate overrated....2 starsLooked great but not tasty. Bagel hard and stale, I couldn't cut thru it with a knife! Smoked salmon wasn't of the highest quality. I should have known to venture a couple streets away from Melrose and not wasted my money.

Reviews.Author: Brittany R.
Reviews.Content: This place was so delicious! I came here on a Sunday morning, a little before 10am. The place was packed, but my girlfriend and I only had to wait about 15 minutes. We immediately ordered some coffee drinks, a latte for myself and an iced mocha latte for my friend. They were so delicious! Our mouths were watering watching all the great food being served around us. We decided to split the crunchy cornflake crusted french toast and the eggs florentine.The eggs florentine were great. The egg was perfectly poached and the spinach and mushrooms and brie were all very tasty. BUT I must say the crunchy french toast was really the star. AMAZING. I never ever order french toast (I am more of waffle or pancake person) but my friend said it was awesome here and I trust her. It was the best french toast I've had in my life. It came with a vanilla bean sauce, which was very good, but I swear it doesn't even need to be dipped in anything. The cornflake crust made it light and crispy on the outside and the inside was so satisfying and melted in my mouth. I love how they serve it too - in little slices with fresh strawberries and bananas.Another note - our server was really great.

Reviews.Author: Anna B.
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the Top 5 on my go to breakfast/brunch spot! Everything about this place is wonderful.  The one thing you have to order is their crispy french toast.  It's enough to share w another person.  Let me tell you..its the best french toast I ever had! Besides the french toast, I got the florentine benedict.  It's about up to par for any benedict.  My friend ordered the steak hash and he told me its one the best things he's ever ate. Also try the banana bread beer!!! Tip: Get there early because there is always about a 45 min wait anytime after 9:30 am on a weekend!!! Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Author: Tiffany C.
Reviews.Content: Not gonna lie.. I had high expectations for Blu Jam... high enough to wait 45 min for breakfast/brunch at 2:00pm on a Sunday. We were greeted and seated by nice hostesses and as of then, the experience was pleasant. The meal got progressively worse and worse as the sun started migrating and shining straight at my face. This made it almost unbearable to eat unless I stood up or moved to the very corner of the small 2 person table. Perhaps the reason for my low rating may be because my face  (along with the faces of a few others around me) was progressively getting roasted by the sun..... But in reality, the food was equally just average that it was definitely not worth getting burned in the sun for. We ordered the crispy french toast and the Florentine egg benedict. The french toast was pretty good, very moist, and nice and crunchy at the corners. The one downside that caused me to lose my appetite was seeing dirt on my strawberries.... I dont know whats with these breakfast/brunch cafes (same thing happened at larchmont bungalow).... but I've had pretty dirty strawberries each time I go. This was a turn off and I ended up just leaving half of my french toast there. My friends egg benny was pretty good.. but it was missing something.... (maybe the meat?). The poached egg was nice and runny and the hollandaise sauce was good. One downside was the muffin was a bit soggy by the time I got to it...Overall, the food was just ok... very typical of brunch cafe places. I would probably go to griddle cafe or one of the many cafes nearby instead next time. With that said, I still want to try their dinner/bistro menu..... so I guess I'll be back for that!

Reviews.Author: Eunice J.
Reviews.Content: One star for the service. One star for the French toast. One star for the mocha latte and organic coffee.  I came here with high expectations. I mean with 4 stars and over 1000 reviews on yelp, it must be good, right? I really wanted to like it but I just couldn't. So... Bf and i waited 30 min on a Friday afternoon, which was expected. The organic house coffee and the mocha latte were both pretty dang good.  The house coffee was light in color and flavor, which was perfect for me since I dilute my coffees with hot water anyway.  I got the Florentine eggs Benedict with bacon and he got the Breakfast Trio. I was super famished by the time i got my food, so imagine my disappointment when my poached eggs on the Benedict were completely over cooked.  The yolks were solid and even the hollandaise sauce was dried up over the eggs.  The waitress was pretty nice about it, apologized and brought me out a fresh plate, but it still wasn't that great.  The flavor wasn't bad, but the pieces of the English muffins were so slim that i felt like i was eating just runny eggs.  And by the time i got my corrected order, my bf had already finished his meal.  Also, Blu Jam makes their bacon REALLY crispy, to the point where it shatters when you try to grab it with your fork  So unless you like your bacon in micro pieces, ask for it to be cooked less crispy.  For waiting over half an hour to be seated, "just ok" food, and a $34.00 bill, I would say go elsewhere if you want a good breakfast/brunch.

Reviews.Author: Allie P.
Reviews.Content: I love how they allow dogs to sit outside with you while you eat - its definitely a plus in my book.  I hate how almost every LA eatery (especially for breakfast/brunch) always seems to be PACKED with a huge mob of people standing right in front.  :[  Awkward for those eating outside...  feeling the pressure to order, eat, & move out!Our waiter & hostess were great!  They even brought out a bowl of water for my little Midge.  I ordered the Steak Hash - it was presented in a way I never thought it would (nicely formed into a circle w/ 2 poached eggs on top w/ some I think it was thyme?) - usually hash is kind of everywhere.  I couldn't just order one dish... I mean, did we not just wait about 30-40 mins just to be seated? So, I also had the Shrimp Ceviche Tacos.  Comes in a set of 4 tacos, nicely sized & topped with lots of ceviche packed with flavor - I swear, when I was eating them, it felt like I wasn't in LA, but on a fancy vacay retreat!  Absolutely recommend!!!!!We got lucky with catching a meter spot a few doors down from the restaurant, but don't worry, if you hate circling the blocks, they have valet.  Staff & guests alike were friendly, just an all around nice place for brunch.

Reviews.Author: James S.
Reviews.Content: OK, I was a Blu Jam virgin -- and after all these years how had I never been?On Wednesday, I got taken for an impromptu Birthday brunch. Turns out it was Blue Jam's anniversary the same day! Well, it was all fabulous. The coffee from a local brewer was outstanding, bold but not muddy. And, our gracious server kept it coming. The blueberry pancakes were an instant hit --- about as good as they get, really. Shared that along with a protein scramble which tickled me in all the right places: Tasty, healthy, not too heavy. Eggwhites with some veggies topped with a marinara like sauce. I was frankly unsure if the sauce would bother me --- and it most definitely did the opposite. SO good.At one point I asked for a bit more syrup for the pancakes, and as they brought that, they sneaked in a birthday dessert with lighted candle: The Tres Leches was so good. Incredible, even. I would likely have never ordered it, like EVER. But I'm an instant convert. Light, moist, sweet, and so flavorful. Yum.It can be crowded, but hang in there: we didn't wait long. And now I know that Blu Jam would be worth it even if we had to.

Reviews.Author: Rebecca H.
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I really wanted some yummy poached eggs so i started researching on yelp and ....We came to Blu Jam Cafe around 12:30pm and the wait was 2 hrs ..we figured we walked around a bit, assuming people wouldn't want to wait the 2 hrs - but oh no, they waited alright...!Since majority of the seatings were meant for just 2 people, my sisters and I had to actually wait longer than expected. It was really frustrating to see people that came after us get to be seated before us. Regardless i understood the circumstances and was kind of put at ease with the hostess attitude, she was super bubbly and smiley that you just can't get upset at that! by the time we were seated, i was kind of ready to go.. It took the server another 10 minutes before she finally took our order, its like do you NOT see us with our menu down and looking at you with hunger & irritation in our eyes!! anyways, to start i had the Iced Chai Latte and WOWee...I couldn't stop sipping on it! It was such a dilemma because it was so delicious i wanted drink it but at the same time i didn't want to finish it so fast. i wanted to savor each droplet of the perfect blend of spice and having it ice blended really was perfect on a sunny afternoon.We ordered the Strawberry Burrata and balsamic vinegar on top of a crostini. This bite size goodness was just the perfect amount to make 3 annoyed girls smile. We each had 2 and it was just the right.I also ordered the Florentine Eggs Benedict, consist of spinach, sun dried tomatoes and mushroom with the most perfectly poached eggs ever. The way the yolk oozes out and falls perfectly onto the english muffin was fantastic! it was unanimous, we all really enjoyed our food and was completely worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: Chariya S.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS PLACE!Except for the long wait - but I guess I can occupy myself with window shopping around the ridiculously expensive stores around the area. I've tried:- Blu Jam Benedict: the egg melt into the bacon.. need I say more?- Crunch French Toast: only the perfect kind of sweetness on the french toast! Best french toasts I've ever eaten, but then again I don't eat a lot of french toasts... regardless, two of my friends had to help me eat them because it was a lot of food for one person.- Mocha Latte: $4.50 a cup. By the time I got to drinking the latte, I was already half full with the food. I suggest you don't order it unless you have a really big appetite. I was able to only finish half of the latte. Shame.

Reviews.Author: Marlon T.
Reviews.Content: This place was pretty yummy with great service in an awesome location in Los Angeles.If it's you and someone else and your stomachs aren't food competition worthy, just get 2 things here:1) Kamil's Breakfast2) Crunchy French ToastYou will be satisfied and it will probably be just the right amount of food. If you're still hungry, order more.Breakfast places own--particularly ones like this one in the heart of Melrose Ave.100% recommended place to visit for locals and out-of-towners.

Reviews.Author: Tammy L.
Reviews.Content: came here today with the hubby. it was his first time, my second time. i love this place even though the wait can get really long at times and parking isn't the best. the hostess told us it would be about 45 min wait however, we got our table pretty quickly (about 25-30 min) since a few tables ahead had left. hubby ordered the crunchy french toast and i ordered the migas breakfast dish. the french toast is always amazing especially with the vanilla bean sauce. the migas was somewhat  bland but with a little extra salt & pepper and hot sauce, delish. portions at this place is pretty large, i'm sure we could have just shared a dish and would have been full. i'd def come back to this place. yum!

Reviews.Author: Kiko A.
Reviews.Content: i normally get Brioche French Toast w/ black berry jam, fresh berries and bananas.Its really good.

Reviews.Author: Charlyne A.
Reviews.Content: Very cute cafe. Street parking. Come early, there's a long wait. Good people watching. Celebrity sightings a huge possibility. French toast was sooooooo cute. Crunchy and not too sweet.  Probably one of the best french toasts that I've ever had.  Also had the loxex. It was a big serving but the lox was too salty. I can't believe I'm saying this but I wish there was less lox mixed with my eggs. This are is really cute too. Come for brunch and walk off your meal by walking around the neighborhood.

Reviews.Author: Reina G.
Reviews.Content: With so many great brunch options in LA, we were lured to this one based solely on a Yelp reviewer's promise of water with mint leaves floating in the pitcher. We went on a hot Sunday morning. There was, of course a line: mostly people waiting for  an outside table. Inside is way better and the wait is minimal. The food is fab, especially the egg dishes and hash. The service is fun and friendly, but once you order, expect to wait a LONG, long time. Bring a paper, drink up the free coffee refills, and chill.  We never got our mint-infused water BTW, but by the end of an incredible meal, we really didn't care.

Reviews.Author: Shirls K.
Reviews.Content: Will definitely be back!Service: Attentive and friendly (4 stars).Ambiance: Casual-modern feel due to the white table cloths.  It's hard to hear the good music they had playing in the background due to the crowed atmosphere in a small place.  You can fit about 2 groups of party of 6 inside the restaurant and maybe another group outside. Most of the table set-up seats 2-4 people.  The wait time on average on a Sunday is about 25 minutes.  Food: Brunch is served till 5pm.  Good selection of breakfast plates, salads, burgers, sandwiches/panini and dinner entrees (4 stars).Came for the brunch menu and tried the following:1) Cruchy French Toast ($12) - coated with corn flakes to give that crunch texture and is topped with berries and sliced bananas.  4 stars2) Steak Panini w/ rustic potatoes ($15)- the steak was tender but it was a bit too salty for my taste.  Would order this dish w/o the extra dash of salt. The potatoes were a hit! 3.5 stars.Parking: Valet ($5) or Meter parking.  Some of the meters accept credit cards ($1/hr).

Reviews.Author: Jen L.
Reviews.Content: We were visiting LA for a friend's wedding and got a group together for breakfast before the rehearsal activities. I was definitely excited to try Blu Jam after reading all the rave reviews.Since it was a weekday morning, there was plenty of residential 2-hour parking just around the corner. They don't take reservations for breakfast or lunch, but we beat the brunch rush. When we got there around 9:30, the place was only about half full, but when we left around 11, there was a line out the door. Most places I know won't let you sit until your entire party arrives, but the hostess seated me right away, which was very sweet.We ordered the Roma via Paris, the French Toast, the Breakfast Risotto, and the Eggs Benedict. My favorite was probably my Roma - it reminded me of a ratatouille. The risotto tasted sort of like fried rice, which isn't necessarily a bad thing. The french toast, as raved about, was delicious, but it's on the sweeter side for my taste. So it's definitely something to share if you don't have a huge sweet tooth. My husband and I also have slightly more sensitive tastebuds, so we both noted that the food was too salty for us. But others may disagree.Overall, the experience was very pleasant. The restaurant is clean and well kept; I particularly admired the brick wall and dark furniture that gave the place an arty gallery feel. I wasn't particularly impressed by the food, but it was good enough to warrant a return visit next time I'm in LA!

Reviews.Author: Judy C.
Reviews.Content: After waiting a good 25-30 minutes for a table, I was excited to finally try their eggs Benedict.  I ordered the Blu Jam Benedict -- which was served on a toasted croissant with Black Forest Ham, crispy bacon, hollandaise sauce, and potatoes. My complaints?  The "toasted" croissant was soft and soggy and not flaky at all.  The worst part was the hollandaise sauce, which was heavy on the lemon juice.  It was unpleasantly tart, and left a lingering bitter aftertaste with every bite.  The only thing that saved this dish (and overall experience) was the side of potatoes.  They were cut up in small cubes and sautéd with bits of crispy potato skin.

Reviews.Author: Luchie d.
Reviews.Content: WOW, their brioche french toast that's tossed in cereal is BOMB. The flavor is an intense vanilla but light and oh so crunchy. Their ranchos rancheros was pleasantly tasty as it's more a of a "California fresh style" as they use a pico de gallo salsa instead of a traditional red sauce. : I asked for an over easy egg but got a over medium - you gotta have the yoke with this dish.The hostess did make a boo-boo by scratching our name off the list for an outside table but it was way too hot out. We told her immediately we will wait for an indoor table but notice a lot of parties were getting seated. I questioned our wait and she said "You're next" and rightfully we were. Overall, a great place and will go back again. Great ambiance and menu.

Reviews.Author: Kat T.
Reviews.Content: My coworker may disagree with me but I really enjoyed my brunch at this place. It was tasty!! I had the Hangover Scramble and I think it was quite heavy but the shreddeed beef was delicious. And No, I was not hungover.Being the pigs that we are, we decided to order a third entree to split between the two of us. We like variety. We also like to make the most of our trips and try what we can. We got the Crunchy French Toast and it was soooo good. I like the idea that they used Corn Flakes as part of the batter. It had a nice crisp texture to it and it was lightly sweet and super soft inside of the Brioche bread. The fruit on top was very fresh as well. I think I might have liked this a wee bit more than my scramble.On to trying more brunch places! Yum!!

Reviews.Author: Elaine T.
Reviews.Content: Yay for Sunday brunch at Blu Jam! Was craving some fish until the server mentioned their famous french toast. Sure! Why not? Possibly the best french toast I've had in my life. Who can resist? Dipped in batter and rolled in corn flakes? The french toast was perfect in thickness and made to a crisp. It came with a buttermilk (I think) dip. Perfect accompaniment. The wait wasn't too bad for brunch ~45 minutes.

Reviews.Author: Helen T.
Reviews.Content: Came with my 13 year old daughter on 12/31 around 11:30am.  Waited about 30 mins which was awesome as I expected to wait longer.  First, I've read lots of complaints about having to wait but, at most decent-to-good restaurants, it's par for the course so you just have to suck it up.  Even at not-so-good restaurants, you still have to wait!  In any event, it's not the restaurant's fault.What the restaurant can control is food quality, service and decor:Food=great taste, creative, and nicely presented. We had the crunchy French toast and the risotto carbonara.  My daughters loved the French toast and I really enjoyed the risotto.  The risotto was a bit heavy for my palate but nonetheless delicious (I still ate it all up).Service=super efficient, well mannered.  I wish I remembered our server's name; he was friendly, attentive without being overbearing.Decor=tasteful, love the brick walls and coffee bar.  It's small but cozy- it is what it is.

Reviews.Author: Courtney S.
Reviews.Content: Nothing wrong with this place at all. Solid - the waitstaff is all very friendly. I appreciated that they served us water outside while waiting for our table.I ordered the muscle beach dish, or something like that - with tofu instead of the ground turkey.All of the ingredients were fresh and tasty. The only thing I could say negative is that my dish was swimming in juices, something that really makes you wonder what they were cooking my "healthy" entree in.

Reviews.Author: Allen L.
Reviews.Content: "Eat breakfast like a king, share lunch with your friends & give your dinner to your enemies." So said Camile the chef/owner of Blu Jam as we finished up our family breaky this morning. While my 18 month old daughter gobbled down a *HUGE* bowl of fruit (good fruit, too: blueberries, bananas and strawberries!) my wife powered down the Blu Jam French Toast and I scarfed my Roma via Paris eggs and potatoes. We love breakfast out. We have eaten and dozens of morning bistros, griddles and cafes. This one kicks the ass out of each of them.I say go early, before the shops open and Melrose comes to life when Los Angeles has that sleepy feeling of a city recovering from a helluva night out. Then the parking is easy, there are plenty of seats and the atmosphere is perfect.If BJC ever put out a cookbook I would be first in line to buy it.

Reviews.Author: gretchen s.
Reviews.Content: I am new to the neighborhood and walked by this place with my dog on a Sat AM to find a line running down the block. Figuring it must be good, I took my parents there the following morning for breakfast and we were all very happy with the experience. We got there early enough to miss the rush, which was good. Our server was incredibly friendly and attentive. He kept our coffees full and warm. We all opted for eggs benedict since they are a total pain to make at home. My dad went for the Blu Jam version, which is like the traditional with the addition of a few slices of bacon and is served on a croissant. The entrees came with potatoes, but my mom and I opted for a green salad and fruit salad, respectively. All sides were great. It was nice to get an actual medley of fruit and not just a collection of melon with a couple grapes. Mine had bananas, berries, apples, pineapple and kiwi. The eggs were perfectly poached and sat on a tasty bed of shaved black forest ham. Other patrons were ordering delicious-looking smoothies, which I will have to try next time I dine there. It was a great first breakfast in my new 'hood. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Author: David S.
Reviews.Content: Roma via Paris and the French toast (pretty hyped-up by everyone on Yelp and other reviews) are among my favorites.Service is pretty decent, definitely seem to always be friendly when i stop in for my Sunday.Parking around an be found pretty easily. Tip: Park on the residential side of the block and it will be free and meter-less. The drawback with the Blu Jam is it can be somewhat pricey, I'd say there IS some value to that.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth B.
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite brunch spot in LA. I have probably eaten here about 5 or 6 times, and the food is consistently delicious. It's also walking distance from my house, which is a plus. Love the outdoor seating. Perfect coffee. Even better Creamy Earl Grey tea (the pot is big enough for two!). Tasty menu. And, as I just discovered, they serve wine and beer! Mimosas, yes please!My favorite meals are the vegetable nest with poached egg on top and the veggie panini. I like that you have a choice of sides, and their fruit salad is particularly good and has a nice presentation. This is the perfect place to relax with good food complimented by a bubbly mimosa on a warm and lazy Sunday. I sent my mother here on a Friday morning last May when she was staying with me and I had to go to work. She walked in and discovered one of the regulars, Tom, who has his own "parking spot" at one of the tables. She was immediately charmed by Tom, who eats breakfast there every day, I believe. She also met the owner, Kamil, who was very nice and chatted with her for a bit. She and I went back early on Saturday morning before the rush and had yet another delicious breakfast, and I got to meet Tom and Kamil for myself. If you arrive and there is a wait, you may be tempted to hop across the street to Vienna Cafe. Don't be fooled!! That place doesn't hold a candle to Blu Jam and Kamil's cooking.Cons: Not open late (the thought of what Blu Jam could do for dinner blows my mind), and there is always a wait around lazy brunch time. Well worth it!

Reviews.Author: Barbara H.
Reviews.Content: I may have found my happy place.   Blu Jam Cafe offered a Valentines dinner menu that left me speechless at the end of my meal. (Therefore causing the 4 day hiatus from Yelp reviewing.) Bistro by night is such a simple, but elegantly translated term in which Blu Jam's excellent service will leave you smothered until your last step out of that door. Where to start? How about to be welcomed with the soft and romantic tones of French music. The host and waiters dressed to par for the evening.  Even their walking and serving pace was tuned to the cozy bistro atmosphere.  The plates came in order and our waitress was attentive to servicing our needs.   The water was always filled and there was barely any wait between each course.As soon as we sat down, they served a complimentary treat of Bake Black Truffle Mac and Cheese with crispy bacon, trio of cheeses and chives on top. Thanks Chef Kamil!Then comes the Tuna Tartar sitting atop the avocado and daikon radish, with ginger wasabi vinaigrette and crispy corn tortilla. Just the right combination of Tuna and  avocado to please the taste. My husband decided to try the Jumbo Scallops with lemon-parsley sauce in cauliflower puree and asparagus. (Let's just say, we ordered a second one.)  These large scallops were seared properly on both sides with a clean and light taste unlike those drenched with creams.  It was not salty at all, but did have that complex flavor. I decided on the cheese platter. Not a huge fan of Blue cheese, but this one had a better musky undertone that pairs well with the green apple. The combination that stood out the most was the brie, nuts (walnuts?) and the slices of grapes. This somehow reminded me of the creaminess that I like from condensed milk. (But I'd prefer brie, nuts and grapes over condensed milk anytime from here on.)  This is probably when the food elevated me already, I was just enjoying every sense that the taste can give. So then there's more, the Gnocchi. Oh you gnocchi, why are you so naughty and fluffy on my first bite? Why do you make me imagine a fluffy pillow so soft and gooey? That bite was so good, I can't imagine eating another store bought gnocchi ever, ever again.The only thing that I was disappointed with was the Risotto. The rice was undercook.  (I know my rice.)  But don't get me wrong, the plate was still finished clean. The mushroom was my favorite and perhaps the best way to highlight the dish.   (A little hiccup, but not to fret.)Wow, that was a lot of food already between two people.   But please, the last one is worth the read.  Ever try Filet Mignon with chocolate-chili sauce? Well it's pretty darn good. I know that I have too many questions, but seriously... I had tears of joy after my first bite of this flawlessly textured meat cooked to a perfect touch.  It can be chewed easily and because of that, it makes it possible to enjoy the real layers where the heart of the flavor comes from.   Sigh, is dessert even worth mentioning? I'm feeling full just mentioning all this food again. I'll skip it this time.

Reviews.Author: Marlis T.
Reviews.Content: Amazing french toast.Great service.Comforting ambiance.I've only been here once during my visit to Los Angeles. Pretty much sold!

Reviews.Author: Elisha G.
Reviews.Content: Was not that impressed by this place. My Blu Jam Benedict was fine, but not enough hollandaise to taste, and croissant isn't sturdy enough to handle runny egg yolk so it kinda got soggy. Ham is pretty good, but probably would have preferred more bacon: ham ratio. Still ate the whole thing though. Bf's make-your-own omelette looked good and he said it was too but I didn't get a taste. Breakfast potatoes are BAD. Too overcooked and dry. Would rather have had Ore-Ida's tater tots. Looked over at the table next to us and the crispy french toast looked really good. Will definitely get that next time.

Reviews.Author: Linda T.
Reviews.Content: I originally had Blu Jam Café bookmarked for brunch, but ended up here for dinner instead.  I was a bit disappointed that I didn't make it here for brunch, but I was definitely NOT disappointed with their dinner.  This little "bistro by night" is a total date spot--cute, cozy, and romantic.  For a Saturday night I was surprised that it wasn't a lot busier.  Maybe that's because they're more known for their breakfast, I guess the secret isn't out yet about their dinner... Or maybe it's because all of the cool kids were out partying instead? Ha!    The servings for dinner come in smaller portions and are meant to be shared.  Our server Herman recommended that we get 2-3 options to share between the two of us.  I'm glad that he suggested that because my friend and I tend to order with our eyes instead of our stomachs.  We ordered two hot dishes to share.  Dish #1 was baby back ribs with orange BBQ sauce, caramelized onions, and a dollop of mashed potatoes.  Dish #2 was baked black truffle Mac and cheese, with crispy Niman ranch bacon, trio cheese, and chives.  Our Baby Back Ribs came out first.  Mmmhmm, this was probably the best ribs that I've had in a while.  The meat was so tender that it melted right off the bone!  And the orange BBQ sauce, with the caramelized onions really gave it a good flavor.  The mashed potatoes were pretty tasty too.  We had already devoured our ribs by the time the Mac & cheese came out, but it did not disappoint.  Crispy crunchy bacon in my Mac & cheese?  I think I'm a happy camper.  It was so cheesy, so yummy, and so flavorful!  I only wished that we could have enjoyed it with our ribs, the two items would have complemented each other perfectly.  Overall, the food was great, the service was amazing, and the ambiance was cute, cozy, and romantic.I will definitely come back for dinner, especially since we received a free complimentary bottle of wine for our next dinner visit.... And I can't wait to come back and try their brunch!Blu Jam Café, I'm a fan!

Reviews.Author: Lyna H.
Reviews.Content: Valet or pay for parking. It's your choice.You always have to wait for a table on the weekends but it's def worth the wait. I recommend the crunchy french toast and/or blu jam benedict and the organic coffee (free refills - the waitress was nice enough to give me one for the road)!

Reviews.Author: Loni L.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam Cafe has deliciousssssssssssssssss breakfast foods!! I could eat it it any time of the day, all day! Highly recommend going in the middle of the day (don't worry, they serve breakfast until 5pm!) to avoid a long, long, long wait. Parking here, sucks. Don't even bother or else you will end up grumpy and cranky before you even get to the restaurant. You can valet for $6.I've tried the Migas omlet without tortilla chips and it was a bit too "smoky" for me... actually tasted a bit burnt, so it was a bit overpowering and I did not enjoy it as much.The breakfast quesadilla, however.... That's a totally different story!  It comes with: Grilled chopped chicken breast scrambled with eggs, tomatoes, spinach and cheddar in grilled flour tortilla, topped with avocado, home made salsa and sour cream, served with potatoes... It was superrrrrrrr yummy. My favorite dish (so far) is their Crunchy French Toast. It literally melts in your mouth and the vanilla bean sauce they serve on the side, is NOT super sweet. It pairs so well with the bananas and berries. BEST. FRENCH. TOAST. EVER!Not a big breakfast person? Have no fear!Blu Jam serves soups (def recommend the split pea soup), salads, sandwiches and more! Oh, &  the Chai Tea Latte is something you MUST try. It is absolutely delightful!Are you drooling, yet? :P

Reviews.Author: Efrain G.
Reviews.Content: I love their breakfast and the lunch items are pretty good too. Service, including hosts, has never been great, indifferent at best? But this review is for their French Toast - The Crunch French Toast.Best. French Toast. Eh. Vurr.It's coated with cornflake bits, cut into tiny triangles - it's too much for one person, but I eat it all anyway.If you're going on a weekend, go early, like before 9:30am so as to avoid the mob of American Apparel ambassadors who swarm for breaky-brunch.Blu Jam is good.

Reviews.Author: Eileen Z.
Reviews.Content: Caviar for breakfast. CAVIAR FOR GODDAMN BREAKFAST!!!Russian scramble, you complete me.Haven't had any disappointments here, an every time I'm in L.A. on Melrose type restaurant. I make sure of it.

Reviews.Author: Neel S.
Reviews.Content: Very impressed. The food is very well made and even though the wait was long and the restaurant super busy all our dishes were made with great detail and tasted excellent. The freshly squeezed mixed fruit & vegetable juice was just superb - try it!!

Reviews.Author: Gwen K.
Reviews.Content: Came here the past Sunday with a small wait. Super cute place, very bustling. We even had a celebrity sighting. The staff was super friendly especially our waiter. We ordered the crunchy french toast and steel cut oatmeal. Both were super yummy! You can easily share as we ordered 3 oatmeals and 1 french toast and had leftovers of both, We also had fresh squeezed carrot, apple and ginger juice. Very fresh. I definitely want to come back and sample more of the menu, When we left there was quite a long wait. The earlier here the better!

Reviews.Author: Jack C.
Reviews.Content: came here around 10:30am on a weekday....a short wait later...HAD THE BEST BRUNCH EVER.Had the carbonara risotto...bacon, peas, scallion, - with a rich, creamy risotto.my fiance had the crunchy french toast...and we were both VERY VERY HAPPY :)

Reviews.Author: Linsey S.
Reviews.Content: Stopped in here randomly today with my mom after deciding against the Village Idiot down the street and we were definitely not disappointed.  Service was great, the staff was friendly, and the food was perfect; not to mention the super-awesome Yelp sticker I posted a pic of. I had the veggie wrap with spinach, goat cheese, tomatoes and balsamic dressing (It also came with avocado and red bell peppers, but I can't eat those- don't ask).  My mom had the breakfast hash which consisted on eggs, black forest ham, veggies and toast.  She also had the organic coffee which I stole some sips from and that was absolutely deeeelish!  I'm a SFV girl, but I wish this place were closer because I'd be taking my friends here for weekend yummies all the time!  (And maybe I still will, they'll just have to trek on over with me!)

Reviews.Author: Samantha C.
Reviews.Content: Based on yelp reviews, I expected a fantastic meal, but I was a bit disappointed.  We ordered:Eggs benedict with smoked salmon on a toasted croissant -- for the feast I expected, it was lacking flavor which seems impossible with the amount of butter and artery clogging ingredients in the dish.  Blu toast -- French toast layered with blackberry jam & cream cheese,topped with bananas and powdered sugar -- the server said it was amazing.  It unfortunately did not live up to the hype.  Everything was just okay -- I'm still searching for the best Eggs Benedict in L.A...

Reviews.Author: Caleb B.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam Cafe...Because sometimes you want a damn fine brunch after a 74 minute wait._C$

Reviews.Author: Jonathan M.
Reviews.Content: I've been meaning to write a review of Blue Jam Cafe for a while now as I've been eating there a few months and love this place.First off the restaurant has a really nice, comfy feel to it. I always try and sit at one of the small tables on the comfortable bench so I can face out and watch people. There are some really, really pretty women eating there.  :)Kamil, the owner and his wife Ilana are so friendly and Its one of the reasons I enjoy going there. The staff there is also very friendly and always say hi and chat a bit so the whole place just has a comfortable atmosphere to it.When I go it's almost always fr lunch and there's nothing better that Kamil's Goulash soup. I've had so much of it that I think my blood is half goulash now. I usually get a cup of the soup and a half salad - typically the Caesars with some extra anchovies - yes, they are very generous with those nice, long anchovies.  Yum yum. The Caesar dressing is on the creamy side which I prefer rather that some dressings that are drier.Sometimes I change up and order the soup with a half sandwich. The BLTA and the curry chicken sandwiches are very, very good with the curry chicken standing out for a robust flavor.They put a lot of effort into their coffees too and will spend the time to make a funny whip cream montage on top. Nice touch.The prices are good and for $20 which includes tip you can eat a great lunch with a drink. Parking is so-so but persistence pays off.

Reviews.Author: Vlad P.
Reviews.Content: We went there on a Saturday evening, on January 1st. The place was a bit empty, probably due to the fact that most folks had partied too hard the night before. We got there right when the bistro night started and in spite of us being the only customers it took about half an hour for the food to arrive.The food was tasty but the portions are small since it is expected that you get several dishes per person. We got beef goulash, lamb chops, and a wild mushroom risotto. All were delicious. We also got herbal tea and it comes with refills of hot water.Conclusion: the perfect place to go when you want to have a small sized dinner and if you want to have a bigger dinner order several plates. Each plate ranges from 10 - 16 dollars.

Reviews.Author: George C.
Reviews.Content: I Loved Blu Jam! Went here on a Sunday for lunch, was a bit crowded we waited for about 30 minutes before we were seated. I ended up getting a great scramble with eggs/macaroni noodles/cheese/bacon/and ham! One of the best creations I've ever tasted. Their menu was pretty vast with great amounts of breakfast food. This place was easily Dennys on steroids. I will be back soon...

Reviews.Author: Betty K.
Reviews.Content: Came here for brunch on a Saturday. The wait for 2 was around 20-30 min. We ordered the Crunchy French Toast, Breakfast Quesadilla, Vanilla Latte, and a Cappuccino. Our drinks came out first. We were excited to see what designs would be on them, but my cappuccino turned out to have a big blob that maybe was supposed to look like a heart? And my friend's latte had a funny shaped feather on it. I think next time we'll try to request something.The food came out next. The Crunchy French Toast was a good-sized portion. The toast was covered in corn flakes which gave it the nice crunch and when you dip it in the custard sauce on the side and eat it with the berries, yummmm! Usually french toast gets kind of tiring to eat after a few bites because of the sweetness, but this one was just perfect. The Breakfast Quesadilla was HUGE. It was pretty much a tortilla that was a foot across stuffed with cheese, eggs, spinach, and zucchini, and folded in half. We definitely had plenty of leftovers after this meal.Crunchy French Toast: yelp.com/biz_photos/ki5S…

Reviews.Author: Adeline C.
Reviews.Content: I don't know how they make everything so damn tasty!!My bf and I were in Hollywood for his bday, and decided to check this place out based on the awesome Yelp reviews.  We were not disappointed!I started with a nonfat dirty chai latte, and he had a regular chai latte.  Delish!  It's probably #2 on my list of best chai lattes, and believe me, I drink a lot of these!For our entrees, I had the Florentine benny, and he had the Roma Via Paris scramble.  We both gobbled up every last bite.  The benny had brie in it, which is actually what intrigued me, and let me tell you, it made all the difference!  The benny was so rich and creamy, but not in a bad way.  It complimented the sauteed spinach, mushrooms, and sun-dried tomatoes perfectly.  I highly recommend it.  Oh, and the poached eggs were cooked PERFECTLY.  Honestly, I don't think I've had non-overcooked poached eggs in a loooooong time.  Most places just can't seem to get it right.You know the place is good when even their fruit cup is top-notch.  It wasn't filled with bits of melon that haven't even reached it's ripe-peak; on the contrary, it was filled with delicious sliced strawberries, bananas, and sweet watermelon.  Yum!

Reviews.Author: Mika L.
Reviews.Content: My FAVORITE local brunch spot. I rave about this place to everyone I know on the daily! The breakfast potatoes are seasoned to perfection and the pancakes are so fluffy. They are famous for their blueberry pancakes but the french toast options are SO good too! I usually just get the bendict or simply eggs and pair it with a latte (which are so good as well) ...and the biggest plus is selection of wines and mimosas for those who like to start the party early. The only downside to this place is how tiny it is and the wait is usually pretty long on weekends. Even on weekdays around brunch time, the wait is at least 25 minutes and it is not an in and out type place. So definitely come here when you are not in any kind of rush!!

Reviews.Author: Haily H.
Reviews.Content: Got the Turkey Burger with wild arugula, fresh tomato, caramelized onions and pesto aioli served with a side of crispy red potatoes. DELICIOUS. Absolutely delicious. My sister ordered the vanilla french toast and enjoyed it. . On the pricey side but worth it!

Reviews.Author: Kim H.
Reviews.Content: LOVE this place!! I make a point to stop here every time I'm in LA. The crispy french toast is unbelievably amazing and the bacon is also the best. Great staff, great feel. Thanks to Frankie for the hook up!

Reviews.Author: Ali R.
Reviews.Content: From nyc.  Everything this place has to offer is 5 star.  Ask the waiter for there recommendation and I promise you . You wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Amy Y.
Reviews.Content: Famous crunchy French Toast. Two. Thumbs. Up.California omelette. Two. Thumbs. Up.BBQ chicken sandwich. Two. Thumbs. Up.Service. Two. Thumbs up.Bathroom clean? Two. Thumbs. Up.Wait time? 0. Two. Thumbs. Up.Beautiful day? Yes, should've sat outside.Love the ambiance.Coming back? Oh, for sure.

Reviews.Author: Nancy T.
Reviews.Content: I have absolutely nothing to complain about except, I guess, the parking. However, anyone who eats on Melrose should be prepared to hunt for that elusive 2-hour parking space for at least 5-10 minutes before eating.The cafe is cute, the menu is expansive and the food is fresh and yummy. I ordered a burger (they didn't ask me how I wanted it, but it came back a good medium well-ish, so no qualms) with cheddar and fruit.
