I was expecting your standard honeydew-watermelon-canteloupe trio with 3 grapes, a la Denny's, but I got an artfully prepared mix of grapes, blueberries, cantaloupe, watermelon, bananas and green apples. Score.The burger itself was fresh, savory and huge, on a toasted brioche bun. The menu says "side of mayo" but the mayo was already on when I got it, so beware if you're anti-mayo like I am. The service was extremely quick and friendly, too!

Reviews.Author: Julia L.
Reviews.Content: Food is 4 stars. wait is 1 star.Came here for brunch on Sunday at 2pm. You'd think the wait would be a little better at 2pm, but I still waited for 45 minutes. The lady that takes your name isn't very friendly and doesn't tell you how long she thinks you'll have to wait, which is annoying because at times I thought she forgot about my small party of 2. Up to you if you think its worth it.My friend got the steak hash and I got the country french toast. The steak hash is delicious, but extremely meaty / heavy as expected. The country french toast had corn flakes that were suppose to make it crunch, but it the moisture from the french toast made it just a little bit hard instead of crunchy. The french toast is served with some milky sugary "syrup." The consistency is watery, not thick.I thought my french toast was really good. It was also very big and very sweet (overpoweringly so sometimes). I think its hard to screw up french toast though.i thoroughly enjoyed it. The steak hash had good pieces of steak and egg whites. The steak was cooked well (very tender, so definitely a plus).I ate half of each and I think the flavors were well balanced out (salty and sweet). I hate getting just one of something and having that one flavor overpower my palate.Got their fresh squeezed grapefruit juice. Its not fresh squeezed right there, but the claim they get it from a place that fresh squeezes it...thus it lacks the "fresh squeeze" tangy taste I'm looking for.

Reviews.Author: Madi G.
Reviews.Content: Good food, excellent service, clean restaurant, and wonderful atmosphere. Beautiful outside seating as well.I've been here several times now; it's always a good place to take a friend from out of town.Has healthy options as well as yummy sugary french toast deliciousness.

Reviews.Author: Steven F.
Reviews.Content: This place is great!I carry and share the photos of the coffee drinks we received on our first visit. Incredible. We had dinner during that first visit. All the menu items were fresh, creative and tasty. During a subsequent trip to LA from San Diego, we made it a point to try breakfast.  We weren't  disappointed. The Crunchy French Toast was excellent as was the granola with yogurt and fruit.  This time the coffee was good but not artistic. It was too busy for that. Try them when they are slow for a special coffee experience.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Author: Kelly J.
Reviews.Content: I think I would really give this place a 4.5 if that was an option. Ginormous menu, cute interior, option to have salad with your omelette instead of potatoes and toast (thank you, finally), and honestly anywhere that has THIS big of a menu is just awesome. Omelettes were all really interesting sounding - I ended up going with the shrimp mazatlan, which was DELICIOUS, and what other cafe has a spanish style shrimp omelette on the menu? None. That I'm aware of, anyway...I guess the .5 star off is just for how busy this place apparently is... I've been told never to go on a Saturday or Sunday during peak hours, which as a boring FT 9-6'er is the only time I can go (and I'm not a morning person, so making it in before 10 on a weekend aint gonna happen). I just happened to stop at Blu Jam on a Friday I had off to spend with my parents for Mother's Day, and we went at 8AM, so no wonder it wasn't at all busy. I hate standing in line for breakfast so who knows when I'll be back, but hells yes the food was definitely worth it.

Reviews.Author: SHANT K.
Reviews.Content: Probably one of the best breakfast spots on Melrose. It gets kinda busy on weekends, but so do most decent brunch/breakfast spots in the area. The staff is pretty realistic with the wait times.The coffee is decent and the eggs benedict are a solid choice. The crispy french toast is a must try. Don't think about it, don't pretend to be eating healthy, just order it for the table. Your fat friend will probably scarf down the piece you pretend not to want anyway.

Reviews.Author: Samira M.
Reviews.Content: Extremely overrated. Could barely cut through my english muffin on the eggs benedict. The OMG french toast was just meh. The coffee was terrible. I missed the coffee at Paper and Plastik. I understand you're not a hipster coffee place, but even dives have better coffee. Not worth the wait. Head over to Bloom or some place you'll get in faster. Super disappointing birthday brunch.

Reviews.Author: Tatyana G.
Reviews.Content: The good: I went here for Valentine's Day and had an amazing night. They gave us free soup and allowed everyone to bring wine without a corkage fee. The pepper steak was delicious! We decided to return at least once a month =)The bad: we reserved a specific table and it was not available but that did not ruin our night.

Reviews.Author: Allison C.
Reviews.Content: This is definitely one of my favorite breakfast places. It's so cozy and chill -- perfect for brunch with the girls, whether you end up sitting inside or outside. Love love the olive tapenade they serve with their bread. Staff is always great and super friendly whenever I've gone and prices aren't too bad for the quality of food you get. So fresh! I've always gone for their eggs benedicts but I've tried the scrambles and french toast my friends have gotten before and they've always been awesome. Can't wait to go back and try more of their menu! P.S. When it comes to egg benedicts, I would recommend going for the egg muffin rather than the croissant, since it's a little sturdier of a base.P.P.S. Location is great too and nice if you want to go shopping afterward on Melrose. Look for $9.99 sales!

Reviews.Author: Amy M.
Reviews.Content: Love the brunch here so so much. Three cheers for brunch 7 days a week! Omelettes: good. French toast: great. Wait: not so fun, but expected.Try the omelette specials -- I've never been disappointed!

Reviews.Author: Gabrielle G.
Reviews.Content: This is my new favorite restaurant! Great atmosphere, delicious food. We went on a Monday afternoon around 1:30 or so. No wait, got seated right away. You must try the corn flake french toast served with fresh fruit on top. AMAZING!! Our server was great too.

Reviews.Author: Sarah L.
Reviews.Content: Easy street parking with cute ambiance.The french toast and omlet were really good and not greasy at all.It would be a great place to have a casual breakfast with girlfriends. I'd come here again and have the french toast. YUMM!

Reviews.Author: Patrck C.
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite places to come for breakfast in LA. The main reason is to order Kamil's Breakfast. It seems like one of the most obviously brilliant ideas, and makes me wonder why I've never seen it anywhere else except here. Pan-roasted macaroni scrambled with eggs, smoked bacon, garlic, chives, and cheddar. It the perfect weekend brunch meal for me since it has the morning breakfast eggs in them with the afternoon lunch pasta mixed together. Its a really simple dish. And doesn't make me feel all heavy like after eating some huge omelet. I am usually the kind of guy who likes to order different things each time I visit the same place. But once I had Kamil's Breakfast, I never order anything else at Blu Jam.Its also great to see Kamil there every time walking around and making sure all of his customers are happy and satisfied.

Reviews.Author: Shasta C.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this place.  The food is amazing.  I have been here dozens of times and never ordered anything I didnt like.  The service is good and the owner is usually meandering around, making sure that everything is being taken care of.  I have brought a few people here as well, and most of them leave with this place being their new favorite brunch spot in LA.  Literally, the only downfall to this place is that it seems I am definitely not the only fan, so if you go for brunch at a prime time on the weekends, expect to have to wait for a table.  If there is a wait, I usually just go to Fratellis down the street, which also has great food and is much less crowded.

Reviews.Author: Bob L.
Reviews.Content: Kamil is a jewel. I am an aficionado of good schnitzel, and Kamil's Czech version is true to tradition:  crispy,  moist, not greasy.  Best I've had outside of Vienna.Pepe

Reviews.Author: Thea Y.
Reviews.Content: My friends and I came here on a Saturday morning. Everything we had was soooo good. Blueberry Pancakes, Classic Eggs Benedict, Crunchy French Toast, and something else. Ask the waitresses for 3 top recommendations and she recommended the Crunchy French Toast. Presentation and taste this is a winner.

Reviews.Author: matt g.
Reviews.Content: Breakfast's here are unrivaled -- best in LA hands down.  But everyone already knows that.  Let's talk about the new bistro nights!  The scallops with risotto are by far my favorite.  Best scallops I've ever had and the risotto with a hint of lemon is the perfect pairing.  Also outstanding are the pulled pork sliders with chocolate aioli, and the truffle macaroni and cheese.  But honestly, every entree I have tried so far has been nothing less than superb.  If you have not gone to blujam before or you have been a frequenter of the breakfast (like me), you owe it to your taste buds to go to the bistro nights and enjoy the amazing culinary creations of owner and head chef Kamil.

Reviews.Author: Julian S.
Reviews.Content: On weekends, come stand in line with me for an obscene amount of time waiting for brunch. The Crunchy French Toast (only available Sat. & Sun.) is more than worth the wait.Also worth trying is the Blu Jam Benedict, Florentine Benedict and Toscana Scramble. Crepes are good but not the best I've ever had -- though comparing them to Parisian crepes is hardly fair. Great coffee and mimosas.Not that I drink mimosas... I'm a man.

Reviews.Author: Paul R.
Reviews.Content: Great restaurant all around!  I usually go for breakfast (which is usually very busy, especially on the weekends), but lunch and dinner are almost just as awesome.The regular french toast is the best and the california omelet is to die for!  For non breakfast food, the chicken schnitzel is awesome!  You won't regret trying this place out!

Reviews.Author: Sassy M.
Reviews.Content: So this place got great reviews and everyone at my work was so stoked to try it out. We had an order of FIFTEEN items, and granted we order lunch every day from a multitude of restaurants all over los angeles that have no problem placing an order. When I called up, a rude lady spoke to me saying they could only take 10 orders no matter what. I begged her to let us please place it, or if I could call with an order of ten and an order of 5 which is exactly the same thing and she said no, there was no way they could do that.I find that a very poor way to conduct business and extremely unhelpful. I would recommend not to order from a place that holds themselves like that.

Reviews.Author: Tiff L.
Reviews.Content: this place is delish!!! our server looked like an actor and he was super nice, totally fit the chic & trendy atmosphere... i would say this is a perfect date spot or even a day out catching up with friends!!! ended up getting the CRUNCHY FRENCH TOAST (french toast layered in an egg batter with corn flakes, vanilla some sort of amazing milky syrup thing it comes with, and fresh strawberries, bananas, and blueberries), & the NORWEIGEN  BENEDICT (salmon, spinach, poached egg, hollandaise sauce, potatoes). both to absolutely die for! can't wait to try the next items i already have on my list!

Reviews.Author: Jason C.
Reviews.Content: Another one of my favorite LA brunch spots.Chilaquiles are my favorite on the menu hands down. Benedict is also great. Can't go wrong with this spot.

Reviews.Author: Anna C.
Reviews.Content: Come here every Saturday for brunch and it never lets me down. Everything about Blu Jam is 5 stars. Food is excellent, service is amazing, and the bathrooms are always squeaky clean (which is a major plus in my books). Blu Jam Love Forever....Food: 5 starsService: 5 starsAtmosphere: 5 starsPrice: 5 stars

Reviews.Author: Natalie C.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam Bistro really is as good as it gets. I think the secret's out on Kamil's incredible breakfast selection (that FRENCH TOAST *sigh* it's love), but he's keeping us on our toes because the evening menu is now WeHo's best kept secret. Though not for long I can assure you because once you try it, you'll be craving some of these flavors. Barbecued pork sliders with CHOCOLATE CHIPOTLE sauce?? What? Only one place to get that again...besides my dreams, that is.  The other night my friends and I decided to order an entourage of tapas plates and $3 beers. The boys went crazy over the baked truffle mac'n'cheese but in my personal opinion, the ceviche took the cake. Seriously, try it. The flavor was action-packed. And I'm not even going to mention the brioche/ fresh berries/ vanilla ice cream goodness we had afterward. Talk about ending on a good note...If you've been to Blu Jam for brunch then you know it's a great vibe and friendly staff. Imagine all of that minus the wait plus some good wine and lovely candles on the tables. Scratch that. Quit imagining and go get some ceviche. :)

Reviews.Author: Christine M.
Reviews.Content: YUM!!Tried this out for brunch recently.  We ordered the eggs florentine and the cornflakes french toast.  DE-LICIOUS!  The atmosphere was classy, modern and comfortable.  The service was great - no waiters interrupting your conversation every five seconds trying to speed you along.  The quality of the food/ingredients was evident.  I will definitely be going back!

Reviews.Author: Ryan C.
Reviews.Content: Brunch on Sunday.. well, we started waiting from 11AM and got seated at 12:10.. over 70 minutes.. and the wait was brutal.  So it was more like lunch and brunch.  But my 4 star rating doesn't include the wait since it's really not and should not be a part of the restaurant experience.We have ordered Crunch French Toast, crunch thanks to flakes around the toasts.. and they were great.  Well mixed with fresh fruits and nice vanilla sauce on the side instead of common syrup..Also Steak and Eggs.. well well well.. the steak was one of the best i have ever had.  And I am a big steak eater.  Great meat and perfectly cooked to medium rare.Service was adequate and professional especially given how busy they were.We probably won't go back there on the weekends, the wait is horrible, but we will DEFINITELY go back on weekdays sometime very soon.Highly recommended for 2.  Never for 4.  The wait will be even worse.

Reviews.Author: Maribeth H.
Reviews.Content: Love this place and today realized - I never wrote a review!it's yum yum yum yum yum and the food is always great. Line/wait gets long, best to go early. Worth waiting. Wait staff is friendly and quick.crunchy french toast here is the evil nemesis of my thighs. especially with that delicious vanilla sauce. Good lattes.My husband (the self proclaimed eggs benedict connoisseur) has dubbed their benedicts 'The #1 best eggs benedict ever had in my life' perfectly poached and delicious.There's a reason this place has 1300+ reviews. When it's good, it's good.

Reviews.Author: Aska N.
Reviews.Content: I just LOVE this place. Not so much the line, but luckily for us, we live close by to dodge it and deal with 15 min wait on average (try to avoid weekends and go early on weekdays). My favorite is the Eggs Florentine (vegetarian Eggs Benedict) with the potatoes. I ALWAYS order this when I go there since they make it perfectly each and every time. I usually share one each with my boyfriend and then we order another dish to share. Their breakfast risottos are amazing, as well as their mushroom salads, which is our favorite as well. The crispy french toast is incredible as well, and I've tried their other main dishes as well for lunch. It's a neighborhood eatery for us. We love the owner Kamil and the rest of the Blu Jam staff who are all friendly and super pleasant. Can't wait to try the new monthly special dinner soon!

Reviews.Author: Aliza R.
Reviews.Content: Best French toast if my life!!! // crunchy French toast is sooo good it will make you a customer for life!  Great vibe & music!! Alex was a great waiter!!! Thank you thank you will be back soon!

Reviews.Author: kendra t.
Reviews.Content: This place rocks! All of their ingredients are fresh and they have a killer breakfast menu. Yesterday, they had crab cake egg benedict.  The owner even waits on tables and always asks people how they are doing. The staff is always super friendly and attentive. And they have mint lemon water....mmmm,....mint.Their split pea soup is amazing, and vegan. And every time i go there i have to get a side of their potato salad.  They also offer 5.99 breakfast before 10:30 on the weekdays...the weekends are always packed so you should check it out during the week  so you don't have to wait. It is a small space so tables are limited....i always try something new each time, and i am always super impressed!

Reviews.Author: Ming-Jou C.
Reviews.Content: Today (Memorial Day) was the perfect day to drive up to this area for breakfast. It only took 30 minutes from Torrance. Parking at a meter was not a problem and the place wasn't empty, but it wasn't crowded when we got there at 10:30. We were seated right away. There's plenty of indoor seating and some seats outside, although definitely not as many as Toast. Monday - Friday any breakfast is $7.95, but today didn't count since it was a holiday. No big deal since most things were right around the $10 range. Mom got a cup of coffee, I ordered a mocha and both were brought right away. Mom wanted the traditional bfast with two eggs, pancakes and they let us sub ham (you normally get a choice of bacon or sausage, neither of which she likes), and that was $8.50. I got the breakfast that's at the bottom of the bfast menu that came with two eggs, choice of bacon or sausage (bacon of course, duh) and for the French toast, they let me sub the Blu Toast which comes with berries, blueberry jam and cream cheese ($10.00). I got about half a sandwich, cut into two triangles and my bacon was perfect. I don't know if I got a smaller portion because I subbed, and if you get a normal square if you just got the stock French toast. It was the perfect size for me though, and since there was excess cream cheese and blueberry jam goodness everywhere, I gave some to mom for her pancakes. She thought it was really good, which you know, for a Chinese mom is like Simon saying he thinks someone is a good singer. Great experience and food. Will definitely come back to try lunch. The only thing I didn't like was that where I sat (when you enter there's bench seating along the wall and it's parternered up with chairs. I was on the aisle side and people kept bumping me as they walked by or drove their strollers. They need just a skosh more room there, so it's like not *bump* *bump* *excuse me* *sorry* *oops* as you're trying to eat. Other than that, it was great. Service was good and the staff was really friendly. We walked around on Melrose afterwards.30 minutes for each quarter at the meters. 2 hour limit I think.

Reviews.Author: Ken G.
Reviews.Content: After all the positive reviews, I thought this place would be really good...instead I found it to be okay.I went with a few friends and was able to sample 4 different dishes.-Breakfast Burrito - this was okay - it was a bit dry for my taste, although it did have some decent flavor.-Brioche French Toast (with Peaches, Berries and Orange Caramel) - Pretty disappointing...it sounds good, but really lacked the rich flavor one would expect from brioche and caramel on the same plate....also, the caramel wasn't really caramel, it was more of just an orange-based syrup.-Breakfast Quesadilla - Pretty tasty...flavorful grilled chicken with eggs, veggies and a decent dose of cheese...definitely the best thing on the table.-Breakfast deal - A typical eggs, pancakes, sausage, potatoes plate - it looked great, but in the end was just okay.The great thing about LA is that it's a big city with lots of options - the next time I'm there, I'll try a different place since it's always good to try new things.

Reviews.Author: Derick N.
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to try this place on a nice sunny day, which of course means "let's go sit on the outside patio and just enjoy Melrose for what it is." Totally loved the patio area.There were so many things I wanted to try at this place! I know everyone seems to be raving about the French Toast, but I was craving eggs benedict for some reason. That didn't really narrow anything down since there were four different ones to choose from!I ended up going with the Florentine Benedict, which came out to be really good! I definitely liked what the sun-dried tomatoes brought to the plate. The side of potatoes were also wonderfully seasoned and delicious.My friend had ordered the Brunch Burger... which was HUGE! Definitely would not have been able to finish that entire thing in one meal. It was really good too! Eggs in a burger? Yep, totally what brunch is all about.AND all this breakfast food is served... ALL DAY!! I will be back! And I swear I'll try the french toast next time!

Reviews.Author: Chrystal Z.
Reviews.Content: Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day (when I can wake up for it). In locations that I visit, I ALWAYS scout out the best place to eat breakfast. You start your day with this meal, so start off incredible!More specifically, benedicts are my favorite breakfast entree. I am so in love with the way that the sauce and the veggies and the meat (if there is any) and the consistency of the egg yolk all meld together to create the most tastegasmic experience ever.Florentine Benedict... MINDBLOWING. I don't think I have ever seen such a perfectly poached egg. The egg yolk was at that perfect point in time where it was suspended between liquid and solid. Just runny enough to mix well with the English muffin and the sauce, and just solid enough for me to differentiate it from the sauce... which made it INCREDIBLE because I could literally taste every part of the meal.Uggghhhhh... I salivate thinking about this meal. It's 1:38 AM and it's near-illegal for my female self to be thinking about food right now but fuck that, I'd be down for a Florentine Benedict right now.

Reviews.Author: Kylah G.
Reviews.Content: First time here Saturday 9/15, made my visit in a pinch after yelping from my android on the go to satisfy my grumbling tummy and i'm happy i did. The service was simply amazing, the staff is great and they like their jobs. The wait was about 20-25 min and it was pretty hot but they had their waiting chairs in the shade with lots of cool ice water with mint out for waiting patrons. I had the breakfast cabonara, the poached egg was cooked exactly as i requested with no run in the yoke!!! the dish was a little toooo rich for me and i only ate aboout 1/4 of it, but the iced tea was amazing, toast and jam delish, my companion had the steak hash and really enjoyed it the only complaint was that there was little steak (i felt the same with the bacon in my dish, just not enough of it). Every table had atleast one person with the famous french toast and i'm still kicking myself for not ordering it but i plan on coming back soon to try that. i abso loved the fact that you can get breakfast or lunch all day because i'm not big on breakfast food other things i'll be back to try are the salads and the grilled cheese with goat cheese and bacon. I'm a huge believer that no place should call themselves a cafe without a full on espresso bar and this place hit the nail on the head with that i even got an iced coffee for the road! once again i'll be back.

Reviews.Author: Ming C.
Reviews.Content: Decent menu. Not expensive. But I don't know, it lacks something. For some reason, it's not a place I think of wanting to come back often. I guess there's nothing outstanding about this place. Another place worth a try if you just want to switch up your brunch place...

Reviews.Author: Jeena L.
Reviews.Content: Everyone raves about the breakfast at Blu Jam. It's supposed to be the best in LA.Well I can't tell you about the breakfast because I came here for dinner. My friends and I came here on a recon mission for a trip we were taking to the Czech Republic.Apparently, the owner of the Blu Jam Café is Czech, and he occasionally has these Bistro Nights where they offer a special menu of cuisine from around the world, including his motherland.We ordered a sampling of everything -- two of my friends lived in CZ for two years, so they told us which foods were the most typically Czech.Everything was delicious -- the gnocchi were crisp on the outside and chewy on the inside. The meats and gravies were all perfectly seasoned. And, according to my friends, every dish was true to its Czech roots.I love the Blu Jam Café, not only for their commitment to good food, but also for bringing cuisine from around the world to we lazy gastronomes here in LA. :)Kamile -- if you're reading this, PLEASE have another Czech Night soon!!!

Reviews.Author: Stephanie W.
Reviews.Content: This is a great find!!! Thanks to Denita, a group of us enjoyed a delicious brunch and good conversation on a Saturday morning. My day started with the frothiest cappuccino I have ever seen. The soft, cloudy froth was piled high with absolute perfection. Take your time checking out the menu as there are many, many tasty sounding dishes. The gourmet benedict with smoked salmon on a toasty croissant has to be one of the best benedicts I've had in L.A. Other dishes around the table ranged from the stuffed french toast to pancakes to scrambles to the crab cake benedict. A great place to relax and catch up with new and old friends. Everyone agreed that this cute, crowded spot deserves a return visit.

Reviews.Author: John O.
Reviews.Content: Been here twice, once about 2 years ago, most recently this past weekend. First time got the Eggs Benedict, which was ridiculously good. Second time around got the Hangover Hash...wasn't as good needed more cheese), but I wasn't hung over at the time so maybe I'm doing it wrong.One a side note, we saw Zach Braff there though, so plus points for Blu Jam.

Reviews.Author: Karli S.
Reviews.Content: So here's what happened: my roommate raved about this place for breakfast, I came I waited I ate, then I reviewed and called their breakfast average, then I decided to give it another shot with the dinner menu, and I'm still gonna stick with my 3 stars (althought if I could give it 3.5, I would).Like a house being renovated, lemme break it down:Brussels sprouts - 5 stars, but I love BS, so it's hard not to win me over hereAhi Tuna tartare - 4.5 stars, really delishScallops - 4 stars, and I hate scallops so this is bigAsparagus w/ egg - 3 stars, plainMac and cheese - 3 stars, if you're gonna serve something that sounds amazing, it should be amazingBurrata - 3 stars, plain againI don't remember what else we had, but like a snuggie, I'm gonna wrap it up by saying that I think Blu Jam is just fine.  Like Yelp says about 3 stars, it's A-ok.  If Blu Jam was a girl, I think her name would be something like Jane: simple, sweet, just fine, plain, a-ok, Jane.

Reviews.Author: Thad C.
Reviews.Content: OK the wait sucks, the parking sucks and the people that are waiting next to you suck.  I won't lie about that.  It's packed, the seating is tight and this place is popular as hell.  BUT! it's got a comfortable feel to it.Back to my point.  There are only two things that my buddy and I repeatedly come here for:1. The Crunchy French Toast.2. The Omelets.That's it.  Don't waste your time on anything else.  To those that live around the place, do what we do.  Wake up, call in, dress lightly, pick up, undress quickly and eat.  Best weekend breakfast a man can ask for.  Crunchy french toast with an omelet in the comfort of your living room with Saturday morning TV, yeppppp that's the good life!

Reviews.Author: Christiana R.
Reviews.Content: A few weeks back my BFF, her husband and her mom headed to Blu Jam after spending a long morning moving.  We arrived on a Sunday afternoon around 3pm and didn't expect a very long wait.  Lucky for us there weren't many people ahead of us and were told about 10-15 mins.  Well, we waited, and waited and saw parties of 2 arriving after us and being seated.  I get it.  They have their "big" tables and "small tables.  After waiting about 20 minutes we realized that there were 2 parties of two who left simultaneously therefore leaving a potential table for the 4 of us.  Did I mention my friend was pregnant and none of us had eaten all day?  I may have been a bit cranky when I requested to Doug, the host to seat our party there.  I'm sure he got annoyed at me, but still honored our request, much to our delight (This is why I gave the 5 stars vs 4).The Florentine Benedict may very well be my favorite breakfast item on the planet (other than Mama's French Toast at The Griddle).  It's well worth the wait and I have been craving it ever since.If you decide to drop by (which you should!), be prepared to wait...but know that it's well worth the wait.Thanks Doug for dealing with our waited-to-long-to-eat-crankiness.  We'll be back again soon.

Reviews.Author: Emily R.
Reviews.Content: This may sound ridiculous to locals as the place is apparently quite popular, but to me, Blu Jam is another stumbled-upon amazing win in Los Angeles.  While shopping on Melrose, we wanted to grab a bite to eat and came across Blu Jam.  I heard it's packed for brunch on weekends, but as we arrived around 3:30, we were able to get a table outside right away.I'm not usually moved by wraps, sandwiches, and salads, but this place was truly exceptional.  So much fresh avocado, wide variety, and breakfast served all day.  The southwestern wrap isn't your typical wrap, as the tortilla itself is crispy, like a quesadilla, but filled like a typical wrap with cheese, lettuce, fresh tomatoes, chicken and black beans.  The Cobb salad is big & finely chopped, and the raw tuna sandwich is fresh, healthy(ish) and filling.  At other tables, everything else looked fantastic too.My only complaint was the overly chatty and seemingly high waiter, but it definitely wasn't a deal-breaker.  Just a very outgoing guy,  If you're shopping on Melrose, definitely make it a priority to stop at Blu Jam with friends.

Reviews.Author: Ruby K.
Reviews.Content: All I have to say is WOW. I had ordered their famous crunchy French toast and it was amazing. Crunchy on the outside and mouth-watering soft on the inside. The portions were generous as well. Their mimosas were tasty and strong but it was $9 for a little tiny glass. Not worth it! The only problem is the parking and wait time. Parking is on the street, and plus it's Melrose Ave. Need I say more? Also anticipate a long wait for a table when you arrive. I had breakfast there on saturday morning at 11am and our wait time was half an hour. Not bad compared to 45 minutes that i had read from other yelpers, but still not ideal.

Reviews.Author: Dean N.
Reviews.Content: If you want to dine for Sunday brunch, prepare to wait.....and wait....and wait.  I don't mind waiting to eat brunch but the wait time here is insane.  When I came here, they told me my wait time was 25 minutes or so.  I think I waited a little more than 40 minutes.  Not to mention the additional stress of parking on Melrose which sucks with its 2 hour time limit.Enough about my bitching about the wait time.  The food at Blu Jame Cafe is good.  I will give them 3 stars for the food and service.  Once you are seated, the service is very fast.  They take your  order and serve you your order within minutes. The food here is very good.  I was quite surprised by this.  Maybe I was jaded by the wait time, or the heat from the sun, or whatever.  I ordered the Norwegian Benedict and it was yummy.  The prices here are relatively inexpensive so you won't break your bank coming here.I think I would like to try Blu Jame Cafe for dinner.  To be continued.

Reviews.Author: Jacquee P.
Reviews.Content: I came here the morning after Bar Marmont and saw the lovely Donna AGAIN! We got the party table in the back. On the way in, we got high 5s and woo's from the Regulars! LOL. Kamil's mac and egg breakfast bowl - perfectAnything eggs benedictAnything with a side of potatoesCrunchy French TOAST! MMMMmmm like the BK french toast sticks but better.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer B.
Reviews.Content: Trekked out here in the pouring rain, and it was well worth it.My friends and I split the Crunchy French Toast and it totally lived up to the hype. Who knew that corn flakes could pack such a punch when paired with battered toast? Well, Blu Jam knew, I guess. The vanilla bean sauce and pure maple syrup complemented the breakfast just right.  Obviously, we also got our own meals, and I ordered the Florentine Benedcit, sans sun-dried tomatoes - the eggs and hollandaise sauce were cooked perfectly and tasted fabulous.My soy latte was served piping hot - I love that. They also wrote "soy" in the foam. Details, folks.The wait wasn't so bad on a Sunday morning, which was surprising. I will definitely be back here.

Reviews.Author: Michelle K.
Reviews.Content: This place is delicious!!!!I came here after a hike at Griffith and was STARVING!!!! There was a little bit of a wait but boy was it worth it.I had the quesadilla which was delicious and he had eggs benedict and we shared the french toast. Everything was SO delicious!! We definitely had a food coma afterwards.  LOVE that they have fresh orange juice - a FAVE.

Reviews.Author: Sheree Y.
Reviews.Content: I have been dying to try this place and I finally had the time to try it this past Memorial day weekend! My sister and my friends have been telling me how AMAZING the crunch french toast is, and knowing me, i LOVE french toast! It's one of my favorite breakfast plates, so I definitely know good from bad! And let me tell you, the french toast from Blu Jam is on the top of my list! It's not too sweet and crunchy with vanilla bean sauce and melts right in your mouth! MMMMM I can still taste it!My BF had got the steak hash, and OMG, PERFECT EVERYTHING! It had mushrooms, onions, poached eggs, spinach, potatoes, and steak...everything you need for a hearty breakfast! And it was the right amount of everything, the portion was perfect! We also got a side of crunch red potatoes and it was perfect on top of everything we ordered! We can't have breakfast without potatoes! The wait was about an hour, but we got there before 1pm, which wasn't bad at all. Service is great and I'm definitely coming back for more!

Reviews.Author: Giulianna N.
Reviews.Content: I did it again.... I came back to this rockin place because I was craving the blu jam egg Benedict!!! My hubby and I brought my mom, who had never eaten here before.. That was our excuse! My egg Benedict was super delicious and super creamy and of course I ordered a crunchy French toast that we all shared! Nothin short of delicious!!! I LOVE this place!!!

Reviews.Author: Pauline N.
Reviews.Content: The parking was easy (we parked on the street). The cafe also has valet parking for $6.00. When we arrived at 10:30am there were already a line, so we waited for 20 mins. By the time we leave at 11:45am the line was brutal. The wait for the food was real long, the service was good though (friendly, attentive, etc.) I had the smoked salmon benedict.. Yum! The poached eggs were just right, the muffins were crispy on the outside and soft in the middle, the smoke salmon tasted good, spinach was a bit astringent (but I'm ok with that), and the sauce with a hint of dill was tasty. Friend #1 ordered the risotto, I tried some, very tasty as well. Friend #2 ordered the steak harsh, it was tasty, but he said the taste is a bit too strong and salty--blue cheese, guacamole, etc--for morning. He ended up eating half of my and the other friend's plate. We all had the cappuccino, very nice. Mine was nonfat and decaf, yet still tasted very smooth and aromatic.  I will come back again for sure.

Reviews.Author: Ray K.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely "stuff your face til it hurts" quality food here. Went on a Wednesday morning, place was a-buzzin but not too crowded. I recommend going on weekdays if you can because I drove past this place on Saturday and Sunday and the wait outside looked beastly. Had the muscle beach omellete and that was hella good. GF had some sorta sandwich and that was great too. Fresh squeezed OJ, bill came out to $30 bucks. interior looks great, i recommend sitting inside one of the corner booths if you can as it's very cozy indoors and I liked the high ceilings. Wait staff was very friendly, very attentive to our needs, I think I saw someone famous there but I didn't recognize him.No nonsense, good food. Like Katie B. says "best breakfast in the world." I'm gonna have to agree there. (Of course the Griddle is very close)

Reviews.Author: Chase W.
Reviews.Content: CRUNCHY FRENCH TOAST! Holy crap. The portion is big enough for two and it's amazing. The syrup is decent, but nothing special. The vanilla sauce is addicting and we drank what remained after meal! I don't even like corn flakes, but apparently I do when it's on French toast! So good.

Reviews.Author: Catherine K.
Reviews.Content: This is really a 3.5 star review, and not because the food was bad, it was very good.  The missing stars are due to parking being a pain in the ass on Melrose pretty much all the time, and because the service was less than stellar.   When we arrived this Sunday mid morning, we didn't have to wait long which was a plus, we were starving.  Once we were seated, our waitress took our drink orders, but then took forever to bring them out.  Then, before she had even brought us water, she asked if we had decided on anything else to drink.  I got a Sprite, but where was our water?  Then, she didn't take our orders (even though we were ready) until after someone finally brought out our drinks.  When we asked for our check (after having to flag our waitress down twice,) she brought us the wrong one.  I'd probably go back because the food was nice, but it was a bit of a disappointment as far as service.

Reviews.Author: Miss P.
Reviews.Content: Obscenely delicious pancakes!!..and their egg sandwich with bacon and avocado makes me want to cry.The wait staff is kind.Expensive for what it is, but the food is really good!  The coffee however is not very good, so don't order it.

Reviews.Author: Laura T.
Reviews.Content: This was my first time trying this place out, my coworker, Jen, found this place on Yelp. From the looks of their reviews we decided to give this place a try. I had their Brioche French Toast with blackberry jam, vanilla yogurt, fresh berries & bananas, it was for $10.95. I loved how fresh the fruits were, just the idea of fresh fruits with toast in the morning makes my day. In between the toast, there was vanilla yogurt and blackberry jam, it was delicious! Even though, we has take out, my order was still warm. It was very filling, i ate only 2/3 of it. Had to save the rest for later. One thing I didn't like was after eating it for awhile, its a bit too sweet, even without the maple syrup. i will definitely go back to this place, hopefully the next time I go, I get to  dine in.

Reviews.Author: Momo O.
Reviews.Content: Came here for brunch! The waitress told my friend and I about the special this morning -- which was a risotto with asparagus, figs, bacon topped with poached eggs.. Sounded super scrumptious, and when I'm at a new restaurant and overwhelmed by the menu, I go with what's recommended so we both went with the risotto.IT WAS DELICIOUS!& super filling! I wasn't expecting risotto for brunch, but it was great. The portion was pretty large, savory, and i enjoyed every bit of my meal. I'm definitely back for that or to try some of the other stuff on the menu!

Reviews.Author: Maxine H.
Reviews.Content: Went on a Saturday morning before going to Madame Tussauds. There were a lot of people waiting, but we got a table within 15 minutes :] I ordered the muscle beach? I think that's what it was called :p Either way it was delicious. The organic tea that accompanied my meal was superb as well. Service was impeccable. Although they did forget our silverware they were very apologetic.I'm looking forward to coming by again and trying the brioche french toast..YUMM!!

Reviews.Author: Alan W.
Reviews.Content: I came here for a quick Saturday brunch, the place was pretty full, a good 20-25 minutes wait for a table for two.  We got seated on the outside patio, great since it was nice weather.All the food looked really good, as I was people watching during my wait.  Some person got the seared tuna sandwich, which was good, but nothing special 3/5.My friend got some bunch burger, which was massive, it had bacon, cheese, eggs, brioche bread, probably a heart attack but he said it was bomb.We shared some strawberry crepes as well, extremely delicious as well, splitting 3 entrees between 2 people might've been a mistake, we were soo full after wards.The service was great and attentive, they even have little doggy water bowls if you bring your dog, nice perk!We found street parking a ways up one of the streets, they also have valet parking available right in front.Will definitely come here again! Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Author: Lisa C.
Reviews.Content: Ahhhhh Blu Jam Cafe'.... How I adore you. This has rapidly become one of my fav spots.  Came here with 6 of my of my cousins on a Sat morning and was seated within 25 mins even though there were people spilling out the spot.  They were very accommodating and our server was spectacular.The food.... Where do I start?  Wait the mimosas of course! Divine, divine, and did I say divine?  Between the seven of us, we may have ordered the entire menu. We are skinny fat as my cousin would say. Anyhoo... I had the crunchy French toast.  Damn that is so good, I can't begin to describe.  One of my nieces had the salmon scramble, pure happiness in your mouth!  I can't tell ya enough, this joint is the business!!!!My cousin had the Norwegian eggs Benedict, and that was gone within seconds of it arriving.  To top off an amaaaazzzziiinnggg brunch, we got complementary lemon crepes.  My tummy had hit Plato, but I couldn't refuse it. Yep, I ate it!!' I'm greedy, yes I am,Can't wait to go back.... Smooches y'all!

Reviews.Author: Mythi N.
Reviews.Content: While the pictures on yelp looked appetizing, the actual food was a bit bland and disappointing. No latte art visible at any tables or bar.... Mimosa serving was tiny....Bathroom didn't have a lock?????????!!!!!!!!Don't think I'll come back.

Reviews.Author: Andrew H.
Reviews.Content: I came here with my girlfriend for a Monday brunch and we were not disappointed. It was about an hour wait for our table, but we didn't mind; we just walked around and checked out the surrounding stores. We finally sat down and we ordered the Blu Jam Benedict, lobster bisque, and Crunchy French Toast. Lobster bisque: Best I've ever had. The flavors were beyond spot on. It's like, they fed their lobster crack... and then they added crack to the soup. It's so good, HOWEVER...... it was the "soup of the day" therefore, you'll never know when they'll make it. Crunchy French Toast: This was pretty good. It's definitely unique compared to the others I've had. Slightly crossing the line towards the "too sweet" side but it wasn't overkill. Blu Jam Benedict: So... I've never had an Eggs Benedict prior to this... but since I had this dish... NO OTHER Eggs Benedict has even come's close to this one. The English muffin was great, ham was awesome, the poached egg was perfect, and their hollandaise sauce was so so SO good; so much flavor!The service here is great. The waiters/waitresses are very attentive and the owner even walks around to see if you need anything!Definitely one of the top places for me to grab brunch. I would have given this place 5 stars... but the last time I came here disappointed me. The Food wasn't that great compared to my first visit, but that's not going to kill it for me.

Reviews.Author: Jessica C.
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite breakfast ever. Amazing food. Cute ambiance. Good brunch. Chilaquiles are to die for. My only complaint is that there was a waitress there that was wearing a black loose tank top and a bright pink bra. This could be motivation for other people to go here but I don't need to see a strip show when I'm eating breakfast. Waitress, I'm sure your good at your job but wear a shirt that covers your chest. And manager- how could you let her serve and represent your business like that. I know you're on melrose but try to get dressed before going into work. You guys aren't Spearmint Rhino -step your game up.

Reviews.Author: Windy C.
Reviews.Content: Have you ever wanted to eat a piece of french toast that is made out of BRIOCHE, then dipped in a vanilla batter and coated with CORN FLAKES?? How about some VANILLA BEAN SAUCE to dip it in?? Well if you, do this is the place to go!  I would srsly give up sex for this french toast, okay maybe not, but it comes pretty damn close!! GO HERE, you will not regret it!  nomnomnomnom  almost forgot, Sat am about an hour wait...totally worth it!!

Reviews.Author: Cat T.
Reviews.Content: Nice little lunch spot... Seems like it would also be a good breakfast spot.I've tried the southwest chicken wrap with bacon, black beans, chipotle and ranch... It was very satisfying... and although the menu said cheddar... I could have sworn it was monterey jack... either way... I love cheese... mmm... cheese... and with most wraps I can get disappointed by the 2 shreds of cheese I get but this wrap had a very good ratio of chicken to beans to lettuce to cheese to sauce ratio...

Reviews.Author: John B.
Reviews.Content: I expected much better food based on the reviews.  perhaps breakfast is their schtick.I had a burger which was fairly good.  though it was served with breakfast style sauteed potatoes.  they were good.  they are not french fries.my companion had salmon and salad.  the salmon was dry and over-cooked.they have no wine.it so full of 'emo style' hipsters i almost wanted to try tossing a potato cube through the gaping dilated hole in the ear lobe of one of the emo dudes.

Reviews.Author: Shana M.
Reviews.Content: Ahhhh, Blu Jam, how I love thee.Weekends are BUSY so get there early. Kamil, the owner, is ALWAYS on the floor, very hands on, he knows ALL the neighborhood regulars, & is super attentive.The olive tapenade they set on the table w/a basket of bread is soooo friggin good, I end up eating 3 (literally) with a fork before & during my meal! heheI dont eat eggs or meat, so the "wrap on fire" w/tofu is my faaaave meal there..I'm kind of a creature of habit so I get it, umm, well, everytime. The split pea  soup is uber yummy as well. By next month they should have their liquor license...mimosas anyone??? They have weekly specials in addition to the menu--which are usually some type of ethnic theme... If you're lucky, & Kamil knows you're a "newbie" he might bring you some complimentary lemon crepes--they literally melt in your mouth & are just sweet enough :) ::bites lip:::Still havent made it across the street to try out Vienna Cafe, because when Blu Jam is in sight...well, theres no comparing......

Reviews.Author: Vivian C.
Reviews.Content: My favorite breakfast place had always been Mani's...mmmm. Don't get me wrong, Mani's is still darn amazing, but I have discovered another piece of heaven. Blu Jam has breakfast all day, and trust me, you'll be thankful for that. Their Eggs Benedict is absolutely amazinggg - the Norwegian in particular! Had their french toast also the other day, was smothered with love and sugar and of course syrup and powdered sugar. Soft and fluffy, it was like biting into a pillow of goodness.Would recommend coming here any day, every day!

Reviews.Author: Gerard R.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam was recommended to me as possibly the best breakfast place in LA and I have to agree. Whenever I eat out, I don't like to get anything that I could make myself. Since I can make a great omelet myself, I usually pass up their delicious offerings and go for variations on Eggs Benedict, which is difficult to make. In the 4 times I've been here, I've had the Norwegian Benedict with smoked salmon, the Blu Jam Benedict with bacon and Black Forest ham, and the Eggs Florentine twice. They are all amazing. I don't know how they do it, but the poached eggs are the consistency of whipped cream. As a side, you can choose between a generous portion of fried potatoes or a fruit salad that includes some premium fruit. Bottomless cups of coffee are great and even the water is like an herbed sun tea. Love this place!One tip: the later you get here, the longer the line gets.

Reviews.Author: Latef X.
Reviews.Content: There was a 30 minute wait but well worth it!  Nice patio seating, albeit a bit crowded.Food was very good.  Vegetarian sandwich was super flavorful and delish.  Turkey or Chicken burger was also very good.  Chai tea latte was one of the best I've ever had.Service was prompt and professional.  And wow, how is every server in LA just beautiful -- even the older ones still look pretty.

Reviews.Author: Nicole G.
Reviews.Content: Sunday brunch can be a bit of a wait, as with any popular brunch spot. There was about half an hour wait for 2, which isn't horrible, but I was told it would be an hour for a take out order. So, if you're getting it to go, be prepared to wait, or try to call it in.I had a grilled cheese, which was AMAZING. The goat cheese and tomato slices makes for a very filling sandwich. Accompanied with the best fruit cup I've ever had [blue berries, kiwi, bananas, and strawberries!]The waitresses and hostess are great. Very efficient and extremely friendly. The staff was honestly one of my favorite parts of my experience here.I'll definitely be going back, I might try to avoid the Sunday brunch crowd next time, but this place is great!

Reviews.Author: Branden C.
Reviews.Content: Came here with my girlfriend because she was craving eggs benedict. I ordered the "wrap on fire" it was pretty delicious. Every bite was flavorful but then I expected it to be a little spicy. At minimum I expected a little kick. Sadly there wasn't any, or maybe my pain threshold for spicy food is way too high. My burrito was streaming hot throughout my whole meal. I like it, but I trend to burn my tongue. My girlfriend ordered the the florentine benedict, she enjoyed it very much. I had a bite off her plate and it was extremely delicious. It made me wish I had ordered the blu jam benedict instead. Maybe the next time I go I'll get that.Service was excellent. Always making sure we are happy and have enough water. I would rate my overall experience a 5/5.

Reviews.Author: Silva S.
Reviews.Content: I'm sure it's worth the wait in line -- just not for the benedicts. The service is great. The crowd is awesome. Love the location. The signature benedict + salmon benedict are just not good.

Reviews.Author: Benjamin S.
Reviews.Content: Had an awesome experience with the Blu Jam Cafe. I may have had to wait for an hour, but it was worth every minute. The staff, the food, the ambiance, all top notch. Plenty of indoor and outdoor seating right smack down in the heart of the trendy and mostly-bum-free melrose corridor.

Reviews.Author: Shelly W.
Reviews.Content: Based on the glowing reviews this place got, I was expecting something really special. I ordered three dishes to share with my friends - and the only one that I thought was really good was the stuffed french toast.  All the food was lukewarm when we got it, and tasted like it had been sitting for a long time. Our server was very friendly and nice, but it took forever to place our order and it wasn't even crowded.I give it three stars because i would try it again for lunch.

Reviews.Author: Leon H.
Reviews.Content: I hate when people leave bad review, or less stars than deserved, because their idiots and had a bad day, couldn't park, etc. So they take it out on the restaurant. Try judging the food and service and not unexpected circumstances.Anyways moving on.... The food is great! very fresh... The service is great! Atmosphere is also a plus, you feel like your in an episode of "Friends" ha! When i went i believe i had the blu jam french toast.... i loved it. The place was not crowded and i will definitely be coming back here again....

Reviews.Author: Grace C K.
Reviews.Content: How is it possible for a breakfast lover such as me to go to blu jam and not order something off the breakfast menu? the goulash. The goulash is legit. The soupy brothy part is delicious and warm and flavorful and there is a good amount of chunky foodie goodness. The tea is amazing. I would come back just for the tea. Chocolate monkey tea.. sounds weird. hate bananas but love this tea. love love love this tea.

Reviews.Author: Leezah H.
Reviews.Content: Decided to finally try this place out for my birthday brunch.  Coming in you get this community feel to it.The hostess found us a table right away.  It wasn't too busy since it was pouring outside.We ordered the Benedict Florentine & Vanilla French Toast.  Both were too die for!  The combination of the sun dried tomato, mushroom, brie, & spinach with the basic eggs benedict is genius.  The Vanilla French Toast was sprinkled with a bit of powdered sugar & fresh berries & bananas, you didn't even need the the syrup that they put on the side for you.  :-)  We're definitely coming back to try their bistro dining for dinner.  Looking forward to trying their baja boulliabaise (sp?)Blu Jam Cafe is definitely a must if you're in the Melrose area.

Reviews.Author: Daniel L.
Reviews.Content: Very good breakfast place that has really great service, tasty food, and a quaint/cute/welcoming atmosphere.My friend and I had the Florentine eggs Benedict and the smoked salmon platter, both of which were really good. Both dishes tasted so fresh !!! The eggs were bathed in a really awesome sauce and the salmon, along with all of the veggies that came on the platter, was so fresh and clean tasting. I like this place for breakfast because they don't try to smother their dishes with over-the-top sauces. The ingredients they use taste good /fresh enough on its own and eating here just makes me feel healthy and ready for a big day. After breakfast my friend and I went to a flea market that was just a couple blocks away and saw Emma Watson...YESSSS.......best....breakfast ever......

Reviews.Author: Sabrina G.
Reviews.Content: Not only was our server the coolest guy ever .... but we seriously could have eaten everything... it was so good!! My boyfriend and I went to breakfast for his birthday. We started out with french toast. Mmmm!!! Probably the best french toast Ive had! Then he got mornin ham breakfast or somethin? WOW! Lots of eggs mixed with everything you can think of! I got the Blu Jam Benedict, of course. I wouldnt be me if I didnt get eggs benedict somewhere. Not my favorite BUT still very very good. Also, they have fresh squeezed juices that you can mix/match. I had the grapefruit and orange. Boyfriend had the apple and orange. MMMMMM!!!!

Reviews.Author: Brian C.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great menu for breakfast.  Wish I could have tried everything on the menu! Food took a while to come out. Minus 1/2 point.  However the service was GRRRREAT.I had the Blue Jam Benedict . Coulda used a bit more hollandaise sauce and a few over cooked/burnt potatoes. Minus 1/2 point.I Would definitely recommend this spot and come back for something else on the menu.

Reviews.Author: Chrissie N.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam had an extremely long wait, but it was worth it!All staff members were extremely friendly and the place itself is really trendy.I got the Florentine Benedict and it was very filling. The eggs were cooked to perfection and each bite was very flavorful. I've heard that the French Toast was good also, so that would be the next thing I want to try!My only recommendation is to get there early or when it's less busy so that you don't have to wait an hour. It's an all day breakfast restaurant so you can't really beat that!

Reviews.Author: Kimberly L.
Reviews.Content: How ironic that tourist-teeming Melrose is the place to be if you're seeking a quiet Sunday morning.  I discovered this while blissing out holding a steaming cup of Blu Jam's organic coffee and staring at the remnants of the previous night's Melrose Ave beer binge.  Jess has already described our delicious meal choices (see below), but I have to reiterate how fabulous the water was.  Such a detail might seem insignificant, but I once had a boyfriend whose entire impression of my parents was somehow enhanced just because my stepmom served water with slices of lemon and lime.  In Blu Jam's case, I believe it's lemon slices and tons of fresh mint leaves.  Both sis and I were touched by the owner/manager's attention to customers - he brought the 2 guys sitting near us a complimentary crepe for being the 1st customers of the day.  All in all, definitely a welcome change from the over-hyped 3rd street breakfast scene.  I will definitely be going back for the "Capri Benedict"....and the water......

Reviews.Author: Kim J.
Reviews.Content: Fabulous orzo/eggs breakfast and super yummy white peach tea. Great atmosphere with satisfying jazz playing overhead, the warm colors and wood tables/chairs. Staff is friendly and pressure free while I lounge with my book. (Thx for the rec Lance!)Went back again and had the amazing Blu Jam Benedict and super scrumptious Chocolate Monkey hot tea. Highly recommended!!!  This was my favorite combo.Actually went back a third time.... the crepe was good but I would rather order the other stuff on the menu... it's so much better.

Reviews.Author: Molly S.
Reviews.Content: I spent the summer in LA with my brother and sister in law and this was my absolute favorite place to eat. The breakfast is amazing.  I didn't have anything I didn't like.  Their ice blended chai was perfect and I crave for it nightly.  We don't have such great restaurants with such awesome menu options in the Detroit area.  We ate inside and it was comfortable.  We also ate outside once with my 1 and a half year old son and it was pleasant.  It seemed a little crowded inside on a weekend morning so I don't know that my son would have done well inside.  I'd go to this place everyday if I could.

Reviews.Author: Fian L.
Reviews.Content: Every time I come down to LA, it's a MUST that I have breakfast/brunch here. First time here, I ordered the granola. It was nothing special, but the experience was great. Great atmosphere, very chill, friendly waiters. Second time here, I ordered the brioche french toast and couldn't contain myself. It was DELICIOUS. I usually shy away from french toast given that they are often drenched in grease and lard, but this was surprisingly light with the vanilla yogurt and berries. As for service, I must deduct a star. Waited about half an hour and watched all the people who arrived after get seated before us. Asking the lady what was up, she responded with quite some snobby attitude. Oh well, the french toast made up for everything that went wrong.

Reviews.Author: Mark J.
Reviews.Content: Please read all the other gourmands who yelped this place for general treatises on the quality of the food, here's my skinny on this kip:  1.  massive lines - avoid weekends ...  but well worth the wait2.  manners  - they've got tonnes, I prefer the waiters to most of my family 3.  crunchy french toast - my last meal before the the poison is administered4.  killer beer list - no fratboy MillerLite nonsense

Reviews.Author: Jen N.
Reviews.Content: With +1200 reviews, mine is probably not needed.  But, service was fabulous and food was delicious, I felt it was only fair to share!Parking: thanks fellow yelpers, found free parking on the side streets thanks to your tips.Wait: Line forms out front, don't get stuck in that line. Head on in and put your name on the wait list (waited 30-40min).  Melrose is fun for people watching as well as dog-watching! They even had LA times for me to read.Service: our Waiter was Charles (I think, that's' what receipt said). And he was EXCELLENT! Tipped him well, he even read my mind when I noticed the shaky table and fixed it without delay.  Drinks/Food: friend had their signature dish crunch french toast which was delicious but not for calorie-counters. It was more fried than the usual french toast (think crunchy rather than soft center).  Vanilla creme to top it was delicious.  I had the Roma via Paris which felt guilt-free but delicious, with a side of roasted potatoes. Hubby had the eggs benedict....only drawback was he does not like runny eggs and they undercooked the egg, despite our specification. That's okay, everything else was delish!Jasmine tea....recommended by Charles.....ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS.  All I could think about after lunch.  Came in a french press pot and a glass of ice.  AMAZING tea. As an asian....I know my Jasmine tea and this wins hands down.  Perfectly steeped and strong.Overall, we had a lovely time at brunch with our friends. Excellent service, good food.  See you soon Blu Jam!

Reviews.Author: Mon K.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS PLACE!First, I must say that the owner is a great guy -- he is warm, friendly, and very passionate about his food.  The second you walk in, he makes you feel as if you are a guest in his home... ...a home full of mouth heaven.... yes, it is true, the food is truly delicious!  With regards to the Friday dinner menus: the soups are great (I never thought I was a soup person until I tried the soups at Blu Jam), the meat is soooo tasty (beef dishes are good, chicken is wonderful, fish is amazing), even the spreadable dip for the bread is excellent.  The brunch food is great also -- tons and tons of choices, great for vegetarians and meaties alike!  I swear on my grandmother's grave, I have never been disappointed at Blu Jam.  In fact, due to the strong menu and great atmosphere, I now bring most of my out-of-town visitors here for dinner cuz I know that every meal is a hit.My fiancee and I try to get to Blu Jam at least once per month, if not more, especially for the Friday themed dinner nights (where the owner/chef focuses on the flavors of a specific country or region).Oh, did I mention how reasonable the prices are?  You are getting a $200 dinner (quality-wise) for only a fifth of that price!  Do yourself a huge favor and eat here!:)

Reviews.Author: J- Lee S.
Reviews.Content: oh my... Was this good or what! I was there for brunch, and I'd such a great experience with their food. Their service was very nice and easy going, The view was a total look of the legendary LA... I would go back for more once I'm back to LA... is worth the drive I drove for 15 mnts. Cuz it was far away from the hotel, but i loved.

Reviews.Author: Elana K.
Reviews.Content: YUM YUMMM!!!  I visited this restaurant about a month ago, my friend got the french toast after seeing ALL the posts on here about it.  It was DELICIOUS!  I, of course, tasted it and she polished off the plate!  I really enjoyed the half soup/half sald (vegan split pea and veggiewich) but my favorite thing was their ice soy chai tea!  It could have been a dessert!  It was by far the best chai tea I've ever had!  The restaurant was really clean and nicely set up.  The staff was very attentive as well.  Restaurant was a little pricey, but definitely worth it! that why 4 stars out of 5.  I have a budget :oP

Reviews.Author: Derek A.
Reviews.Content: I'm the type that loves a relaxing, slow-paced, late breakfast on the weekends after a night out and Blu Jam is my favorite spot for just such occasions.I have never had bad service here. The staff are always quick to accomodate and polite. My favorite menu item is the Hangover Burrito. Yes, I realize hangovers are a common theme for me. Haha. Anyhow, this thing is good! And spicy!Blu Jam also has great sandwiches if you're in the mood for that instead of breakfast. Inside has a nice ambiance and not too loud, outside under the umbrellas is nice when the weather is right. Makes for some great people watching on Melrose ave. Actually, one of the nice things about this place is the clientele. Generally its a hip twenties crowd.Blu Jam is just plain good all around.

Reviews.Author: Kelly C.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love Blu Jam Cafe, it is one of my favorite spots in all of Los Angeles. I often go there on the weekends after a hike at Runyon Canyon, and love their fresh healthy menu. I am a vegetarian and love that they have a lot of veggie friendly options! Their omelettes are spectacular, and I love their caprese sandwich as well. I usually get the side of fruit and it is delicious, complete with fresh apples, kiwi, pineapples, berries, strawberries and more. Delicious! The staff is always very friendly and efficient, and the prices are great too. I often bring my dog with my and they are always very nice and bring him a bowl of water too :)

Reviews.Author: Wilfred W.
Reviews.Content: Ok, as good as it gets? MAYBE NOT! But surely, pretty darn good.First of all, expect of line of some sort, especially on the weekends.Second of all, not a leisure chatty place if you are sitting indoor, cause it is as echo-y as a greek forum! (noise, lots of noise!)Third of all, don't bother going if you are going to determine the worth of the meal base on the ingredients that the use! (oh egg, croissant, cheese, smoke salmon.... i can do this with 3 bucks! 15? they must be mad!)--------So went there at 10:30-ish am on a thrusday, found free parking on the small street next to it. (yay) A small line inside the door, but we were seating within 4 minutes or so.Took them i would say 4 minutes or so to take our order (they do have a pretty big menu). But took them pretttty damn long to even get us our coffee (disappointed) [my sister did say they were much faster when she went last time on a weekend] But at last, about 20 minutes or maybe a litto more.... our food arrived! All the food was well presented, with hot plates.Its not full of fancy syrup wt not next to the plate, but once u taste the food, you know it was handled with care and pride.The family ordered the norwegian egg benedict, and some risotto dish (the special for the day). Which was both fancy and tasty at the same time.I ordered the morning hash, basically potato, egg, blk forest ham, onion, and sun dried tomato cooked together. By all means, its not very delightful when you look at it, kinda looked liek it was regurgitated by someone who has the hungover special. BUT it was pretty darn good for something that looked so...lol The sundried tomato gave it the kick that it will otherwise not have.I highly recommend it if you are in the area, or you are in dying need of some good breakfast. But if you are living far far away and have no business in that part of town, MAYBE its not worth the trip!  Good luck finding parking!

Reviews.Author: Grant M.
Reviews.Content: Went on  a Sunday at 10am.The crunchy french toast is really good, it almost tastes deep fried like a doughnut. Might be a little rich for some. I would get it again, but probably not every time I good. Like I do the pancakes at Dupars. Coffee was good, strong & the right temperature. Not overly hot, just right.Our Server & busboys were on it, and pleasant.We were given a 40 minute wait estimate and it only took 25. Seem to move fast.Girls were comfortable shoes, and window shop, and the time flies by.

Reviews.Author: Karen M.
Reviews.Content: This was probably my favorite breakfast place in LA!  Great Benedict's!  I used to always get this radish, celery, kale, ginger juice thing that was surprisingly delicious!  Laid back atmosphere.  Kind of small and it gets crowded on the weekends.

Reviews.Author: Eric P.
Reviews.Content: Scrounging for the best brunch-eating spots in L.A., my girlfriend and I decided to give Blue Jam Cafe a try. We started off with the Norwegian Eggs Benedict and the infamous Crunchy French Toast as our waiter suggested and our decision was totally worth the money. The Norwegian Eggs Benedict was totally OFF THE CHARTS good! The poached eggs were perfectly cooked, its yolks were overflowing as we put our knives to cut through the whites! Once the runny yolks oozed onto the smoked salmon and spinach, the flavor was incredibly unified into harmony. Served with nicely baked English Muffin and dill hollandaise sauce, I strongly recommend this savory concoction. The crunchy french toast tasted pretty good as well. Toppled with multiple fruits such as bananas and berries, this dish would be a must try for those who often crave for desserts. My word of advice: please completely drench the toast with the vanilla sauce because just the sauce itself would turn the toast from delicious to DELICIOUS!!!Based on the food and service we experienced, we gave Blue Jam Cafe 4/5 stars. The atmosphere was pretty relaxing and it's a comfortable place to hang around. Even though we didn't have the chance to meet the world-famous Mr. Nice Guy Kamil, I would still recommend this place to my friends!

Reviews.Author: Shiya H.
Reviews.Content: the crunchy french toast is awesome!!

Reviews.Author: Joy K.
Reviews.Content: YUMMMThe Florentine Benedict is the best! It consists of spinach, mushrooms, sun-dried tomatoes, (perfectly) poached eggs, & hollandaise sauce on an english muffin. The breakfast quesadilla & crunchy french toast were very satisfying too. I don't like french toast (because it get's too soggy) but it was nice & crunchy and the vanilla sauce was like crack! The lemonade was too sour and the refills are extra. Anyways, the downside is the wait. The waiting area is always cramped with people trying to avoid the scorching sun. I usually just check out the clothing stores in the area. I took off one star because on my most recent visit, the Benedict was sloppy (probably because it was busy), had way less toppings, and the hollandaise sauce was runny. It's all about consistency but i'll be back :)

Reviews.Author: Rashante L.
Reviews.Content: Hands down the BEST brunch spot in LA! The breakfast quesadilla and crunchy French toast were beyond amazing! Even the fresh fruit was juicy and sweet! The service was great as well. The host was a sweetheart and the waiter was very nice and on top of it! Wonderful experience!

Reviews.Author: Lily R.
Reviews.Content: I'm hooked on Melrose. For me, its the home away from home for me. I am not much of an L.A. girl but when I visit, Melrose makes me feel like I'm on Haight street with better shops!Now as for the food, Blue Jam hit the spot. We were starving, it was about 2pm, we had been out late the night before and we were ready to collapse from the heat. We stumbled apon Blu Jam and asked a couple on the bench in front if they were waiting for a table. They said yes and for us to stay because it was WORTH the wait. They were right!I had one of the special brunch items: Spinach with red skinned potatoes and poached eggs with hollandaise.  AMAZING. Now that I'm getting to know the area, I will come back for more! Service was great and prices weren't too bad. Everyone was satisfied with their meal.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie C.
Reviews.Content: Came here this morning to cure a hangover... and delicious food definitely does the trick!  I love the ambiance and it was pretty packed around 10:30, which is rare for a thursday.  But I guess it's just that good.  The place has a comfortable feel to it, I could probably sit there for hours and just relax but... limited meter parking.  what a downer.    They had a superb breakfast menu.  We got the Muscle Beach and the Old World, both were hearty and wonderful, both $7.95.  And with a side of potatoes or fruit, and toast!  Good deal?  I'd say so!!  I would definitely come back here more often for their breakfast food if it weren't a 20 min. drive.  But it might be worth it if I'm ever craving eggs... which I always am.  im a sucker for breakfast foods!

Reviews.Author: Stef S.
Reviews.Content: Honestly I was disappointed. The cafe was so cute! The food was beautiful and sophisticated! But alas, $19 for Roma via Paris, a Chai Latte, and tax and generous tip? Sheesh. I'm not an A-lister with a bottomless wallet.If money ain't your thang, the Roma via Paris is delicious. Nice and light. The zucchini, cherry tomatoes, eggs and montchevre cheese come together nicely. The rosemary toast on the side was nice, but I wish that they had toasted it longer (because it had gotten to that point to where it was lightly crunchy yet stale and chewy at the same time).  The fruit salad? I was so sad! I heard such amazing things on yelp! But alas, the tiny portion just had 1/8 of a fig, 3 paper-thin apple slices, 1/2 a small strawberry, and then some grapes and melon. Honestly I was not amazed. The chai was delicious though. Yum yum. But mine didn't come with any fancy decoration on the top, and for $4 bucks I'd go elsewhere. Also no parking....Boo blu jam. You were supposed to be my favorite breakfast spot in LA! Ah, tthe search continues.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer J.
Reviews.Content: My absolute FAVORITE breakfast spot!  (It was my favorite dinner spot, but they stopped dinner service just until they get their liquor license. I've been going here for years My favorites:1.  GoulashI always get a bowl and share with friends when I go, but its especially good on those cold or rainy days!  2.  Eggwich (order your meals with fruit!)I've tried several items on their menu and although their whole menu is great I always seem to get this dish.3.  Anything the servers or Kamil what they recommend.Kamil is always trying new things so ask!  The main reason why I think this place is so great is because of their attention to detail.  This is what makes it so fresh and tasty! Although an eggwich sounds simple and nothing to brag about... its the ingredients that they use.  In every dish, Kamil pays close attention to everything he puts in it.  Everything is fresh and perfectly selected.  For example, I mentioned ordering all meals with fruit because their fruit can change with the season.  It's not just the basic watermelon and cantalope. I've seen figs, apples, strawberries, kiwi, banana, watermelon, cantalope, etc.  So when you notice such attention to details just in the fruit... you know its throughout the whole menu!  Additionally, Kamil is a sommelier so be sure to watch for the return of their dinners!  When it comes back it will be amazing!  Go early and make reservations.  Again because he is so detailed all the food is fresh and carefully selected for dinner so when they run out their out! (I've never seen this happen with their brunches though... but I appreciate a place that only serves quality food!)Note: Its not a huge spot but there's never really much of a wait because you can always see them hustling and trying to accommodate everyone.   They really care about their customers so they do their best to get everyone seated quickly.  fyi:  I just joined yelp today to write this and a couple of other reviews.  This is one of those spots that not everyone knows about and where you can always take friends and visitors on a Sunday for brunch and its guaranteed to be good!  Its never failed me and I've been going for years.Also, this seems pointless to add but it's good to note that the bathroom is elegant and clean.  Again their attention to detail is what sets this place apart from all others!  Its amazing... You'll love it!Oh and I guess I should mention that their prices are so reasonable... amazing and not over priced!

Reviews.Author: Tiffany S.
Reviews.Content: This place is one of my favorites in la!!!I was introduced several years ago by some great friends of mine after a long day of shopping in Hollywood/Melrose area.It is very down to earth.. they play some wonderful atmospheric music and the nice handsome slovic manager/server is a nice touch to the whole experience, always!! haha no but really, this place is a huge two thumbs up for me. Their panini sandwiches are my favorite and definitely get the rustic potatoes as a side. Highly recommend them. The service and food here are both really excellent, definitely stop in the next time your on Melrose for the day!!!

Reviews.Author: Steve V.
Reviews.Content: Came here on a Saturday morning at 11 which of course meant there was a wait. We were quoted 20 minutes but it ended up being more like 40. We did get an excellent table outside and were able to enjoy the weather.The service was decent and the highlight was really the amount of food you got. The portions are fairly large. I had te California Omelette which is off their regular breakfast menu. Breakfast is served "all day." They do have a special Brunch menu however.The food was good, but nothing to write home about. There is a lot of hype for this place and perhaps I missed it because of what I ordered, but I'm sure I'll be back.

Reviews.Author: denise m.
Reviews.Content: Had breakfast here today with a friend and we shared two items.  I was glad that I did because portions were quite large and I was happy to have two different tastes/flavors rather than a big portion of only one.  I highly recommend sharing (if you're the sharing kind, that is).  We had the brioche french toast with strawberries and blueberries.  Delicious.  It's quite sweet so honestly, it didn't even need any syrup, in my opinion.  They definitely add vanilla and sugar to the egg mixture which the bread is soaked in.  It's yummy thick bread and soaked all the way through to a custardy consistency (but not at all wet inside).  Just perfect.  (I hate it when French toast is not soaked all the way through.)We also had the Toscana Scramble.  It is scrambled eggs with tomato and pesto and some other ingredients that I can't recall at the moment.  It comes with toast and nicely well-done, crispy potatoes.  It was scrumptious, and a super large portion.  There's no way I could have eaten the whole thing myself.I also had a side order of fruit and it was very fresh and delish.  The service was prompt, friendly and professional.  I would definitely go back again and try some of their other items that were calling out to me.

Reviews.Author: Eugi H.
Reviews.Content: I Love Breakfast. Blu Jam serves Breakfast. Really good Breakfast. So I Love Blu Jam.I read about it in one of the yelp newletters a while back and went with the bf to try it shortly after. It's has a very trendy atmosphere, complete with hip staff and cute/comfy decor. I got the Eggwich, which was TO DIE FOR. Everything I loved all smothered in one gigantic sandwich - over easy eggs, bacon, avocado, tomato, lettuce, pesto, and mayo squished together by fresh ciabatta...what more can u ask for? Oh yeah, a chai latte with soy to complete the meal. Pure heaven.
