The bf confirmed from that meal that he officially likes smoked salmon as well (he got the smoked salmon platter, which looked so YUM too). What a successful and satisfying meal!

Reviews.Author: Norm K.
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Yelp, I've been having some wonderful breakfasts when I visit Los Angeles.  Today was no exception when I went to the Blu Jam Café.  There was plenty of on street parking--maybe because of the heavy rain--and it was nice to try the new to me meters that you can use a credit or debit card and not have to worry about having change in your pocket.On to the good stuff.  I got a latté and the barista put a genie face on top with the foam.  I had the Paris Omelette--an omelette made with 3 eggs and has sun dried tomatoes, spinach, chives, one crisp red tomato, and a lot of Montchevre goat cheese both inside and on top of the omelette.  It was an outstanding breakfast with good service, a fair price, and a whimsical latté just for the asking!Thanks fellow Yelpers for letting me in on these good places.  It gets me out of my hotel buffets that are overpriced with awful food.

Reviews.Author: Lauren K.
Reviews.Content: Driving from San Francisco to Irvine to visit friends, my friend decided that this would be a great place to make a pit stop for breakfast. He said that this place had great reviews on yelp so we all agreed to give Blue Jam Cafe a shot.It wasn't super crowded probably because it was a Friday morning and everyone probably has work. There was soft music playing in the background and the service was outstanding. The ambiance was a casual modern feel with white table cloths.Taking the advice of my fellow yelpers, I ordered the Roma via Paris ($11.95) which had scrambled eggs mixed with lots of cheese, tomatoes, and other things, two slices of toast, and some potatoes. Maybe I wasn't that impressed because I'm not a huge fan of breakfast food but I felt like for what I ordered, I wasn't really satisfied. It gives you a choice of different breads for your toast and I meant to order Sourdough but the waiter never asked and automatically assumed we all wanted Wheat Bread (oh well).Remember to park on the residential streets to avoid paying meter parking.

Reviews.Author: Aris L.
Reviews.Content: It was friday morning and we were having brunch at this restaurant.I love the place and the staff was really friendly. I ordered the salad (i do not remember what it's called and quite expensive compared to other dishes) and the french toast. both dishes were tasteful.CONCLUSION = RECOMMENDED

Reviews.Author: Jamie K.
Reviews.Content: if u love to see stars this is the place to eat :D  We spotted a Glee Cast member in this cafe eating her breakfast Wait can be long so the earlier you go the better.  Parking may be a lil bit difficult but there is plenty of street parking if you don't mind walking a little bit.   Potatoes are yummy and served with almost everything.    So they have an interesting kick to normal breakfast food... -Salmon Hash was tasteful and it's good if you want a smaller portion size.  -Florentine Benedict were good but i just love benedicts of all kind! and the eggs were poached perfectly -Migas was extremely LARGE and filling, but the flavors kind of exploded in your mouth.   This meal is not for the ppl that don't like their food touching and dont' like to get their hand dirty b/c everything is kind of scramble into one and you use your utensils and hand.-Quesadills another LARGE meal that could be shareable.   After we left this place the amount of carbs did sure make us SLEEEPY !!! :(    So make sure to pick up a cup of coffee with your meal :D

Reviews.Author: Jenna C.
Reviews.Content: Took FOREVER to get in for brunch it seemed.  However it IS SO WORTH IT!!! And the staff is nice while you wait... I would suggest trying to go at an off time or early(ER) on a Sunday than we did. We picked the worst time.Apparently the best time to go would be 10 am or after 3pm on a Sunday I have been told there is almost no wait during the week! They also serve breakfast till 5 ALL WEEK. Yes, please.Lots of healthy choices, hefty portions.... and i had the most AMAZING skim cappuccino EVER! It was in a huge mug overflowing with foam. YUMMMM!!  I had the Olympic egg-white dish off of the Healthy & FItness section. IT WAS SO GOOD!!! flambe-broiled grilled chicken, tomato-basil sauce, spinach, zucchini, 6 egg whites...  And it come with a brilliant organic green salad. The Florentine Benedict looked delish and my friend took down every bite with delight.I will definitely be back... at an off time... and i cannot wait to try the other goodies on the menu... i certainly was eyeing the lean turkey burger with caramelized onions. So, basically... you should go. FUN people watching on Melrose too.

Reviews.Author: Ronny D.
Reviews.Content: I have been frequently visiting LA for the last year or so and I have found that the restaurant scene around me has always everything I look for. I've found a solid authentic Chinese place that delivers, an authentic and not too overpriced sushi place, an Indian buffet that no one goes to, and a fancy steakhouse that I will probably never go to.But the key word is ALMOST. Still two things missing on my LA restaurant list. I need a mind-blowingly amazing custom sandwich place, and I need a "make this weekend morning more amazing" brunch place. I think I just found the brunch place.Blu Jam is a small little brunch place on Melrose. Plenty of parking around the residential areas near the restaurant. It was a sunny day, so we sat outside. Don't mind the homeless and/or hipster people walking by, it adds to the atmosphere. The scramble I got was really good, plenty of everything I want in there. The side of turkey sausage looked homemade and was also very tasty. The BLTAvo my gf got looked very good, but she did struggle a little bit with the focaccia bread.The waitress was very friendly and the water was always filled.Price was a little bit high for eggs. A few bucks less would have gotten this place a solid 5 star. But for now, I'll give it an underachieved 4. Will definitely be back again.

Reviews.Author: Chris A.
Reviews.Content: Came here on a Friday with friend for lunch. We got seated right away, but had a little trouble deciding what to order. Neither of us had eaten breakfast, but it was also lunch time and the menu had plenty of items to satisfy both. Lately, I've been trying french toast at the breakfast type places, so we decided to share the Vanilla French Toast. As for the second item to share, we ended up going with a recommendation by the waitress, which was the Salmon and Spinach.When the food came, our eyes lit up with the arrival of the french toast. It was calling out to us to eat it first. Plus there weren't any parentals to say no sweets first, hehe. Although you would think a french toast would be really heavy, the one here was pretty refreshing. The french toast was soft and spongy, but not soggy. There was a perfect amount of blackberry jam and vanilla yogurt, and the syrup was served on the side so you could add as much as you liked. But not only was there the fantastic mix of jam and yogurt, there were also fresh blueberries, blackberries, strawberries, and bananas. :) This dish was perfect to share because there were 4 sets of toast and plenty of fruit to go around.Then it was time for the Salmon and Spinach. The piece of salmon was a decent size that was enough to be split between 2 people. Again, grilled to perfection with a nice outer layer and a soft, tender inside that almost melted in your mouth. It went really well with the spinach that seemed to be more on the fully sauteed side rather than just wilted, but nonetheless a good pairing. It was also nice to find the little surprises of zucchini, tomatoes, olives and capers in the sauce and mixed with the spinach. Very refreshing as well and not too salty, despite the mix of ingredients.They even gave us a car for a complimentary bottle of wine with dinner for any wednesday to sunday (6-10 pm), so I'll definitely have to try that along with more of their food.

Reviews.Author: Perry H.
Reviews.Content: Did a quick search and found this spot and decided to head over for breakfast.  We got a seat outside which was really nice.  It was a Tuesday and there were no folks outside which was a surprise.  The service was great which can sometimes be an issue when you're one of two tables seated outside.The first thing that threw me was the minty water...I can't say I'm a fan but I'm sure many others will be.  I took a big swig and placed the mint immediately but thought I was just having a really odd hangover.  But sure enough, when refill time came the pitcher was full of fresh mint leaves.  A nice touch and something I'm sure is quite refreshing in the summer.The breakfast was awesome and very very fresh.  I went with the california omelet which was bacon, tomato, avocado, sour cream & cheddar cheese.  It was served with (although not needed) with potatoes and toast.  My entire party was stuffed for the rest of the day and bypassed lunch altogether.  A great spot for breakfast, lunch, dinner, dessert, and brunch.  Go!

Reviews.Author: Faryoung B.
Reviews.Content: My new favorite brunch spot!! :)They have valet parking in front unless you're lucky enough to find street parking.The wait for a table of 2 took about 25 minutes but it was well worth it. I ended up ordering the french toast which was pretty to look at as well as delicious. My friend ordered the migas (scrambled eggs with jalapeno and chorizo sausage) which we shared and oh my goodness.. I was so satisfied. It has been a while since i've actually enjoyed brunch. I usually love the concept of brunch more than the actual food served but today I loved both!!Cant wait to come back

Reviews.Author: Lauren T.
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed their blu jam Benedict with a side of fruit instead of potatoes. The food comes in large portions. Prices are reasonable and worth the twenty minute wait for a table for two. The place is pretty popular.   Will definitely be back again.

Reviews.Author: Christine T.
Reviews.Content: YEUP, this has to seriously be one of the best breakfast/brunch places!! Best french toast in the world!!!!!!!!! SOOOO crunchy, made to perfection. The Blu Jam Eggs Benedict was also pretty good, has a lot of ham, bacon in it and served on a croissant. It's not too big or anything so it's perfect. LOVE LOVE LOVE the french toast, it's definitely a MUST!

Reviews.Author: Holly R.
Reviews.Content: Hundreds of reviews and 4 stars - what more can I add? Not much so I'll just hop on the Blu Jam bandwagon and say that I love it too. I work in LA from time to time and have had lunch from Blu Jam several times. It's one of those places the whole group can agree on so it's an easy choice when the question "what do you want for lunch?" comes up.I usually order the LA Club. This sandwich is huge both in size and flavor. Seriously I can barely get my mouth around the thing. So the filling usually squeezes out as I take a bite and it's messy but I don't even care because this sandwich is so darn good.  It's loaded with turkey, ham, double cheese, thick slices of tomato and I swear half an avocado. They do not skimp. It's so so so so good. I get the side of fruit which is also great. It's full of strawberries, blueberries, grapes, bananas and more. So much better than the few slices of cantaloupe you get at most places. Nothing against cantaloupe but you know.I have also had their salads, which are huge and tasty too. Basically you can't go wrong with this place. I, along with several hundred other people apparently, highly recommend this place. Yummo!

Reviews.Author: Lisa C.
Reviews.Content: Yummy food, cozy seating - indoor and outdoor, friendly service. TIPS: Go early on the weekend and don't come with a large group to avoid waiting a million years for a table.

Reviews.Author: Kinjal S.
Reviews.Content: So unfair!!! they offer their special french toast only on weekends and holiday!! wah!!! Went there last week after finishing up some work in West Hollywood... Melrose Ave hell yeah! Thanks to my iphone Yelp app, I found this small yet quite popular (4 stars on 900+ reviews! place. They serve breakfast until as long as they are open in the day time. Our server was Jason I think.... A very nice guy... so friendly and he made some good recommendations.I got the veggie omlet and friend got fried eggs and toast. We also ordered fresh juices - which also were very good....They have outdoor seating as well, but we chose to sit indoors to escape the blinding light and burning heat of the 12pm sun....Hmmm wonder if they have one in the bay area...

Reviews.Author: Ellen L.
Reviews.Content: My best friend suggested I take my visiting friend to eat here, and said a lot of positive things about it. Although, she warned me that there's usually a long wait, so I was expecting a lot since it seemed like a hyped up place.Surprisingly, we were seated right away, but our waitress took a little too long to come back with our menus. I feel like she might have forgotten about us until she came to take another table's order, and saw that we were just sitting there. I had the paris via roma omelette, my friend had the florentine benedict, and we shared a side of apple sausages. He was pretty in love with his order (benedict with "Mushroom, Sundried tomatoes, Spinach, Hollondaise sauce, Perfect egg, and Salad with light dressing) said he would come back to eat there again. I, on the other hand, enjoyed my omelette, but was not blown away by it. It tasted like any restaurant's omelette, but presentation wise it looked messy and a little unappetizing. It wasn't a horrible experience or anything, I guess I just might have had higher expectations for it. Good food, okay service, but don't see myself going out of my way to go back.
Reviews.Author_Location: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

Reviews.Author: Margaret M.
Reviews.Content: One of the best breakfasts that I have had in LA. It's a great location on Melrose, parking is easy and they have a great patio. I will warn you that it's a bit of a cluster at the front door, but once you are seated it's nice and comfy. Our server was great, just attentive enough and we never ran low on hot coffee & fresh cream. The coffee and food were both delicious - I had 3 eggs with potatoes & bacon and the hus had the Migas plate which was chorizo, eggs, potatoes & tortillas. Both were spot on and I wouldn't have changed a thing. Food came out a little slow, but it was hot & fresh so it totally made up for the wait. We came in on a weekday at around 11am and this place was packed, so I would assume the weekends have a ridiculous wait, just an FYI.

Reviews.Author: Eric L.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam is a great spot for breakfast.  I opted for the Blu Jam Benedict which disappeared from my plate in about 10 seconds.  The eggs were perfectly cooked and the runny yolk and extra hollandaise made the perfect compliment to the rosemary potatoes.  Bacon, ham and a nicely made hollandaise capped of a great breakfast.Some tempting weekend brunch specials will surely lure me in for another go at Blu Jam's tasty offerings

Reviews.Author: James H.
Reviews.Content: I love it when I have a brunch that blows my mind. To set a premise, breakfast is probably my favorite meal of the day. from eggs, bacon, french toast, i like it all. Came here today with the family to enjoy a hearty brunch. Literally, EVERYTHING here i was impressed with. We had two types of eggs benedict, french toast, and an omlette.The eggs benedict was poached perfectly and complemented with smoked salmon. Sometimes the ham or salmon is overbearing on the taste but here it was paired perfectly. I also enjoyed the roasted potatos they served with the benedict where you could taste a little bit of ginger that was unique but i grew to like it. French toast was 5 stars for sure! I've never had such fluffy brioche french toast in my life.. to top it off they hhave liek corn flakes fried ontop of it so its crispy yet at the same time melts in your mouth. I could eat this dish forever. The omlette though similar to any other omlette at any other location stood out to me because the egg was so "fluffy." Typically omlettes are made a little more crude with oil dripping and cheesing oozing out of it. However this one did not need all the extras to make it taste awesome.Drinks were great and service was even better. This has become my new favorite brunch spot.

Reviews.Author: David G.
Reviews.Content: Simply awesome. Best breakfast I've had anywhere!I sampled: Hot Chocolate, Coffee, Wrap On Fire, and Water. All were above par... way above

Reviews.Author: Danny S.
Reviews.Content: Despite the fact that they do not take reservations and I regularly have to wait a half hour to be seated, Blu Jam is in my opinion in the top 2 for best brunch restaurants in Los Angeles -  the other being Alcove in Los Feliz. The ambiance is nice, with a friendly wait-staff and good service. But lets be honest, you come here for the comida. The crunchy french toast are the best dish on the brunch menu and possibly the best french toast any human has ever had the pleasure of consuming. They are that good. what makes them especially deadly is the vanilla bean sauce that accompanies it plus bananas, strawberrys and blueberries. Man is it GOOOOOD! There are some other delicious items on the menu - Wrap on Fire is real good, but probably not as spicy as I would like and the beef goulash soup is great if you are in the mood for a stewy beef soup.Leave your name, make friends with the hostess, and go for a nice stroll down Melrose.

Reviews.Author: Priscilla Z.
Reviews.Content: My second time here. Arrived around 12pm. So crowded. We waited for like an hour before we had our dishes on the table.We ordered the brunch (Only available on Sunday, so we must take advantage). The french toast was fantastic, as always. But I was not so into the sweet things. The risotto was good too. I like the risotto when it is soft. And just let the poached egg broken and mixed the egg yolk with the risotto. So yummy! The scrambled egg with mac was the winner that day, the texture was really great. It came in a good amount. My Felorine benedict was good too. But not that impressive.I will def come again to test out other dishes!

Reviews.Author: Leonard W.
Reviews.Content: I came here on a Saturday morning and was excited because I saw the reviews and knew that this place had to be somewhat decent. I get there and just my luck there's street parking out front.  I sign my name up and wait. The wait wasn't too bad, about 30-40 min for a table of 5. The line was packed, so the wait didnt bother me. The servers were nice and brought out water for those of us in line.I finally get in and the place has a nice rustic and homey/organic feel to the place. Everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves, which created a great morning brunch atmosphere.I ordered the Brunch Burger, cooked medium rare and got the organic iced tea. The burger came out and was huge. The meat was cooked perfect and the eggs on top made the dish amazing. Everything about it was delicious. I had to use my fork and knife to tackle the behemoth. This burger smashes Umami and is more substantial and costs just a little bit more.I also tried the crunchy french toast and the Steak hash (stolen from my co-diners), everything was great. I have no problems giving this place a 5, and would definitely come back to try other dishes. If you like a great breakfast/brunch on the weekend, you must go to Blu Jam Cafe. Great food, great atmosphere, and great service makes this place one of the best cafes in the area.

Reviews.Author: Thuy H.
Reviews.Content: The location of this cafe is a shopper's dream come true!  I love the boutique stores on Melrose.It's a small cafe with indoor and outdoor seating.  We arrived Friday morning at about 10:30a and there was no wait.  By 10:45a, the pace was packed.  Customer service is definitely great because we were instantly greeted by the hostess when we walked in.  Like every other cafe, there's a chalk board with specials.  As we sat down, we could hear light jazz music playing in the background but was drowned out by the noise level of conversations that were going on.  The decor is very simple and the ceiling with the pipes reminds me of an older building (like those in SF) and has a less modern feel to the ambiance.  I was digging it.It took us about 20 minutes to get our meal after it was ordered.  I didn't mind the wait because I was having a great conversation with my boyfriend.  When the food finally came out, I thought the food was just mediocre.  I was craving chorizo so I ordered the Migas: Spicy combination of eggs scrambled with jalapeños, chipotle, beef chorizo sausage, bell peppers, tortilla chips and mozzarella, topped with homemade tomato salsa, served with flour tortilla and potatoes.However, as I started eating my meal, I didn't see or taste any of the chorizo.  Did the chef just pinched in the amount of chorizo? because there was barely any in there!  I was a bit disappointed but maybe this was what the chef intended?  My meal tasted mediocre, but it least my grapefruit mimosa was good!  I had a bite of my bf's Wrap on Fire (Fresh eggs scrambled w/ spicy chipotle peppers, black beans, cilantro, tomato, bell peppers & cheddar rolled up in a large grilled flour tortilla, served with sour cream and crispy red potatoes) and that was pretty good.  I definitely preferred that over my Migas.  I want to give this place another try so I'll be back :)

Reviews.Author: Phoebe W.
Reviews.Content: During my four day food fest in L.A., my cousins took my sister and I here for brunch. They name dropped a few C-list celebs that had been sighted in the area, but my focus was on the diverse menu ahead of me. The wait was excruciating since I could see everyone else's food, we were then squeezed into the tiniest table for five. Cousins went for the brunch route, sister & I got salads. The Sonoma salad was very fresh and I loved the fresh red grapes in it. For me, the stand outs were the decadent French toast and breakfast quesadilla of Midwestern proportions. I've had a few people ask me for recommendations for brunch out in L.A., Blu Jam has topped my list!

Reviews.Author: Crystal C.
Reviews.Content: I usually don't venture too far out of the west side, but I was on my way to the Pantages so we decided to try this brunch spot.  Everything about it was great - my only complaint is that they don't take reservations, and since it's such a bumpin spot, it's kind of a long wait on the weekends.  We went on a Sunday and got there at around 10:30, and we probably waited a good 45 minutes.  For the girls, it was nice because we were able to walk around the little shops and look at some clothes and such, but the boys were miserable and grumpy (due to hunger of course).  Also - there was ample street parking but it's all metered, and goes for about $1/hour with a 2 hour parking limit (starting at 10 am).After our wait we were sat down indoors - the restaurant is pretty small but it has a fun, casual vibe.  I had the breakfast risotto - which at first I thought would be strange, but it was deliciously wonderful and filling.  With two perfectly poached eggs on top, some crunch from the asaparagus, Other orders from the table were the ahi tuna salad, which I heard was decent but nothing spectacular, the french toast, which was typical yet delicious (really - how can you go wrong with french toast?), and if I remember correctly, the wrap on fire, which was spicy and tasty.  Prices were able average for brunch (less than $20), and I would definitely recommend their tea lemonade! Not sure what exactly was in it, but I tasted some sort of plum or something that added something new to my drink.Overall, sad that there are no reservations for this place since it's so busy, but good food and fun atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Jon S.
Reviews.Content: Friend and I came here for a brunch on a Sunday morning. I usually hate waiting for anything, particularly a table, but having heard some positive reviews from others, decided to give it a shot. We found metered parking and put our name in. I think we ended up waiting close to an hour (definitely more than 45 minutes). We ended up at a table inside. I didn't realize how small the place actually was. No wonder the wait was so long. We ended up ordering the breakfast quesadilla and the crunchy french toast and split them both. I usually hate any breakfast burrito-type foods, but that quesadilla was delicious. Chicken, scrambled eggs, cheese in a tortilla topped with salsa and avocado and served with these extremely well-seasoned potatoes! To be honest, I think this was the highlight of our meal. The crunchy french toast was great too though! French toast covered with corn flakes and served with these DELICIOUS vanilla-y sauce. I'm not sure what it was but it made that french toast. My only complaint was that it could have been served with a few more berries/bananas. Our waitress was great! She was attentive and super nice. I loved her! And while it was clear they were trying to get people in/out as quickly as possible, I never felt like she was rushing us at all. Blu Jam serves some seriously good brunch. I'm not sure it's worth an hours wait. Particularly when there are so many brunch options in LA with waits with half the time or less, but still so good. Definitely a must try.

Reviews.Author: Anya R.
Reviews.Content: This place is popular for a reason! Was super scared of the long wait that comes with places that have been Yelped by a gajillion reviews so I went an hour earlier so my friend didn't have to wait.  My recommendation- don't do that.  My friends ended up showing up after they called me and they couldn't seat me until everyone was here.  I say if you want to go during a busy time like weekend brunch hours come with EVERYONE and be ready to wait. The food comes out really fast and its tasty.  Got the Shrimp Mazatlan and finished everything. On the service side- I just want to shout out Allyson. After eating here I had to go to the airport to fly up to the Bay and realized that I left my Kindle on my seat! Oh no! I called them and they found it and kept it for me.  I ended up retrieving it a month later.  They could have EASILY kept this to themselves but instead there are good people out there.  Thank you Allyson! This place is in the heart of Melrose so street parking should be down CAREFULLY aka reading all the signs if you can park there.  There's also outdoor seating to enjoy the LA sunshine!

Reviews.Author: Tu-Anh N.
Reviews.Content: This place was so yummy I forgot the part where the wait was long to get seated.  It probably wasnt even that bad :]We sat outside and it was just lovely!  Here's what we got:CRUNCHY FRENCH TOAST - $11.95Egg brioche dipped in batter, rolled in crunchy corn flakes and grilled to perfection, topped with fresh bananas and berries, served with vanilla bean sauce.  This was delicious...I loved that it came with the vanilla bean sauce.  I didnt even have to add maple syrup!  This dish was perfect!BLUE JAM BENEDICT - $11.95 Poached eggs on a toasted English muffin with Black Forest Ham, crispy bacon, topped with hollandaise, served with potatoes.Perhaps the best Eggs Benedict I ever had.  It was nicely presented and I remember there being a lot of meat!  The hollandaise sauce was great.  Even as leftovers it was delicious!!!I would definitely love to come back and I wont mind having the exact same thing again!

Reviews.Author: Jackie T.
Reviews.Content: This rating is given due to the long wait, and somewhat hasty hostess. Lets talk about this before we touch on the good stuff.I understand that you have to keep a restaurant moving, especially when there is at least a 45 minute wait, but c'mon, do it in a pleasant manner. This hostess was friendly to my party, but I was a bit shocked on how she dealt with a family and their baby (of about 5 months old). The baby was clearly  very young, and asleep in his stroller. The family was TOLD, not asked to leave the stroller outside, and would be given a high chair for the baby. The mother explained how young her baby was, who still isn't able to sit up on his/her own. The hostess looked at her and said, "What? He can't sit up on his own?"  I was baffled and a bit disturbed. I would have left, had we not have been served at the moment. We were sitting at the tables near the door, so we overheard the entire incident. hostess, you are lucky I didn't here this before I was served. Had I heard this, the rating would have been horrible (and strictly because of her attitude, of course).Aside from this incident, 5 Stars for the food, excellent waiter service, and down-home, neighborhood gem feel. Everything was absolutely delicious and I couldn't have been more pleased with the dishes. Our server was also a doll, taking down my difficult order (and getting it right).I definitely plan on returning, and hope that the hostess is no longer working there. I can see her potentially turning away many customers.

Reviews.Author: Lillian C.
Reviews.Content: What better place to write my 200th review than Blu Jam! So I came here pretty darn early at like 10 something because we knew this place gets PACKED! We waited for only about 15 minutes before we were seated at an outside table. It was a nice sunny day out and I sat in the shade so it was nice! The server and busboy were both very attentive and helpful. I ordered an Arnold Palmer and eggwich. Let me just say, the eggwich is SO BOMB! Super flavorful and the egg was cooked perfectly so that when I bit into it it was nice and oozy. The potatoes were also nicely flavored and salted unlike other places that make potatoes bland. We also ordered a carafe of the white sangria and that was pretty good, but not sure if I'd get it again. Everyone at my table really enjoyed the food and we would come back more often if it wasn't also so  busy! I think I may even just order the eggwich to go whenever it's too crowded. Oh, and they were nice enough to give me a refill of my drink in a plastic cup to go so that I could enjoy more of my drink! Great service, delicious food, and fair prices... what more can anyone ask for?

Reviews.Author: Francis A.
Reviews.Content: After having their legendary crunchy French Toast (served w/ Crack Cocaine.. OOOPS, I mean vanilla sauce), Blu Jam easily tops my list of places to eat Breakfast not only in LA...but in all of So Cal.There are restaurants that serve amazing food.. blah blah blah... Then you run into a place like Blu Jam Cafe. Where the food itself is so damn good that it transports you to a little place called Foodie Heaven... You know that moment where you are tasting something unreal that your eyes roll back, you get chills, and you actually feel like you grew some wings because you're so high on what you're tasting? Well my Yelp friend, that's Foodie Heaven. And Blu Jam can take you there...it's an experience that's pretty hard to forget . First timers: Order the crunchy French Toast you wussy. DO it.  Two can share. THEN.. order Kamil's Breakfast. IN. Sane. It's a perfect companion to the French Toast. Then ask your companion to order the Eggs Benedict.. any style! Boom.. you are set!  We live in the OC and Kris and I will drive an hour plus in traffic, then endure a 45 minute to over an hour wait in line just to satisfy our Blu Jam cravings. Every time we come here, Kris and I feel like little kids on Christmas morning... That's where Blu Jam takes me.Hope to see you in Foodie Heaven!

Reviews.Author: Peili H.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam how I love thee. 2+ years and you're still my favorite breakfast/brunch place in SoCal. Always reliable, always consistent, can you move to San Diego?I've taken so many native and non-native Angelinos here for their virgin trip and have heard nothing but kudos for the place.  Keep up the awesome work!PS I've never had a cup of burnt coffee since my first visit here.  Thank you for listening and improving.

Reviews.Author: Jessica S.
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to love this place because all of the food around our table looked bomb, and my boyfriend loved his grilled cheese so much that he duplicated it at home. It was a 30-45 minute wait, but we expected this- it was Sunday around 12. The waiter we had was very nice, friendly, and it seemed like the rest of the staff was as well! It was like they were enjoying their work, which was a nice change of pace from other waiters I experience. The complaint I have, is that I couldn't eat my meal. I ordered an omelet with spinach, chicken and some veggies, with a salad on the side. Now, I've cooked my fair share of omelets with close to the same ingredients, and if you do it well, it's not going to be watery. My plate was so disgustingly watery that I couldn't eat it. I tried! But it really didn't even taste good. Under seasoned, under cooked. And because the omelet was watery,  I couldn't have my salad. It was warm and wilted. Talk about bad plating. The manager came over and tried to ease my mind, but she came off as rude and upset that I had sent a dish back. She continuously cut me off when I said anything was undercooked, because my plate was full of water, or juices. And she said "spinach holds a lot of water." But, it really doesn't. But this was her excuse for why my eggs were undercooked, which she refused to believe.. But homegirl didn't see my plate.And you know what, I let that roll off.. I said, okay, I'll just take her word for it. Everybody seemed to be enjoying themselves and their meals, maybe I just ordered the wrong thing.But as we walked out, the manager glared at me. She gave me the meanest, evil eyes she could muster. And for that? I probably won't be back.

Reviews.Author: Ashley V.
Reviews.Content: Ohhhh one of my favorite restaurants of all and how I miss it so (being based in northern california now)I always took my out of country guests here because it was the only restaurant they would not complain was too "oily" or too "salty" (their words for too processed).Excellent quality! Excellent tastes and a wide menu to choose from. I always ordered the Power Scramble (egg whites, tomatoes, chicken) with potatoes and my friends would order a wide variety depending on their taste buds.A sufferer of a severe tree nut allergy, I have NEVER had a problem with this place and the hostess, servers, and cooks have all been incredible.LIVELOVEMANJA absolutely LOVES !!!Manja

Reviews.Author: Melly H.
Reviews.Content: Cannot wait to come home and have the best most delicious breakfast again. Long wait but totally worth it. You can always just walk up and down the streets of Melrose shops in the meantime while you wait.

Reviews.Author: Steven H.
Reviews.Content: As a fan of brunch and great cafe food, this establishment was soon checked off my to-eat list.Just like most LA Cafe's, you must have patience to enjoy these places.  On a Saturday morning, our wait was about 30 minutes (give or take) around 11am.  There are both indoors and outdoors seating.  The interiors ambience is pretty neat as well.The food is absolutely amazing (when is brunch never?).  I had an order of the Crunch French Toast along with the Blu Jam Bennedict and breakfast quesadilla (fat ass I know).  Every single bite was absolutely astonishing.  Writing this is just making me hungry.  The service was average, given that it is a place that works the servers.  Props to them.Overall, great establishment to enjoy your brunch.  Will be back soon.

Reviews.Author: shishi s.
Reviews.Content: 3.5Florentine benedict was decent - the sundried tomatoes were overpowering. Potatoes were delicious. The crunchy french toast was very buttery.  The fruit and vanilla bean sauce make a mouthwatering combination. Chicken apple sausage tasted like cinammon and Christmas, but was kinda gross with the bits of cartilage in it. Mocha latte was deliciously fattening. I would say, not really worth the wait, and the prices are a bit high for me ($12-14 pp). Server and host were polite and gracious.  At the next table over, two annoying girls had obviously finished their meals long ago, and had their food boxed.  There were about 60 people standing outside waiting for a table, and these girls, oblivious and inconsiderate, took their sweet time.  Surprisingly, our server didn't ever rush them to leave.

Reviews.Author: Jessie F.
Reviews.Content: Good food made with fresh ingredients. Lots of vegan and healthy options.I had the "Olympus" which was made with egg whites and lots of vegetables. The service was friendly and quick as well. The parking is always a issue around Melrose. I would try to go during non-peak hours so that you don't have to wait and parking is easier to find.

Reviews.Author: Danielle M.
Reviews.Content: Wholy- eggs benedict HEAVEN. I think I've come here enough times that I've tried every version they have and I have not been disappointed yet. Seriously though, whether you're getting a breakfast platter or just some vanilla french toast- this place does not skimp on flavor. Pros: -Fresh squeezed orange juice and beautiful lattes-Brunch on a Sat/Sun- try their eggs bennedits, breakfast tacos, and their crunchy french toast (corn flakes coat this masterpice!). - Water for your pups.Cons:-You're going to have to find parking, which can be a challenge.-The wait is sometimes ridiculous- I'd suggest getting there at a non-peak hour and/or putting your name down and going for a walk down the street. I once went and the wait was over an hour- yeah... I didn't eat here then, but you can't really blame their populatiry and delicious food.Even if you're contemplating on going to this place, I suggest you try it at least once. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Author: Linda N.
Reviews.Content: Damn! I always get so caught up in the bright red review stars, try to read all the reviews and then I think about how hungry I am and my eyes glaze over. Leaving for LA from OC was a trip just like any other during the day and thankfully, parking was as random as it would be in any normal neighborhood where there are actual homes and not parking garages on every block.I came here thinking that breakfast is breakfast is breakfast. In a way, it is because of the comfort level the food provides. But here, they take quality to another level. They use organic ingredients and craft their dishes colorfully, artfully. It actually made me want to take a picture of my Norwegian Benedict. I hate taking pictures of my food, just as much as I hate taking random photos because out of context, how are you supposed to know what it's of, where it's at, what it tasted like? Anyway.The smoked salmon benedict with dill hollandaise was, whoa, damn good. The eggs were poached perfectly, the hollandaise was creamy and dill-y, the smoked salmon melted away. My friend got granola which was as fresh as granola with berries and yog could taste but all I could think about were all the other dishes I WASN'T trying. Next time.The one gripe I really had was with our service. The hostesses were unnaturally nice, and maybe it was a one-off, but our server was another story. I get that it's LA, but dude, when I ask you for a suggestion between two items on the menu (I narrowed it down for goodness sake!), don't answer with "Oh yeah. I don't know." and walk away to refill everyone else's drinks. Multiple times. Then not come back for 10 minutes at a time.Short story, try it. And read articles about the place when you're here! It can really renew your sense of community and pride for hardworking immigrants that have made the American dream their own.

Reviews.Author: Jackie D.
Reviews.Content: Oh Melrose how I need to visit thee more often! This cute little place was just what a group of ladies needed on a weekend. We had a reservation as you can make one if you are 6+. They sat us in a private little room in the back which was so nice as it was away from all the hussle and bussle. The service was attentive but spotty in terms of timing getting the food out. It was worth the wait! Passionfruit black tea and coffee were both fresh and  good.Various breakfast foods, and salads were ordered and all with great flavors. Their bread was fresh and it is served with a side of garlicy olive tampenade which was good I heard. Not partial to garlic myself...dont get me wrong, I love it, it just doesnt love me. We all shared their lemon and banana walnut nutella crepes. Both were good, but I was a fan of the lemon. Not overwhelming in flavor, subtle. I was full the rest of the day! I will definately be back when Im in the area and also heard about their one night a week dinner which is supposed to be fabulous. Overall a great choice!

Reviews.Author: Jim A.
Reviews.Content: This place is within walking distance to my home, yet my first visit was tonight. I have to say, the food is delicious and very well prepared. We had the bass, mac n cheese, short ribs and brussel sprouts. Each dish here is meant to be shared so you order what looks good and everyone digs in. Although I've had better mac n cheese, it's still pretty good. The other dishes I mentioned were at the top of their game. Perfectly cooked and seasoned. I will positively return here again. 4.5 stars from me!

Reviews.Author: Ann N.
Reviews.Content: This place was busy even at 9:45AM! There was already a wait for their delicious food especially for a Saturday morning too! Come early and feed your empty bellies ASAP! We got the Crispy French Toast and the Blu Jam benedict which were amazing! The service is amazing and they get you in fast! It's pretty neat how they ask for your phone number when you put your name down so they can text you when you're next/table is ready so you're free to roam Melrose until your time is up to indulge yourself!

Reviews.Author: Serena L.
Reviews.Content: Apparently you need to be friends with the owner to get a seat to eat in the given wait time. Or in a reasonable amount of time for that matter.  Especially on a Monday morning.  Not impressed with this place by any means.  Pretty sad really.  Make your employees accountable instead of rude and full of poor excuses.  I would recommend the Vienna Cafe across Melrose.  They have outstanding service and great food!  Thanks for driving me across the street to find a different restaurant, due to the poor treatment of your host staff.

Reviews.Author: Kristin W.
Reviews.Content: What a great place for brunch!  My husband I came on a Saturday at noon (prime brunch time) and were seating in five minutes.  We also found street parking almost immediately.   The service was friendly and the drink orders came out fast.  I got a coffee (delicious) and my husband got orange juice and a blended chai.  For our meal we got the blueberry pancakes to share along with the Kamil's Breakfast.   We had to peruse the menu twice before we saw this jewel.  The description read something like this "Pan-fried macaroni with eggs, cheddar cheese, garlic, bacon, and chives".   I'm not kidding when I say that the Kamil's Breakfast might be the best thing I have ever had for brunch  It's a treat to say the least.**The next day we were wanting to go to The Griddle Cafe on Hollywood for my husband's birthday.  The line at The Griddle was around the block.  I called Blue Jam and they said my party of 7 could be seated in 15 minutes.

Reviews.Author: Collin O.
Reviews.Content: Tucked in between bustling Melrose retail stores lies this little gem of an eatery. If the packed sidewalk tables or the 15 people waiting to in line to get a table on any given day weren't a dead give away to its deliciousness, one meal here will put all your doubts aside. This place is a treasure chest of delicious food.I have been to Blu Jam a number of times and the quality of food and service is always 5 star. The decor inside is subtle and comfortable. Wait staff is always very knowledgeable and helpful. They have a very extensive menu ranging from just about any breakfast  item you can think of to delicious soups and gourmet quality sandwiches and salads. If you can think of it, they probably have it! On my latest venture to Blu Jam cafe I had the Florentine Benedict which came with sun dried tomatoes, mushrooms and brie cheese. The eggs were PERFECTLY poached and the hollandaise  was nicely herb flavored and not overly salty(which was nice for a change). On the side were some herb potatoes that did not do much for me but were in no way bad either. They were just kind of there...yelp.com/biz_photos/ki5S…I also tried the Turkey sausage as a side dish and much to my surprise the portion was actually very generous! The sausage was spicy, salty and juicy. Casing had a really good "snap" to it as well. The flavor of the sausage was really good and well worth ordering.Seriously, the food here is really good and service is great! It's a shame that other reviewers knock them for the type of people(hipsters, scenesters, whatever the hell you are calling them these days) that patronize this business. Does it really matter and at the end of the day does even really effect the quality of your meal?I think not...

Reviews.Author: Edna T.
Reviews.Content: 10:30am Sunday Morning= 10-15 min wait* Service: very friendly and attentive* Ambiance: one of LA's hot spot * Food: nice presentation but mediocre food---especially for the high prices. - Crunch French Toast: $11.95---french toast coated with cornflakes= good concept but the french toast itself was a bit dry. The dip and fruits were really good.- Blu Jam Benedict: I didn't find anything special about this dish at all- Organic Latte: decent but served lukewarm, which turned cold real quick.There's a wide variety of food to choose from---we must've ordered the wrong dishes. oops.

Reviews.Author: Judy L.
Reviews.Content: The pluses: Mint lemon infused waterNice surroundings with local artClean restroomWhat is good but not great:The food. Had the crab cake benedict. It was good, but did not quite have enough flavor to be considered great. The crab cake was too small to fill the cibatta toast.

Reviews.Author: Denis K.
Reviews.Content: I already know I'm coming back cuz Blu Jam is FANTASTIC. The food was wonderful. The staff is excellent, uber-friendly, and attentive. BluJam is dog friendly which my puppy loved and people watched on Melrose. The Food- everyone loves and they'll recommend the Crab or BluJam Benedict. But I want to be unique. My brain was SCREAMing smoked salmon and I was right.  Gourmet Benedict had the salty flavor from the salmon, no salt needed pls.  It's so frackin' good.  I think this is one of the the BEST benedict combo I've ever had.

Reviews.Author: Vincent L.
Reviews.Content: Nice little restaurant on Melrose.  Came here specifically for the Blu Toast but, unfortunately, they don't have it anymore.  Disappointed, I got their french toast, which the waiter told me was like the Blu Toast but with yogurt instead of cream cheese.  The french toast was pretty darn good; not too sweet, flavorful, and fluffy.  I gotta say, though, that I think I would've preferred it with cream cheese.  Cream cheese, in my opinion, would've given it an extra flavor and texture to make it truly unique.I also had a chance to sample their bacon.  It was quite flavorful, albeit a bit soggy.  If you're someone who likes crispy bacon, you probably won't be satisfied.I was surprised to see that it was only half full around 1 p.m. on a Sunday.  If you don't want to have to deal with lines, come here.

Reviews.Author: Scotty E.
Reviews.Content: Spa Water, Cholula and great service, OH MY!When I first walked up to Blue Jam Cafe and saw Cholula sitting on the table I knew this was going to be a great breakfast!  I walked inside and was immediately greeted by one of the nicest hostesses I have ever met.  We were seated in under the time she quoted us outside in the beautiful weather!As soon as we sat down we were served ice cold spa water, yummmm..... The boys ordered coffee.  It was simply amazing and never empty!  The girls ordered a chai tea (amazing) and a vanilla latte which came with a cute design in the foam.  For breakfast I decided to get the Migas, which was soooo tastey!  My girlfriend got the Blu Jam Benedit which was also great with that tastey bacon on top.Our Waiter was also incredible.  Our drinks were never empty, but we were never bothered.  He was very knowledgeable about the food and had a great attitude about everything.You just cant ask for a better experience then Bu Jam!

Reviews.Author: Tracy T.
Reviews.Content: Highlights: - Breakfast, lunch, and dinner options. Vegan, Gluten free, or simply health conscious? No problem! They offer a bunch of options and you can ask them to customize if needed.  - Beet Salad - Arugula, beets, black currants, candied walnuts, citrus vinaigrette (minus goat cheese). It came in a hearty portion size and I finished it ALL. SO delicious and light! If you want bread with your salad, you'll have to ask and I recommend you do so, because the baguette bread is sliced/grilled and comes with pesto olive oil for dipping on the side. Cherry on top to my salad and my kinda salad meal! - Crunchy French Toast (Signature dish) - Get it! Different from typical french toast as it is rolled in corn flakes to give it a crispy texture. It came with slices of bananas, strawberries, and blueberries. The best was the vanilla bean sauce for dipping on the side. An interesting twist to something ordinary. I really liked it! Good to share along with another dish. - I wish I ordered a latte, so that I could have gotten fancy latte art in my cup (pictures are so pretty). I instead opted for fresh squeeze OJ. They also have plenty of other fresh squeezed juices to order (you can mix them as well). Improvements: - Extremely long wait for a party of 5 during brunch time on a Saturday! Tip: Come either really early or after lunch time to avoid waiting in line for a table.

Reviews.Author: Michael P.
Reviews.Content: There is a super long wait and the hostess/host was a bit sub par - he was a Chatty Cathy and totally did not optimize the waiting experience.  For example, we waited for 45 min and ever time a name was called, we never knew how much longer ours would take.  He should have explained that big groups and twos take shorter time than a 3 or a 4.  As for the food, we ordered 3 dishes to share - power brkfst (chicken breast, egg whites and spinach with a tomato basil sauce), the crunchy French toast (a must order) and a Sonoma salad (which was good but overpriced).  I would go back and try some of other dishes.

Reviews.Author: Jen E.
Reviews.Content: Hands down my favorite brunch spot in LA.The sign outside advertising "LA's #1 place for brunch" is a bit tacky but well-deserved.  Excellent service, variety in the menu, and reasonably priced for a truly delicious, hearty meal.  In my humble opinion, beats Toast, Doughboy's, and the like in terms of quality and overall vibe of the place in general (good crowd, friendly staff, etc.)  I can't quite place my finger on it, but something about this place makes it worth trekking just a bit further east from the usual string of brunch places on 3rd, Beverly, etc.4 stars since I'm keeping hope alive that there is a brunch spot in LA that deserves a true 5 (still looking).  But Blu Jam is definitely worth checking out.  ASAP.

Reviews.Author: Brandon A.
Reviews.Content: If you want to be trendy, eat some smoke & mirrors type of food called "organic" and pay a premium, this place is for you.  Since it's off of Melrose, parking is truly a bitch but it's free on Sunday.  My best advice is to be a sucker a pay for Valet or find a "failed" meter and park there and park for free like a champ.  We waited about 40 minutes for our food which was bullshit I thought.  They charge $4 for a small glass of OJ that they call "large" and douse their water with mint leaves and lemon to mask the LA tap water taste which I thought was pretty smart.I ordered this benedict sandwich was pretty huge actually and served on a bagel.  Served with home fries which was decent.  They give you this bread with some sort of dill/rosemary spread as an appetizer which was pretty good.Overall, environment is cool, parking is a bitch, lots of LA socialites and a bimbo looking hostess tops it off.

Reviews.Author: Hina K.
Reviews.Content: I am unsure of what made this restaurant so appealing when I walked by, but it appeared to be archetypal Los Angeles brunch locale. The patrons sitting outside were wearing the typical garb consisting of basic tees, embellished jeans, and maybe some funky accessories if they were really feeling energetic. Something was very inviting - or maybe it was because it had a sign outside that read, "Best Breakfast in LA." Now, I am one who usually writes off restaurants that boast their popularity via garrish signage atop their establishment.Nonetheless, my friend and I went inside, and were pleasantly surprised by the ambiance. The high ceilings helped give the feeling of space - which is necessary because the tables are very close to one another. As for food, I like to stick to the basics, so I just ordered the breakfast special. The French toast was very tasty, so I didn't feel the need to drench it in syrup. The bacon was the perfect consistency - not too crispy and very juicy. Finally the eggs - I have to say that I was so full from the French toast and bacon, that I could scarcely swallow another bite. They tasted good, but next time I would order a side of toast or the potatoes as I am not a fan of eating eggs straight up. Finally - the drinks! My boyfriend is a sucker for the vanilla latte, and could not stop ranting and raving about it after he left. I ordered one of the loose-leaf teas (it was chocolate-infused - can't remember the flavor), and the chai latte amongst my many visits. I have to say that I love the latte art, but neither of the teas were impressive. Quite frankly - Starbucks does tea better. I think the lattes are enjoyable though, but I would say that a coffee connoisseur might say otherwise. I have read many reviews about the questionable service, and I would say that the restaurant is so packed that it is hard to get really good service, but I was never truly offended by the service either. The first time I went there, I sat next to a director, and he got GREAT service (from the owner's wife).

Reviews.Author: Garrett P.
Reviews.Content: There's always a line of people spilling into the street in front of Blu Jam Cafe, so when I was driving by one day we decided to stop by and try it out.  The grub was pretty excellent - the Eggs Benedict in particular were a hit with me.  The coffee's good, the scrambles, steak and eggs...pretty much everything we tried was pretty tasty.  One major complaint though: the potatoes.Potatoes are served with practically every dish, so seems like you, as a restaurant, should have that thing down, right?  Your potatoes should be something you're pretty proud of, something you're serving to everyone.  Problem is, Blu Jam Cafe's potatoes are straight-up bitter.  I don't know how you make potatoes bitter, but they were just plain off.  Blu Jam, work on your potato skills, then I'll be back much more frequently to get my grub on.

Reviews.Author: Becky A.
Reviews.Content: RARE SEARED AHI TUNA SALAD!!!! :D I don't usually eat salads but omg.... when i took one look at the menu this caught my eye!! :D ahaha I've been eating a lot of fattening foods lately so I thought eh, why not have a diet day ^^ We drove around like literally 5 -6 times looking for a parking spot --" Dang my Mr. was so determined to eat here lol... The service was amazing and our waiter was awesome he treated us as if we were regulars here.... well one of us is *ahem* I'll definitely be back to try the salad with the steak~ mmmm sounds good (:

Reviews.Author: Graciela G.
Reviews.Content: All the Yelp love led me to Blu Jam. I was going to the Grove anyway so it wasn't out of my way. I biked there and found racks all over the street. Easier than driving, no doubt. The wait was pretty much unbearable (almost an hour for a table of 2). Everyone in line kept saying that it was worth the wait. I disagree.I ordered the Burgundy omelet and it was pretty flavorless.The side of potatoes were horrible. I am the kind of person that puts salt on everything but these potatoes were too salty even for me (no, I didn't add any). My bf said his tasted fine. So they must not be consistent in their seasoning. The good were the iced coffee and the bread the meal came with. I'm not sure if they make or buy the bread but it was fine bread.Look, I would probably think about giving the place another chance if it wasn't for the wait. There seemed to be other things on the menu that looked interesting. But when you factor in the time spent vs the food I got, I would have rather gone to Bloom Cafe on Pico or even made it to my beloved Foxy's in Glendale (would have taken just as long to drive over there). I just don't think this place is worth the time. Certainly not the best breakfast place in LA. Mine is the minority opinion here but do think about how you want to spend your time if you've got other plans. The ones that love it will wait no matter what. Those who haven't been here before may just be gambling their time and meal away.

Reviews.Author: Ernest Y.
Reviews.Content: A long overdue review. Blu Jam I wish you were closer to my house or else you'll see me every so often. You happen to be one of my favorite breakfast place as of now. There isn't that many legit breakfast place around LA but Blu Jam happens to be one of my favorite place for breakfast/brunch.Service was great and food was good! Got the vanilla french toast which I happen to love! :) I thought it had a little crisp to it but being fluffy at the same time which makes it excellent. Side of syrup on the side to make it just the right taste.I remember having a bite of the burger from my friend and it happened to be a lot better than I expected because I didn't expect the burger to be that tasty for a breakfast place. The meat was cook right and not dry and I remember the bread being fluffy the way I like it. :) Not the best burger I had but it was good enough. What I really wanted from Blu Jam was actually the mocha. I heard that you can get whatever designs you want and I got super excited as I really wanted the Panda design on my mocha coffee. My waiter hinted to me that "this is not the right guy to make designs for your coffee." As I got really disappointed by the fact that I got a really regular and simple design for my mocha but the taste was good. The mocha was just the way I like it possibly even better than I imagined as Sugar Rush(another breakfast place) used to be this good but I can only come here for mocha now. I SWEAR THE NEXT TIME I COME BACK I WILL GET MY PANDA DESIGN MOCHA!

Reviews.Author: Adaeze N.
Reviews.Content: No reservations taken so  as far as i know, it's a half hour to an hour wait on weekend afternoons.Service: albeit a bit slow, pretty good. the servers are babes and the busboys are wicked attentive.Food: lots of vegetarian options and a good amount of terrific nonveg options as well. The menu can be healthy, oily, exotic or homestyle-depending on what you order. I had some kind of bacon breakfast sandwich and a chai latte, both of which were to die for. Ambience: outside patio is ok. to be honest it's small, crowded and in full view of the starving masses who are waiting outside for a table to free up. it's a little creepy having everyone and their little dogs staring you down while you're trying ton eat. also it's on melrose so it's a bit noisy. inside however, is A-ok with a decent casual ambience and nice big windows for sunlight to filter in. great place for breakfast/brunch/lunch.Price: moderate-price. it's hollywood so... you know.

Reviews.Author: Kim V.
Reviews.Content: No wonder there is a line to get in here!I met some friends here for brunch and the first thing one friend said was, "the french toast here is amazing, and I don't usually order french toast".So what did I do? I ordered the brunch burger! BUT, my bf and other friend ordered the vanilla french toast and the crispy french toast. That was a surprise because the bf never orders sweet breakfast options, often opting for a savory meal. Anyhoo, with both in front of us, we had a "french toast off" and the unanimous verdict: vanilla french toast had the best flavor, but the crispy french toast had better texture.My burger was awesome. Medium, the way I like it with a medium over egg. The side potatoes were a little too salty, but overall, very filling and delicious. Yay for having friends in LA to have an excuse to have brunch with!

Reviews.Author: HP M.
Reviews.Content: I don't know what all the hype is about. Waited an hour and half for a table (not sure why the crowd, food is very OK). And the food was COLD. Tried the french toast that came highly recommended, very ok, maybe would have been better if it was warm.

Reviews.Author: Katherine T.
Reviews.Content: The Crunchy French Toast is the thing to order.  You'd be fine (or more than fine) just ordering that for a meal or to share among friends. It comes with fruit, powdered sugar and vanilla bean sauce to drizzle on top.

Reviews.Author: Ian M.
Reviews.Content: Just an FYI- this place is AWESOME.  No matter what you get (yes yes, the french toast is superb, but theres so much more on the menu and it is ALL worth your exploration!), you are not only in for a great TASTE experience, you're in for a great personal experience.  The staff is SO awesome, and so laid back, and so intent on making sure that even at their busiest, you feel taken care of, you're gonna wanna come back.

Reviews.Author: Anthony B.
Reviews.Content: Food is real good and all fancy sounding. The setting is so ******* trendy like seriously so ******* trendy the table next to me was talking about signing Kaskade to something which was weird bc they did not look like they were about that life. But yeah, good food, good service, hot waiters, and a whole bunch of LA trendiness

Reviews.Author: Liza R.
Reviews.Content: Review is for the Breakfast Menu.4 stars to wait staff for being friendly and attentive.3 stars for their Signature Dish - Crunchy French Toast. It was different and yummy. The fruit thrown on top looked like an afterthought. A bit more fruit would have been nice. From menu: Egg brioche dipped in batter, rolled in crunchy corn flakes and grilled to perfection, topped with fresh bananas and berries, served with vanilla bean sauce. 2 stars overall though because of the other dishes we had and a manager at a loss for words. Steak and Eggs we ordered as well done steak and firm egg but came out as red steak, runny eggs and burnt potatoes. The potatoes came back a second time as burnt. The manager came over and said they make their potatoes crispy. Someone in my party showed her the burnt black side of the potato and the manager didn't respond at that point except to tell us she would bring out another Steak and Eggs. We declined. The Roma Via Paris - scrambled eggs with veggies. The eggs were watery and not appetizing. According to the American Egg Board, this occurs because the eggs are cooked at too high a temperature too quickly or the scrambled eggs become completely overcooked.The rest of the menu looks enticing but I won't be coming back. It seems the cooks at this busy spot have the stoves up too high and are rushing the food out too fast. At $10.95 + for breakfast dishes I think I can find better.

Reviews.Author: billy l.
Reviews.Content: I'm glad this place is walking distance and I love breakfast!

Reviews.Author: Julia K.
Reviews.Content: I swung by here for breakfast with my sister-in-law.  I designed my own omelet and she ordered the Rancheros.  We both asked for egg whites and she added chicken to her plate.  Overall, I liked my plate.  But then again, it wasn't that complicated.  I got an egg white omelet with avocado, chicken sausage, onions and chives.  I do want to try the crunchy french toast -- that looked sinfully delicious.  Also, the coffee was darn good.What prevents this from being 5 stars?Cost -- it's pricey for what it is.  The sister-in-law's plate was nearly $18.  Egg whites and adding chicken tipped it over to nearly $20.  A little cray.Service -- considering we were there on a random weekday and the place was nearly empty, service was a bit slow at first although it did eventually get better.Overall, good food and cute cafe.  It's on Melrose so I can guess parking is terrible on weekends or later in the day but for us it was free and clear.

Reviews.Author: Ethan G.
Reviews.Content: It was an a treat having brunch today.  No muss, no fuss, just a really good experience.  Very good food and great service.  Great hamburger...thanks for putting it on  ciabatta bread (which was great in itself).

Reviews.Author: One-M-and- M.
Reviews.Content: Long lines (every single time) but outstanding food.  Vegan and meat-eater friendly.   In my two trips, I've gotten the vegan burger and the vegan tacos (a special ).  Both were amazing.  Great Cali nosh on trendy Melrose Blvd.

Reviews.Author: Angie K.
Reviews.Content: Pass pass pass, average food. Make your way down to California chicken cafe on Melrose. Cheaper and better. But anyways. The service was awful took forever to order and to get our food. Their was 10 people working but only 2 serving. Go figure. I got a panini and honestly I would rather eat subway. It was pretty gross and their was a hair in my fruit. The server didn't even apologize about it. You'll be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Lindsey H.
Reviews.Content: This place kind of sucks. The first impression of this place was that it was pretty cute. We go up to look at the menu & are stopped my this woman who looked like a less hot version of Chantal from last season of America's Next Top Model asking us very quietly if we wanted a table there. "Uh, I don't know, we're going to take a look at the menu." Menu looks fine, so we say what the hell.She escorts us into a rather small, but nicely decorated room filled with Hollywood dickbags. The skinny blonde girls who are pushing their food around the plate, the skinny blonde dudes wearing those terrorist scarfs, skinny jeans, huge shoes & sunglasses even though they are inside. Yeah, whatever.  I guess that's who you cater to when you're located directly in the heart of Hollywood. Anyway, on to the food. I order the Salmon & Greens salad which sounds pretty good & reasonably priced. Man-friend orders the Muscle Beach which is an egg white omelette with spinach & some other junk. It seems like its taking forever to get our food, which probably wasn't true, I was just starving, but in that time I realized that the servers don't actually do anything. Our waitress basically just took our order, she didn't bring us anything. Which I'm not complaining about at all, just a random observation.So, a food runner brings us our food. His looks good, mine... a tiny piece of salmon thats charred black on one side & RAW in the middle. Damnit. I'm STARVING. I get our server's attention, I tell her my dilemma, & she's really sweet about it. I hate HATE sending food back, but it wasn't a problem , thank god. I get my salad back in about 5 minutes. It's ok. It's swimming in salad dressing, & my salmon, even though it doesn't look burnt, still tastes like it is. I still ate the whole thing. I was hungry! I probably wont be coming back, but it's far away & these types of places are a dime a dozen.

Reviews.Author: Jeffrey O.
Reviews.Content: As a breakfast connoisseur, I'm confident in saying that Blu Jam cafe is one of the best for an LA brunch.I've been to Blu Jam twice thus far, for Sunday brunch and both times have been excellent.Although service is a tad slow, who can blame them considering how busy they are.  The menu has a lot of choices, the coffee is delicious, and it has a great crowd of diverse people.  It's small and cozy and the food is just great.  I would recommend the Eggwich or the Breakfast Quesadila - both are delicious.  Prices are reasonable as well.I imagine parking woudl be quite difficult after 11:00am on a weekend or during the week, but if you go Sunday before 10:00 you should be fine.Great date place, great to bring a few friends - all around great LA restaurant.Tip:  Dont' be afraid to try some of the more non-traditional dishes - this place won't disappoint.Visit sixtaste.com/blog for more reviews.

Reviews.Author: Ming C.
Reviews.Content: Amazing.  -1 star for the expensive and not so good fresh squeezed OJ and the wait, but everything else was just amazing.  I ordered the Eggwich, which is over easy eggs, strips of crispy smoked bacon, fresh avocado,sliced tomatoes, lettuce, pesto & mayo on a toasted ciabatta,served w/ potato.  Oh my, I seriously just licked my entire plate clean.  My gf ordered the Kamil's Breakfast which is essentially mac'n'cheese with a twist of bacon and eggs and it was very yummy, but a little too heavy for me.  Nevertheless, will definitely come back

Reviews.Author: Lynne H.
Reviews.Content: For my birthday, I wanted to be adventurous and try out a new brunch spot. Hooray for Yelp because I came across Blu Jam and it was a happy birthday brunch indeed.A little bit of wait but worth it. Cute little place, totally packed. I ordered the smoked salmon egg benedict with dill. Devoured! What a brilliant idea to use crossiant instead of the usual english muffin! It's more fattening but makes everything taste so much better. And then of course we ordered their famous Blu Jam french toast to share. It's honestly sinnful heaven. I would not order it for a meal..all you need is two bites and you're done. But it is a must-try!I can't wait to go back here and try their other brunches!

Reviews.Author: Donna F.
Reviews.Content: Breakfast here is pretty good...My favorite is the Le Paris omelette with goast cheese and spinach...I also like the eggs benedict and french toast.I have yet to try their dinner menu...

Reviews.Author: Karen L.
Reviews.Content: Another successful brunch spot! We took a gf to Blu Jam for a birthday brunch and we all walked out of there quite happy. There was a 20 minutes wait, but for a Sunday morning on Melrose, I guess that has to be expected. As usual, I could not decide between salty and sweet, so I ordered two entrees - a make your own scramble (with ham, onions, green peppers and sausage) and an order of french toast topped with an assortment of fruit and berries. Mmmm.... heaven! One of my favorite parts of a good breakfast is the quality/taste of the potatoes and Blu Jam's potatoes did not disappoint. Though, I must say, the coffee was nothing spectacular. Boohoo. Service was excellent and the manager stopped by our table several times to make sure we were doing okay. Yes we were! Next stop, Cafe Vienna across the street.

Reviews.Author: Gily J.
Reviews.Content: Two words, "Frickin'" and "Delicious."  Walked in with my fam really early on a Saturday morning, @ 8:30, had a hair appointment at 9 around the corner, so I tried to sneak in a little breakfast.  There were a few diners there, the owner was around with his family and baby in tow, which gave it a real homey and comfy kinda' feel.  I told the waitress of my time constraint and unbeknownst to myself, ordered the "Lost Bread," which takes the longest to make  (of course it does) out of all the orders which we placed, according to the owner, 15 minutes or so.  However, just like the star quarterback 10 seconds before the 4th Quarter ends, they came through in a clutch.  My order came out with 5 seconds to spare.  "It will compromise the flavor" the owner warned.  I'll' be the judge of that.  "Lost Bread" Definition: French toast topped with seasonal fruit and powdered sugar, served with pure Vermont maple syrup. One of the best French Toast concoctions I've ever eaten, not too eggy, great bread, the fruit the maple syrup, all the flavors dancing the macarena in my mouth.  This is what happens when you rush it?? Wow.  Blu Jam Cafe, great food and super accommodating.  The Coffee was great.  Nothing worse than good food and bad coffee.  Nothing was compromised in my opinion, but it's hard to F*ck up quality food and good service.

Reviews.Author: stephanie m.
Reviews.Content: Wow, thank goodness for internet on my cell & to yelp for finding this place. We drove to hollywood with my family to take them to a yummy breakfast place and the wait was... 2 hours, i kid you not (yea... its pretty darn good). So since we were all starving and not about to wait 2 hours for breakfast, I found this little place on yelp, reviews were great, 3 blocks away from the other place, the wait was 20 mins (if even that!), we were sold. Friendly hostess sat us at our table & gave us menus. Customer service, by the way, was excellent. Everything we ordered was deelish:Amazing Lattes!!  vanilla lattes, chai tea latte--YUM & YUMFood: Crepes, Omelets, french toast, macaroni & cheese scrambled eggs (?) that my hubby ordered...strange and yet amazingly good. You get the picture. We'll be coming back!

Reviews.Author: Francine K.
Reviews.Content: Yelpers, you don't lie! Blue Jam made a very tasty brunch well into the afternoon last Sunday. I got the Roma via Paris, which was a very tasty scramble, and a chai latte, which came with an absolutely adorable design in the top -- little trees and a sun -- and was very tasty. We sat out on the patio and our waiter was friendly and quick. I could have dealt without the smokers, especially the guy with a cigar who kept wandering around and yelling at the two women I think he was with. Definitely a solid breakfast spot that'll serve you no matter what time you get up on the weekends.

Reviews.Author: T R S.
Reviews.Content: I brought my boyfriend here because he's huge on breakfast, and we had to try the "best breakfast in LA." We were both very disappointed, and I really, really wanted to like it here. COMPLETELY overrated!Our waitress was wonderful, the place was so cute and cozy, and the prices were more than reasonable. Everything on the menu sounded so delicious.I ordered the eggs with mushroom, spinach and cheese with fruit. My bf ordered the CA omelette (I think it was called?) with potatoes, and we shared a pancake. I liked the fact that there were lots of good vegetarian options. My food was lukewarm. It was so disappointing. I think it's because they told my bf at the last minute that they were out of chorizo (he ordered a different dish originally) so he ordered something else. My food may have been sitting out for a while. Regardless of my food being two minutes away from cold, the flavor was just alright. It was nothing like I would have expected from all of these reviews! I know I could have a similar dish that tastes just as good if not better elsewhere.My bf said his omelette was alright, but he wouldn't go back for one. I tried some of his potatoes, and, Dear Lord, they were STALE. I swear they were little rocks! He'll tell you the same thing!As for the pancake, it was way too heavy. Our waitress said they taste like donuts, and she wasn't kidding. It was like a large, flat, fried cake donut. I was also disappointed with the fake maple syrup, aka corn syrup. The best breakfast in LA should have real maple syrup, man!!I really just didn't get it. I thought it was funny, though, that there was a massive chalkboard with the yelp.com logo asking everyone to write a review!Anyway, I won't come back. Next time I'll just go to the Griddle.

Reviews.Author: Sharon P.
Reviews.Content: I came here for breakfast awhile ago and I can't really remember what I had, but it was pretty good. The restaurant itself is not that big, but they have good service. I know this place is like one of the it breakfast places of LA but to be honest, I am not a big breakfast person and I think eggs and pancakes usually tastes the same wherever I go... But I do enjoy the people I am with whenever I go to these places~It's kind of on the pricey side for a breakfast place. I think I ended up paying like $20 for a plate and a cup of latte. But it IS Melrose...

Reviews.Author: Jane H.
Reviews.Content: Wonderful restaurant in every way! Came here memorial day about 9am and it was busy but we got seated right away and the waiter came to help us right after with everything. The waiters were all very helpful, making sure we had enough  water and filling up my VERY delicious organic coffee when it was halfway down. I got the Norwegian Benedict, which included salmon, steamed spinach, cooked tomatoes on country bread toast and poached eggs with hollandaise sauce. The entire thing was extremely flavorful and very filling. My friend got the cripsy french toast which were covered with brown sugar, served with blueberries, bananas, strawberries, and very sweet but great texture and definitely worth getting again. The person on the table over got a hamburger which looked perfect so I'm going back to try some lunch.

Reviews.Author: AJ F.
Reviews.Content: Get here early because this place is hot!  Luckily my husband and I beat the crowd here on a Sunday morning, but it would be worth the wait.  We had the Le Paris Omelette and the Crepes with Giradelli dark chocolate, bananas & candied walnuts.  Both were stellar.The service was friendly and though, very busy - appropriately attentive.  My only complain, which fairly I have about many LA restaurants, is that it is a bit noisy.GO HERE!

Reviews.Author: Christine Y.
Reviews.Content: Met my friend here for brunch on a Saturday.  I had read through some Yelp reviews beforehand so I was pretty sure that I wanted to try the brioche french toast, but I also wanted something savory so was planning on ordering a side of bacon.  I like to be prepared when going to a new restaurant. When I got there, I saw that they had this "Breakfast Deal" on the menu, which included two eggs, two French toast and bacon.  After confirming with the waiter that the French toast would indeed be brioche french toast, I decided to get that instead with a side of fruit.The brioche french toast was SO good that I wish I had gone with my original plan and ordered a full plate of it!  At least now I know for future reference.

Reviews.Author: Lissy K.
Reviews.Content: I was so excited when I saw the Shrimp Mazaltan Scramble had returned as a special. Well it arrived at the table covered in white cheese and not quite looking like itself. Then I stuck my fork in it and realized this once great $15 dish was now barely edible. Boo Blu Jam. That dish tasted like the chef got sick and the dishwasher made it.WTF?!? Los Angeles is the capital of taking something great, fucking it up and serving it in a cheese cloak.

Reviews.Author: Joyce L.
