Reviews.Content: Words can't describe how good this place is!  I've never had such good breakfast/brunch before.  My friend and I tried this place out a couple of months ago while we were on vacation in SoCal.  We found this place on Yelp and decided to give it a try.  We came around 11am on a Sunday and probably waited for almost 30 minutes to get seated.  The restaurant is small but it has this cozy and friendly atmosphere which I enjoyed.  I got the french toast with fruits on top which I thought was awesome.  It had this great texture to it.  It was one of the best french toast i've had for a while.  My friend got scramble eggs with like mushrooms, cheddar, onions, tomatoes and potatoes on the side.  It looked really good.The dishes are big.  It definitely fills you up.  The service was great.  If I come back to SoCal I definitely will come back again.

Reviews.Author: Candice L.
Reviews.Content: Yummy!Came here for breakfast on a Saturday morning, and the wait for 5 ladies wasn't very long! We even got a semi-private room in the back. =) But it looks like that may have been the only "large group" table there. The other tables were for smaller groups and pretty close to each other.. but it's LA, right?The place was nice, though I remember wondering what the leaves were in the water (Don't take it out, it's "flavor"!). Service was quick and our server was super nice! I wish I remembered her name... oh well.I decided to go with the Eggs Benedict after reading all the Yelp reviews and even asking the server what she recommended. It was super filling! After having given a portion to everyone to try, I still managed to have leftovers.I think the best dish, though, was definitely the french toast. Despite the good reviews, I decided not to get it because I really don't care for french toast. I wish I had listened to everyone! My friend ordered it, and I kept wanting more. Really doesn't taste like your normal french toast, though it's nothing "fancy". It's just super yummy! I suggest getting that, if you want to try something different. But it is sweet. =)Prices were decent. I'd def come back again.. someday!I took a picture of my eggs benedict, but it seriously looks the same as the ones already posted. You'll know what to expect!

Reviews.Author: Stephanie C.
Reviews.Content: I loved this place for breakfast/brunch! Our waitress was very friendly and gave great suggestions on what to get. Between my mom, brother, and I, we got:-vanilla french toast-salmon benedict-and the roma scramble All three were very tasty and delicious! After reading such great reviews about the crunchy french toast, I was kind of disappointed that it is only served on weekends and that I didn't get to try it. My brother was a little disappointed when his latte didn't have any designs on it as well but it was still very delicious. The place is small and cozy with great food and a phenomenal staff! I will definitely come back when I visit LA again.

Reviews.Author: jenbug l.
Reviews.Content: My friend recently treated me to brunch here for an early bday celebration and it was delicious!  We parked in a residential area and it wasn't that difficult on a Saturday morning...There was a bit of a wait but I think we were already aware of that after reading several reviews.  So what did we eat? We ordered the caprese sandwich with red potatos and we also shared the crunchy french toast topped with berries and bananas and a side of vanilla cream.  Tasted like a big orgy in your mouth! My girlfriend was quiet for most of brunch...thats how yummy it was.  The hostess was very sweet, the service was great..even the busboys were friendly...But i'm taking away one star because my gf's orange juice was $5. Really? $5? yea i'm taking into account that it was probably fresh squeezed but thats still kinda overpriced...But other than that I'd definitely make another trip out here :)

Reviews.Author: Natalie C.
Reviews.Content: Excellent spot for a great latte! The cute little foam design also made my breakfast that much better. I ordered the florentine benedict, which was very good. It came with spinach, brie cheese, mushrooms, and their florentine sauce (I think?). Mushrooms were incredible. So much flavor ah! It also came with a side of breakfast potatoes, which were also just as yummy. My boyfriend ordered from the special weekend brunch menu--he got the crunchy french toast. Of course, just as stated in the name, the french toast was delightfully crunchy and accompanied with strawberries, bananas, and these amazing vanilla sauce--instead of syrup.All in all, it was a lovely brunch right before our day at the Getty! I don't think I'd try the benedict again, not that it wasn't any good, but it was a very typical item on the menu. The person next to me ordered this scramble that had mac n cheese fried in with the eggs and the breakfast quesadilla. They're pretty innovative with their menu, I regret not ordering something more unique!There was just one downer: it does get extremely crowded on the weekends. They don't take reservations for brunch, and when I called earlier to inquire about the wait time, they couldn't tell me how long it was until I got there. If you ever do go on a weekend, just expect to have a 20+ min wait.

Reviews.Author: Jackie D.
Reviews.Content: Finally went to BJC today after waiting foreverrr. I really wanted to get the crunchy french toast, but didn't want to go into mega carb coma since I'm going to Griddle Cafe tomorrow...so I decided on the Roma via Paris scramble and it did not disappoint!It was a pretty decent sized scramble with lots of veggies (zucchini, tomatoes, spinach AND sundried tomatoes = yummy!) and the cheese that was mixed in was perfect. They ran out of rosemary bread which was a bummer, but sourdough is my fav anyways :). I had the fresh fruit instead of the potatoes and the fruit bowl was so fresh! There was even some kiwi!! Friend had the veggiewich which was HUGE and the crispy potatoes on the side just added to it so neither of us finished our meals.The only thing I wish was that there was fresh jam with my toast, not just a Smuckers container, but everything else is so good that it doesn't matter. Can't wait to come back to try the french toast :)

Reviews.Author: Lisa S.
Reviews.Content: What better way to start a Monday then by heading with your girlfriends for brunch at a cafe that makes cute little design on your latte...It was such a beautiful sunny day with cool breeze so should have requested outside seating but as busy as this place was, I'd be happy with sitting any where. I pursued the reviews and based my decision to eat here based off the photos. Luckily for me, I chose well as this place was totally what I had expected it to be!While I understand they don't take reservations during the day, it's cool they are doing bistro style dinner where you can make reservations and the menu would be completely different! I have to make a trip for that!  Upon receiving our food, we ladies looked up from our plates and while our eyes met; we just knew. This was our new go to place for brunch and that it was be every weekend, either Saturday or Sunday. We decided we could go every week so they would recognize our faces and get to know us because we want to get preferred seating! hahaha....yea right! Okay I know that's not what you guys want to hear so about the food; it was amazing although I would have liked my steak more medium than rare. One of my poached eggs was fully cooked which has not ever happened to me whenever I ordered. My friend had crunchy french toast? I think I would order that next time I go but I would order an extra dish because I couldn't eat all that sugary carb. Overall.....best start to a beautiful day. It's now our new ritual!

Reviews.Author: Adam C.
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable french toast and brunch overall.  The wait can be long but totally worth it.  Everybody knows about their awesome brunch, but we stopped by for dinner on a random night and it was equally impressive.  Dishes are more along the lines of small tapas style which allows you to try multiple items on the menu.  Again, the most amazing crunchy french toast I've had in LA thus far. Definitely preferred it over The Griddle.

Reviews.Author: Gene K.
Reviews.Content: This is another LA staple for breakfast/brunch. This is on my top 10 list for breakfast spots in the city. It can get pretty crowded so come early to start your day well. Once it hits 11am on a Sunday morning it can get packed.Pretty much this is a gourmet breakfast place at very reasonable prices. I ended up having the fresh banana pancakes and that was some good stuff. As sweet as a cake!And of course riding down by bike is more easier than driving and looking for parking. There are some bike stalls on the sidewalk to park your bike as well.  Definitely this is a good spot to go.

Reviews.Author: William T.
Reviews.Content: Wow what a great brunch place! The place was packed; we were lucky to have only waited 10 minutes.  We shared the Olympian (6 egg whites, grilled chicken, greens, toast) and the fresh banana pancakes.  I must say the best brunch I've ever had!  The portions are huge and everything was delicious!

Reviews.Author: Evelyn S.
Reviews.Content: Checked this place out after all these positive reviews, and it was definitely DELICIOUS! I ordered the Wraps on Fire, which is a breakfast burrito with eggs, cheese, peppers, onions, tomatoes, etc etc. I liked how the tortilla was thin so it didn't overpower all the ingredients inside, and allowed me to really taste all the vegetables. It was a bit spicy, but I definitely loved it!The bf got the Venetian Chicken sandwich, and it definitely filled him up! The best part of his dish though, were the RUSTIC POTATOES. They were perfectly seasoned and makes you want more and more!Came out to be $30 for two, but with these huge portions, it was definitely worth it! The atmosphere is amazing because it's quite the artistic cafe. If you go on a good, Sunny day, definitely sit outside!

Reviews.Author: Alisa S.
Reviews.Content: Come hungry, but don't come too hungry because there's always a  wait and you're liable to pass out.I'm addicted to the crunchy corn flake french toast.  I crave it and I dream about it.Drool.

Reviews.Author: Tracy S.
Reviews.Content: Warning: Do not go hungry. If you are, bring a snack.I came here on Sunday at around 11:30AM and didn't get seated until a little over an hour. I expected there to be a wait so I wasn't too upset, but I did feel like I was gonna pass out from hunger.I ordered:1. Blu Jam Benedict - It is ham and bacon served on top of a croissant instead of English muffins. I enjoyed this dish but it didnt exactly wow me. I did actually prefer the croissant though. The Hollandaise sauce was good--not too tangy like some other places I've tried. Good amount of meat. I opted for a side of fruit, which was fresh and sweet. You can opt for potatoes as well.2. Crunchy French Toast - The plating of this dish was super pretty. It's called crunchy because there are little pieces of frosted flakes on the toast. It also comes with scattered fruits.The toast itself was really moist and soft. However, if it wasn't for the condensed milk dip and frosted flakes, I thought the toast was pretty flavorless.If you plan to go, make sure you don't have plans right after lunch because you probably wont make it. I also recommend valeting because it doesnt make sense to street park with the wait. There are a few shops on the street to stroll around while waiting.

Reviews.Author: Derek J.
Reviews.Content: Went to this place on a Sunday after church.  We waited a long time but we heard the place was good so we didn't mind.  I ordered the french toast and my friend had the Migas.  My french toast was very good but it was not the best I've ever had.  For that I'd have to give the nod to Marston's in Pasadena.  Yeah I know I'll probably get a lot of heat for saying that but I really think Marston's french toast is better.  I like the way Marstons uses sourdough bread and the cornflakes taste crispier.  I want to go back to this place so I can try other dishes.Service was prompt and our waiter was very attentive considering it was very busy. One thing I also must note is that part of Melrose ave is kind of run down and dirty.  The sidewalks are filled with old gum and stains.

Reviews.Author: Eileen K.
Reviews.Content: Always a great experience here. Came at about 11 on a Friday for some brunch with a girlfriend, and there was no wait! I ordered the Morning Hash with a soy chai latte, and both were delicious. The Morning Hash was really really good, but the potatoes in the scramble were kind of plain and didn't add much to the dish. My friend got a Roma...something or other scramble, which was delicious too. The goat cheese really gave it a nice flavor.By the time we left, all the stores had already opened so the wonderful meal was topped off with some wonderful shopping :)

Reviews.Author: Steve T.
Reviews.Content: Steak Hash (only available on weekends I believe), crispy french toast and the only place I know of that serves banana bread beer. This place was by far the best brunch I have ever had. The wait is definitely long and there isn't really a designated spot while you wait for your table but definitely worth the hour or so time frame. One of the places you have to eat at if you're an out-of-towner.

Reviews.Author: HourLy L.
Reviews.Content: ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!  I always order some kind of eggs benedict here.  Crunchy French Toast is a must!Yay:-eggs benedict.  The Norwegian Benedict is my favorite so far-crunchy french toast: always get this to share with the table-breakfast burger: great for when you're craving lots of meat and starving-location: since there can be a wait, I love that they're next to so many shops.  I was able to shop at neighboring stores before I got called to be seated.Nay: -location: Parking can be a hassle.  It's street parking or valet.  -It's always busy so there can be a long wait

Reviews.Author: Shreya O.
Reviews.Content: This is one of my top 2 favorite brunch places in LA (the other being Aroma Cafe). There's a reason there's generally a line out the door. The wait is well worth it, though.Here are my favorites:- Crunchy French Toast (rolled in corn flakes, topped with fresh banana and berries & served with vanilla bean sauce)- Garden Panini (goat cheese, mushrooms, mozzarella, sun-dried tomatoes, caramelized onions, roasted red peppers and pesto on grilled focaccia- Tofu Scramble with sundried tomatoes, goat cheese, avocado, spinach & caramelized onions. I love that this place offers a tofu scramble because I don't eat egg dishes and I love savory brunches.

Reviews.Author: Susie P.
Reviews.Content: So I am always on the lookout for the best french toast and this place is the top on my list in LA. (My favorite place is in philly, Sabrina's cafe) I came here on a tuesday, and I guess I hit a lucky day cause they only have their french toast on saturdays. AWESOME!!the steak and eggs here are so good as well. The steak especially.

Reviews.Author: Kheng C.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love everything about this little cafe.  Blu Jam has a very jazzy feel to it and is decorated with artwork all around the wall. This place is not very big and based on the number of positive reviews.....the expect wait is about  45 minutes to an hour long....but completely worth the wait! The food here is delicious and is very well presented. I have nothing bad to say except great things about this place. The food we ordered: Crunchy French Toast - delicious  Blu Jam Benedicts Breakfast Risotto Steak HashEverything we got was delicious delicious delicious!!!!!!!  Can't wait to go back again (^_^)

Reviews.Author: Kristy K.
Reviews.Content: No wonder this place is so popular! I had the vanilla french toast and it was amazing. The toast wasn't too sweet or heavy on the stomach. The banana, strawberries and blueberries complemented the toast very well. I didn't really notice the vanilla pudding though. I tried some of my friend's gourmet burger and it was good too. Lots of meat on a slightly crunch bun. The green mayo-y sauce was interesting.My other friend had the breakfast quesadilla was was also very good but hard to eat. I really liked the mix of avocado, spinach, tomatoes and eggs. Would definitely go again.

Reviews.Author: M K.
Reviews.Content: OMGOMGOMGThe most amazing french toast I've ever had in my life. EVER. EVEREVERThey're like fluffy bread clouds sandwiched between heavenly jam...dusted with fairy dust (powdered sugar) and garnished with sweet, delectable fruit......mmmmmI want to marry the owner of this place and eat here every day for the rest of my life.Oh, and Jason, one of the waiters, IS AMAZING! Love that guy :)

Reviews.Author: Liang W.
Reviews.Content: I'd be lying if I said I didn't leave Blu Jam Cafe wanting a little more, but I'd also be lying if I said I didn't have some solid food here as well.Dinner, just for your information, is served tapas style, with plates meant for sharing.  I found the prices a little too high and the portions too small.  Plates average $10 - $15 but you'll definitely need a few to fill up.  We, a party of 2, got (4) plates to share: Mushroom Risotto, Burrata & Strawberries, Ahi Tuna Tartar and white asparagus.  Mushroom Risotto - favorite dish of the night.  Of course, it uses Black Truffle Oil, and when can you really go wrong with that? I mean right?!Burrata & Strawberries - the most interesting dish of night.  Burrata on strawberries and then on a small piece of toast drizzled in balsamic.  I must say it was quite a happy explosion in my mouth.The Ahi Tuna Tartar and the white asparagus did not make an impression.  The first was just average, and the second was meager portions.  A mouse wouldn't have even been full on those 5 stalks of asparagus - come on!We also got drinks. I got the red sangria, which wasn't the best.  The cinnamon wasn't that strong and I wished it was.  Also, the drink itself was rather bland, no taste of the fruit that I love so much about Sangria.All in all, it was a decent meal.  We had a good time, good service, and decent meal.  The bill came out to almost $80 which is definitely a little too much for what you get.  I think that if I ever do come back, it'd be for breakfast (which seems to be the real prize here)

Reviews.Author: Jen H.
Reviews.Content: Delicious. Need I say more? I do? Oh, okay.They serve brunch from 8-5pm, FIVE O'CLOCK PM! Not many places do that, so based on that alone, they get 5 stars! They have a lot of plates that just from description alone seem beyond appetizing. One of my most difficult tasks with brunch is having to pick between savory and sweet dishes, and Blu Jam made that even harder. French toast or eggs? Pancakes or burgers? I ultimately went with the breakfast tacos (which are only served on the weekends) and I don't regret my choice at all. In the tacos are: onions, tomatoes (large pieces too!), eggs and beef scrambled together, and cheese. It includes a side of potatoes with ketchup, and sour cream for the tacos. Amazing. Beyond amazing, actually. Out came 3 tacos, and they were hefty. Not a street taco at all. The eggs and beef were perfectly seasoned and with the addition of onions, tomatoes, and cilantro/salsa, it felt complete. Then add some sour cream and it's heaven in your mouth. So so good, and the plate is huge! I could only finish half of my potatoes and 2 of the 3 tacos.See you again soon, Blu Jam! Next time, it's french toast!Oh, parking. Valet your car for $6 or park on the residential streets. Not too bad looking for parking though, I found one immediately but had to walk a little bit. Just make sure you move your car within 2 hours, or you might get a ticket. Damn LA.

Reviews.Author: Terence L.
Reviews.Content: We got here at about 10am, greeted by a strong British ascent and had a good 30-40 minutes wait before seated. Our server too had a strong Brit ascent which was pretty interesting. The best part about Blu Jam Cafe was that they served brunch till 5pm! Yes, 5 in the evening! I have read multiple reviews from here and never had a chance to stop by. K was here just the day before and recommended us coming again today. I guess that alone says a lot about the cafe.Both yy and me had the breakfast trio, two eggs any style, two classic pancakes or French toast with smoked bacon, bockwurst, or chicken apple sausage, with different combinations. Had a cappuccino along with it and the coffee was decent with overflowing froth and much better than most cappuccino I had at brunch spots, which were mostly disappointing. Normally I would just wait till after brunch before driving to Starbucks for my caffeine dose. Anyway, K had the salmon hash which tasted really good! The food portion are relatively small than regular breakfast/brunch spots which is good, means I don't need a to go box.Btw parking was not that much of an issue on a weekend morning but street parking are only valid for 2 hours. Definitely will be here more often. Blu Jam Cafe, see you soon.

Reviews.Author: Pauline F.
Reviews.Content: My friends all told me I had to try the crunchy French toast, so I came and had that after a 30 min wait, which wasn't bad. It was a little over-hyped though, because I had expected a cereal type of crunch... Not knowing it would be a little more stale due to all the oil its fried in... I really liked the vanilla French toast better, which has a blueberry sauce to it, and less heavy. Street parking can be bad, so come early for brunch if u want to beat the crowd and find close st parking!

Reviews.Author: William H.
Reviews.Content: I've had the pleasure of having brunch here with a friend a few weekends back. Because this place is obviously a hit, you will probably end up waiting in line for an hour or so during busier hours. Fortunately, my dear reader, Blue Jam is surrounded by a bunch of stores and shops, so, if you like browsing around like I do, there are plenty of shops to keep you occupied! Shopping, sunshine, and brunch - is this not a great way to spend a Saturday morning?Breakfast Risotto - Having never eaten risotto for breakfast, I thought this was very interesting! The risotto comes with two poached eggs topped with cheese and contains bacon, mushroom, peas, and sun-dried tomatoes. It's been a while ago, so I don't remember exactly what the price is for the risotto, but I remember it being around $15. I must admit that the risotto did not "WOW" me; this is not to say that the risotto wasn't delicious because it really was, only I did not think that the risotto tasted like what a risotto should taste like. It sort of just tasted like a soft, past-y fried rice (but in a good way!)...but take it from an Asian: one can never go wrong with eggs and rice!!!Coffee - fresh and aromatic, just like a coffee should be! Free refillsAmbiance - Considering its location, it's no wonder that Blue Jam Cafe is staffed with hipsters and has a hipster-y environmentParking - You kind of have to look around for it, but, as this is by a residential area, parking is not too hard to find.

Reviews.Author: Carol L.
Reviews.Content: My first thought upon entering this place and looking at the menu was "Larchmont Bungalow", which is one of my favorite restaurants. The two restaurants have many similarities and are almost identical. Both are great places to brunch on the weekends. Everyone is friendly and the food is great; you can't go wrong with whatever you order. There's been a lawsuit filed against Larchmont Bungalow to shut down for operating illegally and it seems like they are going to lose the case. When that happens, I guess I won't be as sad since there will always be Blu Jam to fill that void.  :)There always seems to be a long line. There was a 30 minute wait when I went so what I did was walk over to Crossroads (which is a couple stores down) for a little shopping. If you don't like Crossroads or if you still have time after shopping at Crossroads, don't worry because there are other neighboring shops you can visit to pass time.

Reviews.Author: Cindy E.
Reviews.Content: Ordered a grapefuit juice for myself and an orange juice for my son.  We sat at a table next to the bar and I saw the guy freshly squeeze the grapefruits and the oranges for our drinks.  Whaaat?  It's not from a box or from concentrate??   It was sooo refreshing and delicious! If you go here, you MUST order their special...the Crunchy French Toast.  Do it.  It's the BEST french toast I have ever had.  Their vanilla bean sauce that comes with it is perfect! I also ordered the Morning Hash.  Portion was perfect and the ham was delicious!!! The waiter brought us a free bowl of fresh fruit because the french toast was taking long (lots of orders!).  Really appreciated that! Will be back for their french toast!

Reviews.Author: Candy S.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam Cafe....you definitely rocked my socks off!!I came here a while ago for a friends birthday. I'm so glad we beat the lunch rush. I had to make my way through the crowd in order to get to my amigos. Because we had a large group, we were situated in a semi-private room in the back of the restaurant. It was dark, but a whole lot more quiet and intimate than sitting outside. Service was okay. Everybody received their order in a timely manner. No one had to wait impatiently and suffer as the rest of us ate. So that is definitely a super plus. The only problem was that we had to ask the waiter to refill our drinks. Maybe he forgot or maybe its because we were our own room. Who knows.Now the food...Florentine Benedict was to die for. Sun-dried tomatoes, brie cheese, sauteed mushrooms and spinach...what is not to love about it! And the side of potatoes it came in was surprisingly good as well. What a dish! Crunchy French Toast. YUUuuUum. The birthday girl ordered this as a meal, but it was soo sweet it should have been a plate for everyone to share. The French toast is amaze balls. There are so many different textures going on, from the crunchy corn flakes and the fluffy toast. Every bit of it worked well together. The vanilla bean dipping sauce really topped off the dish.All in all, it was a great meal with a great group of friends.

Reviews.Author: Angel S.
Reviews.Content: Definitely worth stopping by, especially if you're in the neighborhood shopping as I often am! French toast is absolutely amazing & a huge highlight. It would even be great without syrup! Potatoes are also a must have. Prices are reasonable, definitely a cool & diverse crowd & the waiters are attentive & actually fit right in with crowd dining here. Mind you, it is pretty loud & the tables are in close proximity to one another, so I wouldn't recommend coming here if you're trying to get to know someone or feel the need to have a serious conversation...someone from another party is pretty much in your space, though it varies slightly depending on where in the cafe you're sitting. Lastly, the portions here are reasonable, but not overly abundant. Thats great for me because I don't want to head into my day after breakfast or brunch feeling sluggish. On the other hand, I can see how perhaps for a man or anyone not as petite as myself...it may not be as filling portion wise (then again, also depending on what you order). All in all, I love it here & I am a happy repeat customer.

Reviews.Author: Ting H.
Reviews.Content: OMG love their crunchy french toast! It tasted just right for me without dipping the toast into the creamy thingy the restaurant provided. We had a very friendly and attentive server. The host was super nice too! Would definitely come back to try other dishes!

Reviews.Author: Taylor G.
Reviews.Content: If you are one of the 317 people left in Los Angeles who has not been to Blu Jam then what the heck are you doing?! It's no secret that Blu Jam Cafe is one of the best breakfast and brunch spots in the city. It has earned that reputation rightfully but that means you are also likely looking at a wait time especially on the weekends.There are a number of wonderful items for your enjoyment but the French Toast is one to keep in mind along with the Breakfast Quesadilla. Service is always friendly and prompt and the setting is casual and clean. Just go here! You will love it. Seriously.

Reviews.Author: David U.
Reviews.Content: Thanks to other Yelp reviews, we came early yesterday (Saturday), so we only waited about 15 minutes.We went with the crunchy french toast since everybody here raved about it (and it says it's their signature item right on the menu) and an order of migas.The crunchy french toast was different... definitely not what we were expecting. The strawberries/blueberries/bananas complemented it very well. I don't think we would have liked it very much if it weren't for the good fruit. I think it's creative and looks awesome, but still not 100% sure if I love it... Guess I'll have to try it again, haha yelp.com/biz_photos/ki5S…The migas were really good and IMHO, better than the crunchy french toast. Because the two dishes were so different, it worked out very well because we just put both plates in the middle and shared. I would definitely go back for this dish. yelp.com/biz_photos/ki5S…I also really like that the chef/owner reads all these reviews (and responds to a lot of them!) It says a lot that he's taking the time to do that.Next time, we'll probably try some of the other dishes... there were so many on the menu that sounded delicious.

Reviews.Author: Mike F.
Reviews.Content: First off you have to try the French Toast!!! Absolutely amazing! Came here with a friend and we both wanted to try the french toast, but also have something else, so we each ordered our own dish then shared the french toast. Great decision on our part. I had the tex-mex tofu dish, and he had eggs Benedict. He was in love with his food, mine was good, but I would rather have gotten something else. But the french toast sooo delicious. The service was wonderful and the ambiance is great. It's not always easy finding a breakfast spot during the week, but here you can sit and enjoy. They have a full coffee bar and were playing jazz music. I will be back!

Reviews.Author: Kenny N.
Reviews.Content: Came here yesterday after our 3 hour hiking at the Hollywood Sign with a group of 6 people. This place definitely not a good place to go to for brunch if you have a party of 6 or more because it looks like you would need to wait for about 45 min to an hour before you're seated since you're waiting on what looks like the only table big enough for 6. I'm not sure of this logic since when we finally got seated, they could've easily pushed a couple of smaller tables together to accommodate us. With the place not being that big in the first place, I guess I understand since there are usually more groups of 2-4 waiting than bigger parties. A hint for the 2-4 group of people waiting; stay close and don't end up wandering off or else you'll be skipped on and whoever is waiting closer will get your seats before you. Also, be on the lookout for parking around the area and make sure you read all signs as parking is one of the worse in this area. If you end up parking in the residential area, make sure you move your car before the two hour limit or risk getting a ticket. Food wise comparing of all the Brunch places I've gone to, it's not too bad but not sure if I would end up coming back again anytime soon. I ended up ordering their Migas which wasn't too bad as portion was a good sized portion. It was flavorful and I loved the added tortillas and chips. I also enjoyed their known Crunchy French Toast which had blueberries, bananas and strawberry toppings. I understand at some places the added gratuity for a large group which in this case a 18% gratuity added for a party of six or more but I expect the service to be better. Our waiter wasn't around us most of the time and it looked like he cared more about the smaller tables than ours. Also, we had one french toast left on the plate and the employee ended up taking the dishes away without asking us if we wanted the last one. Don't think I'd be coming back here willingly for a while unless I was craving their crunch french toast.

Reviews.Author: Chris L.
Reviews.Content: Had their omelettes and pancakes and I admit they were really good. But nothing outstanding worth of 1hr wait and all the hype. Except for the parking and wait, good place for brunch.

Reviews.Author: Julie P.
Reviews.Content: Saw the great reviews on Yelp, and it does live up to the hype.  We came here for breakfast, and the french toast coated with corn flakes is perhaps the best french toast I've ever had.  It's moist but the flakes give it an interesting crunchy texture that I didn't think would be so tasty.  You definitely need to try this for yourself.  Hubbie said that the french press coffee is off the hook!  My only complaint is that the waiter only took my husband's order and didn't give me a second glance or give me a chance to speak, so I had to flag him down to place my order.  It was irksome, but not enough to knock my review down a star.

Reviews.Author: Jamie C.
Reviews.Content: Yelp hooked us up again! Thanks for sending us out of our way to this spot during my recent trip to LA. What's a girl to do on vacay when the tourist traps can come at you from ever angle. I need a solid brunch and this definitely hit the spot. I had the french toast and it was DELISH!!! One of the highlights of the trip.

Reviews.Author: Steve T.
Reviews.Content: Food is great and staff is friendly..Good during the week.. completly overrun by asian yelpers during the weekend breakfast...no fault of blu jam maybe it's just yelp that needs the two stars for brining an army of sgv patrons here..Im Asian but I have an id with a Hollywood zip code sooo yeah..the local vibe is gone from this place on weekends so you should all go on the weekdays

Reviews.Author: Shery B.
Reviews.Content: Crunchy French toast lived up to the reviews- it was good! Crunchy texture on outside was nice contrast w/softer inside. Vanilla bean sauce complemented it well. Huge servings at this place! I had the migas- chorizo egg scramble w/chips & corn tortillas-tasty, cheesy, also a generous portion. Everything else other patrons were ordering looked good too. Would def return to try other things & for that French toast.

Reviews.Author: Yuri O.
Reviews.Content: they have an amazing french toast!!!!!! :)))))))))i went to try there with my friend on Wednesday for a brunch. when we got there, it was so packed!!!!i mean, seriously packed although it was Wednesday, middle of a week!!so we had to wait for a while.but once we got seated, it was wonderful! the food was absolutely delicious :))))))and the server was nice too! so it's worth a wait, and im totally coming back ;)

Reviews.Author: Jen T.
Reviews.Content: Nice!  What a sweet sweet spot we found for breakfast here at Blu Jam. With the help of some Yelp brunch research we wanted to try this place.  It is an awesome brunch at Blu Jam! Get the famous crunchy French toast. It will leave a smile on your face.  Also Best Cobb salad ever! and yes that was for Breakfast

Reviews.Author: Megan T.
Reviews.Content: worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: R P.
Reviews.Content: First, the negatives.  Loooooong wait (no reservations).  Be prepared for 30 to 60 minutes any time of day.  (Since nobody in LA seems to have a job, peak hours is pretty much any time they're open.)  Because they are so popular -- with the lines around the block -- customer service is not the highest priority.  They offer a side of pancakes on the menu.  We asked for a side of French toast instead.  Simple enough, right?  No substitutions!  The chef cannot be bothered!  The staff is otherwise very good and friendly.  The waiter we had today was excellent.  The food is good, just not amazing (pancakes are the best thing on the menu, served with real maple syrup).  The line is simply inexplicable, if you ask me.

Reviews.Author: Hannah B.
Reviews.Content: One of the best breakfast and brunch spots in Miracle Mile. Get there early though on the weekends because the line can get cray. Totally worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: James H.
Reviews.Content: This is for sure my favorite breakfast place in Hollywood, but I still don't think it's worth the wait. If you insist on going on the weekend, try to make it really early or expect to wait for A LONG TIME. You should definitely try their french toast if it's your first time, but there are tons of nice items on the menu.

Reviews.Author: O K.
Reviews.Content: 1. Water that tastes minty!2. Super yummy eggs benedict served on a croissant.. angioplasty NOW!

Reviews.Author: Arlene C.
Reviews.Content: The Lost Bread french toast was wonderful.  It didn't even need any syrup.  The fresh berries and dusting of powdered sugar gave the brioche just the right compliment.  Go early if you want the Crab cake Benedict.  They ran out, so we ordered the Blu Jam benedict.....it did not disappoint.This place is very comfortable, and the service excellant.

Reviews.Author: Zedar B.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam has BYOB "bistro night" on Fridays according to its chalkboard, but I haven't been yet.  On weekend mornings, wooden cafe tables are jammed too close together, full of diners and natural light filtered through the rustic diamond skylights of the bare wood, half arc ceiling.Labor day weekend we did not have to wait long for a tiny table for two because the hostess firmly refused to seat diners until their complete parties were present.I can't wait to go back for more, but do not understand the five star ratings.  Like many purveyors with expansive menus, not every dish is as good as the next at Blu Jam.  Our two breakfasts were each 50% great and 50% not.  So, I am going to get specific about what was good and bad:Many breakfasts come with your choice of potatoes, mixed greens or fruit.  My husband and I recommend that you avoid the greens.  Mine were soaking in vinegar and his were rotten on different occasions.  However, the crispy potatoes were exceptional and the fruit - ripe fig, water melon, cantaloupe, peach, apple, blueberries, strawberry, bananna - was my favorite.Despite a dearth of beans, the ranchero was sublime.  One of the best omelettes in which I've indulged was the Normandy with Thyme, goat cheese, red peppers, artichoke and asparagus.  At $12, it was a little more expensive than the other breakfast items at Blu Jam, but it was worth it, especially with the abovementioned fruit.I disliked my fire wrap and my husband's Mexican Hangover special was no good (maybe he needed a hangover to appreciate it?).  The coffee I ordered was a little disappointing.  First it bubbled like there was dishwashing detergent involved and it just didn't taste great.  The cream on the table must have been milk because it was very thin.  Maybe most of all, I was disappointed that a restaurant called Blu Jam served me Smuckers with my toast.  I expected some special blue jam or something!Tea drinkers take note, Blu Jam serves a somewhat interesting selection of hot tea in tea presses.  You may also order a glass of ice and make your own iced tea.  We instead ordered the house iced tea which is an unsweetened raspberry peach.  I thought it was interesting but by husband said it tasted like a peach pit.My water, to which Blu Jam added lime slices, was not refilled on my second visit.  I hope it carefully washes the limes in its water.  Many bars and restaurants don't.

Reviews.Author: Alvin F.
Reviews.Content: So much food and so little time in my life.  I went there late Sunday morning and we were seated right away.  On a lazy Sunday morning the seating outside seemed more inviting and relaxing than inside.  Would like to check this place out for dinner someday.  Looked like there was a cool separate room in the back for large or private parties.There is metered parking in the area and for some odd reason there was plenty in the area that time.  I think there is valet parking randomly spread out on Melrose.I tried the Blue Jam toast and was delightfully amazed at the sweet concoction.  The mixture of bananas, blueberries and strawberries on top of the toast was a nice touch. There were a host of specials and boy did I want my friend to order the carnitas scramble.  I will have to come back here some other time.  A delightful selection of things to try.  Almost overwhelming.  The key to this place was the friendly service.  Not sure if this was specifically for us, but the manager came out to check on how our dining experience was.  The service was slow if you want to eat and run, but if you want to chill, it was absolutely perfect.A relaxing Sunday morning with a good friend, good food and great service... well it was fantastic.  The prices are a bit high for the food, but I guess it is the location.

Reviews.Author: Kevin F.
Reviews.Content: I really doubt I need to review this fab cafe...it seems to have plenty of reviews, but now it has one more.I heart this place for several reasons:Great food, I mean that.  They aren't breaking new ground in crazy creative ways ( although there is some rad stuff I have never seen else where ).  But they get it done right.  Some places have a hard time doing simple eggs and meat.  Blu Jam is not one of those joints.  They don't drown food in oils and butter as far as I can tell, and are great at modifying food if you ask.  The staff is friendly; I get English Breaky Tea with milk and honey...they have done went and learnt this, I like simple stuff like that. The customers seem cool and laid back.  If it is good enough for Chuck Liddel ( he sat next to me this morning ) then it is good enough for you!I only have one minor grip, and it is minor...tea pot ( although bottomless ) is 3.95.  I know it sounds silly but I enjoy my caffeine to be inexpensive.  Be aware that like any rad joint, it can get VERY busy on the weekends, so if you want to get grub on Saturday or Sunday go, but plan on waiting a short while before getting tasty food in your belly!  Soooo, go to Blu Jam, lock your bike up outside and read a book while Chuck Liddel and his Mohawk eat next to you!

Reviews.Author: Alicia S.
Reviews.Content: Popped in here on a Tuesday, not crowded, not deserted eitherHappy to note that they had weekday breakfast specials (basically their more popular dishes at a reduced price of $7.95 instead of the usual $10.95 and up)Coffee was great! Good portions too, still some leftover to take home Service was attentive without being intrusive....the owner read my friend's mind as she looked at the large take out box in her hand....he just wordlessly brought over a smaller box.... sorta creepy yet awesome! We'll be BACK

Reviews.Author: Lisa H.
Reviews.Content: i've been to  blu jam twice so far, and plan on returning.First time I ordered "Lost Bread" (French toast w/ fruit toppings I believe) and the other time I ordered the "Olympus" (egg whites, chicken, spinach...). Both times I got a Chai Latte, which tasted super yummy.Both of my breakfasts were good. And both times I had very personable and friendly waiters that gave me great service. Both meals were delicious. They have a healthy section of the menu if you're into that. Just a cute little independent cafe. My boyfriend's first meal he thought was "ok." (I forgot what he got, something with Salmon..) but upon returning, he ordered another selection and was very happy with it.

Reviews.Author: Sam C.
Reviews.Content: For all of their good reviews and 11 am on a Sunday afternoon, our 15 minute wait seemed like a breeze. Despite having not too many tables and a constant number of peopel waiting for a table (although not too large of a crowd), I was glad that I didn't have to wait too long to get seated.I had the their Russian Scramble from their brunch menu, which consisted of three eggs scrambled with smoked salmon, onion, cream cheese and cherry tomatoes,topped with sour cream, chives & black caviar, served with toast and potatoes. It was absolutely amazing. I don't know how they made their scarambled eggs so fluffy. All the ingredients matched very well, and the whole dish .. potatoes and all .. was very tasty.Also ordered the french toast, which came smeared with thick slabs of cream cheese and some blueberry jam. Although it was good, I thought there was too much cream cheese. Also, it was a bit too sweet for the morning.I'd love to come back and try their other offerings some other time.

Reviews.Author: Peter S.
Reviews.Content: Got here at around 9am on a saturday morning and got a table no problem, outside in the sun under a nice big shady umbrella. Service was excellent. Started with a nice big latte of which they provided with a kaleidoscope foamy design. Decided on the Gourment Benedict with generous portions of norwegian smoked salmon atop poached eggs, toasted croissants, and hollandaise sauce for $9.95.Best breakfast in LA? Maybe. Best breakfast on melrose? A good chance. Best breakfast between melrose and fuller and martel? Fo shizzle.

Reviews.Author: Monica W.
Reviews.Content: Being a sweet tooth, brunch is all about the pancake, crepe, and french toast. Finding the perfect french toast in never easy, but clearly Brioche Blu Toast is super scrumptious. French toast with blackberry jam, cream cheese in between two slices of battered brioche slices, and complimented with fresh strawberry, blueberry, bananas, powdery sugar on top, and maple syrup on the side. The cream cheese part might sound so over the top, but everything combined is a sweet escapade.On a savory note, we ordered Hangover Burrito - Eggs scrambled with beef chorizo, jalapeños, smoked chipotle, black beans, cheddar and cilantro, inside a large grilled flour tortilla, served with potatoes and side of sour cream. This thing is the best breakfast burrito ever! Spicy and zesty at the same time.One of the thing that always draws me back to Blu Jam is the service and the atmosphere. The owner always hangs around to make sure all is satisfactory.  Despite this place is located in Melrose, there's nothing Hollywood about this place - simply modest and cozy...pics - yummycrave.com/2009/11/b…

Reviews.Author: Mimi T.
Reviews.Content: Came here for the first time after seeing all these yelp reviews. I was not disappointed. It seemed pretty crowded and I was surprised they still had room for my co-worker and I. We got seated right away.Everything on the menu just sounded so good. I was debating between the french toast or omeletts. I ended up ordering Le Paris omelette. When the food came, it was huge! The omelette had spinach, mushroom, sundried tomatoes, and goat cheese. The eggs tasted so fresh, and everything just went well together. My water was constantly being refilled and the waitstaff didn't interrupt our conversation. I had a great experience here, and can't wait to come back to order the french toast and everything else on the menu. I think i like this place more than Vienna Cafe across the street.

Reviews.Author: Dee N.
Reviews.Content: Best breakfast in Los Angeles, hands down. My mouth is watering just thinking about their lemon crepes.Breakfast quesadilla and a soy latte and I'm sitting happy for the rest of the day.

Reviews.Author: yuyi x.
Reviews.Content: Food was great~ The burger was ok, and it came with fresh fruits. The soup I had was just ok~~~ I told them that I was in a rush, however, my food still came really late, I see people next to my table already got their food for a long time~~~~~~~~~~~ah~~~~~~~~~I was in a hurryyyyyyy~

Reviews.Author: Miss C.
Reviews.Content: What can I say, it meets the hype.  Fresh quality food, just try and eat all of me portions, good service, decent price...coffee is velvety good.  Interior is warm and comfy with rich orange walls and gorgeous wood ceiling.  I like the added touch of water flavored with fresh mint and lemons.  Sometimes there is a bit of a wait, but check out the vintage store next door they have dresses made of afgans and pacman sheets.  it's weird and entertaining.  The line moves fairly quickly, I always seem to miss my turn while wandering.  One thing I could have done without is loud doctor lady telling ER horror stories over my eggs.  Nope, could have done without that but, I can't hold it against Blu Jam now can I?  I could hold it against all Dr's though... hmmm.Where was I? Yes, Blu jam...  It didn't strike me down like lighting but I dig it folks.

Reviews.Author: Annie R.
Reviews.Content: Huegos en fuego delicious!For what it cost - I thought I would have half to take home - not the case. Which means I didn't overeat and feel too full, but usually breakfast places give you more bang for your buck. Plenty of street parking, outdoor seeting, and a very friendly owner. Just went for breakfast - it was packed but  there is a high table turnover.

Reviews.Author: Madeline C.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I love Blu Jam!  It's our go-to place when we want good inexpensive breakfast.  It has never let us down.  Even when we've had longer waits (never waited more than 25 minutes though) or slower service, the owner or someone always comes around and apologizes, making everything better again.  Plus, they have this bread that they don't give out anymore unless you ask for it.  But the best part of it is this olive spread that it comes with.  SO good!  So ask for it!And I know this isn't a big deal to anyone but maybe me, but most breakfast places smell like burnt toast and other smells that stick to my hair and clothes afterwards.  Blu Jam does not and also offers outside seating.  It's very casual and comfortable and doesn't smell.  Yay for Blu Jam!

Reviews.Author: Rosalyn T.
Reviews.Content: My favorite place to get breakfast! Every time I come here, the food is excellent along with the atmosphere and service.  The strawberry, banana, dark chocolate pancakes are to die for.

Reviews.Author: Carol K.
Reviews.Content: What is a must when visiting sunny LA?  Brunch with friends!  For yet another weekend brunch on a sunny LA day, I suggested this spot after looking for some new ideas in the area (3rd St. used to be my go-to).Area/location: Good; like the chill layout and it's a fun area to people watchService: Overall good, but it should be noted that they don't seat you until your entire party is here (which makes it not-so-fun when a friend is running late due to lala land traffic!)Taste: Didn't strike as anything special.  My friends each had some sort of omelette.  I was feeling the need to eat healthy (to keep myself somewhat in balance midst the weekend dining marathon) so opted for a tofu hash.  It was meh-ok.  But to be fair, we didn't order the stand-out dishes (i.e. french toast, which did look mouthwatering on the tables around us). Since we found something a little lacking afterwards, we headed for Milk to check out some sweets goodness.  Good thing I'd had the healthy fare!

Reviews.Author: Jimmy H.
Reviews.Content: Great place for brunch on melrose! Of course, gotta start with some booze. They have Prosecco, and Mimosas for the ladies!Loxex - Three farm fresh eggs scrambled with smoked Norwegian salmon, onions, tomatoes and brie cheese mixed in. The sour cream and chives made this scramble extra nice!Kamil's Breakfast - Pan-roasted macaroni scrambled with eggs, smoked bacon, ham, garlic, chives, and cheddar. Again, the chives were a great touch but the pan-roasted macaroni hit the hang-over spot!Kamil's Famous Goulash Soup - Authentic Czech goulash that was hearty and fulfilling. The pork chunks were especially nice because there were some cartillage in them!Kamil, the owner, was really nice. Came over to the table to make sure everything was in order. And then he gave me some goulash on the house.

Reviews.Author: Yasuo O.
Reviews.Content: Kamil Kamil Kamilwhat an awesome place!food was fantastic and reasonably priced.  If you want to go to a cheap place for breakfast, then go to DENNYs.  If you want to go to an expensive place, it aint here.  This is just right.  the waiting was bothersome and I wondered if it was worth it but at the end of the day, it was actually pretty awesome.  loved it!  Sure fire bet I will be making trips out here when I am LA.UPDATE:so I wasnt even thinking the wait was worth a gripe but immediately after I post, Kamil comes back and send me an email... WOW.. CUSTOMER SERVICE!  thats RESPECT.  Thanks Kamil!  You got this Hawaiian as a customer for life!

Reviews.Author: Erin L.
Reviews.Content: Holy Shrimp Ceviche!  I had the pleasure of having a nice, quiet dinner at Blu Jam, and had a wonderful dining experience!  It has that cozy, small restaurant feel with the good food to match.  Something different from the Sunday brunch, for sure.Obviously, the shrimp ceviche was my favorite.  Mmm.  Mmm. And, mmm.  Next in line, is the mixed greens with fried goat cheese.  Love, love, love cheese.  Also loved the braised baby back ribs.  Holy, the meat just falls off the bone.  I also had the lentil soup, beef goulash, and tuna tartar, all of which appeased my little belly.Now, here comes the dessert.  I had the chocolate cake, tres leches with strawberries, and blueberry panacotta.  I'm normally a regular chocollate cake kind of girl, but man.  I was blown away by the blueberry panacotta.  Yummmmmm is all I could say through my mouth full of panacotta after all of the above-mentioned dishes.Service, as usual, was friendly and good.  Atmo was good.  Food good.  What more can a girl ask for?

Reviews.Author: Vince The G.
Reviews.Content: Short hand::allot time to waitlittle squishypay lots of money..but..great serviceyummy foodIt's worth it :)so.Of course I went on Sunday for brunch.  Of course there was a wait.  I wouldn't recommend going with a party larger than 4 because it gets pretty crowded inside.  We waited about 30 minutes.  As a party of 2 we got a little table on the side, but it was big enough for us to have 2 drinks, 2 waters, and 2 dishes. it's pretty cute inside :) Old school style, cute place for breakfast for sure.Sooo yummy!  I had one of the benedicts. I think the florentine? I got the sauce on side though.  It looked soo heavy! But boy was it delicious! :) With the red potatoes which weren't good at first, because the benedict has way more flavor. But afterwards, I was munching them down!  The croissant under my benedict was quite soggy and awkward, so I didn't finish that.  My friend got the Salmon Entree.  The salmon was slightly over cooked, but still not too bad.  Strawberry Smoothie was good.  Latte was came with a cute little flower, that of course you saw on the pictures.It def a nice cute place for breakfast. Buttaahh..2 drinks and 2 entrees...after waiting 30 minutes..came out to 42 dollars without tip.  Thats quite a bit for breakfast/brunch. But heck. I'd go again :) It's cute. Its delicious. And the service there is very nice! :) They are attentive. Give recommendations.  It's just a very homey place that hits the heart :)  I like it.   the burger looked nice there too.  Next time. next time. They have a lot of different things available on the menu :)  More breakfast creations than normal.  The lunch stuff is also available.  Wraps, sandwiches, entrees, omelets, granola, paninis, steak...

Reviews.Author: Eunice L.
Reviews.Content: love love love the food here.  There's quite a bit of a wait.. my girlfriend and I waited about 50 minutes.. but it's worth it.  Good atmosphere, great service, and delishhhh foods!   It's best to come when you dont have any other plans right after brunch, so you can lounge and sip on your coffee or mimosa and chat away.  Its one of those restaurants, you just wanna stay there all day.  :) The food is awesome.  This place has gotten recognition from all over, voted the best breakfast/brunch joint in the city, and it's been featured in magazines and papers multiple times.  And though I feel that some places are recognized for no special reason, I can definitely say that the appraisals given to this restaurant are warranted.  Vegetable Nest:  super flavorful, and not what I expected.  i thougth it'd be a boring stack of vegetables with some tomato sauce, but its really good!  topped with a poached egg, which of course made me like it even more.  :)Blu Jam Eggs Benedict:  not your typical eggs benny.  A toasted croissant, topped with a ample amount of black forest ham and perfectly crispy bacon slices, topped with two poached eggs and hollandaise.  Scrumptious, delish, to die for.  i love it!  the croissant takes the benny to another level :) Blueberry Pancake:  Made from fresh blueberries.. this pancake is different from others.. even from the looks of it.  It's thicker than others, super dense, and when you cut into it, you can just smell the butter and blueberries.  mm mm mm!  The syrup is another story too, i dunno if it's just me, but it was really good. hahaThis place is definitely worth a try.  Don't be frustrated if it's a long wait, just swing by the stores nearby and kill some time~!  You won't regret it :D

Reviews.Author: Paul M.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the best french toast I've ever had!  Service was A+++Great crowd.  Had to wait 1/2 hour on Saturday morning.  Worth it!

Reviews.Author: Em G.
Reviews.Content: I took my husband here this morning for breakfast and it was perfect!The food was delicious and the service was excellent. They have tofu scramble which I got and it was unlike any tofu scramble I've ever had. It was flavored with a tomato based sauce that was out of this world. My husband got eggs which he also really liked.Definitely very happy to find a new breakfast spot we love!

Reviews.Author: Kem D.
Reviews.Content: Pure heaven. Seriously - a flavor fiesta in my mouth! I had the hangover scramble which was an accurate depiction of all that is LA: all American eggs and ground beef with the Latin flavor of jalapenos, salsa fresca and corn tortillas.  We paired our late lunch with beer.  BJC has an interesting selection of rare local beers like Pranqster along with your normal shock top.  Everything was delicious and it was a perfect day to sit on the patio and people watch. Starting next week BJC will be open for dinner daily served tapas style - Yay! (blujamcafe.com/dinner) Kamil, the owner is also the executive chef.  It is evident that he takes pride in his restaurant.  If you eat there this week ask the owner for a certificate to get a complimentary bottle of wine with dinner in March :)Parking is admittedly difficult.  Valet is an option or look for street parking but watch out for the resident-only streets.  The wait time to get a table is long so plan accordingly and bring a gabby friend to kill time till your table is ready.

Reviews.Author: Linda L.
Reviews.Content: Ok so they're not the first to do the James Beard style corn flake french toast... but they certainly do it well!  The crunchy french toast is perfection.  PERFECTION.  Thinking about it is making me salivate a little right now.I also had the florentine benedict, which was pretty good other than the fact that the spinach was quite salty.  The hollandaise is really nice.  Otherwise the potatoes were good enough to gobble up, but would've been better with just a tad more crispiness.  The service was attentive, friendly, and fast.  This place is definitely going on my list of "when I'm in LA" food destinations.

Reviews.Author: Jean K.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam is pretty good, but I don't know about the best breakfast/brunch place in LA. I got the crispy French toast by recommendation of my waitress but I personally thought it would have been better if I had stuck to the regular French toast. I don't really like mixing cereal into other things.... other than milk. The fruit on top was very fresh and nice!The food is good but I think a bit overpriced. Which is why I'm not rating it higher than a 3.

Reviews.Author: Lolita K.
Reviews.Content: The crunch french toast is really as good as it gets!!! I was definitely impressed! I can't wait to go back and try other things!

Reviews.Author: Tina L.
Reviews.Content: I hope my boyfriend never sees this review, because he loves this place, and I'll keep coming here with him since it seems to brighten his days. Anyway, I think I just don't love American brunch food enough to pay the price and wait in a long line. When I'm here, I generally get one of their omelets... and it's just like any other omelet. Decent. o_O  My boyfriend gets the same french toast every single time, so it must be good.Just like the rest of the street/area, this is a fun place to watch hipsters interact with each other. Sometimes I feel sorta out of place, being the grumpy tiny person I am, but it's actually pretty enjoyable seeing everyone laugh and talk about things that I know nothing about (trashy reality tv shows, the crazy adventures they had last night, a bunch of celebrity names I don't recognize) around me....yeah, I'll be back.

Reviews.Author: kelly l.
Reviews.Content: First of all, I highly recommend the Gourmet burger, Ahi tuna sandwich & the Blu Jam Benedict. The french toast is to die for, and the owner always likes to come by and say hello to the tables, which is refreshing to have such 'front of house' social skillsI've been coming here for a while now, and I just recently I was there, and had the most charismatic server, JUSTIN. I love brunch. I love the waiters that bring me brunch like food items, but this guy was hilarious and totally personable. Ask for him, you will love him, he was the best server I've had there in a minute.BTW ... he does stand up @ The Comedy Store on Sunset! Wow!!

Reviews.Author: Daniel G.
Reviews.Content: My friend is a regular and suggested the place after an afternoon of shopping. I was undecided between a wrap and the Ahi Tuna Salad... Jason, our server, suggested the salad... I got it.Awesome!!!The tuna was cooked just right... The salad was tasty, with half an avocado on top... The bread and the olive jam was so tasty we asked for seconds!!!Our tea and water (was it lime and mint?) were never empty, all the staff stopped by to see if were okay.Jason left before I could thank him... Thank you, Jason!!!

Reviews.Author: Sarah N.
Reviews.Content: We were driving down Melrose and spotted this cafe.  Decided to go in because there was a good crowd compared to all the dead cafes around the area.  We were immediately seated out in the patio.  There were crazy homeless people that we were bugging the customers...thank goodness we were not one of them!Steak Salad- steak was cooked PERFECTLY.  Balsamic Vinaigrette dressing and Gorgonzola cheese, fresh mixed greens.  I want to come back and order some more.  Too bad I don't live in LA.  Service was excellent.  Will definitely come back if I am in the area again.

Reviews.Author: Laura H.
Reviews.Content: Waited a long time for my food.I ordered eggs old style, ad it was a scramble with mushrooms, cheese, and other forgettable items.  I really like the rosted potatoes that came with my dish but I only got 6 pieces.  I am a potato lover and for them to deprive me of this wonder was soo sad.

Reviews.Author: Linda T.
Reviews.Content: Kamil Majer, you can do no wrong.Blu Jam has been my go to brunch place for close to a year now. Since moving to LA and witnessing the gigantic queue outside, I have sampled damn near everything on the menu and have not been disappointed once. The portions are huge and I have always gone home with a full belly and doggy bag of that night's dinner. Yes, the wait is long so plan to spend at least 45 minutes in line if you arrive after 10:00am. No reservations. Servers are always wonderful. Highlights:- Chai latte: Hot or iced, this is hands-down the BEST CHAI LATTE in town! Spiced perfectly with a healthy dose of milk froth... I can never stop at ordering just one.- Benedicts: Kamil, how do you keep everything so crispy and non-soggy?- Crunchy French toast: The secret must be the corn flakes because this packs a serious crunch. I've always avoided French toast because it either ends up bland or soggy. This is neither. - Vegetable nest: Pulling off a fully vegetarian dish that is hearty by a carnivore's standard is a testimony to the chef. - Kamil's breakfast: In an attempt to experience the breakfast of champions, I tried this eggy, mac and cheesy goodness. The flavors of the omelette scramble balanced with the cheddar and shells as none of the ingredients overpowered the other. Quite filling.Best brunch in LA indeed.

Reviews.Author: Valerie R.
Reviews.Content: The Crunchy French toast is out of this world! It comes with vanilla bean on the side, but I like to ask for syrup too.Also tried some of my boyfriend's Burgundy Omelette. It was good but I wish there were more add-ins in the middle, seemed a little plain.

Reviews.Author: Karina T.
Reviews.Content: I ordered their organic latte thinking that they'll put latte art on it but...there was none and it was just a regular latte. I was kind of disappointed.Food - I went there for lunch and I got the Grilled Fresh Salmon. Considering the price, I thought the salmon would be bigger but it was..normal. Again, that was kind of disappointing. Nevertheless, the taste was great though!

Reviews.Author: Renita K.
Reviews.Content: So I came in for dinner with a girlfriend a week ago and loved it. We were smack dab in the middle of the fattiest week of our lives (we had BLTs and bacon wrapped bacon the night before), so we kept most of our options light. All the dishes are meant to be shared and I was surprised at how big the portion sizes were. We started with the beet salad, which came sprinkled with grapes, walnuts, gorgonzola, microgreens, and a delicious balsamic reduction. The presentation was nice and colorful too.Next we had the shrimp ceviche, which came out as 4 mini tostadas. They were really good, but didn't have anything remarkable about them... as in you can find the same thing at any of those little mexican mariscos restaurants (sans the drizzle of chipotle aioli on top).Finally we had the autumn risotto with mushrooms, black truffle, and parmesan. This was SO good I could have eaten the whole plate myself. It was rich and flavorful without being heavy. I would highly recommend BJC for dinner!!!

Reviews.Author: Becky U.
Reviews.Content: Pretty tasty, i recommend the Smoked Salmon Platter which consist of..Smoked salmon, red onions, capers, cream cheese, lemon, sliced tomatoes, cucumbers & plain or onion (choice of bread).We did not make reservations, but waited for about 20 min to be seated.  Our waitress was really good with checking up on us and refilling our waters.. THAT in itself is always a PLUS!  they do have outside seating but it was too cold to enjoy it, but window seating was great too. AWESOME BLU JAM!

Reviews.Author: Cherie T.
Reviews.Content: I waited almost an hour to have brunch with a girlfriend here and it still gets 5 stars. That mean it was damn good and well worth the wait!I had the signature crunchy french toast along with a mimosa (yeah, I went all out ;o)  ). French toast coated in corn flakes..... Absolute perfection!  Makes for a wonderful crunch and the center was firm (not custardy) - just the way I like it.  Now by itself, the toast was so MMMM mmm GOOD  but, the sauce that came with it was just made it ridiculously, over-the-top - tasty. It was vanilla bean but, if I didn't know better, I would have assumed if was madagascan vanilla frosting or melted ice cream.To add to the experience, the server was very professional, quick and attentive. It was evident that the long wait was due to the sheer number of people coming through, not anything to do with a slow kitchen or waitstaff.It's been too long.Got to go back!

Reviews.Author: Christina T.
Reviews.Content: Crunchy French Toast (11.95): "Egg brioche dipped in batter, rolled in crunchy corn flakes and grilled to perfection, topped with fresh bananas and berries, served with vanilla bean sauce" The best dish of the bunch! I loved the crunchiness and the vanilla bean dipping sauce! It was sooooooooo good!! Definitely will order this again if I eat at Blu Jam again.Roma via Paris (11.95):  "Three farm fresh eggs scrambled with spinach, sun-dried tomatoes, zucchini, chopped tomatoes, bell peppers, fresh basil, Montchevre goat cheese and mozzarella, served with potatoes and toast".  This omelette was really good! My only negative was that I didn't think there was enough cheese. My sister says that there was the perfect amount. Maybe she ate all the cheese? In that case, I wish that the cheese was uniformly distributed in the omelette because the part that I ate was not cheesy enough, whereas the parts my sister ate had the right amount. I feel ripped off! The potatoes were not the best. I personally enjoy crunchy potatoes. I think they were a bit too roasted. The toast was hard. My least favorite dish of the bunch.Blu Jam Benedict (11.95): "Poached eggs on a toasted English muffin with Black Forest Ham, crispy bacon, topped with hollandaise". We got this with a side of fruit. The fruit was OK. The watermelon was not sweet and it was not firm/crunchy. The benedict was tasty. It tasted just like a benedict should! An abundance of ham! The eggs were perfectly poached.Organic Coffee: Bro-in-law said it tasted like hotel coffee, and it was a big disappointment. He said that it was not strong and that coffee in America is crap (he is from Australia where he boasts really good coffee!).Organic Latte: Sister says "Average". I say there wasn't much coffee flavor. It was very milky, and there was no design in the foam as shown in some pictures. Sad.Service: Bro-in-law and sister says the server was "abrupt". They didn't enjoy him. On the other hand, we were seated relatively quickly, after only 25 minutes. We were quoted 45-60 minutes, so that was great! Especially since it was raining and lots of people were waiting in their tiny little foyer. The place is very hipster! Very trendy, and it's on Melrose. After we finished eating, we went to go shopping. It was upon exit that we realized we stunk of restaurant!  Make sure to wear clothes you're going to wash soon so you don't make new, freshly laundered clothes stink!Parking: Valet is $6. Street parking is better. Have someone jump out of the car, put their name down and wait while you circle and circle to find a parking spot. Metered street parking. Bring coins!Recommend: Crunchy French Toast!!!

Reviews.Author: Ringo M.
Reviews.Content: Best french toast ever.Also probably the best chai latte I've ever tasted.

Reviews.Author: H M.
Reviews.Content: Wait time was probably 30 seconds on a Saturday morning at 10am. We were seated on the patio and waited on by a fun, bohemian chick. I ordered the California Omelette minus the bacon and the BF had the French Toast. Midway through, we did a switch-a-roo, and tried the other's order. I enjoyed both very much.Were in and out in about an hour. Good food, fast service.Will be returning.

Reviews.Author: Diana A.
Reviews.Content: I like the set up of this restaurant, it is so nice and bright :pI ordered their Blu JAm egg benedict and their crunchy french toast. Both of them are fantastic :).I also love their fresh juice. You can ask any combination you want(from their list of fruit and veggies ofc :p). The line is pretty long, I need to wait at least 30minutes or so to get seated(party of 3).

Reviews.Author: Herman Y.
Reviews.Content: The coffee is pretty terrible here, but we know you're not coming here for the coffee. I suggest another beverage on their menu.Food is good though, and the atmosphere is gentle. Smack dab in a decent shopping district too so after you eat you can walk it off by checking out some shops nearby.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie H.
Reviews.Content: Stopped by here on a monday to have brunch. I reccomend you do 2hr parking on Fuller St but check all the signs before you park! A nice gentleman in the front of the restaurant immedietly greeted me with a big smile and asked how many people in my party. I told him three. There appeared to be a wait...but, he looked at the list and peered back into the restaurant and said "you guys are lucky and came at the right time...come this way!" (No wait...sweet!) He seated us quickly and the waiter was very nice and on cue. Menus, water vase and 3 cups were brought to our table without asking. We ordered the salmon benedict, migas, and crunchy french toast! Food was delicious...the portion was really big! Great place to eat breakfast off melrose...you wont be dissapointed!

Reviews.Author: Stephen P.
Reviews.Content: Doesn't do take out AT ALL on the weekend. I tried to call in an order, nope. I asked if I could come in, order wait, and then take my food to go, nope.

Reviews.Author: Noemi M.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE breakfast! It's my favorite meal of the day! It's the MOST important meal of the day. It was Friday, my last day of winter vacation. So, before returning to my workaholic state, I was feeling a bit spontaneous, and decided to give Blu Jam Cafe a try. I was greeted and seated immediately. I understand that this was unusual, since I came here on a weekday and was by myself. I mean being seated immediately, as I hear that there is usually about an hour wait on the weekends. Of course they'll smile and say "hello" to you. :)I was given a glass of water and it was infused with cucumber. Oooohhh! As a friend of mine calls it-- "spa water". What a refreshing surprise. :)Next, I ordered a cup of coffee.  I had to stop myself as I caught myself getting all  Portlandia on my waiter, asking about the source of their coffee and such. But, he happily answered my questions. They use local roasters, Cafe LA.  I tried to order their French press, but my waiter told me it wasn't available yet. Said that though it was new on the menu, the equipment hadn't come in yet. This was a little confusing. Well, next time. Still, I really enjoyed my regular cup of Joe. It was smooooth in taste and texture...:)This being my first time here, I ordered their signature Crunchy French Toast. And to balance out the sweetness, I ordered a side of bacon.My food came out, and I was pleased that it was a perfectly sized portion, enough to finish in one sitting. Not three! :) I have to say that it was very good. Very flavorful. However, this was not my first time having French toast rolled in corn flakes. I first tried this at Marston's in Pasadena, years ago. This is also their signature dish. However, Blu Jam makes it better. It is softer and easier to chew. Plus, they add different fruit. And of course, it comes with the vanilla bean sauce comes with the French toast. But, I wasn't crazy about the vanilla bean sauce in a small steel cup. The sauce was TOO sweet for me-- too sweet for my taste. It was a little overwhelming for me. But then again, this is coming from a person who doesn't put sugar in her coffee nor uses flavored creamers. I should have asked for some maple syrup or honey instead. If that happened, I would have liked the French toast even more. You however, might love it with the vanilla bean sauce!  So, to balance out the sweetness of my French toast, I had the bacon.  They use bacon from Niman Ranch--one of their partner producers. It was pleasantly crispy and nicely cooked, not dripping with grease, nor overly salty. There was a point where I crumbled some pieces of bacon onto my toast. Yum!  Towards the end, however, my French toast was a little on the dry side. But then again, that's what the vanilla bean sauce was for. Not wanting to waste my food, I used all of the vanilla sauce with my toast. Though not everything is local or organic, as strawberry season is over and bananas are not local, unless they're from my backyard, (Yes, I have a real banana tree), I do applaud Blu Jam for their efforts. As mentioned on their menu and website, "Blu Jam Café supports the California economy by sourcing the majority of its food and beverages from local producers, farmers, and distributors."  Hooray! Keep it local, organic, and sustainable--as much as you can! I will be back to try their other dishes, especially as they have many veggie and vegan options. :)

Reviews.Author: Hansome K.
Reviews.Content: by far my favorite place to go to for brunch! I always end up getting some sort of eggs benedict but its so damn good i don't want to try anything else. The wait here is usually around 30 minutes but honestly its worth every second.

Reviews.Author: Brittany B.
Reviews.Content: The wait is a bit much, the inside has an odd smell, but this place serves amazing food!  My Norwegian Benedict with smoked salmon was beautifully done, with eggs poached to perfection.  The fruit served on the side is really lovely: strawberries, bananas, grapes, blueberries, and pineapples.  My friend loved her Panini.  Service is friendly, if not a bit slow.  All in all, a great place to stop by if you can wait about 45 minutes before you actually eat something.

Reviews.Author: Marina Z.
Reviews.Content: Amaazing food! Gets a little too packed though.

Reviews.Author: Laura L.
Reviews.Content: mmm....mac n' cheese! One of the best comfort food ever! even for breakfast!Went to LA for a weekend and let me tell you, food in socal is A-MAZING! seriously. I am quite disappointed we don't have some of those restaurants here in the bay. But its okay. it gives me an incentive to go back down to socal. Anyways. We came here for Brunch (there was 6 of us). It wasn't too hard to find parking on the side streets but this is definitely a very busy area and we had to drive to get here. It was about a 30 minute wait which was short considering we had 6 people. So while we waited, we strolled up and down the block and browsed the many shops (well, the girls did. The guys waited outside the restaurant in the off-chance we got a table sooner. we didn't). Once we got out table, we were seated and the waitress was quick to get all of us menus and ask us what we would like to drink. definitely good service.My friends ordered eggs benedict, someone else got a omelete (i think) but I went to for the mac n' cheese plate since I had a pretty interesting adventure the night before [and by that i mean i don't remember a thing but my friends filled me in so it's all good. lol]. I needed some comfort food and so I ordered "Kamil's Breakfast" which was Pan-roasted macaroni scrambled with eggs,  smoked bacon, ham, garlic, chives, and cheddar ($12.95). I mean, c'mon. Macroni, eggs, bacon, and cheddar? how can that NOT be good?and it definitely met my expectations. I was a little worried that it might be a tad bit salty but no. It was perfect. Came on a hot plate, soft macaroni, and no overkill on the cheese. Every bite had a tad bit of bacon, ham and cheese so it was like a perfect bite every time. It was delicious! I usually wouldn't be able to finish the whole plate but I ate everything! it was that good. I feel a little bit bloated afterwards so I suggest not trying to eat the whole thing.

Reviews.Author: Kim S.
Reviews.Content: This place gets mad points for top breakfast spots! If you are looking for an amazing spot for breakfast in LA, then I would strongly suggest the Blue Jam Cafe on Melrose. The food in Europe puts the food in America to shame.... but when I had stopped in here, I had to give them mad props! The food is excellent, service impressive, atmosphere relaxing,  jazz tunes in the background that makes you feel nothing but happy.  I  must say that I was also impress with their Gluten free menu.
