I woke up the next morning in Amsterdam dreaming about breakfast at the Blu Jam Cafe on Melrose.

Reviews.Author: Courtney G.
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience here in the back room the other weekend. I would take other friends here or out-of-town guests, even. The menu features a ton of interesting dishes for brunch and we each got something different. The coffee is good, to boot.If you want to kill time afterwards, pop over to L.A. Eyeworks to try on glasses (either a few doors down on Melrose or take a little stroll to the other location on Beverly Blvd).

Reviews.Author: D W.
Reviews.Content: A wonderful little place for brunch or a casual lunch.  Melrose does have a lot of these delightful places (very reminiscent of arty college town cafes) - but this place actually has pretty good food and competent service.  There's a huge menu ranging from breakfast foods to brunch foods to burgers to salads to pastas, etc.My friend had goulash soup (quite tasty - i had never had it before) and a turkey sandwich.  I had a yummy "blujam benedict" - ham, bacon, poached eggs atop a croissant (very good - not healthy at all).  My other friend had a crab sandwich benedict but she wasn't that pleased with it (i think because we all expected the crabcake to have more lump crab).  But all in all, we enjoyed our time there and will likely try it again.  (just don't get the crabcake).Afterwards we walked around on Melrose and shopped - probably one of the few places in LA where you can still score a bargain occasionally.

Reviews.Author: mike g.
Reviews.Content: Man, I had this omelette with avocado and bacon and cheese and sour cream I think? There were some tomatoes up in there, too. But MAAAN it was good. Almost to the point that it was unfair to other omelettes.I mean, most omelettes are pretty good to begin with, but there was something special about this one. Not that it was fluffier or fresher or anything...it was just CLEAN. Immaculately prepared. Put together with care. Sometimes you get an omelette and there's mushrooms falling out of the side, there's like half a slice of avocado even though you paid extra for that ish, or the cheese is starting to coagulate. Like it's a total wreck, right? The grill man was hella whipping it together along with a zillion other breakfasts.Not the case here. Blu Jam served my food (and my girl's food) straight out the effing oven. Or pan, or whatever. It was prime. I had the rye toast. It was great. Came with grape jelly (and strawberry after we asked.) Small orange juice is pretty small. Wouldn't get it again. Didn't have the coffee. The water was a little funky. Excellent fruit selection, though. Oh, and you know how some brunches/breakfasts leave you feeling hella stuffed? Like you leave the table and know immediately that the meal was a mistake. Like, you woke up early just to make it before the crushing line, and now you just want to go back to sleep - but not because you want to, but because your food is forcing you to? It was not that way at Blu Jam Café. I ate my omelette and felt excellent afterwards. Ready to take on the world. And I did. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Author: Eric H.
Reviews.Content: I was in LA with some friends, sharing a hotel room, which meant sharing a double bed with one friend. Well, one of his friends living in the area got too drunk, and had to stay over in the hotel. At some point in the night, he pushed me to the middle of the bed, leaving me with like 12 inches of room for my body. I slept through this until 6am, when I realized what happened and thought "WTF." I didn't want to be sandwiched between those two, so I figured I should go find breakfast.I searched yelp for a breakfast place open early enough on a Sunday and came across Blu Jam, hopped in the car, and headed up, hoping I would beat the weekend brunch crowd. Sure enough there were only 3 tables occupied at the restaurant.The staff was really friendly and far more awake than me at that time. I ordered a gunpowder green tea and the Blu Jam Benedict (an eggs Benedict with Bacon as well as Ham.)I'm picky about tea, so I was a little surprised when the tea came out steeping in a french press (You don't want to use a french press because it's plunger is a screen, and you can't completely isolate the tea leaves from the water when you're done steeping, meaning you end up over-steeping what's left in there. Bodum makes something that looks like a french press for tea, but has a container to isolate the tea.) Anyway, it was better than bagged tea at least.The Benedict was awesome. Looked perfect, tasted good, and was a generous serving size. The country potatoes served on the side were seasoned well, but a little bit undercooked.L.A. has more breakfast spots than the Bay Area, so I am hesitant to give that fifth star, but if you transplanted it up north, it would top the selection here.

Reviews.Author: Mahealani F.
Reviews.Content: This place can take a few minutes to get your food, but as our awesome waitress told us... they don't pre cut anything and make it completely fresh as soon as your order it. Besides, when you're munching on freshly toasted bread slathered with olive tapenade and chatting with friends, it's well worth the wait.Free street parking is always available, if you know where to look, but there are several parking structures around that are inexpensive.This place has the best breakfast in LA with veggie friendly options. The staff is friendly, quick with suggestions, and very knowledgeable.I discovered this place on a whim, but will reccomend it to everyone i know in LA.

Reviews.Author: dana b.
Reviews.Content: YES!i love this place. i've been 3 times in the last few months and don't even live that close.the food is always delish.they have fantastic brunch selections! the service has always been great.no complaints.

Reviews.Author: Ron F.
Reviews.Content: A friend had the Blu Jam Benedict and I had the Gourmet Benedict (has smoke salmon in it) and it was fantastic. The poached eggs were slightly running, but not running copiously. The dill hollandaise was balanced, rich, but not too heavy, and accented the eggs and salmon. The croissant on which it was served also was toasted nicely. I had mixed greens as a side and possible the best Balsamic dressing. Light, slightly sweet, tangy, perfect. My friend has the potatoes and they were perfect. And the chocolate monkey ice tea? Its worth it. A robust tea that has hints of chocolate and banana (though they use apple bits). No need for sweetener.While the restaurant was packed, getting our water refilled was automatic. Our waitress checked in with us, but did so in a non-disruptive manner.

Reviews.Author: Christina M.
Reviews.Content: I love this place.I've been here several times for brunch and even selected it for my company birthday lunch.Everything here is delicious- I'm partial to the salmon hash and the huevos tapatias- the waitstaff is friendly, and the location is great for people watching and shopping.Just the mention of this place makes my inner (and outer, haha) fat kid do awkward cartwheels of glee. Go there; it's great.

Reviews.Author: N.N. R.
Reviews.Content: Such a great place, seriously!You're missing out if you don't give this place a try. From the service to the food, we were totally impressed. Of course, we felt that we were paying a bit of a high price for breakfast (minus the 1 star), but really other than that, LOVE this place.Our waitress was amazing. I'll never forget the amazing service we got and how cool she was. Not once did we feel rushed or anything, and everything we ordered was seriously not only delicious and cooked just right. Even down to the hot tea I ordered, I was just so happy to be eating at Blu Jam. We didn't have to wait to be seated - I think we beat the Sunday morning rush, but even if we did have to wait, I think it would have been worth it. Super cute & cozy place (reminded me of san francisco), very cool crowd, comfortable seating ... I don't think I can say one bad thing :-) I look forward to eating here for a meal other than breakfast soon. I think all of their selections are sure to please!

Reviews.Author: Msi L.
Reviews.Content: i love breakfast menu!! orange juice is soo fresh!! i still have to take my co workers  here for our breakfast fix after wok!I had the eggwhich, super yummy!!!cant wait to go back and try the rest of the menu! :)

Reviews.Author: Sheila Fay N.
Reviews.Content: The words heavenly, ambrosial and scrumptious come to mind when I think of Blu Jam! Again, I am very bummed to move from that area- since Blu Jam was one of my Sunday brunch places! They have a great menu, and very congenial servers. Their coffee is delicious! I always have a favorite dish wherever I dine- and the Mazatlan Scramble is wonderful, their fruit is very fresh and goes well after such a wonderful meal. Their Salmon Hash is also delightful! Minus one star- and it isn't their fault because it is truly a great place- they become quite crowded on the weekends!

Reviews.Author: Sabine A.
Reviews.Content: I have been to Blue Jam several times for brunch.  I think the food is solid but its a bit overpriced.  I usually order a simple breakfast, eggs ,toast and chicken apple sausage.

Reviews.Author: T Y.
Reviews.Content: The perfect place to get breakfast after a hike in the hills not too far away.  Pet friendly dining on the sidewalk, but it's a popular place to walk dogs with no shortage of ill tempered dog owners...The breakfast specials are the ones to order, a separate one page menu that typically comes with the regular menu.  The migas always hit the spot.  Be prepared for long lines during the weekends, and a grab bag of mostly friendly staff.I'll go back for sure, but it's not going to be a regular place.

Reviews.Author: J L.
Reviews.Content: Blujam Benedict: outta control tastey.  Perfect ham/egg/hollandaise sauce on a very good croisant.  After this brunch, no English muffin will ever do for eggs benedict, only croisants from now on.Nice ambiance, friendly staff, unusually good coffee, crowded but we (4) were seated quickly.  This place wins.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan W.
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went here for a nice Saturday morning brunch and I really was impressed by the quality of food.  My morning hash was perfectly cooked and mixed with a ton of yummy fillings.  The potatoes were not over or undercooked.  The eggs were tender and not rubbery.  The toast was a tad bit lukewarm for my taste.  But overall it did an excellent job in filling me up.  On top of it all, I LOVED the lemon and mint leaves in the water that made the meal that much more refreshing.The service was excellent and really made an effort make me feel welcome.  As I sat on the outside tables waiting for my friends, they were kind enough to bring me water.  The outside tables are a little noisy for my picking, but the indoors isn't too much different.  Instead of car noises, it's people's voices.  Overall this place is an excellent choice for brunch/breakfast and I would definitely love to come back.

Reviews.Author: Jessie C.
Reviews.Content: So I came here with two friends for "breakfast" at 2pm on Saturday. Good thing about eating at weird times is that you don't have to wait very long to get a table. Even at 2pm this place was full, but we only had to wait like 5 minutes to get a table for 3 (perfect amount of time to look over the drool inducing menu.)My friends ordered the daily special of Goulash over pan-fried gnocchi and the Norwegian eggs benedict, while I got the Loxox (smoked salmon scramble.) The head chef, Kamil, even came out to explain to us exactly what the famous goulash was. We saw him eating a big plate of it at a neighboring table so we knew it must be decent. The goulash and gnocci was very good. It was obvious that the beef had been slowly stewed for hours since it was falling-apart soft and saturated with the rich soup. The gnocchi was a bit hard but an excellent counterpart to the goulash. The special was good, but the Norwegian Benedict was absolutely heavenly. The smoked salmon was so flavorful and buttery, while the hollandaise definitely had a punch that took it a step up from any regular eggs benedict. Unfortunately, I wasn't as ecstatic about my Loxox. It wasn't bad, but I couldn't taste the brie and the smoked salmon made the scramble kind of watery. On the whole, I really enjoyed eating here. Great cozy happy atmosphere, and our waiter was really nice as well as super cute (even my guy friends agreed.) Definitely worth a second visit.

Reviews.Author: Jason S.
Reviews.Content: I went on Thanksgiving day and they were  packed!  This was my first trip to Blu Jam and I'll say I was very pleasantly surprised.  The cafe featured indoor and outdoor seating with friendly staff and aesthetically pleasing decor.Food:We ordered the breakfast quesadilla and the gourmet burger, both of which were absolutely delicious.  The serving sizes weren't huge, but definitely sufficient for big eaters.  I also ordered their OJ which seemed to be like a combination of concentrate and fresh squeezed juice (nothin' too special about that).  What will make me want to return to Blu Jam is without a doubt the laid back ambiance of the cafe.  It's located on Melrose makes it perfect for a lazy Sunday morning/afternoon stroll after you dine.  I highly recommend this gem of a restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Shana B.
Reviews.Content: GREAT breakfastluckily i didn't go on a weekend because i hear the line/wait is nuts but really, it'd be worth it

Reviews.Author: ANGIE H.
Reviews.Content: This is my go to breakfast place.Price is average, $30 for two.Ordered fresh oj, blu jam benedict and the power house.theyre both great my fave is Blu Jam Benedict served on a croissant....mmmmm =*)Great Beer selection, theyre all californian beers.keep it local.love it.Parking is a sinch.

Reviews.Author: Liza T.
Reviews.Content: When visiting Los Angeles, I searched Yelp for a good place to have breakfast and this place came up. It had a lot of decent reviews and many people kept raving about this crunchy french toast they served here. I LOVE having something sweet for breakfast rather than something savory; so once I kept seeing all these raves about french toast.. I knew I had to try it.When: My boyfriend and I ended up coming here on a Saturday around noon. Being it was Saturday and around the prime time for brunch, I knew we would have to end up waiting. The wait time for 2 people was around 20 minutes. Definitely well worth the wait though!Where:This place does have seating outside; however, being that it was cold outside.. we opted to sit inside. The restaurant itself was pretty small, and the tables were all pretty close to each other. This was the only downside of this restaurant; there doesn't seem to be a lot of privacy between you and other patrons dining there. I could literally reach out and touch other people's tables, food, etc. if I wanted to. However, given that this place is SUPER busy.. fitting as many tables in there as possible does help reduce the wait time.Who: The service we received was pretty good. When we asked questions; she didn't hesitate to answer them even though she was slammed with other customers. We did have to ask maybe once or twice for refills on water and ice tea; however, given the fact that it was soooo busy.. that is understandable.What: Since everyone gave rave  reviews on their crunchy french toast; I ended up ordering that. The crunchy french toast w/ vanilla sauce is only served on weekends; this is hands down THE BEST FRENCH TOAST I EVER HAD. Yes, it is that good. The french toast wasn't too dense, it had the right amount of crunch, and combined with the vanilla sauce and fruit.. OMG i'm craving it more and more just as i'm writing up this review. I ended up eating EVERYTHING on the plate which is rare for me because I usually need a to-go box for every time I eat out. My boyfriend ordered this steak hash. It had steak, avocados, potatoes, onions, and other goodies in it. It was pretty good as well; however, after he had a bite of my french toast.. he said he wished he ordered that as well.Why.. I would return again:The service was good, the food was awesome. I would definitely come here again for their crunchy french toast. =]

Reviews.Author: Devon R.
Reviews.Content: Can't even lie, I was not even interested in eating at such a nice place lol. But the people there were amazing and welcoming (they probably knew i was from New York). That french toast was unbelievable, it was rolled in cornflakes and served with some buttermilk vanilla dip, topped with fruits galore. I ordered the Breakfast Quesadilla... i could not finish but my glutton was craving for more. I loved it here to be honest. Will definitely come back when I move to LA.

Reviews.Author: Amy U.
Reviews.Content: Came here for breakfast with the fiance this morning and was super pleased.  The decor is stylish, yet comfy.  Service was great.  Food was delicious!Love the coffee and would definitely recommend to everyone!

Reviews.Author: Tiffani Y.
Reviews.Content: I think BJC offers one of the best French toast and egg benedict in Los Angeles..Must order:French toastFlorentine egg benedict...(you can change the muffin into croissant)However, it usually has a long wait line ..approximately 40mins to one hour wait..but i think it's definitely worth it..go try it if u haven't!

Reviews.Author: Louloua J.
Reviews.Content: After spending an entire night watching a cricket match, my friends and I did not want to sleep hungry. Our stomachs were roaring for some FOOD. Come into picture "Brunch at Blu Jam Café". After being up for an entire night without food, it is only obvious that you would be irritated and grumpy. So writing a bad review would only be justified.But, much to my surprise, I FELL IN LOVE with this place. The liveliness around the corner, people buzzing in and out all the time - I just instantly fell for Blu Jam Café.There is always a wait time here, so be prepared. We were around 8-10 of us, so they had us seated separately in private booth.Some of us ordered for fresh juice while others preferred their morning dose of caffeine. And we all loved our drinks. For breakfast, their French toasts and pancakes are the most popular options. And on eating that, we knew exactly why. Some of us called for omelets (I specially feel their California omelet is to die for). They serve most of their dishes with fresh fruits/breads/potatoes.  They also have loads of healthy options for people who are more calorie-conscious. Let's just say we all had a wholesome meal and nobody was left complaining.All in all, this is on the top of my list for the perfect Sunday morning Breakfast/Brunch.

Reviews.Author: FOODY L.
Reviews.Content: Ahh - mazing french toast. You have to get this..it has crispy corn flakes on the outside with fresh fruits on top.I also ordered a spinach risotto thing, that was really good too.I even got a grapefruit juice, but that was not work it, it was really pricey for fresh squeezed, around $8.If your a brunch lover, I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Author: Stacy L.
Reviews.Content: I AM SUCH A HUGE FAN OF THIS PLACE. I went on a Friday for lunch and it was easy to find parking across the street and the crowd was not big, I heard it gets packed for brunch on the weekends. I had the french toast... OMG so good. I was in heaven. The coffee was good, the service was excellent, the prices were decent.. I loved the decor, the crowd was pretty trendy as were the servers. I love this place, really fresh food and a great place to have lunch in LA.

Reviews.Author: Dahlia F.
Reviews.Content: Put it this way...I have NEVER had less than delicious food, less than super friendly service or ANY attitude at this, my favorite breaky & lunch spot in LA!But SSSSHHHHHH! Don't tell anyone...it's a secret!

Reviews.Author: Casey T.
Reviews.Content: A friend and I visite Blu Jam cafe saturday afternoon around 12:30 for brunch before a marathon day of melrose shopping. We arrived and the hostess said the wait would be 25 minutes. We came back 15 minutes later to check to see how much time we had because we wanted to go across the street to do a bit of shopping to work up an appetite - she almost rudely said "well, I told you it was going to be 35 to 40 minutes and its only been 10". Strike one. So 20 minutes later we came back and sure enough they had already given our table away. They were kind enough to hurry up and give us the next available table - this is when it starts getting good.The brunch menu is fannn tastic. My friend had the eggs benedict and I had the crunchy french toast - recommended by our waitress (french toast battered not only in egg but then coated in corn flakes and then put on the griddle - YUM!).  The portions were enormous and neither of us could completey finish our plates. The service here was okay - we were immediately served water but had to wait about 10 minutes for a server to even come to the table.  She was great once she arrived - and the food came out pretty quickly once she put our order in.  They were busy -  I understand, but as a former waiters shoudl at least walk up to each table to acknowledge them within a few minutes of them sitting down.  I'll definitely come back because the food was that good, but will certainly make a reservation if possible beforehand.

Reviews.Author: W L.
Reviews.Content: Been there for breakfast (enjoyed it) and we are back for dinner. It's a tapas style bistro at night and the dishes are delicious! Love the variety and everything we ordered tasted great. Great service too. We ordered filet mignon, shrimps with toasts, risotto with dried tomatoes, baby back ribs, shrimps with tortillas, grilled white fish and vanilla ice cream with grilled dough.

Reviews.Author: Jensen S.
Reviews.Content: Went for brunch today and this had become one of my favorite brunch places.Three of us ordered...eggs benedict, italian "giambotta", and crispy french toast.  Eggs benedict was pretty typical - but well made.  The italian "giambotta" was special - surprisingly light even with the strong taste of pesto.  the winner?  Crispy French Toast - never had anything like this.  toast covered in corn flakes and fried slightly, topped with fresh fruits complemented by condensed milk. - 5 of 5.   Almost singlehandedly brought in the 5, but IMO, there needs to be multiple 5-star dishes to bring in the overall 5.However, I did hear their dinner menu is quite good as well. - will come again, and hopefully, we'll get the 5.

Reviews.Author: Roy T.
Reviews.Content: UPDATE.  I am increasing my review to 3 stars because Kamil the owner has written to me and seems genuinely, sincerely to care about his business and his customers experience, that means a lot.  I will be taking up his offer to give them a second chance and will write an update then. Went here for an 8am breakfast last week after seeing the crowds and hearing the great reviews.  I had the salmon and my work buddy had some asian dish.  The food was good, very good.However the girl serving was snooty and unfriendly, hey there could be a million reasons for that of course but all we did was ask for breakfast, whatever her issues were we didnt deserve to be on the end of them.As it happened we had to stay for over an hour to meet some customers there and the guy that served us later on was very nice and improved the experience dramatically.One word of warning, do NOT park outside before 9am, I did and the local traffic nazi gave me a $88 ticket even though I was sat outside and immediately offered to move the car, my ticket time is 8.57am.  Thats how much of a dick the local traffic cops are.

Reviews.Author: Christina R.
Reviews.Content: First review ever written and I'm glad Blu Jam Cafe gets the honors!This place was by far one of the best brunch places in Los Angeles! I went with a party of 5 and I got to try a great deal of their menu. Their crunchy french toast was absolutely delicious! Their vanilla bean sauce with the mixture of fresh fruit was probably one of the best french toast ever tasted. I wouldve been happy with just getting that alone. I suggest everything/anything on the breakfast/lunch menu as we thoroughly enjoyed all of what Blu Jam Cafe has to offer! I really recommend it to anyone!! The place is pretty cramped and small but this would be a place you would go for good food not good ambiance although it didn't matter as much once the food had arrived!Thank you Blu Jam for such a great experience! I will definitely go there again soon!

Reviews.Author: Sam Y.
Reviews.Content: Their special is egg dishes, I usually order the lunch special. Great place to go if you are shopping on melrose. Only thing I don't like is that they close early so make sure you call or check before.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie M.
Reviews.Content: Wow, was this a good brunch! My husband and I came here on a Sunday around 10:30-11, and had a twenty minute wait for a table. It's good we showed up when we did though, because a huge rush came shortly after us and some of those folks still hadn't been seated when we left. I'm not sure I would have waited that long for someplace I had never been, but maybe they have had the pleasure of eating at this place before. We sat indoors, because that was what was available, and although the place is not big, we were not crowded at all. Our waitress was cute and friendly, and the service was prompt. We each ordered a Mimosa, which was pretty boozy but WAY too expensive at $9. No matter, because the rest of the meal was fantastic. We ordered the crunchy french toast and Kamil's Breakfast, and split them between ourselves. The crunchy french toast was unbelievably good - sweet, crunchy, and with vanilla bean sauce that was irresistible. The breakfast pasta was the complete opposite, savory and delicious, with the cheese, pasta, meats and spices melding together. I cannot wait to come back for brunch... though they open at 8am, so I will likely show up earlier to skip the wait.

Reviews.Author: HIgirl H.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam Cafe breakfast was delicious, don't get me wrong, but I would not wait in line again for 45 minutes to have brunch here.  We had the crunchy french toast special and the blu jam benedicts, washed down with the house coffees.  The crunchy french toast, coated in corn flakes and decorated with fresh strawberries and bananas, were good, with almost a nutty taste to them.  It was a little too sweet for me, so maybe a nice slab of bacon would be a good accompaniment.  Sadly, the blu jam benedicts didn't come out on croissants as promised.  They were still very tasty, and we enjoyed them better than the crunchy french toast.  Overall, Blu Jam Cafe's breakfast was delicious and filling, but not worth the 45 minute wait we endured before.

Reviews.Author: Adrienne S.
Reviews.Content: tried this place because of all the great reviews and it did not disappoint. I had the crunchy french toast with a mocha latte and the bf had the steak hash and a mimosa...probably the best breakfast i've had. the staff was friendly and efficient, didnt rush us though the line was long plus the presentation was spectacular. everything tasted as good as it looked. my only problem is we waited quite a bit, about 45 min-1 hour (for a Sunday at 11am) so I highly suggest going early on the weekends or come around lunch time (which is just as good since they serve breakfast until 5 pm). i am definitely coming back again and would love to try dinner there.

Reviews.Author: Margaret F.
Reviews.Content: We went here for brunch with a group. I typically have a ton of trouble finding brunch I like - I'm a savory brunch eater, veg, not into eggs. As you can imagine, I have limited options. If you're like me, get the Tex Mex Tofu Hash. You won't regret it. I am a huge fan of Sabrina's Cafe, in Philadelphia, and never thought I'd find a brunch to compete with their tofu scramble and (new) vegetarian brunch specials. This place is it. (Granted, California has a very large avocado advantage over Pennsylvania.) Coffee was good, too.Downsides: we waited rather a long time. Not longer than any weekend brunch wait in a major city, though.

Reviews.Author: Ashley H.
Reviews.Content: The Verdict -------- Blu Jam Cafe is a great place to eat.The atmosphere is casual and the service is friendly. Definitely not as pretentious as I  was anticipating based on the location and the fact that is filled with quite a few hipsters. Our waitress was nice. Although she did forget the avocado on one of the burgers, but we can't all be perfect.The wait for our food on the other hand was a little long, but the quality of the food was delicious. One more thing. This place is definitely pricey. Three people = $54.35.We ordered two turkey burgers one with avocado on the side, two orange juices and I ordered the vanilla french toast and one egg on the side.Order the french toast it is fabulously tasty.

Reviews.Author: Helen P.
Reviews.Content: We came here around 11am for a brunch and had to wait a bit before the 6 of us could sit down. However, the wait was not bad at all (less than half an hour) and there were many vintage stores and shops nearby, so we were checking them out during the wait and time flew by quickly. We tried many dishes, but the only thing I can remember clearly is that they have the best french toast ever!! They used corn flakes to make the outer shell a bit crunchy but the inside was very soft. The sauce on the side was creamy yet not too sweet or thick. Just perfect. I could just eat this french toast all day long.As for other dishes, they were all pretty good but not fantastic enough that I remembered their names and the details of the dish themselves.The host and the waiters were very courteous.The portions are perfect for one person, so if you eat large portions or are thinking about sharing, I would recommend Griddles over this place.But, I would definitely choose this place over Bungalow in Larchmont anytime.

Reviews.Author: Jane P.
Reviews.Content: GREAT breakfast food. I rarely eat breakfast but when I do, I love to indulge. Came here to catch up with an old friend and chose this place based on Yelp reviews. We got here around 12:30p on a Wednesday and there was no wait. I ordered the vanilla french toast, my boyfriend got Kamil's Breakfast and my friend got the Roma via Paris omelette. ALL were fantastic. The french toast had a great bready texture that was not overly sweet or soggy. Fresh berries topped it off with powdered sugar and it was delicious.Kamil's Breakfast made me wonder why I never thought of it before - basically mac&cheese with ham and bacon bits, garlic, chives and scrambled eggs. SO GOOD.The Roma via Paris omelette was a health-conscious eater's dream with fresh veggies and yummy square potatoes.Only downside to this place was that the portions were smaller than I expected.

Reviews.Author: Elle D.
Reviews.Content: My friend's crunchy french toast was really great. I liked the vanilla sauce served with it. It was nice to have french toast with something other than maple syrup. I vaguely remember what mine was called, Roma via Paris or something, but it was tasty. There were lots of vegetables and they were prepped so that it was the perfect bite-size. The fruit portion that came along with it was nice. My apple, carrot and ginger juice was overpowered by the ginger. It was really hard to drink. Ginger shouldn't be juiced like an apple. A hint is more than enough. Maybe I should have made it clear that I only wanted a hint.My wait was about 15 minutes on a Sunday around 10am. Free street parking before 11am!

Reviews.Author: Tony L.
Reviews.Content: I'm absolutely in love with the brunch at Blu Jam!Although the wait can be quite long during peak times (what respectable brunch place doesn't?), the fact that its nestled in the heart of the Melrose shopping district provides plenty of entertainment while you wait.  Thank god they don't implement a line system like the one at Mama's in San Francisco, but instead, simply put your name down on the list and check back later at your own convenience.I love the fact the venue was once known as a jazz bar (as a lover of jazz music) and the proprietors stayed true to that tradition, both in its name and decor.  You really pick up its vibe as soon as you enter the premises, with its brick-exposed walls and jazz music playing in the background.  This is the perfect spot for me.For brunch, the Blu Jam benedict with black forest ham was delicious, but the real highlight of my visit was the french toast topped with fresh berries and bananas.  To be honest, I don't typically order french toast but I have to say this is probably one of the best versions of french toast I've ever had the pleasure of eating.  The uniqueness lies in its flaky outer shell, giving it just the right amount of texture to balance it out.  I now compare all french toast to Blu Jam's.The place seemed to thrive from a constant wave of customers, people were still ordering brunch into a Saturday afternoon.  The crowd was filled with an eclectic mix of people, perfect for those that love to people-watch.I'm not sure if it was the beautiful weather outside or the delightful company I was with that day, but my brunch experience at Blu Jam will always be a reminder for me to come back if I ever find myself in the area again.

Reviews.Author: Olivia Y.
Reviews.Content: I went to Blu Jam today for the first time and l loved it. Not only was the food amazing but the atmosphere was fun and the place played great music. My friend and I split our meals so we could both taste everything.Food: 1. Crunchy french toast with fresh fruit and a vanilla dipping sauce. This was the BEST french toast I have ever had.  2. The Venetian Chicken sandwich had so much flavor. The roasted bell peppers adds a very sweet touch to the pesto and chicken.  3. Tuna Tartar Starter. This was good, I was expecting something better for the price though. (A delicious Tuna Tartar is at Omi Sushi on Santa Monica and Crescent Heights!)Downside: The salad that comes with the sandwiches was only greens and barley any dressing. Not impressive, but stil ok. They also ran out of red potatoes, which is why we had to get the salad as a side. The red potatoes looked so good.The service was quick, we waited less than 10 minutes and were seated outside where we could people watch. The wait staff was very quick and friendly. Highly recommended for Breakfast/Brunch/Lunch.

Reviews.Author: Wes C.
Reviews.Content: Came here on a Sunday afternoon around 1:30pm.. wait was about 30-45 minutes, but worth it to check this place out.Organic Latte = 4.5Roma Via Paris + ham = 5Norwegian Benedict = bf rated it a 3.5 because he didn't like the salmon with raw tomatoes.. wished he'd gotten the Blu Jam Benedict or Florentine instead.Overall = 4.5, would like to come back and try the french toast w/ vanilla bean sauce and other omelets/benedicts for sure.

Reviews.Author: Nick T.
Reviews.Content: On our way back from Beverly Hills, stopped at Blu Jam Cafe to get some breakfast. We ordered their crispy french toast and a regular 2 egg breakfast. Crispy french toast is a must since it is one of the best I have ever had. They basically take a regular french toast and dip it in corn flakes and then fry it. It is then topped with fruits and a creamy sauce which is to die for. As far as the eggs, they were ok, I mean there isn't much that can be done with eggs if you know what I mean. If you are ever in the area in the morning, definitely stop in and try the crispy french toast, you will be very happy you did.

Reviews.Author: Sarah K.
Reviews.Content: The french toast is probably the best I've ever had. Sooo delicious. The California omelette was good too, but the gem of this place is definitely the crunchy french toast. You HAVE to order it if you come here.Service is really friendly, as well. There was a bit of a line, but it was definitely worth it. Parking is pretty difficult though.

Reviews.Author: Cassie R.
Reviews.Content: This place was so amazing until all of LA realized how amazing it was!  It gets so crowded here for brunch, and you can't make reservations, so if you come during peak hours (10 a.m. - 2 p.m.) be prepared for a 45 min to 1 hr 40 min wait time.  I would eat here for breakfast everyday if I could, but it's pretty expensive and I'd have to wait everyday. Aside from that fact, I've been coming here for a couple of years and I absolutely crave it.  The regular drip coffee is the best, I re-emphasize, THE BEST I've had at a breakfast place in LA.  Endless coffee refills, amazing egg dishes, friendly staff, cool atmosphere, sufficient free street parking nearby, all pretty awesome.

Reviews.Author: Sheerin K.
Reviews.Content: Dreamy! There is a wait if you go for lunch at a weekend (around 20 - 45 mins) but is totally worth it and they come out with water while you wait - Best things on the menu - strawberry barrata is actually why i go back every weekend, crunchy cornflake brioche - Amaaaazing! Eggwich. Nuff Said. Top it off with a Latte and an orange juice and i don't need to eat the rest of the day!Sad they lost their liquor license and are no longer open in the evenings - used to love dinner here -  Nice setting, great atmosphere and great staff - It's as good as it gets!

Reviews.Author: Tabitha C.
Reviews.Content: Review is only for brunchLongest wait I've ever experienced for brunch, nearing 2.5 hours, although the food was not disappointing.I would go back just for their Crunchy French Toast, which is really all I remember from my brunch meal there, their egg dishes are great, nothing that stands out from the million brunch places in LA.  But it also means you can't go wrong with anything you order there.It is a great place for brunch although i do not know when would be a good time to get there because there always seems to be a wait.  Parking: Residential streets on the side

Reviews.Author: Jonny M.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic. One of the best in the city. Love the place and the staff. A bit pricy at times but not when you think of the TLC going into what you eat. Great spot.

Reviews.Author: Audrey M.
Reviews.Content: Service from the host/hostess was excellent. Flavor of food was great but the bread for my Blu Jam eggs Benedict was way too overcooked and hard... And our actual server didn't really ask us how our food was..but all in all I was happy. Also there was a disgruntled homeless person yelling at the people sitting outside but management handled the situation with tact and respect. I was very impressed. It was my second time and I will def go back! But minus one point for food prep cuz my jaw hurts from trying to chew that sorry excuse for bread.....

Reviews.Author: Brenda Jiwon L.
Reviews.Content: This brunch restaurant is known for being one of the best brunch places near Hollywood!Fortunately we went on a Wednesday afternoon so there was no wait so we got seated right away. I tried their famous crunch french toast, which was honestly the best french toast I've ever tried! Compared to other places, the bread wasn't as thick, but the inside was still very chewy and the outside was made perfectly crunch and it just melted in my mouth! The french toast came topped with some strawberries, bananas, and blueberries and it was definitely worth it!We also ordered the Olympus, which was from the health and fitness menu. The plate is made out of 6 egg whites, chicken, and was scrambled with Zucchini, tomatoes, and tomato sauce. It came with a side of salad and 2 slices of wheat toast. The jam that came with the toast was also perfect and not too sweet. Overall the meal was very filling but the scramble was a tad bit too savory, with too much tomato sauce. We also ordered iced coffee, which was really strong and bitter. However, they give you a small side of milk so with milk, the iced coffee went perfect with the meal! The prices are also reasonable considering that it is one of the top brunch places in Los Angeles!They serve breakfast food all day and the staff is also very friendly! The ambience is really nice! One bad thing is that it is only street parking so you would have to find parking in the neighborhood, which is 2 hour parking.

Reviews.Author: Vonyse R.
Reviews.Content: Yeah! I love Blu Jam!  The owners the staff, the customers, everyone is wonderful!

Reviews.Author: Laura P.
Reviews.Content: This is my all time favorite brunch place in L.A. I have been coming here for years and I recommend it to anyone who asks for a good brunch spot. The only downside to going here is the wait for a table.

Reviews.Author: Alex J.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam? Mo' like OoOoOo Dayum! Ya boi came here early befo' dis spot opened its doors up as to avoid dem python-long lines! I got dat recommended Crispy French Toast and if imma be 100 here, it was OKAY....nothin a thug like me aint never had in a correctional facility! So da reason I gave dis four stars was cus the hostesses were cool and and the seats were comfortable on ya boi's bottom. 4 stars for them seats! Other wise, i'd give it 3...

Reviews.Author: Jen D.
Reviews.Content: You have got to be kidding me...this place was awesome.  We have chef friends with another similar type of restaurant in another part of the state and I will be passing along my review for them to try too.  We happened to be in Malibu for the sunrise this lovely Saturday morning and I looked on Yelp last night for some breakfast options on the way back south.  I always lean towards the most reviewed because that is usually a very good sign to start with.  Once I looked at the menu, Blu Jam was the clear winner.So, luckily, we arrived about 8:55am...there was only one table taken outside and still plenty of seating inside, so we chose outside before it got to hot, and were seated immediately.  I know in my area, any decent breakfast restaurant has a line after about 9:30am and this place was no different.  The point that there was a line (complained about by some people in reviews) is a GOOD thing when it comes to the food.  That means people are willing to wait...and wait...if necessary.  It didn't seem like many people had to wait for more than about 10 or 15 minutes.The food...ohhh my! We ordered the Crunchy French Toast - yes, it is as good as everyone says.  Just the right amount of crunch and a great vanilla sauce.  Also on the table was the Brunch Carbonara.  The eggs were poached to perfection.  once the yolks were cracked on top, the risotto's consistency was perfect.  We live pretty far away...but will be back as soon as we can.  Great breakfast!

Reviews.Author: Terry C.
Reviews.Content: Hi!OMG!  My team and I had a breakfast meeting at Blu Jam Cafe on this past Wednesday and what a treat!  The Crunchy French Toast is out of this world!  We each tried something different on the menu so that we could share; none of us were disappointed.  Yum Yum!  And the best part of the morning was Frankie, he is not only handsome, charming and a gentleman, (with lots of compliments for the table of ladies), he was the most hospitable manager I've seen in a very long time!  Koodles to Blu Jam Cafe and Frankie!  We will be back again and again...The girls at 729 Beauty!  (Rhonda, Shelle and TC)

Reviews.Author: Lauren F.
Reviews.Content: Wonderful food, wonderful service. I always take visiting friends to Blu Jam and always have a great time. Inside or outside its a warm and comfortable place with really great food and music. Favorite breakfast place in LA

Reviews.Author: Michael B.
Reviews.Content: Food is still very good! David our server was awesome thanks bro! But...the seating situation sucks!Their rule is simple: if all of your party is not present when they call your name they will not seat you, no if ands or buts about it.I think the rules needs a lil discretion from the hosts but alas nope.Heres how it all went down...My wife left my name and we patiently waited 30mins-no problem. Table was ready and we immediately said 3rd guest hadn't arrived so we'd continue waiting-no problem. About 20mins later our friend arrived and needed to park her car and after waiting 50 mins I needed to put quarters in the meter-still no problem. When I walked back 1-2 mins later my wife informed me we had been passed up TWICE because I was no longer there and friend had not "appeared for them to see her." I informed them my wife was pregnant our guest was literally walking up and that we very politely gave up a table and played the waiting game without getting upset. Basically they told me "so that's the policy". The way all 3 greeters spoke to us was quite rude and without basic compassion. While arguing/talking our guest walked up and it became a mute point, rules were now followed so we were seated... I understand regulations but this was one of those moments were seating us minus the arguing would've have been the right thing to do - the little lady is eating for 2 she needed food pronto! We are great customers and it will be hard not to share out experience with our friends and associates (and you Yelpers). Business looks good at Blu Jam, but not sure we'll come back. If my wife makes the final call we definitely won't be back - she was pissed. Food is good too...damn!

Reviews.Author: H R.
Reviews.Content: Pancakes and the sausages were really good. I will definitely go back. I got there at 9 and it was already getting busy so get there early.

Reviews.Author: Rhodri D.
Reviews.Content: Loved it, met up with some friends there for Brunch. We each ordered something different and shared: Chilaquiles, Kamil's Breakfast and Crunchy French Toast. All three were delicious, fresh and soooo goooood!! When we got there we were told the wait was 30-45 minutes (pretty standard for a good place in that part of town), but were seated in about 15. The wait staff was so nice and attentive. I have nothing bad to say, except I wasn't able to eat more.

Reviews.Author: Abike W.
Reviews.Content: The food was delicious. The French toast was worth the long wait. I also had the breakfast quesadilla and thoroughly enjoyed it. I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Author: ninon a.
Reviews.Content: Kamil is the sweetest guy and makes great crepes!  The food is always wonderful here and when your on some weird diet--he always goes out of his way to grill me some veggies or other special requests.  International Friday nights are the best!!  I am a regular!:)

Reviews.Author: PetsUntilEaten L.
Reviews.Content: If one of you like savory & the other likes sweet - you found your new spot - Blu Jam does both very well.  I love all versions of eggs benedict. They even tolerate all my additions of tomato, spinach, ect to my benedict & even get the eggs poached right.  My man loves the blueberry french toast.  It's so good I have to have more than one bite - and I normally dread sweet fluffy breakfast stuff. But damn that's good!

Reviews.Author: Joe S.
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite breakfast spots in Los Angeles.  Been going to Blu Jam for over two years now, still waiting for it to get old!  While it has become more popular since we first discovered it, we still don't have to wait too long for a table (as you might at a place like Toast).The breakfast menu is extensive enough for it to take time to decide on what to order.  With most breakfast spots I frequent, I find one favorite thing and order it over and over.  At Blu Jam, I find myself switching it up on a regular basis.  The Migas?  Wrap on Fire?  Turkey Panini?  Olympus?  Curry Chicken Wrap?  Muscle Beach?  Aaaargh so much goodness!The friendly owner Kamil is always around checking to make sure everyone is taken care of.They don't mind when I substitute cottage cheese instead of potatoes, and once they made me a breakfast panini months after it had been removed from the menu.  Great place.  Love that I can walk there.  But if I had to, I'd drive.

Reviews.Author: G. L.
Reviews.Content: This is a brunch-only review, and, when it comes to Blu Jam brunch, I am a fan.Kamil's Breakfast might very well be my favorite "well, we all have to die of something" way to start the day: baked macaroni, egg, cheese, bacon, garlic and chives. Mix in some ketchup and hot sauce and it's got the sweet, savory, spicy, crunchy, chewy bases covered. Everything else I've had there is good - and there are a lot of unique options outside of the normal eggs, pancakes, breakfast burrito you find everywhere else.Weekends can be a bit crowded, and Melrose can be a little too hipster for some people's taste (but isn't that more about their insecurities than a hipster's choice in 80s retrowear, tattoos, and emo hairstyles?), but if you don't mind those tiny distractions you'll be rewarded with something tasty.

Reviews.Author: Des R.
Reviews.Content: The service is tops. Be prepared to be treated as a valued customer.The owner/chief is a super nice guy, a great host, and  very creative.The food is great. Breakfast is the big deal here, but let me tell you that diner here can be down right amazing. The crowd is fairly local, and always great for people watching and making new friends.

Reviews.Author: Freeds L.
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Old World (scrambled eggs w/ mushroom and caramelized onions) and shared a Crepe (w/ peach, white chocolate and strawberries). Both were amazing!  The eggs were not fully cooked and were the perfect amount of "runny," if you know what I mean. The crepe had a perfect amount of sweetness too! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Author: Mark S.
Reviews.Content: I know that fellow Yelpers are going to start thinking that I generally give five star ratings, but please remember that the grading system on Yelp blows. I would rather give someone an "A" (which would be 4 1/2 stars, which I can't give) when they deserve it but will not give them a bloody "B-" (four stars) when they don't deserve that. Okay?As for the place, this is the second spin for the CC and me at the Blu Jam. Like the first time, the place was packed with standard-issue hipster doofuses that are endemic to Melrose. The people working the place, however, were top shelf. Lauren, who brought us the food, was cute, bubbly and sharp - just want you want in service. Kamil, the owner, was there and was engaging and thoughtful. The people who run the place rock even if most of the patrons are meh.The food, once again, was excellent. I had the Nowegian Benedict which had just the right amount of dill in the hollandaise. The smoked salmon was perfect and the whole thing just worked. The CC went veg and had the panini with the apples, brie, onions and...and...I ended up eating half her sandwich. It was smokin'.Do yourself a favor and hit up the Blu Jam. Just ignore the "wacky hat" masses and dig in. It is worth it. Shake Kamil's hand on the way out, too. The man deserves your love...and your patronage.

Reviews.Author: Flip C.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely delicious and well-made meals of sizeable portion for reasonable prices?! Hardly something you expect to find on Melrose Boulevard, but this place ended up proving to be a major surprise and a treat. I had the mozzarella and tomato salad for starters and a large, juicy but wholesome-looking cheeseburger for the main course. I was very impressed with the food and the staff was friendly and personable. Again, something you rarely find while on Melrose. After a long day of shopping, nothing hits the spot better than a grade A food experience, and this place is precisely that. Five stars!

Reviews.Author: MenuMan T.
Reviews.Content: Loved it.  Excellent food (and portions), fun service and environment.  Three of us went and ordered different items on the menu and ordered a side of pancakes.  *I judge a breakfast joint by the quality of its' pancakes and Blu Jam did it right.  I'll definitely be there again.

Reviews.Author: Darren v.
Reviews.Content: Awesome!I went this Saturday with my Girl and her sister. Wait was 30 mins (around noon), we just walked around and came back (it's Melrose there's a lot to do/see). I ordered the gourmet burger with a cup of the goulash, my girl ordered the tex mex tofu burrito and her sister orderd the split pea soup. wow WOW \/\/(o)\/\/!!!Yeah, everything was really super good!From the hostess, to the busser, I couldn't ask for more! Our glasses of water were never empty.Priced well for the area, food is well worth it, service is tops!

Reviews.Author: Timmy S.
Reviews.Content: Cool place with great omlettes.  They have nice pancakes and good coffee as well.  Get there early because the place fills up quick.  Owner is nice and visits tables.  Host is friendly, it's like a mom and pop place with a hippster vibe.  Consistent everytime I go.  Get the loxix (sp) really worth the trip and crappy street parking in weho.Cheers

Reviews.Author: Jaqui C.
Reviews.Content: Everything in this hole in the wall cafe is DELICIOUS...even down to the water, which they put mint in!!  The chai was perfect, a must for me with my chai addiction.  I had the Paris Omelette consisting of a huge amount of spinach and mushrooms and also had some goat cheese!!  It was great because it tasted pretty healthy which left me with a guilt free feeling.My beau had simply eggs that came with a side of toast and a side of fruit, with blueberries and all!  I would recommend that outdoor seating especially on a warm sunny morning, but the inside is nice and cozy too!I'm excited to come back and try everything else on the menu!

Reviews.Author: Harry B.
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best brunch in Los Angeles !!Sometimes there is a wait .... but  well worth it

Reviews.Author: joanna l.
Reviews.Content: YUMMMMMMM.i loved it.Even though my friend and I had to wait 20 minutes to get seated, and another 20-30 minutes for our food, when you have good company, and lots to talk about,  it doesn't really matter how long you have to wait.I ordered the Norwegian benedict, and although a little soggier than other egg benedicts i've tried, i loved how they laid everything on a croissant rather than the tough english muffin-type things other restaurants use. yummmm. they're potatoes are also really good! good flavor and texture. :)My friend ordered the french toast with blackberry jam and yogurt and topped with fresh berries. however, I don't know if i'd be able to eat it for breakfast because i like heartier breakfasts,  but nevertheless, it is mighty delicious!i enjoyed their coffeee, but then again, i always enjoy coffee (as long as it's not starbucks. )

Reviews.Author: Margie K.
Reviews.Content: If friends come to town or I need to meet someone for lunch, I always take them to Blu Jam. On average, I'm there twice a week. Once, I went six times in a week and that was crazy, but still tasty. My favorites are Huevos Rancheros, Migas, Curry Chicken Wrap, and Lemon Crepes! And the Spanish Breakfast Rice, which is a special that's only served every once in awhile. Also important: Blu Jam has the best iced coffee I have ever had. Really nice, fun people work there. There's not a bad thing to say about this place!

Reviews.Author: Bob S.
Reviews.Content: We've had brunch there more times than I can count. Blu Jam recently got a wine/beer license and is now serving dinner.  And what a wonderful dinner we had there tonight with a couple of friends!The menu is based on a shared-plates concept, so we tried about 8 dishes, and each one was absolutely delightful. The lime-chipotle shrimp, the lamb chops, the spare ribs, the pork tenderloin, the wild mushroom salad with goat cheese! Each one a revelation. Chef/owner Kamil Majer feels personably responsible for each dish, and it shows. The care in preparation and presentation, and the flavors -- just a fabulous meal. Be sure to try some of his special Czech dishes.The staff is very friendly and welcoming. Service is attentive without being pushy or overbearing. It's easy to see why Kamil has so many regulars; and why his regulars become friends.Can't wait for our next excuse for dinner there!

Reviews.Author: George Y.
Reviews.Content: The wait time was very long so be prepared for that. I ordered the blu jam Benedict with potato sides and my sis gets the Toscana scramble with fruit, our sides get switched but they fix it by bringing me another side of potatoes half way thru the meal and they where cold. Timing of service was a bit off but the Blu Jam benedict was good and my sis said the same about the scramble.Although service could have been a bit better my experience may have been just a fluke so bring plenty of change for that meter and order the cappuccino.I will be back, hopefully everything will be better next time... a lot of good stuff on that menu that I wanna try.

Reviews.Author: Benny G.
Reviews.Content: I'm not a breakfast person other then some coffee. Be side's having terrific food, the coffee is wonderful. We dine s a group and they don't mine if we sit for awhile. The eggs dish and the pancakes I highly recommend. Fresh juices always. Thank Jill!!!!

Reviews.Author: Megan P.
Reviews.Content: Adorable spot! I just had brunch here and I ordered the Specialty Omelette. Ingredients were fresh and delicious, staff was very friendly, and I loved the atmosphere. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Drew L.
Reviews.Content: I don't have time to do this restaurant justice, but five stars all way.  Love brunch. Love dinner.  Love the owner.When I daydream about opening up my fantasy restaurant, it's a nice, local place, a restaurant version of the local bar where you know everyone.  It has small-moderate sized portions for very reasonable  prices, so nobody is limited to one entree.  Everyone orders everything that looks good and eats family style.  Of course, in my fantasy restaurant, everything is vegetarian. Eating dinner at Blu Jam is like eating at my secret fantasy restaurant.  The staff is super friendly and they make us feel like repeat customers, even if they've never seen us before.  The portions are perfectly sized (i.e. small and conducive to sharing) so I can try everything that looks good.  That means three appetizers and four entrees between two of us, and it costs the same as you'd pay to have one app and one entree at some reasonable but not as good restaurant.  Even though the menu is not ALL vegetarian, the brilliant chef has certainly not neglected me.  Even the vegetarian looking risottos were not made with chicken stock - is that not the most considerate thing ever?  (You veges know what I'm talking about - drooling over the mushroom risotto only to learn that it's made with beef stock)Ask your server, or Kamil, what the to-die-fors are.  Last time there was some strawberry vinegar something sweet appetizer thiing that I wouldn't have ordered and it was like heaven in my mouth.  I hope it's still there and it wasn't just a special.Man this restaurant is amazing.  Yes, the brunch is incredible and you should have that.  But, do yourselves a favor - come here for dinner.   I will be.  Hopefully very soon, and very often.

Reviews.Author: Allison C.
Reviews.Content: Food was delicious! I got the seasonal risotto on special that seemed a little interesting (poached eggs on top), but I went for it. It was so good I wanted more and will try to recreate it in my own kitchen!!! Everyone around was also enjoying their food and specialty drinks, including the girl next to me who also ordered the risotto.Atmosphere is LA hipster coffee shop/cafe like with a small patio and overpriced paintings on the wall available for purchase. I give it 4 stars because service was not top notch. Waited too long to get drinks and the check. Overall, I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Author: Eunice L.
Reviews.Content: This is my go-to brunch spot. Yes, the wait is typically horrendous during the weekends, but the yumminess of the food is so worth it. Service is inconsistent but overall, I've never had a problem getting the attention of the server.Now the food. Delicious. They do have mimosas, but I am a fan of their coffee -- keep it comin!

Reviews.Author: Carolyn W.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam is the jam! I'm a creature of habit and normally order the same dish at a particular restaraunt...not at blu jam.  I've tried multiple breakfast, lunch, and dinner entrees and have been thrilled with everything I've tried.  Their staff is super nice, and fun to interact with.  Give it a try...you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Author: Marisaa T.
Reviews.Content: Dinner Review: My boyfriend and I came here for dinner last week. It was the last day for our Bloomspot deal so we had to use it. I have been here for breakfast on numerous occasions, but never for dinner, so I was super excited.We made reservations for 6:45 and we were seated immediately. It wasn't packed at all which was nice since I'm use to seeing an extra long wait. FOOD: The food was great, but I just wish it was more. My boyfriend and I shared everything, but the portions are small. Shrimp Ceviche: Amazing! Four Tortilla chips served with a few spoonfuls of ceviche with some sauce on it. Argentinean Steak: Tender pieces of steak with potatoes and salsa on the side. Loved it! Pasta: Can't remember the name of it, but it's the only pasta on the menu. It was okay, but our least favorite. Tres Leche cake: Amazing! I'm use to authentic Tres Leche cake from my neighborhood, and surprisingly I was impressed! White Wine Sangria: refreshing! I had two and it definitely hit the spot!  Left me with the perfect buzz.Overall I enjoyed the meal, but wish the portions were a little bigger. With the average price for items on the menu ranging  from $12-$18 you want a little more for your money.

Reviews.Author: Anthony F.
Reviews.Content: DELICIOUS!!! I went there for dinner last night and then again today for brunch and both times I was absolutely blown away with their food and service!!!I was with a party of 6 last night and the owner (Kamil) made amazing suggestions for food and wine.  Kamil's passion for high quality ingredients and how the flavors blend together really shine through in the food! We were served one plate after another of some of the BEST FOOD I have ever had and everyone in my group agreed.For dinner, definitely try their Baby Back Ribs (the meat just falls off the bone), the Scallop Carpaccio (melts in your mouth...in a good way), the Ahi Tuna Tartar, Sauteed Okra (done perfectly with a nice chipotle spice) and the Shrimp Ceviche.  AMAZING!  Then for brunch today we had the Crunchy French Toast and the Breakfast Tacos!!!  AWESOME!!!  Definitely try their French Toast--the best I've ever had!  Also, the ambiance is perfect for a dinner place at night and then the outside patio is a great spot for brunch!Great food, wonderful service and a cool atmosphere--you will love it!!!

Reviews.Author: Jim B.
Reviews.Content: I found this because of Yelp, so I have to return the favor.  I have spent many weekend mornings here to eat breakfast.  The food is incredible, the service is great, and the location is beautiful.  I always sit outside.A few warnings:  parking isn't always easy (it's on Melrose), and there is always a wait.  If you can get over those (which I have), you'll have a great experience and probably keep coming back.

Reviews.Author: Ryan U.
Reviews.Content: After a loooooonnnnggggg and tiring walk on the Paramount lot today having received a delightful tour of the studio my friend and I decided we were in dire need of nourishment. During our drive on Melrose Ave. we almost stopped by a pita restaurant, dreaming of falafel and scharma and singing "Joy to the World." Ok, maybe not the singing part haha. Unfortunately, the place was closed due to Passover. My friend, the wonderful person she is decided to recommend we try the Blue Jam Cafe. It occurred to me I'd been there before for breakfast and could easily remember how amazing the Salmon Hash was. I tried something a little different this time.I asked our HOT waitress Lauren how the egg sandwich was???? Simple enough right, I mean how good could an egg sandwich be right???? Well, I died and went to egg heaven. The bacon was crunchy and flavorful. The egg was soft and flowed with juices as I took each bite, thus adding more flavor to the sandwich. The bread, equally crunchy filled my mouth with carbs of happiness. The tomatoes were as fresh as the tea I was drinking and the side of hashbrowns were tastefully cooked to perfection.Let me just put it this way. That's the best breakfast I've ever eaten at 3:30pm in the afternoon. I think I would only eat breakfast there. If it was dinner and they didn't serve it anymore I would beg them on my knees to serve me breakfast!!!!!! If scavengering through the Sahara Desert for something to eat, I would dream about the breakfast at Blue Jam Cafe!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Author: paul g.
Reviews.Content: Love eating here. Everything is mouth watering, fresh and delicious..The service is the best in La.. Every bite we had tonight Was epic.. Recommend 100%

Reviews.Author: Minkkwan W.
Reviews.Content: Excellent Corn Flakes French Toast! It is so unique and left such an impression on me. The batter is also not overbearing as to take away from enjoying the french toast itself. The vanilla bean sauce that comes with it is also perfect in sweetness and consistency. I want to go back to Blu Jam Cafe just for this french toast again...tomorrow!My friend ordered the Eggs Benedict. I thought the hollandaise sauce was a bit too thick, and I am not a fan of ham anyways. Overall her dish was good, but also very forgettable.

Reviews.Author: Terry S.
Reviews.Content: The last time I went here a few weeks ago, the food had taken a bad turn for the worse. Service was also less experienced.Very sad,

Reviews.Author: Donya S.
Reviews.Content: Woke up with remnants of last nights vodka based drinks lingering throughout my body faced with the option to hike Runyon or grab some breakfast and chill. I clearly chose the latter, for this my body was ever grateful.My friend pulled up a few options, after viewing the BJC menu my salivating mouth decided we needed to check them out.For a busy Saturday, our wait was only 15 minutes. Overwhelmed by the deliciousness described on the menu, it was hard to make a decision, but after the patient waitress(kim) came back for the 3rd maybe 4th time we(excluding me) were ready. My sis ordered the Florentine Eggs Benedict(drool), her friend got the Brunch Burger(happiness), my cuzzo had the risotto(savory treat),  my friend had the Cali Omelet(fresh), and I wanted the Paris Omelet but they didn't have it so i tried the Burgundy(elegant simplicity) and added brie. Ohh and we got the infamous crunchy french toast to share.I'm to full to go into detail about how good everything on our table was-you are just gonna have to trust me and the other thousand + folks and check it out for yourself. The flavors won't disappoint, nor do the prices. So in the words of Tom Haverford, "Treat Yo'self!"

Reviews.Author: Elisa B.
Reviews.Content: Blue Jam's Florentine Benedict is AMAZING. I get this every single time I come here, even though I always go in thinking that I'll try the famous Crunchy French Toast.Maybe next time I can grab a friend to share the Crunchy French Toast because I simply cannot get myself to let go of the Florentine Benedict.Last time, I got their freshly squeezed orange juice, which was a bit too sour for my taste buds - I literally tasted sour the entire day after Brunch! But that was probably my fault for getting freshly squeezed orange juice - and this is a testimony to how FRESHLY SQUEEZED the OJ actually is! That's awesome, but because of my taste buds' aversion to the fresh sourness, I think I'll stick with their absolutely nommy Spiced Chai Latte.This is one of the institutions that I crave for when I'm on the other Coast, and I'm back every chance I can get!

Reviews.Author: Brian C.
Reviews.Content: Great place with great atmosphere and service.Got the hash and breakfast sandy.  Both were fab!

Reviews.Author: Brian L.
Reviews.Content: Great experience.  Delicious food.  Went on a Sunday evening at around 7pm (to avoid the crowd that Yelp reviewers warned of).  The eatery's decor is stylish and hip, and the food delectable.  I enjoyed their white wine sangria, Breakfast Nachos (corn tortilla chips, scrambled eggs, shredded chicken, fresh salsa, grated cheese, and sour cream), mushroom soup, and Crunchy French Toast (with vanilla bean dipping sauce).  Everything tasted amazing and the service was wonderful.  My only recommendation is, if you order the Breakfast Nachos, definitely ask for more tortilla chips because 1) they're amazing and 2) there was plenty of everything else (chicken, salsa, etc.,) to pile on the chips.  You can always ask for chips on the side so they stay super crunchy.The owner, Kamil, who I didn't know, but introduced himself with the warmth that you'd expect to receive only from long-time friends and family, chatted with me as I was finishing my meal.  He was kind, considerate, and informative.  His time was well spent on this newbie customer as I'll definitely return for my 2nd visit soon.  Again, fantastic place.  Thanks Kamil and Blu Jam Café!

Reviews.Author: Margaret Menglu H.
Reviews.Content: french toast is a must try!

Reviews.Author: Jenny S.
Reviews.Content: YUM YUM YUM nuf said! My favorite place hands down. I have loved EVERYTHING I ever ate there. Worth the wait and long lines!

Reviews.Author: Lizzy S.
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere of Blu Jam is really trendy and lovely. It's a small space, but it's made to seem bigger by the high ceilings, which I love. It was pretty busy when I went, but the wait was only 15 minutes or so and the host was friendly and gracious. I went with my boyfriend and split the Buratta with Strawberries for an appetizer. So soft and light! I had the Power House and he had the Herb Chicken. Both were amazing and very filling.Service was prompt and good, not overly friendly, but it was busy so I understand. I'm definitely coming back!

Reviews.Author: Julius J.
Reviews.Content: This place is so insanely good. We came here on a yelp search of some of LA's best brunch spots and we were not disappointed. We've been twice both on a Sunday after 1pm and had about a 30 minute wait. Both times we went next door to The Village Idiot(which is also a really great spot for drinks and mellow atmosphere) and had a few drinks before heading back over for some food. I made my own omelette each time and my girl got the Rome via Paris dish which was excellent. We also had a few friends join us last time and they got the french toast which was also great. The service is spot on, the champagne is good and the price is right. Even down to the host stand, they are very hospitable and make you feel very comfortable. Big, big fan of Blu Jam Cafe.

Reviews.Author: John S.
Reviews.Content: Outstanding breakfast. This is Los Angeles, there are a lot of good restaurants in town. The waiter brings the food, it's good, he asks you how it is, you say "really good," etc, etc. Breakfast at Blu Jam this morning was one of the few times I took a moment to tell the staff how truly good the food was. I had the risotto with poached eggs (ironically the dish pictured above) and it was really, really, REALLY tasty. I highly recommend you check out Blu Jam!

Reviews.Author: Christine C.
Reviews.Content: Came with my girlfriends.  Had to wait 30 min which I guess was not a big wait.  Loved that when our table was ready, without asking the waitress gave us  the back private eating area!  She gave us lots of great suggestions on the food; it was all so yummy.  Came back another time with my 4 kids later to eat ... not sure what I was thinking; eating with my girlfriends was so much more civilized.  But 5 stars anyways for staff, food and ambiance.

Reviews.Author: Gobbledygook C.
Reviews.Content: That crispy french toast is massive! Couldn't finish it all but it sure was tasty. I would probably have preferred to have maple syrup instead of the bean sauce... didnt really taste like much to me. The apple chicken sausage was a tad to sweet for me but I cleared it all anyway! Will have to try a savory dish next time- it all looked sooo good!

Reviews.Author: John D.
Reviews.Content: Lived up to its rep--good food and attentive service. Parking can be tight, but , hey, it's LA!

Reviews.Author: BX L.
Reviews.Content: Visited LA for the weekend and went to check out Blu Jam as it has so many reviews here.We waited for an hour (for 2) as it was lunch peak on a holiday. Ordered the Blu Jam benedict as I was craving for some. After a few forkfuls (which is great by the way), the combination of the bacon & ham got a little too salty for my taste that the muffin & the egg couldn't compensate for the saltiness and can barely finish my plate.Other than that, the service is excellent and definitely, will give this place another try and will try the french toast next time.

Reviews.Author: Jan L.
Reviews.Content: Over 1600 reviews with 4 solid stars, need I say more?  This place has amazing food! I really enjoyed the CA Omelette, the Crunchy French Toast (make sure you order this!), and the Paris something Scramble.  All were really good and I was really happy since I didn't have to wait for a table since I came at around 11:30 on a Monday.  I can't wait to try more things at this place!!!  I'm also really excited about the new location in Sherman Oaks, which is a lot closer to my place!

Reviews.Author: Kelsey W.
Reviews.Content: A nice breakfast spot that has delicious food! The vanilla chai tea latte is sooo yummy.  I even took one to go because it was so good. Once you're seated, they give you mint water which is very refreshing.  Next time I'm in LA, I'd definitely visit Blu Jam Cafe!

Reviews.Author: karen p.
Reviews.Content: Fantastically decadent, or wonderfully nutritious, the food here is exceptionally good! I  visited twice on a trip from London, first greeted by the delightful Doug then the wonderful Rick...or was it Will, apologies I forget but you were exceptionally warm, efficient and accommodating - thank you for taking such good care of the girls in the centre!  Karen

Reviews.Author: Linh T.
Reviews.Content: I came here on a Sunday at 3:30 and there was still a long wait. That says alot about this brunch. I also love that they serve brunch this late. I ordered the Blu Jam Eggs Benedict and as Benny connoisuer, this definitely gets a stamp of approval! The hollandaise sauce was light and flavorful- not too salty. Instead of a thick cut piece of Canadian Ham, it was served with thinly sliced Black forrest ham AND crispy BACON.Oh and served with a side of country potates. Need I say more? This was all washed down with fresh squeezed OJ and freshly brewed coffee. My date got a breakfast burrito wrap that was also very tasty! I'm craving to come back here and try the french toast that I saw on the table next to me. Very cute place with excellent service and food!

Reviews.Author: Rosie S.
Reviews.Content: Great place for brunch! The wait can be a bit brutal though, especially since they don't take reservations. On a Sunday, you will wait up to hour for a table. The food is definitely worth the wait. The benedicts are amazing! Fresh squeezed juice. French Press Coffee. Crispy French Toast with a vanilla bean glaze. Yum!

Reviews.Author: Basma I.
Reviews.Content: This place is actually worth all the hype. I went on a friday afternoon which probably made my experience better since i hate waiting. I've had the roma via paris which was really good, the florentine benedict which is ridiculously good, best i've had. The most popular thing here which you HAVE to try is the crunchy french toast!!! It's simply fantastic!!

Reviews.Author: William B.
Reviews.Content: Great food, great service. A little pretentious but what else can you expect for LA

Reviews.Author: Elle E.
Reviews.Content: I love this place! Even their healthy options are tasty! I love the Muscle breakfast! Great coffee too. Also, come early! Less of a wait!

Reviews.Author: Omar R.
Reviews.Content: A fun casual restaurant with unique tasty meals and a gourmet burger that was among the best I've ever had and made it worth the trip from Orange county. This is great place to eat with friends and if you wind up waiting, there's abundant shops and boutique to wander around, check the products and pick something up like my wife did. Seating is limited, so it might not be the best place for groups larger than four or to bring kids. The service is excellent and when I asked about the ingredients the server was very knowledgeable about them and helped me understand why my order was soo amazing.

Reviews.Author: Chaz S.
Reviews.Content: The french toast is just something you're going to have to try at some point - especially if you don't mind desert for breakfast. Took awhile to get seated but if you're in no rush on a weekend morning and you're close, it's worth the trip.

Reviews.Author: Amanda S.
Reviews.Content: Meeh. I mean it was a good breakfast but only 3 stars (3.5 if I could do 1/2s) because the wait is usually SO long and people raaaaave about it here that I was expecting the bar to be higher. Service was good- everyone was pretty friendly.Our eggs benedict and fruit bowl with granola were delish (could have had more yogurt). I would go back again but I wouldnt wait more then 10-15 minutes for a table.

Reviews.Author: Aly S.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam is one of my favorite breakfast go-tos. I crave the florentine benedict regularly. The portions are filling and the prices are reasonable. Great iced coffee. The location is far for me, but it's definitely worth it. If you like sweet breakfasts, the crunchy french toast is where it's at. One day i'll try the lunch/dinner menu, but i'm too busy craving their breakfast.

Reviews.Author: Rob S.
Reviews.Content: Oh man! You must try this place great food affordable and service is awesome I personally would not try this on a weekend , as the place is kinda small but it is SO good.......

Reviews.Author: A M.
Reviews.Content: Went here for brunch with my fiance on a Sunday afternoon.  The place was packed at around 12:30 pm.  Luckily for us, we only needed a two person table and we were able to be seated quickly.  Larger groups were waiting outside, but it didn't seem like their wait was too bad.The waiter was real nice and helped s with the questions we had in regards to the menu.  We received our drink orders pretty quickly too.  The bread and olive paste that you dip the bread in was really good, so good that we got another basket.  I ordered the Gourmet Benedict and my fiance ordered the Roma Via Paris omelette.  Both tasted awesome and were large in portion size, which is a plus for me.  My fiance couldn't finish the omelette... I don't think I could have either.  The gourmet benedict hollandaise sauce was a bit different than what I am used to, but it was still tasty.  Not the best breakfast ever (as the signage says on their window), but pretty close to it.   I have had eggs benedict at other restaurants and the salmon/hollandaise combo just didn't go well.  We found the restaurant on yelp by doing a search for brunch and we recommend Blu Jam to anyone interested in a good breakfast/brunch option in the LA area.

Reviews.Author: Krock K.
Reviews.Content: This is such a good place to eat!!!!Everyone should go there if you are in the area.  Very affordable and great atmosphere but it does get packed.  Overall Love it.

Reviews.Author: Kelly C.
