Reviews.Content: 3.75 stars.  The ONLY thing that held this place from getting 4 stars was the terrible coffee! It was flavorless and tasted like water, but that won't stop me from coming back to blu jam, I'll just have to make a trip to starbucks beforehand...I ordered the custom made omelet with a side of fruit cup and wheat toast with a cup of "organic" coffee.  I must say, the fruit cup was one of the most impressive that I've ever seen from a brunch cafe, much better substitute than a plain ol' plate of potatoes.  At this point, I thought this place was pretty decent (but then again, how impressive can a tomato/basil omelette be.  and then the "Ilonka's crepe" arrived and....MAGIC.  One of the best crepes that I have ever tasted.  Me and my friend were a bit reluctant to order a crepe filled with cottage cheese, but we decided to be adventurous and give it a go.  The cottage cheese, fresh strawberries and white chocolate was the BEST combination.  I only wish the omelette didn't fill my stomach so that I didn't have enough room to devour the entire crepe like I wanted to.  I would definitely go back to this place for the crepes!

Reviews.Author: Brandice W.
Reviews.Content: This place is very quaint and fun. The environment is friendly and casual, especially when sitting on the patio. The inside is neat and fun as well. The staff was exceptionally friendly and attentive. The food was very tasty, though I came especially for the Goulash, which wasn't exactly traditional but still very good. I guess different families make dishes differently. I do love that they integrate traditional Czech cuisine into the menu for specific time periods. Apparently they have different themes for weekly specials!They have a good breakfast menu and a tasty lunch (sandwiches and salads) menu as well. The option of half sandwich/half soup or half sandwich/half salad creates a large variety of lunching options. Their lattes are pretty satisfying as well.Overall a fun, laid-back yet trendy place that definitely satisfies the stomach.

Reviews.Author: Tim O.
Reviews.Content: I couldn't ask for more! I went in today for lunch and was greeted by very friendly staff members. I ordered the LA Club and LOVED it, fresh ingredients, good quality meat and bacon cooked to perfection. I had the crispy red potatoes which basically are like home fries and were also quite yummy. The owner Kamil had me sample a bit of his turkey chili (I think that is on the menu as Kamil's Gulash), another hit with the tastebuds. I was expecting spicy but was pleasently suprised by great flavor without the heat. As I ate, I saw numerous plates coming out from the kitchen, a few had burgers on them that looked like heave and others had pancakes and omletts that made my mouth water as they went past me. When I got back to work, I took the half of my club that I couldn't finish around the office to show it off to my coworkers who now seem to be itching to go down for a meal soon.I just wish it was open later as it is tought to get there and back on my lunch unless I order to go, but what is the fun of togo when you have a restaurant situated in such a vibrant community??What more can I say...GO THERE!!

Reviews.Author: Roger S.
Reviews.Content: This is one of those tasty breakfast places that represents the gratifying and often decadent lifestyle of the young professional living in the city. You wake up after a night of drinking, just in time for "breakfast" (usually 12 or later), hop on over to this crowded spot in this trendy neighboorhood, gorge yourself on eggs Benedict and delicious french toast. Then you step outside into the warmth and sunshine on this beautiful Sunday, before reaching a consensus with your other hung-over buddies that it's time to get ice cream sandwiches.It's very nice. The wait was about 20 minutes for five people, and our server kept coming outside to reassure us that it wouldn't be long. The Norwegian eggs Benedict (smoked salmon instead of ham) is definitely something that should be experienced by those who enjoy the traditional kind. My friend who ordered the vanilla french toast endured a extra 7-10 minutes of waiting after the rest of us received our orders, but he was ultimately satisfied with his choice.This place might need some maintenance, though. Two of the people at our table were getting "dripped on" throughout the course of the meal. Hope that's not from some restroom upstairs...

Reviews.Author: Angie X.
Reviews.Content: THE best brunch I've had in LA. They have an amazing Crunchy French Toast served with a warm vanilla syrup. My favorite though is the lemon crepes that taste like lemon meringue pie. Eggs Benedict are also pretty amazing...honestly, everything is good.They can get really busy on the weekends though, so come early or expect a wait around brunch time. The servers have been very good as well. All around 5 stars.

Reviews.Author: Rachel R.
Reviews.Content: This place is really cute and in a fun area (Melrose), but to be totally honest, I just don't get what all the fuss is about.  A guy I dated lives a couple blocks from this place and is obsessed with it.  Every time we went for brunch, we waited at least 40 mins, even when the hostess told us it would be 15-20.  Once she even forgot about us or just completely skipped over us somehow. When I asked her how much longer, our name was already crossed out even though she hadn't announced it.  So she said we were next, but then gave the next table for 2 to a couple who had definitely arrived at least 10 mins after us.  Really annoying!As far as the food, it's pretty average.  Everything I ordered always looked fancy and delicious, but once I tasted it was usually very bland and lacking in the good, hearty flavors I normally expect from a $15-20 brunch.  I am a hot sauce lover and fully admit that I tend to over do it sometimes, but at Blu Jam I literally had to smother every last centimeter of my meals to really taste anything.

Reviews.Author: Jaymee L.
Reviews.Content: The food is good, but not great. My salmon hash was dry but I enjoyed that it was a unique dish. Also, be prepared to wait. The hostess told us 20-30 minutes, but it took approx 1 hour and 20 minutes to be seated!! We were continually told we were "the next group" (there were only 4 of us) so we stuck around... getting more and more frustrated each time some valet-parking a-hole rolled up and was seated immediately. Boo on Blu Jam for having lying hostesses and allowing people to jump the line. Please just be honest so people can plan their day accordingly.

Reviews.Author: Michael R.
Reviews.Content: I love this place for breakfast and for dinner. Always great service and great food. It gets busy at times, so try not to be there at peak hour so you can sit, relax and enjoy a delicious meal. They carry the staples and have a menu of specials that changes often. The late night dinners are designed to share; so come hungry with a group and taste a little of everything. Breakfast for lunch, breakfast for dinner, and even breakfast for breakfast.

Reviews.Author: Angela O.
Reviews.Content: Blue Jam Cafe is delish!!!  I have been here a couple of time, but each time they have a very good crowd with what appeared to be regulars and satisfied returning customers.The staff is very nice, efficient, and friendly, and the food is awesome.  Everything is extremely fresh and cooked the way it's supposed to be (not over or under-done).  I've only had breakfast here, but can't imagine lunch/dinner not being just as good...i look forward to trying that it the near future!

Reviews.Author: Orley K.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam has the most excellent service and food which is rare in LA.  You can taste the high quality in the produce and food. I have never had a bad meal here. They have the best espresso and coffee drinks as well.This is my "regular" coffee shop!

Reviews.Author: Madonna M.
Reviews.Content: The food here is pretty tasty but GOOD LORD, have more than one host on during the weekend. And maybe a bus person? I don't hold it against any of the staff, they were all delightful, but when a 45 minute wait turns into an hour and 45 minutes its a little ridiculous. Either that or buy up the store next to you and expand. Or open a second location. Went here with a couple friends a few weekends ago and if we'd known we were going to wait almost two hours we would have gone somewhere else. I know it's a bummer to tell people it's gonna be that long, but better that than cranky customers. Either way, the staff were really nice and once we got in the food was great. With popularity comes issues like this, though. Hope they expand soon.Thanks for the response Kamil- Best of luck opening your new location! I appreciate you responding to your guests. Again, staff was great and food was tasty. Thanks for including vegan options. I work in a restaurant so I get the issues...  Perhaps the day that I was there you were understaffed. I know people call in/things happen. It was just a LOOOOOONG time. I dunno how long you've been bustling like that. Looks like you're getting popular enough to hopefully open that new location smoothly.

Reviews.Author: Yu W.
Reviews.Content: Awesome egg benedict and banana pancakes!!!The French Toast looks like a master piece and it tastes really good!!

Reviews.Author: Jessica T.
Reviews.Content: My friends and I waited for an hour and half for sub-par food. Don't believe the hype. My friend had the crunchy french toast, my other friend had the ambrosia somethin or other and I had the breakfast trio- which can only described as something for a geriatric Denny's connoisseur. The only thing that redeemed my plate was that they have some decent bacon. The pancakes were ok, but not good enough for me to take home the leftovers. This is really going to make me think twice about the restaurants out here in LA-yelp land that are getting RAVE reviews...

Reviews.Author: Ester W.
Reviews.Content: I'm such a huge fan of brunch, especially sunday brunch. The wait was about 45 to an hour wait. But i mean i love brunch, and being that it was in the middle of melrose avenue, finding a few stores to shop around to pass the time was a piece of cake. The entire staff at Blue Jam was really sweet, attentive, and the food came in a very timely manner. Love the ambience, it's super cozy and very warm and just overall a great sunday brunch environment. Me and a friend split the pitcher of red wine sangria. It was alright, not the best. The crunchy french toast was delicious. Just the perfect portion amount and the vanilla bean sauce wasnt too thick or too runny. perfection!The olympus scramble was huge! im such a fan of tomato basil, added nice flavor. however it was a bit too watery with the egg scramble. the wheat toast was super fresh, tasted like it was freshly baked. definitely coming back here again!

Reviews.Author: Sarah G.
Reviews.Content: The BEST brunch in LA!!!Food: Delicious! The Florentine Benedict is definitely a must try. I also love the Migas. And sometimes they have this special, poached eggs over risotto (I can't remember the name), which is good too. Everything I've tried there is good though! Although the coffee is only so-so (in my opinion).Atmosphere: So fun! The inside is cozy, and you see so many interesting (local) LA people. The waitstaff is cool. There are also a few tables outside, which would be nice in nice weather, but I almost prefer sitting inside here.Cons: A long wait (like 1 hour) on weekends for brunch. If you don't want to wait, try it on a weekday.

Reviews.Author: Lori H.
Reviews.Content: Incredible service greeted me here. I have gotten used to dining alone, and the host showed no flinching when I said "just me!". I had risotto for breakfast. I've only done that when I had leftovers in the fridge. It was gluten free nirvana!!

Reviews.Author: Sam L.
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the crunchy french toast-the crushed corn flakes definitely gives the french toast a nice texture. Not too sweet and comes with fresh bananas, berries, and a vanilla bean sauce that reminds me of flavored coffee creamer. They also make a decent chai latte and service was very good. We came here on a Sunday at around 930 am and there was already a line in front of the restaurant. We were seated in about 15 minutes (only because we didn't mind sitting outside... wait would have been longer if we requested an inside table). The line tripled by the end of our meal and the wait to be seated increased to about an hour! I'd highly recommend the french toast if you can go early enough to beat the weekend brunch crowd. Otherwise, probably not worth the ridiculous wait.

Reviews.Author: Dan L.
Reviews.Content: I've been here for lunch and dinner and every time I've been impressed. The food is absolutely delicious, and the staff there are all so friendly.

Reviews.Author: Noey N.
Reviews.Content: REPLY TO OWNER: You shouldn't have to make excuses for your employees. Clearly, if a host sat 2 parties ahead of costumers who were waiting in line ( hugged, and had lengthy conversations) it's hard to believe the host was catering to your "friends". Either way,  I have never been so unsatisfied with such rude and unprofessional staff. In this case, unfortunately, rude costumer service outweighs the infamous crispy french toast.

Reviews.Author: Dan C.
Reviews.Content: I just ordered food for 6 people for pickup and was slapped with a 10% fee. Not talking delivery here. Spoke to owner who would not budge. Screw this place. Took my business along with the 5 other people elsewhere.

Reviews.Author: Raul G.
Reviews.Content: I'm such a huge fan of eggs benedict. Blu Jam's are by far some of the best I've had. And omg the Crunchy French Toast. Fresh, healthy, light, but so filling.Wait time is usually pretty long but I'm not sure how that is now that they serve bfast all day.

Reviews.Author: Brett M.
Reviews.Content: Impressive breakfast.  I really enjoyed my experience at the cafe and I'm glad we found it by using yelp.  We usually scope places out for being identified as a restaurant with gluten free options. We didn't think that Blue Jam had gluten free dedicated items on their menu, but to our surprise they did.  The omelet and oatmeal were excellent.  My son had a pancake which looked great, but it wasn't gluten free so I didn't try it.  We had the french press which was really, really good coffee.  The service was great and we sat right away on a Monday morning.

Reviews.Author: rob d.
Reviews.Content: Great food, cool atmosphere and fast service, what more could you want from brunch? Artistically Designed cappuccino? Oh, they have that too!

Reviews.Author: Laura S.
Reviews.Content: Went here with a french toast craving, left more than satisfied.  Good coffee.  Very nice service.

Reviews.Author: Eric S.
Reviews.Content: No more mimosas and an hour and a half wait? When we asked about why they no longer served liquor our server went into a long drawn out story and recommended we get our food to go and have a mimosa next door. Wtf does that make sense? Who waits an hour plus for mediocre eggs?

Reviews.Author: Brittany C.
Reviews.Content: They offer a lot of gluten free options and the cappuccino are to die for!

Reviews.Author: Samantha N.
Reviews.Content: YUM! Had the barbecue chicken sandwich and it was amazing. The service was speedy and polite. Love the fresh juices and how many choices they have for beverages in general. Cute little cafe with quality food. Friend had the famous vanilla french toast and raved about it. Not too pricey, and well worth the 15 min. wait. If youre on Melrose then stop by!

Reviews.Author: Joanna M.
Reviews.Content: this is my first YELP review.I'm in LA on and off from Europe, and I always have to go to this place at least once for breakfast.I love the Mexican styled breakfast dishes and their drip coffee AND the service. I have always only had very sweet and professional waiters and this place is on my top 10 things to do when in LA. Because of the jet lag I usually come in with my BF just when they open, but I also have had to wait for a table, and i do think it is worth it. They usually also play really nice smoothing jazz that makes you wake up slowly and ready for the day. I havent tried it, but they have a pretty big selection of non fatty options- egg whites only/ veggies etc, so for someone watching their waistline this place also caters yummy food.

Reviews.Author: Michelle H.
Reviews.Content: Worth the wait! The food was delicious! I highly recommend their french toast.They call your name twice, and if you are not there when they call your name, they will cross your name off the list. So don't wander off!

Reviews.Author: Marc R.
Reviews.Content: Pretty good.  Nothing to die for though.

Reviews.Author: Jimmy R.
Reviews.Content: Yes, please.

Reviews.Author: Alan E.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam lived up to all the hype, heck, even exceeded it. The food was suburb! Our family have the Blu Jam Benedict, Crusted Fresh Toast, and Eggs Bohemian. We couldn't find one critical thing to say about any of the entrees or sides. The service was perfect. Our server welcomed us a tourists and shared helpful advice to a few of our questions. This is a must whether you are a L.A. local or traveling guest.

Reviews.Author: Diana T.
Reviews.Content: We had the Miga and both of the Benedict dishes. They were delicious, and the ice latte was really good! Their french toast and coffees are generally very popular, they say. The waiter was nice but kinda slow to let us go. We sat outside with a full view of Melrose. However, with such a busy driving street, I actually prefer sitting inside because it's much quieter and the ambiance has a good vibe.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan C.
Reviews.Content: I love this place. My wife and I do breakfast here whenever we can. The wrap on fire, any of the Benedict's, or my wires fave, the old world are all great. The service is wonderful, and the prices are very low for what you get. and don't get me started on the Friday Night Bistro. Every week is a different and special menu.  I'll see you there. Jonathan Coogan

Reviews.Author: Kiran M.
Reviews.Content: 3.5 stars. Was definitely a good breakfast - just wasn't as impressed as some others.Its a cute little cafe - very cozy. We tried the Roma via Paris omelet and the french toast. The eggs were pretty good and the french toast wasn't bad. I guess I would rather go to the Griddle for breakfast since its right there and is amazing.

Reviews.Author: Eric L.
Reviews.Content: Wow! This is some great food. Everything was amazing. Cant think up a bad thing to say about the place.If you haven't been you need to. Seriously

Reviews.Author: Mark E.
Reviews.Content: I love the food, especially breakfast.  The other day I had blueberry pancakes.  The pancake was ideally flaky on the outside and the blueberries were plentiful and succulent.  In fact, I had a delightful experience when I sliced into the pancake with my fork and several blueberries burst spraying my shirt.  It was awesome!  Never happen to me before, so I thought it added to the experience.  The owner - Kamil - offered to pay for a new shirt - naturally assuming the stains would not come out, but I declined seeing an opportunity to test the skills of a new dry cleaner I started going to.  Finally, I have to add that Blu Jam Cafe has a wonderful ambiance.  It transports you away from the hubbub of the outside world into a place of exciting chatter and people just being with each other.

Reviews.Author: Adeana X.
Reviews.Content: I went here for brunch and had an amazing omlette!  mushroom, ham, goat cheese, spinach, onion...yum yum, we also got a blended soy chai and it was tasty. The split pea soup was also very good. They also have a nice choice of flavored loose leaf tea, I had white peach and I really liked it. Friendly service and located in a cool area, right on melrose so you can shop afterward or just take a walk.: )

Reviews.Author: Sam W.
Reviews.Content: I cannot get enough of Blu Jam. I try and make it there every weekend for brunch. Kamil is the nicest guy and runs an amazing restaurant. Everything is always fresh. I try something new each time, and am always amazed. A foodie's paradise. Even on a teacher's salary, this place makes it worth it to go out on a Sunday morning.Get this place its beer and wine license so it can stay open for dinner!

Reviews.Author: Brian B.
Reviews.Content: This place never disappoints.  The food is always delicious and the service is always great, no matter how busy they are.There's usually a 15 - 20 minute wait during lunch hours but you'll understand why.Great food, great vibe.

Reviews.Author: Kimberly D.
Reviews.Content: All I can say is I'M IN LOVE WITH THIS PLACE! My friend took me here when I first moved up here last year, and I've been hooked ever since. This is my go-to place at any time of the day! I even had my two dogs with me one afternoon and sat outside; they brought me a water bowl for the little guys and were so nice!Everything they have on the menu is as good as it sounds, you can't go wrong with any choice. Yum.LOVE!

Reviews.Author: Dan H.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam is a pretty good but not great place for breakfast. The menu is a good combination of classics, like pancakes and french toast, and more interesting fare, like their omelets full of fresh and varied ingredients. Every dish is reasonably priced, but with this the food will not wow you. The omelets come with fresh fruit or potatoes, both of which are very fresh. However, most of the food is pretty standard. Coffee and juice are both average at best. My review is brought up though because of the price, the area, the decor (which is beautiful, with a great little place to sit outside if you can fit), and the wait staff which were incredibly friendly and attentive. Definitely a solid breakfast spot on Melrose, but not particularly memorable.

Reviews.Author: Christine S.
Reviews.Content: We were planning to come here for brunch.PLANNING being the the key word. Exceedingly ditzy of us, we left the planning to a friend who thought that Melrose was at least two hours away from where we lived.It was more like twenty minutes. And events worked out in a sense where we should've thanked her for her blonde moment. As soon as we walked in and grabbed a table, a line began to form. The turnover was pretty quick but even Blu Jam couldn't handle the traffic especially because outside seating wasn't even a viable option thanks to the rain.The food was amazing. I'm a picky eater of sorts so I got the customized omelet. And the food came out pretty quick too (of course, my sense of time could've been distorted because of the good company I was with).The only thing I was "ehhh" about was their water. I love love love love water. I love plain water and water with lemons or even with cucumber but with mint!?Yeah, I'm just not liking it.

Reviews.Author: Pat H.
Reviews.Content: Yeah, this really is as good as it gets.  Kamil is a world class restauranteur.  His breakfast would be an amazing start to anyone's day.  I refer top entertainment and advertising agency clients and colleagues here regularly and they all return with enthusiasm.The dinners are simply amazing.  Kamil's ability to pair his menu with wine shows a deep knowledge and uncanny sensitivity.The service is top notch.  That written, I must also claim that over the years, I've come to know the owner and grow a friendship with him.  That's just the kind of guy he is and it resonates through his staff.Can't return soon enough!!

Reviews.Author: David C.
Reviews.Content: Tuna tartar: Fresh tuna overwhelmed by the heavy oil that didn't not have much chive flavor or seem like a vinaigrette at all.Cevichi: Fresh crisp salsa. Great texture contrast from the shrimp, but wish there was more shrimp.Lamb: Medium rare as I ordered. Flavorful and aromatic.Mac n cheese with truffle oil: Truffle and cheese goes beautifully. Great texture contast of crispy cheese, mac, and gooey cheese. Then a piece of bacon here and there overwhelms and ciders the truffle taste. None the less, I had a moment with the dish.Apple tart: Good flavor but the soggy crust ruined it. It needs a light and flaky crust.For the reasonable price, this was worth it given the complexity of taste and texture.

Reviews.Author: Eddie C.
Reviews.Content: I came here with my girlfriend for breakfast about a week ago. The place wasn't too crowded which is always great for me since I hate waiting. We got sat down quick and the service was great. The waiter was friendly and treated us well. She made great recommendations and made us feel welcomed at the restaurant. I ordered the steak and eggs. I love meat and I am pretty keen on picking up good meats. The steak and eggs was potentially the best steak and eggs I've ever eaten. The meat was tender and juicy. The potatoes it came with were crisp and cooked well. The eggs were cooked well as well and the dish was balanced and delicious. My girlfriend got the Crunch French Toast. The french toast was cooked well and tasted good. The cream sauce that it came with tasted amazing as well. I thought that the cream wasn't too strong but it was nice and blended well with the french toast. Overall it was an excellent meal.

Reviews.Author: Jordan A.
Reviews.Content: I've always LOVED breaksfast and weekend brunch here, but I tried their small-plate dinner service a couple of weeks ago, and now I find I must have dinner there at least twice a week.  The food is AMAZING and the cost is very inexpensive.Plus, they have incredible wines.I love that I can go here with my girlfriend and friends and have an amazing dinner with wine without having to spend a fortune!I LOVE THIS PLACE!!

Reviews.Author: Pop L.
Reviews.Content: First time at Blu Jam Café.  First impression marred by waitress' request for me to move to a smaller table--at 8:15am, on a Wednesday, with only 4 guests in the entire restaurant ....really?Ordered the Eggwich--fresh ingredients and good combination of flavors. Tip: have a knife and fork ready--the ciabatta bread is delicious, but the crust is firm so that if you bite down on the sandwich, the stuffings just squeeze out (know what I mean? ).

Reviews.Author: Heather W.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam Cafe, is by far my favorite spot for great breakfasts in West Hollywood!You can sit inside where it's beautifully furnished with local artists paintings and photography always being rotated. There coffee is phenomenal!! There food is delicious and the service? great! You can also sit outside under the yellow umbrellas on a beautiful day!Thank you!

Reviews.Author: Charisse D.
Reviews.Content: LOVE!A friend told me about this cafe, so I had to try it! Let me tell you...the crunchy French Toast is to DIE for!! So delish!!If you're going for Saturday/Sunday brunch, the wait might be a while (ours was 40-45 mins), but it's definitely worth it!! I miss this place already!

Reviews.Author: Yns S.
Reviews.Content: Great French toast! Coated with corn flakes. Amazing Kamil's breakfast was so-so. Would come back again - nice vibe also

Reviews.Author: Khat S.
Reviews.Content: One of the best places I've ever had breakfast/brunch! Woaaaw! Sooooo good! We had to wait about an hour on a Sunday for brunch and it was totally worth it! Everything was amazing! I had the large bowl of fruit with some yogurt and my boyfriend had the quesadilla and we both shared their famous French toast. It was amazing! The staff was super friendly and nice and it wasn't expensive at all. Definitely going back when I'm in LA. Loved!

Reviews.Author: Kelly V.
Reviews.Content: Best eggs florentine i've ever had.  they jazz it up - it's sooooo good.  in addition to the spinach, there is brie cheese (!!!!!!!!!!) and a mushroom + sun dried tomato mixture under the egg.  OMG OMG OMG.  *faints*

Reviews.Author: Jennifer A.
Reviews.Content: i love this place! i go to brunch with my grandmother almost every Sunday, and she is a hard one to please, but she loves blu jam cafe. the first time we went our server was David who later not only remembered our faces but what we ordered, which beyond impressed my grandmother on our second visit.my only complaint is the long wait (although is worth it) either get there early, or not to hungry because chances are you will wait an hour no matter what your quoted.

Reviews.Author: Bernadine B.
Reviews.Content: I had the brunch carbonara which is the risotto with poached eggs, bacon, peas...and some other things.  Yuuuuummmmmmmyyyyyyy; David was the waiter; nice guy; pace was just right.  The area has gotten grundgy; very down in the heels: t-shirt shops, tattoo (sp?) shops...it will change.

Reviews.Author: Debbie O.
Reviews.Content: Bookmarked in 2011 and finally tried it in 2013. You know it'll be a good year when you've crossed out 8 places off your bookmark list within the first month of the year. Blu Jam definitely brought it last weekend when I came here for brunch with my girls. We waited a good 35 minutes but got the chance to shop around Melrose for some good deals. I don't see how you could ever get past the wait since even after we left around 2PM, there was still a line outside. I would recommend adding some standing umbrellas especially on warm sunny days because there is absolutely no shade during the AM, and I could tell people were getting hot and sweaty waiting for a table.I started off with an iced Chai latte, which funnily tasted like iced Horchata. It actually makes perfect sense since both are full of cinnamon and mixed with milk. I suppose I preferred a stronger Chai, but it was refreshing and not cloyingly sweet. I saw on yelp that someone ordered the smoked salmon eggs benedict substituting the English muffins with croissants. Genius. I immediately knew that was exactly what I wanted. Even when our waitress said it would be an additional 75 cents to substitute with croissants, I didn't hesitate. Unfortunately, they were all "out" of croissants. I suppose we did go later during the day, but I didn't see many other items on the menu with croissants, so I had my doubts. I decided since that basically ruined my desire to get eggs benedict, I would go with the Morning Hash. Good second choice. The hash came in a large portion and had generous amounts of all the toppings: black forest ham, sun dried tomatoes, spinach, onions, red potatoes, and mozzarella. It was delicious and very satisfying. Others in my group got the BBQ chicken sandwich, mushroom salad, and Florentine Benedict, and we all shared an order of the crunchy French toast. The French toast was by far the most interesting thing I ate that day. As their signature dish, the crunchy French toast is rolled in crunchy corn flakes, topped with fresh bananas and berries, and served with a vanilla bean sauce. It wasn't too sweet, and the texture was perfect: moist and fluffy with a crisp from the corn flakes that's not too overwhelming. The vanilla bean sauce was just the cherry on top. Definitely one of my favorite French toasts of all time. I'm sure I will be back here soon because there are so many other items on the menu I would like to try. Worth the wait and sunburn.

Reviews.Author: Diane S.
Reviews.Content: Let's see, to sum it up..you gotta go!We were visiting from San Diego and saw the Yelp reviews.  Went for breakfast and had the Crunchy French Toast and the Blu Jam Benedict.  So much flavor! Both were awesome! The coffee was great too!  There was a quoted 45 min wait but there are stores to  visit while waiting.  Take note..we were told 45 min wait but they got us in in 30 min.  I was told by some woman in one of the shops that they usually get you in faster than the quoted time.  Glad she did as we would have kept shopping and missed our table call!

Reviews.Author: Andrew C.
Reviews.Content: I've been hearing about this place for quite some time and how amazing the food was. So I decided to come and check it out with a friend on an early Friday afternoon. I was surprised there was already a wait over 30 minutes but the host Trace was so sweet and engaging we barely noticed" He suggested the Crunchy French Toast and Kamils breakfast which were botg phenomenal and well worth the wait...thanks again Trace-

Reviews.Author: Kathy C.
Reviews.Content: You just need to go. Its fantastic.

Reviews.Author: Sara M.
Reviews.Content: Came in for breakfast on Monday. Line was a bit of a wait but their crunchy French toast with the frosted flakes made it worth it!! So amazing I'm already craving it again. Will definitely be back but hope the wait isn't as long.

Reviews.Author: Mike S.
Reviews.Content: Live 5 minutes away from this trendy LA restaurant and might have to make this place more regular on the spinning wheel of eatery.  My friend brought me here from my birthday and suggested the french toast, but i got the "old world" an egg dish that was actually very tasty.  the service was perfect and they accommodated my friends 8 month old.  as a matter of fact, the whole place did...people were just super friendly.  was a very nice way to start the day...good food, good company and just perfect service.

Reviews.Author: Brianna G.
Reviews.Content: They have amazing French toast and a turkey burger. Just seen this was suppose to be posted back in December. lol. Ive been back multiply since.

Reviews.Author: Vicki W.
Reviews.Content: oh blu jam,i discovered this place through coming here with some friends. there were a couple of us and of course, there was a wait of about 30-40 mins. it was a really cute place and everyone seemed to be having a good time. I ordered the cornflake crusted french toast and a cafe latte. I think the cafe latte was soo soothing and wasnt too sweet at all. The french toast was really good, I also wanted to try a different one, but cant remember what it was.My brother got the brunch burger, which was super good, of course with the fried egg, its a plus in my book.I def want to come back and try some of the other dishes.come here and dont worry about the wait, there are a couple of stores you can browse at next door!

Reviews.Author: Anthony L.
Reviews.Content: Been to Blu Jam a few times and I must say, the consistency is great, the people are super cool, and it has a really nice vibe in there, although because it is such a amazing gem, you must get there a little early or wait a little while, those "in the know" know what to do, if you happen to have to wait, who cares it's on melrose there are plenty of things to see there, anyways I will continue to have a meal or two at this café

Reviews.Author: Anh P.
Reviews.Content: came here for a late valentines lunch around 3pm. there's outdoor seating, and inside there are tablesand booths. staff was very friendly :)ordered a chai latte with soy, so foamy and delicious.*crunchy french toast: like everyone had said- this is legit.you might want to save this for "dessert" bc it is sweet.vanilla bean sauce..please and thank you!*florentine benedict: took my knife and fork and gentlysliced into the poached egg..slowly oozed out the yolk.it was perfect. and it was soo delicious. side of fruit wason point. apples, blueberries, watermelon, strawberries,grapes, and bananas?! done right.*bbq chicken sandwich: chicken, bacon, carmelizedonions, provolone, tomato with a side salad. i was totallydiggin' the dressing on the salad, the salad is literally justthe lettuce blend and dressing. but the dressing is so light and tasty that i could eat a whole bowl of it! overall, a wonderful lovely experience. i would def love to come here more often but the traffic at this part of town isn't so pretty. we were lucky to find a meter parking right out front-- luckkky.

Reviews.Author: Miranda K.
Reviews.Content: I had a great brunch here, despite the long wait. The service and the food were both excellent, oh, and Jeff Goldbum was there. So it was pretty much the best brunch ever.

Reviews.Author: Carolyn C.
Reviews.Content: so the boyfriends been tryna take me to blujam for years but we never got around to it...this year i got sick and have to eat gluten free and thought all these places i wanted to go to and bookmarked were no longer possible...BUT i whined too soon!!!! blu jam offers an array of vegan and gluten free dishes and clearly lists them on the menu...and these arent altered to become gluten free they ARE gluten free so no worries on them accidently making it another way which may hurt you =)ben and i got here around noon and parked around the corner...we waited maybe 15minutes for a table as i browsed some stores ben stayed close by because they have a notice up that they will only call your name 2 times...ben was obviously starving and couldnt risk loosing our table lol :)we got seated indoors (yay! since its super hot these days) and we got helped quickly...i browsed the menu beforehand and knew I wanted the brunch carbonnara...i TRIED to get ben to order the crunchy french toast cuz it looked and sounded AH MAY ZING but he refused -_- and got the breakfast burrito boringgg i can throw bacon and eggs and roll them into tortillia at home for him!!i didnt get no cute coffee because we had plans to get coffee after but i sure will next time! after I saw all those cute pics on yelp! my risotto came out looking fantastic with 2 delicious poached eggs perched on top and bens burrito came out omg...(of course i couldnt try) but it looked freakin GOOD...tortillia was even toasted golden and just looked heavenly...ben and i literally scarfed down our meals with no conversation but a few "mmmm" "yea soo mmmm" "mmmhmmmm"s AHAHAHA we  really couldnt stop enjoying our food! and anyone who knows ben or has read his reviews or mine knows that boy can EAT!!! but he really only could finish HALF his burrito and some of my risotto and took home the other half for dinner....my risotto was licked CLEAN hahaha afterwards i bet you couldnt guess what I had on my plate LOL....seriously that risotto w bacon...peas...& that beautifully poached egg that oozed yolk was just perfect!!ben and i left totallly satisfied and totally promising each other we would be back again asap! love it....no wonder the high stars with over 1000 reviews!!!

Reviews.Author: Jodi S.
Reviews.Content: Food was amazing. The bf had the Olympus and I had the Wrap on Fire along with a vanilla latte. Coffee stayed hot the entire time as well as the food. Came out steaming. Irene was or server and constantly checked on us and our coffee. Great place with a beautiful low key and relaxing setting. Major 5 stars!!!

Reviews.Author: Stephen M.
Reviews.Content: French toast is fantastic. The wait to get in is not. If you have time, go for it. Otherwise, the wait and the french toast are the only memorable things about this place. Very popular, and hey, there's a 7-11 down the street if you want to pre-game.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany C.
Reviews.Content: Went to the Griffith Observatory only to find that it wasn't open until 12 PM. Hm, what to do with two hours of spare time? Find somewhere to eat for brunch! We yelped around the area and came across Blu Jam Cafe. It was a restaurant that my friend had wanted to eat at for awhile, so we decided ... why not?! Because it was on a weekday, there wasn't too much of a wait. We found metered parking right in front of Blu Jam and paid for an hour before giving the hostess our names as we waited for a table. They have tables outside, as well as tables inside of the restaurant. I feel like the outside area is a little more cramped as it is basically on an enclosed area of the sidewalk. There is a little tarp that keeps the public from staring at the people who are inside the outside area though. After about a 7 minute wait (menus are posted outside so we were able to look and see what we were interested in), we were seated at a table inside. The hostess and our waiter were both very nice. We were quickly given water before given our menus. I really like that they have a breakfast menu that is served all day, as well as a few specials. Lunch is also served all day. There are also vegan, gluten free and vegan possible dishes that you can order as well. Very helpful that they include that on there! Given my previous situations at brunch places, I decided to go with a savory food choice, despite the wonderful pictures and rave reviews of the crunchy french toast that I saw on Yelp and on other people's tables. I ordered the California omelette: Three egg omelette, crispy smoked bacon, fresh tomato, avocado, sour cream & cheddar cheese, served with potatoes & toast $12.95, replacing the potatoes with greens. My friend ordered Kamil's breakfast: Pan-roasted macaroni scrambled with eggs, smoked bacon, ham, garlic, chives, and cheddar $12.95 after asking the waiter what was popular and what he himself recommended (there were so many choices!). Both her brother and sister ordered the crunchy french toast: Egg brioche dipped in batter, rolled in crunchy corn flakes and grilled to perfection, topped with fresh bananas and berries, served with vanilla bean sauce $12.95. Lastly, my friend's boyfriend ordered the LA Club, I believe: Sliced turkey breast, black forest ham, crispy bacon, avocado, tomato, cucumber, mayo and provolone on toasted ciabatta $13.95 and substituted the potatoes for the mixed greens. Food breakdown: Everything came out fairly quickly. I was really really surprised at how big my dish was. I had an omelette and some bread with jam and butter AND some mixed greens? Dang! It was really good, but really heavy. I couldn't finish the entire thing because of how heavy and filling it was. I feel like the bacon made me incredibly full really fast. I did try a piece of the crunchy french toast. It was really really good, and not too sweet. I think I could have eaten it, but I'm glad I stuck with savory. The vanilla bean sauce was really nice, too. That dish came with lots of fresh fruit sprinkled on top. I was able to try Kamil's breakfast. I remember the waiter telling my friend that that dish would be incredibly filling, but it was a big bowl of eggs. She said she kept wanting some cheese to fill her palate, but there was just a whole lot of egg. I thought it was pretty good, very fluffy and light, but I don't know if I would eat it again. As for the LA Club, her boyfriend said it was very good. The waiters were really busy and always walking in and out, but I felt like they were all incredibly nice and helpful. I saw the juice prices and felt it to be a bit pricey, but then again, everything on the menu was a bit on the pricey side. As wonderful as the meal was, I think something in the omelette gave me a stomachache for the rest of the afternoon. Besides that unfortunate incident, I felt that the food was very good; I would definitely return again!

Reviews.Author: Jenn J.
Reviews.Content: I've been going to Blue Jam cafe for years, ever since it opened...and I keep coming back because it's that good! The owner is such a great guy, I'm so happy that he has had so much success. All of the dishes are handpicked by him, and sooo delicious!Some of my favs...the morning hash, steak hash, steak salad, beets & greens, and my all time favorite Kamils Famous Goulash!!!! YUM!I usually go during the week because it gets packed on the weekends-totally worth the wait though!

Reviews.Author: Jess A.
Reviews.Content: I love breakfast food and I have to say, their Florentine Eggs Benedict was pretty darn good... but not earth shattering.  The staff was good, except the host was a wee bit inept.  Very busy spot and no parking.  Worth a try.  Go with a friend for a fun brunch.

Reviews.Author: jax j.
Reviews.Content: Saw that Blu Jam was serving dessert so I dropped by on a whim. Tried the Tres Leches cake with berries- it was delicious! Not the best Tres Leches I've had and not one I would travel very far for, but a solid 7/10. Server was very nice and accommodating as well. I'll come back and try other things soon.

Reviews.Author: Steven S.
Reviews.Content: Simply, The Best Breakfast Joint! Reminds me small joints on Bleecker St. in NYC. The owner, Kamil, is a great guy and really knows how to run his restaurant. I drive very far to eat here at least three times a week. Food is delicious, latte's are amazing, service is on-the-ball.

Reviews.Author: Reez T.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam Cafe is spitting distance from my office. The food is always good. This is why Blu Jam is my go to breakfast spot when I get before noon hunger pains. The steak and eggs is amazing if you are feeling gluttonous. I was not, because I knew what other meals I had planned for the day and I needed to start off light. Obviously I went with a nice cup of coffee. I followed that up with the Hearty Granola Oats, wheat, honey, almonds & fresh fruit w/ yogurt topped with fresh berries, bananas and black currants. It's not hard to mess this dish up but none the less Blu Jam does it right. On the weekdays it is mellow but on the weekends expect a wait.

Reviews.Author: Nathan B.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam Cafe was introduced to me a year ago and is still rated my favorite place to get breakfast.This place takes a lot of time and effort to put their meals together and will literally leave you full for almost the remainder of the day.  I'm absolutely serious!  Every time I eat at Blu Jam, I normally do not eat again until later in the evening.  The food is so filling (in a good way), and, of course, delicious!Great location; great staff; great food!  What more do you want?5 stars!

Reviews.Author: Lubna S.
Reviews.Content: So a friend of mine told me to meet her for dinner here at which I said... Dinner?  I thought they only served breakfast.  Now I never wrote a review for their breakfast for the times I have been there but it is pretty awesome and I always enjoyed the food and the service at this spot.  Also liked the location as I could go for a weekend breakfast and do some Melrose shopping after.But I digress...so YES...now they serve dinner, which is what compelled me to write this review.  It is rare to find a restaurant that can do breakfast and dinner both equally well.  Their staff and owner were SUPER friendly and hospitable.  They were able to recommend wine and the right dishes for us.  My favorites, the Pepper Steak entree and Burratta appetizer.  Will definitely check this place out again for an AFTER shopping meal on Melrose.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany G.
Reviews.Content: If i had to eat at one place for the rest of my life...it would be here. I go with my cousin a few times a month and have never been dissapointed. The waiters are kind and friendly, the food is TO-DIE-FOR and the atmosphere inside and out is amazing. Not to mention, inside they have beautful pictures up for sale. But back to the food. If its your first time - TRY THE FRENCH TOAST. This will leave you breathless. The plating is BEAUTIFUL and with one bite, your head will be spinning.I can't imagine what i would do without this place. Pros:Best food in LABest French Toast in LABest Orange Juice in LA--best everything--Cons:none

Reviews.Author: Reid H.
Reviews.Content: We stumbled upon this place walking on Melrose. Their was a wait and it was longer than quoted, but it was worth it. The food and atmosphere was good. We got a table outside and the people watching was superb. Service was adequate. Price was reasonable for the area. Highly recommended for breakfast or lunch if you are in the area and looking for a good spot.

Reviews.Author: Lisa M.
Reviews.Content: Stumbled across this place on a Saturday night 2 weeks ago. Quaint little cafe. Didn't have a reservation but they accommodated and we were greeted with a yummy 'Welcome' bite on the house. Some ceviche-like tostada. The staff was very friendly and helpful with the menu and wine. We were informed the portions were family style and small, but bigger than tapas. All I know is we loved everything we ate! I forget everything we ordered-but lamb tacos, honey shrimp, and the dessert- all delicious. We are still talking about this dinner.hahaWe were told the chef changes up the menu -so I definitely recommend it as i will be going back. =)

Reviews.Author: Logan S.
Reviews.Content: Although I've heard the breakfast is the main draw here, we went for dinner and it should not be undermined by its pre-noon counterpart. Blu jam's tapas style dinner menu is extremely good. With a wide-array of menu items, the tapas is sure to please a diverse crowd.The Spanish Shrimp and Tuna-Avocado Tar Tar were among some our favorites. The wine menu is also perfect for their Melrose location. A great overall restaurant with a great and helpful staff. If you are in the area go here. If you aren't, make plans to go here.

Reviews.Author: T. R.
Reviews.Content: My first time at Blu Jam and it was just OK.I ordered the rissotto breakfast plate because risotto is absolutely delicious when it's done well. It wasn't done well here. The risotto with the bacon and peas were just OK. Perhaps, instead of bacon, prosciutto might work? I was surprised that this bland dish was being served at a really hip and trendy cafe. On a bright side, the two poached eggs that were on top of the risotto were fantastic. Poached to perfection! Even with that, it didn't save the entire dish.The service was spotty at times. I waited quite a bit to get my check.Would I come back? Sure, I would give it a second chance, perhaps order something more of the American breakfast standard.

Reviews.Author: Amita F.
Reviews.Content: AMAZING FOOD, AMAZING STAFF!Definitely worth the 45 minute wait on a Saturday for brunch. I have lived in LA for over a decade and this place is my favorite by far!

Reviews.Author: Karen N.
Reviews.Content: Came here a few days ago on a weekday for a late lunch at 2pm. Undeniably, hands down, THE BEST (vanilla) French Toast I've EVER HAD!! Did I have to capitalize 'BEST and EVER HAD'? YES. It's as good as all the reviews rave about, there's no way to overhype it. Every bite feels like you're in heaven. Sweet but not overwhelming topped with strawberries and bananas. My mouth is watering just thinking about it. AND if you're a latte/capp drinker, not only is it made WELL, but with a whole lotta TLC b/c they make lovely little designs with the foam. The service is great, everyone is laid back and pleasant. i can't wait to try the rest of their menu!!

Reviews.Author: Rachellite L.
Reviews.Content: I've been here 3-4 times.It's a super cute place, and the service is great, but the food is always pretty bland and never as flavorful and tasty as it looks. Not sure why - maybe they just don't use enough spices?I've never waited less than 30 minutes, so to me it's just not worth it.In response to Kamil: Thank you for the comments - I did have the Spicy Tex Mex Tofu Hash, which was not very spicy/flavorful at all. I also had the Migas and something else that I don't see on your regular menu - I think it was called the Hangover Special??I guess my complaint is that while everything LOOKED really good, it all just tasted bland and mushed together without any real distinct flavors. Maybe some things were a little over-cooked? Maybe some fresh garlic and pepper would help? Although not professional, I also love cooking and take pride in my abilities as a chef, and I just felt like I could make better dishes at home.Like I said in my original review, the service was always really good, and I've always enjoyed the restaurant itself. And a LOT of other people seem to really enjoy the food, so maybe it's just me.

Reviews.Author: Haley W.
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite place to go for brunch. I usually try to avoid it on the weekends though since it can be up to an hour wait. Still worth it if that is the only time you can go. The Wrap On Fire , Egg Sandwich, Veggie Sandwich and the Soy Mocha are my favorite things I have had there. I don't get to go very frequently since I don't live in the area, yet my waitress recognizes me and knows what I want to drink every time. I wish I knew her name.I have yet to try their dinner fare, but I am sure it is amazing.

Reviews.Author: Miss C.
Reviews.Content: Yummy!! We went early on Saturday morning not a long wait. 15 minutes. Go latter you will wait a lot longer! I had the florentine benedict! It was so good the yolk on the poached egg was so creamy with the Brie cheese and holindase   sauce, a little bit of heaven in every bit!!My husband said they were the best pancakes he has ever had! And he knows his pancakes!The service was very friendly and helpful. In short this is a great place!

Reviews.Author: nathan p.
Reviews.Content: Oh.  This place is good.  I came for breakfast and tried their French Toast. Delicious.  Crunchy corn-flakes on the outside and soft tasty egg toast on the inside. If you like French Toast from Marston's in Pasadena...you'll love this one in Melrose.Friendly personnel.  Love the ambiance plus the people we met were very friendly, kid friendly and all around great experience.

Reviews.Author: Mal C.
Reviews.Content: The French Toast is sweet, rich, fluffy goodness. A little piece of heaven on a plate.

Reviews.Author: Micheal Y.
Reviews.Content: Food was good but the server was horrible!!

Reviews.Author: Simon H.
Reviews.Content: Food was great. Pricy but great.

Reviews.Author: Ryan G.
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the food, and the hostess did a good job finding us a table even though it was crowded.

Reviews.Author: Torry D.
Reviews.Content: Nice café. I had the gourmet burger medium rare sans onions. AMAZING! My bf had the crispy French Toast. Equally fantastic; the curb flakes added an interesting texture. Would 100% recommend.

Reviews.Author: Tom W.
Reviews.Content: I live around the corner from BluJam so I am well aware of the long wait time. This past Saturday around 11am I put my name on the list for a party of 4. Knowing the wait would be long (and it was, 50 mins that morning) I went to the car wash down the street to kill time. I was already on my way back to the restaurant when I received the text saying my table was ready. The nice African American host quickly sat me at a table inside. As I was about to sit down a second host named Mc something came and threw me out of my table because my party was walking in and not seated with me. He was so rude, dismissive and aggressive for no reason. I have come here many times and with all the competition on Melrose this most likely will be my last despite the kindness of my waiter and the manager. Between the humiliation and another 20minutes I had to wait for another table, nothing on their menu makes that worth it. I think so much could have been avoided with proper explanation and simple kindness.

Reviews.Author: Annie L.
Reviews.Content: The coffee is so rich and good. The food is tasty as well. It's a nice spot to bring someone visiting LA, or meet up with friends for brunch. You can sit inside or outside.

Reviews.Author: Ron M.
Reviews.Content: What a great experience.. Food was excellent.. Service was great, our server Trace treated us so well.. A+++

Reviews.Author: Nia R.
Reviews.Content: not much to say, speechless really... food is awesome, staff was great, especially for having gone January 1st for hangover food...

Reviews.Author: Will S.
Reviews.Content: Great food and a nice location. You have to try the french toast, it's unique.

Reviews.Author: cassandra v.
Reviews.Content: love it

Reviews.Author: Ben B.
Reviews.Content: A-OK.

Reviews.Author: Veronica C.
Reviews.Content: good

Reviews.Author: Melissa W.
Reviews.Content: mmmmm crispy french toast and hang over scramble mmmmmmthe wait was ungodly, of course, but if you're with the right people it goes pretty quick. My friend and I decided to get the crispy french toast and the hang over scramble, not because we were hung over but because who can say no to cornflake crusted buttery fried bread, and jalepenos, tomatoes, cilantro, cheese and eggies thrown into a pan. Oh! and a side of bacon, extra crispy. yea, we're fatties. LOVED the french toast. I really don't know what came with it but it was intensely sweet. yay fuzzy teeth! the scramble was also really good and came with a side of potatoes. I would have been perfect hang over food. Prices weren't bad and the service was really nice. He was so happy to help us it was a little shocking at first. We sat inside which made us smell of breakfast all day. merp! If you're willing to wait then you would be happy with the food but if not, no big. It's definitely the place to be apparently.

Reviews.Author: Diana H.
Reviews.Content: My father has this annoying habit of always telling my mother how she can improve a meal while we are still eating it.  This past Saturday night, my poor mother slaved over a parmesan/panko-crusted halibut dish, served with basil asiago orzo pasta and green beans.  As I groaned/moaned my approval in between forkfuls of the flakey white fish and cheesolicious orzo, my food snobbo father said, "This would be better if there were more basil and maybe a citrus sauce."  I kind of wanted to throw my fork at his eyeball for my mother (she's not inclined toward physical violence... except when she watches CSI).This past Sunday, my experience dining at Blu Jam Cafe helped illuminate my father's insensitive and unwelcome commentary.  As I ate my chicken curry wrap (enthusiastically recommended by our impossibly skinny waitress), I couldn't help but think, "This would be so much better in a spinach or sun-dried tomato tortilla as opposed to a flour one."  As my tongue assessed the curry chicken salad, I found myself craving a different texture -- toasted slivered almonds or cashews, and the addition of a mango chutney to liven up the rather bland purely mayo + curry dressing.  While the red onions, raisins and tomatoes were nice, I needed something more -- just like with my side field greens that really were strictly field greens with nary a tomato slice nor carrot shred in sight.  Now before I get a flurry of protests claiming that I sufferred a case of bad ordereringitis, my two dining companions who ordered an omelette and cobb salad, reached the consensus that MY dish reigned supreme.  (?!?!)Blu Jam Cafe is the reason I eat most of my meals at home, or stick to true gems that do what I can't do as well (or better) in my own kitchen.  While I love trying new places, I think I might have to stick with my constants in the future -- the Little Next Door, Urth Cafe and Joan's on Third.Two stars for the nonexistent wait for a table, the craveably good balsamic dressing on my very lonely green salad, and the amazing way my wrap held together without deconstructing like a corpse on CSI.

Reviews.Author: Jenny S.
Reviews.Content: my new FAVORITE place for breakfast in LA!came back for my roomie's birthday brunch and with a party of 9 we were seated in the private back room that I didn't even know existed! (though the wait was still around 1 hour)I shared 2 dishes with the birthday girl----KAMIL'S BREAKFAST because that dish is just amazing (read previous review)!! ----CRUNCHY french toast!! the crispy CORNFLAKE CRUST made the french toast so much better than the regular version i ordered last time & it comes with a delicious vanilla bean dipping sauce (tasted like melted vanilla ice cream)! it all went so well with the fresh berries!i had a bite of the roma via paris but it wasn't as good as the other two dishesKamil, i'm glad I gave your crunchy french toast a try.. definitely upped Blu Jam to a 5 star rating!!!

Reviews.Author: Rosy A.
Reviews.Content: Super cute place with friendly staff. The eggs benedict are delicious and the French toasted is crusted with crunchy flakes. The food is delicious though the wait to get a table can be rather long. Worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Mel D.
Reviews.Content: My new favorite breakfast spot. I can't wait to go back. If you have never been to Blu Jam Cafe, GO NOW!!!!!!!!!  There is usually a long wait but well worth the wait. There are plenty of shopping to do in the area if you need to kill some time...a definite must do and their menu has a little of everything. There are even options for those healthy eater (low cal), vegetarians and vegans.  Parking is what you'd expect off melrose - not easy but you''ll eventually find something. After an hour wait, we were seated. My friend and I shared the spicy tex mex tofu hash and the corn-flake crusted french toast (which is off the special menu).  The spicy tex mex tofu hash is probably the best breakfast I've ever eaten.  I'm not a vegetarian nor do I ever plan to be one BUT this healthy breakfast dish was AMAZING. It had the perfect amount of kick, you can still eat it if you aren't a fan of spicy food, it wasn't too spicy.  I felt like eating tofu rather than eggs and am I glad I did - I love living in the hollywood (midcity) area because many places do offer alternatives to eggs. The corn flake crusted french toast was something almost every table seemed to be ordering. We didn't know what it was, we just pointed to the table next to us and the server gave us a big thumbs up. It's exactly what you'd picture - crunchy on the outside, fantastic flavor and no syrup needed. they do have a special cream sauce you can pour on it but it tastes so good you may not need anything on it.  It also come with a nice amount of fresh fruit which nicely decorates the dish.I was pleased with the service from both the hostess girl and the server. Everything was efficient.  We waited an hour but they turned tables around as quick as they could - unlike many restaurant where you stare at empty tables that need to be cleaned up, Blu Jam Cafe cleans and seats the table immediately. My water was refilled often and the server came by to check on us the perfect amount of time.  I'm not surprised that there is always a crowd of people waiting outside...I plan to be a regular myself.

Reviews.Author: Cherie T.
Reviews.Content: i bookmarked Blu Jam Cafe because of Daniel L.'s review and pictures. i normally would opt for the patio seating but given that the weather was just waaay to hot, my friend and i decided to sit indoor w/ the AC.First thing first... ordered my Vanilla Latte... it was satisfying, it'd be nice to have stronger coffee flavor. I did enjoy the latte art!My friend and I shared the Florentine Benedict and the Brioche French Toast with fresh berries and banana.I substituted my potatoes with a cup of fresh fruits. I have to say this, the fruits, yes they're fresh - not the canned ones.. but they're not FRESH enough.  the bananas were turning brown, some of the strawberries were brown too, the watermelon and cantaloupe were eh.. i would like for them to cut bigger chunks of melon instead of giving us what looks to be leftover / scraps of melons. When they mentioned cup of fresh fruits, I had an image of TOAST's cup of fresh fruits - now THAT's fresh!okay so back to Blu Jam's food.. the Florentine benedict was light and fresh. I definitely would recommend this dish for people who wants a lighter benedict breakfast.the french toast, well since it's made from brioche - one of my favorite breads - i am definitely a fan. the toast was light and fluffy just the way I like it.our waitress was awesome, the restaurant was small & cozy.i wish this place was close to my house - i'd definitely come here more often.

Reviews.Author: Tara M.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam Café, you never fail me.  This was one of the first brunch places I went to when I moved to LA.  I've been with my best friends, dates, out-of-towners, etc. and it has always been a great experience.  This past Sunday I went with my heterosexual girlfriend, Sunny K. It was jam packed with people and I thought it was going to take a while before we got our table.  But before I could finish a smoke, we had a table.  Starved, thirsty and hot from the January sun (??) (hey, it's LA) we ordered food and mimosas.  I ordered the Roma Via Paris egg scramble (spinach, sun-dried tomatoes, zucchini, cherry tomatoes, bell peppers, fresh basil, goat cheese and mozzarella) with mixed greens and rosemary toast.  I mean, really - the dish speaks for itself.  It's amazing. And it's pretty large portions.  Between Sunny and I, we usually can put down a pretty good amount of food - we didn't even make a dent into this dish.  Sunny order the Venetian Chicken sandwich (grilled chicken breast, melted mozzarella, pesto, mayo, fire-roasted red bell pepper and fresh tomato).  This sandwich is the reason I didn't get any help with my eggs!  Sunny was too busy with this and dropping half her salad on the table to notice anything else!  Lol!The waiter was funny and totally catered to Sunny and I's personalities - i.e. two aggressive women, who will end up sitting together on the porch, drunk,  yelling at people and letting them know how much they suck when we're like 80 years old. He totally got a kick of out of us and was even happier when we started calling each other names as we fought over the check.  Then we split another mimosa.  Perfect times.  Full and happy,  we then went shopping, where I proceeded to yell at Sunny for wanting to buy some shi shi crap.

Reviews.Author: Rachel A.
Reviews.Content: UPDATED:apparently a bad review at blue jam cafe comes with a side of hate. within 24 hours of posting my review, i was contacted by both the owner and a random user. here are their replies:[from a random user]they probably felt that you are a spoiled cunt and fucked up your food:))Page Bottom Between stasik m. and Rachel A.stasik m.Block User3 hours agocunt cunt cunt cunt cunt:)spoiled cunthere is a link to stasik's page:yelp.com/user_details?us…[and a reply from the owner]Kamil M.OwnerBlock & Report Owner6 hours agoSorry that you had a bad experience..I am yelper myself and would not review place based on take out.( i was not doing take out at first but customers were getting upset so I started to do so and now..?!?) I must assure you that I have been cooking for over 30 years and have enjoyed restaurant business and never been accused in using cheap ingredients.Now if you would eat here I would take full responsibility.I dont understand about the service either..what service..you ordered to go.If you read other 740 reviews you will find out that our food is always fresh and service very good.Best regards Kamil Majer chef/ownerPS: I answer every review ..bad or good because I care..Once again thank you for your visit.__________________________________________________­____I am downright shocked by the stellar reviews for this place, and after having visited solely based on this, I can state that I firmly disagree with the publics opinion on this one.The service was...lacking. It actually was kind of bland like the food...I came in without much of a greeting to non-enthusiastic waiters who finally directed me to the pick-up space at the bar. My food was brought out promptly but without much of a smile.The food was downright awful. I have to mention, I did get my food to-go. But maybe if their food doesn't stay fresh and delicious in a to-go box on a less than 1-mile journey via car down melrose...they shouldn't offer to-go. Suffice to say, I don't think the deliciousness factor of the food was effected by the take out journey, it was flat out boring. I ordered a simple order, and one that I figured was hard to mess up: grilled cheese w/out tomatoes & red potatoes on the side. For one, they put on tomtatoes when I asked for none, but hey, while I feel bad that someone else who enjoys tomato didn't get the ones I was served, I have no bad feelings about picking something off I don't like, and can still enjoy it. This was not the case with the grilled cheese. Besides the bread being soggy and literally almost dripping wet, the cheeses they chose were either cheap or simply not pungent enough to have any real flavor. It was inedible. I didn't even feel right giving it to the dogs. The potatoes were equally soggy, bland, and boring. I don't think there was any seasoning on there at all. I won't be back for another visit. They left me nothing to desire.

Reviews.Author: Sam V.
Reviews.Content: BEST BRUNCH PLACE IN LA!!!!Came here for brunch after a long night out and really enjoyed it! When the weather is nice, it s great to sit outside.  Came back a second time and loved it even more.  My wife loves huevos rancheros, something she ate every morning for breakfast on our 2 week stay in SoCal.  This was by far, her favorite.  She is still trying to find something similar in NYC.  Eggs are served on a crispy tortilla with salsa, avacadoes, black beans, etc.  I had a steak hash and tore it up in minutes.  Good quality meat and the hash was filled with flavor.  This place is awesome!

Reviews.Author: Mike N.
Reviews.Content: Friend: Wow the server and hostess were so nice to youMe: I know. I think they think I'm one of Far East Movement or I won America's Best Dance Crew. Thank you to those two for making being Asian cool again. John Cho, you almost had America with Harold & Kumar, but effed it up after Fast Forward. Nice try. Greetings:Just kidding I'm sure they knew I was just a regular joe enjoying a Sunday brunch amongst the other sunglassed angelinos. The service was still superb.  Our lovely hostess came out to tell me that I was next to be seated. Impressive. I can't even remember the name of the person who's hand I just shook. "You're the director of who what? shrug." The server was just pleasant. Even as the doorway lined with waiting patrons she never pressured us to hurry. I made my order and she smiled an encouragement and gave me a mental high five for my excellent decision. Seriously, I'm not from Far East Movement. It's cool.   Bites:The Crunch French toast ($11.95)- Light and indeed crunchy. Being grilled and sweetened only by the topped fruit is a nice step away from the traditionally over syrup-ed and egg slopped toast of grandma's past. The vanilla bean sauce cuts nicely through the toast's textured crust and acidic berries.   The Vegetable Nest ($11.95)- My friend ordered this and said it was delicious. I can't give you a first hand account as I didn't have any. She's a pretty damned picky eater so if she liked it then that's the closest thing you'll get to seeing a double rainbow across your plate. Scenes:Breakfast for me everyday is a bagel and coffee as I run around the hospital. Same bagel. Same coffee. Same sick people getting their germs all up in my cream cheese.  So a weekend brunch here is a grand reprieve. Cozy natural woods and high ceilings. Close yet not too apprehensive seating arrangements that remind you that you share this city with actual people and not just their shiny cars. --------------------------------------------------­-----------------------------------Street parking is plenty so unless you want to flaunt your steeze or are still on your date from the night before...no need to valet. -The line looks foolish and bothersome, but the wait is 30 min tops. Enjoy your company and ease drop on everyone else. -Definitely a scene without being too much of a scene. I would rather eat here than any of those other joints around 3rd and Fairfax/Beverly.-Don't give up John Cho.

Reviews.Author: Retired B.
Reviews.Content: Yummy! I was very pleasantly surprised at how good blu jam's breakfast/brunch items were. Shared the blu jam Benedict and crunchy French toast.The blu jam Benedict was one of the best eggs Benedict that I've had. The eggs were on top of ham bacon and a croissant  with a side of potatoes or fruit or yogurt. I opted for the potatoes.The crunchy French toast had it's crunch from corn flakes. It wasn't too sweet and it also came with fruit and a vanilla dipping sauce. Really good food, service wasn't bad- the only downside was the wait for a table. It took us about a hour to get a table for 8 ppl and we went early.

Reviews.Author: Di R.
Reviews.Content: This was an unexpected trip to LA. It had been a sucky week. We had to put my daughter's 11 year old dog down who had suddenly gotten sick. And I had brought her back to LA after her own closure. We had decided that This day was going to be our Buddy Closure day and Blue Jam Cafe could not have come through more!!!! My daughter had heard of this place and wanted to try it and so we did....The coffee was piping hot and awesome. The food was not disappointing one bit. Everything we tried was great. Our server was great. Her name was Marcela. The busser was even great! Our coffee was always filled.  My daughter had the Lorex which was an egg dish with Salmon. We had been in the mood for lox and bagles so that was a good choice and then I had the Breakfast deal which included incredible pancakes that my daughter mentioned had a Krispy Kreme flavor to them and she was not too far off and the bacon was sooo good. I was suprised when I asked about the bacon Marcela didn't rave over it! But everything was perfect, from the food to the atmosphere!  Even the couple sitting next to us was entertaining. Very sweet but very high maintenance. My daughter is an actress and currently supporting that career as a waitress and could sympathize as we watched our patient and gracious server cater to their every need without missing a beat with us.Thank you Blue Jam!!! We definitely will be back! Judging from over 400 other reviews I can only imagine that this place must be jammed on the weekends. We enjoyed it on a Tuesday and so hopefully it would be just as good on an overly busy day but would be worth the wait if you had to!This is definitely the kind of place you want to keep for yourself and share with a friiend!

Reviews.Author: Bianca J.
Reviews.Content: I am very sorry, I am unable to give a place more than four stars if I have only tasted a couple of items on the menu. However, I went there from brunch & I had breakfast. There is so many creative dishes here and everything looks so good! I wish I had more space in my stomach! I did have the chicken breakfast quesadillas which were yummy, but I shared some crispy waffles w/ my Bo which were so yummy I literally closed my eyes and smiled at them. The staff is extremely welcoming & not over the top friendly where it seems fake. Sweet & helpful waitress, efficient cooking times, and reasonable prices. I will return!

Reviews.Author: Vicky V.
Reviews.Content: Brunch-Fresh ingredients and impeccable service (Derek= perfect server) but rather colorless cuisine and limited griddle menu.Food 3.25, Service 5,  Ambiance: 3.5, Noise: 1 (but it was 2pm), Value 3.5So you know those annoying customers who are N-E-V-E-R ready to order, who of course need more time because they keep chatting rather than looking at the menu and are then doubly plagued with indecisiveness, well that was us today. Perhaps it was because I am unaccustomed to Brunch at 2pm or because my friend was on his B positive blood type diet that shuns poultry because it's the only protein with no taboos yet (no not really, you'll have to read this NY Times best seller for more details) or because for once, sugary griddle goodness just didn't sound appetizing. Whatever fueled our indecisiveness, we did finally settle on the following: Loxex with egg whites (sour cream on the side): Warning the smoked salmon is adulterated by heat, so set your heart on COOKED salmon and BIA (Brie missing in action). Overall, a decent egg white scramble. Rosemary toast: Pleasant herb quality that is subtly flavors the bread and compliments the Loxex. Tasty! The Potatoes: So PLEASE DO NOT ORDER THE POTATOES, PLEASE DO NOT ORDER THE POTATOES, can I say this enough times, PLEASE DO NOT ORDER THE POTATOES.. save yourself the disappointment and order the FRUIT! YES THE FRUIT! The charming little fruit bowl with fresh figs (don't like figs, don't know what they are, it's OK they're expensive and worth it), blueberries, strawberries, bananas, not too fresh cantaloupe, watermelon, and honeydew. Did I say it came with FIGS and BLUEBERRIES? OK enough said. The potatoes consist of diced red potatoes sauteed in olive oil and lightly seasoned, so unless this appeals to you then I'd consider another side, like umm the fruit. The Goulash-I don't know if you can tell, but clearly I'm not Hungarian and really had no idea what I was ordering, but I do know that it was comforting, rich in flavor, and delicious! A Goulash virgin before this I have no goulash barometer for you. However if you're looking for a thick paprika flavored soup with tender beef, carrots, onions, and potatoes, here you go. The bread was over toasted and just straight up hard and slightly stale, perhaps they were trying to infuse a bit of Eastern Block authenticity to the meal. I rarely say this, in fact I never say this...but the service was perfect especially when we were such imperfect customers. Derek was the most pleasant, gracious, patient server who tolerated all of our "special requests" and order a new item ever 30 minutes tactic because we were so indecisive. He even rescued my sweater for me when I accidentally left it behind my chair! An outstanding server and gentlemen, we are coming back because he was so pleasant, perhaps our next meal will be more spectacular. TIP: Full brunch menu on the weekends only, bring quarters for parking meters, and FYI they close early (4pm on Weekdays, 5pm on Weekends)

Reviews.Author: Charles H.
Reviews.Content: Best breakfast anywhere in the area..! Up to date look and feel on the interior. The service was great, these people like what they do and they do it well. Oh, the French toast is fantastic..! Check this place out.

Reviews.Author: Sabrina I.
Reviews.Content: Went again this weekend. Food still ridiculously good - and now they are version 2.0 - WITH COMPUTERS! yay.

Reviews.Author: Bree C.
Reviews.Content: Be prepared to wait a while, especially on the weekend. We went on a Sunday and waiting 50 minutes, but it's SO worth it. The seating is a little cramped and you can hear the persons convo next to you but the food is delish and healthy! Except the crunchy french toast. But get the crunchy french toast, because you won't regret it.

Reviews.Author: robert p.
Reviews.Content: Great clean, locally grown food with an Eastern European touch to the menu. If you want real great food for breakfast, brunch and lunch - then this is your place.

Reviews.Author: Cambria K.
Reviews.Content: Hands down best breakfast in town- French Toast! Lunch and dinner are super delicious as well- The Herb Chicken!

Reviews.Author: Rebecca P.
Reviews.Content: Yum! When I have a good breakfast--I mean really good breakfast--I smile all day. This makes me smile. I had the Tex Mex Tofu Scramble. It was healthy and delicious. Some places make their tofu scrambles too oily or too bland. Not here. They make it with just the right combo of black beans, tofu, salsa, green peppers, and cilantro and add a slice of rosemary wheat bread on the side to top it all off. The coffee was great and they kept my cup full. But the best part is that they substituted the fruit for the potatoes (no extra charge!) and--get ready for this--they were willing to give me a melon-free, all-berry fruit cup! Ok, if you are not a fruit cup lover, this might not matter to you. But I HATE when places give me a melon cup with one dinky grape and one shriveled sliver of strawberry. Give me fresh strawberries and blueberries and peaches and I am a happy camper!

Reviews.Author: Cc R.
Reviews.Content: I love everything about Blu Jam Cafe! So great for breakfast, brunch, and lunch.

Reviews.Author: Robert S.
Reviews.Content: Ya know what? I'm giving the 4th star back.
