Not that I revisited or anything, but Kamil, the Owner/Head Chef, personally sent me an message on Yelp apologizing for my first time experience. I don't find blame in him or anyone else, things went down the way it did because of simple timing. He offered my friends a nice bottle of wine or a pitcher of sangria on the next visit and I really do appreciate that.

Reviews.Author: Connie L.
Reviews.Content: This place is great! I am always looking for a good brunch spot. And I never would have thought to go to Melrose. I try to get together with my cousins once a month and this month he recommended this Blu Jam Cafe. I have to say, I was excited about going here for a week. He already prepared me for a 1 1/2 hour wait so wanted to get there early. There was an aids walk the day we went so I was hoping for a shorter line. That did not happen. We waited for an hour and 15 minutes. I think the wait was totally worth it. I had something that was like mac and cheese but with bacon and egg. Amazing. My cousin had the risotto with pesto and 2 poached eggs. I think that is my favorite. It tasted and smelled so fresh because of the pesto. We also ordered an order of the crispy french toast that he said I had to try. It was very good. Luckily he ordered it for us to share because I could never finish a sweet dish for brunch alone. I will have to bring my parents here since they like brunch a lot.

Reviews.Author: Angel T.
Reviews.Content: This place is super cute.  I went with a couple of girlfriends for brunch.  The waiter was EXTREMELY slow.  I know it's brunch, but it shouldn't take 20 minutes to get water.  The food was good, but basic.  I had an omelette and it was fine, but nothing I couldn't have made myself.  The OJ was 3.95 + tax, so almost 5 bucks.  Really?  Okay, next time can I bring my own?  Decent, but there are way better brunch places in the area.

Reviews.Author: Puddintang T.
Reviews.Content: This place was delicious! A little busy but the yummy food makes up for the busy crowd. I had the french toast andvit was to DIE FOR!!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Lynn J.
Reviews.Content: three simple words sums it all up: CRISPY FRENCH TOAST!!!!!ohmyguy, the crispy french toast is PHENOMENAL...first time i've had this variation of french toast, and i was totally impressed. comes topped with seasonal berries and bananas and a side of vanilla bean sauce - as Rachel Ray would say, YUMMOOOO. complimenting my decadently delicious french toast was a steaming hot cup of chai tea latte...prob one of my fave chai tea lattes in LA!can you imagine what this breakfast did to my blood sugar level? thank goodness i'm not a diabetic!the l'il sis got the smoked salmon scramble with potatoes - equally delicious and ridiculously hearty. i think next time, we can ask for no sour cream on top...

Reviews.Author: Shida S.
Reviews.Content: Love the breakfast here...really awesome service to go along with it.  Love the Salmon hollandaise as well as the stuffed berry french toast its heavenly....there is certainly a long wait on weekends for seating but its so worth the wait or hit them up during the week.  Also, great management.  The owner is extremely involved at the restaurant and he is very friendly and kind and don't be surprised if you are greeted by him.

Reviews.Author: Darlene Y.
Reviews.Content: I came with a few friends of mine for brunch. If you plan to go, be there by 10 AM, the wait gets pretty bad, but we got pretty lucky and were seated right away. Their portion sizes are pretty generous, so if you plan to order more than one dish, make sure you share it. I ordered the MUSCLE BEACH which had Six egg whites scrambled with fresh thyme, ground turkey, onions, spinach and chopped tomatoes, served with a cup of low fat cottage cheese and toast. You can not go wrong there. On the side I ordered their signature dish CRUNCHY FRENCH TOAST which had Egg brioche dipped in batter, rolled in crunchy corn flakes and grilled to perfection, topped with fresh bananas and berries, served with vanilla bean sauce. That was not physically possible for me to finish alone, but it was delicious. I will come back again soon. ENJOY!

Reviews.Author: Tina M.
Reviews.Content: we came on a tuesday for brunch and sat outside since it was a beautiful day. the service was great and we were seated promptly.okay, now for the food...as you may have already read, the crunchy french toast is simply a-ma-zing! when i first read the description, i was skeptical because i'm a huge fan of the original french toast but to my dismay, this version was far superior. we also ordered the eggs benedict and it was done to perfection--i actually preferred the black forest ham to the standard canadian bacon.i shall return!

Reviews.Author: Lisa M.
Reviews.Content: Freakin delicious!!! No wonder this place was voted the #1 breakfast spot in La........though I didn't order breakfast, haha. Still, not the point. Parking sucks. Period. You're chances are upped if you go up a couple blocks from Melrose and find street parking, then walk to the cafe. It was really crowded, though we did come on a Saturday morning. I think we waited an hour before we were seated. We got a lovely table outside on the edge, so at least we didn't have to uncomfortably sit there and eat while people waiting oogled us. The service was friendly and attentive, but the food was fantastic. I ordered a bowl of the split pea soup and half a gourmet sandwich- you get to choose which kind. I was pretty bummed they wouldn't let you get the soup and sandwich combo with the ahi tuna, but what I ended up with was yummy, so who cares. I got the turkey with avocado, cucumber, and cheese on delicious bread. First of all, the soup- AMAAAAZING. I'm a huge fan of split pea, but it's hard to find a good one that's not too pea-y but not too watered down. This one was perfection, let me tell you. Every spoonful was heaven, and the huge parmesan croutons were a great garnish. The bread was great for sopping up the deliciousness that my spoon just couldn't scrape. How much of a pig do I sound now?When the sandwich came, I was almost disappointed that I was going to have to take my taste buds away from the soupy goodness, but once I bit into the bread, I somehow rose higher than food heaven...if you can imagine that. The bread was perfect, soft inside and crunchy outside. Delicious blend of flavors. I, of course, was full off the soup alone, but I refused to waste the scrumptious sandwich. I somehow managed to shove most of it down, and I was busting out of my dress on my drive home. But do I care? NOPE!!ps. my friend ordered their iced chai tea and it was DELISH as well!!!

Reviews.Author: Kevin R.
Reviews.Content: After a long and tiring day of walking up and down Melrose and hitting boutique after boutique, my friend and I felt that grumbling in our stomachs. We decided it was time to get some grub. We were looking for something close, fast, cheap, and healthy. Not too many choices right? Well, luckily we found one; Blu Jam Cafe.We first showed up to Blu Jam around 5:30 and we were told the restaurant is closed between 5 and 6pm to set up for dinner. Grrrr! Fine. We walked down the street and checked out a couple more shops, then finally came back just itching to stuff our faces. We chose a small table on the patio and gave the menu a looksie.Blu Jam is a cafe by day, and a tapas bistro by night. The menu even says that each dinner dish is meant to be shared between two people. Suh-weet! I love tapas restaurants. I love having a bunch of different tastes for each meal rather than having the same taste for twenty or so bites.The dinner menu is pretty small (but usually that means each selection is as great as the next). There are cold plates, hot plates, Mediterranean plates, and sweet plates (dessert) sections. There were two of us, so we decided on four dishes to split. We got the sauteed jumbo scallops (with herb-parsley sauce, asparagus, lemon risotto, and bread crumbs), grilled wild salmon (with tomato-olive caper sauce, and lemon risotto), tuna tartar (with avocado, and black truffle oil-chive vinaigrette), and warm berries (with balsamic sauce, and vanilla ice cream). The scallops were extremely juicy and cooked to perfection. This was actually my first time having scallops, but I instantly fell in love. The salmon was flaky with a firm outside. The tomato-olive caper sauce was an interesting addition that I have never seen with salmon. It was almost like marinara sauce I guess you could say. I don't eat too much Mediterranean food, so maybe it's a normal thing. But either way, it was great. My favorite though was the tuna tartar. Oh. My. God. It may have been the best tuna tartar I've tasted (or maybe tied with BLT Steak).The warm berry dessert was the perfect selection to go with our other dishes. Having such rich entrees (sauces, and other additions) it was nice to have a settling, healthier dish to cap the meal. Of course, I had my eye on the chocolate cake, but my friend talked me out of it. I guess girls know better blah blah blah. But what can I say, she was right.I've heard Blu Jam is mostly known for their breakfast and/or brunch. I think next time I come here I'll do it before hitting the flea market down the street. It sounds perfect to me!

Reviews.Author: Claire W.
Reviews.Content: I've been looking for a place like this that serves tasty breakfast food and reasonable portions!

Reviews.Author: Adriana A.
Reviews.Content: By far my favorite breakfast place in LA! Everything I've tried has been amazing!! I always get a mocha latte and the crunchy French toast is ridiculously good!! Love this place and always look forward to returning!

Reviews.Author: victoria r.
Reviews.Content: The best chai latte I've ever had! Yummy omelettes! Staff is super friendly. Indoor/outdoor seating. I would definitely recommend this spot for anyone and/or would return.

Reviews.Author: Jake H.
Reviews.Content: Expensive but for a reason. Location (Smack dab middle LA), awesome food, awesome service. Couple unimportant hiccups but this place is unique and deserves praise. Came for blueberry pancakes and was delivered my expectations and more when the short stack showed up on my table. Good ambiance, chill vibes....good breakfast!

Reviews.Author: Aurora N.
Reviews.Content: Best vegan burger I've ever had!  Also after trying the tofu tex mex scramble I couldn't stop thinking about it for weeks. Amazing!

Reviews.Author: Caroline W.
Reviews.Content: Meh.  It's good but not great.  I don't understand the popularity of this place.  The two times I've been, I was neither disappointed nor wowed.  In fact, I actually FORGOT about this place after the first time, and wanted to try it because of yelp, and when I got there, I was like, oh, this place.  I've been here.  Why so popular?

Reviews.Author: Airik B.
Reviews.Content: with over 1100 reviews i'm not sure why i'd even write one...oh wait...because this place is the shiznit. it deserves my 2 cents. hell it deserves a solid 6 pence!i've been visiting this establishment regularly since 2007. i've never, never, EVER been disappointed. if you're a local who can find time off during the week to visit blu jizz, i'd highly recommend it. this place is totally swamped on weekends. the wait will always be at least 45mins on wknds. perhaps that's because it's so awesome. people will wait for 45mins to eat!!! as i have NO patience for excellence, i can't do the blu jizzle, nor will i ever do it, on a weekend. you can catch me on a random tuesday or wednesday never waiting for the greatness.the french toast is good enough to make you want to smack the person sitting across from you...especially if they try to talk to you while you're eating them. (CAN'T YOU SEE I'M FOCUSED!!!!) i'm also a fan of kamil's breakfast. quite delicious. their omelette combos are really good as well. hell...just go often like i do and eat everything on the menu. it's all tasty.now let's talk about customer service...jason the waiter is THE man. this witty man who wears cut off jeans and regularly rocks a porn stash is half the reason i've continued to frequent this place for the last several years. ("is jason's section open?" "no, but it will be in about 15mins." "15mins...screw that. i'll sit over here, just send him over to my section, please. thank you.") dude is that good. i also like the manager, allison. she's cool beans. kamil is one of the best restaurant owners in LA. he should teach a seminar on how to run your business. anyway...i say all that to say this...blu jam is great. if you don't like it, then YOU have a problem. if you went on the weekend and had to wait forever for a table, then that's your problem. you wanted brunch that bad, so suck it up! i've already told you to go on a random day during the week. yeah...i know you work. shit, i work too. you've gotta make it happen. i make it happen. i'm not better than you. so figure it out.

Reviews.Author: Emily S.
Reviews.Content: Menu has options for everyone. Nice atmosphere. No wait when we came around 9:30 on a week day. We were able to park on the side street for free. Average prices. Good service.

Reviews.Author: Kristine N.
Reviews.Content: Best eggs benedict I have ever had.  The hollandaise sauce was to die for and the smoked salmon, oh so good.  And their coffees are yummy...mmm soy mochas! I rave about this place and recommend it to everyone.  The wait is not so bad, I've gone with large groups and usually get seated within 10 minutes.  This place is SOOO much better than Toast or Griddle Cafe, which are both overrated.  The waiters are super nice and friendly.  Definitely my favorite brunch place in LA, such a delight everytime I go.   The menu is diverse and if you have friends like mine, who are all super picky, you can always find something for everyone.  Love it!!!

Reviews.Author: Susan B.
Reviews.Content: Damn good breakfast place, great location. Give it a try if you are in the West Hollywood area.

Reviews.Author: Nancy L.
Reviews.Content: I had been curious about Blu Jam for some time now and was glad to finally try it out. If I hadn't seen the Yelp reviews I never would have stopped by. It's pretty nondescript. My friend mentioned she had driven by many times and never took notice. Now that I think of it, I've driven by lots too. You gotta be looking for the place.They get points for having fresh squeezed OJ. And ginormous portions of fantastic food. I was glad I hit the gym early in the AM. As always, picking entrees was a collaborative effort since we like to share. The smoked salmon eggs benedict with sauteed spinach on a croissant was the unanimous favorite. It's such a luxurious dish that it always takes first place. I love breaking the runny yolks all over for a creamy treat. Next up: Migas, a superb excuse to have nachos for breakfast. It's a mix of scrambled eggs, cheese, jalapenos, peppers, chorizo, salsa and tortilla chips. Sides include potatoes and a flour tortilla. I had only had cafeteria grade Migas previously. This is way better. We finished with strawberry, banana, and Ghirardelli dark chocolate pancakes. There was just the right amount of chocolate for a hint of sweetness however I thought there could have been a bit more strawberries.I actually think the food is 4 stars, but the service is so pleasant that I gotta round up a full star. Our waitress was amiable and not in that fake LA way either. I also liked the happy yellow walls and cute paintings. Only downside is the tables are super close and makes for some tight quarters. The wait wasn't too bad either: 20 minutes on a Saturday afternoon.

Reviews.Author: Taleia M.
Reviews.Content: I went to Blu Jam Cafe' with a friend today. I was so pleasurably surprised to discover this amazing little gem. From the host, server, to manager everyone was a delight. I had the sonoma salad that I got goat cheese instead of Gorgonzola along with this AMAZING turkey burger seriously it's the best one I have ever had!!!!! Irene who was my server was amazing mad me just feel like she really wanted to make my experience a good one. Frankie the manager was just as awesome! Really glad that I found a new lunch spot that I can easily become a regular, and good to know LA still has a restaurant with heart.

Reviews.Author: Julia T.
Reviews.Content: Blue jam: As befits a breakfast establishment on Melrose whale eggs are on the menu and so is frosty tecate from the can. The waitresses are redolent of  $ 60.00 an ounce cologne and the patronage make cruel conversation about such pressing matters as actress fad diets and whether or not to introduce a girl you feel serious about to your friends as your girlfriend even if she is a little thick in the thighs. I had Eggs Benedict  on an over toasted and thereby exceedingly difficult to quarter english muffin. However the sauce was very yummy.

Reviews.Author: Denis S.
Reviews.Content: This place was fantastic!  I went here for brunch with a group of friends, and while the service was a little slower, it was brunch, so what do you expect?  The menu was huge, both breakfast and lunch.  Everything looked great (including the surroundings) and after ordering not a single person was disappointed.  Great good, great prices, what else can you ask for?

Reviews.Author: Jennifer L.
Reviews.Content: I came here with a friend on a nice Sunday for brunch.  Perfect weather, perfect day so far.  Oh lucky me, I found street parking right out front!  The wait to sit inside was about 15 min. so we decided to sit outside.  I ordered the Loxex which was three eggs, smoked salmon, onions, tomatoes and brie cheese.  It normally comes with sour cream and chives but I asked them to leave it out.  It's served with toast and potatoes.  I also got a peach smoothie to drink.  Oh my, the portions are more than enough!  My friend ordered some sort of omelette and we decided to share an order of pancakes with strawberries, bananas, and chocolate.  My omelette was perfectly made with just the right amount of salmon.  Some places get sheisty and sprinkle crumblets of salmon.  I was already past full when I was halfway through my meal when our pancakes came out.  All I could stomach was a small cut of pancake with a slice of strawberry.  Their pancakes are GYNORMOUS, it's not even funny.  They cover the entire plate, I had to lift up the pancakes to see what color the plate was!  Their mango smoothies are so good, and they come in a big cup, so need to ask for water should you run out.Their staff are kind and attentive.  I'd definitely come back here again, and I always recommend this place when friends ask me for a brunch suggestion.

Reviews.Author: Wendy T.
Reviews.Content: Coming from a brunch fanatic, you def need to check out this place. My girlfriends and I opted to try the place out since we'd be shopping around Melrose. I decided on the Blu Jam Benedict. Eggs benedict on a fluffy croissant. It doesnt get any better. Our waitress was also super friendly and attentive. Two thumbs up :) will be going back for sure.

Reviews.Author: Reba K.
Reviews.Content: this is one of those places that was SO BAD that all i could think about during the meal was coming home to yelp about it.i ordered the blu jam benedict, which is pretty much eggs benedict served on a croissant instead of an english muffin.  bad idea.  the croissant was so soggy that it might as well have been welded onto the plate.  the potatoes on the side were grossly undercooked and not seasoned.  but my dish was the better of the two that my friend and i ordered, because...my friend got rosemary bread with her toscana scramble, and IT WAS MOLDY.  to add insult to injury, when we finally flagged down the waiter (who, btw, was too busy to stop by our table EVER; we had to wave him down just to take our order), his eyes just got really big at the sight of the mold, and he just whisked it away.  no apology.ok, so we figured maybe he was also traumatized at the sight of toasted green fuzz and would apologize when he returned with fresh bread.  NOPE.  he didn't come back.  he sent a busboy with the replacement bread.  wow...NO APOLOGY, NOTHING OFF OUR BILL, NO ACKNOWLEDGMENT BY ANYONE AT BLU JAM CAFE THAT WE WERE SERVED MOLDY BREAD...well then, NO BALLS, NO GLORY; just a review on yelp warning others about your moldy bread and rude service.

Reviews.Author: Steven P.
Reviews.Content: I was a bit apprehensive about coming here because of all the hype.  Usually when a brunch restaurant is this popular, I tend to leave the place disappointed because my expectations were high and the restaurant just wasn't able to meet them.  Well looks like I've finally met a brunch restaurant that's able to meet my expectations!  Even though the wait to get seated was painfully long, all that was forgotten when we received our food.  I ordered their special steak and egg concoction (I forgot the name of the dish) and thought it was pretty good.  My dish though, didn't compare with the Norwegian Benedict that my friends got.  Theirs were absolutely delicious!  I believe the secret to a great benedict is the Hollandaise sauce and Blu Jam's was the best I've ever tasted.  This paired with friendly service and good coffee results in a 5 star rating for me.

Reviews.Author: Connie V.
Reviews.Content: my friends and I came after a sort-of-tiring hike. however, we were famished afterwards and decided to stop by a local restaurant to reward ourselves... haha. we got the crunchy french toast, florentine benedict and california omelette... they were all super good.my biggest fave was the california one. I don't know whats so special about it but the first bite i fell in love.I i highly recommend this one. it was a good combination of salty along with the lovely french toast :) however, i don't know how great you would feel after eating the french toast by itself if you were ordering by yoruself because it's super sweet. all these dishes could easily be shared and i recommend that :) good portions.
Reviews.Author_Location: East Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

Reviews.Author: Nicole F.
Reviews.Content: My family regularly chooses Blu Jam for brunch. We only go elsewhere if it's too busy, but generally wait however long for a table anyway.  Get the Kamil's Breakfast!

Reviews.Author: EJ C.
Reviews.Content: I found this place via yelp, of course, so I wanted to check it out. Sooooo I took my sisters there one morning...well, it was early afternoon-ish by the time we got ready and everything. There were three of us, all girls, you know. Anyway. Let me tell you, the breakfast here is fantastic. I ordered the Blu Toast, which was absolute heaven. If you have a sweet tooth, then I'd definitely recommend that. There was a concoction of cream cheese and some berry spread in between the toast layers and topped with some strawberries, bananas, and I believe blueberries. After a while, it did get a bit too sweet for me, but for the most part I loved it. I believe we went on a Sunday too, but we didn't have to wait at all to be seated. The place is a bit small, so small group is best. Go get your grub on!

Reviews.Author: Katherine B.
Reviews.Content: My friend and I found this place through Yelp when we were looking for a good brunch place. We got there around 10:30 AM, and the line was pretty long, but we didn't have to wait for a long time. We actually had to wait for a while to get our food, though. Anyway, my friend ordered plain coffee and egg benedict, and I ordered white peach tea and French toast with berries and blackberry jam (they have 3 or 4 different types of French toasts, and it was very exciting to choose from them! The waitress was super nice and made friendly recommendations to me when I was indecisive). I was actually getting a little bit impatient because it took them a long time to serve our food. But mmmMMmmmm! With a sip of white peach tea, I forgot about my impatience. It was just PERFECT--not too bitter, not too sweet, and very VERY soothing and calm. Yes, it's weird to use those words to describe the taste, but trust me--that was the best peach tea I have ever had. But of course, if you prefer sweet drinks, then you shouldn't get it since it's not sweetened, at all. Meanwhile, my friend was pleased with her coffee since she was smiling as she held her cup with two hands and enjoyed the smell of her coffee.When our food was finally served, we could not take our eyes off from our plates. My French toast had nice decorations with mint (I believe it was mint), fresh berries rolling around the toast, and not-too-much powder sugar. I fell in love with it when I had my first bite--God, it just had to be the best French toast I've ever had in my life. The berries were VERY fresh, and the toast was not too soggy, either. It was sweet because of the blackberry jam and powder sugar, but it wasn't too sweet. It was just RIGHT. I LOVED IT!My friend's egg benedict was a success, too! She really loved it. If you are looking for good amount of food as your brunch/breakfast, then this is it for you! The only thing I didn't like about it was that the egg was too runny for me. I always cook my eggs well-done, so I didn't like egg benedict as much as French toast. So if you don't like runny eggs, then you should get something else, such as French toast!Overall, I really enjoyed my brunch at Blu Jam Cafe. Yeah, you have to be patient because they don't serve you right away. My friend and I had to wait a while to actually get extra plates we requested. Also, it seems like the cafe is good for a party of 2-4 since it's a very small cafe. The tables outside are mostly for a party of 2. But definitely, I am thinking about going again some time soon. As I'm writing this review, I just can't stop thinking about the French toast I had. God, I feel as if I can still taste it in my mouth. Hahaha! So yeah! I highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for a nice, hearty brunch!I hope this review helps! :)

Reviews.Author: Lolita E.
Reviews.Content: Feeling like an alternative walk is coming on? Take a stroll down Melrose and end it with a wonderful brunch at Blu Jam Cafe. The wait is absolutely worth it. Thinking of the crunchy French toast? It is delicious, I hear, but what's truly worth the calories is the Florentine Benedict. What it is: poached eggs on a toasted English muffin with sautéed fresh spinach, mushrooms, sun-dried tomatoes, and brie cheese, topped with hollandaise, served with potatoes. Le sigh.

Reviews.Author: Aaron L.
Reviews.Content: Another great experience @ Blu Jam.  French toast, best in LA.  Oatmeal huge and delicious.  Our first order of French toast arrived the table on the cold side, so I asked the waiter to take it back and bring us a fresh order. He did, and then offered to remove the charge from the bill. The manager then came over, apologized for the issue, and also offered to remove the charge from the bill. It was a well handled incident and I would love to come back.  This restaurant has quickly become my favorite restaurant to visit in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Author: Sharon E.
Reviews.Content: again - thank you Yelp for pointing me in the direction of someplace new for breakfast/lunch... i just popped in with a friend for a monday lunch...  and we had a nice meal... the crab benedict was nicely flavored and seasoned - but the chiabatta bread that they served it on was too thick and tough - i'd have prefered it on an english muffin or croissant...my friend had the chicken paprikas which looked tasty - she liked it.prices were moderate - the whole menu looked so good - i had a hard time deciding what to get - so i will definitely return to try something new.oh - and the water did taste delicious - but it had a peachy flavor today - not lemon/mint.  the coffee was good enough to enjoy black - and they did bring us some crusty bread with a mildly spicy tapenade before our food was brought out - very good.in all - it was about $15 each including tax & tip... not bad at all.*****update 8/14/07*****my second visit here was just as good as the first!  i came with a different friend, and we split their catch of the day - a blackened salmon served over rice... SOOO good.  it wasn't just salmon over rice... it was served with a baby carrot, slices of zucchini, garnished with fresh sprigs of dill and snips of fresh chives... and the rice was cooked with peas and something else - i can't remember... but it was a perfect lunch!i just bumped them up to 5 stars because they were just as good if not better than the first time.

Reviews.Author: M M.
Reviews.Content: obsessed. best casual breakfast in los angeles. i deal with the drive and with the inevitable wait because blu jam is consistently A+. dine at off-hours if you are impatient.my favorite menu items are the regular french toast and the crunchy version (depending on my mood). definitely  big enough to split with someone.  i'm all about getting 1 savory, 1 sweet thing for breakfast :).  the toasts are served with super fresh berries and banana which really enhance the dish.  prior to blu jam, i had always had mediocre, not-worth-the-calories, toast.  not so at blu jam. the french toast is excellent every time.also recommended: the omelets and the steak and eggs (minus the hollandaise).  the potatoes served with savory dishes are notably good.the lattes and teas are delicious and the service is quick once you are actually seated . the hostesses are always flooded with hungry guests anxious to eat, but they seem to have a system that works and smiling faces.5 stars.

Reviews.Author: Shelley H.
Reviews.Content: nice little spot a little off the main strip of melrose - it's in the "cool" part that has all the boutiquey stores you've never heard of and away from the big names like paul frank and fred segal.they had a great selection of cali-inspired brunch fare.  not serving dinner yet until they get their liquor license :(  but everything was fresh and well prepared.  bonus points for their czech owners who serve goulash (i'll try that next time).parking on melrose is a bitch, so try one of the residential side streets that offer free parking for 2hrs 8am-6pm.

Reviews.Author: Daniel T.
Reviews.Content: I know this review is long so here is is how I break it down: First is my brunch review, then my dinner review, and then the overall service.Since my girlfriend and I moved down the street from Blu Jam last year, we have become regulars. Yes, the wait on weekends averages about an hour, but you're on Melrose so go shopping while you wait (lucky for me, I can walk home and hang out for an hour). I have had maybe five or six things on the brunch menu. I suggest starting with a shrimp ceviche, which I know might not sound appealing for breakfast, but it is one of the most refreshing, flavorful dishes I've ever had. The Eggwich is unreal, with soft, fresh ciabatta bread, pesto aioli, greens and delicous eggs and bacon. You cannot oversell their eggs bene since it is redonk (props to HIMYM fans). Get either dishes with potatoes, which are deliciously crispy and cooked with rosemary. Their crunchy french toast (and make sure to get the crunchy french toast rather than the regular) also lives up to the hype.After coming and being blown away a few times for brunch, we finally tried it for dinner and were once again blown away. Alex, our waiter, now knows us as regulars and greets us asking, "The usual?" which is a downtown brown to start. He is full of great recommendations and is, without exaggeration, the best waiter that has ever served me. The dishes are meant to be shared, which I love because it allows me to try a few different items. Once again, the shrimp ceviche is amazing. I also love the chicken tingas, the brussel sprouts, and last time we went there was a salmon special with a black bean risotto that Kamil (the awesome and friendly head chef and owner) said was going to be added to the menu soon. His soups, whether it is cream of spinach or shrimp and lobster bisque, are some of the most flavorful creations and I savor every single bite. The nice thing (for customers) is that the dinner here hasn't caught fire yet, since they haven't been doing it long, there is never a wait--but I expect that to change soon. They are also doing a five course meal the first Tuesday every month that has wine pairing to each dish, which I NEED to try. The only downside is that they are only open for dinner from Wednesday to Saturday. We would have gone there for dinner for my girlfriend's birthday last night, but it was closed.Finally, the service. For brunch, yes, service suffers since they are so crowded, but they still get the job done. For dinner, as I already mentioned Alex is a great waiter and genuinely seems like a cool guy. On our first time here for dinner, Kamil came and gave us a friendly greeting as well as shrimp ceviche on the house. He is always genuinely kind and takes time to come say hi. He also seems like he's had an amazing life. I read he used to be a butler for the Reagan family when Ronald was governor of California. My girlfriend took me here for my birthday and he specially, and on the spot, made me a tiramisu that's not on the menu. I had not had a tiramisu that delicious since I was in Italy, and it still topped most that I had there.In short, they have secured our loyalty for a long time.

Reviews.Author: Josh P.
Reviews.Content: David was super friendly and kind enough to help me with my groggy headed menu indecisiveness, pointing me toward "Kamil's Breakfast" a delicious combination of macaroni and cheese, eggs, ham, garlic chives and cheddar.   Everything,  and I mean everything was good,  every detail...every flavor.  The potatoes had just the right crispness,  the bacon was cooked perfectly.  David brought a French press to the table, and the coffee from it was so good my non-coffee drinking wife who had just gotten off night shift and needed to go to sleep kept drinking it.  Go to this place,  and go often. If I see you, promise not to bother you with bad syntax mediocre word play  :-)

Reviews.Author: Jay T.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic brunch!

Reviews.Author: Hannah L.
Reviews.Content: i got the blu jam benedict. very nice presentation but it wasn't the best. the hollondaise had a nasty consistency and the potatoes were just average.wish the mimosas were cheaper! $9 each means i can't get drunk at brunch. :'(

Reviews.Author: Rebecca L.
Reviews.Content: Tried out Blu Jam for the first time last weekend. Had a friend in from out of town and wanted to try something new. Was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food and the friendliness of the servers. Good menu with lots of variety - some standards and several unique items.  Had the Toscana Scramble and it was quite delicious. Nice indoor seating and patio. And the hot chocolate was yummy. And didn't need reservations for weekend brunch. It was busy but not overcrowded. We needed to wait a couple of minutes, and then were seated and greeted quickly. Definitely a place I would go to again.

Reviews.Author: Pathu S.
Reviews.Content: After eating at various overpriced breakfast eateries, I became wary of good breakfast joints in LA. Blu Jam definitely changed my mind. Although it is overpriced, I think the flavors and quality of food is worth every penny. There's always a wait on the weekends but I've never waited for more than 15-20 minutes. My favorite is their Salmon Hash with ample salmon, capers, veggies and poached egg. It is a bit pricey at $14 but for worth it for the amount of salmon and large portion (not crazy Griddle Cafe size but enough to share or take half home). I also love their Vanilla French Toast served with vanilla yogurt and fresh fruits. I came here once when they ran out of this french toast but the waitress recommended the lemon crepe with fresh fruits. I'm glad that they didn't have the french toast that day because I would never had tried this interesting and delicious dish. The lemon juice complemented the fresh fruits so well. My only complaint is that it got soggy by the end of the meal but it is definitely worth a try.Their lattes are also delicious. Restaurants, even breakfast eateries, rarely get the soy latte right. The soy was never burnt and the portion of the latte justified the price. I've also tried their teas (white peach, plum oolong, chocolate monkey) and felt it was just a tad too pricey.I wish that they served breakfast during dinner hours as well. They should know that people crave breakfast foods during dinner time also!

Reviews.Author: Stephanie A.
Reviews.Content: So i usually don't do more than one review for a place but i am very upset with the service i received yesterday, as well as my food. Since i first discovered this place in April, I've fallen head over heels with this place. And i've been here about 6 or 7 times since then and have brought people with me a couple of times. I'm a student at CSUN so i am always in the valley. I live here now. But i decided to visit my parents in LA this afternoon while i ran some errands. About 3:35pm i realized i was in the area, so i decided to call for take out for the signature crunchy french toast. They told me it would be ready in 10 minutes (red flag number one). I know they close at 4pm so I got there 10 minutes to close and no one acknowledged me so i walked up to the cashier. She had very low energy. Paid for my stuff and even left a few dollars tip! I guess i shouldn't have done that because when i got to my bf's house to eat it, the bottom was kind of burnt though it was still edible. And the fruit on top looked like it was also a rush job. There were no bananas. The strawberries were chopped super tiny. I don't really care for the fruit too much but it just goes to show it was a rush job. The presentation was horrible. I was buying it for my best friend to try and i was disappointed. I've been hyping this place up for the last 6 month and even planned to bring my girls here for a nice brunch but i don't want to do that if i'm not certain they will enjoy their experience or if i'm not sure the dish is CONSISTENTLY made the way i'm used to. I'm just very disappointed. And i can't even believe i'm saying this, but the vanilla bean sauce was nasty!

Reviews.Author: david s.
Reviews.Content: i love you blue jam cafe!  every single dish in this restaurant i fell in love with almsot all of them! very very good service and a fun friendly atmosphere!!probably the only place i go for my brunch here in LA.MMmhMm can't wait to go back

Reviews.Author: Bean K.
Reviews.Content: I've only been here a couple times for brunch because I can't bear to wait so long for a table again. However, every time I've eaten here the food was delightful. My most memorable order was the breakfast burger. It's huge but so delicious you can't not finish it. I've also had their bacon, pancakes and hangover scramble. All good! If you go during brunch hour you'll have to wait, but it'll probably be worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Jessica K.
Reviews.Content: Sometimes I feel like the only thing I eat is brunch, but I guess that's not necessarily a bad thing.  I must say, people might not see LA as a "foodie" city, but it's pretty brunch-tastic and Blue Jam is yet another great brunch spot in LA.  Personally I love the scrambles, they have a lot of different options, many of which have interesting combination you might never think of on your own.  They have a delicious looking selection of sweet stuff too, like pancakes, french toast and crepes, but I don't think I've ever tried them because I just can't seem to pull myself away from those scrambles.  I guess I'm just not as sweet as I look.

Reviews.Author: Cameron C.
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the hype. The food doesn't justify the wait. Very long lines always. Solid ambiance inside and out. The food is lackluster, except the crispy French toast dish which I found to be great. Breakfast burrito was tasteless. All and all I found this place to be no better than any other breakfast establishment though the wait is 2-3 times as long.

Reviews.Author: Neil M.
Reviews.Content: an unstoppable force of delicious stuff.  I've never had a dish i didn't love.  Please don't go early, that's when i go, and i like getting a table right away.

Reviews.Author: Azzi K.
Reviews.Content: located in the heart of the infamous melrose this place totally lives up to its awards. .their breakfast is outstanding!!!! i wanted to try everything on the menu because it sounded so delicous. We ordered a turkey sand. and eggs benedict with spinach and mushrooms now i HATE mushrooms but i ate every piece of this dish!SOOOOOOOOOOOOO GOOOD GO NOW

Reviews.Author: Michelle L.
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I was really disappointed by Blu Jam, especially after reading such rave reviews.The hostess at the door definitely did not appear friendly, nor were we greeted in a friendly manner.  Good thing we didn't have to wait TOO long (15-20 min), but then it was 1 pm after all.I ordered the Power House, which was one of the most disappointing dishes I've seen in front of me in a long time.  On the menu, it is described as "Four egg whites scrambled with spinach, topped with flamebroiled chicken breast and sautéed tomatoes and basil."  I'm not sure if they're using quail eggs here or what, but I'm used to making egg-white omelettes at home with only 3 egg whites (from normal-sized eggs, mind you) and those always turn out to be pretty sizable portions (as in 20 times more egg than what I saw on my plate at Blu Jam).  What I was served at Blu Jam was more along the lines of sauteed spinach sprinkled with some egg whites.  I honestly don't believe if I had picked out all the egg-white from my plate, that it would have amounted to even one-egg's worth.  How pathetic, right?  At least the two pieces of grilled chicken lying on top of the spinach (+ egg whites?) was decently-sized...except everything was basically sitting/soaking in the tomato basil broth.  Not too appetizing if I do say so myself.  Sorry I didn't have my camera on me that day because this was definitely a photo-op.My boy ordered the Morning Hash and also claimed it wasn't up to par =/.  I stole a bite, and yes, I agree it wasn't very tasty, and then it was STILL better than my Power House.  How sad.The organic non-fat latte (nice and hot too!) I ordered was the only factor keeping this place from slipping down to 1 star.  Oh and I suppose the prices were sort of reasonable given the location.If you want to have delicious, well-portioned, no-nonsense breakfast/brunch, I recommend you check out the Griddle Cafe (yelp.com/biz/griddle-caf…).  It's SO MUCH BETTER.  You won't regret it.

Reviews.Author: Brittany K.
Reviews.Content: Love their breakfast.  Just love it.  Their food is delicious, and the menu options include everything you could ever want for breakfast.  They do this one dish with macaroni, bacon, eggs and cheese, which sounds weird but is really good.  I also like their burrito.  This, so far, is my favorite breakfast spot in LA.  It gets 4 stars because sometimes it takes a long time to get your food, but I still love it.  Also, the line never seems too long on weekend mornings.  The breakfast here is just my style.  If only they could open another spot in Silverlake.

Reviews.Author: Karen C.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam is a great breakfast and lunch spot to drop by before a full day of shopping in Melrose.  I like it here much better than horribly overrated Toast.  I also love their cute latte art!  It makes a cup of coffee/tea much more enjoyable.  Their chai latte was the best I've ever had, it had just the right amount of spiciness, foaminess, and creaminess, yummy yum yum.  I tried their blu jam benedict and it was heart attack-inducing deelish.  The idea of replacing the english muffin in a classic benedict w/ a butter croissant is genius.  I would definitely come back despite the pain the a$$ parking in Melrose and yay for their new weekday breakfast specials!

Reviews.Author: Elysse P.
Reviews.Content: Starting your day off with brunch in LA in the summertime is amazing. I love Blu Jam Cafe and its warm, welcoming ambiance and comforting brunch food. My friend and I ordered the Blu Jam Benedict and Crunchy French Toast to share and it was the perfect combination of savory & sweet. Highly recommended for first-timers!!! Don't forget to order a latte... perfecttttttion. Love you Blu Jam, I'll most definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Katie N.
Reviews.Content: Best breakfast during our trip to la.  Our favorites were chicken apple sausage and of course the French toast. It was impossible to eat anything less than what was served to us, and the portions were extremely generous.

Reviews.Author: Nic W.
Reviews.Content: I live in the neighborhood and have been eating here for almost two years now.  It's always good.  Don't think I've ever had anything bad.  Kamil, the owner is a good guy and a great chef.  You can tell he cares because he's always there but more importantly, you can tell he cares in his cooking.  I've talked to him about dishes and it's obvious that he loves to cook and he loves to put dishes on the menu that he wants to cook.  I've eaten many items on the regular menu, but it's been a long time since I have.  Now, I look to the specials.  Kamil gets new ingredients or an idea for a different combination and runs it for a week or two.  They're great.  Some of the items are a little costly due to the ingredients (you get something with salmon for instance).  But, if you get a $9.99 breakfast item off the brunch special menu or the other specials menu, it's going to be awesome.  It just is.  I had the Huevos Tapitio last Saturday and it was so great.  My roommate had the Hangover Scramble and it was terrific.  Lunch items are great.  And he's known for his soups.I haven't been to the Bistro Nights yet, but they're every Friday night.  Each Friday is a different theme (recently had South American night from recipes he culled in travels through Bolivia and Peru - this weekend is French Bistro night).  I walked by one night around 10 or 11 and there were tables of people sitting chatting having clearly finished their meal long ago.  Bottles of wine littered the table.  (there's no corking fee).  To me, that's a great experience.  Kinda the euro thing.  Again, I haven't done it, but I'm excited to soon.  That's the only night they're open for dinner.Honestly, looking over what I've written, it sounds very homer of me, but I don't have any affiliation with the restaurant.  I just like to see it succeed.  For the prices and what not, it's that nice spot between high-end and diner.  Which seems tough to maintain a lot of times.  But, the food will win I believe.

Reviews.Author: EC F.
Reviews.Content: love love love.  my friend recommended this place to me.  the barista drew a little punk rock girl in the foam of her latte.  super cute.aside from that, they serve breakfast all day and the breakfast was amazing.  the portions were large, the atmosphere of the place was very nice with high ceilings or optional outdoor dining area (nice to people watch).  unlike griddle cafe which lives on super large size but nothing amazing, blue jam's food is really really good.  their scrambles are soo yummy and i wanted to try every single one.  i would also highly recommend getting their french toast with the berries, it's not overly sweet and really crisp on the edges.the prices are more than fair, if you dont get a latte its probably about $10 a person.the only down side is the long long long wait.  i think we waited over an hour on a sunday afternoon around 11am.  i dont know if its worth waiting over an hour for but maybe 20 minutes. har har.-E

Reviews.Author: Kaz K.
Reviews.Content: Come here for dinner!! It's amazing, one of the best I've had. Everyone normally only thinks of this place for breakfast and brunch, but everyone needs to come here for dinner.I came here on a Saturday night, when dinner started at 6PM and it wasn't crowded... it probably should be. They have dinner from Wednesday until Sunday. The atmosphere was pretty different from brunch, even though it's the same room.Our server was great - she recommended great things, explained everything to us, and was so friendly.The dinner menu consists of a bunch of tapas like plates, but everything (at least what we got) was so bomb!!! They're either cold or hot, and cold comes first...Tuna tartar... they gave each one of us a sample of this. Delicious and refreshing!Ceviche Marinated Shrimp... a cold dish, so good. It's like a delicious refined taco with chipotle sauce.Seared Ahi Tuna with fake paella... this was my favorite dish. One of my favorite dishes ever!! The ahi tuna was great in itself, and the fake paella (which is risotto instead of rice, or something like that) had such a great intense flavor!!!! If you get anything, get this one!!Baby back ribs... the meat literally fell off the bones. All you had to do was touch it and it fell off. So delicious! The mashed potatoes were good too, they were even better with the leftover sauce from the ahi tuna, hehe...Argentinean steak... this was so tender, and had this tangy chimichurri sauce on it. And the potatoes were so crispy on the outside, but so tender on the inside. It was like the chef took the skin off first, and then fried them, and put them back on a cooked potato... they should just serve potato skin.For dessert, our server recommended the brioche bites. These were kind of like sweet waffles or a thick french toast with ice cream and fruit. We actually weren't planning on getting dessert here but since dinner was so delicious, we decided on getting some. This was also delicious.Anyways, service is great, the price isn't too bad (worth it actually for the deliciousness), atmosphere is really bistro-like, and food is one of the best I've had. COME HERE FOR DINNER!!! And breakfast, I guess lol... Definitely coming back here.

Reviews.Author: Vicky N.
Reviews.Content: I felt like I had high expectations for this place. I did. Ordered the Vanilla French Toast and tried the Kamil's breakfast. I think I could have made both of it at home, but better. Also had the Vanilla Latte. Nothing really stood out to me. *Sadface

Reviews.Author: Angelica C.
Reviews.Content: I found this little place before I left for home in San Diego.  I am EXTREMELY disappointed that this restaurant is NOT in San Diego.  This place is absolutely amazing.  I began with a vanilla latte hot.  It' was the best latte I had have had in my life.  I then ordered the Eggs Florentine, which consisted on two poached eggs, sun dried tomatoes, brie...yes brie, and elegantly dressed with hollandaise sauce, all on top of a English muffin. This amazing mix of flavours danced together so wonderfully.  As a side I had potatoes which were mixed with rosemary.  Everything was delicious.  Beyond expectations.  The waitress was a doll and the atmosphere was comfortable.  The service was on point.  Not one single complaint about this restaurant. During my stay in L.A. I was very disappointed with what the city had to offer, Blu Jam made my stay 100% better.

Reviews.Author: Jim C.
Reviews.Content: I've never even been inside Blu Jam! All meals on the street. Why eat indoors when the people watching on Melrose is so good. The special french toast (eaten on my first visit) deserves all the plaudits. Outstanding. The Florentine Benedict was perfection. The accompanying potatoes were terrific. My vegan friend was exceedingly pleased with the spicy tex mex tofu hash. Expecting it to be something thrown together to please vegans, it was so much more. A real, composed dish. Staff and service are excellent.

Reviews.Author: Gary I.
Reviews.Content: The food was delicious. I got the french toast brioche with yogurt and it was too die for. I like this dish because it's not incredibly sweet and that's the way french toast is supposed to be like. The blueberry jam on it was great. Reminded of Ina Garten's Stonewall blueberry jam. The Blu Jam benedict was also delicious. It wasn't drenched in hollaindaise sauce which is a plus. The eggs was poached to perfection. It wasn't runny and it wasn't solid either. It was the perfect consistency. Our server was also way cute. His name is Derek. Sorry, I just had to throw that out there. He had such nice eyes and this might sound weird but his eye lashes were well groomed. I was going to give it 4 stars but our server was great so I am going to give it a full 5 stars. It was a great experience. Beware of long lines!!

Reviews.Author: Minah L.
Reviews.Content: late review!brunch on the weekends is kinda busy. but we still got seats for 6 people party within ... 20 minutes. parking was also not that bad.the food was pretty good and satisfying. i ordered the FLORENTINE BENEDICT with the fruit bowl. i love love love benedicts so can't complain. EXCEPT!!the sun-dried tomatoes were too strong. i couldn't eat it with 100% satisfaction because it was too overwhelming my meal. i had to take them out.. and honestly.. i with the portion was a little bigger.. teehehe. the fruit bowl had variety. i liked it. :))i also ordered the apple juice but way expensive.. $4.. seriously?but it was freshly squeezed. yummmm.i would describe what my friends ordered but its not worth my time because everything was pretty delicious. i love breakfast food!!

Reviews.Author: Veronica C.
Reviews.Content: Blu jam is a great spot for my post workout hunger since it was on my walk back to my destination. Digg the morning hash and jazz tunes serenading my meal.  I'll be back here for the french toast .

Reviews.Author: Suzanna K.
Reviews.Content: ok ok ok... i love brunch and this place is the BESTTTTTTTTTTTTTTT. Walked up there and there were lots of ppl waiting.. which is a good and bad thing. Good that a lot of people like to eat there but bad that there will be a wait. Went on a Sunday around 1230pm. Waited about 30 minutes to sit down.We were looking at the menu while waiting so the we immediately ordered once we sat down. We both got fresh squeezed apple juice and it came in a decent sized cup. Not too shabby but Not the Best either.  I ordered the GOURMET BENEDICT.. omgah...... it had salmon on a normal benedict and it was DELICIOUS. I would strictly come back here for this. Best Eggs Benedict that I've ever had. (even beats Griddle's benedict). The salmon added the best flavor to the meal. I got a side of potatoes which topped it all off.A great menu too. I would def come here again to try out the menu. Service kinda stank, needs more service. But got little mini cookies for dessert for free. eh...

Reviews.Author: Gregory L.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam Cafe's french toast is better than Dupars. Very like the best breakfast spot in Los Angeles. Outstanding coffee, eggs, toast and of course french toast. The potatoes were small cubed red potatoes and aren't that exciting. But everything else is really good. There is outdoor seating. Service is very friendly.

Reviews.Author: Puna K.
Reviews.Content: Why cant there be more solid breakfast spots like this? One of my favorite breakfast spots while in LA. Fresh ingredients, good sized portions, great prices, fast service and lively atmosphere. My favorite is their eggwich, this breakfast sandwich is king! Eggs over easy, strips of crispy smoked bacon, slices of avocado and tomatoes, lettuce, pesto and mayo on a toasted ciabatta. SO good. Brioche french toast and pancakes are yummy when you want something sweet and any one of their benedicts are a sure bet.

Reviews.Author: Thuy P.
Reviews.Content: Went here yesterday with some friends, group of 7 adults and 2 kids. This place was quite popular and had people waiting out the door for a seat.  I had a non fat mocha latte.  Quite good and love the little design they did in the foam.  Ordered the hangover scramble while all the others ordered the Florentine eggs Benedict and Norweign eggs Benedicts.  The portions were huge!  The food itself was ok, nothing spectacular.  I thinks its all about the atmosphere, great place to chill.  The service was ok.  The waitress messed up our order, we had to ask for utensils a couple of times before we got any.  They didn't come around and refill our water glasses.  We had three people that wanted to pay with their credit cards, but they didn't want to do multiple credit card transactions.

Reviews.Author: Rhi G.
Reviews.Content: Up-front real talk: As everyone else has said, expect a looooooong wait for brunch on the weekend. Who cares, it's worth. it. Crispy french toast? Hell yeah. Side of roasted potatoes? Heeeeeeeeeeeeeeell yeah. Just plan ahead for parking and wait times (are you really that surprised though? It is LA people!) and you will be prepared to enjoy some of the best brunchery Los Angeles has to offer.

Reviews.Author: Annie S.
Reviews.Content: We waited over a hour to eat here and I sat next to Gerard Butler!! Was the food worth it? It was pretty good, but kind of unmemorable. This is more a place to go to catch celebs. Still, a trendy place to see and to be seen. When I came with my group of friends, it was actually the second time we had attempted to eat there. First time, the line was equally long so we ended up eating at the pub down the block. Second time, we decided to wait. Apparently the french toast is famous. I also ordered a latte based on the Yelp pix but was slightly disappointed when it came out lukewarm and without a cool design (just plain milk froth on top). Still, I would come back and give it another chance!

Reviews.Author: Espree D.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely incredible breakfast. Been here twice. Parking is super easy on side streets. Have had the brunch burger, french toast, eggs benedict. Its a distance from the westide, but well worth it.

Reviews.Author: Mary B.
Reviews.Content: I love Blu Jam! I first tried their food after reading about it in the L.A. Times.  Everything I have ever gotten here has been amazing.  The first time I was here I tried the turkey panini on focacia bread.  Amazing! On my most-recent visit, I had breakfast.  The pancakes were huge and super fluffy.  A lot of food, for not a lot of money.  My coworkers and I have added Blu Jam Cafe to our regular lunch rotation.

Reviews.Author: Traci M.
Reviews.Content: I've eaten here many times and never had a bad experience.  Service & food are simply good and professional as you would like every place you eat to be.  Blu Jam if you read this - PLEASE BRING BACK THE TOFU SCRAMBLE!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Author: bobby c.
Reviews.Content: I'm a regular Blu Jam customer (not as regular as Tom, which is probably the only reason I don't have a nametag above MY table) so the 5 star review is to be expected. Best food, friendliest staff, and coolest owner in town. Period. This review is for dinner, which I finally got to experience. UN-BE-LIEVABLE. Hats off to Kamil- the man continues to amaze. My only complaint about Blu Jam nowadays is that Kamil has such an awesome establishment with so many regulars, I may never get my nametag.

Reviews.Author: Thy L.
Reviews.Content: I've been here two and it hasn't disappointed once. Things my friends and I have tried include the Crispy French Toast (delicious!), Norwegian Benedict (solid!), Steak & Eggs (yummy!). Everything delivers here. The wait however is always long. Try to get here early. Remember to be around when they call your name, or else they will cross you off. Ample street parking everywhere.

Reviews.Author: Renuka V.
Reviews.Content: 2 of us went there for my bday brunch and altho it was a Tues 11am (election day), place was almost full. We had a great table which was at the inside corner and perpendicular to the other tables so we could see everyone+everything! Started with a cuppa espresso which was good. Had the czech gholash which was tasty but disappointingly, had very little actual meat in it. Also had the wild mushroom salad w warm melted goat cheese  which was good. Had the orange+carrot+ginger juice which was yummy since it was ginger forward! For dessert, had a slice of tres leche cake which came with a lit candle stuck on it and after the ENTIRE cafe sang happy bday to me, I blew it out + had my delishh cake! The extra star is for the decor-exposed roof w skylight which gave the place the extra spaciousness. Recommended.

Reviews.Author: Sherry P.
Reviews.Content: Best brunch restaurant hands down! Not only is the food delicious, they close later than most places at 5pm. I had their Norweigan Benedict(smoked salmon) and unlike other places, it's not too salty nor too bland. I had to wait 2 hours to be seated on a Sunday but if coming on a weekday,there is no wait at all! Bummer that  they don't serve alcohol.

Reviews.Author: Janette M.
Reviews.Content: My family and I found Blue Jam Cafe while walking around on Melrose... it wasn't crowded at all, maybe since it was before 4 p.m. so we were able to walk right in and be seated right away which was a big plus. First off, I love places that serve breakfast all day so I was happy with all the menu choices.  I had a hard time deciding between the Breakfast Quesadilla (chickenbreast, scrambled eggs, tomatoes, spinach, cheddar and mozzarella in grilled tortilla, with avocado), Blue Jam Benedict (poached eggs,croissant with ham, bacon, hollandaise, chives), and the Florentine Twist because they all sounded so good... I ended up going with the Florentine Twist:  poached eggs on a ciabatta with sauted spinach, mushrooms, brie cheese and chive-hollandaise, served with red potatoes.  My teen daughter had the burger with provolone and my husband had the Uptown sandwich (Oven roasted turkey breast, cucumber,  tomato, mayo, Dijon mustard, avocado and provolone cheese).   I was very pleased with my delicious brunchdinner :)  Everything tasted very fresh and healthy-- the hollandaise was not heavy at all and complimented the poached eggs perfectly.  My daughter really liked her burger, too, and my husband's sandwich looked good... If we lived in the area I think we would go to Blue Jam Cafe regularly, because pricewise it's very reasonable, the atmosphere is cool and kick-back, and the service is great.After reading some of the yelp reviews, I wish I had ordered coffee instead of getting a diet soda, but oh well...  I also would have liked to have sat out on the patio but it was chilly that day.  We had a good table, though, near the windows so we could still people-watch.

Reviews.Author: Crystalle M.
Reviews.Content: My favorite breakfast/brunch spot in LA!!! Love love love the florentine benedict and the crunchy french toast. The owner and staff are all super friendly and welcoming; there's always a fun casual vibe here. Make sure you have time to wait for a table...I've waited up to 45min to be seated. Oh, but it's definitely worth it! You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Author: Karen N.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam Cafe is known for their Kamil Breakfast, eggs benedict and french toast.  My girlfriends and I were feeling something savory so each of us got eggs benedict and I'm not an eggs benedict person but because this item is so popular, I gave it a try.  And boy, I was not disappointed.  The florentine eggs benedict was delicious.  My favorite elements were the spinach and croissant.  (I'm so over egg muffins for eggs benedict.)  The hollandaise sauce wasn't too bad.  According to my friends, big hollandaise fans, it was a win.  The iced soy latte wasn't too bad, either.  It was refreshing and a bit frothy thus making it filling.  If I lived in LA, I'd definitely make this a regular brunch spot.

Reviews.Author: Kathy S.
Reviews.Content: Really good Eggs Benedict...The outside patio is a little too crowded for my liking..but if you get there early enough..not a problem. I could go on and on about the Benedict...but will let you decide. Really good!

Reviews.Author: Erin O.
Reviews.Content: I've lived in LA for 10 years and this is hands down the best brunch in the city.  Friendly staff, nice ambience and everything on the menu is delicious.  My favorites are the Kamil's Breakfast (umm, macaroni & cheese + eggs), the Blu Jam Benedict and the Crunch French Toast.  My only complaint is that they removed the lemon crepes from the menu, which were the best!!!

Reviews.Author: Ronjini M.
Reviews.Content: I came here to meet a friend. The place is quaint, not soo small that you'd think its crowded. Once we got the menu, I was kind of surprised at how large their selection was. It was pretty big. We also got some of the sangria...delicious. We came here for a weekday dinner and it wasn't too crowded. Looks like it would be great for a business meal or a first date, where its not too loud.

Reviews.Author: karen n.
Reviews.Content: had the am burrito today and the veggiewich (shared with a friend). veggiewich was a little too rich for me (i should have said no mayo) but the breakfast burrito was yummy. i went here once before for breakfast and i think my boyfriend got some pancakes and i got the french toast. i usually expect french toast to be spectacular and i think blu jam's was so-so. i still like this place though and i think there are some gems on their menu (still to be discovered soon, i hope).bottom line: decent prices, good food, nice servers, cozy atmosphere

Reviews.Author: Lina L.
Reviews.Content: the menu is too large- this is one of those promising brunch places where everything sounds good, but the list is so extensive you can never read through it all and have to risk food envy when a delicious place is paraded by that you didn't even realize was ON the menu... nevertheless, I was quite content with my Saturday morning brunch here. myself and two others were seated very quickly- the interior space by the window is quite spacious and gives you room to spread out. the water was normal, so I don't get the fuss (minty? chlorine-y? come again?), the tea selection not bad, and the service quick. as hinted above, I myself gave up on the menu and ordered the last thing read that sounded good. my toscana scramble (turkey sausage, fresh farm eggs, baby tomatoes, homemade pesto) was not bad. be sure to ask for the potatoes 'extra toasted/crispy' or you'll get the mushy stuff. i also recommend they supplement their jam selection, smuckers strawberry is pretty generic. all in all, a pleasant brunch experience. i'd definitely come again for the ambiance, and try something else in that loooong menu.

Reviews.Author: michael w.
Reviews.Content: pulled up to the curb, rockstar parking. bingo.two-top open right next to the car. bingo.not too many melrose douchebags around...puhhh...the one right behind me gets up as we sit down, bumping into the back of my chair...i hear him tell the girl he's with: "i'm a popular guy, people like me" (in a persian accent) and they walk into the sunset, uhh, his convertable beamer...at least he opened her door first...food: minutes too late for the $7.95 breakfast deals before 11am, but who cares?what did matter was that they were out of the crabcakes for my benedict, no crab today...but who cares? there is a real black forest ham, WITH BACON, benedict. forkin right!!!poached egg on toasted croissant.that is the best ham in LA.delicious.the potatoes were weird though: 1/8 " thick slices, cut down further into segments, ok, but they came out soggy and burned.(??)(here's my recommendation: parboil the spuds, then golden-brown 'em to a slight crunch in butter/olive oil blend.)(just sayin...)i still like the place. a lot. the owner kamil kicks ass

Reviews.Author: Linda T.
Reviews.Content: Happened upon this place while walking around Melrose on a Sunday afternoon. First thought was: they must be understaffed. Wait for a table was nothing; the host was super attentive from the moment we stopped walking on the street to check out the menu. But we had to flag someone down to order, and water didn't even come until after we ordered. There wasn't even that many customers! On the plus side, service was courteous.They have a wide variety of foods: regular entree foods like steak and spaghetti, to sandwiches/wraps + soups, salads, and even breakfast foods all day long. I got a wrap & soup combo. The wrap was exactly that, no garnishes. It tasted pretty good, or maybe I was too hungry at 4pm having skipped breakfast and lunch. The wild mushroom and herb soup looked like nothing but tasted like heaven. I could have had 5 bowls of that and called it good. My friend got the omelette which came with a side (she got mixed fruit) and 2 slices of toast. It looked really hearty and pretty good. Lastly we got triple chocolate cake which was set up really nicely and tasted sinfully rich. I couldn't stop eating that.I would go back to this place if I happened to be in the area. I'd like to try their omelette and/or a salad (and probably a french toast based on the reviews here). Or to check out the "bistro at night" scene. But I wouldn't go out of my way since I don't live exactly near it. I like the atmosphere of the place, but to be honest, it's pretty cliche and not much to tell a friend about. I wish I could give it 3.5 stars.

Reviews.Author: Kaveh T.
Reviews.Content: I had breakfast here and it was amazing. Try the Blu French Toast or the Eggwich. They will seriously blow your mind!

Reviews.Author: Elle C.
Reviews.Content: yum...no, YUM!  This place is soooo good.  It's one of those places you go for a slam-dunk breakfast each and every time.  I got the Blu Jam Benedict with a side of fresh fruit.  I was so impressed with the eggs.  They were poached to perfection, quite unlike the disaster I had a few weeks ago at Jan's Restaurant (don't go there!)  The black forest ham and bacon were flavorful and delicious.  Put that all on top of a toasted croissant with hollandaise sauce and I was in heaven.  I also tried the stuffed french toast with peaches and bananas, pancakes with strawberries and dark chocolate sauce, and the banana crepes.  Excellent!  It was like having dessert with my breakfast.  This place is by far one of the best breakfast joints around.

Reviews.Author: Eliz C.
Reviews.Content: This is still my favorite casual breakfast place even though I saw something there unneededly nasty today! The bus boy empties ashtrays into the water glasses ! WHY!!?? I couldn't believe it!!!!!!! I know glasses get washed but stilllllll... I was dissapointed to see a soggy mound of cigarette butts and garbage in the glasses people drink out off.

Reviews.Author: Donald R.
Reviews.Content: Food is aight, came in on a friday morning, the waiter was hating because I said there's something in my water, and she's like that's mint leaf, and walked away... I'd rather go to Griddle cafe after that line...

Reviews.Author: Robert G.
Reviews.Content: Had the chicken schnitzel...it was great.  It felt like I was back in Europe.Great place, great food....expect a line and a wait.

Reviews.Author: Lillian M.
Reviews.Content: I had lunch today with my daughter for her birthday.  I had the best beet and arugula salad I've had in a while.  It had red and golden beets, black currants and just a dab of goat cheese with a delicate vinegarette dressing.  I love a good salad and this one gets high points in my salad book.  My daughter ordered  crunchy french toast (which I had the pleasure of sharing and was also delicious, slightly sweet and coated some type of crunchy cereal).  We had a short amount of time due to traffic, but the service was quick.  It has a casual atmosphere.  I will definitely go back.  There were several other items I'd love to try from their menu.

Reviews.Author: Annie P.
Reviews.Content: The eggs florentine had a bit too much Benedict sauce, but other than that the crispy French toast was the best, and the fresh fruit was delicious. We were so full afterwards!

Reviews.Author: T K.
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite breakfast places in LA.  Quality coffee, great food, and always perfect service. I'm a big fan of the eggs benedict, and I always opt for the fruit bowl. It's got to be the BEST fruit selection in the area -- figs, mango, raspberries, perfectly ripe, and sweet. YUMMMMY!

Reviews.Author: anna j.
Reviews.Content: Nothing is more satisfying than to be able to check a restaurant off your bookmark list. Blu Jam had been on my list for over a year now and I FINALLY got around to trying it today. I ordered the Le Paris omelette with egg whites.  It wasn't anything SPECTACULAR but I'm not one to be wowed by an omelette.  The only thing I take with issue with is the lack of goat cheese.  I'm sure for others the amount of goat cheese is just right, but i'm a HUGE goat cheese fan so it would've been nice to see a little more on my dish :)  My friends ordered the crunchy french toast. YUMMMM i really enjoyed this dish. The crunchy corn flakes gives an extra oomph to the french toast.  Because the bread is egg brioche and not regular toast, it is buttery and SUPER soft. Aside from the taste, presentation was impeccable. Staff is super friendly. I can't wait to come back here!

Reviews.Author: Kim C.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE BRUNCH! My boyfriend had the Migas which is a Mexican style scrambled eggs and I had the Blu Jam Benedict. I substituted the bacon for spinach in an attempt to eat a bit healthier. My boyfriend commented: "Why would anyone do that?!" The portion sizes were big and filling. The only downside was that flies would periodically fly near our food so we had to swat them away (we were sitting indoors, too!). The wait was around 30 minutes on a Saturday morning so it was not too bad. Overall, the food was tasty and I can't wait to come back and try their crunchy french toast.

Reviews.Author: Ju Ling H.
Reviews.Content: Came in for brunch on Wednesday morning. There's people lining up in front of the store at 9 plus. Luckily we only have two so we got a table pretty fast. Ordered the Norwegian Benedict, blu jam Benedict and the pancake. Pancake is alright, Benedict is well cook and good :) hot chocolate is creamy . This is a place worth revisiting again, will order the French toast next time !

Reviews.Author: Valerie B.
Reviews.Content: 1st time here since we were visiting the area from SD. Yelped some good breakfast/brunch spots and this one came up. The wait was a bit long 45 min and even after we got seated and finished our meal, the wait continued for others. That's a good sign I guess!The place was small and quaint. Host was very nice and friendly. I got their special french toast brioche w/ corn flakes, vanilla bean sauce and fresh fruit. OMG... It was SO GOOD, very delish! Even my husband liked it! He got a special that had scrambled egg, macaroni and smoked bacon and ham. It was very tasty as well. We enjoyed our food and would definitely go back again!

Reviews.Author: Kyle E.
Reviews.Content: A gem of a eatery. One of the most comfortable and easy dining experience's i've had. Astounding is the only word to describe the food. If you can ask for Aaron as your server.

Reviews.Author: Shazie P.
Reviews.Content: This place has a chef renowned for his breakfast dishes. He does not fall short anywhere on the menu. He gives each dish his special touch. One time he came and took back a plate from our table before we touched it because he saw the cook miss a detail. The blueberry cream cheese french toast is worth the trek and the parking. I have never ordered something I didn't finish here. AMAZING!!! I actually crave it sometimes and have to make the drive...

Reviews.Author: Derrick A.
Reviews.Content: Good food with a wide selection.  The atmosphere was cozy & they give good portions.

Reviews.Author: alyson y.
Reviews.Content: I have been to Blu Jam about 10 times since moving to Los Angeles 2 years ago. Every time I go I find myself getting over excited. I get to blu jam very hungry and ready to grub... just to wait an hour and a half to sit! The worst part is the British hostess queen of the world who tells everyone it will be about 30 mins but people are always leaving so really it might just be 10 minutes! Lets be real here. The wait is NEVER 10 minutes. Maybe right as Blu Jam opens or mid week you will find little to no wait but the weekend lies must end. The food at Toast is just as wonderful with a lot less wait. I suggest traveling 5 minutes down the road for a better wait staff and the same quality food!

Reviews.Author: Bianca L.
Reviews.Content: Really nice modern cafe. Dishes have a good proportion and the service was nice. I got the French toast and it was delicious! The cornflakes and fruits with the vanilla sauce really added just the right amount of  crunch and sweetness to the French toast.  This got me beggin for more! However it ends here. The other meal I got was frittata which was no different from any other bland scramble you can make at home.  This place is bit too overpriced for breakfast that doesn't really specialize in much other than the French toast.

Reviews.Author: Thomas C.
Reviews.Content: Great omelette + eggs benedict, but AMAZING french toast. It has a corn flake crust which makes it crisp on the outside and soft/chewy on the inside.

Reviews.Author: Adam R.
Reviews.Content: Went here for breakfast because of the great recommendations of fellow Yelpers and It was the best breakfast ive had in LA... and probably the cheapest too. We had the muscle egg white omelet with Turkey was one of the best cooked and flavored omelets ive ever tasted, and came with a side of fat free cottage cheese (we were going to the gym afterwards).The breakfast special was $7.50!!! Unbelievably cheap.We also got the gun smoke green tea. Whoa! I LOve my strong green teas, but i have to say this was one of the strongest ive had, It was great. The server even filled it up with more hot water when we were finished and gave us to go cups with it when we left.  Great friendly service.

Reviews.Author: ralph d.
Reviews.Content: I was really not impressed.  I ate there because the reviews were so good here.  Here is what happened:9 AM..the place was not busy.  I got a cup of coffee.  The coffee was OK, a little weak but the cup had a very strong odor of maybe peach or vanilla hand cream.  I thought I would be nice and ignore the smell but it was "in" the coffee too.  I asked for a new cup and that cup was fine, but it was not delivered by the waitress, but the guy at the bar.  I ordered pancakes.  I asked for them to be thin, and not burned.  They eventually came but they were thick..but OK..they did come and they looked good.  I tasted one plain and they had a strange very sour aftertaste.  I don't know if part of the batter was bad or if that was the taste they just have.  It might have been a whole lot of extra baking powder taste but who knows.  I put two of them off to the side to take home since I could not eat three of them and then poured the "maple syrup" on the pancakes.  The syrup tasted like come crappy imitation maple high fructose corn syrup product, which is what it was, so what happened to the real maple syrup?
