 I asked the waitress and she said "we had a busy weekend and we ran out of maple syrup".  I find it curious why they would even have this crap in the place, if they serve real maple.  I returned the pancakes and ordered a bagel toasted with some of their blueberry jam, which she told me "people love".  15 minutes later she returned with a toasted bagel and 2 mini portions of Smucker's Blueberry jam, you guessed it, with genuine high fructose corn syrup.  So I don't really get this place.  Maybe their fried eggs and stuff are good but I wanted some real homemade pancakes, but they were bad plain, and even worse with imitation maple syrup.  I won't be back...sorry.Oh one final note.  The person I was with got a coffee refill and the server/busboy leaned over me to pour the coffee and his alcoholic breath about knocked me off my chair..this guy was either freshly loaded or left over from last night..but whatever, it was a bad strong smell.

Reviews.Author: Beth W.
Reviews.Content: The best!  Amazing brunch, super friendly owner (Kamil), good everything.The bread with olive tepenade is so good while you wait.  They just got a wine/beer license-try a mimosa or the tropic drink (made with champagne and juices).  No matter what you order, you can't go wrong!

Reviews.Author: Marshall S.
Reviews.Content: All in all, a very positive experience.  Went for Sunday brunch during the busiest time of the day and was told it would be a 40 minute wait, but turned out to be only 15 minutes.  I had heard great things about the crunchy french toast and gave it a shot.  It was amazing.  The only thing about it though, is that it put me in a serious food coma for the next few hours after we left.  It's worth trying, but be prepared to suffer the consequences. lol.

Reviews.Author: Rennie A.
Reviews.Content: Checked this place out while on vacation in LA. Wasn't disappointed. Friendly staff and nice decor. Food was really good with very generous portions. There's many choices as well. I chose to make my own omelette. The only problem for me is that I didn't like the way the omelette was made (where egg is wrapped around the filling). More of a style thing as some people prefer that. Nonetheless, I'm rating so I deduct a star. Check it out for yourself though.

Reviews.Author: Ari F.
Reviews.Content: I had heard about this place from Instagram and had to give it a try.... Longgggg wait, but worth it.  The host was super funny and cool, he wasn't rude about ppl keep asking him about when their turn was. Food was great... Got the poached egg nest and crunchy French toast. Both great. Food was 4 out of 5.  My egg was too hard, they brought me another that was perfect. Chai latte was 5 out of 5. Would come again, but in a weekday this time so the wait is not as long.

Reviews.Author: Iris T.
Reviews.Content: By far my favorite brunch place. its a place that i would recommend anyone to come.Every dish i had at Blujam was great. (crunchy or vanilla filled french toast, quesadilla, omelette, pancake, Benedict, salad, soup, bread, sandwich, burger...etc yes i came quite a few times)The price is reasonable for its quality and the service is great. every server i had was warm and welcoming. I came here several time on weekdays and never needed to wait for more than 10 mins for a table.

Reviews.Author: Joe S.
Reviews.Content: Such a great place. Right in hollywood in a good neighborhood. Food is amazing. Great Benedict and incredible french toast. great service

Reviews.Author: Janani S.
Reviews.Content: i LOVE this restaurant.  i love the vibe, i love the food, i love the wonderfully hospitable owner.  i dont mind that the wait is long because each and every dish is amazing.  i've now tried the steak hash, the florentine benedict, the migas, the crunchy french toast, the hangover scramble and the BURGER with gorgonzola! that burger is sooooo amazing. and i hate burgers! seriously, go here for brunch, at least once.  if you have a large party, ask about getting the back room, which is super cute and seats about 10ish.

Reviews.Author: Edgie T.
Reviews.Content: this is one  my favorite places for brunch in Los Angeles.  the food selection is great, the ambiance is very laid back and the service is phenomenal.i had the pleasure of dining here when i started morning runs at Runyon Canyon.  Blue Jam Cafe was my motivator to run up the steep hills so i can get my hearty brunch...my favorites:-Steak Hash-Crunchy French Toast-Blu Jam Benedict-Chai Tea Lattebreakfast is served everyday until 5pm, yes there could be long waits on weekends; but totally worth it.  parking is on the street - residential area.highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Author: Peter D.
Reviews.Content: Best brunch place I've been to so far. I'd recommend the Toscana Scramble: grilled chopped Italian turkey sausage, eggs, pesto sauce, mozzarella and tomatoes. Comes with potatoes (nice crust on the out and soft on the in) and choice of bread. Came during a weekday - no lines! Look for parking in small neighborhood streets.

Reviews.Author: Rae R.
Reviews.Content: Love the food...but didn't get the best service. First, the wait was about 45min - ok, that's cool, Sunday brunch hour -so makes some sense there. But then we sit down and order immediately (we knew what we wanted)-only to be served AFTER the table next to us who were seated AFTER us... But don't worry-we got served 12-15 mins after they did smdh. We didn't see our waitress not once since she got an attitude with us about the wait for our food being the "standard 20-25min" - oh, oook. The point is the table next to us got there after us but got served 12+ min before us. Sooo long story short, great food, the short waitress with lots of forearm tats-HORRIBLE. The other waitress with red hair and the manager were absolutely wonderful.

Reviews.Author: Anna M.
Reviews.Content: Consistently delicious and great service! Order the Ranchero and add chorizo, yum.

Reviews.Author: Glenn G.
Reviews.Content: Excellent food and coffee!

Reviews.Author: Darla M.
Reviews.Content: Went here for breakfast on a Sunday.  Nice location for people watching - especially if you get a spot outside.  I ordered the strawberry & peach crepes.  They were average - the crepe & strawberries were good, but the peaches tasted off (off-season, I should have known better).  I also had the iced chai - blended which was ok (tasted pretty much like the "Oregon Chai" boxed mix).  Service was friendly (waitress was in kitten heels btw) but they never refilled my water or asked if I wanted another drink.

Reviews.Author: Nick P.
Reviews.Content: Nice place. The service was super slow, and the egg sandwich was a bitch to eat, it all tasted great, and the food at tables around me looked great too.

Reviews.Author: Suzan L.
Reviews.Content: It's seriously just like any other old cafe. The only perk? it's in a great location where there's tons of tourists/LA hipsters/famous people. My experience there was partly my fault. My friend and i decided to sit in the sun cause there were no other seats at the time. The food wasn't all that great. Typical mixed greens with balsamic dressing and a mediocre panini. blahh

Reviews.Author: Dixi Z.
Reviews.Content: Great establishment. The service is always friendly and attentive. The food here is fantastic. The line seems long, but it passes relatively quickly. I rarely venture into restaurants on melrose even though I live there. The crowds and the hype doesn't do it. However, I love Blu Jam Café. Everything is delicious and you get a lot of food. I usually have enough food left over for another meal. I was there this past weekend with some friends and waiting roughly 15 minutes. Seated promptly once our name was called and served almost immediately. The waitress is very sweet and my water was refilled at least 3 times. Love it.

Reviews.Author: Jinna K.
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite breakfast spot! I love their blu jam benedict. It's so hard to find a really good egg benedict. The only reason that I don't eat here as often as I should is the wait is always around 45 minutes or so. The waffles and french toast is really good as well. The food is very savory and they use local farms.

Reviews.Author: Wonder W.
Reviews.Content: I really hate to do this since I had heard (and seen on Yelp) such great reviews for this place. But I just can't give Blu Jam anything better at this point.I didn't have a problem with the service (which actually makes it worse since if the food blows me away then I'll usually ignore any minor service issues), altho for early morning and only 2 other occupied tables my waitress was SLOW.But the thing that really makes this bad is the food. I ordered the Old World dish and was really excited that there was, in fact, an actual dish that included mushrooms in an omelet. Most places I go there's a bit of modification that needs to be made to the omelet order so I had really high hopes for this dish. It came out watery....Yeah.For those of us that love mushrooms (and cook with them) you know there's nothing worse than putting that mushroom into any dish and having ALL of the juices from the mushroom come out and completely ruin the rest of your food. From baking pizzas in the oven to sauteing the mushrooms FIRST to get rid of all that excess liquid I really think it's sort of cooking 101. The fact that an accomplished breakfast joint like Blu Jam couldn't nail that was really disappointing. To make matters worse I had less than an hour before I had to be somewhere and couldn't send the dish back. I picked around the drier edges and what I DID consume was decent, the pairing choices of the mozzarella and very fresh chives was great, usually I'm stuck with cheddar or some other cheese. But the mozzarella was a very good choice and I think it actually helped thicken up the eggs in certain areas. Just was over matched by the mushrooms tho (which were also good, a great variety).So, not saying I'm never going to eat here again... but the next meal I grab here better be worth the hype or I'm gonna have to write off Blu Jam-- and such a shame cause it's a great location.

Reviews.Author: Derek F.
Reviews.Content: This place was alright. I had the Russian Scrambled, salmon and egss... Pretty good, I was satisfied.  The place is cramped inside. Got a ticket parking on the street Saturday because I assumed it was free on weekends - oops. Oh and a fork was not cleaned well, had food on it.

Reviews.Author: Charlie Sheena S.
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to write a review here for a while. I want to thank Yelp! For suggesting this to my better half and me a few weeks ago. This is hands down the most amazing restaurant I've been to since I moved to Los Angeles. Everything I've tried has been delicious. The French toast and berries seems to be my favorite. Although, the raw granola isn't something I'd pass up either. If you're a tea junkie like me then you'll love that they have the best blends from The Art of Tea stocked on their shelves. Their plum Oolong is a gift from tiny infant Jebus. I loved it so much I ordered my own stash for my office to drink when I am unable to be here. I love the music they play in here. I love everything about this place. On the walls they have the most amazing photographs that were taken on a safari. There is one photo that every time I see I actually have to stop myself from spending 350 on it to own a picture of a baby giraffe drinking out of a lake. I am also pretty sure Rian is sick of hearing me say,"I love that picture I really want to buy it I need to not be broke." so that being said If you've never been here I suggest you come. I feel like each of my visits has gotten better than the last. (that says a lot because I make Rian come here every Saturday and Sunday since the first visit and sometimes twice a day.)I recommend the following items on the menu that I am obsessed with: (side note: I haven't had the pleasure of tasting the entire menu. I have only tried a few items.)Brioche French Toast served with syrup & powdered sugarwith fresh berries and bananasCrepes with Giradelli dark chocolate, bananas & candied walnuts (I like mine sans walnuts.) Hearty Granola with oats, wheat, honey, almonds & fresh fruit w/ milk topped with fresh berries, bananas and black currantsPower House which is four egg whites scrambled with spinach, topped with flame-broiled chicken breast and sautéed tomatoes and basiland lastly there is Rian's favorite.... BBQ Chicken Sandwich which is grilled breast of chicken, smoked bacon, caramelized onion, melted provolone, mayo, tomato & BBQ sauceThe fruit and vegetables are always fresh and from local vendors. The service is never less than perfect. The staff is always wide awake and smiling even when I drag Rian out of bed at 8 am on a Saturday to get there before the rush. The prices are reasonable for the amazing quality that you are provided. This place is my favorite place to eat next to my Nonna's kitchen back home. This is my new home away from home for sure.

Reviews.Author: Patricia Z.
Reviews.Content: This place kicked ass. Food was outstanding, the french toast was to die for! There was a wait- but hey, for a good place in LA where isn't there a wait? The hostess was refreshing- no makeup, no cleavage and she had a brain! The rosemary bread toast was yummy, the fresh fruit was actually fresh and the cappichinos were delicious! High marks for Blu Jam---maybe time to expand?

Reviews.Author: Sonia C.
Reviews.Content: you know what you're ordering is DELISHHHHH when every table around you is ordering the EXACT SAME THING! when i came here i had no expectations for this place because my bf brought me here and i didn't read up on it or anything. but we basically ordered and then realized what we ordered was what literally every table around us was having. the crunchy french toast and blu jam benedict. they were sooo delish! especially the french toast because this was actually my first time having a french toast coated with cereal which makes it crunchy. the way they displayed the french toast was also very creative and pretty! it was cut into small triangles, drizzled with maple syrup and fresh fruit! anyways, the pictures speak for itself. this place is a must try!

Reviews.Author: Stephanie L.
Reviews.Content: LOVE THIS PLACE! We eat here almost every time we're in Hollywood. Amazing breakfasts & lattes, well worth the sometimes lengthy wait to get seated. Creates a craving.

Reviews.Author: Morgan P.
Reviews.Content: I just moved to LA a couple of weeks ago, and I found this place on Yelp when looking for a brunch spot. I've already been back once! Including friends, a total of 7 entrees have been consumed. We've all enjoyed all of them. I had the breakfast quesadilla, which was sensational, and a french-style omelet, which was also excellent. I really have no complaints, except that it's a little bit far away from us! We will definitely make this a usual brunch haunt when we have out-of-town guests.

Reviews.Author: Josh H.
Reviews.Content: Great menu, great coffee, great patio.  This place can get crowded, but it's worth the wait.  This is a perfect patio breakfast place.  And i'm a sucker for coffee art, so this place always leaves me smiling.

Reviews.Author: Jen L.
Reviews.Content: I heard about this place through a friend and wanted to check it out so badly.  I went on Sat around 12:30pm and we waited about half an hour to be seated.  The wait was so worth it!  I ordered their special on the menu, crunchy french toast.  It's french toast covered with corn flakes.  It was so crunchy on the outside and moist inside.  It was probably one of the best french toasts I've had.  They have a diverse menu and vegetarian options as well.  I'm definitely going back there to try other things on their menu.

Reviews.Author: Toy L.
Reviews.Content: I have so many great things to say about this place and I think everyone should try it out for themselves. Its a small cozy places that makes you feel as if your grandma could be cooking. The Blu Jam Benedict is AMAZING paired with the Crunchy French Toast you cant ever go wrong!!! The service is exceptional including the host who even remembered my name as we left (at a very busy place and an unusual name that I have this hardly ever happens). Definitely a place for any Breakfast Enthusiast.

Reviews.Author: Ms N.
Reviews.Content: My husband loves there crunchy french toast!! ( i don't like french toast at all from anyone or anywhere) but I love the shrimp omelet and chai tea my favorite to order!! when I go!!.. bu my last visit was about 2 months ago and i wanted to try the Benedict  it was good except very salty!! yuck...,but i rinse that taste out with OJ! lol.. I do recommend you go.. its only street parking thought so pray for a meter! xxoxo

Reviews.Author: djmyk e.
Reviews.Content: YUM. I WANNA GO TO L.A JUST TO GO.. if your ever on melrose. go to blue jamm.

Reviews.Author: Bernnie M.
Reviews.Content: Went this past Sunday for brunch with the wife to meet some friends. Definitely was glad we arrived early, as there was a 30min wait. In fact, there was a line throughout our entire visit! We put our names down and got seated just as our friends arrived. The hostess was very nice in that we asked to be seated outside and was able to accommodate our request. I had the Migas plate and it was delicious! I kept having to shoo away my wife's fork from my plate. Great sized portions too. Not too much, but definitely not skimpy at all. Service was great and consistent.   I really liked how they accomodated a couple that brought their little pooch by bringing him a bowl of water since it was pretty warm out there.  Definitely have to try to the Eggs Benedict next time.

Reviews.Author: Jessica S.
Reviews.Content: My new favorite brunch place!!!I called ahead and tried to make a reservation for brunch because I knew it would be crowded on a Saturday, and they said that they don't take reservations.  I thought that's too bad, so I asked when I should get there to avoid a long wait?  The girl on the phone said the best time to come would be 8:00- 8:30, because the place starts getting packed at 9:00!  So I came early, but it was well worth it.I found a great parking spot, easy metered parking, then checked in on Yelp ;) and saw that they were offering 50% off on their sangrias!!!!  Woohoo!!!  It is impossible to have a bad day when it starts off with an early-morning breakfast of half-off sangrias, that much I know.We get to the restaurant, and even at 8:45, the outdoor patio is full.  The inside is nice, cozy and nicely decorated.  I asked the waitress about the sangrias and she said that she recommends the red, so we started with that; $4.00 instead of $8,00, amazing!  It was the best sangria I've ever had; I've never been to Spain, but my friend had, and she thought it was a great sangria too.I was happy to see that there were vegan options clearly marked on the menu.  There weren't very many options, but all of the breakfast and lunch menu items were available at any time of day, which helped (hmm do I want a panini in the morning?  Possibly, I almost ordered a veggie panini for breakfast).  Might I suggest offering all or some of your egg scrambles made with tofu, upon request?  I think a lot of vegan customers would love that.  I ordered the Spicy Tex Mex Tofu Hash, which is easily one of the tastiest breakfast items I have ever had in my entire life (I think it may be tied for 1st place with one other breakfast I've had, but the ambiance, sangria,and coffee is better here, so this place is better).  The flavor is amazing, the potatoes are crispy on the outside and perfect, and the corn tortillas that are served with it are so soft and fresh.  My only (personal) problem is that it was so delicious, and the portion size was so big, that if I didn't have the self-control that I do, I would have eaten it all and made myself sick.  It was just sooo good, but it's nice to get so much for your money!I also had to order one of their coffees, since I saw on the Yelp photos that they make little designs in them.  I love when restaurants do that!  It's such a nice detail!  It makes me really happy.  I ordered a soy latte and my coffee came out with "soy" written in it in soy, I posted a photo of it.  Everything here is above and beyond amazing, I just wish that I didn't have to get here so early (okay, I did have a full, productive day because I was forced to wake up early, that was nice).  I would love if they took reservations.  I love that they use organic ingredients and have vegan options that are insanely delicious.A+++!!!!

Reviews.Author: evan b.
Reviews.Content: LA is full of great breakfast places, but this is my favorite.  Everything I've had there is good, but I'll focus on the lox plate.  It's the best I've ever had.  They get their salmon smoked by an artisan who's only client is a high end casino in vegas (belagio? can't remember).  Also, the chef/owner is a super sweet guy and takes care of his customers like a beloved uncle.  You have to root for a place with dedicated regulars like this.  I hope their liquor license comes through and they can turn into a 3 meal force to be reckoned with.  They have a real dedication to interesting, well made food.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie N.
Reviews.Content: This is the first time a restaurant has inspired me to make a Yelp account and write a review - Blu Jam is amazing!  We got sat right away (and it didn't hurt that Jake Gyllenhaal was at the next table) and our waiter was awesome.  He never let our coffee cups be even halfway empty and he was so friendly and patient.  I ordered the California Omelette and it really was the best omelette I've ever had.  The veggies were so fresh, as was the fruit I ordered it with was yum.  Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Chi Y.
Reviews.Content: This was probably one of the worst brunch experiences I've ever had.  The only reason I'm giving it one star is because the eggs were pretty good, but I've had better eggs and way better service elsewhere.A 30 minute wait turned into 90 minutes, thanks to the fact that the hostess kept seating people who arrived after us ahead of us.  When I pointed this out, she said those people had put their name down an hour before us.  Well, I know when someone is lying to my face.  The people she was seating ahead of us were either regulars or friends of hers.  I'm not the only one who noticed this.  It was sooooo obvious.The waitress was okay but she messed up our order and didn't really go to great lengths to fix it.  I think what annoyed me the most was the fact that while she was taking our order she turned to the table behind us to take their coffee order.  Seriously?? After waiting that long to get service, the least that she could do is give me her undivided attention while I'm putting in my order.And the best part of all...they allow smoking at their tables outside.  There is nothing more disgusting that having to smell someone's cigarette while you're trying to eat.  Nevermind the lovely stink it leaves on your clothes and hair.So, to sum up my experience:  had to wait for so long that I was practically having dinner and not brunch, had a frustrating meal because the waitress wasn't paying attention while she was taking our order and went home with my brand new suede jacket and freshly washed hair smelling like an ashtray, compliments of the chain smokers sitting behind my table.  I will not recommend this shitty place to any of my friends.

Reviews.Author: Brandi H.
Reviews.Content: It was ok.

Reviews.Author: Janine K.
Reviews.Content: Waited about 45 mins.   Not really worth the wait.  It was okay. Nothing super exciting.  I had the crunchy French toast because that was their signature thing. Was a little sweet. I did like the fresh fruit on it. Hubby had some BBQ chicken sandwich on ciabbatta bread. Just okay too.  I just didn't see what the fuss is about.  Best thing was the coffee!  It was really good coffee.  Would I go again... probably not... it was just okay.  Maybe something else would be more enjoyable to me... so I might but my hubby says... not worth it... too many other places in the world to try.

Reviews.Author: Chris J.
Reviews.Content: I have to say that when I arrived to Blue Jam early Sunday morning I did'nt know what to expect. What i got was WOW...the Hostess Sara was a sweetheart and really helped to make the dining experience super...The food was excellent and the atmosphere was great. When we left my sister said what did you think,and I told her that may have been" the best breakfast I ever had".

Reviews.Author: Erik n Deb J.
Reviews.Content: We try to get up to LA as much as we can, and there is no better food on Melrose than Blu Jam!  The breakfast is fantastic (try the migas for a great wake-up), and lunch is even better.  As most reviews will tell you, the goulash is simply perfect.We have never ordered something we didn't love.  This place can fill up fast, so don't be surprised if there's a line.  Great for couples, kids, and groups.  Servers are friendly and very knowledgeable about the dishes- ask for their advice, and then take it!

Reviews.Author: Arrick S.
Reviews.Content: Service is friendly and attentive. It's Melrose, so tons of cuties and weirdos all around. Food is good. Cool place to grab a bite and chill on a Melrose afternoon.

Reviews.Author: Carla S.
Reviews.Content: Really disappointed! You will wait forever and hosts are way off on the wait. Then once you do get seated they don't even serve alcohol! No one seems to care that they jack you around. French toast really good but rest was just good. Not worth the parking and waiting.

Reviews.Author: Vicky L.
Reviews.Content: I've been here on multiple of occasions for breakfast and each time I can't wait for another excuse to come back!  The food here and service has always been great!If you come here on the weekends, I recommend being prepared for a 30 minute to an hour wait.  That's probably the only draw back about this place, but trust me, it's definitely worth the wait! The ambiance is nice and cozy. The tables are set a bit closer than I would like, but I can understand that they're just trying to maximize the little space they have. My two absolute favorite dishes here is the  Spicy Tofu Tex Mex Hash and the Crunchy French Toast.  Here's why I think these two dishes should be given a shot. The Tofu Tex Mex Hash is full of flavor and will blow your mind! Let's put it this way, my meat lover bf cant get enough if this vegan dish. It comes with roasted red potatoes, black beans, tofu and pico de gallo. The plate also comes with tortilla for all of you that likes breakfast tacos. :)Now on to the Crunchy French Toast... I'll be honest, I've never really like any type of French toast period. They're always too sweet or too mushy for my liking. However, the ones here are to die for! These are coated with corn flakes and topped with fresh strawberries and bananas.  I've ordered it every time I'm here and it's each time the French toast came out perfectly! Perfect balance of sweetness and freshness.Finally, the vanilla latte is adorable and delicious! I enjoy the fact they took time to make a cute picture out of my latte.  If you're not in the mood for coffee than definitely try their Peach Tea (hot or iced are both yummie).

Reviews.Author: Tammie B.
Reviews.Content: What a disappointing place! First for most the hostess on the door is very rude lady and not to mention the food is very bad! Blueberry pancake was terrible, cold and doughy. Yuck i don't even want to start with the frittata that has pasta in it was the worse food i have tested!!! Never going back to this place ever.

Reviews.Author: Jun A.
Reviews.Content: Love the french toast!  Glad it's now on their menu everyday!

Reviews.Author: pauline c.
Reviews.Content: blu jam benedict was awesome.  very cute place. very beautiful people.  people roll up in nice cars.  get there early on a weekend morning (before 11a) to avoid waiting.

Reviews.Author: Bethany K.
Reviews.Content: WHAT WE GOT (since this matters the most... lol)*Crunch french toast... YUM! It looked like it was 2-3 full slices of brioche cut into quarters, powdered with sugar, with bananas and berries (strawberries/blueberries) topping and the awesome vanilla sauce on the side. Yum yum! Would happily recommend that.*Florentine eggs benedict... so-so. I honestly didn't think this was all that great. I may have let it sit too long because by the time I took a bite, the English muffin was somewhat damp and soggy, and the hollandaise sauce was kinda salty. Eh. I'd be willing to try the Blu Jam eggs benedict again next time, but I thought this was whatevs.*Side of potatoes - YUM! Love love love their breakfast potatoes - love the seasoning and the size and the crunchy edges*Side of fruit - good! Sometimes the fruit sides are bleh at restaurants, but I was pleasantly surprised by the fruit... bananas, blueberries, strawberries, etc... yay!*Custom omelette... with chicken apple sausage, mushrooms, bell peppers, and smoked bacon. Thought this was whatevs. Not bad, but whatevs. They were generous with the toppings but sometimes I think I prefer a different ratio of egg:topping.*Juices - got a fresh squeezed "designer" juice of carrot-orange juice and it was lovely.*Water (I know sorry) - the water had mint in it, just a smidge... and it was nice! I might try this at home the next time we have guests.RESTAURANT*Some outdoor seating, but sitting inside is lovely - decorated well, sufficiently lit, quick and attentive service, though overall it's small*Breakfast all day!*No reservations, but we got there at 9 on a Saurday and didn't really have to wait that long... though I was late, the other two members of my party were there and ready :)*I didn't have any trouble finding street parking -- there was parking along Melrose, then along the residential side streets nearby.VERDICT: liked it! I'm not going to beg to go back, but really liked the overall feel of the restaurant and the crunchy french toast. I would probably give it a 3.5 if I could, but I think it tips to 4.

Reviews.Author: Grace T.
Reviews.Content: Oh how LA peeps make me giggle inside.  My fiance and I dropped by for some brunch and of course on a Saturday there was a 40 minute wait.  So we endured the wait by browsing through the stores on Melrose.  We finally got seated on one of sidewalk tables.  I got the lox scramble and he got the egg and pasta scramble.  It was all delish.  The best part of sitting out on the sidewalk was the entertaining conversations that I was eavesdropping on.  For example, the guys that are in "business" discussing the various projects that they are producing.  My favorite was this guy who asked a girl if she had done drugs last night.  She said, "Yeah, I had some Adderall and two lines of coke."  Are people for real?  It was pretty entertaining for what would have been a regular old Saturday brunch.

Reviews.Author: Todd M.
Reviews.Content: Stopped in to Blu Jam Cafe for Brunch this past Sunday.  We got this around 11:30 and parking wasn't an issue.  We had to wait about 10 mins for a table for two - no big deal.  I had the Blu Toast (French Toast with Bluberries and cream cheese inside, topped with fruit) and my date had a custom omelet (Chicken, Brie & Mushrooms).  Both were tasty!  Lots of food means we left plenty on the plate.  Coffee was good too.  I'll definitely go back if in the area.  Thumbs up!

Reviews.Author: Erika S.
Reviews.Content: Every plate that went by looked so beautiful.  Breath-taking against the brick walls. The fried eggs draped like big floppy hats. I ordered a bowl of goulash that came in an elegant, low white bowl. The beef was butter. Thank you to Frankie and the wait staff for their beautiful energy.  The cafe is an oasis.

Reviews.Author: Geoff Y.
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty sweet place.  All around are these vintage-y and somewhat odd shops (not to mention a few dispensaries which I was pleasantly surprised to see, considering we have no such thing back east), and smack in the middle of it is this pretty cool cafe.  I went off the special French menu and ordered the scrambled eggs with spinach and potatoes (I have no idea what it is in French).  It was nice a filling without being obscenely heavy, which worked out well since the day prior I ingested nothing but animal protein and carbohydrates.  The spinach helped, I think.  Best part was that it was pretty inexpensive too.

Reviews.Author: evan p.
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was great! french toast was amazing as well as all of the scrambles. The servers are always friendly and super kind.

Reviews.Author: jennifer t.
Reviews.Content: there is always a line.outside. even on the weekdays! The crunch French toast, however, is only served.on Saturday Sunday and holidays. It's super delicious. Breaded with a corn flake exterior and served with a vanilla bean cream sauce! Make site.you share though. One order might be too much alone!

Reviews.Author: London J.
Reviews.Content: Just stopped by this place for Sunday brunch, a sort of tradition with one of my best girlfriends, and actually decided to check it out after reading the reviews here on our luvley Yelp community. There was no wait when we got there, a major plus from our usual spots Toast and Joan's on 3rd, which was around 9:45am. They even sat my girl before I arrived -- which is almost unheard of! LoL Now, food wise it's pretty damn good. I got the Cali Omelet which was delicious, and I agree with Sarah Beth S., their fruit cup is above the standard of other brunch spots. I wasn't too impressed with my vanilla latte, but I am not a huge coffee gal so what do I know...The food did take a bit long it seemed, for it to be somewhat slow for a Sunday morning, but all in all the service was great and super friendly. We headed out around 12 and the place was officially packed, folks waiting and taking up the sidewalk packed, so if you can't get there early I say skip it until you can. Not to mention, parking is a breeze before shops open. Also, the bathroom (I can't help it, ladies bathrooms are a big factor for me - lol) is super cute and was very clean. With a huge full length mirror, someone taught them well ;-) My friend and I have decided to keep it on our list, I'll let you know next time we go just how consistent they are!

Reviews.Author: Marah A.
Reviews.Content: The service was great the food was just OK. I wasn't impressed. The coffee was tasteless.

Reviews.Author: Cally B.
Reviews.Content: We came in on a Saturday morning, and were able to get right in.  Our waitress was super friendly, which was really nice.  I got the Loxex, and it was delicious!  The ingredients were fresh, not laden with butter, and served hot.  I asked for no sour cream, and (as usual) I wound up with sour cream.  When I brought this to their attention, the kitchen made me a fresh plate instead of simply wiping the sour cream off.  That is ALWAYS appreciated.  I can't remember what my boyfriend got--something with a Mexican kick to it, like migas--but I do remember it was equally as good.  My only complaint would have to be NO MIMOSAS.  Brunch just isn't brunch without mimosas!I think the biggest perk for my boyfriend may have been that the owner is Czech.  They were able to converse a bit in Czech, and the owner brought us a special bowl of some Czech soup.  It wasn't on the menu, but it should be!  We will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Author: Cynthia M.
Reviews.Content: Amazing food!! Showed up around 10am on a Saturday morning and it was about a 20 minute wait. While I waited the bus boy gave me some of their lemon- mint leave infused water... Sooo refreshing!! Ask for some while you wait!! My friend and I ordered the crunchy French toast and eggs Benedict which were amazing! The French toast topped with fresh fruit had a vanilla bean sauce on the side that really made it a special treat! Not too sweet; just the perfect balance. Their mocha latte was also delicious! Service was stellar so I will definitely come back! I'm not sure about parking since I rode my bike!

Reviews.Author: Lindy J.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found Blu Jam on Yelp, so obviously we wanted to check it out while we were in LA.. not disappointed!! Delicious food, huge menu to choose from, and quick, friendly service! No question, the best breakfast in LA. Do it.

Reviews.Author: Dani P.
Reviews.Content: Hi Blu Jam. I love you. Here is why:I like it here. I actually prefer sitting inside , I'm not sure why exactly but I just do.  I almost always have the same waiter. He never recognizes me as Lauren Conrad from "the Hills", which though aggravating, its also kind of refreshing.  The menu options are plenty, and they are large too. I recommend splitting something. I usually get one of two things. both are basically variations of egg whites with vegetables, mixed greens, and rosemary toast. I had the brioche french toast once too. C.O.M.F. !!!!Don't worry, I always throw up afterwards to keep the weight off. Anyway, the ambiance is amazing, staff is a delight, and the coffee....HOLY HELL. Its not only good (and they have soy which is good for me because I can't drink regular), but the guy that makes them creates pictures in the foam that air of van gogh with a sense of humor. I'm serious.

Reviews.Author: Jen B.
Reviews.Content: This place gets packed for brunch so there may possibly be a long wait. However, I can guarantee that it's all worth it! I've only eaten here for brunch and their Smoke Salmon Platter is by far one of the greatest. My boyfriend had the steak and eggs and he said it was the best he's ever had. The Soy Chai Latte is like a taste of Heaven. Please eat here if you haven't already, it's definitely a great eatery located among all the shops on Melrose.

Reviews.Author: Gloria L.
Reviews.Content: parking sucks... but that's not the restaurant's fault... but crunchy french toast is AWESOME!!!!!  which is why i'm willing to overlook the parking issues and give it 5 stars!  seriously, i can order crunchy french toast any time of the day because they serve it all day loooooong!!!!!  that's just what you have to get!!!

Reviews.Author: Lisa N.
Reviews.Content: Amazing and fresh.

Reviews.Author: Joel H.
Reviews.Content: I've been here three times now since moving to LA about a month ago. Each time, I keep telling myself that I'm only coming here to test the place again, but there's no way around it: I just love this place. The food is delicious, especially for breakfast and brunch. The wait staff are uniformly warm and attentive, without hovering. The prices are reasonable by LA standards, and the place has a little charm to it. At this point, I'm quickly becoming a regular. Well worth a trip if you're in the LA area.

Reviews.Author: Jeffrey S.
Reviews.Content: Indeed, great French Toast.  The more I looked around at other plates, the more disappointed I was with what I ordered and I truly enjoyed what I ordered.  Worth a return visit for sure!

Reviews.Author: Erica B.
Reviews.Content: Dinner was amazing and thank you for the complimentary bottle of wine!

Reviews.Author: T R.
Reviews.Content: I've been going here for breakfast for at least six years. One of my favorite places. The food is always fresh and delicious. I appreciate the mix of healthy choices and one's that satiate the desire to have unforgiving dinning.

Reviews.Author: Nina G.
Reviews.Content: I arrived at Blu Jam at 10:45 on a Saturday morning. I was able to park for free in the residential neighborhood; it was only about a two minute walk from my car. I was told the wait would be between 35-45 minutes; weary, I consented and gave my name. Fast forward an additional 45 minutes later; I am finally seated. Food was excellent. I had two orders of their signature Crunchy French Toast and a single order of a Blu Jam Benedict. Ambiance wise, it's kind of loud and jam-packed inside, but I'm willing to overlook it for the sake of the food. Unfortunately, there's no where for the waiting crowd to sit (which tends to be anywhere from 15-20 people), so I was made to stand in the sun for the 45 sem-odd minutes. My bill totaled to $53 dollars. Their orange is exorbitant and does not come with free refills. The two glasses of orange juice I had brought my bill to $9.90 alone. Overall, a decent experience. I will probably return in the future.

Reviews.Author: Emerson F.
Reviews.Content: This place has the most awesome egg sandwhich for breakfast.  They are very nice people as well inside.  Nice architecture as well inside.

Reviews.Author: Charles L.
Reviews.Content: Actually now I'm in this restaurant to and writing this review.....got it? They have wireless here!! I didn't expect that until I open my laptop and have the wifi on~ that's really convenient for me to have breakfast and deal with my stuff at the same time~ btw~ another best thing about this restaurant must be the price. The original price of the breakfast wasn't very cheap~ just accecatable~ but thanx to their activity----every items on the breakfast menu is just for $ 4.95 ( until am 11 from Monday to Friday)~ that really makes a good deal~ You don't even need to spend more than $ 10 (tips included) getting yourself a nice breakfast in a lovely plcae. I'm sure I'll visit here again and recommend others to come here~

Reviews.Author: Rian T.
Reviews.Content: Love at first bite. I've eaten at Blu Jam at least once every weekend since first tasting it. I'm in a three dish rotation: the Power House (four egg whites scrambled with spinach, topped with flame-broiled chicken breast and sautéed tomatoes and basil), Hearty Granola (oats, wheat, honey, almonds & fresh fruit w/ milk or low fat vanilla yogurt topped with fresh berries, bananas and black currants), and the BBQ Chicken sandwich (grilled breast of chicken, smoked bacon, caramelized onion, melted provolone, mayo, tomato & BBQ sauce - I order mine without the cheese and mayo, in case that matters). The BBQ Chicken sandwich is available at all hours, which is nice because sometimes that's what you're supposed to be eating at 9:00AM on a Sunday. All three are phenomenal. I count myself to be very fortunate that my eating partner will split some of these dishes with me from time to time, allowing me to get a double-dose of deliciousness. I've tasted the pancakes and french toast - both are superb. The fruit is always ripe and the bacon is usually mighty fine.The service is largely communal, and everyone's very friendly and helpful. This place can get pretty crowded, but I still fell adequately attended too. I've taken it upon myself to seek out my own water refills on occasion, but that's mainly due to my own impatience.My biggest knock on this place is that they haven't jumped on the bottomless mimosa craze that I've been enjoying at my other other weekend haunts. They don't serve any alcohol here, but hopefully that is being remedied as I type.Nice jazz music is always playing, which is a great weekend morning ambience. The decor is hardly worth mentioning, but I'm going to anyway because I know a certain someone who enjoys the photos of the big cats and the giraffe looking awkward as hell trying to drink some water.I recommend arriving early to make parking easier (and cheaper, if you arrive very early) and to beat the crowds. I find Melrose to be pretty obnoxious in general, but that hardly matters if you get in and out early enough.

Reviews.Author: Victoria A.
Reviews.Content: Thank you Yelp...great suggestion! This place is so consistent. I love bringing out-of-town friends here. The service can't be beat. The owner is very friendly...and circulates around the cafe making sure everyone is happy. Everything we've tried on the menu is scrumptious.

Reviews.Author: Natasha R.
Reviews.Content: Came in asked how long the wait was told me 35 mins but most likely 25... was ok with that considering it was Sunday afternoon... went for a brief walk came back told me 10 more minutes waited 15 asked how much longer? There's still 3 parties ahead of you... but watched him sit parties of 3..5..6..and 11!! In 15 mins... unless you have time to kill or a huge party regardless of how many reviews they have a 50 minute wait for 2 is rediculous!!!

Reviews.Author: Jessica B.
Reviews.Content: We went on New Years day and had no wait.  We got a table in the back.  First of all I was impressed with the atmosphere and the general feel of the restaurant.  It's small enough to feel cozy without being cramped.  We ordered a variety of coffee drinks, juices, 2 french toast plates, the special of the day, which was french eggs and an omelette.  None of it dissapointed!  Our bill for four was $72 and we left an $18 tip and at $90 for breakfast, it was worth every penny.  One note is that they prefer not to split checks, but we did request it ahead of ordering and they obliged.

Reviews.Author: Ryan V.
Reviews.Content: Had read the many good reviews on Yelp and decided we had to give this place a try for bunch.  We were not disappointed.  We had read there is normally a decent wait here and since we were a group of 5, we got there early.  Apparently, we got really lucky as they had a table for us right away and a really nice one in the back.  The food was amazing, I got their french toast and drank plenty of coffee.  The service was fantastic as well.  I think one gentleman who was really nice to us the whole time was the owner, and he was making his way around the restaurant talking to everyone.  Overall, it was a great experience.  Definitely recommend and will be back for sure.

Reviews.Author: David B.
Reviews.Content: Service and food is awesome! Myself and my girlfriend always order the fence toast and mex tex tofu. We always try to visit every chance we get

Reviews.Author: Ray C.
Reviews.Content: Great food.    French toast was excellent.  Paris via rome was also amazing.  Long wait, but I took the time to shop next door at the boutique next door.  Stay close to the checkin stand, as the hostess is soft spoken and won't call your name twice.I visited needed a table for 4, and waited about 45 minutes.  But scores of tables for 2 were seated before we were.  Seems they could have put 2 tables together to seat us faster.

Reviews.Author: Caroline M.
Reviews.Content: decent brunch food, but the darkness of the interior kinda detracted from the morning vibe. underwhelmed.

Reviews.Author: Carolyne N.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam is my jammy jam. It has the best lattes! The latte comes out with a design and is sooooo yummy. Service as great. Good people. Good vibe. Definitely going back

Reviews.Author: Jennifer L.
Reviews.Content: Great Breakfast.  We were here before most people were out.  The staff was great.  I ordered The Old World (Scrambled eggs with mushrooms, thyme, onions, and mozzarella) served with toast and potatoes.  I am a big fan and critic of fried potatoes and these were oh so good.

Reviews.Author: Cynthia L.
Reviews.Content: Yum!  Definitely on my weekend breakfast list.  I had the Blu Jam benedict with fruit and it was very good.  The assorted fruit was very nicely presented in a side bowl and was surprisingly sweet.  It was very reasonable, too.  I've paid up to $12 for eggs benedict at times, and it may not even be that good.  They also serve organic coffee, which was amazing and it was only $2.50.  I definitely recommend coming here!

Reviews.Author: Jenny K.
Reviews.Content: i have been wanting to go to blu jam for a while.  opportunity knocked.  i answered.i wanted to have something sweet and something salty.we ordered the "lost bread" and the chicken curry sandwich. first, they came out with bread and an olive spread.  I LOVE THAT OLIVE SPREAD.  very flavorful and a bit spicy.  couldn't get enough of it.the lost bread is the french toast everyone raves about.  i must say that their french toast had the perfect amount of chewy-ness, bread consistency, and taste topped with fresh berries.  it was one of the best i've ever had. embarrassing enough, we were full by the time the chicken salad sandwich arrive!!  it came with a choice of fries, potato salad, fruit.  we got the potato salad - yum.  had to save the sandwich for later.  conveniently located on melrose...we were able to walk off our brunch by shopping on melrose during the lazy afternoon.  after all the shopping, i was hungry again for my "leftover" chicken curry sandwich.  it would have been better if it were on a softer bread...but i was famished, so i enjoyed every bite!  *blush*i'm sure that this place gets quite crowded on the weekends.it's wonderful to be able to go to brunch on the weekdays.  brunch and shopping.  what else do you need in life?

Reviews.Author: John L.
Reviews.Content: The setting is nice and it's on Melrose avenue so good for people watching but my wife and I were really disappointed with the food. We had just gone to Square One Dining the day before and loved it and so almost went back there, but decided to try something different. The split pea soup was good but the other things were a bit disappointing. My wife got the veggiewich and although i didn't try it she thought it was just "A-ok."  I got the gourmet benedict with Norwegian smoked salmon and thought it was very mediocre.  Maybe we picked the wrong things, but supposedly those were some of the most popular items. I was really torn with the breakfast eggwich, maybe I should've tried that.The staff were attentive,  timely,  and nice. We went midweek so it wasn't too busy.We were going to order a few sandwiches to go for our visiting relatives but instead decided to pick up sandwiches to go from Joan's on Third instead.

Reviews.Author: Leslie C.
Reviews.Content: I came here when the place first opened and was debating whether to come back since my salad was a little wilty.  But my cousin and I came here for brunch today and I was impressed.  The decor is very cute and cozy..I especially like the brick and custom artwork on the walls. The bread and olive tapenade was delicious (but the waiter didn't give us any small plates to eat off of).  I had the St. Petersburg Scramble and my cousin had the Veggiewich.  Both were good, but her bread was a little soggy and my eggs were a little wet.  Overall, the food was pretty good.  My latte was delicious...creamy and smooth.  The service was also friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Author: Caroline K.
Reviews.Content: So this is another place that won't seat you if your entire party is not present.  Unfortunately, my friend and I were the late ones this time, so the friends that got there on time lost the table that had been reserved for us.  We ended up waiting another half hour before getting another table for six.  However, we were given a free order of crepes!  The waiter said it was bc we had to wait so long - that's prob the first time I've received a free dish for having to wait long, and we all appreciated the gesture.  The crepes were very good - they were drenched in a nice lemony syrup.  The owner (or manager) also came by our table twice to see how we were doing.  Two of us ordered the french toast - they no longer have their "Blu Toast" ($9.95) but have something similar.  The outdoor menu still lists it but the menu you are given once seated does not.  Replacing cream cheese is yogurt, and it's simply listed as one of the three french toast plates available.  I never even had a chance to try it when it had cream cheese, only having read about it on Yelp.  I did order the one with yogurt and thought it was good but nothing great.  I was disappointed that it did not have much yogurt at all and that I had to dip it in the syrup to give it more flavor.  I prob would not order this one again, though the portions were more than enough.  Two friends got different types of the eggs benedict, the Blu Jam Benedict ($9.95) and Gourmet Benedict (salmon and dill - $10.95) .  Both loved theirs and the salad it came with.  Another friend got some scramble (good), I think it was the Migas bc it came with a tortilla, and one of the veggie dishes, which was actually good considering it was all vegetarian.  It came with potatoes, poached eggs, pesto sauce, etc.  The rosemary toast it came with was excellent.  Some friends also ordered the orange juice and said it was delicious.  Overall, service was great and the food was hearty and pretty good.  Expect to pay about $15 pp w/ tip and tax.

Reviews.Author: Faisal L.
Reviews.Content: My second time here was a repeat of the first. Great food and service.

Reviews.Author: stephen p.
Reviews.Content: When I first came across the popular Blu Jam Cafe it was closed. Not this visit though. I got myself Kamil's Lunch: pan-roasted macaroni topped with BJ's "famous Czech style meat goulash", $13.95. Just writing this review has me hungry. It was good even after reheating. Go eat!

Reviews.Author: Betsy R.
Reviews.Content: This place isn't horrible but I don't understand why people say it's so great. It's a standard breakfast place.  They offer a variety of meals and breakfast is served all day but the food is mediocre. We had the French Toast, Wrap on Fire, and a Caprese Sandwich. The  mozerella had the texture of egg whites, which was strange, so it was hard to eat. The bread was OK but honestly Whole Foods makes better sandwiches.  The salad didn't taste fresh and I wasn't able to eat more than 2 bites. My friend liked the French Toast with berries and bananas, but really how could you mess up something that simple?! My husband had the Wrap on Fire, which was OK but nothing special that we would have to go back for. Most likely wont go back here b/c it wasn't memorable. The service was good, prices are reasonable, but the food is not fabulous.

Reviews.Author: Kari R.
Reviews.Content: yum yum yum what a great breakfast place. Good selection and all four of us enjoyed what we got. Def something for everyone

Reviews.Author: Chira E.
Reviews.Content: All cafes take notes, Blu Jam Cafe is the way to do it! Great customer service, friendly staff, and the food is awesome. They have a large variety of breakfast items on the menu, from crepes, to scrambles. For you java lovers the organic coffee is bold and strong, but far from bitter. Most of the breakfast plates come with their delicious potatoes. I try to get to this place anytime I'm in So-Cal. The prices are moderate, and they serve lunch as well. I have never had the lunch, but it just has to be as fabulous as the breakfast.

Reviews.Author: Brad Y.
Reviews.Content: I ate here because it was voted the best breakfast in Los Angeles.  I ordered the Migas, a spicy egg dish with jalapeños, chipotle, beef chorizo sausage and bell peppers.  It was good--not out of this world but good.  This left me a little disappointed because I went in expecting a kick ass meal.  If I went back I would probably get a benedict or an order of pancakes but you can get benedicts and pancakes anywhere.  I'm not sure what the hype is all about.  I went in thinking there would be a wow factor--I really didn't see it.

Reviews.Author: Betty Ming L.
Reviews.Content: A lovely spot!

Reviews.Author: Munya S.
Reviews.Content: Came here for breakfast with my mom.  We sat outside on a nice sunny day- waitress was friendly, efficient- and the food was the best part.  I had the Rancheros (delicious) and my mom had the French toast which was fluffy and good.  The portions are quite generous, so if you're not hungry, you could always share one or two different entrees.

Reviews.Author: Hamed M.
Reviews.Content: the crunchy french toast, which i think is only served on sundays, is to die for. it comes with bananas and strawberries, a mouth watering sauce, and of course, corn flakes, which provides the crunchy exterior texture. bottom line, opt for the crunchy french toast over the regular ones.waiter was attentive and nice. street parking is pretty easy to find within a block or two.expect to wait 15-30 minutes, unless you go off hours.

Reviews.Author: Laurie H.
Reviews.Content: Delicious brekkie of potatoes and salmon in a mound with poached eggs on top, plus fresh o.j. What's not to love?

Reviews.Author: Graham S.
Reviews.Content: Had the Tuscana scramble the first time around--which, how can you beat green eggs?--and the eggs Benedict the second visit. Both were very tasty. The service both times was also great, too.

Reviews.Author: Kara P.
Reviews.Content: food: yes the portions are big, but totally not worth the wait.  the french toast was dry, the pancakes were ok, and benedict was pretty good.  service: awful.  they are so impersonal...and they just want you to eat and leave the place.  rude!final thoughts: never going back

Reviews.Author: Anita W.
Reviews.Content: i came here while on a trip to socal with my sisters a few years ago.i came in on a weekday morning around 1030 and there was no wait, the restaurant wasn't too packed. ordered a chai latte, which came out to be too sweet for my liking.as for a breakfast plate, i went with their roma via paris. that was a tasty dish, and it was memorable for me.also sampled their french toast, which didn't stand out for me taste wise. i could find something comparable somewhere else.service was great!

Reviews.Author: Monica G.
Reviews.Content: Holy Vanilla French Toast-I am in love with you!!!!!  And I am also in lust with Kamil's Breakfast because it is delicious and reminds me of a breakfast that my dad use to make for us.  Yes, there is a wait for a table but once seated inside this place is unpretentious and comfortable.  Yes, you might sit really close to another couple or a group but that just means less pressure to make conversation with the person you came with.  Yes, the parking sucks but this is LA.  I really loved Blu Jam Cafe!

Reviews.Author: Thy N.
Reviews.Content: hands down my favorite brunch spot in LA. i took a 2 year hiatus from this fine city, and came back to find that not only is my favorite brunch spot still as good as ever, but now i can get my precious mimosa there too!you'd be hard-pressed to find another place that can poach an egg like blu jam. absolute perfection.so many great things on the menu, but you'll never go wrong with their benedicts. i also love their veneto breakfast. it's risotto, and yes, risotto seems like a weird thing to have for brunch, but it is seriously good stuff. and of course, it's topped with two amazingly poached eggs.did i tell you i love their poached eggs?ps if you get there around 8:30am, you can beat the rush. otherwise, you'll be waiting a velly, velly long time for a table.

Reviews.Author: Pauline L.
Reviews.Content: OK, OK, I'll give you one more star.  We came here for brunch today for a friend's b-day brunch around 10am.  We found street metered parking for $1 an hour, but they have valet for $6.  We waited about 40 minutes to be seated, which was expected, but the staff was super nice and accommodating.  Love the hostess with the British accent! haha.  Three of us ordered the Blu Jam Benedict (I couldn't resist even though I've already tried it), another ordered the loxex, and another friend ordered the wrap on fire.  All were delicious!  We also ordered the french toast to share and it was oh-so-yummy!!  One of the best french toasts I've ever had!  The arnold palmer was also really good and refreshing, and service was pretty good about refilling our drinks.  All in all, it was a great experience with delicious food, good service and great company.  How could I not give this place five stars?

Reviews.Author: Ru C.
Reviews.Content: i had the blu jam benedict and i really liked it! the sauce wasn't overwhelming as some restaurants do and the beet salad was delicious as well!things are a little more the pricier side but it's worth the visit.the coffee wasn't great and it was a little too much, but the staff was very friendly and nice!!

Reviews.Author: Liz T.
Reviews.Content: I've fallen in love with another restaurant... maybe because of my luck on my first visit, a saturday prime time and we were lucky enough to get seated right away.  Got to sit in the outdoor patio (sidewalk that is gated) area.  Got the Le French Omelet ( veggies, brie and sundried tomatoes) WOW, now I don't like a lot of cheese in my food because sometimes it overpowers the dish with too much fat/calories/creaminess...but the brie was a perfect compliment.  Also ordered the crunchy french toast, that was good but definitely on the sweet side and after my huge omelet I was stuffed to the brim, but it was still tasty.  My other half ordered an ahi seared sandwich, very interesting, healthy and isn't as strong as the normal tuna sandwich you get.  If you like Ahi tuna, I would give it a try.  I can't wait for my next brunch return at Blu Jam.  Oh and the jam was delish and perfect!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer C.
Reviews.Content: I would give this place a 5-star if it wasn't for the long wait. Worth the 45-1 hour wait, but it's so long. And, you can't leave the place because they announce the names. The host even did a roll call, it was quite funny.After checking out Yelp reviews, my friend and I chose Blu Jam. This is a definite place to go for brunch on a Sunday. Parking wasn't too awful to find in the residential area. All the food coming out (as we were waiting outside) looked so good. Unfortunately, my friend and I ordered the same thing. We ordered the Crunchy French Toast. By "unfortunately", I just mean that we should've ordered something else. But, it was so good. On the other hand, we should've gotten a variety. This is their description of the Crunchy French Toast: "Egg brioche dipped in batter, rolled in crunchy corn flakes and grilled to perfection, topped with fresh bananas and berries, served with vanilla bean sauce." SERIOUSLY, TO PERFECTION. Hands down, best French Toast I've ever had.I definitely will come back to try their other yummy items.

Reviews.Author: Riko M.
Reviews.Content: My friend recommended me their French toast, and I went there for Sunday brunch. There were already a lot of people outside of the cafe waiting for seats. We ordered smoked salmon Benedict and, of course, French toast. Not only French toast was good, the Benedict was very tasty, too. I actually don't like huge French toast or pancake that have too much honey on top, but their French toast was good size & not too sweet. I'd come back here again.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie S.
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and Excellent food! My friends and I stood in line for an hour on Sunday but the wait was well worth it. They gave us a complimentary crunchy french toast for waiting, which I would highly recommend on ordering. I would highly recommend this cafe to any friends and family who are in LA

Reviews.Author: Orchid L.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam is one of my favorite place for sunday brunch. Their benedict is so good. I've tried their Norwegian benedict...It comes with the potato, spinach and they are so yum! My friend ordered the crunchy French toast topped with bananas and berries. I have to say that it's the best french toast i've ever had. 5 stars for the food!

Reviews.Author: Zoya B.
Reviews.Content: There was definitely a long wait to get into this place but it was worth it. Very delicious and fresh food. It's rare to be able to taste how fresh the ingredients are. Tables are a bit too close to each other but that's typical of LA.Great food, thats all that counts.

Reviews.Author: Tati R.
Reviews.Content: I have eaten lunch here twice and both times the food was fine, not amazing.  The real problem is the service.  I have had the same waiter both times and he is rude and never checks on the table.  One time the place was almost empty and I still couldnt get a glass of water.  He also gives the check about two minutes after being served.  Is this Denny's?  What if I decided I wanted another drink?  Poor service with tons of better places on the same block.

Reviews.Author: Blu M.
Reviews.Content: Best service in LA. Busiest bathroom. Fast food service.

Reviews.Author: Michael W.
Reviews.Content: Fun place to get some good breakfast. We got the Crunch French Toast and Kamil's Benedict and split it.  Everyone ordered the Crunch French Toast.  Service was great, very friendly and on top of it.  Wait was super long, the whole sidewalk was full of people, it was a saturday around 11. Fresh squeezed juices you can customize as you want.

Reviews.Author: Kim N.
Reviews.Content: What can i say? I love me some good breakfast food. I came here with 3 girlfriends and we wanted to try everything!! We came at around noon and there was about a 15 min wait, and we ended up getting to sit outside on a lovely summer afternoon! What we ordered: crunchy french toast, veggie omelette(I'm not sure what it was called but it had spinach, tomatoes, onions) , and the breakfast trio. Everything was delicious, especially the french toast with its fresh fruit and vanilla syrup! One star off bc my Gfs ordered the white sangria and they said it was not good and could barely finish it. Oh and remember to read the signs carefully if you park on the street and make sure you put enough money in the meter to account for the wait time!

Reviews.Author: Carol J.
Reviews.Content: This is a great brunch place. It has good food and great services. I had egg benedict which was really yummy.

Reviews.Author: Adam H.
Reviews.Content: man i was always going "duh, where should i go to breakfast" because i was sick of 101, griddle, village coffee shop, etc.so i got adventurous and tried vienna cafe and blu jam. it is awesome they are right across the street from each other on melrose. i tried them on separate days. the winner is vienna cafe but they are both great places for breakfast.blu jam has a million different choices, we got the $7.95 specials, muscle beach and something else with eggs/mushrooms/onions. Tasty. coffee tastes normal and is refilled at a good rate. server was a nice lady.

Reviews.Author: andrea r.
Reviews.Content: I thought Blu Jam was fine.  Maybe I ordered wrong.  I got their soup and salad lunch.  I  had spit pea soup which was good.  I had a salad of goat cheese and beets.  It was wholly unspectacular, but certainly not bad.  Ordinary.  Nice ordinary food.  On Melrose.  Meh.

Reviews.Author: Syd M.
Reviews.Content: Visited Blu Jam with a couple of friends last weekend for Brunch. We wanted to try something new so I headed to Yelp to see what I could find. After a bit of research we decided on Blu Jam.I had the Eggs Bohemia. It's two eggs, any style-I opted for over-easy, mixed with smoky bacon, ham and chives. All served with a side of country potatoes and your choice of toast- I chose the Rosemary on the recommendation of our server. The eggs were cooked perfectly to order and it was mixed with a generous amount of bacon and ham. The potatoes were crispy yet soft and the rosemary toast was a nice new flavor! I also ordered a fruit smoothie, you have the option to choose any combination of fruits, I chose strawberry and blueberry. It was quite tasty and a good start to the day!One of my friends chose Kamil's Breakfast and didn't love it. It sounded pretty interesting but she said "there was something missing" from the dish. Couldn't pinpoint it exactly (she said it could be cheesier??) but it was just "something" that made it feel lacking. Another friend chose the Louisiana hash and while she liked it, she didn't love it. Unfortunately none of us really loved our dishes. And for myself and my friend who had the Louisiana Hash felt like amongst our eggs and such we were eating grass as they completely overloaded the dish with an overly generous amount of chives. Normally chives are sprinkled atop the dish and diced quite small, our dishes were covered in green and the chive pieces were at least a half inch to an inch in length. A bit overwhelming. Also while placing our order we had asked for water to be brought out. We had received our other ordered drinks (latte, tea and smoothie) but never received our water. We then asked for the water and our server never apologized for forgetting it,  instead we were told by a gentleman (I'm guessing the owner or manager) that they are conserving water and we have to request it. Um...we did, and never got it. it wasn't rude or anything, but we did make the request and it was forgotten. We didn't really feel like a lecture was necessary since it was the server's fault not ours.I realllly wanted to like Blu Jam, especially after reading such positive reviews here. Perhaps it was what we ordered, I'm not sure, unfortunately I don't know that I'll be back. The food wasn't stellar and service was ok, not completely efficient (see water comment above) but friendly. It was an ok experience.**Rating is probably more 2.5, but I didn't really feel it was a 3.

Reviews.Author: John K.
Reviews.Content: I love this place so much!! You'll see me here every Saturday for the rest of my life!!

Reviews.Author: Ramzi E.
Reviews.Content: I've eaten many a breakfast at Blue Jam and will keep going back.  They've got a wide variety of ways to prepare eggs, pan cakes and other assorted breakfast standards (my go to is their eggs benedict, served on a croissant).  Their lunch menu is equally good and it's really too bad they don't stay open for dinner as I think they'd get a lot of business.  If you don't mind waiting for a table, definitely check it out.  You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Tony T.
Reviews.Content: I have to add the fifth and final star to Blu Jam Cafe.  The owner, Kamil sent me an email explaining the issue we had with my wife's french toast.  This was a first for me; to have an owner personally contact me and apologize for something.  For that, Blu Jam Cafe truly deserves my Five Star Rating.  Everyone, please know it just doesn't get any better than this.  Blu Jam Cafe is the place to go when you are hungry in L.A.

Reviews.Author: Joel M.
Reviews.Content: A nice menu and chill atmosphere.  Definitely a worthy spot for breakfast or lunch.  Props for all day breakfast, too.

Reviews.Author: Chris P.
Reviews.Content: Good food and great portions. Get there early while everyone is still recovering from their hangovers and stay a while. If you're lucky you might get a spot outside. It's a pretty cool place inside but doesn't necessarily live up to the hype of the 5 stars. I didn't see a line when we were there and we were one of only a few people inside so it was nice the service was quick and the staff friendly.

Reviews.Author: Liz C.
Reviews.Content: definitely going back.ordered the migas -- and it definitely hit the spot. the beef chorizos went so well with the chipotle and scrambled eggs. i didn't care too much about the rest of the things on the plate, except i was totally into it. i guess in the back of my head, i didn't expect the real deal spanish dish. it was def. a surprise :D5 stars for 1) lucking out on a great parking spot that day 2) quick and friendly service 3) amazing food!i saw kamil, the owner, greeting people and making sure everything was going well. nice to know that for a change owners are active and around (:i want to go back for their dinner menu and more breakfast!

Reviews.Author: Molly M.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend got a bloomspot deal to this place, and I am SO SO glad he did.  Seeing as though I live on the Westside and am not suicidal, a.k.a. refuse to deal with the traffic that comes with driving anywhere near Melrose and La Brea near dinnertime,  I would have probably never discovered this place otherwise.  Though most of the reviews on here seem to be about their delicious-sounding brunch, we went for dinner.  GREAT CHOICE, go us!  We made a reservation (it was a Friday), though we didn't probably didn't need it - there were a few tables open while we ate.  The ambiance is...dark.  That's the best way I could describe it.  Kind of a lowly-lit place, which made it a little more romantic I guess.  The decor wasn't anything special.Right after sitting down they brought us a free appetizer of buffalo mozzarella and plum tomatoes on a skewer - delicious!  My man ordered a craft beer and I ordered the featured red wine - he loved the beer and I LOVED the wine.  Really really good syrah.  For food, we split three hot plates - I think this place is tapas-style (at least for dinner), and three plates was more than enough for us.  The first thing that arrived was the spring risotto:  I let the man pick this one despite my aversion to peas.  It was good but the lemon in the dish overpowered the other flavors.  The risotto was cooked perfectly though.  The second dish was the goulash with gnocchi:  this dish was UNREAL it was so so good.  Instead of the traditional stew-style goulash, they serve perfectly seasoned and perfectly cooked meat along with gigantic potato pan-fried gnocchi in a delicious paprika sauce.  It was heaven, I could seriously eat it everyday.  The last dish we got was the argentinean steak with chimichurri and red potatoes:  soooooooo gooooooddd.  The steak was cooked perfectly and the chimichurri was well-balanced.The service here was great - everyone was attentive but not overly attentive.  The chef came out a couple of times and talked to a few tables (I don't know if he knew them or was just being nice).  There is also a nice "private" room in the back of the place that would be great for a dinner party.  The desserts sounded amazing but we were way too full plus it was memorial day weekend the next day and I had to be in a bathing suit, so we passed.   But I will be getting some next time!

Reviews.Author: Chris R.
Reviews.Content: Simply the Best French Toast and Orange Juice in LA. DONE! NOW GO THERE ALREADY!!(i think they serve breakfast all day) - Park on Martel. 5 Stars- A++++++ #1 EBAYer Would Recommend. ... :P

Reviews.Author: Joyan C.
Reviews.Content: I did not like this place that much.  We had to wait an hour even though the waitress said it would be less than 30 mins.  I got the salmon benedict, it was cold and soggy, and the potatoes were flavorless.  The chai latte was really good though.  The staff was nice and attentive but that does not make up for the bad food and the wait.

Reviews.Author: Abby C.
Reviews.Content: Food/Cost: (4/5) Blu Jam's signature dish is the Crunchy French Toast ($11.95) and it lives up to expectations. Eight half-slices of french toast encased in crunchy cereal arrives on a endlessly long, rectangular serving platter. Bananas, sliced strawberries, and blueberries dot the vision and powdered sugar is dusted atop everything. The french toast is wonderful -- moist on the inside, crunchy and buttery on the outside. It pairs very well with the vanilla bean sauce they provide on the side and I loved dipping each bite into the sauce for another kick of subtle sweetness and moisture. I also had some of my friend's Migas Scramble ($11.95) which is described on Blu Jam's menu as a "spicy combination of eggs scrambled with jalapeños, chipotle, beef chorizo sausage, bell peppers, tortilla chips and mozzarella, topped with homemade tomato salsa, served with flour tortilla and potatoes." It was just spicy enough and was a delightful mouthful of flavor. Portions were hearty and generous. Oh, and I can't forget the amazing fresh-squeezed Orange Juice ($4.50/large) here. it's a bit pricey at $4.50 a glass, but it was so different from any other OJ I've tasted and uniquely sweet -- I think they have magical oranges here. You've just got to try it. Ambiance: (4/5) Came here for brunch at 1:20pm this past Saturday and our party of 2 got seated after a relatively short 12 minute wait. We were seated in the small, umbrella-covered, fenced outside area (~9 wooden tables for 2) , which was pretty fun as there were always interesting characters or things to look at. I usually prefer indoor seating, but sitting outside at Blu Jam is fun, particularly if you enjoy people watching. The mood of the place is laid back, no pretense, hipster, and cool -- i thoroughly enjoyed dining here.Location: (5/5) Blu Jam is located right on Melrose in an area just alive with energy, and activity. There are an over abundance of things to do and see in this immediate area -- shopping galore, salons, etc.  Parking is, of course, a concern, but its not impossible. There are plenty of spots in the residential areas on either side of Melrose. Granted, most of them are filled, but if you just keep driving a little bit you're bound to find a spot. Just read the signs carefully -- some residential areas allow you limitless parking after certain permit-only hours and some areas only allow 2 hour parking after permit-only hours. Service: (3.5/5) Service was prompt and straightforward. our waiter didn't try to make any unnecessary small talk and didn't actually smile -- ever -- but he was very conscientious about checking in with us every so often and making sure our needs were taken care of. Overall: (4/5) I was very happy with my dining experience here. Just an overall great place -- a no-frills, no-nonsense place serving seemingly straightforward food that still impresses and packs a flavor punch.

Reviews.Author: Sandie S.
Reviews.Content: I came here during a week day so there was no wait time. I came here with two friends and we ordered a Rare Ahi Tuna Salad to share, and I forgot what my friends had, but I had the B.L.T.A sandwich and it was delicious.. But their Kamil's Famous Goulash Soup was even more amazing!! The soup was so delish that I almost ordered another one.. I'm definitely coming back here again JUST for the soup!!

Reviews.Author: Kyan B.
Reviews.Content: I just hate when waiters think they re the best and make us wait and f****g wait and even take other ppl to sit before me and my friends. Tiny shitty place i didnt even eat there we just left. Also Ppl have no decence as well. They see us first but they dont care. I m starting to hate la and hate the ppl in this city

Reviews.Author: Anna M.
Reviews.Content: Decided to pop in because I read the rave reviews. I live nearby so I wanted to check out the scene. Food was ok, did have to wait a bit but that's to be expected. Overall think there are loads of better options nearby, which actually have locals dining (found it to be overrun with visitors and out of towers). Would not recommend the granola or oatmeal, verrrrry plain and found it supremely overpriced. The French Toast and florentine was very good, but again better options just down the street.Did not live up to my expectations.

Reviews.Author: Javier J.
Reviews.Content: This is quality food. Doesn't get any better, sure there is the supposedly better spot of the "Griddle Cafe" but to me that's more of a hangover breakfast spot. This is where you take a girl out to breakfast and griddle cafe is where you go with all your buddies. Very clean, quality ingredients. I had the chilaquiles and I was skeptical because I am extremely picky with those..and they did not disappoint. The crunchy french toast were amazing too. The apple juice was some quality stuff, just don't expect motts! Honestly Blu Jam Cafe and Paulas pancake house are the 2 best breakfast spots in Southern California.

Reviews.Author: Mike D.
Reviews.Content: Definitely a solid brunch place. The patio competes with the noise from Melrose, but it's dog friendly and the people watching somewhat makes up for that. The menu provided plenty of choices for meat and veggie lovers. Both of us thoroughly enjoyed our meals. I look forward to trying Blu Jam again.

Reviews.Author: Heejin L.
