Reviews.Content: for what i ordered, i 'd say the place was average.it's not too hard to make an egg sandwich...Eggwich comes with potatoes, or fruit.  Egg which was supposed to be over easy but wasn't.the sandwich was Ok if you like bland.  the potatoes that came with my meal were bland also.  The skirt steak with chimichurri was Ok. THe portion was small though. it came with mashed potatoes.  Overall it was ok. My apple juice wasn't anything special, kinda like the mott's juice box you get at the store.

Reviews.Author: Marisa E.
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed brunch at Blu Jam for the first time this morning. Took me a while to decide what to order because everything made my mouth water. Decided on the Le Paris Omelette, which was exquisite. Our waitress was super friendly and my friend and I went next door to buy a bottle of champagne since mimosas were definitely in order (BYOB). The 7/11 didn't have any chillded champagne so we bought a warm bottle and when we came back to the restaurant the owner swapped our warm bottle with a chilled, nicer bottle of champagne. Above and beyond anything we expected and it was so appreciated (and enjoyed!). Overall, delicious food, friendly staff, good vibe and good parking. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Author: Raquel V.
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Blu Jam Benedict and it was very good, although not the best I've ever had. I also got to sample the Lemon Crepes (like lemon merengue pie!) and Split Pea and Lentil soups. Everything was delicious, fresh, reasonably priced (for the area) but most importantly the service was wonderful. We were acknowledged as soon as we walked in the restaurant and we were not neglected

Reviews.Author: Irene C.
Reviews.Content: The wait for 2 people for Sunday brunch was short, but I can imagine how crowded this place could get.  Great menu that offered reasonably priced breakfast and slightly more expensive brunch entrees.  For two people, the Russian scramble, Mexican hangover scramble, coffee and fresh OJ was about $40.  Not for daily consumption, but I've done worse!  The Mexican scramble was only okay compared to the awesomeness that was the Russian scramble -- lox and cherry tomatoes scrambled with eggs and topped with sour cream, a nice dollop of creamy, salty caviar, and chives.

Reviews.Author: erika h.
Reviews.Content: I am in Luv. I am never dissapointed with breakfast at the Blu Jam. The breakfast quesadilla is awesome. And the Crepes (especially the Lemon) are not to be missed. The portions are huge. I can't eat a quesadilla by myself. And I love the teas. One is infused with banana and chocolate. Enough said.

Reviews.Author: Erica H.
Reviews.Content: I've heard so many great things about this place. Brunch was great, I'll try it again and follow up. Right now it's staying at three stars for bad service

Reviews.Author: Nancy H.
Reviews.Content: In a quest to find new brunch places with coffee art, i found Blu Jam Cafe.I was sold on the coffee art posted on yelp and had to go.To my dismay, they got our drinks wrong and then to top that off I didn't even get anything close to a cool coffee art in my vanilla latte :( Not even a generic heart one. The latte itself was not good. Starbucks does it better.The wait was relatively quick (15 min wait), and the owner was really friendly. He greeted us when we arrived and then when we left. The staff was equally friendly. I have to say, nothing was overly impressive here.The french toast was good, but just ordinary. The blueberry pancakes were crispy on the outside, and moist on the inside. No complaints there.The 'crispy red potatoes' could have been more crispy.Overall, it was just A-OK.I wouldn't venture back out that way when I can get something equally as good or better on the westside.

Reviews.Author: Morgan V.
Reviews.Content: I came here based on the other Yelp reviews.. My experience was "meh". I don't see the big deal about this place. I don't know about lunch or dinner, but the breakfast (the most important meal of the day) was awful. The servers were not friendly at all. Two stars for its nice location.

Reviews.Author: Rochelle G.
Reviews.Content: I  Blu Jam.  My husband and I try to go for brunch at least 2xs a month and have never been dissapointed.  My favs are the Bird's nest, Grilled red potatoes sautéed with cherry tomatoes, baby spinach, zucchini, bell peppers and olives, topped with 2 perfectly poached eggs and  tomato-basil sauce, and Salmon Hash: Chopped fresh salmon sautéed w/ red potatoes, tomatoes, capers, chives and olives topped with poached eggs and dill hollandaise.  They also serve bread with olive tapenade.  Plus their coffees, lattes and chai tea are good too. Yum.  I'm getting hungry just thinking about it.

Reviews.Author: Kimberly R.
Reviews.Content: Great food and service we all left content and happy. I recomened this to everyone. Also they have the best french toast ever!

Reviews.Author: Lynn P.
Reviews.Content: They have a killer french toast, highly recommend trying it.

Reviews.Author: Mike K.
Reviews.Content: met some friends here for brunch yesterday and the Blu Jam lived up to the subtle hype Yelp! proclaimed...the brunch menu is pretty limited but they serve breakfast all day so really, the menu is huge on egg items...  scrambles and benedicts dominate the menu, but there are a few starch items for those looking for a different kind of hearty...i opted for the corn flake crusted french toast...  good choice, good choice.  served with some powdered sugar, your typical morning berries and a vanilla bean sauce for dipping, it oh so hit the spot.  portion was just the right size, two pieces of bread, i.e., 4 triangle slices...the egg scrambles the rest of the party ordered looked good and received two thumbs up all around...  not to mention they were pretty sizeable to say the least.the wait on a Sunday morning around 10:30-11:00 wasn't too bad, maybe 20-25 min?  put it this way, i was expecting worse, but they do a good job of cycling the customers in and out without making you feel rushed.  parking wasnt bad either, at least if you're like me and don't mind parking a block or so away in the surrounding neighborhoods off Melrose.not sure i would drive out here again solely for breakfast on my own, but meeting friends from the westside this provided a nice meeting point...  definitely worth a spot waking up from a party in the hills for...  and you have The Village Idiot right next store for those needed morning shots of vodka

Reviews.Author: Grace K.
Reviews.Content: Hands-down, the BEST spot in LA for brunch, unsurpassed in quality food, service, and genuine authenticity. I've been coming here for years for their chai (NO ONE does it better), French toast, bacon and eggs. Owner Kamil is a total gem. This is a true mom-n-pops, good people owned-n-run, authentic LA joint WITHOUT the pretentiousness of The Griddle or other "hip" brunch spots. It doesn't get any more real than Blu Jam. Sadly, this is the only good spot left on the Melrose ghosttown block...

Reviews.Author: Michelle Y.
Reviews.Content: so i finally made it to blu jam and boy am i glad that i did!!we got seated immediately which surprised me considering theres always a huge line! our very helpful waitress brought us bread and olive tapenade out  as well as our refreshments. the olive tapenade was delicious! totally unexpected twist.i ordered the vegan burger! it was tasty!! packed with veggies and had a very meaty quality to it! it was a lot of food and i was ravenous...i still couldn't finish!my bf ordered the turkey pesto and he loved every bite. he said it was flavorful and a pretty large serving!i never expected to get the bountiful plates of food in this area but we did and for the price you really can't beat it!!

Reviews.Author: Sabrina T.
Reviews.Content: Really good breakfast, no wait on a Sunday, and try the french toast. :)

Reviews.Author: Lynne C.
Reviews.Content: the kamil's breakfast, like the manly burger at umami (beer cheddar cheese, bacon lardons, onion strings, MEAT, bread) has all the things i love most in life: mac and cheese, smoked bacon, eggs, ham, garlic, chives all in a bowl. true comfort/hangover food that i can eat with a spoon (in case i'm really that wrecked the next morning--no fork and knife BS). it reminds me of edwin's pasta at swingers, but its five million times better as it uses mac and cheese!!!!the coffee is excellent. i had a glee sighting. i was very happy that morning.

Reviews.Author: Kat K.
Reviews.Content: Cute little cafe on Melrose. The eggwich here is the best breakfast sandwich I ever ate. It is bacon, avocado, pesto, lettuce, tomato, and a runny egg on ciabatta bread... I'm drooling just thinking about it. The ingredients/tastes all go perfectly together. Service is also excellent. However, we were seated next to these snobs who amused themselves by muttering comments/observations about everyone who came in, laughing quietly to themselves. That was a turn off. Typical L.A. for you. But I must come back for this sandwich whenever I'm in town! It's that good!

Reviews.Author: Naterra W.
Reviews.Content: Love this place! It's very trendy, so you may eat brunch next to an up and coming or retired actor! The food is Ah-mazing!!! I've eaten here and ordered take-out.  There can definitely be a wait most times, so prepare accordingly! But enjoy! BTW, the french toast is amazing!

Reviews.Author: Susan L.
Reviews.Content: so blu jam cafe invited me to a complimentary dinner so i couldn't pass up a free dinnermy bf and I made a reservation at 7:30pm. parking was absolutely crazy because the streets have no parking zone after 8pm.we walked in and they had seats already assigned to us. so they seated us right in.our waiter Jason came and asked us what we wanted and he gave us the dinner menu and told us that the dinner was like a tasting menu and that we can try and eat whatever we liked. we looked over the menu while he went to get us some water. we had an idea of what we wanted but we asked him for recommendations of the menu. he recommended the items and we decided to try the ceviche, baby back ribs, grilled salmon, beef goulash, risotto, and dessert. we waited about 5 minutes and then we finally got our ceviche. the ceviche, lime marinated shrimp, chipotle aioli were on top of a crispy corn tortillas. this was absolutely refreshing and had a great amount of flavor and acidity. We then got out baby back ribs and you can see the meat already falling off the bone. The ingredient were Baby back ribs, orange BBQ sauce, caramelized onions and mashed potatoes. This was my favorite of the night! Then grilled salmon was okay, it had mediterranean flavors with olives, tomatoes and other ingredients.We then got the beef goulash with gnocchi, beer-red paprika" gravy", I was excited to try the gnocchi but it was all right. This dish was all right. Nothing special. The risotto with butternut squash, baby spinach, sage cream, parmesan was good but the butternut squash was in chucks and that needed to be cooked a bit longer. I thought they could have made it much more flavorful.The last dish we got was warm berries, balsamic sauce, vanilla ice cream. This was good but I had my eye on crunchy brioche "bites", vanilla sauce, fresh strawberries, vanilla ice cream. I did not get to try this dessert, but maybe another day I will try this one. Overall, this complimentary dinner was great! so we got our bill and my bf and i ate $70 worth of food and at the end it was for FREE :) Dinner is great here but however, its just a bit pricey.our waiter Jason was absolutely great!

Reviews.Author: Ang H.
Reviews.Content: The service was prompt and attentive.  Hands down, their breakfast is a wonderful way to start your day.

Reviews.Author: Josh K.
Reviews.Content: My Blue Heaven The Blue Jam Café made me feel like I died and went to Hipster heaven yet the chicks are hot and have perfect tan complexions like their thyme roasted hash browns. I used to live in West Hollywood off Melrose yet closer to boy's town in Santa Monica which still hadn't fully embraced the brunch wave so finding this place on my nearby Yelp app after being gone for six years was a pleasant surprise like when a She-Male realized that the black man in sunglasses picking her up in the SUV that night was an A list black star that had plenty of money to burn and rubbers to rip through. Six years ago the brunch craze wasn't a wide spread obsession in LA. The only main options in West Hollywood was the cramped, never wow worthy Griddle Café yet it did offer French Press coffee back then so that was a cute novelty act that made it appear ahead of it's time yet so did the breakfast burrito at one point.  If you wanted a more upscale brunch option you'd go to Hugo's but that's more of an upscale tea restaurant for actors, pretty Gung Ho types in wife beaters and old maids like Ed Limato that did an awful job of cleaning up Richard Gere's name after it got smeared.  These are all reasons for why Blue Jam is the best thing to happen to Melrose place since Heather Locklear hooked up with Richie Sambora and took all of her new video vixen friends shopping for more leather studs  in the only area in West Hollywood where you can see sexy street traffic that causes traffic jams from behind. Blue Jam is located right off of Sierra Bonita which is a gorgeous, vibrant street that my friend lives on which is how I ended up so close to the place. His apartment is 425 Sierra Bonita and available for rent by the way.  I had the California Omelet which wasn't dried out like Tawny Kitaen or every  ex-party girl from the Rag Doll and Girl School video. The avocado was like any black heavyweight after a fight, you couldn't find a bruise in sight. And the roasted bits of bacon in the omelet made regular old bacon bits taste like dried out piggy pebbles of poo.  On top of that, my Red Eye was suburb and the wait staff was informed yet chill in a medicinal weed is here to stay sort of way. Hipsters back east should be praying to get relocated out west so they can inch closer to the light and bask in the glow of my blue heaven.

Reviews.Author: Daphne A.
Reviews.Content: Sunday mornings are for catching up on girl talk over a steaming cup of vanilla soy latte and a decadent brunch.  After reading the rave reviews of 850+ brunch-savvy Yelpers, there was no question:  Blu Jam definitely needed to be hit up.  And hit up goood.  Street parking on Melrose is plentiful at 9am on a Sunday (and free until 11. perfect!) and there was no line.  Yes!  I arrive 10 minutes before my girl and had time to peruse the menu.  Wow... so many choices!  Do I feel savory this morning? Or do I satisfy the sweet-tooth?  No matter what, I knew I was in a for a treat.  My friend arrives and we are promptly seated on a smallish table near the window.  The tables are set pretty closely next to each other, reminiscent of one of our girly brunches at The Griddle Cafe.  We literally could listen in on everyone else's convos, but whatever.  Our fellow early birds are friendly and pleasant :)On to the food.  We start with the caffeine (umm, of course!)  I order the organic coffee (a little bit disappointed that they don't offer French press); she orders a vanilla soy latte which arrives gorgeously in a cup.  Honestly, I think the barista is a master of foam!  We also order something pretty and sparkly:  "the Royal," a sparkling wine with black currant and d'arbo syrup.  I finally decide on the Crunchy French Toast since I'm such a sucker for sweet carbs..and she, The Steak Hash: Angus beef tenderloin, grilled, chopped and sautéed with spinach, caramelized onions, gorgonzola, mushrooms, red potatoes and two poached eggs on top with herb-chive hollandaise on the side.  These two dishes are gorgeous to begin with..and taste even better!  The steak is tender and juicy with chunks of perfectly seasoned potatoes..and the eggs are runny and complements the entire dish.  My French toast is egg brioche dipped in batter, then rolled in crunchy corn flakes and grilled to perfection then topped with fresh banana and berries, served with vanilla bean sauce.  It is so much better than Canele's version.  This toast is lighter, not runny/custardy like others and isn't overpoweringly sweet at all.. suffice to say, yeah...that toast got worked!By 11am, we finish up and ready to take on the day, plus, parking is up, ..and all the hipsters are finally awake and lining up in droves outside the place!  Just wanted to thank the Yelpers for helping ol' me find another amazing breakfast joint.  Must check this place out for dinner next time.  After all, it's a cafe by day, bistro by night. yay!

Reviews.Author: Wen B.
Reviews.Content: kellogs french toast was delicious.  Vegan Tortilla soup was not got at all but the chicken sandwich was yummy.

Reviews.Author: Caroline N.
Reviews.Content: This place absolutely deserve all the stars it can get. The atmosphere and service was wonderful, and I very much enjoyed the food. Too bad it is in LA and getting there is a pain in the butt. But with the friendly service and high quality foods definitely makes the drive worth it.

Reviews.Author: Caroline T.
Reviews.Content: Came here after a long 12 hour shift. I think it's a ritual now for me to try different brunch joints after work. Anyways, I got the MIGAS which is an egg scramble with chorizo, bell peppers, cheese and with pico de gallo on top. I liked it but i didn't love it. I saw other people ordering the eggs benedict. I personally am not a fan...hollandaise is not my thing but i'll probably try it next time. Didn't get to try the famous french toast either. I will do that next time.

Reviews.Author: Christina L.
Reviews.Content: service was very good. all of the wait staff we encountered was friendly (we went two days in a row). they were really helpful in explaining dishes. highly recommended:-crunchy french toast-kamil's breakfast (extra tasty mac and cheese with eggs and bacon, ham, and chedder)-blu jam benedict (this was amazing! except i didn't like the potatoes as i do not like rosemary so i don't fault them for that)i also love the outdoor seating. great for nice sunny mornings and people watching =)OH and the coffee is fantastic too. all organic. great stuff.also, i saw the reviews where they had to wait forever to eat. i didn't have that problem. i went around 9-9:30 both mornings. i think it gets super crowded later around 11 and on. so note that if you want breakfast/brunch.

Reviews.Author: ANGELA J.
Reviews.Content: Yes the french toast is all that and a bag of cornflakes.  We had a great time and a great meal. The staff was friendly and attentive, the food was very flavorful.  Nothing negative at all.  Expect a wait when you go on a weekend, we went on a Sunday around 1p the wait was approx 40 min. If you put your name on the list, you had better be around when they call you or you WILL get passed up and they are on to the next person in line.  We heard our name called but there were quite a few people whose names were called a couple of times and then they kept it movin. The place is small yet roomy.  I will be returning.  I wasn't doing carbs but that french toast made me carb out.  I just had to try it and it was worth every gram of carbs.  Yummy

Reviews.Author: Connie L.
Reviews.Content: A solid brunch spot if you're in the area. There's a bit of a wait, but it's never too bad and you can check out stores around the area in the meantime. I ordered the steak and eggs - steak was cooked just fine but lacking in flavor. Thank goodness for the caramelized onions and the nicely poached eggs. Coffee was just OK. Large portions, tended to be on the pricier side (entrees $12-$20). Friendly albeit slow-ish service.

Reviews.Author: Rebecca M.
Reviews.Content: Cute brunch place! Came here with the girls for brunch and were seated rather promptly for a brunch place in LA, even tho there were many on the wait list. Loved the vanilla French toast! Also, the Blu Jam Benedict was delicious :)

Reviews.Author: Audrey N.
Reviews.Content: I was a a unbeliever that places known for their brunch (eggs, eggs, more eggs) could have equally good sandwiches...until I came here and had their Tuscan Chicken Sandwich. Mmmm epiphanies over a delicious lunch - I wish every Saturday morning was like this

Reviews.Author: Ivy N.
Reviews.Content: I came here for brunch after my hike at runyon canyon - ordered the Spicy Tex Mex Tofu Hash (Vegan) it was delicious very full of flavor I couldn't believe I was eating Vegan food! It came with 3 tortillas to fill up and the portion was a very good size I had the most delicious dinner later with it! =) I am excited to come back and try out the other items!

Reviews.Author: Jenny T.
Reviews.Content: Very popular brunch spot and worthy of the hype! The wait is usually long, but the food is worth it. Blu Jam is located on Melrose in the middle of a bunch of great shops to wander in while you're waiting.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie T.
Reviews.Content: BEST french toast I've had thus far! Before I write my review I need to explain why I give it a 4 instead of 5 and that's the wait. This place isn't that big so you better expect to wait especially on the weekends. We sat outside by the entrance and a lot of people were standing around since it was right off the street and there isn't much of a waiting area. I dislike sitting so close to people waiting but what can I do. I would recommend this place just for the french toast.

Reviews.Author: Joyce Y.
Reviews.Content: This place is crowded starting at 10:30.  We waited for about half an hour and got seated at 11.My friend and I both shared the florentine benedict and their famous crunchy french toast. Florentine benedict:  poached eggs on top of spinach and mushrooms on top of an english muffin.  Comes with potatoes.  This was delicious!  We put the hollandaise sauce on the side since we're not big fans of mayonnaise-y sauces.  Eggs were yummy!  $11.95Crunch french toast:  yummy!!  The corn flake crust gave it a delicious crunchy texture and didn't overpower the french toast.  The french toast was tender.  Topped with delicious blueberries, strawberries, and banana and vanilla sauce!  I wish they gave more vanilla sauce, though.  $11.95My friend ordered their coffee while I ordered their vanilla latte.  The vanilla late had a nice spider-web latte art and the drink was huge!  Vanilla latte was really really sweet, though.  $4.50 for a vanilla latte. We were stuffed!!Come early or else the line will be long.Parking:  You can do valet but we parked on the street.  2 hours parking on the street, metered parking.

Reviews.Author: Marilynn L.
Reviews.Content: Big portions, yes. Average taste. Eggs Benedict overwhelmingly creamy, ahi tuna sandwich was flavorless (needed some more of that chipotle mayonnaise!), and breakfast nachos were too loaded and mushy. Don't understand the hype.

Reviews.Author: Alex T.
Reviews.Content: I'm not really the type of person to wait in line for a long time for breakfast, but one day we decided to check out Blu Jam Cafe cause we read good reviews on Yelp...And right from the start I was a huge fan after just coming only a couple of times and trying the Olympus and Muscle Beach protein breakfast... I didn't even know about the Crispy corn flake french toast, but once I had them too I was sold on the place... I love the hostess with her red hair and attitude.. and the servers are always doing a great job when I'm there. I mainly come on Mondays since the weekends are always crazy. I like coming to a place not just  cause it's close to where I live but when the owner comes to your table and says nice to see you again. That to me always makes a great  restaurant!! Keep it up Blu Jam!

Reviews.Author: Justine C.
Reviews.Content: I could write a novel about how good Blu Jam is, but I think what speaks loudest is I will sit outside in the boiling sun for an hour starving just to eat brunch here. The vibe is great, everyone is always enjoying themselves, and always respectful about the line outside and do not hang around. The service is great, and the food comes out fast. Now for the food. I have dreams about the Burrata with strawberries, and even though I swear I am going to branch out I can't stop myself from ordering the Eggwich. In all the cities I have lives (and this includes NYC, which is the Brunch Capital of the world) Blu Jam is my favorite restaurant. I have never had a bad dish there in all the meals I have eaten there. It is however very disappointing that they had to close for dinner and no longer have their liquor license :( Everyone go to Blu Jam and support this amazing place!

Reviews.Author: Elda P.
Reviews.Content: Great place for breakfast but be prepared for the 1hr wait. A half an hour to be seated and another half hour for you order to be served!!!  Also, make sure you at least pay the 2hrs max on your meter...metermaids are ticketing!!! Blu jam cafe valets. The meal portions are enough to share. I had the power breakfast (egg whites a bit wattery and chicken was not grilled but maybe baked and a bit on the tough side) and French toast (it was yummy)

Reviews.Author: Carling H.
Reviews.Content: The crunchy french toast is SUPERB and easily split between two people. It sucks that you have to wait so long for a table, but ITS TOTALLY worth it!! I will definitely be back for seconds...possibly thirds :)

Reviews.Author: Jenn N.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely amazing food, the crunch French toast was out of this world but so was the blue jam benedict.

Reviews.Author: C B.
Reviews.Content: I was here in the morning recently.  After reading their menu online and all the good reviews I was very excited.After tracking down the waitress - I had to get up to find her - I waited 46 minutes for a simple bowl of oatmeal.  It was good, not the price they were charging good, but I mean you can't mess up oatmeal.  But after waiting 46 minutes, I would expect it would be spectacular.  The coffee was excellent.The waitress was very rude, called me "hon" and "sweetie" when she was clearly ten years my junior.  I find that disrespectful.  During the meal, she slammed down waters or the milk for coffee.  At the end of the meal we asked for separate checks and  she lectured us on asking for separate checks before  we ordered because "it's just easier that way, hon."As a former server, I know separate checks are a pain in the ass, but she acted like I just kicked her dog.  Plus, you never say that to a customer that's about to leave a tip in the way she did.The food is okay.  Service needs work.

Reviews.Author: Rich T.
Reviews.Content: Went there for the first time for Briana's birthday, and I'm in love.   Well, yeah, with her, of course...  But also, I'm in love with the cornflake french toast.  Amazing.  It was by far the best french toast I've ever had.  Perfectly crunchy, the bread wasn't the least bit soggy or over-eggy, and there was some flavor sneaking out of it that was wonderful.  As usual, I shared with B, and she monopolized the great vanilla bean sauce (it WAS her birthday, after all).  I was struck by how busy the staff were, especially the guy at the door, but also by how friendly and polite they all were.   All of this would have been fine, but then I ordered a side of crunchy red potatoes.  They looked fine, and basically like all other red potatoes, so I let them sit awhile while I carried on my budding love affair with the French Toast (and the longer-term one with B).  After awhile, I took a bite, and Oh My!  The best ever.   I made her try them over and over, imploring her to tell me what the hidden flavor was (she claimed Rosemary and a little salt, but I fantasize it's far more exotic and mysterious than that.) .  TRY THESE.I always love restaurants where the standard, basic dishes are very different from what you expected, due to the skill and creativity of those in the kitchen (or who run the place).So I wolfed down my crunchy french toast, and pounded down the potatoes, and I am completely in love.  (okay, you know what I mean). Leaving a star uncrossed here, only making it 4, so that there's room for another dish on my second visit to this wonderful little place.  Sorry, regulars, yet another has found your secret, and will probably be ahead of you on the wait list next Sunday.Incidentally, on their Facebook page, the owner mentions some of his problems with city hall and regulations and such, and asks for support.  So hit this place and try it, or if you're a regular, add another visit, to help the guy out, and keep his great staff up to full strength.

Reviews.Author: Leanne T.
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but great things to say about this place!  The breakfast/brunch is A-W-E-S-O-M-E!!!  My boyfriend and I usually get the the Eggwich and Breakfast Quesadilla, but they've got great french toast and egg dishes which are to die for.  And Kamil's Goulash is the best soup I've ever had.  Hearty and Tasty with every bite.  The staff is friendly, the food is good and the atmosphere is cozy/trendy.  This is def my new favorite spot!

Reviews.Author: Enna R.
Reviews.Content: It was a gorgeous, warm Wednesday afternoon when we decided to stop by Blu Jam Cafe. Even though it was 1in the afternoon, neither of us had had breakfast yet so this was the perfect place. My friend ended up having a Mexican Omelette which he devoured. I had the red beets and greens salad which was great. I love beets and I love goat cheese, so I was in my happy place. I was hoping for a bit more of the balsalmic dressing but I didn't ask for it. I typically don't care for meat or chicken in my salads but that day I was in the mood for some protein so I asked for it on the side. I would say that the chicken was a bit dry on the ends so I am glad I stuck to my decision to have it on the side. Overall a very pleasant way to spend a Wednesday afternoon.

Reviews.Author: Kai-Lee P.
Reviews.Content: I loved the breakfast quesadilla...soo good. And the hidden french toast as well. My party and I sat in the private wine room, where they have a flat screen. The only thing I did not like is the no split check policy, so bring cash and enjoy the food!

Reviews.Author: Andi I.
Reviews.Content: awesome  breakfast/brunch joint. i only wish i wasn't feeling sick. otherwise i would've licked my plate clean. i ordered the lemon crepe that just melted in my mouth. i found my fork trying to find its way to more goodness. the ladyfriend was also happy with her via roma. i would've tried it, but my stomach was a little scrambled out from eggs. it looked delicious though. the only part i am disappointed with are the potatoes. it seems to be a trend in every breakfast joint we've been to. they just lack flavor. but hey at least the food didn't look like they took a communal bath in oil.now my list of good breakfast places is growing finally!

Reviews.Author: R S.
Reviews.Content: Thank you Yelpers, with your help we had another breakfast experience that hit the spot and left us feeling satisfied & full.  So far the only breakfast place I know that serves pasta in their egg dishes (the Sicilian) and the pancakes are huge and tasty.  There were a lot of choices and relatively reasonably priced. Their coffee was just okay, but they had a very attentive coffee re-filler upper.  An added bonus is that you can window shop on Melrose to walk off your meal.

Reviews.Author: Samantha G.
Reviews.Content: Sooooo busy on a Sunday morning, but totally worth the wait.  Everything is delicious and can be made healthy.  It's a great place to people watch.

Reviews.Author: Christina Y.
Reviews.Content: The ambiance at this place is great. I felt like I was at jazz cafe. I ordered the Florentine Benedict, which was okay. My friend and I both loved the Kamil's breakfast special which was mac and cheese scrambled with eggs and bacon. I wish I would have ordered something more adventurous. I was in one of those situations where the person I was eating with had way better food! I had food envy from across the table. My friend ordered the plum Olong tea that was delicious, whereas I had a vanilla latte that was just too sweet. So it's really the luck of the draw if you are coming here for the first time. I found this place on the yelp application on an Iphone, so definitely take the time to look at the pictures of the dishes before you come here for the first time. It was a satisfactory breakfast, but I'm probably not gonna rush to eat here again next time I come back to LA

Reviews.Author: Marissa L.
Reviews.Content: Came here for one of those let's have breakfast at 3 o'clock in the afternoon kinda days. I wasn't expecting much when I walked in but boy was I wrong! The menu was really good with all the best breakfast foods, and the best part, the food was excellent!  The service was great too. Our waitress was there when we needed her and very helpful. As I began to look around after I fed my hunger monster I noticed this place is really cute and they had a counter you could order coffee and food from. I was really impressed and want to go back very soon!

Reviews.Author: Stacy L.
Reviews.Content: I went to Blu Jam for Saturday Brunch with one of my girlfriends and we both enjoyed it quite thoroghly. Given that it was a Saturday Morning, it was poppin' but we got seated quickly and the hostess was sweet the whole way. Our server was nice, constantly checking up on us and taking the liberty to bring over 2 waters, "bc the glasses are small". Most importantly the food was good, not AMAZING, but good brunch food (CA omelet and french toast with berries &bananas) and I'm glad we went! overall it's a yummy place and the atmosphere and service we got was great. 4 stars, blu jam! =)

Reviews.Author: Patrick D.
Reviews.Content: Great place to dine.   this is one place where the owner/cook takes pride in its food, Prices are a little spicy (high), but the food speaks for itself

Reviews.Author: Shane S.
Reviews.Content: My favorite brunch place in LA.  Slow service (seems to be the norm for brunch places in LA) but worth it if you're not in a hurry.  They let you substitute, have some outside seating and the price is right.  Plenty of street parking avail too.  Can't go wrong.  I'll be here lots!

Reviews.Author: shortyjessie t.
Reviews.Content: ummm...first of all, i don't think i have ever had a bad experience from this place. I tend to go for their egg benedict and french toast. their generous portion certainly satisfies the hunger. Taste is good, and service is wonderful. Wanna people watch? It's a good place to do that too!!!BUT BUT BUT BUT BUT, they dont accept reservation. And what do you get for good food but no reservation? Be very prepared to wait for at least 30 to 45 minutes to get seated. ALSO, no dinner available. ooooo, yummy yummy breakfast!!

Reviews.Author: Susanna S.
Reviews.Content: I decided to check the place out on MLK day. The menu looked great. I was indecisive about what to order because there were so many great options. We ordered the Florentine Benedict, California omelette,  and this Chicken dish on a bed of macaroni, I can't believe I forgot the name despite the fact the owner overheard us talking about it and told us what it was called. I didn't like my Loxex too much but the other dishes were amazing. I was reading that the service was great and I agree the owner was super friendly. The blondie waitress we had was only friendly in the beginning and eventually just disappeared. I would say she might've been flustered because it does get really busy in there but... the place was only half filled.

Reviews.Author: Nora K.
Reviews.Content: Got there around 10am for a Sunday brunch and was nervous that I would have to wait a while to get a table. The patio was pretty packed, but we got seated right away inside the restuarant. The menu had different varieties to choose from. I got an egg dish with sun dried tomatoes and spinach with potatoes on the side (paris something... forgot what it was called). It was pretty good. Not too heavy for a brunch, but enough to keep me full and going for the rest of the day until dinner time. My friend ordered a strawberry crepe w/o the cottage cheese and it came out looking and tasting delicious! even the customers to my right was looking and asking about the dish. it wasnt too sweet or anything too, so it didnt really feel like you were eating a dessert for brunch (nothing wrong with that btw).overall, it was a yummy place. very chill and relaxing atmosphere. the waiters were pretty attentative even though it was busy. always had waiter and coffee at my table. never empty. I even saw Cutner from house eating with some of his friends :) my first start sighting. haha I feel so hip now -__-

Reviews.Author: Rachel T.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE BLUE JAM!!!!  I have a great meal every time I come here!!

Reviews.Author: Grace L.
Reviews.Content: Came here for breakfast/brunch with my friend Derrick & Janet Anne P. Janet & I both got the breakfast deal with eggs, brioche french toast, & bacon.  The brioche french toast is excellent but you gotta eat it quick before it gets too soggy (not that that's a problem!) & the bacon was nice & thick & crispy! mmMmm... Griddle Cafe's still my favorite breakfast place but Blu Jam's a close one!

Reviews.Author: Shening S.
Reviews.Content: finally! blu jam cafe! SOOOOO I know everyone's been raving about their brioche french toast! sadly, I wasn't able to get the special corn flake crusted french toast since they only have that on weekend...booothis place has nice outdoor seating like Toast, but there's less seating. Service was reallly good! and very friendly! maybe just MAYBE it was because our food was taking so long?? I don't know why? I had the french toast and my friend got the roma via paris which was pretty standard but had more flavor from the sun-dried tomatoes, basil, bell peppers etc. Oh! and the goat cheese...man I was still tasting that after the meal....no bueno. I think my fav part was the potatoes! bite size and crispy!This another cute breakfast/brunch/lunch place in la where u can people watch and get somewhat of a tan outside haha oh and p.s. THEY SERVE BREAKFAST ALL DAY LOOOOOOONGfor that, they automatically get 3 stars in my book!

Reviews.Author: Grace E.
Reviews.Content: Great AtmosphereGreat ServicePERFECT scrambled eggs - moist but not runny! The turkey sausage was flavored with an herd I personally didn't care for, but others may like it. The pancakes were also solid. I've also heard amazing things about the french toast, so I'll be trying that next time.Only minus is they don't have fountain sodas and they charge $2.50 per can...

Reviews.Author: Ella G.
Reviews.Content: Cute little cafe with a great variety of breakfast/brunch dishes.  They were busy but seated us within 10 minutes.  Service was ok but they did charge for salsa when we asked for it even though it was on the menu as being part of the dish ordered.  In any case, the food was good and the seating was comfortable.  I would recommend it if you are in the area.

Reviews.Author: Tyson G.
Reviews.Content: If you are a granola fan...do yourself a favor and try the "Hearty Granola".  Huge bowl of tasty granola with fresh fruit and yogurt, and I mean a big bowl of it.  They never let my coffee cup reach empty so I left with a caffeine rush and extra pep in my step.  Service was excellent and food was delicious...the vanilla french toast looked pretty amazing too.  If I wasn't moving to New York, I'd make this place a regular stop.

Reviews.Author: Chuck H.
Reviews.Content: Typical WeHo eatery with amazing food and great service! We tried the crunchy french toast (available only on weekend brunch menu) and that was excellent! Also tried the Miga omellette which was nice and refreshing. Portions are generous! This is a must try when walking the streets of Melrose.

Reviews.Author: Kevin C.
Reviews.Content: My experience here was great. The breakfast is so gooood! I ordered the Crunchy French Toast, omg it was the best french toast I have ever had in my life! The service is awesome and so is the environment. I would definitely come here again and recommend my friends to go here.

Reviews.Author: Lena Y.
Reviews.Content: oh so very good!! we had: Burrata, fresh strawberries, micro greens, aged balsamic vinaigrette, grilled bread; Sautéed jumbo scallops, herb-parsley sauce, lemon-asparagus risotto; Beef goulash, pan roasted gnocchis, beer-red paprika "gravy"... omg everything was very delicious! burrata with strawberries was so good and almost dessert sweet, which i didn't mind. scallops were a bit too salty for my taste, but i have low salt tolerance. then we had goulash...and it was sooo good!!! growing up in Russia, my Russian nanny used to make this one for us all the time, so i had high expectations. i am definitely coming back for more!

Reviews.Author: Magid H.
Reviews.Content: I went here with 3 friends visiting from Australia and we all had a breakfast. Mine was Paris via Roma eggs. It was delicious and very fresh, the potatoes were so good. Their freshly squeezed OJ is to die for. My friends has eggs benedict, I did not try it but they loved it..This place is well worth it...

Reviews.Author: Lauren R.
Reviews.Content: Stopped by for brunch early on a Sunday morning, luckily we had gotten there early because it got packed fast. I had their famous crunchy french toast - DELICIOUS!! I also had a side of bacon and that was pretty darn delicious as well. My friends had some egg plates which also looked really tasty, everyone seemed really satisfied with their meals. Our waiter was very attentive and always had a huge smile on his face, that was really refreshing and great to see. I really enjoyed my meal, the only real thing I would say is to go early on the weekend because it does get packed very quickly.

Reviews.Author: Laura G.
Reviews.Content: The breakfast choices are amazing & probably deserve 5 stars, but the wait is awful.  We waited 45 minutes to be seated.  Almost doesn't make you want to come back even though the breakfast is great.  Definitely recommend the place if you don't mind waiting.  Just eat something before you get there.

Reviews.Author: Jerry G.
Reviews.Content: Beware the wait is loco!   Told 45 to an hour it took 40 min.   I would never go back for breakfast because 1 hour wait is not worth it.  Once we got to eat the food the service was exceptional, but management needs to book reservations the food was 4.5 stars though.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie W.
Reviews.Content: i went here for brunch on a saturday around noon, and it wasnt that busy when we got there. we were seated about 10 mins after we came, which was ok. we ordered the steak hash, blu jam benedict and the pancakes.the server was friendly and the food came out quite fast. i took my first bite, and it was really good! i really like the way they cooked their eggs benedict, it was fluffy and the yolk was still runny. just how i like em.the steak hash that my mom ordered was also very good. it was cooked thorughly, but not dry at all.the potatoes that came with the plates were also very well-seasoned, crisp and good.as for the pancakes, it was really good but not the best i've ever had.overall, i really loved the food and ambiance of the place. i'd come back again for sure. tip: come before 1pm to avoid the crowd and long wait. especially on the weekend.

Reviews.Author: Dave S.
Reviews.Content: So I finally decided to try Blu Jam Cafe because I'm learning to like Eggs Benedict when certain places don't make Chicken Fried Steak and Corned Beef Hash.  I got there when they opened at 8am and got the only deuce next to the window.  Within minutes, the place started to fill up.  I can only imagine what it looks like as I type this review at 10am.  There is probably a line on Melrose. The place has a few quad tables, and about 30 deuces that are moveable to make quads and larger.  You can probably put in a party of 20 along the big wall by combining tables, so they are very flexible with their seating space. Very smart for a place with a small dining room.I orded the Norwegian Benedict which is smoked salmon, spinich, tomato and poached eggs on top of a croissant.  It's topped with dill hollandaise sauce.  It's served with grilled red potato wedges.  I also ordered one blueberry pancake.  The coffee is really good.it's like the chef knew what he was doing.  I got the benedict without the pancake.  I was able to enjoy the savory portion of the meal before the sweet.  Maybe it was a mistake for the pancake being late, but it was a good mistake.  The benedict was okay.  The salmon didn't have that big of a smokey flavor so the hollandaise and egg yolk overpowered it.  The croissant added a buttery flavor, but the texture of the croissant is crushed by the toppings, so I would say it's like a soft pie crust instead of a flakey croissant.  I think a crispy english muffin would give this dish better texture.  The red potatoes are crispy on the outside, but the wedges are so big, the crispy to soft ratio was very small.  The only savior for these potatoes were the yolk and hollandaise sauce.  They do serve a ketchup in a small sauce tin and maybe it's the tin presentation, but I thought the ketchup was homemade.  I guess you can put a few drops of apple cider vinegar into some Heinz and make it taste gourmet.  I'm not saying this is what Blu Jam does, but the ketchup tasted good too.The star of the show was the single blueberry pancake that arrived when I was done with the benedict.  It was perfect timing.  A crispy edge pancake with blueberrys and powder sugar with real maple syrup.  Great texture on the outside and soft pillowy on the inside.  I probably could have forced myself to eat an entire stack of these, but luckily for my belly, I only got 1.

Reviews.Author: Leigh D.
Reviews.Content: Delicious, healthy - a must-try if you're in LA. I wish we had this place in SF.

Reviews.Author: Brian S.
Reviews.Content: Came here for a fantastic brunch and only had to wait about 5 minutes for a table!  Everything on the menu sounded so good, it was almost impossible to decide what to get.  After much deliberation, ordered the Spicy Tofu Hash and a short stack of Blueberry pancakes.  The hash was a delicious savory dish that had a nice kick of spiciness to it.  The pancakes were cooked to perfection, managing to be moist on the inside with a light crisp to the outside, dare I say, it may have been the best pancake I've ever tried!  I'd love to come back and try more of the dishes!

Reviews.Author: Janice K.
Reviews.Content: Very popular place for brunch/lunch. Food is good here but a bit pricey. Nice, comfortable ambiance.

Reviews.Author: Bacong F.
Reviews.Content: Tried it for breakfast and dinner.  Tried 4 dishes for breakfast and about 6 for dinner.  Both times were okay.  Not bad but nothing really stood out either.

Reviews.Author: Mrs H.
Reviews.Content: This is only for what I had eaten there.  I had the Tex Mex tofu scramble as some yelpers said it was really good.  I came with a party of eight and the trio breakfast was nothing special. It was basic and plain and according to my hubby not filling at all he was still hungry. I had someone order the breAkfast burger and that was good and also the banana pancakes was decent. The cornflakes French toast was nothing special since my guest didn't finish them.  So long story short... Unless I'm by myself I won't be back since everyone else I was with didn't think it was all that great.  And the wait on Sat around 1030 was 45 min as it was so busy.

Reviews.Author: Kimiyo I.
Reviews.Content: I'm not a breakfast person, but I will get my butt out of bed just to eat here!I've been here twice for a girls brunch date. The first time, we decided to split so we could try more.  At the recommendation of the waitress we had the crunchy french toast and breakfast risotto...both were life changingingly delicious.  The crunchy french toast is super crispy with just the right combo of sweet and buttery savory.  The risotto, as decadent as risotto is, was rich and creamy, but light tasting at the same time.  It has a nice fresh taste from the green pea, but good saltiness from whatever srumdiidliupcious bits o' meat that are in there.  To make it even more mind blowing, it's topped with a poached egg, which after you crack it, melts into the risotto adding another layer of creamy goodness.  The combination of these two are so good, I couldn't bring myself to order anything else off the menu my second go round; although I'm sure there are even more delectible goodies that have yet to be discovered.  The service staff are always really great.  The wait and parking can be a bear, but it's worth it.  GO NOW!

Reviews.Author: Lyn F.
Reviews.Content: OMG! This place has the best french toast I've ever tasted hands down! :)

Reviews.Author: Gina L.
Reviews.Content: Stopped n for a quick bite for breakfast, had the California omelette and migas.The omelette was okay and so was the migas, pancakes were, meh. It wasnt anything to write home about, maybe it was what we ordered but then again, the service wasnt that hot either.  Never came back to refill coffee or water, usually what you do when you want a table to leave, one refill would have been nice.  Oh well...

Reviews.Author: Margery N.
Reviews.Content: Went to visit my son in LA and stumbled here by chance and boy were we sooo happy we did! They have the most amazing French toast covered in crushed corn flakes with fresh blueberries and strawberries with I think was a vanilla coconut sauce on the side -absolute heaven!! For breakfast I ordered some kind of breakfast risotto (sorry wished I posted this earlier than I would've remembered the name)! My son ordered a Vegeterian breakfast hash and it lolled like you could feed 2 people easily! This place was so good I had to come again before I left home for Hawaii! Of course I had to order that French toast again and tried their eggs Benedict and was not disappointed! The ambience was perfect, the help was always very welcoming and did everything right! Coming back in September this time with my hubby and guess where I'm gonna take him for breakfast?? :)

Reviews.Author: Caprina A.
Reviews.Content: Great goulash soup. Better than Prague. Good bacon, norwegian Benedict

Reviews.Author: Steven P.
Reviews.Content: Had excellent looking and tasting food...the place is a bit smooshed, had to sit pretty close to the party next to us. And it took a little longer to get our food on my visit, it was pretty busy, so ill give them the benefit of the doubt. However food quality totally outweighs the wait.

Reviews.Author: Melinda L.
Reviews.Content: I went here this past friday based on a recommendation from a facebook friend. I told my friend when he picks me up from the LAX we are were str8 to Blu Jam. I really wanted to check this place out. We took the street from LAX to Melrose and Labrea, OMG, I have not lived in los angeles in 5yrs and forgot how silly the traffic is. Well my friend said it was best to take the street cuz the freeway was out of control at 8something am on a friday. Anyway, we were able to find street parking on a side street rather quickly. We were seated quickly no wait at all. I thought the place was going to be bigger, but hey it didn't matter. I ordered the Breakfast trio which was alright, my friend ordered French Toast. I also ordered the Crunchy French Toast, when I read the description of it, I knew I had to have it. The Crunchy French Toast was good especially with the vanilla bean sauce, that really set it off. Now the Crunchy French Toast the next was not good at all. I would not recommend taking it go for later. As you know soggy corn flakes are not the business, very nasty. I came out of there spending $47 for the two of us. I thought a little pricey, but you can never pay too much for new experiences with good company. I would go there again if I was ever in the area.

Reviews.Author: Dan L.
Reviews.Content: Good service. GREAT coffee and lemony well seasoned hollandaise on the Benedict.  No need to say more!!

Reviews.Author: Jane B.
Reviews.Content: okok. i'm not a brunch kind of girl (i live off rice and noodle ;D) and some friends wanted to come here so i just gave it a try (the good ratings from yelp helped too)we had a party of 10 and the host were lying to us about 20min wait. we ended up waiting for 40min. smaller groups should be able to sit faster..when we finally got in, our table was located in a smaller-cave looking-room with no door. and it was hot as hell. the server told us that the AC inside that room broke and after a while, they finally gave us a fan.ok, move on with the food.. so i tried:blu jam benedicts: 7/10 just average. like any regular egg benedict..salmon and spinach: 9/10 omg. the sauce is amazing. please try!steak hash: 8/10 steak, mushroom, egg benedict, potatoes. need i say more?brunch carbonara: 8/10 yummy risotto!!kamil's lunch: 5/10. this was my order. i was so disappointed!! it is basically like a big bowl of tomato soup, dumped with macaroni and potatoes. i only finished half of the bowl.crunchy french toast: 12/10! The only reason why i give this place a high rating. if my wallet supported me, i would eat here like every morning -this is critical especially coming from this humble rice and noodle girl-...  yummy crunchy warm french toast with banana and blueberry with vanilla dipping sauce (some friends said they dont need the dip coz its already sweet)and oh yeah, parking sucks. if you dont come early enough you have to find parking near the residents' house, where you will find stupid drivers who park their car in the middle of a two-car parking spot.thats all readers. Viva CRUNCHY FRENCH TOAST!

Reviews.Author: Allen P.
Reviews.Content: first of all,  the food is really good. The 45 minute wait for breakfast was worth it all in all. The waiter was so nice, he never rushed us and always attentive. Would I go back and wait 45 minutes again? probably not, just because I get really hungry early morning.

Reviews.Author: Sarah P.
Reviews.Content: I've been here three times, and I had such a great meal each time!  We got there around 10:30 on a Sat morning and there wasn't a wait which was great.  This past time, I had an Old World scramble with onions, mushrooms, and mozzarella.  My friend had a Tuscany omelet that came with pasta in it.  I never had a omelet with pasta.  Both dishes were delish.  We also had a side of blueberry pancakes and a side of fruit.  It was splendid with all that food on our little table.  Service was a bit slow, but they were friendly.  I can't wait to come back again to try something new..

Reviews.Author: Maasai K.
Reviews.Content: Went to breakfast today, great space, very LA chic. Owner was there to say hello. Ordered blueberry pancakes but was very disappointed. They were kinda bitter, I guess it was cornmeal batter. But I did get 3 ginormous pancakes :) Never-the-less, I will go back and try other things on the menu.

Reviews.Author: Louisa O.
Reviews.Content: We had our ladies' brunch here today, and we loved it.  They sat us in a small private nook.  We didn't have to wait too long because we had a reservation.  They take reservations for parties of 6+.  To start with they had great passion fruit iced tea and absolutely fresh coffee.  I tried the Florentine Benedict, which had a great combination of flavors. The ladies had a combination of sandwiches, salads and breakfast items.  Everyone seemed more than satisfied with their choice.  We also got shared some crepes at the end... the lemon one and a banana walnut nutella crepe.  Both were delicious, but I'm genetically predisposed to favor nutella.  Overall, great experience!

Reviews.Author: JD H.
Reviews.Content: We came in here for a quick brunchy brunch.  I got a lunch special- organic tofu asian salad- it was pretty yummy.  My fiance and I shared the blu jam french toast.  The cream cheese and blackberry jam filling was amazing but they served it with fake maple syrup.  I thought the whole point of overpriced yuppy brunch was the mangoes in the fruit salad and real maple syrup.  The service was a little slow but they were very nice.  Overall it was a pleasant meal.

Reviews.Author: Cecily J.
Reviews.Content: Yumm!!!  We live in walking distance and went there for the first time last week - I have no idea what took us so long.  We've already been back.  Both times we went for breakfast & we loved it.  BF likes it so much he wrote a love letter on their comment card.  The service was friendly, the food was fresh & delicious & the soy lattes are perfect & so lovely...  It's the little things...  First time I had the Old World & BF had the Migas - fabulous.  The second time I had the Muscle Beach & BF had Hangover Burrito.  All fantastic.   I'm going back Tuesday morning for a business breakfast & I can't wait.

Reviews.Author: M. M.
Reviews.Content: I liked the food and service. It was very nice!

Reviews.Author: jane m.
Reviews.Content: YUMMERS!!!This place is so delish!  We came on Labor Day and the wait was gonna be pretty long for parties of 2 or 4 but we were 6 and a table had just opened up about 10 minutes after we got there.  My sister and I ordered Old world - scrabbled eggs with cheese and mushrooms and it was seasoned really yummy with rosemary and came with rosemary toast.  And we also split the french toast which was fluffy and made perfectly with brioche bread served with berries.  I also ordered the vanilla latte and seriously, it was the best I ever had.  Defiantly coming back here.  Our waitress  and hostess was really nice too.

Reviews.Author: Ev T.
Reviews.Content: Venetian Chicken Sandwich was totally tubular. French toast is the real deal. The tea was fantastic and the staff guided me through my emotional struggles in finding the right thing on the menu.

Reviews.Author: meredith m.
Reviews.Content: YUMMM!!!!  My girlfriend took me to brunch here about two weeks ago.  I had heard about Blu Jam, but was unsure what the buzz was! - That was until I had breakfast there!  I had the breakfast sandwich - no words!  It was fantastic.  The service was spectacular and we were treated like family!  Thumbs up, I definitely suggest you schedule your next brunch at Blu Jam Cafe.

Reviews.Author: Shawn F.
Reviews.Content: Best breakfast in LA--By far. The El Fuego Scramble is amazing.

Reviews.Author: Alex F.
Reviews.Content: Found this place on Yelp and decided to give it a go for a late brunch. Thoroughly enjoyed my Toscana scramble - pesto & mozzarella in my eggs? Yes please. The staff was very friendly and the clientele was very good-looking. I'll be back for sure. Great brunch spot. The wait to get in was about 20 minutes, and this was on a cloudy day at 1:30pm...so I would imagine it's pretty packed on a typical sunny LA morning.

Reviews.Author: john h.
Reviews.Content: Great meal on melrose ave.  The staff is friendly and attentive. I had the southwest wrap today, I was really impressed with this. The best part actually was the side of fruit I got with my wrap, it was probably some of the best fruit I've ever had at a restaurant. But I don't want to take away from the wrap, it was unique in flavor complexity and a hardy portion. I definitely suggest people in the area to try this out.

Reviews.Author: M L.
Reviews.Content: Food was good but service disappointing and integrity questionable.  My daughter wanted the french toast with vanilla bean sauce as she had read positive reviews.  While there for brunch, she asked the waiter and pointed on the menu and asked if this was the french toast with the yummy vanilla bean sauce....to which the waiter replied 'yes, indeedy.'  My other daughter ordered something entirely different but asked if toast/bread came with her meal and the waiter replied 'yes, indeedy, which would you like:  sourdough, rosemary......etc etc.'When we questioned where the vanilla sauce was, the waiter now back pedaled and said it was available 'only on weekends.'  hmmmWhen our bill arrived, we were charged $2 for the one slice of rosemary toast (cut into 2 pieces) and questioned it.  The waiter now said that toast was not included in the entree order.    hmmmWe were not pleased with this waiter/servers integrity and it left a bad taste in our mouth.  We also sat and watched as other diners who came in us were served ahead of us.    hmmmOur meal was good but all in all, can't give more than 3 stars overall.

Reviews.Author: C. K.
Reviews.Content: I've been to Blu Jam a few times, and love their blueberry crepes. It's not too sweet, and is loaded up with fresh blueberries. The brioche french toast was just okay when I had it, as mine was slightly on the soggy side. The breakfast spinach salad with poached eggs was delicious, eggs came out perfect. Friendly service, will be back.

Reviews.Author: Madeline H.
Reviews.Content: Five stars for outstanding customer service! Boyfriend ordered take-out soup and sandwiches on a rainy day while I was sick in bed. He got the meal home to discover they had forgotten the soup -- a major bummer for my sore throat! When we called, Kamil, the owner, was extremely apologetic and refunded us the whole price of our meal for the inconvenience. The sandwiches were great; I can't wait to go back and actually try the soup now. Good food + amazing customer service = awesome.

Reviews.Author: Christine K.
Reviews.Content: The crepes are a delight, tart and sweet at the same time! The food is very light, meaning you don't leave feeling oily. I got a delicious omelette, toast and lemon crepes and finished everything (mind you I am under 120lbs)... so you know it's good if I can eat everything on the table! Also a really cool and young crowd, expect some celeb sightings.

Reviews.Author: John H.
Reviews.Content: OK, here's the deal, all bs aside... foodwise, arguably the best brunch I've ever had. The French toast is the absolute TRUTH. Staff was sharp and friendly, owner said hello and checked on us... I'm all in on this one.

Reviews.Author: Salimah D.
Reviews.Content: I love this place.  They make pretty designs in your latte.  They have killer cornflake crusted french toast served with their version of maple syrup and sliced fruit, which is TDF!  They have outdoor seating and on a good day, cute dogs to pet while you're enjoying a glass of freshly squeezed juice.  I wish I lived closer, because this place truly gets breakfast food right!

Reviews.Author: Rochelle R.
Reviews.Content: Obsessed. So good. Best service. Nothing more to say.

Reviews.Author: Christopher J.
Reviews.Content: Really great breakfast.  We honestly came to eat across the street but their power was out.  Pleasant surprise.  Great food and service!!  The Blue Jam Benedict was soooo gooodddd!  Waitresses are friendly and attractive and the place is just plain cool inside.  I will definitely go back when I am in the Hollywood area.

Reviews.Author: milton r.
Reviews.Content: I've had breakfast here about 50 times by now, and for someone who loves making breakfast at home, this is a lot! I'm in love with the Eggwich, but I love pretty much anything here. Try anything! You'll love it!

Reviews.Author: VICKY C.
Reviews.Content: Love this place so much. Only 4 stars becoz I had to wait in line for almost an hr (it was 3pm on Sunday). Crunchy French toast and the blu jam benedict were awesome!!!!! Parking were easy to find on the street thou. Highly recommend this place for everyone :D

Reviews.Author: Mike R.
Reviews.Content: This place is a local favorite.  The food is amazing, but the lines suck ass, but the food... oh man.  Just do it!

Reviews.Author: SSS K.
Reviews.Content: one of the best breakfasts i've ever had in la. if the french toast i had were coffee, then it'd b eon par w peet's coffee or urth cafe coffee.excellente. I LIKE!

Reviews.Author: Kenny F.
Reviews.Content: Good coffee, the Breakfast Risotto was excellent, and the service here was fantastic and refreshingly friendly. Spot on, this place.

Reviews.Author: Stephenie L.
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Blu Jam Benedict. I enjoyed it. it was classy and tasteful. I love the environment. very Los Angeles. I felt that they lacked a bit on the sauce for the Blu Jam Benedict. otherwise it was perfect

Reviews.Author: April F.
Reviews.Content: I literally just rushed home to write this review.  I have passed by this place for years and just barely tried it today.  Not only was the food SSSOOOOO amazing but the service was spectacular.  The waiter was so nice and awesome even the guy that cleaned out plates was talkative and nice.  The chef came out and gave us a free taste of his ceviche that was delicious.  It's really cool that the food is tapas style because i'm not a big foodie and i didn't know what to expect for most of it but it was all amazing.  I highly recommend the spanish shrimp YUM!!! I will definitely be back...quite often

Reviews.Author: Brittany B.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went here because of the great reviews and were not disappointed.. food was delicious, service was great, and didnt have to wait at all on a early Friday morning.. It's a bit pricey and the portions arent big, but you get what you pay for in quality.

Reviews.Author: James W.
Reviews.Content: Got there on around noon on a gorgeous Sunday afternoon.  Definitely expected to wait judging by the number of reviews from yelp.  The wait was about 45 minutes but the lady at the front was super nice as were the servers.  I even sat next to the black guy from the first twilight movie/x-men first class haha. Anyway, ordered the blu jam benedict which was pretty yummy as well as the vanilla french toast afterwards.  My only gripe is that fact that I had to pay for parking but I guess that's expected for eating on Melrose.  Overall, the place was excellent and the service was great.  Check it out if you're in the area :)

Reviews.Author: K M.
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable menu!  So mouth watering, I want to go back and order everything on it!

Reviews.Author: Amanda M.
Reviews.Content: the waitttttt was so long! BUT other than that I had a pretty good experience.  I ordered the omelet..it was called paris something.  The service wasn't exceptional, but it wasn't terrible either.  The seating was a bit crammed, but it's because the restaurant is just soo busy!  I didn't and definitely wouldn't come here for a fine dining experience, it's more of a "come here because I'm hungover" kind of place..at least that's what it seemed like.  Overall, the food was good and I was happy.

Reviews.Author: Meilani M.
Reviews.Content: We came here on a Saturday afternoon around 1:30. We had a party of 6 so I was thinking it would be a really long wait. Fortunately, they had the private room available. We didn't have to wait at all! Perfect timing! Everyone was very nice and attentive. I had the Argentinian Steak, Salmon & Spinach, and the their signature Crunchy French Toast. Delish! The steak was nice and tender. It had a nice chimichuri sauce on top with pan roasted potatoes and green beans. The salmon was cooked perfectly. Moist on the inside and had a crispy skin. The spinach was nice and buttery too! The french toast had corn flakes cooked all around and was topped with fresh berries and bananas. Loved every bite! Will come back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Author: Labrador B.
Reviews.Content: Not only is this place awesome for breakfast but for dinner it's delicious.

Reviews.Author: Tony S.
Reviews.Content: Great Breakfast Spot, Large Selection Great Prices! Great Service.

Reviews.Author: Annie L.
Reviews.Content: I love their crunchy french toast.  All their other breakfast foods are good but not to die for.  Be aware, parking and wait times are always a pain!

Reviews.Author: Adam W.
Reviews.Content: Delicious food. Cozy atmosphere.  Friendly staff. Great for groups.

Reviews.Author: Lucien E.
Reviews.Content: Come early. Otherwise be prepared to wait. This place is the best breakfast spot in the neighborhood. Lot's of different healthy breakfast options, but I love the not so healthy ones. My favorite- Kamils breakfast is a macaroni dish with eggs and bacon. Amazing!

Reviews.Author: Laura O.
Reviews.Content: Very delicious...very impressed!!

Reviews.Author: Edith M.
Reviews.Content: Crunchy French toast.  The day I tried those things was the day my life changed forever.  No longer do I think of the best breakfast as egg white omelette, no more. Crunchy French toast and that fabulous white syrup they give you might be the best thing I have ever eaten, like ever.  Obviously it's a huge serving and I took half home and was like 'I'll share when I get home'. Phst, yeah right.  As soon as I got home I put them in the back of the fridge to be found by no one but me.  Then 10 minutes later I decided it wasn't safe enough, so I heated them up and ate them.

Reviews.Author: Hana A.
Reviews.Content: Ghoulash soup, Norwegian Benedict, crunchy French toast with vanilla bean sauce, mocha latte, good service, wait time around 30 minutes. A little pricey- $12.95 for the French toast, $14.95 for the Norwegian benedict. Total price for two people $50 including tip. Go here for a first time experience only.

Reviews.Author: saucy i.
Reviews.Content: arrived at 10am and there was a 40 minute wait (wish they took reservations), but well worth the wait. to date, might be the best breakfast i ever had in my life. we ordered blu jam benedict with potatoes, breakfast nachos, vanilla french toast, and lattes. it's going to be hard for me NOT to come here every weekend.

Reviews.Author: Cami B.
Reviews.Content: I always try to order something different here because EVERYTHING is delicious. However, my friends and I always make sure someone orders the french toast because it is incredible. Make sure to try out at least once, it's ridiculously good.

Reviews.Author: Doug M.
Reviews.Content: In a word, this place is excellent for breakfast.At a former resident of Texas, I was pleased to see the migas on the menu.  It did not disappoint.  It was flavorful with a kick and was served with salsa that complimented the dish perfectly. The potatoes that were served with it were equally impressive.The place was extremely busy when we arrived, but we were seated pretty quickly.  The service was attentive and professional.The atmosphere is casual and slightly trendy.  The prices are about right for the neighborhood.The only bad mark - the valet parking was extremely slow and inefficient.Overall, 4 stars...

Reviews.Author: Sarah S.
Reviews.Content: I've been here several times and have always been impressed.  The menu is quite large and the food is always fresh and delicious.  The owner is sweet and gracious and always happy to bring you a sample of the soup du jour.  An awesome family-owned place on Melrose.

Reviews.Author: ann.ie k.
Reviews.Content: this place is cool.  a bit on the trendy side (naturally expected being on melrose and all) but not overly oozing hipsterville. service was slow.  i think the syrup on the french toast we ordered ran quicker than our waitress!  literally i timed how long it would take to refill my iced tea (after reading reviews that service was slow) and 9 minutes later i finally got it. 90% ice, and 10% iced tea. the food was good.  i ordered the le paris. omelet with sun dried tomatoes, spinach, mushroom and goat cheese with a side of home fries topped with chives.  flavors meshed well and nothing was over powering.  seasoned well to the T! others in my party ordered the pancakes (w/strawberries, bananas & chocolate chips), blu jam french toast, gourmet benedict, and florentine twist.  the pancakes were on the doughy side.  i was surprised because they looked fluffy and tasty but sadly they were on the soggy side with a doughy taste!  and there wasn't even any syrup on them yet!  the blu jam french toast was great!  i was surprised because it's usually the french toast that's soggy and doughy, but to my surprise it was really light and fluffy!  taste was great, the jam and cream cheese complimented one another without having a heaviness to it.  the gourmet benedict was great!  i preferred it over the florentine twist.  it sure had a twist, but it was nothing to write home about.  i must say that their hollandaise sauce was very welcoming and not threatening.  not over powering what so ever!i think it's safe to say that blu jam cafe is good.  just remember to bring enough quarters for the meter.  depending on the wait (to be seated) it maybe 30 minutes before you're actually seated.  enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Jana L.
Reviews.Content: I love to have breakfast any time of the day.. the Kamil's breakfast is must.. pasta scrambled with bacon and eggs.. I am comming back for more.

Reviews.Author: Lauren N.
Reviews.Content: Yum. I had brunch there and it was delicious. The wait was pretty long (55 mins but they originally told us 15-20, so that was annoying). Food was good, prices were decent. Good vibe. Cute place. Recommended.

Reviews.Author: Professor S.
Reviews.Content: If I could make love to a restaurant, this would be the one.  I love this unpretentious gem on Melrose.  Go there!  You will be treated so well and eat well without breaking the bank.  Kamil is what really makes the place.  His warmth and true dedication to customer service excels.

Reviews.Author: Althea B.
Reviews.Content: This place was delicious! My boyfriend loves breakfast and really enjoyed his food. The atmosphere is layed back and the staff was super friendly. I would suggest this place to anyone who wants a yummy breakfast and great service! :)

Reviews.Author: Ben C.
Reviews.Content: Definitely one of my favorite breakfast/lunch joints in town. They make one of the best wraps I've ever had, I believe its the Southwestern Chicken wrap. Soooooo good. Great atmosphere. I usually get there early to avoid waiting, most folks don't do breakfast until 11 am!  Being located in the heart of the scenic Melrose district makes it great for people watching too.

Reviews.Author: Lai Y.
Reviews.Content: My trip to Blu Jam Cafe was completely spur of the moment and started with a couple friends wanting to grab a quick drink. We noticed this Cafe only by its bright yellow umbrellas out front and I honestly wouldn't have stopped in if it weren't for my friends - I think I have tunnel vision when it comes to Melrose..everything looks about the same to me. I walked in on a Saturday afternoon thinking we'd be in and out pretty fast, but somehow I was sitting at a table 30 seconds later. First impression was alright..the cafe is cutesy and decor was nice and bistro like.There weren't any problems with noisiness or crowds for me; in fact, there were only 2 other tables occupied. Then again that might be due to the fact that it was 4pm and the place closes at 5 on the weekends.The waitress that served us was friendly and attentive, as was the owner. I assume he's the owner as he was calling out instructions and just seemed in charge overall. He was pretty nice, asking us how we were and seeing to our needs.The food. I loveeee food, especially when that food is good and priced in a reasonable range. So when I looked at the menu and saw a breakfast of 2 eggs for $10, I was VERY hesitant to order a lunch entree. Maybe I'm just cheap, maybe I just figure I can make my own eggs at home for 1/10000000th of the price. Anyway, I cautiously turned to the lunch portion and saw combos! That's always a good sign :] My friend and I decided to split a cup of soup and half grourmet sandwich combo: bbq chicken sandwich and turkey chili soup.I don't really have anything special to say about the meal, just that it was pretty good. Up til that point, I'd been munching on the bread and olivey vinegary dip thing that they provide beforehand, so I wasn't super hungry when the sandwich and soup came. Portions and my meal's pricing were average for a little cafe - I paid $12 for a cup of soup and half sandwich (with a little bit of salad to fill the remaining half of the plate).To sum up my visit I'd say go for yummy food if you're in the area, don't if you're more than a few miles away, mostly because parking is a pain and it's out of the way unless you live nearby.

Reviews.Author: Sylvia W.
Reviews.Content: My favorite brunch spot these days. Good food nice people and coffee... Mmmm I want that soy latte !! The only thing is hard to go on weekend. Waiting are average 1~2 hrs.

Reviews.Author: Alex K.
Reviews.Content: This could quite possibly be the best breakfast in Los Angeles. Went there on a quiet Monday morning and was just thrilled at the calm atmosphere. I'm sure it's much crazier on weekends, which I'll probably avoid when possible. The place is small, and quaintly so.Their breakfast menu is incredibly expansive, unlike any I've seen before. Not only that, but it's not filled with variations on your standard fare, but instead it includes just tons of fresh, enticing creations. My friend and I both ordered trademark dishes: the Roma Via Paris for him, the French Toast with blackberry jam, vanilla yogurt, fresh berries & bananas for me. We were both just enamored with the freshness of the food, and I could not have imagined a more satisfying breakfast. The coffee, I suppose, could have been a little bolder.My only complaint was our waitress, who generally met all of our needs, but could have been more personable. I can't wait to come back here for another quiet weekday breakfast, and it was the perfect start to my week.

Reviews.Author: Kelly G.
Reviews.Content: This is one of the brunch places in LA that I would go back to. I went there on a Saturday for brunch, and I don't know if it's because I was super excited about going to Disneyland afterwards. But the food was good, and I really liked the vibe. Even though there was a lot of people inside, it wasn't crazy and chaotic. A guy was on his laptop, and another woman was reading her newspaper.

Reviews.Author: Bryce S.
Reviews.Content: Delicious Eggs Benedict. Great service. Even though a bunch of people were waiting, we were sat in 15 minutes. Def going back.

Reviews.Author: Ellie C.
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast spot! Everything I've had there is great, but the salmon hash and migas are my favorites. Gets really crowded on weekends after 10:30 but worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Leigh W.
Reviews.Content: Great food, amazing service & awesome value. We were seated quickly & the food came out quickly. I loved the atmosphere & I will be back again!

Reviews.Author: Brian I.
Reviews.Content: If you are ever in the area, Blu Jam cafe is a must.  I have been here a few times now and I have not yet been disappointed. i have tried a couple of the omelette's on the menu all were great. On top of the you get a heaping side of potatoes and toast on the side.  But the thing that makes me crave this place the most is the pancakes. IMO they're one of the best pancakes I have ever tasted, I dont know what it is but every bite i take it always has a crisp bite to it like it was fresh off the griddle. ahhhh!!  Can't say enough about the place, but the atmosphere is very homey and relaxing. The staff has been very friendly with every visit. Good thing I dont live in the area or else I might be tempted to come here everyday!

Reviews.Author: Gameela E.
Reviews.Content: AMAZZZZING!!!  Between the table we had...Caramel French Toast, Kalil's mac n cheese, Eggwich, Huevos Rancheros...you get the idea.
