We had a little of everything and everything was fabulous! We also had beer at bfast hahaha YES and take Kalil's recommendations on it, he knows what he's talking about, he owns the joint. The staff is super friendly and the owner kalil is hands on and is ALWAYS cruising the floor. His business means a lot to him and you can tell in the food alone. There is usually a small wait on the weekends but most of the time you can get right in. I now frequent Blu Jam anytime I can :)

Reviews.Author: E G.
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast spot! Looking for a place for some tasty pancakes and found this spot on yelp with good reviews. I agree it is a tasty spot. I had the banana, strawberry, walnut pancakes and they were great. The wait was about 30 minutes, but the host was very accomodating and was moving people to seats as fast as possible. Great server as well. Will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Author: Sal S.
Reviews.Content: Awesome food. Good service. Priced reasonably

Reviews.Author: Jade L.
Reviews.Content: I'm always on a quest for a great place to have breakfast.  I think I found one I can truly rave about.  Hands down, their Crunchy French Toast (Egg brioche dipped in a batter, then rolled in corn flakes and grilled just perfectly and served with bananas and berries.  And, let's not forget the Vanilla Bean Sauce.  Yummm!!!!  Just writing about it makes me want to go back for more.We also had their Blu Jam Benedict (made with ham and bacon) - Eggs pefectly poached - and Kamil's breakfast...a different and innovative breakfast scramble with elbow macaroni tossed in.  Truly filling!!!Oh..and, I can't forget the Hot Chocolate...my son had one that he couldn't finish.  That's how big it was.  Sure made his eyes pop when he saw it coming.Definitely a great place.  Service staff was friendly.  I got lucky...no wait.

Reviews.Author: Cecilia C.
Reviews.Content: Took for ever to get our food ...wait satff was rude and the owner even worst.

Reviews.Author: Kristen J.
Reviews.Content: This is my go-to spot in LA.  Their Blu Jam Benedict is a show stopper.  I had it two weeks ago and I am still dreaming about it.

Reviews.Author: Erin S.
Reviews.Content: Starting with service at the door, Blu Jam Cafe was a good experience. All four wait staff interfaced with us just in the process of seating...they are attentive in a casual fashion.The food is good quality. The whole place has a low-key, fresh-squeezed OJ, neighborhood joint but good quality feel to it. Had an excellent eggs Benedict breakfast. I would go back to this place in a heart beat. It was my best food experience of a weekend trip in LA.

Reviews.Author: Nicole G.
Reviews.Content: Crispy french toast = a must.  Get an order for your table.

Reviews.Author: Lynn B.
Reviews.Content: i def. need to come back and try their brunch because I went at dinner time and it's a completely different menu. each dish has a lot of flavor, but portions are small. i had the seafood soup (forgot the name), pulled pork tacos, and risotto with veggies. i thought they all tasted great!a lot of the reviews said there was a super long wait, but when I went it was pretty empty! in fact, we were seated immediately! :)Service was GREAT and food was wonderful too. at the end, I even received a complimentary bottle of wine on my next visit (dinner only)! pretty sweet! :) i'm most def. coming back blu jam!

Reviews.Author: Alexandra W.
Reviews.Content: Just had brunch here with a friend! Excellent all around. Great food (with simply gorgeous presentation), wonderful service, great ambiance...even though we came in for the very popular Sunday brunch, my friend and I only had to wait 15 minutes to be seated. I'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Scott W.
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed a custom juice and a coffee drink in the afternoon; returned the next night for a tapas dinner. Tasty and great service. We'll come again next time we're in LA.

Reviews.Author: Alex C.
Reviews.Content: I just discovered this little cafe because I work very close. The food is 4 stars but the service is definitely sub par guys. Starving and in a hurry like most of Los Angeles I ordered to go. I'm not one to complain but they totally forgot one of the most important pieces of my plate  and when I called to let them know that I was unhappy all they said was we'll throw in some crepes next time. Felt like a pity gift if you've ever had one offered to you. Thanks but no thanks. I think I'll find a different breakfast spot now. Hope your experience there is better than mine.

Reviews.Author: Tania L.
Reviews.Content: I've wanted to come here for ages, but I ws daunted by the incredibly long line on weekends. They now serve dinner, and the hordes have yet to discover it, so I sauntered in a couple of weeks ago. So glad I finally tried it. The food was excellent and, when I told the owner I wasn't a fan of okra, he actually brought us an order on the house to change my mind. Dear reader, it did! This restaurant is one I will visit again soon and often, and I recommend you do too. And don't forget to order the okra!

Reviews.Author: Anh N.
Reviews.Content: Eh... brunch was so-so. I could've made a better omelet at home. French toast with cornflakes ... not a big fan of. It's too much texture for a french toast and made it seem a little bit dry. Service was great-- very friendly waiter. Although, while eating our food someone managed to sneeze half their omelet onto my friend's back. Needless to say, I lost my appetite QUICK!

Reviews.Author: bhavna p.
Reviews.Content: The vegan tex mex hash was fabulous!! (I added cheddar cheese to it as well)My friends loved the corn flakes crusted french toast, regular french toast, roma via paris scramble, burgundy omelet, and mixed juices. I love that they have tofu options since I don't eat eggs. A++++ in my book.

Reviews.Author: Arlen H.
Reviews.Content: Great place for brunch! Mac'n Eggs, my new favorite.  Great french toast as well.  Good service with a cool vibe.

Reviews.Author: Jen B.
Reviews.Content: This is still my fav place for breakfast but lately the hostesses have been poor in their seating. Go in on a busy day and they say "45 min but it will probably be shorter b/c a lot of people have left." It's true, people have left, but as soon as they return, even after their party has been called and moved on from, they will seat those people immediately. They will continue to do this as people come back and your wait will probably be longer than 45 min.

Reviews.Author: Dominick G.
Reviews.Content: yes, you have to wait an hour.  Who cares?? Do your life a favor and get the corn flake crusted french toast and anything else on the menu.  This is a special special place....

Reviews.Author: Jonandre B.
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere and food but way to long of a wait.

Reviews.Author: Sarah M.
Reviews.Content: Go here if you have time! When it's busy the service is very very slow but the food makes up for it!! I order the eggs florentine or the eggs Benedict with a vanilla latte! Perfection!

Reviews.Author: Huong V.
Reviews.Content: Came to Blu jam cafe day after my bachelorette party and it was AMAZING! The waiter was a guy who was super awesome! His rocking the mustache and grungy look and gives the best Service! Only thing is if you go there and have to wait make sure your literally next to the door to hear your name to be called. They barely make a peep calling ur name.

Reviews.Author: Amanda N.
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome to say the least. I've been there twice and they have awesome service, a chill atmosphere, and most of the time during the week it's not that packed. They serve breakfast till 5:30 I believe, and I highly recommend getting something off the breakfast menu, even though EVERYTHING looks good. My personal input would be to get the Blu Jam Benedict, for something simple. I've had some of their other food, and it's still just as delicious as the rest. It's about $12 a plate, but totally worth it!

Reviews.Author: Susan K.
Reviews.Content: Great place for brunch in Hollywood area.  They don't take reservations so you need to be there at least by 10am on Sat/Sun to get seated - usually a 20-30 minute wait on weekends.  Love coming here with our dog since they have sidewalk space and water bowls.  In terms of food, i like the pesto scramble and the french toast.  Parking can be limited but they do have valet.

Reviews.Author: Michael L.
Reviews.Content: Ordered the breakfast quesadilla that came with potatoes. Inside had chicken, eggs, tomatoes, and cheeseeee! Also got the crunchy French toast, which came with yummy vanilla bean sauce. This had blueberries, banana slices, and strawberry. The iced mocha amped me up. The environment was modern and solid. Overall, it was quite a lovely experience.

Reviews.Author: Patty V.
Reviews.Content: New to LA? Local LAian? If you want some good breakfast you need to eat here!!

Reviews.Author: Jane S.
Reviews.Content: Ate here for the first time with a friend who suggested we get brunch. Got there around 11:20 in the morning on a Saturday and was told the wait would be 50 minutes. We were seated in about 40-45 minutes. The experience was definitely worth the wait. Our waiter was AWESOME: quick, friendly, and very helpful even though the place was very packed and busy. Ordered the Midas which was really good. Would order again.Their french toast is to DIE for.I wouldn't mind waiting 45 minutes again to be seated here!

Reviews.Author: Sara R.
Reviews.Content: Instead of writing a lengthy review (With this place i could go on and on and on), ill keep it simple. This place hands down has some of the best food! HAVE YOU TRIED THEIR TAPAS???!!!! WHOA! if you live or passing thru LA it e a crime not to experience this place at least once

Reviews.Author: Nick C.
Reviews.Content: portions are quite small, and it is pretty pricey, but worth the taste. wait was pretty long so i don't know i'd go back again knowing that griddle is just around the area. atmosphere is nice and so is the service, can't give it a 4 most because i wasn't full when i left

Reviews.Author: Didi B.
Reviews.Content: Was my first time in LA with a couple of friends, we decided to have breakfast here, and i LOVED it.

Reviews.Author: Jo C.
Reviews.Content: Came here last Friday at noon for brunch. For a party of three, we were seated right away. I love breakfast, especially places that serve breakfast all day. I usually prefer to order pancakes, but after reading the reviews about their infamous Crunchy French Toast, I was intrigued. The order came with 3 slices of brioche bread sliced in half, topped with bananas, blueberries, and strawberries with a dusting of powdered sugar. This dish did not disappoint! The corn flakes that coated the toast gave the perfect crunch in every bite and the vanilla cream sauce was so delicious! In addition to my French toast, I ordered a side of chicken apple sausage and a mocha latte, which came with a cute coffee art topping. These additions complimented my meal very well. Our server was also really friendly & attentive to our needs. Everything was great about this place! My only complaint would be the parking. It is located on busy Melrose so of course street parking can be a pain to find. Nevertheless, I will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Author: VioletsMom L.
Reviews.Content: You will probably wait in line - especially on a weekend - but be patient. Its well worth the wait! We have been to Blu Jam many times and have NEVER had a bad experience. Yes, we always get the same breakfast items (Crunchy French Toast with vanilla bean sauce and Eggs Benedict - take your pic which one. They're all glorious!) but its because we don't want to fix what ain't broken :)Do yourself a favor...work up an appetite and get to Blu Jam. Great atmosphere, the staff are very accommodating and the food makes me love LA just a little bit more than I already do!!

Reviews.Author: Kristen S.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely delicious.  I had the Rome Via Paris for breakfast.  Awesome!

Reviews.Author: Mary C.
Reviews.Content: I had Crunchy French Toast and Blueberry Pancake for brunch today. These were amazingly delicious. My server was nice. But I would "never" visit this place again because of the terribly unkind hostess (African American with red hair). She ruined my happy Saturday brunch. I just asked her twice whether she called my name. I asked twice because when I asked her for the first time, there were only two parties ahead of me, and I left and came back after about 10 min to put coins in the parking meter. She replied me back, "you just asked the question." I should have replied her back, "So what? What's this attitude? Can you just answer my question one more time?" But I couldn't because I was very shocked by her attitude and didn't wanna deal with her attitude any more. I asked what her name is and she refused to give her name. She was very rude when I asked my first question too.

Reviews.Author: Scott S.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam gets crowded on the weekends so go early. Should you not make it early, just wait, its beyond worth it. I've eaten here tons of times and not once has it been anything short of awesome. The service is always friendly and on top of things. The food (especially breakfast) is always top notch. The migas are incredible if you're looking for a good breakfast dish to order. The french toast rocks. The coffee is delicious. Huge huge fan of this place. If you haven't tried it, GO!

Reviews.Author: June D.
Reviews.Content: Wait was 15 minutes... YES 15 minutes! I decided to order almost exactly the same things I did the first time I came cause I was craving for really good brunch! To my disappointment... many things were off. We ordered the Crunchy french toast and it seemed old... not like the last time we had it which was a lil more fresh to my liking. It kinda felt as if it was sitting out for a lil LOT longer than it should have... sad to say it didn't really crunch as much as it should. Our Steak hash was also missing something... steak... ok it had pieces i think from what we remembered  6 pieces... I only know its about 6 pieces because i was looking for it to begin with. The red potatoes were also quite salty with the herb hollandaise. I still think service is spectacular... but i am disappointed and what my eats. I can't say i won't be back... cause I'm assuming it was a bad day for the kitchen. Parking's not easy... ghetto gangsters harassing people outside is not fun... but i still am coming back cause it had to be a bad kitchen day.

Reviews.Author: Cesar F.
Reviews.Content: Ive been to every top breakfast spot in Hollywood, and this is by far the best breakfast spot around. Ive been here over 20 times and they are very consistent. Prices are very reasonable, especially for being on Melrose. Great people watching. Either get there early on the weekends or going during the week to avoid long lines.

Reviews.Author: Saf E.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam is THE jam.  Yeah, that was lame, but it's true!  I've visited Blu Jam about 5 or 6 times, and each time has been delightful.  I usually get the Roma via Paris omelet, and, seriously, I do not order omelets from any other restaurant because I know that their omelet isn't going to touch this goat cheese and egg ambrosia.  I have had this omelet with either their rosemary potatoes (which are just OK) or their fresh fruit bowl (which is just Great!) and an iced Vanilla latte. Their Iced Vanilla Latte is the BEST latte I've ever had.  The best, the realest vanilla flavor ever!  This is a MUST TRY!The only time I've ever been disappointed was when I decided to branch out and order the Russian Scramble.  I don't think it was their fault, rather a matter of not liking the taste of salmon and caviar.  It was too salty.  The vanilla latte was still very excellent.Parking on the street or side streets is pretty easy.  Sometimes there's a bit of a wait in the mornings on weekends, but it's never too long, and you can order a coffee or Vanilla Latte as you wait.  The staff has always been super nice, and they even let us reserve their back room for a large group of friends.  There was about 16 of us crammed into the room, and they still served us with a smile and patience, and they got every order right. No sweat. Blu Jam it up!  Order the Vanilla Latte!

Reviews.Author: Martin S.
Reviews.Content: My favorite breakfast place.  The owner and staff are very nice and the food is very high quality!   Great vibe and decor! Best Thing on the menu-THE EGGWICH!

Reviews.Author: Adam H.
Reviews.Content: Great spot for lunch right on Melrose.. cool atmosphere and great food with seasonal specials. The pulled chicken tacos were superb.

Reviews.Author: Mike C.
Reviews.Content: Initially when I walked by, I was a little skeptical of this place because it had a large yellow banner hanging in the front window that said: "Voted best breakfast in Los Angeles."  Typically, if a restaurant is the best, it doesn't need to say it.  Frankly, the banner led me to believe that it was a total tourist trap, and that it was going to serve me some bland and overpriced food.  However, my girlfriend and I were starving, so we decided to give Blu Jam a chance.We went in during the early afternoon on a Thursday, and it was not very crowded initially.  Within 10-15 minutes, the restaurant was very loud because it had filled up completely. At that point, I was a little disappointed because my girlfriend had received her tea, but my latte hadn't come yet.   As each minute passed, the pain became even more excruciating.. I NEEDED MY DAMN LATTE.  Once it came, I was in heaven.   I fell in love with my Vanilla Latte from the minute I laid eyes on the creative latte art.  With each little sip, my heart grew fonder of the Blu Jam Cafe.The waiter took several minutes to take our order, but the latte kept me distracted.  It was just soooo good.  When the waiter came, I ordered some red potatoes and the Kamil's breakfast.  The Kamil's breakfast was a unique combination of macaroni, cheese, scrambled eggs, and bacon.  It came relatively quickly; however, there were no potatoes in sight!!!  With each bite of my breakfast, I grew even more impatient waiting for my red potatoes.  I wanted to stand up and flail my arms in each direction, but I still wouldn't have been able to find the waiter.  After I finally got his attention,  it still took him 15 minutes to bring me my potatoes.  At that point, I had already finished most of my meal, and I didn't really even want them anymore.   The worst part about it was that he was a little snarky, and he didn't even appear to be apologetic.   It was clearly his mistake, and he blamed it on someone else.  However, I didn't care because I thought the breakfast was  so damn good.  I came back several days in a row, and each meal was even better than the last.  The service was actually better the second and third time around; I think the first time was probably just a fluke.I also learned that the trick to successful ordering here is to be adventurous... step outside your comfort zone.  It's not like eggs and bacon are going to awe you anywhere you go.  Give the place a shot for breakfast or brunch and you might even fall in love (with the barista).

Reviews.Author: Christine R.
Reviews.Content: This the place I love more than any place on Melrose the spa is next door so its really nice. The food is excellent. The waitresses are so cool too. THe coffeee freakin rocks

Reviews.Author: Joby C.
Reviews.Content: I eat here almost daily.. hands down best breakfast on Melrose and maybe even LA. great service and outstanding fresh food. I have eaten nearly everything on the menu and everything is ace.

Reviews.Author: Cynthia P.
Reviews.Content: My family came in from the east coast and they are SO PARTICULAR about where they eat breakfast.  I read about Blu Jam and their breakfast special, so I took a chance and am I glad that I did.  My family absolutely loved this place.  I had the crunchy french toast with fresh fruit and my parents had some egg dishes and my sister who is ALWAYS on a diet had ordered some special meal she created.  The waiter was top notch, friendly and got the order right.  We absolutely LOVE this place, we go all the time, although now that I am working, can't stop in the for breakfast special price -- oh well.

Reviews.Author: Kaitlyn R.
Reviews.Content: Food was WONDERFUL! I came here on a Sunday morning for breakfast with a friend, and it was just delicious. And the portion was large, so I ended up boxing some to enjoy later at home :-) I also got a coffee, and it was very good. My friend loved her food as well.The BEST part was our waitress gave us a free dessert at the end, and I'm not even sure why- just an act of kindness maybe? But it was fine by me because it was DELICIOUS! It was a chocolate crepe filled with caramel & bananas, drizzled in chocolate syrup. So so good!My only complaint is how busy it was (but understandable, based on the quality of the food), and how pricey it was. I don't know if I'd come back simply because I can't afford to drop 20 dollars on breakfast on a somewhat regular basis! But if money was not an issue for me, I would definitely come here all the time.

Reviews.Author: Rachel K.
Reviews.Content: I went here (twice now) on the recommendation of a hipster foodie-friend and was not disappointed!  The asparagus-leek soup and the split pea soup were full of flavor and delicious.  I also had half of the "uptown" and half of the "LA club" - both of which were yum.  The complimentary olive tapenade was also really delicious and so is the iced tea!  The only negative is that they don't take reservations, but despite having to wait the hostess kept checking on us and letting us know where we were in the queue.  I much prefer BluJam to places like Toast, Doughboys, and Mani's.  Also the servers and bussers were very efficient.

Reviews.Author: Chris K.
Reviews.Content: Came here on a Sunday morning around 9:30 with my girlfriend thinking we'd have to wait for a table but surprisingly we were seated immediately. I ordered the California Omelet and it was amazing. The portions were big but I'm a big eater so it was a good amount for me. My girlfriend ordered the Breakfast Quesadilla and that too was amazing, but a little too heavy for a breakfast item. To top it off the service was also awesome and I love it when they refill your coffee without even having to ask the waiter. Definitely going back here again.

Reviews.Author: daniella s.
Reviews.Content: Yesterday was was first time going to blu jam cafe it was good, however the only thing I didn't like was the pancakes, they were luke warm and they were too dry, it took awhile for my food to arrive so I expected everything to be hot. I guess I am just hooked on the griddle cafe, I still have yet to find a breakfast spot that can top the griddle cafe.

Reviews.Author: Frank S.
Reviews.Content: Stopped in for Saturday breakfast around 10:00 and only waited about 5 minutes for a table, maybe because everyone was at the pub on the corner watching World Cup. Ordered the Hangover Burrito from the specials menu (I wasn't btw) and the Toscana Scramble from the regular menu. Breakfast burrito was one of the best I've had (lots of chorizo and super spicy jalapenos) and the scramble, despite not looking very tempting because of the pesto mixed in, was excellent as well. All of the staff were super friendly and the atmosphere was great with jazz on the speakers.

Reviews.Author: Ji Young H.
Reviews.Content: To me, the point of having brunch at somewhere is to have a relaxing, stress-free, quality time with the people I like.  I went to Blu Jam Cafe last Sunday 8/15 around 9 AM when the place was not yet crowded at all. For some reason, however, the waiter asked us three-four times if we were done, even when we were clearly not done and even verbally explained that we were still eating and having a conversation.  He started asking us about 40 mins after we had walked into the restaurant and of course the 30 mins includes the time we spent to order and waited for the food.  My friend and I were both feeling rushed and couldn't stand that attitude, so I paid and walked out of there.  I won't go to this place ever again.

Reviews.Author: Ivana S.
Reviews.Content: Love this place.  The food is incredible, like Mom made it, only even better!  Huge portions and savory flavors totally satisfy!  Go out on a limb and try something new... like lemon crepes!

Reviews.Author: Eric E.
Reviews.Content: Amazing breakfast in a great place on Melrose. Come early or risk waiting a while. Great atmosphere paired with  the best breakfast in LA. It will not disappoint. And you may even catch a celeb or two. Camille is the man!

Reviews.Author: Jeffrey G.
Reviews.Content: on top of great food, you have a great staff.i went about a month ago and had the pancakes and a delicious latte.  about halfway through, the owner noticed my pancakes were not perfectly cooked and brought me another order without asking.  super nice guy and gesture.the menu is plentiful with enough options to please anyone.  not too expensive.  nice tastes without being pretentious.

Reviews.Author: vicky c.
Reviews.Content: Had brunch here on a weekday with my girlfriends. Was really excited about coming here based on all the rave reviews but I must admit the food was just so-so. I had the Norwegian Benedict and was not very impressed with the lack of smoked salmon on the plate. There were way more tomatoes than smoked salmon. Also, the mushy tomato texture doesn't quite go with the salmon. One of my friends had the crunchy french toast, while it was pretty tasty, I think the french toast at Cici's Cafe in Tarzana is way better. Service is excellent but I'd prefer driving a bit further to Cici's for a much better brunch food experience.

Reviews.Author: Joanna S.
Reviews.Content: The wait was super long (like 35 to 40 mins after being told 25). The cafe was a fairly good size inside with also outside seating also.  I enjoyed the ambience of the place  I was fully satisfied until our unfriendly waitress completely got my order wrong when she suggested how it can be done. Both my friends plates looked and tasted great definitely try the fruit french toast.

Reviews.Author: p w.
Reviews.Content: Went for breakfast, which was excellent.  Food was great.  Had a the eggs benedict- eggs perfectly poached.  Wonderful hollandaise sauce.  My daughter had the lemon crepes, which were the perfect balance of lemony sweet/tart.  Perhaps one of the best things about this place are the waitstaff, who were accommodating, but not pushy... Oh yeah, and Thomas- the dude holding court in back.

Reviews.Author: Nami D.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I wanted to find a nice place to eat brunch in LA and decided to choose this place because of the name.  =)  We were told that the wait was 15 minutes.  We walked down melrose, going in and out of the shops, and came back in time.  We ended up waiting for 40 minutes to get a table inside.  What made up for this was the amazing food and the very friendly staff.  We enjoyed ourselves, and our stomachs were very satisfied.Food break-down:BEST FRENCH TOAST EVER!  The vanilla bean sauce was absolutely amazing.  The toast was just right and the crunch was perfect.  The fruits were a little sour.The eggs Benedict with the bacon was a bit on the salty side and the potatoes were burned black, but still yummy.  And when they say freshly squeezed juice, they MEAN FRESHLY SQUEEZED JUICE.  No sugar added so don't be surprised with how bitter it is.Ambience:You can sit inside or outside (with heaters for those cold days).  We opted to sit inside because of the street pollution, people in line watching you eat, and it was cold.  Inside is a very hip, young feel with wood floors, cute intimate seating arrangements, and contemporary art on the walls.  It is a bit loud inside.

Reviews.Author: Maggie P.
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast joint, I always get the Eggs Bohemia.  It's so delicious!

Reviews.Author: Gissel F.
Reviews.Content: Had the best fruit cup at this place, got the eggwich, it was good, felt light, but on the other hand my boyfriend tried the french toast and thought it was ok, not amazing.

Reviews.Author: Destiny W.
Reviews.Content: I was really starting to get cranky at the wait, but SO worth the wait! Absolutely delicious and simple, rustic recipes. Well worth the time and money.

Reviews.Author: Alix MJ K.
Reviews.Content: Favorite brunch spot in Los Angeles. Although street parking can be a little difficult considering it is on melrose, it is so worth it !

Reviews.Author: George S.
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast/ brunch menu. Breakfast is served until 5pm, usually not a breakfast fan in the afternoon but saw other patrons eating breakfast (it was around 4pm) and everything looked delicious.  Next time I will try the french toast, saw it being served and my mouth watered.

Reviews.Author: Mike D.
Reviews.Content: You might know of Blu Jam as a breakfast destination, but they've recently begun serving dinner, and it's excellent. I brought a date for her birthday, and couldn't have had a better experience. The food is a 'small plates' concept, but don't let that fool you. A couple of plates each is enough for a filling meal. After being given an amuse bouche of a really nice mac n' cheese, we ordered some cold and some hot dishes. The strawberry burrata with balsamic sauce was excellent, as was the risotto with peas and prosciutto. A delicious filet, reasonably priced, and a standout shrimp dish made for a wonderful dinner.Add to that the fact that the staff were knowledgeable, friendly, and attentive, and the fact that they've got some really nice wine specials, and Blu Jam Cafe is in serious danger of being not just a breakfast place much longer.

Reviews.Author: Jmar G.
Reviews.Content: I was just informed that the blueberry smoothie was removed from the menu!  Blu Jam has replaced the smoothie options with natural juices instead.  This makes me sad but I'm keeping the rating the same because this place is still great.

Reviews.Author: C M.
Reviews.Content: This place is great!  I went on a week day and it was still crazy busy but we were seated right away. The wait staff was fantastic-- friendly, funny, attentive, but not overbearing. The food was great too, although I had a hard time deciding what to get as there were so many choices. I went with the standard eggs/bacon/pancake option and was not disappointed (eggs were creamy...pancakes were light and fluffy). The coffee was yummy too--not too strong or overly bitter.  I'll definitely be back to sample more of the menu!

Reviews.Author: Barbara L.
Reviews.Content: We have had some amazing brunches and breakfasts at this fine establishment, but last night we tried them for dinner. All small plates, 4 of us sharing, and we loved everything. The beet salad was right on, the salmon dish was great! The berry cobbler was amazing. We followed them on face book and twitter and they were offering a free bottle of wine if you made a reservation and mentioned aspecial word. The wine was a great $29.00 bottle of wine and it made it such a wonderful deal. We will definately return soon.

Reviews.Author: Carolyn O.
Reviews.Content: Amazing food, good service that was quick and polite! I will definitely eat here again.

Reviews.Author: Heidi G.
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere! Sunday brunch is scrumptious! You may have to wait for a table, but well worth it! French toast is YUMMY! The Veneto Breakfast is my favorite so far :)

Reviews.Author: Jahkova L.
Reviews.Content: Excellent everything.

Reviews.Author: martin T.
Reviews.Content: What a great spot! Wonderful service, thought the wait outside looked awful but we were seated and sippin great coffee in under 20 minutes. Everything on the menu and all the plates flying by make deciding really difficult... I've had worse problems. I settled on the salmon hash and was blown away by the hefty portion as well as the creamy dill deliciousness of their hollandaise covering perfectly poached eggs. I look forward to exploring the menu further, one more shout out to the great wait staff and the cool host dude Kamil!

Reviews.Author: Chris A.
Reviews.Content: Very good place for breakfast/lunch. Expect to wait though if your coming for brunch on the weekend. French toast is a must.

Reviews.Author: Lucio M.
Reviews.Content: Always great food - but the customer service is by far the most appealing reason to go. Kamil, the owner, is great and you can see it by the way his staff take care of their customers. All you need to do is see the smiles on the faces of the other patrons. Crunchy French toast is the best - but my favorite is the Gourmet burger. My husband & I have been going here for years, and I recently took my 13 & 8yr old nieces visiting from Chicago - they felt like stars with the great treatmet they recieved. Fantastic place!

Reviews.Author: Patricia B.
Reviews.Content: Great place. Awesome food, cooked with style and skills. Served that way too. Well worth of your money and definitely of your time. You'll enjoy it, I bet. i did, sooo..don't wait much. Check'em out.

Reviews.Author: Sandra O.
Reviews.Content: I am thrilled to know that Blu Jam is now open for dinner! The menu consists of several tapas style plates. I think I may have had nearly everything on the menu, but let me highlight a few heavenly choice; the scallop ceviche (buttery and spicy), burrata and strawberries (A heavenly combo of fresh ingredients), spanish shrimp (I died and went to heaven at this point), sautéed okra, chicken "tinges" , and seared ahi. The presentation and quality of every entree was impressive and delicious. The chef, Kamil, is very detailed and only lets the best come out of his kitchen. How lucky I was to get a taste of his wonderful creations. Also, the dessert was decadent (tres leches). I would highly recommend going during the week as the service is more personal and you can give every dish the attention it deserves.

Reviews.Author: Marisol M.
Reviews.Content: Had breakfast last Saturday morning with a great friend and we both enjoyed the food.  I had the Spicy Tex Mex breakfast with tofu - delicious! Would recommend it if you're in the area. Just as important as the food, the service, it was prompt and super friendly from the moment we walked in until we walked out.  The place gets super busy so if you don't want to wait I strongly recommend you get there no later than 9:30 am...oh and don't forget to feed the meter!

Reviews.Author: T'Hud W.
Reviews.Content: Really perky, attentive staff. Although we had to wait a bit, and the hostess was swamped, we really felt looked after.The coffee was top-notch, and my girls proclaimed the hot chocolate the absolute best that they'd ever had. I had the risotto breakfast- the risotto was done perfectly, as was the poached egg on top.Girls had banana pancakes (divine and fluffy), and the crunchy french toast (fabulous).*sigh* I wish they were closer, but we'll definitely go back whenever we're back in the area, and will recommend to fellow travelers.LOVE!

Reviews.Author: Sarah D Z.
Reviews.Content: Kamil, tried it and loved it! Crunchy French Toast is on my list of must haves from now on :)

Reviews.Author: P S.
Reviews.Content: Great brunch place! Been here twice and had good experiences both times. Fulfilling  portion with the right taste in every bite. Expect a line for weekend brunch. If you're going for something salty, try steak hash. If you want something sweet, try crunchy french toast. Can't wait to be back for more.

Reviews.Author: devina s.
Reviews.Content: Well what can i say after eating this guess what i got..!!! FOOD POISONING!!! and for some of you guys that may have had it.. It wasn't lovely and might i add that is was the first time that i had it.... So i had the worst ruff two weeks ever.... The only thing that i can say was really good was the Chai tea latte. But other wise then that, I should have known better not to eat from it cause the food came out cold.. and my eggs were slimy... While i was eating the crunchy french toast all i can think bout was how soft they were not crunchy at all... To me it just felt like they had our food sitting for ever and then brought it out... overall i want to thank all the people that gave this restaurant a five star review to get over there to have food poisoning omg... I have nightmares thinking about..... thanks but no thanks never again...so update 5/6/12.. i sent this to him for this reply he sent to me..woah woah woah... don't get you panties all in a bunch...i did say your chai tea latte was great... And nobodies "excellent" you temperatures suck... And i didn't dream up a food poisoning it happened.. I have my witnesses that were with me to side with me on that...Im not the only one who said your french toast was soft or your eggs were slimy or your food came out cold. I even copy the name of one of the reviewers who said that, her name is Janine R. And its no point in coming back... ill take it as a loss, don't get sentimental about your family and kids. All i said is it was a horrible experience probably a bad cooking day for the chef.. And to say you have NEVER received complaints from customers.. I'm guessing you can't see all the one star reviews you got. Some even saying the same thing i said( like the eggs were undercooked or the french toast was slimy or your food was room temperature) your food should ALWAYS be hot when you serve it like that chai tea latte you served me...P.s- this was no flu... and when i say my stomach contents (water or food) couldn't stay in my stomach for two weeks you do the math... Food poisoning or flu. Duh food poisoning....

Reviews.Author: Mr. Pleco S.
Reviews.Content: Excellent breakfast stop. Eggs Bene was really good..

Reviews.Author: Aaron P.
Reviews.Content: Most know it as another of the hour+ weekend brunch haunts that welcome all who are hungover.  But did you know they also have an awesome dinner too?  Well they do.  Fresh, delicious and about 1/29th the crowd.

Reviews.Author: Lori B.
Reviews.Content: Went for the first time last Saturday.  Was told to expect a wait but it didn't seem too long.  Had a great waiter named Trace that recommended the crunchy french toast. Loved it!!! Totally enjoyed the French Press Coffee too.  Our waiter was spot on with his suggestions and made the morning so enjoyable.  Both the food and the service were great.  We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Rachel O.
Reviews.Content: I had heard ppl rave about this place forever and I finally got to try it out yesterday. The Norwegian Benedict was AMAZING. Best I have had in a long time and if that is on the menu I will always get it. Service was great as well and liked the ambience, not to crazy, nice and relaxing and you had no idea it was 102 outside! Definitely going again!

Reviews.Author: Katie B.
Reviews.Content: I have to give the Blu Jam Cafe 3 stars mostly because of service. Their food is pretty awesome, but I've been there twice and the service is what kills me. I work in a restaurant so I know it can't take THAT long for breakfast food. The first time we went, my friend and I both ordered omelettes with potatoes. It was about 11 am and it wasn't super busy. But it took almost 30 minutes for our food. We kept seeing food come out, yet it was never ours. The server never came over to tell us our food was on its way or anything... FINALLY it came. I had the Burgundy Omelette. It was pretty amazing. The creamy goat cheese was fantastic. So we were able to overlook the service. BUT the second time we went... oh man. So we place our order and wait. I got the Morning Hash and my friend got the California Omelette. So we wait. Knowing that is might take a little while, we settle in and start talking. Then we see all this food coming out, assuming it should be ours. NOPE. A party of 5 came in about 15 minutes after us, and got their food about 20 minutes before us. So finally I get our servers attention and ask her where our food is. I tell her we had been waiting about 45 minutes. She CORRECTED me and said oh well it's only been about 40 minutes. (Excuse me?!) She said apparently the kitchen just never got the ticket but she did put it in. Ok whatever. So then the manager came over and apologized for the wait. He brought us a half order of their famous crunchy french toast. Well, ok. The server informed us that because we did wait so long, they would give us 50% off. 45+ minutes seems absolutely unreasonable that I didn't really want to pay at all. I am not the type of person who is ever looking to get food for free. I have no problem paying good money for great food. But by the time our food came, we were in a hurry to eat so we couldn't really enjoy it.I might be back but it is just for the food because it is a little more interesting than just eggs and bacon.

Reviews.Author: Hermela N.
Reviews.Content: Amazing food and atmosphere! The restaurant get's a bit crowded around peak brunch/lunch times so the best time to go would be between 2-5. The crunchy french toast is to die for!

Reviews.Author: Michelle H.
Reviews.Content: Honestly, the best breakfast I've ever had. The burgundy omelet was amaaaazing and portioned perfectly. The service was also fantastic. I highly recommend it. :)

Reviews.Author: Matt M.
Reviews.Content: Overrated!! Went to this place because yelpers led me here. Place was packed and had to wait 45 minutes, which didn't upset. The food upset me. I had standard egg breakfast with bacon, french toast and what not. The eggs tasted like buffet eggs, completely unexpected. My girlfriend got the california omelet and it was subpar. 95% of the omlettes I've had at other restaurants are better. The french toast was delicious I have to admit and the orange juice was fresh, thats about it though. Not worth the wait

Reviews.Author: jleesa r.
Reviews.Content: Decided to check out the Sunday Brunch at this Cafe last weekend since it touted as one of the best places to have brunch in the area.  It was okay.  But it had a long wait on the sidewalk in the sun to get a table. The girls coordinating the wait list was fun and friendly. The wait was about 45 minutes. Once we got inside it was very noisy and the server wasn't attentive.  It was very crowded and people were closely packed. The food was showy but lacked flavor.  I found it a bit over-rated.  Not anxious to return. But it was trendy kinda fun, nice to get out.

Reviews.Author: Victoria W.
Reviews.Content: I've only been here twice & have only ordered the Eggs Benedict, but they are divine!

Reviews.Author: Theresa W.
Reviews.Content: Yet again I am astounded by how good breakfast can be sometimes.  I got an egg white omelet with mushrooms, brie, avocado, and tomato.  Fresh fruit on the side.  The quality of the food way surpassed my expectations.  This isn't even what the waitress suggested as their best dish, so that must just be out of this world!  The service was good - a little slow - but who is usually in a hurry on a Saturday morning?  I got a chance to read my book on the patio outside and really savor their offerings.  Would absolutely come again.

Reviews.Author: Zazu L.
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere. Hipster(ish) vibe. Predictably good breakfast dishes. As the other posts indicate, the only thing to complain about is the wait time, which I take as a good sign.

Reviews.Author: Aishwarya P.
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased with places that we tried in the Melrose area that we decided to visit another Melrose hotspot, BJC! This place is packed on sundays and we secured a spot only after a 1.5 hour wait time. You can walk the entire melrose avenue in the meantime, the wait time doesn't seem so bad then. Breakfast is served here all day, so if you intend to have breakfast here and are disappointed by the long wait time, don't be! We ordered the florentine benedict - classic eggs on toast. This was made very well and also ordered the vanilla french toast - excellent. Topped our order with freshly squeezed orange juice. We were seated in the outside patio area and it felt so good to have an excellent sunday brunch while watching the hustle and bustle on Melrose.

Reviews.Author: Molly M.
Reviews.Content: This place is one of the things that I miss most about LA - especially their bistro nights.  The food is so amazing that whenever someone here asks me for a restaurant suggestion, I want to say Blu Jam.  But sadly, it's about 2,000 miles away.

Reviews.Author: Bradley H.
Reviews.Content: Great food. Breakfast special 7.95 between 8 and 11. That's the way to go on this one. Good location, easy parking during the week. I had the benedict on toasted croissant with bacon AND ham (sorry pigs) plus a GREAT fruit cup. Nice place to know in my neighborhood!

Reviews.Author: chelsea s.
Reviews.Content: I've been going to Blu Jam since the day it opened. I love this cafe and bring all of my friends there for the food and service. There's such an amazing variety of dishes that you'll be happy with any choice you make. Fresh and tasty, I recommend this place for anyone to try. You're sure to become a regular like the rest of us have...

Reviews.Author: Joanne V.
Reviews.Content: I love Blu Jame!  I live in the neighborhood and its such a yummy place.  The Soups are always delicious!  The service is great!  and word on the street in they are opening soon for dinner, I can't wait : )

Reviews.Author: Stephen S.
Reviews.Content: This restaurant is excellent. The food and atmosphere are wonderful. A modern flair combined with an old world rustic style mesh into a beautiful postmodern environment. Local artwork adorns the walls, both beautiful and exemplary of this cafe's community focus. The clientele and staff are both eclectic and friendly. The manager, in particular, is a sweet guy and will remember you if you or he makes your acquaintance.The food is both artful and delicious. Each dish is crafted with style and skill. Old standard favorites, exciting twists, unique flavors, and delicious healthy choices fill the menu. At a reasonable price, you can get a great meal.I highly recommend this restaurant. If only great places like this were more common!
Reviews.Author_Location: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

Reviews.Author: Grace L.
Reviews.Content: I just moved to the neighbourhood and decided to try both "best breaskfast in LA"- Vienna cafe and Blu Jam. They are across the street from each other. I went to Blu Jam with a group of six people. The host gave us a private room. Super nice! We sampled 6 different dishes and they were all super tasty! In my opion, Blu Jam has better food than Vienna cafe.

Reviews.Author: Mish M.
Reviews.Content: Probably one of my most favorite breakfast places in Los Angeles! Everything on the menu is legit. Jason is a great waiter and I always have a great time going in there. Last time I was there, we saw Drew Barrymore chowin' down on some delish treats. it's yummy! I recommend the California Omelet for sure! mmm mm. Jason is legit too!

Reviews.Author: Deborah T.
Reviews.Content: we were a party of 6 with visiting relatives. I wanted a breakfast place with not only great food and service but quiet enough for us to talk. Blu Jam was able to fulfill our needs. The owner, Kamil was gracious and accommodating when he suggested his private room in the back. It was perfect. Jenny our waitress was attentive without being pushy and we were able to have a leisurely meal and conversation. The food was excellent!  Our choices ran from eggs to pancakes to crepes & french toast. Everyone was more than happy with everything. I can't wait to go back and try their lunch menu. I highly recommend this restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Timothy T.
Reviews.Content: I live in Chicago and was in LA a few weeks ago.  My girlfriend recommended Blu Jam Cafe and I have to say it was the best eggs benedict I've ever had.  Ever.  The owner Kamil was also very nice and even took the time to teach me how the eggs are prepared for the eggs benedict.

Reviews.Author: Christopher K.
Reviews.Content: Ordered the French Toast with assorted fruits and the Peach tea. Both were really solid, and the toast is around Square One quality (which, believe me, is saying a lot). The owner seems to take a very vested interest which is great, and judging from some articles posted in the hallway he takes a lot of pride in his food. The place is in a nice location, good to walk around, and very comfortable inside with a very courteous staff. Look forward to coming here more often and trying different things-and the tea, of which there is a great deal, is really good.

Reviews.Author: Adriana S.
Reviews.Content: Classic breakfast spot.  Artsy, brick walls, packed seating.  Service is quick and attentive.  No wait on weekdays but busy on weekend.  Food was great, large portions.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer H.
Reviews.Content: Everything is yummy here.  Best grilled tuna sandwich in LA.  Great atmosphere and service.

Reviews.Author: Nicholas C.
Reviews.Content: Eggs Benedict.

Reviews.Author: Amy R.
Reviews.Content: LOVED this place! It's situated on Melrose Avenue in LA where many eclectic clothing stores are located. I love the fresh tapenade and attentive service by the servers. The owner was especially cool and ended up giving us some of the most delicious Lemon Crepes!

Reviews.Author: Foodie D.
Reviews.Content: One of my most favorite breakfast and lunch spots in L.A.la land!  The menu is huge and believe me everything I've tasted has been either great or fantastic!  The vibe is relaxed and has the feel of a euro-cafe, except you're on the Melrose strip. The food is fresh, well prepared and you can taste the high quality of the ingredients.  It's an excellent place for a full sit down meal or for just a quick bite/shot of espresso. I enjoy going there solo, with friends and business clients alike.  When family and guests come to visit LA, we always hit up Blu Jam.  The owner Kamil is a great restauranteur who always take the time to makes us feel VIP - (even though we're really not).  Blu Jam is highly recommended for anyone looking for a delicious meal at a fair price!

Reviews.Author: S K.
Reviews.Content: Food: 4.5 starsService: 5 starsLOVE this place for brunch!  I agree with the other reviewers.  The crunchy french toast is awesome.  Service was amazing as well.  Can't' wait to go back.

Reviews.Author: Matt D.
Reviews.Content: I got a toasted bagel awhile back and there was mold on it.  The manager told me it was just "burnt." i refused it and was still charged for the bagel.not sure what's worse, Blu Jam or Vienna.  sad state for brunch spots on Melrose...

Reviews.Author: Josh Z.
Reviews.Content: My fellow Yelpers, as you can see I have already written about Blu Jam Cafe, but I must write about it again because of how awesome it is. From the service to the most important part-- the food. The staff and the cooks have never ceased to amaze me with with warm hospitality and their unflinchinly constant great food. This is all thanks to the great ownership of Kamil, who makes you feel at home and creates an atmosphere of good vibes. I have a lot of friends that come in from out of town and Blu Jam is one of the first places I take them. If you as a resident of LA have not been here-- the time is now-- go-- you wont be sorry.

Reviews.Author: Jasmine F.
Reviews.Content: Blue Jam was GREAT! My boyfriend and I went for lunch. I got the gourmet burger and he got something (can't really remember distracted by my burger). This burger was so juicy with packed on flavors. Service was just alright, but that burger... mmmm that burger won it over for me.

Reviews.Author: Laura C.
Reviews.Content: Great service, best breakfast I have ever had in L.A. The end.

Reviews.Author: cassidy l.
Reviews.Content: Went back...Got to egg dishes...I REALLY want to like this place...but...it's not that good.Owner sent me a message inviting me back and recommending a sweet dish I believe but I was too embarrassed to say hey, I wrote an average review of your restaurant... I feel bad... But anyway...it was a friendly message and perhaps I just choose the wrong items every time. The menu has grown extensively since I last went and is now open for dinner with small plates.Ahhh well...

Reviews.Author: Holly D.
Reviews.Content: I waited tables for 7 years - so I have experience when it comes to service.  Blu Jam totally gets it.  The key to great service at Blu Jam is everyone helps.  The whole restaurant is treated as "one table".  Great food - and always  consistent.  We have a 2 1/2 year old who is shall we say a bit challenging to go to restaurants with, but not here.  They get our food on the table and a check quick!  Forgot to bring some toys?  They got you covered.  Water in a plastic to-go cup with a lid and straw - I didn't even have to ask.  Kamil the owner is always there making sure his ship runs smooth.  LOVE IT!  We go for breakfast and it gets crowded after 10am, but worth the wait.   So happy to have this gem in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Author: David D.
Reviews.Content: I came here after seeing the reviews for the all day breakfast on yelp and it does not disappoint. The venue and food are both excellent, as is the service. Old brick walls, dark wood tables and chairs, a beaten copper counter and vaulted wood ceiling perforated by triangle skylights certainly give this place the unique level of flavor one would expect from it's location on Melrose.The food is excellent! I ordered French toast, eggs and sausage from the all day breakfast menu. I couldn't say it was what you would call "spectacular" but, it was EXACTLY what I was looking for in a late breakfast, which in my mind is worth 5 stars any day. Coffee was good (always a plus) and the service is first rate. All the servers are quick, bright, and seem to enjoy their work  (rare enough these days). All around the Blu Jam Cafe exceeds expectations and I would certainly recommend for a late breakfast/lunch to anyone looking for a casual, unique, midday experience that certainly will satisfy in both taste and atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Alex K.
Reviews.Content: best brunch in LA... hands down.   Food is so delicious and fresh.  Also have great salads for lunch -- the beat salad and warm mushroom salad are my two favorite, but they are all great.  Staff is also super nice and accommodating.

Reviews.Author: oyefunke a.
Reviews.Content: So....I returned for breakfast and feasted like  a monarch!   A very delicious and filling benedict, way too much meat for me but I'm a sucker for some good bacon and their bacon is I believe housemade and delicious!!!And, I got a good enough explanation of the cocktail issue (and there are several good champagne cocktails).   Full throughout the day!  Thank you Kamil, Tripp and co.!  Did is mention lemon crepes?!

Reviews.Author: Matt K.
Reviews.Content: I know the owner.  Am I biased?  Maybe.  But the only reason I've come to know him is because I ate there once and fell in love.  Best food all around in the area.  If you've never eaten here, give it a try.  The staff makes you feel like you're at home and not in some big ridiculous city.  The food?  It'll make you go back.

Reviews.Author: KC S.
Reviews.Content: Was just at Blu Jam and had one of the best restaurant experiences I've enjoyed in ages. Not just for the delicious food but for being treated with so much care and seemingly genuine appreciation by a server!!! In Los Angeles, a city full of unfounded attitude it was refreshing to be spoiled with unreserved gratitude.

Reviews.Author: mendy l.
Reviews.Content: Olympus and Muscle beach were really good. as well as the Vanilla French toast.

Reviews.Author: Cristina S.
Reviews.Content: By far the BEST breakfast in LA!!!!!!! Everyone must try the crunchy french toast!!!!!! Only on the weekends though. They are open at night as well and have amazing dinners!!!! Great selection of wine too!!! Blu Jam is a must go in LA!

Reviews.Author: David B.
Reviews.Content: Disappointed that the pancakes were only bleached white flour, from what I could tell.  They didn't have the oats and whole grains that most places now offer.Their scrambled eggs were good, their turkey sausage was not.  Service was okay at best.  I can't believe people think this is the best breakfast in LA, I must have missed something.

Reviews.Author: m w.
Reviews.Content: Look out Luna Park, we might have found our 'new' favorite restaurant. But once again it is the tough decision to post our recent experience at the Blu Jam Café. We have only eaten here for breakfast and now have found it to be far more enjoyable to eat there at night. The ambiance is fabulous and after experiencing the most attentive service we have experience in a long time. The small plates are the perfect dining option. We had incredible brussel sprouts, then a brisket served with thin slices of bread and then we decided on the risotto followed up by a berry cobbler dessert. All top quality and just the right size. We had a free bottle of wine coupon that we got at breakfast and it was very good. All 'n all it was AWESOME! Will we return, OF COURSE. Just a great dining experience. The owner, Kamile, makes the evening enjoyable and fun and the bantering with the staff was very fun. Great new restaurant for us.

Reviews.Author: Carl N.
Reviews.Content: As an avid Griddle lover, I was skeptical of the praise friends were giving Blu Jam.  Could it really measure up to my beloved breakfasts on Sunset and Fairfax?YES.  It's a tie.  I have only had one thing on this menu, and it is a tie (don't get me wrong, I love Griddle...still my favorite place in LA, everything on that menu is gold) but oh my goodness.  If you are anywhere in the vicinity, stop what you are doing and go EAT THE VANILLA FRENCH TOAST.  Let's back up though.  Even their water is delightful.  They toss in some mint, I believe some limes, maybe a cucumber?  It's great, very refreshing.  And just go on an off day/hour if you don't want to wait.  This place is popular for a reason and it doesn't help matters that it's right smack dab in a very busy section of Melrose.Friend had the benedict florentine with potatoes (huge, delicious, so so good).  Everything on that menu looked/sounded so tasty.  I went with the vanilla french toast at high recommendations from another friend.  So worth it.  Melts in your mouth, the perfect amount of everything.  The jam is delicious.  Melting blueberries and fresh fruit...it was unbelievable.Can't wait to go back.  Though I don't know if I can ever order anything but the french toast (it should come with a warning).

Reviews.Author: Angellie G.
Reviews.Content: I tried my very first eggs benedict here and i wasn't as impressed as i hoped to be especially after hearing about the cafe's good ratings and its benedicts. If only the 3 different kinds of food i was able to try, such as the Florentine's Benedict, would taste much better than it looked, i would give this place an A+. However, it really was okay - i'm only glad they had potato wedges because that saved my whole lunch. i'll come back again to have a french toast instead!

Reviews.Author: devorah p.
Reviews.Content: Just had the Rancheros (huevos rancheros) here and they were outstanding. OMG so good. The service was also fast and friendly and my mint tea came in a generous french press which was good for 3-4 cups, i only drank about 2.  Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Sergio P.
Reviews.Content: I love this place. The food is great and fresh. The only negative to this place is the wait. You can always expect a wait. But I feel it is totally worth it.

Reviews.Author: Damir T.
Reviews.Content: This place sucks!!We sat down ordered a drink...place is empty....by the way....the waiter comes back and asks us if we are eating dinner i asked my date and she said maybe later and the waiter said if you are not eating here we cant serve you drinks ....WTF take it easy Middle Eastern food Nazi this is America ....Pal....WTF?????

Reviews.Author: Rebecca E.
Reviews.Content: Long wait, but it's worth it. There's not exceptionally spectacular about it, but their breakfast is delicious and the chai lattes are the greatest I've ever had ever ever. Friendly staff. Next time, I'll try the crunchy french toast.

Reviews.Author: Stacey F.
Reviews.Content: Tried the hot chocolate, Spring Omelet (asparagus, Brie, goat cheese, sun dried tomatoes and baby spinach) as well as a pancake on the side. I'm not am omelet person, but this was delicious!  The pancake was great - tasty and not too filling. Even the hot chocolate was exceptional. Would live to try other items perhaps next time we are in the Los Angeles area!

Reviews.Author: Kelvin L.
Reviews.Content: A friend described the Crunchy French Toast as Halloween for adults. Wow! He was right! It looked beautiful, and it tasted even better. It's great french toast with a little twist that will surprise your taste buds, in a good way. To be honest I didn't think corn flakes would work with french toast, but I'm glad I was wrong. It compliments the toast perfectly. Ask for real maple syrup on the side (costs a little extra). You will love it! Oh. That was only half of our brunch. We also had the Steak Hash. If the Crunchy French Toast were Halloween, this would be the manliest holiday you can think of. It's steak, potato, cheese and eggs. It isn't just all brawn and no brain though. This has very sensitive gourmet touches that gives it depth you probably wouldn't expect from steak hash. On top of that, it was portioned for humans unlike other gourmet foods that may taste really good, but you can't tell because you don't get enough of it to determine if it did. Unless you've been starving for a while be prepared to take some of that home with you. Kamil, if you ever open a Blu Jam in San Francisco we'll definitely be there. We'll be back next time we're in LALA Land.

Reviews.Author: Ni'Cole P.
Reviews.Content: Love this place, I live right up the street so it's my go to brunch place because everything is yummy and it's so close. On weekends there is usually a line but the service is quick and the food is great. Can't go wrong with the french toast or an eggwhich!

Reviews.Author: Naomi G.
Reviews.Content: I went on Saturday for brunch, there was a full house, but the wait time was only 20 minutes. They have the main posted outside so that while you wait you can think about your order. All the tables are pretty close to each other but it is not that bad. After you have ordered your food it does take a while for them to bring it to you, but trust me, it is WORTH it. I ordered the Chicken Pesto Panini with potatoes and it was DELICIOUS!!! The french toast with fruit is also amazing, it is lightly covered with cereal and gives it an amazing taste! The dips are a great touch to the food. If you are looking for a good breakfast or brunch I recommend coming here. It is a little pricey but well worth it.

Reviews.Author: Suzy H.
Reviews.Content: Hands down the BEST  breakfast/brunch in town.  Fantastic service, amazing food. Everything on the menu is delicious.  You can't go wrong with the California Omelet. The water they serve has fresh mint and lemons in the pitcher. Great ambiance.  It's the hip, popular place to go on the weekend so GO EARLY, or else there will be  LONG WAIT.. worth the wait though...

Reviews.Author: Rd C.
Reviews.Content: I have been coming here for breakfast for several years.  The owner is there most mornings, and generally makes sure everything is as he wants it.  Great food, lots of variety, and a few things on the menu that are unique to only the BLU JAM.  Nice environment.  Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Author: Damien C.
Reviews.Content: These guys have some of the best benedicts in Los Angeles!  I've tried a few places, and it seems hollandaise sauce is just a little too hard to get right for most restaurants, but these guys do it justice.  Any time of the day!

Reviews.Author: Pearl H.
Reviews.Content: Went for the first time last week for late lunch.  Food was da bombz! I ordered the special La Paris omelet and it was awesome! However, even more awesome was their vanilla french toast and their amazing vanilla latte..  I would go back just for their lattes and french toast!

Reviews.Author: Jasmine N.
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite cafes. SO CUTE!!! lovely location.

Reviews.Author: Liliya K.
Reviews.Content: The service is amazing and the food is great! Only problem- the wait time is forever, but it is worth it!

Reviews.Author: Amanda Z.
Reviews.Content: My favorite breakfast place in LA! My only complaint is that they don't serve veggie sausage. Order th French toast! They serve it during the week now- best idea management ever made!

Reviews.Author: Amar S.
Reviews.Content: Brunch was spectacular here today. The service is pretty fast and effective. My main dish was the eggs florentine. Although, I have also had the chance to try the "wraps on fire" - a pretty spicy and pretty delicious entree if you are a spicy eater. The eggs florentine  was delicious and made perfectly. Needless to say, I enjoyed the food thoroughly as well as the fresh orange juice and white peach tea. I will definitely come back here again sometime in the near future! On a side note: beware of a long line for wait, however we only had to wait about 10-15 minutes even though the lady predicted about an hour.

Reviews.Author: Janet O.
Reviews.Content: I love this place!  I've always passed this place while walking around Melrose, but never really noticed it.  Finally, my friend suggested going to brunch there.  The wait was super long, but we decided to wait and try it out.  It was probably about a 45 minute wait, but it was well worth it.  Adrian Grenier from Entourage was waiting in line too, so we knew this was gonna be way worth it.lol  We were finally seated, and the staff was very nice.  I tried the migas, it was good.  It was like a spicy chorizo and eggs with potatoes.  I've also tried the california omelet and the roma via paris.  Both were great dishes and tasted very fresh.  But the best dish at Blu Jam Cafe has to be the french toast!  They make the best french toast.  I have taken numerous friends here, and they all are blown away by the french toast.  It is perfect!  I really recommend the french toast!

Reviews.Author: Fe S.
Reviews.Content: Good atmosphere and service. Food was filling and delicious. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Author: Cyn K.
Reviews.Content: I'd recommend this place if someone was a french toast fanatic and to try out this place. But overall it's good restaurant but not worth the wait or tight eating space. Btw, the orange juice is very acidic so be prepared (Urth Caffe's OJ is better and sweeter).

Reviews.Author: Jon A.
Reviews.Content: I've been to this place a couple of times and couldn't help sharing because it's amazing!  The dishes I've had:  Blu Jam Benedict ( the best Eggs Benedict I've had in many years with good hollandaise, properly poached eggs, ham AND bacon); Kamil's Breakfast: scrambled eggs, bacon, ham, herbs, cheese AND macaroni; Chicken Schnitzel: perfectly breaded and fried cutlets with awesome green beans and homemade mashed potatoes; and, the piece de resistance: Crispy French Toast (unbelievably good...whatever you start with, share this for dessert).  The managers and wait staff are excellent. Young, energetic and personable (our favorite was Trace), they make what could just be hip and trendy, into a place that's really cool and fun, with fantastic food that you'd be more likely to find in the West Village or on the Upper West Side. But NO...it's right here in our own L.A. backyard.

Reviews.Author: Jessica P.
Reviews.Content: I had this placed bookmarked before I even got to LA as I definitely wanted to hit up the "must go's" although this place might just be "trendy". A VERY hungover group of 9, no 10, oh wait just kidding 11 finally got here around 4:30 pm, a half hr before closing so luckily there was no line for such a big party. We ended up getting seated in the back with the comfy pillows which was pretty cool , yay. I had heard the French toast was bomb and the vanilla bean sauce was crack so i didn't hesitate to order it although not being a fan of sweet breakfast items i should have went with my standard choice of a savory Benedict. My fault. The French toast was good , served in small portions like donuts but for someone who lets just say had a rough night the night before i could have used something more filling and hearty. The fresh squeezed OJ was delicioussss tho, something I'd be too lazy to make but I'd buy jugs of in a heartbeat. Luckily my BFF let me have half of her Benedict and i passed my dish around. Overall brunch here was a success. Memorable quote of the meal was from the waiter "so how do you guys all know each other?"  "Singles awareness meeting , jk!" I guess we appeared to be a very eclectic group of people which I love to call my friends, d'aww.

Reviews.Author: Rachel L.
Reviews.Content: I must say I was extremely disappointed by this spot. The coffee was alright, service was pretty good, but the food seemed to be mediocre. It was definitely not bad, but did not live up to the hype. The food didn't seem very special to the restaurant,  I felt like I could get the same food anywhere else. The crunchy French toast is the specialty, but honestly, I would not trek there for something I can make on my own.

Reviews.Author: Steven H.
Reviews.Content: try the jam Benedict

Reviews.Author: Sean T.
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast. Great potatoes, great coffee (French press).  Went out of our way to eat at Blu Jam on our trip to LA. Did not disappoint. Every bite was a quality taste and one of the best breakfast that I have had. It is hard to make a difference with eggs and pancakes but Blu Jam exceeded our high expectations.

Reviews.Author: Red Carpet Systems S.
Reviews.Content: The wait is too long so I went across the street at Vienna cafe and was very disappointed. I should've waited a little more. Will be back soon! I hear so many good things about this place.

Reviews.Author: Roc L.
Reviews.Content: I went to blu jam in hopes for a great brunch after church with friends. After waiting for 40 mins we were seated and greeted by a very unpleasant waiter Charles. Not only was his attitude bad, the table next to us felt the same way about His attitude. He was sarcastic and rude to both tables. He argued with a customer about the menu and persisted to do the same with me. He was not helpful at all. He also did not come and check on us for the entire meal. The food is amazing but the service was horrible! The manager came to speak with us and tried rectifying the situation but didnt do much! Won't be back

Reviews.Author: Melisa I.
Reviews.Content: Went there for the first time today with my daughter, I can't believe I haven't been to this place before!!! Wow, what a fantastic place. We had orange/carrot juice and the apple juice, both of which were fresh squeezed, and absolutely wonderful. Next came the signature french toast with vanilla bean sauce and fresh berries, and Blu Jam Cobb salad. Hands down, the best french toast I have ever had, and having been a professional chef for 20+ years, that is saying something. It was busy when we got there (12:30) but got seated right away. The Manager is most excellent (Frankie, I think) and the servers were all very professional, laid back and did a wonderful job. The salad had the perfect amount of everything, and tasted so fresh, I swear they picked the arugula while we were ordering. I can NOT wait to come back here and try the Burger, which smelled amazing when it went by our table. Great job, guys. You for sure have a new loyal customer.

Reviews.Author: Brent W.
Reviews.Content: Went with a group of friends and were excited to try this place. 3 of our 5 glasses were dirty with lipstick and other grub. The waiter took forever to take our order. They weren't that crowded and it took an hour to get our food. We were rudely reprimanded when we tried to split our check...he said "I'll do it this once but don't do it again." The sad part is the food was really good but the service was horrible.

Reviews.Author: Ash S.
Reviews.Content: I love brunch and something about this area reminded me of the Haight in San Francisco, a place where I have had some of the best breakfast/brunch ever.  HOWEVER, Blu Jam seemed highly overrated to me. First off the service is incredibly slow.  I think they have one waitress serving everyone.  Our food took a good half an hour to actually come out.  I know they are busy but the wait time was excessive and the waitress never came to check in on us.  We ordered two chai tea lattes which were cold by the time our food arrived. I ordered the french toast or "lost bread" which I thought was a pretty straightforward dish.  It doesn't take  a lot of culinary expertise to make french toast taste good.  But the french toast was just okay.  It needed a little more sweetness, maybe some powdered sugar or a dash of cinnamon in the batter, or some strawberries instead of just bananas.  It was pretty bland. My husband ordered the Power House.  It completely lacked any flavor and you could smell the Lawry's seasoning salt as a way to add any flavor.  Healthy doesn't mean it should have no taste. I know this has been voted the best in LA, but I think people are limiting themselves in thinking this is the best breakfast-brunch place in all of LA.  If you want an amazing breakfast/\-brunch experience go to Jack n' Jill's in Santa Monica.

Reviews.Author: Ana Maria B.
Reviews.Content: An ok place. Two tables next to me had problems with their dishes. Erratic service. I still prefer Square One and good ol' Jinky's for my pancakes & eggs...

Reviews.Author: karen l.
Reviews.Content: I went here for the first time last weekend.  We ended up there pretty early, so we beat the crazy brunch crowd (nothing worse then a crazy Sunday brunch).  I had the breakfast quesadilla; it was perfect.  I scarfed the whole thing down while I shared a giant pancake with the man.  The pancakes are huge, fluffy and deelish. The man had a super spicy scramble that he raved about.  The coffee is so-so, but friendly service and comfy dining area. We will be back.

Reviews.Author: Julie S.
Reviews.Content: Love, love love Blu Jam. The food, the service, the owners are all great! Right now they only serve breakfast and lunch but I can't wait until they get their beer and wine license so I can go there for dinner!

Reviews.Author: Gary Z.
Reviews.Content: The food's great - I especially recommend the Venetian Chicken sandwich and the Turkey Pesto Panini. Anything on the breakfast menu is terrific, and can be had all dayParking's a mess, but that's Melrose. Try to find something around the corner on Martel, but watch for parking time/day restrictions.I've found the staff to be pleasant, but the service is slow pretty much any time of day, and no matter how many patrons are in the place.

Reviews.Author: Angel V.
Reviews.Content: French toast yummy....

Reviews.Author: Harlan A.
Reviews.Content: Yes, I'm connected to this place.  I eat here a lot.  If there was a kitchen for me in LA aside from my own kitchen, which has no food in it, I'd have to say it would be Kamil's place. Okay, this place is not just about the food.  It is about the owner Kamil.  He actually cares about all his customers.  Yeah, I know, crazy.  But yes, he is really interested.  Kamil has been around for a while.  He actually ran the restaurant across the street and then ending up opening up this place a few years after he left.  If you want to feel at home and eat food that someone "worked" to get right-- and keeps working to get right.  Go here.  Now.  But if you go on the weekends be prepared to wait a bit (its worth it)-- you see, the secret it out.  Clearly, look at all the reviews that have come before me.

Reviews.Author: Andrew M.
Reviews.Content: A little surprised that I had to wait 25 minutes for a mediocre and forgettable meal. Blu Jam just doesn't live up to the hype for me.

Reviews.Author: Amanda C.
Reviews.Content: Literallly the best breakfast I ever had. The crunchy french toast was ahhhhhhmazingggggg! Not too expensive. The wait was a little long, but soo worth it.

Reviews.Author: Sea J.
Reviews.Content: Went here for the first time today, so delish! It's hard to find a good breakfast place in LA, I like a good ol' traditional french toast breakfast one in awhile and this place has... THE BEST FRENCH TOAST IN LA. Seriously. It melts in your mouth and is somehow not super heavy, though I'm sure it has 6 sticks of butter in it. Went here on a Sunday afternoon and the wait was about 20 minutes, not too bad. The service was a bit scattered, they clearly were packed and short staffed but they got the food out in a decent amount of time. While I don't live mid-city I would definitely come back and let's be honest, i probably would get the french toast again.

Reviews.Author: Kristen C.
Reviews.Content: This is my FAVORITE breakfast place in LA. Great egg dishes, especially the array of benedicts, and delicious french toast. Great atmosphere. If you go on a weekend, however, be prepared to wait anywhere from a half hour to an hour and a half.

Reviews.Author: milk c.
Reviews.Content: I  love Blu Jam!!  The best breakfast in LA ;) Never dissappointed at this place.  Great for everybody.. I always come to this place when I need a great breakfast for starting my great day. No parking but...Well .. on Melrose ?? Just park on street and feed the meter.

Reviews.Author: susana r.
Reviews.Content: I just can can say that this place is sooooooooo good, anything you order will be yummy. The waiting on weekends are long of course, but wait is  so worth it, enjoy!!!

Reviews.Author: Puja K.
Reviews.Content: Only thing missing ... They don't serve fries!Warm mushroom salad, caldera sandwich with sundried tomatoes, and a side of Rosemary bread were really good!!

Reviews.Author: Sasha P.
Reviews.Content: A+ breakfast. in my top 5 LA restaurants. build your own omelette and make sure to add their pesto, it's amazing.

Reviews.Author: Joe N.
Reviews.Content: Last night I had dinner at Blu Jam for the first time. I have been a huge fan of it's breakfast for a long time, but never made it in after dark. What a mistake. Dinner was absolutely fabulous. The shaved scallops with paper thin jalapeño slices was sublime with a beautiful balance of sweetness and heat. The perfect setup for the juicy and creamy sweetness of the burrata cheese with strawberries, grilled bread and balsamic reduction that followed. We also shared the owner's famous goulash (rightly so) and a brilliantly prepared plate of Niman Ranch filet over gorgonzola mashed potatoes. The service was spot on and Mr. Majer set us up with a stunning Syrah from Beckman vineyards to go with the meal. May be the only place I ever do breakfast, lunch and dinner in the same day. Go now before everyone else figures it out and you can't get a table.

Reviews.Author: Allison E.
Reviews.Content: Amazing food and fantastic service! We have gone back twice and I couldn't be more pleased. The waiter is beyond words amazing! The food is top notch- tip: get the scallops with lemon risotto (you won't be sorry) and the ceviche. Go here, you won't be sorry!

Reviews.Author: michael c.
