Reviews.Content: Riverdog farm greens, crispy Chevre goat cheese, sautéed trio of mushrooms, balsamic...... TASTY DELICIOUS!!!Argentinean steak & Ribs.... Cooked to PERFECTION!!!Really enjoyed every bite of food... and Kamil picked a perfect wine to compliment the meal...Perfect for a large party of people to order lots of different plates to share and get a taste of everything, tapas style! Maybe thats just me because I wanted to order everything when I saw the menu!Such a diverse menu to suit all! I would highly recommended it.You can just tasty and smell the passion put into the food and well put together menu.

Reviews.Author: She D.
Reviews.Content: Went for bday brunch with 7 girls... hard place to go with big group bec we waited over an hour for our table.  BUT...... IT WAS SOOO WORTH IT!!!   And that's why I gave it back the star.  The food was awesome, and so was the service!!  Cant wait to go back.  And yes, get the crunchy french toast for the table!!

Reviews.Author: Abe C.
Reviews.Content: Good food, fast service and friendly wait staff

Reviews.Author: S H.
Reviews.Content: I'm from out of town and picking out a restaurant in an unknown area can be precarious at best.  But this place delivered! Great food! An awesome environment in a fun stretch of Melrose!  I had the chicken schnitzel.  Piping hot and well seasoned and the latte' was perfect as well!  Definately will return!

Reviews.Author: Barry B.
Reviews.Content: Best breakfast we have had anywhere!!!  Must try crunchy French toast, and the egg sandwich.  Enough to share for 2!  Lauren was our server, and she knows what she's doing!

Reviews.Author: Sarah L.
Reviews.Content: ***** Five Stars for the killer Steak Hash.  Once of the best breakfasts I've had ANYWHERE !!!  Well Done.Service was poor at best.  The more I evaluate my dine out dollars it is SOOOOO important be part of what I am paying for.   Lots of room for improvement here.

Reviews.Author: Christopher T.
Reviews.Content: Good breakfast palce.  Get there before 10AM and you'll get a seat pretty quick.

Reviews.Author: Cristina S.
Reviews.Content: Love the turkey paninis! I've been here a few times with friends for lunch. The food is always tasty and service is just fine.

Reviews.Author: Cynthia C.
Reviews.Content: My husband, two tweens and I had breakfast here our first morning in LA. I got the recommendation from yelp and am so glad we stopped in!  The four of us have varied preferences for breakfast, but all of us couldn't have been happier and more satisfied with our choices. Two of us got egg dishes and they were great. The side of potatoes are really well done. My daughter got the crunchy french toast which was a special and it was amazing!  My husband got the risotto special and was very happy. We are only in town for 4 days and already my kids want to come back here!

Reviews.Author: Heather B.
Reviews.Content: AWESOME!  Favorite restaurant in LA.  Everyone is talking about breakfast and brunch, but y'all have to try dinner at Blu Jam.  Such a GREAT place....great atmosphere, food, and wine.  A great date restaurant.  Fun when friends are in town.  The service is always great and the owner, Kamil, is extremely hospitable.Everything on the dinner menu is awesome, but you have to try the brussel sprouts and the ribs.....and the mac and cheese.....and the shrimp ceviche....and the strawberry burrata....and the petite vesuvius.....YUMMY!  There are seasonal items so if you see something that looks good, try it!

Reviews.Author: Robin F.
Reviews.Content: Owner was rude, I called a first time to ask a question and the phone was picked up and hung up on me. Called again and was told that they dont do take out when I have gotten take out from them multiple times and their own yelp page says they do pick up. I wont be giving this establishment my business ever again especially if the owner feels he can talk to his paying customers that way. STAY AWAY!!!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Katherine M.
Reviews.Content: Dinner at this place is beyond amazing! I am going there regularly for breakfast -which is commonly known as a fantastic place, the best in LA.. But dinner?OMG... The Argentinian steak as well as the tuna tartare with avocado and ginger was orgasmic to the palette.., Kamil, the owner and the friendliest host, connoisseur in wines, suggested a delicious wine for us, and to finish it all up... An insane desert, seriously! Fantastic  price for all the food and the super-friendly service! Bravo guys, we'll be back every week!

Reviews.Author: Daniel B.
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I rarely review unless there is a place I truly love, and I LOVE this place.  I've braved some serious waits to get my fix .  Almost everything on the menu is spectacular but a few highlights are:Fried egg sandwichMigasBreakfast QuesadillaCRUNCHY FRENCH TOAST (if you are into sweet breakfasts, I have never had anything this delicious in this way)Steak Hash (brunch menu)Brunch Burger (aka the self loathe hangover special)Make no mistake, this place runs a long -- and well earned -- wait on weekends.  Plan accordingly.

Reviews.Author: Kurosh K.
Reviews.Content: The food was great. The wait was bad. Even at odd hours there is a long line.We ordered the Migas and the crunchy french toast. Both were excellent.Also the beet green salad was good. Food overall was very good.

Reviews.Author: I R.
Reviews.Content: Bju Jam Cafe was way more built up to be this incredible place than it actually was. The food was better than alright, I got a delicious benedict. The only downfall to the restaurant is that it feels dirty-- as if the tables weren't wiped off enough. Great food and service though!

Reviews.Author: Nick M.
Reviews.Content: Their tofu hash is great! Can be crowded at peak times, but it's very good and worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: L B.
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favourite places to eat in LA! breakfast is so good, crunchy french toast is to die for! their omeletes/scrambles are really good too... i've been for dinner a few times too its tapas style but its some of the best food i've had! stawberry bruschetta is amazing. The customer service here is wonderful they gave us free champagne and every time i have been for dinner they have offered a free tapas dish of their choice.

Reviews.Author: Matt M.
Reviews.Content: Blu jam is the spot! Got in about 8:15 am so there was no wait. My wife had the benedict florentine & she absolutely loved it. (She is very fond of brie) I had the crunchy french toast & I don't think I will ever enjoy french toast anywhere else ever again. Thanks for ruining that for me blu jam! Can't wait to try more here!

Reviews.Author: Izeena E.
Reviews.Content: My friend I experienced "The Blu Jam phenomenon" earlier this week it exceeded our expectations. Spencer was our host....amazing service our server...amazing our food....amazZzzing!!!
Reviews.Author_Location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

Reviews.Author: Noam B.
Reviews.Content: If u don't mind to wait ( can be 30-40 min. On sat. & sun.) then this is the place to have breakfast in town

Reviews.Author: Ruth W.
Reviews.Content: Great food and good ambiance.  I've been there several times and they never miss.  I love their french toast. It is a tad pricey, but totally worth it.

Reviews.Author: Mike E.
Reviews.Content: A friend wanted to come here and I blindly followed without having done any yelp research so I went in with little to no expectations.  We arrived at around 2:00 PM on a Saturday and were told there would be a 20-30 minute wait.  No problem, we wandered around some of the stores nearby.  50 minutes later, we were still waiting, and this despite only having three groups ahead of us.  At least they had ice water outside; that was a nice touch (though I wish they had a trash can to throw away your little cup).  Once we were finally in, we ordered the crispy french toast, the blu jam benedict, and the brunch carbonnara.  We were starving to begin with, which made us sorely unprepared for the next 45 minutes it took to get our food.  When it finally arrived, the presentation of the dishes was great, but I was underwhelmed with the taste.  The french toast was ok but nothing special.  It was basically corn flakes glued onto a dry piece of brioche.  It would have been much better if the brioche had actually seen any of the egg batter.  I usually love french toast, so it's a bad sign when as here I let me wife eat most of it.  I got the brunch carbonnara because the menu sold me with the words "risotto with bacon".  I should have kept reading the rest of the ingredients because I swear half the risotto was actually peas, which sort of took over the dish.  Again, it was fine, but nothing special.  The blu jam benedict may have been my favorite but even that was just good, not amazing.  Our server was nice when we saw him, but the only times we saw him were when he took our order and brought us our bill.  On the plus side, the portion size is pretty generous, the prices are reasonable (~$13/entree), and the interior is well done.  Finding street parking down some side streets wasn't too hard either.  But the whole thing left me with the impression that people go there because it's trendy, not because it's good.  If you served exactly the same dishes in an untrendy restaurant without the long wait, I don't think it would get nearly the same reviews.

Reviews.Author: Ellcee C.
Reviews.Content: SUPERB!!! Hands down one of my favorite places to eat.  The atmosphere is beautiful and the food is amazing.  They also do catering which is perfect for impressing clients,  spoiling your staff or friends.  They create a wonderful presentation, are very professional, and the food is phenomenal both at the restaurant or for catered orders.  I highly recommend Blu Jam Cafe!

Reviews.Author: Pearl V.
Reviews.Content: i was in the restaurant in yesterday for a quick breakfast~i ordered the most famous Villia Latte n the Cruncy French Toast~honesly,i m disappointed~~somehow,the waiter is friendly and the service is quite nice~~

Reviews.Author: Deyan B.
Reviews.Content: We had great expectations for Blu Jam Cafe, based on the rave reviews. But the place failed to deliver. The wait was not too bad; we expected much worse. What was inconsiderate, though, was that the establishment failed to provide shade for its waiting patrons. Under the scorching sun, many people had elected to wait under the awning of the adjoining modest store. We were given a choice of outdoor or indoor seating. We chose indoor, since the outdoor patrons are completely exposed to the waiting crowd, and it felt kind of awkward to eat while 25-30 people are waiting for you to finish. The indoor seating did not turn out better. The place is very crowded, with tables jammed close together and noise level very high. It appears that the owners are milking this establishment to the max. The waiters were hurried and clearly overworked. We waited 15 minutes just to get water. After we got our food, we felt rushed; my wife was only halfway through her meal (I was done, though) when the waiter showed up with the check and asked her whether she wanted a box. The food itself was ok, but I expected better from a place with such good reviews. The potatoes were bland and slightly burned. The eggs Benedict were ok.The most irritating thing at this place, though, was the double standard applied to the customers. While we were waiting to be seated, a big black Mercedes parked in the passenger loading zone in front. The couple (apparently someone important plus wife) was seated immediately. We also observed how their drinks and food were delivered before many others who were waiting. When we were leaving, we saw the guy play chess with a boy at his table at the window, while scores of people were waiting outside.

Reviews.Author: Chris A.
Reviews.Content: Wow! Amazing food, we were in a hurry and the wait was longer than we were told but once we sat down they took care of business! Great place, great service, plan to wait but worth it!! Gave us iced coffees to go as well!!

Reviews.Author: Joy B.
Reviews.Content: I knew I loved Blu Jam from the multitude of Yelp reviews that came up every time I browsed for "brunch". In this city, brunch on a Sunday = 2 hour wait so I never dared try for Blu Jam until I somehow got out of bed before 8am. Made it to Blu Jam just after 9 and it was only a 10 minute wait for a table. I really appreciated that I had my own "space" once we were seated, a lot of brunch places in Weho cram you so close together that you can't hear yourself think! Being healthy, we split the Burgundy Omelette with wheat toast and fruit- so delicious! I was eyeing the french toast at a neighboring table, but unlike pancakes they can't serve a single french toast- it's an all or nothing deal. We were not so secretly hoping that our neighbors would abandon their remaining french toast so we could sneak a slice but they took it all (8 pieces in 1 order!)... Overall a good experience, I'm keeping that french toast on my to try list and will DEFINITELY be back!

Reviews.Author: Chris L.
Reviews.Content: Local art, good healthy food choices, tasty coffee and mostly nice employees. Nice prices too.

Reviews.Author: Nancy R.
Reviews.Content: You where right Gary...the french toast was amazing!  Loved this place, I have so many things I want to try!

Reviews.Author: EVAN B.
Reviews.Content: Our friends took us here, and called it their favorite restaurant. Well, now it's ours too. Awesome food, Awesome service, and the prices are reasonable. They also have a great selection of beer. I recommend the banana beer. Just try it! Kamil the owner is great too! Heard breakfast is super, but haven't tried it yet.

Reviews.Author: Carrie R.
Reviews.Content: This place rocks - if you like breakfast, you'll love Blu Jam. Everything on their menu is great and portion size is generous. But go early - the lines start forming quickly!

Reviews.Author: Marie M.
Reviews.Content: Definitely one of the best places for french toast!  Literally out of this world goodness. I ordered an egg dish, which wasn't memorable, but the brioche french toast- wow!

Reviews.Author: Raymond K.
Reviews.Content: 4.25 stars, the food is good and the atmosphere is good.   A hidden surprise is that the tea is good here, they put it in a coffee press.  Why not have the coffee also in the coffee press.  We order the eggs benedict and the crunchy french toast. The toast and benedict were both good.  Tip is aggressive here, the printed tip percent starts at 18.  Overall a nice place.

Reviews.Author: Jessica L.
Reviews.Content: Went here for breakfast yesterday (Sunday) around 9am, and boy, am I glad I did. It was wonderful! Very quiet and relaxed at that hour - not many people out on Melrose, all the shops are closed, and the people were there for the food and the ambience, not the "scene." It looked like there were quite a few regulars. The owner came out and chatted with everyone, even giving his regulars a hug or (in the case of the dog) a scratch behind the ears. It was another of those places where I can't decide what I want - everything looks too good! I ended up with "Roma via Paris" - three eggs scrambled with spinach, zucchini, sun-dried tomatoes, goat cheese, and a few other things I don't remember. Definitely not pretty on the plate (all the ingredients turned the eggs a weird brownish-grey) but yummy in my tummy! It came with potatoes or fruit (I had fruit) and choice of toast (I highly recommend the rosemary). My sister had eggs benedict Florentine. Now that was a beautiful dish - we wished we had the camera! She got the potatoes and said they were just "okay." The coffee was wonderful, both the decaf and the full strength. And I love that the water has lemon and mint. How many places do you go where the tap water is memorable? What attention to detail! Speaking of detail, when I finally stopped stuffing my face and had a chance to look around, I noticed all the original artwork lining the walls (it's all for sale), the rough but warm wood paneling, the high unfinished loft ceilings that are all the rage in restaurants right now, and the general charm of the place. It would be fun to come back one night to see the difference when it's more of a "bistro." Just a note to respond to some of the other reviews - it looks like they may have upped the price on the weekday breakfast special - I think it's $6.95 now. Still a good deal when you consider the quality of the food and the care with which it's prepared.

Reviews.Author: Megan K.
Reviews.Content: yummy, yum, yum. lucky for us, no one is out in LA at 9 am. outside seating, a plenty. service on point. great coffee, but the eggs benedict was off the chain. my gf was in love with her breakfast too. there was only one problem, and it was no fault of blu jam. the Hollywood douchbags at the next table, loudly dropping names and being high maintenence. i should thank them for my reality check. i was having too much fun to remember why i can never live in LA ever again. they are the reason. i cant stand the bullshit.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer S.
Reviews.Content: ehhh. ok ...$4 for a small cup of OJ? mickey D's has a better deal and it's even juicer!!! do you see something wrong with this picture? everything else, however, on the menu was reasonably priced...it's rather annoying how certain places is rated to be the best, the BEST brunch places in town when one's experience is rather mediocre ... keep in mind, we ARE in LA, and we ARE on melrose where parking is notorious for crazy parkers, with so many stupid signs, and so many retarded touristy pedestrians! :[ maybe its the best brunch spot for location?this place is suitable for tourists who want to be part of the LA scene minus people watchin for celebs, and those who want to graduate oneself by feeding themselves a big fat pinks hotdog up the street...if you want to be considered "remotely" uppity oopity trendy,, eat some "or so they speak" type of food called "organic" and pay $$$ and not to mention wear sunglasses INDOORS* (arf!)  this place is for you.  why not be kind to yourself and make it over to the next city over, yes, 90210, and munch aways...  like serrrriooously!!!COMPLETELY OVER HYPED!!!

Reviews.Author: Goldy H.
Reviews.Content: YUCK!!!! IF I COULD GIVE THIS PLACE NO STARS I WOULD!!!!  I ordered the roma via paris which is supposed to be eggs scrambled with spinach, zucchini,sun dried tomatoes, red bell peppers, fresh basil, mozzarella and goat cheese served with toast and roasted potatoes, sounds good right ? Well not so much the eggs were not seasoned and the veggies were raw not sauteed  like they should have been i mean who wants raw hard veggies in their eggs, it was smothered in cheese and just flavorless. I also ordered a omelette with red bell peppers, tomatoes , bacon , and cheddar cheese , same thing with this omelette the peppers were raw and the omelette was flavorless and smothered in cheese the potatoes were also bland. The food was plated to go in a very sloppy manner it literally looked like it was emptied from someones plate and thrown into a box. All this garbage tasting garbage looking food for a grand total of $27.14 I could have made omellettes for a week at this price , well you live and you learn now I gotta go brush my teeth and my tongue to rid my mouth of the disgusting after taste from the 2 bites of food i actually ate. What a waste of food if I had a dog I wouldnt even insult the dog by feeding it this slop.

Reviews.Author: Dave W.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam on Melrose - a real institution. Go and get wild, trust me and 100 others, it's worth it! Norwegian & Florentine Benedict, French toast and the Eggwich are simply genius and worth every cent. Mhmm!

Reviews.Author: Thom H.
Reviews.Content: Had the most delicious dinner here Friday April 1.....here it is 2 days later and I cannot stop thinking about it! With a menu full of small, meant to be shared delights....Blu Jam Cafe offers simply the best dinner to be had in Los Angeles. The scallops were perfection, and the Argentinian Steak was so tender, so perfect....I can't wait for another round. Think you know mac and cheese? The truffle infused mac and cheese if off the charts. My advice...go, try, eat, enjoy, go some more. I know I will!

Reviews.Author: A W.
Reviews.Content: I had been hearing about this place and went there for the first time on Friday.  The food is delicious.  I had the turkey burger and demolished it in three minutes.  Two waiters told me that the BBQ chicken sandwich is their favorite.  I ordered it to go to eat for dinner.  It did not disappoint!  I cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Author: Eric C.
Reviews.Content: Great place for breakfast in the Hollywood area.  Gets busy quick, so get there before 9:30am and you should be good.  Food was good overall, fresh and they put a little spin on traditional breakfast items. I had the "Kamil's Breakfast", pan roasted macaroni scrambled with eggs, bacon, ham, garlic, chives, and cheddar cheese.  I thought it was good and you will like it if you are a mac & cheese person, although the dish was a little heavy on the garlic.  My wife had the "Florentine Benedict", poached eggs on english muffin with spinach, mushrooms, sun dried tomatoes, and brie cheese, topped with hollandaise.  She thought the eggs were cooked just right and the veggies were all fresh.  Everybody else at the table also seemed satisfied with their meal.  We also ordered Blu Jam's signature "Crunchy French Toast", which was actually just ok and didn't live up to the hype.  Ours was not really crunchy at all, more on the softer side if anything.  We could have passed on ordering the french toast all together.  Overall I would rate this place a good breakfast option for something fresh and a little different.  I would come back again to try out some of the other breakfast items.

Reviews.Author: Randy D.
Reviews.Content: blu jam is located right in the heart of melrose's retail alley.  the outdoor sidewalk seating is a great spot to people-watch while eating a meal.  my breakfast order today was definitely four stars, but that's all on the menu that seemed remotely interesting.  so i don't really see myself going here again, unless i wanted a norwegian benedict with a side of bockwurst and a large grapefruit juice.even then, the croissant they used for the base of my benny had a bready texture as opposed to the traditional flaky one.  they'd prolly benefit more from their bread being supplied by an artisan gourmet bakery.  the consistency was a little off, but all the buttery flavor was still present.  at least, the hollandaise and poached eggs were spot-on while the salad on the side had a nice vinagrette.i sampled my sis' and gf's meals which were pretty meh.  sis had a kinda flavorless morning hash with what seemed like boiled mushy potatoes, while the gf ordered a dry salmon and spinach which was covered with a heavy tomato sauce.  the salmon and tomato sauce pairing really didn't go well together.  real glad that i ordered what i did.  otherwise, i'd have been disappointed.the service was very friendly and attentive.  they came around every few minutes to refill our glasses and make sure things were alright.  they also did their best to promptly seat us even with a large hungry crowd gathering on the street.  personally, i don't think it's worth waiting over half an hour on sunday to be seated for a decent breakfast.  i'd rather waste my time on something more remarkable....

Reviews.Author: Michael C.
Reviews.Content: I was by myself and the wait was 45 minutes. I waited anyway because I was really hungover and didn't want to make an effort finding another place. It was worth it. I had the Miga dish, but they were 86 on chorizo! Nonetheless, they substituted with apple-smoked chicken sausage, which turned out to be great. The scramble was spicy, so had the chorizo been in there it  would've ignited a fire in my mouth. The portion was not too big but definitely not too small. I had a choice of fried potatoes, mixed greens or fresh fruit. The potatoes where very flavorful as they really browned them. I also had the crispy french toast. (Yeah, I was being a fatty.) It was really good. I had to box up half and I'm eating the rest now. It wasn't served with syrup though. They had this vanilla icing for it. I was too afraid to ask for syrup. The only reason I give this place 4 instead of 5 is because it wasn't EXTRAORDINARY. The food was really, really good, but nothing really surprised me. I'll def go back when I'm in the area. Oh, they had really good coffee. And the freshly squeezed OJ was very tasty. So I'll go ahead and bump the rating to a 4.5.

Reviews.Author: Adam M.
Reviews.Content: It might be unscrupulous to give five stars after visiting an eatery only once, but honestly, it was just that good.  Everything about the place makes me certain I will return.  For now, let me discuss the brunch.  First, the food.  The pictures online are appetizing, but do not do the taste justice.  The menu is creative, with a combination of flavors I have not seen before, but definitely want to try.  The Louisiana Hash had eggs, salmon, red peppers, tomatoes, potatoes, spices and came topped with hollandaise sauce.  It was delicious and fresh.  It was also humongous.  The oriental tofu scramble is an excellent vegetarian alternative to those who don't prefer eggs.  It had great texture and flavor.  The coffee and tea were good too.  Now for the service: it was friendly and fast.  There was no wait for a table, no rush to order, and no rush to leave.  The food came before I could start wondering about it.  And the waitress was very sweet.  Finally, the ambiance.  The place is unpretentious and relaxed - both the patrons and the staff.  The interior walls are exposed brick and the roof exposed beams, and the tables are very cosy.  It's a good place to bring friends, a date, parents, etc.  I thoroughly enjoyed it.

Reviews.Author: Tiffanie C.
Reviews.Content: the owner is super friendly and the food is good as usual!

Reviews.Author: Maylin G.
Reviews.Content: probably the best breakfast i've ever had...i'm a huge fan of egg sandwiches and they made it exactly how it's meant to be.  the egg was over medium, a pesto mayo working perfectly to compliment the super fresh avocado and tomato.  it didn't even fall apart with every bite, even though the bread was toasted.  i will return and return. everyone else at the table ordered different and equally impressive meals.  there was complete silence as we all fell into our plates.  the breakfast risotto taste like paella in this weird but surprising way.  if you're looking for a way to have eggs taste better then what you aspiring chefs can make, try these guys out.

Reviews.Author: Katherine S.
Reviews.Content: I love this place! It is 2 blocks away from my house and i have been going here for years now.. Their crepes are unbelievable, last time i was there we ordered one of each... everything there is delicious and the owner is a sweetheart. This is one of my fave breakfast places

Reviews.Author: Effie G.
Reviews.Content: good breakfast food.  vanilla latte to die for.  very smooth!

Reviews.Author: Teena S.
Reviews.Content: we had friends in from nor cal visiting and needed to take them to brunch comparable to lime in castro - not quite the case at blue jam..but didnt hear any complaints! we had a party close to 10 people and the wait wasnt that long. we got nestled into the back "wine room" which was private and big enough to hold all of us.the service was attentive, and staff was friendly - the food was very clean and definitely rave worthy! we ordered practically one of everything off of the menu and everyone was pleased with their order! **warning - no alcohol = no mimosas.

Reviews.Author: Abhaya S.
Reviews.Content: Vanilla French toast and florentine benedict.. that's all I've got to say. Food tastes amazing!

Reviews.Author: Christie K.
Reviews.Content: never disappoints :)

Reviews.Author: joanne p.
Reviews.Content: came here on a sunday for brunch, there was a bit of a wait about 30miniutes not too long. got sat as soon as a table opened up and i ordered the soup of the day, mushroom soup, it was not my favorite but the delicious crusted french toast and Roma Via Paris made up for it. plus the goat cheese on the scramble complemented it very well.

Reviews.Author: I. K.
Reviews.Content: Good but far from fantastic. I tried the meat stew they had which was alright and something that you cannot get that often around here. The other stuff I had was average, including an omelette's and a couple of cappuccinos.

Reviews.Author: David A.
Reviews.Content: We had a party of 15 for my birthday, and wanted a reservation for brunch.  I was initially told they don't take reservations for brunch, but I was put on the phone with the owner who said it would be fine as long as I gave him a credit card for him to keep on hold.  Our table was ready early, and the service was great, even though it was just one waitress for the entire table (though we're pretty easy).  Their fresh juices are incredible, though i could have used a little pulp in the oj (minor personal gripe).  Nearly all of us ordered different things, and everyone left satisfied with a full stomach.  I had the breakfast quesadilla and was thrilled with it. The food came out pretty quickly considering the size of our party,  and came out relatively together which is always the toughest.  It was all our first times, and we will definitely go back.

Reviews.Author: melissa B.
Reviews.Content: Amazing! The wait was 45 minutes on a late Sunday morning, but soo worth it. My boyfriend and I just went across the street to get some coffee while we waited. I got the breakfast tacos and he got the crunchy french toast. Really, really awesome food. Parking sucks, though. Can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Author: Lola S.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam is right around the corner from me so we go a few times a month.  Everyone talks about the breakfast, which is amazing, but their lunch/dinner was also great.  The only reason this isn't 5 stars is they recently got rid of their Bistro Menu at night.  That was a favorite dinner place to take out-of-towners and for special occasions. The new menu is just like any other place which was disappointing the last place I went.  Still great food, but none of the favorites we love.  I will sorely miss that tapas menu and a place to go on Saturday nights!!!

Reviews.Author: Amanda Y.
Reviews.Content: I had the crunchy french toast when I visited, and it was so yummy! I am now back in Boston and I am missing the french toast. My friend had the norwegian benedict and she loved it too! My other friends thought that it was nothing special. Overall, I like the place :)

Reviews.Author: Alice W.
Reviews.Content: I am in love with Kamils Breakfast.  It is simply divineeee. Theres a perfect balance of gooey cheddar cheese scrambled with eggs, bacon, ham, and garlic, all topped of with chives, a suprisingly perfect ingredient to tie everything together. On top of that it's all pan fried together with perfectly cooked al dente macaroni noodles.  When it comes out the entire dish looks like a bed of yummy melted cheese, eggs, and ingredients just peacefully sitting on top of a fluffy cloud, (a cloud made up of plump macaroni noodles that is). If you want to venture out something and try something different from the usual french toast or eggs benedict, this is a good dish to start with. Best of all? Blue Jam serves breakfast is served until 5pm! If you're like me and breakfast is youre favorite meal, then I suggest coming here because they have an extensive breakfast menu serving all delicious kinds of morning fare. Also worth trying are the blue jams benedict. If you can, try sitting outside on a sunny day cause you can people watch and take in the scene of Melrose St.

Reviews.Author: BM V.
Reviews.Content: great breakfast, good atmosphere. we got to sit in the special room. yay!

Reviews.Author: Jenny C.
Reviews.Content: i'm going to keep this simple...i loved everything about my order! (eggs florentine w/ crab)

Reviews.Author: MaryAnn D.
Reviews.Content: Had breakfast/brunch here a couple of weeks ago, but had to write because it was delicious!  I had the veggie tofu hash and it was very good!  I do think I would probably order a tofu scramble next time just because the table next to us had it and it looked even better.  The French toast was another favorite amongst our group.  Definitely recommend for the food and the fun smaller atmosphere!  Will definitely go back!

Reviews.Author: Molly O.
Reviews.Content: Great brunch food, large portions and the best chai tea latte ever!

Reviews.Author: Blake E.
Reviews.Content: Actual nice people who care about your needs as a customer!!  I came here with my room mate after hearing good things about a secret dish they have called Blu Toast which is the most delicious French Toast you'll ever have in your entire life!  Basically french toast stuff with warm cream chz with powdered sugar and fresh fruit.  Anywho, Since we live in the area we've been to a bunch of other places for brunch like Toast, etc. and the hostesses can be uninterested and not really want to work with you. We were in a hurry that day to get a table and the hostess said it'd only be 10 min.  THEN we had two friends call us and tell us that they wanted to join.  Our table was ready and I was nervous to tell the hostess about us being 4 now,  figuring she would get annoyed and just forget about us.  I explained that my room mate had to get to work but we really wanted to eat the Blu Toast.  She told us to hold on while she figured something out.  Came up with the brilliant idea to seat us in an empty 2 top, knowing that the 2 top next to us was about to leave, so that we could get started with our order while we waited for our 2 friends to arrive. AMAZING...  TOAST would have just told us, too bad, if you're entire party isn't here you can't be seated.   :(  ALSO, the Lattes are supercool cause the guy makes these great drawings with the foam.  We were taking pictures of our lattes and the owner roles by and shows us his iPhone with some of the best creations from the past. THEN at the end of the meal, I guess cause we were so ecstatic about the Blu Toast and the Lattes,  the owner brings us his favorite Lemon Crepes for dessert on the house :)We had a great time, good company, good food, good service. What else can you ask for?   oh and the bread with olive tapenade they give before your meal is delicious, and the tap water is in pitchers with mint and lemon so us cheapos can have tasty tap water.

Reviews.Author: Grant R.
Reviews.Content: I have lived in this neighborhood for a decade and was astonished when I tried Blue Jam for the first time a month ago that I hadn't been here before!  From the outside it doesn't look like much -- just another cafe on Melrose -- but inside it's got a really chill vibe (for LA) and the food was much better than expected.  When I go out for breakfast or brunch it's usually to Vienna or Tart, but Blue Jam is my new fave!

Reviews.Author: Clara L.
Reviews.Content: came here for a lazy saturday breakfast. the food was great. custom ordered an omelet  and got a tex mex scramble. both were really good. but what made the whole experience better was our waitress. she was seriously the NICEST waitress i've met here in LA (and i was born, raised, went to college, worked here for the last 25 years). not only did she come by frequently to check up on us, she also got me a to-go cup for my coffee. as sad as it is, that NEVER happens in LA. so let me give the restaurant & food 4 stars and the waitress an entire star for just being so great.

Reviews.Author: Megan H.
Reviews.Content: We came to Blu Jam on Monday morning of Presiden's day weekend.  We got there around 10am and there was definitely a crowd waiting, but the wait staff did a really good job of moving everyone through quickly without being rushed.  They had quite a bit of seating inside, and about 8 tables outside (where we sat).  The waitress was very attentive and when she didn't come immediately, the host made sure to send her over.  We had water brought out before they had taken our order.  I got the breakfast burrito with potatoes and my bf got the Roma via Paris scramble.  The breakfast burrito was toasted to perfection and was pretty cheesy.  My one complaint would be that it lacked a salsa or something inside, but I love hot sauce and sauces in general.  It did come with a side of sour cream, but I didn't use it.  The potatoes were cooked to perfection, with a wonderful seasoning.  The scramble was also delicious, very fresh filled with veggies.  They also serve breakfast all day!  I had the fresh squeezed OJ and drank it in minutes, it was fresh tasting and you could tell the oranges were at the perfect ripeness.  Overall the service was quick and the food was fresh and delicious, we would go back.

Reviews.Author: Shahboz K.
Reviews.Content: thier name is like thier food...stupid.  First I must say Whats up with the water! I did not know it was imported from Mexico.  I took a drink and almost spit it out on my girlfriend.  Went there for breakfast.  It was about 10am and we were immediatley shown to a table.  That was good but I am not sure if it would always be like that because No one in Hollywood ever wakes up before 1pm on a sunday anyway.  The service was Excellant, the waitres was nice and helpful.  She was a little too cheery for that early in the morning.  She would look at you and smile but the kind of smile like you have something on your face but she was too nice to tell you that you do, smile.  I was constantly wiping my face. Felt like a breakfast sandwhich.  I ordered the Eggwhich, (I am the Cult leader of Bringing the Dagwood back to Denny's). Now when it comes to food there is not many things I do not like.  Not a big fan of Bacon, Pesto Sauce, and I am just recently getting into Mayonaise.  I recieve my food farely quickly and it contained all the above such drama. I ate it anyways! it was not that bad,   I bet if I would have paid attention to the menu I would have ordered something I liked and it would have been good.  My girlfriend orded something wierd and it tasted a little bland to me. she said it was ok.  I was not really impressed with this place.  I would rather go down the street to Cayenne cafe.  That place is awesome.

Reviews.Author: Kevin P.
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best breakfast spot in LA and they serve TABANERO hot sauce with is the best hot sauce I have ever tasted, I just love this place. Try the brunch Carbonnara with a little Tabanero and you will be in heaven!

Reviews.Author: cari t.
Reviews.Content: found this place through yelp and will definitely go back.  i got there on a sunday around 11:30 and even though there was a line outside we got seated within 10-15 mins.  we ordered the toscana scramble and the morning hash and both were delicious.  the pesto sauce really stood out in the scramble and the morning hash had all the flavors you want in a hash w/o the grease.  we also ordered a banana walnut pancake on the side and it was great but i felt like it could've been a little warmer when it was served.  overall i took a star off b/c there was a little bit of a confusion with the seating (we were asked to moved to a different table 5 mins after we sat down b/c someone reserved the table we were sitting in) and it did take a while for us to get our food.  but i'd say this is a 4.5 :)

Reviews.Author: Anna K.
Reviews.Content: On a I-really-want-brunch kind day, A and I headed over to the very cool shopping meca on melrose avenue. After being informed of the 15 minute wait, we consulted over yelp and framed menu, we settled on the migas and the blueberry crepes the plaqued reviews raved about.  Upon being seated, we promptly told the server our selection only to be greeted with the unexpected: "oooo I'm sorry but we don't make blueberry crepes anymore." WHAT? How is one of the chef's supposed best known dishes no longer offered? In a scramble, brioche french toast with blackberry jam, vanilla yogurt, fresh berries and banana was placed instead. As we chatted and oogled over the dishes our neighbors were consuming, 2 plates were placed in front of us. A very large portion of scrambled eggs with jalapenos, chipotle, beef chorizo sausage, bell peppers, tortilla chips, and mozzerella was served with crispy potato cubes and flour tortilla. The menu stated it was spicy but even after adding spicy sauce on the eggs, it left both of us disappointed. The french toast was delicious on the other hand. Thick pieces of french toast with jam in between, it had enough sweetness on its own but we couldn't pass the chance to eat it with the real maple syrup accompanying it in a little silver jar. The syrup wasn't too sweet and was a nice option to accompany the toast along with the fresh fruit. The french toast saved my review from being a solid 2. Considering all the good reviews on yelp, I was full and somewhat satisfied but it wasn't as good as I hoped it to be. A: "But that's how brunch is supposed to be." I wholeheartedly disagree.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer C.
Reviews.Content: long wait...this place is clearly a popular brunch place but it's delicious and innovative

Reviews.Author: Emily M.
Reviews.Content: Good brunch fair. However, I waited more than 20 minutes for breakfast for one person on a random weekday.  I can only imagine the wait times for a weekend brunch.  This is a New York level of wait time, but not a New York caliber of food.  The wrap on fire, which is their spicy version of a breakfast burrito, was just a good, not great, breakfast burrito, and it was in no way spicy at all.  In california, I expect a spicy dish to be spicy.  It's basically why I travel this cold place that everyone thinks is hot (LA).  Another thing I expect in LA, which I cannot get in NY, is good orange juice.  I ordered this OJ at this brunch place expecting it to be as good as the OJ my friend had just squeezed from me from the orange tree growing outside of her LA apartment.  It wasn't even OK; I'm not sure it was even fresh squeezed, and I don't believe I finished it.  The food wasn't terrible, but when there's a line, I have pretty high expectations for brunch.

Reviews.Author: Leang E.
Reviews.Content: I usually make breakfast at home especially on the weekends, and knowing that I wouldn't have my own kitchen available I was ready to seek out this place during my vacation in California.  The wait time was underestimated, but it's like when you put in the 45 minute wait already, you can't exactly say screw it and go some place else and invest time waiting at the new place.  It was a Saturday, so I expected it to be busy and ended up waiting for an hour.  My cousin, sister and I got seated outdoors, which suited me quite well as the sunny sky was nice to look out at.  I had a tasty cappuccino and ordered the Venice Risotto or other, and it reminded me of fried rice with all the vegetables with a runny egg.  It was delicious and quite creative.  It was filled me up just right.  My sister's benedict was very yummy as well.  I'm sure there might be a better time to go when the wait isn't so long, but I'd love to try more dishes if I come back for a visit.  Our waitress was friendly and helpful with recommendations, and the whole staff seemed pretty attentive refilling our water and clearing up our table as needed.  I appreciate how dogs were able to sit outside with their owners at tables, and like how they are located to a few shops that you can browse through while you are waiting for your name to be called - just don't forget to listen for it.

Reviews.Author: Burt b.
Reviews.Content: really good food. worth the wait. drinks are good.  the green tea chai latte doesn't taste like dirt which I can't say about urth cafe.

Reviews.Author: Samuel C.
Reviews.Content: Love this spot!  Great pancakes and waffles.  One of my favorite brunch spots to hit up in LA whenever I'm in town.

Reviews.Author: Mike L.
Reviews.Content: went here on a rainy in melrose and spent a good 10 mins looking for parking. No luck on melrose and decided to park one block north and make the short walk from the local neighborhoods. the wait was quoted 25 mins and we were seated exactly then. we ordered the norwegien benedict and the salmon benny cakes. the benedict was perfection. the smoked salmon wasnt too smokey and the pouched eggs were cooked perfectly. the portion size is okay as they do give you alot of potatoes. The down side of the meal was the benny cakes. i thought this dish to be overrated by other reviewers as the cakes were mostly made of batter. there is barely a hint of salmon or whatever else goes into the cakes. the only bright side to the benny cakes again is the wonderfully pouched eggs. All and all, the goods outshined the bads and I am willing to come back and fight traffic to try something else off Blu Jam's extensive menu.

Reviews.Author: Ryan C.
Reviews.Content: Get the French toast. Parking is terrible because its melrose and sometimes the wait is bad but go get your car washed or shop somewhere and you'll be fine.
Reviews.Author_Location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

Reviews.Author: Babette C.
Reviews.Content: Went this morning with my sister and brother in law.  We are all food snobs from San Francisco and since I moved to L.A., there aren't many restaurants that I love.  Blu Jam might become a favorite.  We got there at about 9:30 am on a Saturday morning and there was no lines and no wait.  Their eggs benedict was solid and I was impressed that the fruit that came with it wasn't thrown in to a bowl, but was actually arranged.  My sister said that the greens she picked as her brekfast side was so good, that she almost licked the balsamic vinaigrette off the plate.  Her salmon scramble was so good, that I'm definitely going to get some of that on my next visit.  The restaurant is small and yes, it is reminiscent of some of those places you'd find in the San Francisco bay.  And the staff is super-friendly.  They don't get in your face about it, but every single employee made a point of saying goodbye.  Don't know if these hard economic times are going to spur restaurants  to try harder in the service department, but no matter what the motivation, it was nice to be told goodbye by everyone.  It made me feel like I was my visit was appreciated.

Reviews.Author: Julie W.
Reviews.Content: Great service and delicious french toast.  I also had the mocha latte which was very good!

Reviews.Author: C S.
Reviews.Content: Wait was 1 hr, street parking was 2 hrs, but food was out of the world! they gave us complimentary crispy french toast for the wait. It is the best ever and I am not exaggerating, It must be had. Florentine benedict was yummmmm. I'd go there again and take my guests there too.

Reviews.Author: Alyssa B.
Reviews.Content: Just had New Year's breakfast here and it was fantastic! We got there early around 10 and the wait wasn't too bad. Service was great and the food was delicious! We even got a complimentary crepe and it was amazing! I got a breakfast sandwich and it was one of the best that I have ever had. Yummy with a pesto aioli sauce (or something like that). DELICIOUS!! Great potatoes too!!! Great food and great company- perfect way to start 2013!

Reviews.Author: Teresa F.
Reviews.Content: Have been in for breakfast twice.  Last time I had poached eggs, mixed greens and turkey sausage with wheat toast.  My latte was well made.  I enjoyed my breakfast and would not hesitate to stop by any time I am in the area.

Reviews.Author: Geoffrey S.
Reviews.Content: I met Kamil Majer through my best friend.  Since then, I have been delighted to know him, his cooking, his family Goulash (mmmm), and every breakfast creation you can think of.  Imagine art, made from food, which you are supposed to eat, where it not only delights the eyes, but your taste buds!  Its no wonder that he's rated one of the best breakfast places in town!  He also does a superb job when catering private parties; I know this, as we've had several at his location.  Lastly, if you have traveled abroad, and you're used to fine bistro cuisine, you will experience it again with Kamil's food.  He has run in the past bistro nights, where you'll need to make a reservation a month (or two) in advance, as you'll be transported via his food, to the region that he's chosen to cook for that evening.  You will be delighted at the atmosphere, the food is top notch, and the clientele are all warm and friendly.  You'll realize on a bistro night, you're not eating with strangers, but new friends waiting to share they're joy and experience with you, as it all comes together in a synchronous moment in time.

Reviews.Author: Amanda M.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jame is an anomaly to me. It's sort of hard to explain what type of restaurant it is. Is it really a cafe? The breakfast and lunch menu full of your usual cafe type fair would imply so. Yet, you can also find goulash on the menu (it's good - though I've never had goulash before). Then there is the dinner menu. On Bistro night expect high end small plates that include lamb chops and other items you would expect on a more "fancy" restaurant menu.I wasn't expecting small plates that night and there wasn't any other menu offered, but I have to say I really loved it. That said - it's all a little schizophrenic for my taste. I work really close by and I find myself coming here occasionally but at the same time I can't say I really like it. But I don't not like it. I guess I just don't really know what to think of it. It's like it wants to be a more bistro then cafe but the menu straddles both worlds.

Reviews.Author: Anonymous D.
Reviews.Content: This place blew my mind. I had the tofu vegan dish, which was as tasty as it was healthy. She had, and was kind enough to share, the famous crispy French toast. Holy Cannoli, hands down best French toast I've ever tasted. The strawberries and bananas on top were so flavorful! And the vanilla bean sauce...craving it right now. I would consider kidnapping the chef if prison didn't frighten me.

Reviews.Author: Shamiah C.
Reviews.Content: Excellent food and service!

Reviews.Author: Brendan B.
Reviews.Content: I love Blu Jam.  All of their breakfast choices are unique, delicious and the perfect portions.  The service is great!  To avoid the crowds on the weekend, try to get there before 10:00 am.  Even when it's packed, they still seem to turn tables over rather quickly.

Reviews.Author: Lydia S.
Reviews.Content: every morning, my alarm goes off and i try to find a reason to call out of work and go to blu jam for breakfast instead. everything i've ordered off their menu has never failed to disappoint. even in the satisfaction of my own dish, i glare at my friends' plates with envy. if there were only enough room in my stomach for everyone else's dishes AND mine. woe is me.

Reviews.Author: Sarah M.
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, Blu Jam seriously lives up to its title of "The Best Breakfast Place in Los Angeles" (according to MyFoxLa.com and Aol's City Guide).  I live nearby and have come here countless times for breakfast and brunch.  In fact, if there wasn't the slight drawback of usually having to wait, I would have a bit of a problem since I'd only want to dine here.  Their egg dishes are just so good.  The eggs are always cooked perfectly (never too dry, never too runny).  The side of hash brown potatoes is well seasoned and quite large.  The fruit side if I'm feeling particularly healthy is also always fresh, ripe, and yummy.  After reading a bunch of these reviews I think I need to definitely order the French Toast and Eggs Benedict during my next visit.  Yesterday I had the "Old Word"--eggs scrambled with sautéed onions, mushrooms, chives and mozzarella--with Rye toast and potatoes.  SO good.  The generous portions of mushrooms, mozzarella, and onions were an excellent combination and a great complement to the eggs.  I got a side of turkey sausage which was also amazing and deliciously flavored with fennel, although you would have to really love the liquorice-y flavor of fennel like me to truly enjoy.  My friend got some sort of pesto veggie sandwich which she polished off and my other friend got the banana/dark chocolate crepe that I took a bit of and almost melted. To me this is truly one of the best breakfast/brunch places around (and I live like a block away from the Griddle...)

Reviews.Author: Leigh W.
Reviews.Content: Had the most beautiful sandwich of my life here! And fantastic service! Moseyed in here on my first trip to LA and was pleasantly surprised! Silly me did not realize they were closed between the hours of 5 and 6 for dinner preparation but the friendly waiter said it would be NO problem serving me (it was 4:55) just as long as I paid quickly. I insisted upon leaving to find another place (I'm in the service industry, I get it!) but the nice guy persuaded me to stay and sat me at a nice table outside so that I could people watch on Melrose. I asked for a veggie sandwich and was greeted with a very large sandwich on toasted wheat bread piled high with colorful vegetables. I think it went like this: pesto, thick slices of fresh mozzarella, perfectly ripe avocado, juicy purple cherokee heirloom slices, sprouts,  and crisp golden and purple beets. Seriously the best sandwich I've ever had in my life, and no doubt the most beautiful! The beets were truly the "icing" on the sandwich. Go here! You won't be disappointed! It was a little pricey, I think about $13, but I'd do it again :)

Reviews.Author: mike B.
Reviews.Content: mmm delicious eggs benedict!!!!

Reviews.Author: Caitlin Z.
Reviews.Content: I got here around 10:00 which is right when the line starts to form outside. Our wait was about 15 minutes which is quite bearable. The atmosphere is lively and fun but a little smooshed. We were stuck against the wall with barely enough room to squeeze past the next table. The waiter was a little slow, but that was where the negative stopped. The latte and the regular brewed coffee were both excellent. I ordered the famous crunchy french toast with the vanilla sauce. All I can say is oh my gosh. This was the best, and I mean the best french toast I have ever and will ever have. The white bread was substantial yet soft and the corn flake added the perfect texture missing in most french toast. It has the perfect sweetness by itself because of the cornflake flavor but the vanilla sauce, jeese was that good. It was like horizon vanilla milk just thicker and richer with more vanilla bean flavor. My mom had the classic eggs benedict. The potatoes were too dry but the eggs were great. They were poached absolutley perfectly, the english muffin was just right and the hollandaise complemented everything perfectly. The scrambles looked really good and big! This is a great spot for breakfast on Melrose.

Reviews.Author: Kristin H.
Reviews.Content: I love this breakfast spot because the food is great, it's walking distance from my apartment, and I can go shopping at my favorite stores after! I'm not very adventurous so every time I go I get the Roma Via Paris. It's a yummy egg scramble with veggies, goat cheese, and mozzarella. It comes with potatoes and toast but sometimes I'll substitute the eggs for fruit if I feel like being extra healthy. It is always so yummy and the ingredients are fresh! My friend knows the owner who informed her that they only use fresh, organic ingredients which only made me love this place even more. Every time I've been here it's only been with one other person so the wait tends to range from 15-30 minutes which I think is typical for any breakfast spot on the weekend. It's really nice to sit outside if you can to do some Melrose people watching. Definitely a place you must try if you live or are hanging out in the Weho area!

Reviews.Author: Tracy M.
Reviews.Content: This place is all kinds of Awesome!! A friend and I went for Sunday Brunch, there was a wait of about 20mins.But the place is so small that we had to wait outside which wasn't too bad considering it was a nice sunny & breezy day. We were finally seated and we ordered The Spicy wrap, Vegetable soup, Turkey sandwich, and the famous Crunchy French Toast. My soup was very tasty however it was warm not hot, My Turkey sandwich was delicious until I ran across horseradish which I don't really care for, I must have missed it on the menu. Anyhoo! I ate the side that didn't have any visible horseradish because I don't like sending food back unless I really have to. My friend had the spicy wrap and confessed that it was absolutely delish! We decided to share the Crunchy French Toast, which was a Mistake!  because after eating our first bite we were hooked! and was eyeing each other for the last piece....This french toast is AMAZING!! I've tasted my share of french toast and this was by far the Best! I can't wait to go back for more. Valet parking is available which makes parking on a busy street like Melrose stress free.

Reviews.Author: Es L.
Reviews.Content: The crunchy french toast is sweet.... literally! It was like dessert for breakfast.

Reviews.Author: Jason B.
Reviews.Content: la wake up. you guys must be nuts to give this a 4. after taking a trip to SD and going to what my brothers friend said was the best in SD. i have to say that we are spoiled in LA. made me realize how awesome this place is. if the lines are to long dont freaking wait. someone will wait and not be dumb about it.

Reviews.Author: rtda i.
Reviews.Content: This is my first post at yelp.  I am glad that my first experience was pretty positive.  We went to Blu Jam Cafe because of Yelp reviews hehehe.  So let me start at the beginning.  We parked at the street, meter.  The place was nice, paintings were a lil odd but nice.  The waitress was nice also.  It didnt take long before we got our food.  We had high expectations because the rating were pretty good and when we saw our food it was impressive.  For $7.50ish forget exactly the cents the food looked like it was worth more than $10.  My plate was Blu Jam Benedict it was simple and looked yummy.  But my girls she ordered  Eggwich which was about $10 had a side of fruit and I was just amazed at how it was presented they sliced apple and shaped like a fan.  I was just thinking of the effort put to make it look good.  The taste was YUMMY.  The Blu Jam Benedict is soo yummy I will go back and try the other two eggs benedict that they had in the menu.  My girls Eggwhich is pretty good too I like how the creamy egg yok breaks when you bite and the crispy bacon hmmm and how it all melds together with the pesto.  The side of fruit look good and it taste good *smiles*.  I would go back.  Service, food and place are pretty good. Have a good one y'll!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer C.
Reviews.Content: This place deserves all the credit its got! I went on a Sat morning and didn't waited for too long(people that came around noon might had waited a bit). I must say, all the waitress are very helpful and "pretty"! This is the first time i've ever seen a store with "all" their waitress pretty and charming. So the atmosphere was great, filled with energetic early birds :) Last but not least, their food were amazing! I had a glass of  pinot grigio and the Loxes and my cousin had Norwegian Benedict, both were delicious! I'll definitely come back to try the crunchy french toast and other stuff!

Reviews.Author: eliza k.
Reviews.Content: i wish i could afford to eat here everyday, i would come just for there Florentine benedict,  everyday, seriously.  ive tried everyone elses food too- nothing less then spectacular.  fantastic brunch spot.

Reviews.Author: Scylis A.
Reviews.Content: great vibe and atmosphere. instantly greeted with a welcoming feel. i was fortunate enough to have an awesome server who was on her A-Game. i had their special of the mushroom risotto with two poached eggs. it was really filling and bursting with flavor. my friend had their eggs bohemian, which looked awesome. i didn't get the chance to snag a bite cause i was too busy scarfing my face with my own plate.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany J.
Reviews.Content: This place has the most mouth-watering breakfast that I've had in a long time! I like to go to brunch or breakfast with family and friends and this time I went with my mom. She got an omelette that she couldn't say enough and I got the Toscani Scramble. Oh my gosh, this is the best scramble I've had anywhere and highly recommend it. I never would have though to pair scrambled eggs, mozzarella and Italian turkey sausage together, but Blu Jam makes it one of the best things you will taste. The topper was the French toast. We shared the French toast and the woman at the next table saw ours and ordered it for herself. My mom still raves about that French toast and it's been a month since we went. The ingredients are high quality and our server, even though she had a lot of tables, was nice attentive and made you feel at home. Not only would I recommend it, I am planning on going again to try the lunch menu, soon.

Reviews.Author: Max D.
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast, always accommodating staff, terrific vibe.

Reviews.Author: M P.
Reviews.Content: Loved the surf and turf. Unique without crossing the line into strange.  Superb flavor.

Reviews.Author: Nata M.
Reviews.Content: I have tried the restaurant three times, and I am not impressed. The food is too salty (I guess it is not bland because of it), service is slightly pretentious, and the wait is long. There are better places on melrose.

Reviews.Author: Tracy L.
Reviews.Content: I went to this place while I was visiting the area based on the yelp recommendation and it definitely lived up to the reviews. The service was great and so was the food. It's a cold rainy day and I had the soup of the day which was light and healthy and flavorful. I also had a veggie wrap which was surprisingly tasty. I rarely pick the pure veggie options, but it was great.

Reviews.Author: amanda j.
Reviews.Content: Maybe my hopes were too high for this place but I found it to be only average.  I do like the European ambiance and the menu is exciting but nothing quite lived up to the description.  I might give it another go as I live  within walking distance but for a place that says "Best Breakfast in Los Angeles" out front, it definitely has some work to do.

Reviews.Author: Amy E.
Reviews.Content: This place is AWESOME.  I took my boyfriend there for his birthday brunch.  I got the crispy french toast (french toast covered in corn flakes with berries, bananas, and some vanilla maple syrup thing) and he got the Loxex, which was a smoked salmon scramble with some kinda chives creme fraiche and tomatoes and potatoes on the side.  Everything was really excellently cooked, had huge portions, a friendly staff, and an enticing menu.  I love that they serve breakfast all day and the lunch stuff looks equally awesome.  They accidentally got our order mixed up and as a result we each got two iced lattes instead of one, which was awesome!  Best french toast I've had in a while (they only serve it on the weekends).  Good location, cute decor.  Definitely coming back!

Reviews.Author: Shannon S.
Reviews.Content: We didn't have to wait long, like at The Griddle, and we only had enough change for an hour in the meter. Our wait time was about 25 minutes, which isn't bad on a Sunday afternoon. The place is small but seems to sit people pretty quickly. I ordered their delicious vanilla latte on ice and it was the best one I have had! Not to much vanilla and not too much coffee. My boyfriend got the OJ, which seemed very fresh and refreshing. Our waiter was very quick. Before we could even sit down he was asking us what we wanted to drink. Luckily, he gave us some time to look at the menu before we ordered. I ordered the traditional breakfast with eggs, turkey sausage, and pancakes. My boyfriend had the crunchy french toast. Although I didn't like my turkey sausage, I absolutely loved my pancakes. They tasted so very good, I didn't even have to use a lot of the syrup. My boyfriend's crunchy french toast came with berries (strawberry and blueberry) on top and powdered sugar. On the side was a vanilla glaze you put on the toast to replace the syrup. He ordered some bananas to add to it. It was very good! It almost tasted like a crunch cereal but it had the deliciousness of the french toast. Would I go there again? Of course. From what I have seen they have a lot of lunch items that also look very delicious.

Reviews.Author: Suzanne R.
Reviews.Content: Alright, after being a yelp member for about a year, this is my first review.  And it has to be written!  My husband and I are live in San Diego but we like to take weekend trips up to LA throughout the year.  We first discovered blu jam in February and have yet to come back to LA without stopping for brunch here.  I  first found it by using the yelp app on my phone to find local breakfast and brunch places in LA, and this was the highest rated around.  It's almost always crowded on a sunny LA day but the staff is super accomodating and we've never had to wait more than 15-20 minutes.  Some funky, hip waiter is always there within a few minutes of us being seated to take our drink order.  I always get coffee and when I need it I add a shot of espresso.  Very good.  All of their teas are made fresh in a press and are delicious either hot or iced.  We always order breakfast food no matter when we come-- it's available all day.  We both love their Brioche French Toast and I am particularly fond of their scrambles.  The Morning Hash is my favorite but I've had the Roma Via Paris and Le Paris Omelette as well.  Everything is always fresh and delicious! The Czech owner is always hustling around making sure his restaurant is running smoothly and often gives us a kind farewell at the door.  We have brought all our friends here and although the place is small and good for groups of 2-4, they've managed to seat both a group of 6 and a group of 8 rather quickly (~30 minutes).  All in all the food is amazing, the workers are fun and attentive, and it's set in the perfect LA setting.  I wish there was a place like this in San Diego.  I'm getting nostalgic (and hungry) just writing this! Do yourself a favor and try this place out.  It is worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Eunice C.
Reviews.Content: 2.5 For me, this place is really over hyped. Had brunch and lunch here many times but I was never impressed by their food. Egg Benedict was too salty. Omelette was bland.

Reviews.Author: Robin D.
Reviews.Content: this is the place to fill up for breakfast food lovers.

Reviews.Author: Brittany B.
Reviews.Content: Returned to try out dinner and it was fabulous.  Melt in your mouth filet mignon... great burrata bruschetta... rich mac & cheese w/ truffle oil... Wowza...

Reviews.Author: Susie S.
Reviews.Content: Breakfast / Brunch here is great, but service was spotty. It can get really busy- even on weekdays. We waited about 40 minutes for our food to come out. However, everyone was satisfied with their food, and we all left the place feeling full and happy. Walking around the Melrose area is fun, too.

Reviews.Author: Lulu S.
Reviews.Content: very very slow service. but overall good experience. the french toast is the best i've ever had...has fruits etc. wonderful!4 stars

Reviews.Author: D C.
Reviews.Content: Came her for breakfast with the family on a sunday am. Got there around 9am and the placed was already full so I knew it had to be good. Had a tough time deciding what to order because every dish I saw rolling out of the kitchen looked so good. We ended up getting the steak hash which was excellent except a little salty. My wife got the breakfast tacos which were awesome. Only thing I regret is that we didn't try the french toast. It seemed like alot of people in the restaurant were getting a dish and then having a french toast to split among the table... guess i'll have to try it next time.

Reviews.Author: Kate C.
Reviews.Content: great brunch place. They have traditional brunch items. The food is nicely presented and taste as good as it looks.

Reviews.Author: Farhad S.
Reviews.Content: You WILL wait for you table, but it WILL be absolutely worth the wait. Cool atmosphere amongst young people. Great food and service. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Author: M G.
Reviews.Content: Burger is out of this world - brioche bun it comes on should be outlawed, it's so addictive.  We also shared the eggs benedict with bacon instead of Canadian bacon.  Flawless!  I normally would dock it a star as our waiter was arrogant and odd but their brunch maitre d' was so sweet and fun, I knocked it up one for him.

Reviews.Author: Jenny L.
Reviews.Content: This place is sooooo good! Get the crunchy French toast like everyone else said to!!

Reviews.Author: Lulu C.
Reviews.Content: Went there for breakfast. Was told the wait would be 20 mins. Watched the host greet his friends and seat them before us (after waiting 25 mins) We left. The kicker  was when I called the manager to complain she told me that the owner was OK with that and  he often seats regulars before other customers. HUH?? Oh well, ended up at the Bungalow cafe on Larchmont.  Great food and great service there. Never going back to Blu Jam. They can have their seating policy! Oh by the way this was the second time I went. The first time the hostess insisted that we sit at a certain table even thought the restaurant was practically empty. I gave them a second chance and they failed.

Reviews.Author: Sherry S.
Reviews.Content: I heard great things about this place and my friend who is very picky said this place has the BEST turkey burger she's ever had.  I came after most of my friends were already done with their food, but then after I put in my order, we saw a HUGE COCKROACH on the wall!!!!!!  I ran out of the restaurant, cancelled my food, apologized to my friends and left.  I never got to taste supposedly the best turkey burger in town but I don't think I'm ever going back.  And this happened on a Sunday afternoon, not even at night which freaked me out even more that it comes out in the middle of the day.

Reviews.Author: Doris J.
Reviews.Content: My friend sent me to this place b/ca he said it was the best breakfast place in LA.  I have now gone twice, once yesterday for breakfast and today for lunch.  These people are super nice and the food is really good.  The owner is there and is constantly walking around checking on tables.  On Sunday I had the granola and low-fat yogurt.  When I got my dish, there could have been a little bit more yogurt in my dish.  I didn't have to ask for more because the owner recognized it when he was doing his rounds.  He asked me if I wanted more too.  I told him no.  I said this b/ca I didn't want the extra sugar from the yogurt and it was still very good.  My husband got the breakfast wrap without the cheese and that was really delicious.  It had great flavor and not just eggs and some garlic.  When I went today, we ordered the Mexican Fish Stew.  Everyone was still really nice, however, the food came out quite a bit slower.  I didn't mind once I got my food though.  The stew was FANTASTIC.  It had lots of fish, shrimp and veggies and was quite yummy.

Reviews.Author: Ben D.
Reviews.Content: So after reading the reviews of Blu Jam Café 6 months ago, the day finally came! Stopped here yesterday morning with family. Lots of parking available on the street, I'm assuming it's because it was around 9 A.M. on a weekday? And if I remember, it was $1/hour? We arrived inside, hooray--not crowded at all, which I enjoyed because I hear & read this place can get jam packed. We were seated and took some time looking over our options. There's lots to choose from, I wanted to try everything (well, mostly). I decided on the popular Brioche French Toast with bananas and berries (other dishes ordered at the table were Migas, The Breakfast Deal, and Blu Jam Benedict). Our waitress was very friendly, another plus because she was very helpful with suggestions and recommendations. The wait for our food to come out wasn't too long, about 15 minutes or so? Now the moment came: I took a bite into my Brioche French Toast--they were absolutely amazing! Probably more-so because I hadn't eaten French toast in ages. I definitely don't remember French toast tasting this good! (Again, probably because I hadn't had them in such a long time, so I may or may not be exaggerating--most likely not!). My French toast was topped with fresh bananas & berries, and a side of syrup--tasty indeed. However, if sweet isn't your thing, the Migas looked very tasty, as well as the Blu Jam Benedict. The portion of our meals were great because we didn't feel as if we were going to explode after we finished. Prices are reasonable, considering the great food that is served here. We will definitely be making our way towards here again to try other items on the menu--the service was great, the food was great, the atmosphere was great; Overall, I really enjoyed!

Reviews.Author: Sagar T.
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a great breakfast spot after a Friday night out and am so glad that a friend recommended this place! I wish there was a breakfast spot like this in Orange County and is a place I do miss after moving to the OC! Their ingredients are fresh and you can taste that on every dish. Their service, portions, prices and most importantly taste are awesome. I recommend their different eggs benedict (big fan!!) and their freshly squeezed juices!

Reviews.Author: Vanessa D.
Reviews.Content: After hearing good things about Blu Jam Café, I was exited to try it out for Sunday brunch. I prepared for a wait, but it ended up being about 15 minutes longer than we were quoted. This is where the bad part ends. The rest of the experience was amazing. We were quickly seated inside along the benches and greeted by our server. I ordered just a regular coffee. The constant refills were a nice surprise. I'm not sure if my cup was ever empty, but at the same time they weren't obnoxiously refilling it. The menu is huge and deciding between sweet and savory is nearly impossible. I chose the Crunchy French Toast, which is only offered on the weekends, and my friend selected the Salmon Hash. Our dishes came out fairly quickly due to the fact the restaurant had people spilling out of it. My French toast was not only delicious; there was a least eight-halves of toast! The corn flakes added a crunch that paired perfectly with the moist center. I could barely bring myself to drizzle on the vanilla bean sauce because I didn't want to overpower the sweet toast. The dish was scattered with fresh berries including strawberries, blueberries and blackberries. My friend's dish looked as equally spectacular. It came out in a round stack formation with the potatoes at the base and the salmon and other ingredients on top. I am already planning my trip back to try a savory dish. I left very satisfied with a fresh cup of to-go coffee for no extra charge.

Reviews.Author: Saurabh A.
Reviews.Content: I had the egg-white omelet. Oh. My. God. Blew my mind. Excellent options for vegetarians and even people who don't like egg-based breakfast. My dad had a crispy tofu dish that was absolutely amazing.

Reviews.Author: MARY D.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I came here for dinner on  a Saturday evening. We had a reservation at 8pm. When we showed up to the restaurant we were seated and got greeted by our server Charles (which whom by the way was a wonderful server---VERY ATTENTIVE). We ordered about 6-7 items since the dishes were tapas style. All of the meals that we ordered were amazing. I have to say though that the Seared Scallops with lemon asparagus risotto were to die for and the Niman ranch filet mignon, chipotle-coffee reduction, Stilton cheese-chive mashed went very well with the wine, which I believe it was the Pavi-Dolcetto. After being there for almost 2 hours of just devouring the food, wine and wonderful service, I guess the table that was reserved for us specifically by Kamil, he realized that we have been there and NO ONE had told him that IT WAS US. We were there by recommendation by someone that Kamil knows and even though we didn't get the "special treatment" I still felt like we did get the special treatment. Kamil and his staff were oh so amazing. And we got to see how they treat their patrons, whether or not we were special b/c we were recommended  by someone Kamil knew. I am glad that we went and I can say we will be coming back for more. Kamil is very sweet and so is his staff *just had to repeat that*

Reviews.Author: Alline C.
Reviews.Content: Was told there would be a 20 minute wait, took 1 1/2 hours. Although I did get a complimentary crepe, which was very kind and generous. Food was very good. Wait, not so fun.

Reviews.Author: Moana S.
Reviews.Content: This place is delicious

Reviews.Author: sayda d.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam is AMAZING for dinner. Try the "fake" Tuna paella and the trio of mushroom risotto is like a party in your mouth!!!!

Reviews.Author: Scummy M.
Reviews.Content: Unless you can handle shuffling around a crowded restaurant for the hour that it will take to get seated, I suggest going somewhere else. My biggest complaint aside from the year that I had to wait to get a table, is the general lack of organization and accommodation for the people waiting. First of all there are no seats or waiting area which leaves a clustered jumble of people around the hostess's station. Leading to my second grievance, the front door, which is used by the waiters, food runners, busboys and patrons all of whom are annoyed by the hovering mass of  people who have no where else to go without risking a missed seating call.  The food itself is decent but not at all worth the wait and overcrowded dining conditions. If anyone who works here is reading this, I think employing the beeper system or at least a row or two of chairs would really go a long long way. Final Analysis; not worth it..

Reviews.Author: Phong L.
Reviews.Content: Planning on coming here with a group of more than 4? It will sooner snow in Los Angeles before you eat. I arrived here Sunday morning at 10am and requested a table for 7 -- the hostess said it will be 45 minutes to an hour. I understand large parties require more time so I was more than happy to wait. As I saw people who came after us with parties of 4 come and go -- at 10:30am I asked the hostess (this girl with a African/British accent -- I think her name was Donna) how much longer, just to get an estimate, she replies "Well you came in at 10 and I told you 45 minutes to an hour. It's 10:30 right now, so 15 to 30 minutes." (I hope my fellow yelpers can understand what a terrible answer this is for someone waiting) I'm not one for confrontation -- and by that I mean I'm not going to give you a bitchy attitude because you determine when I eat -- so I said okay (like it made any sense) and walked away. Later, hoping to get a different answer, my friend asked her at 10:45 and she gave her the same ridiculous answer. At 11 I go in and ask her how much longer and mind you she can't use her previous answers so she goes and checks after some debate and comes back with "they're nearly done."
