I asked her what does that mean and she said -- BE READY FOR THIS -- "Well I don't know, how long would it take you to eat." (WTF) I'm asking you as a hostess, in your professional opinion and these are the answers you give me? Now I hope you've followed this story long enough to understand that not only am I annoyed with her attitude at this point, but at the vagueness of her answers. I've lived in LA my whole life, I'm not some tourist from the Nascar nation states. I understand that there are 12 million people in this city and when you come with a large party that waiting is almost always mandatory. What I don't understand is someone who works at such a busy restaurant can't give me a better answer. This is your job, no? I understand that it is a really difficult job -- no joke, you have to plan accordingly when large parties come. But what kind of self respecting LA hostess gives this answer? And what kind of attitude is this? She couldn't deal with us so the manager came out and apparently we were waiting for the one large separate table they have in the restaurant while there were empty tables in another area. Now if I have to pay a mandatory 18% gratiuity fee because of the larger party, I expect a little more from a restaurant. You have us waiting for one party, with no back up plan? What kind of restaurant does business like this? When asked if we could get separate tables, the manager told us that it wouldn't be fair to the waiters if we separarted the parties. Now I was really peeved at this point because it wasn't fair for us, the customers, to wait so long while other parties of two/three came and went while we waited. All we would've taken up were two small tables. After waiting for what seemed like forever and a half, we were finally seated. Our waiters name was Jason and he was extremely delightful and that's why they get the star. As for the food, it wasn't worth the wait or the drama. I've waited 3 hours for sushi before, so it's not like I don't know how to wait patiently for food. There are better restaurants out there for mediocre brunch. I really hope for the sake of the restrauant that they get a better hostess, in my experience, this is prbably the worse hostess I've had to deal with. I will definitely not be coming here again.

Reviews.Author: Andy K.
Reviews.Content: Best breakfast ever.  Roma via Paris and the California Omelet are amazing! And don't forget to get a single side of the blueberry pancakes!

Reviews.Author: Dreem Q.
Reviews.Content: Ordered the Crunchy French Toast. The sweet strawberries, blueberries and banana slices went wonderfully with the crispiness of the toast. The vanilla sauce was lovely too. I appreciated that they added a wrapped square of butter, but I didn't use it. I'll be back to try the Norwegian Benedict!

Reviews.Author: June C.
Reviews.Content: So delicious and cute inside!

Reviews.Author: Aaron B.
Reviews.Content: Friday 7-26-13 Great spot for breakfast!! We were a large party with teenagers, and baby, and got seated quickly. We managed to beat the rush by 15 min (whew). The server was pleasant and quick(I would like the server to get a gold star for his service it was great but I forgot his name, and I wont write about his skin color to describe him), he got our drinks right from the get go, and our order in fast. On the menu they say fresh squeezed juice and this is 100% true including the apple juice my 18 month old got (So good). The crispy French toast was inhaled by the three teenage boys the eggs benedict my wife got was fantastic! The steak hash had me full for the day, and the egg and sausage my 10 year old got was amazing for being so simple. A bit pricey for breakfast, but as my wife pointed out the quality, freshness, and time put into making everything from scratch made it all worth it. If you are anywhere near this place and looking for a quality breakfast, be it organic, vegan, or gluten free, this is where you must go!!!

Reviews.Author: Tracy S.
Reviews.Content: I have brunch here every other weekend. Definitely one of my favorite spots in LA, but it's wildly popular so get here early! The host Doug is friendly and patient, despite the massive number of hungry patrons hounding him every second, and the service is excellent. The atmosphere is so laid back and welcoming, you'll never feel as though you're being rushed through your meal. Their chai latte is the best I've ever had and the food is out of this world good!! Ingredients are always fresh and the menu is extensive. Very gluten free and vegan friendly! I recommend the crunchy French toast, the California omelet, and Muscle Beach. This is a great place to come with your friends, family, and/or significant other. It has something for everyone.

Reviews.Author: Howard H.
Reviews.Content: The food here is rock solid.  A great selection of breakfast and lunch with very creative twists on standard breakfast/brunch items.  The Blu Jam Benedict is one of my favorites, using a croissant instead of english muffin.  Rich, creamy sauce and excellent canadian bacon.  The french toast is out of this world.  They used to have one with cream cheese and berries that was as tasty as tasty gets.  Last time I visited, they had a great risotto with bacon, peas, and a poached egg on top.  It was a great spin and delighted all the senses.

Reviews.Author: Greg D.
Reviews.Content: Absolute first class treatment!  My friends Gene and Ramar had there birthday breakfast there at it was he best!  The lamb was fantastic, and I had some of my friends white fish, very good also.  I will be back very soon :)

Reviews.Author: M B.
Reviews.Content: Great brunch (eggs, pancakes, bacon) and great coffee. We especially liked the outdoor seating.

Reviews.Author: Kenenth H.
Reviews.Content: I am not a foodie, but I do like a good place to eat breakfast. My pet peeve is that no one does good bacon and that most of the taste from American style breakfast needs to come from cheese or butter. This is not true at Blu Jam. The have great and subtle flavors without having to have the cheese. They have cheese if you want it, but the Eggs Florentine was great without it. Was this the best breakfast I have ever had? Yes. I am 35 years old and never cared to ever write about a place, send in a note or recomend to all of my friends, but this is THE place that I don't mind driving 800+ miles round trip just for breakfast - the best I ever had!!!

Reviews.Author: Alexis G.
Reviews.Content: Lauren bet that we couldn't finish the pancakes and we couldn't.  They were so big and delicious(thats what she said).  I love breakfast burritos and the mexican hangover burrito was the best burrito I have ever had EVER.  This was the most epic breakfast that I have had in a long time x 3.   EPIC  BREAKFAST !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Chika C.
Reviews.Content: I just came from having lunch there with a friend and was served by their waitress Lauren. SHE WAS AWESOME!!! She was so attentive and astute with the service that she delivered and she paid attention to the smallest details anticipating our needs and fostering friendly/funny appropriate conversation without being too much. Her sensibility of how best to serve me and my friend was so great that many times throughout our meal I found myself randomly interrupting my convo saying to my friend, "Our waitress is really great!" He agreed. So just wanted to give kudos where it was due. She helped to contribute to a MOST enjoyable leisurely Saturday afternoon and we'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: debbie w.
Reviews.Content: I actually stumbled upon this place when I went to a meeting in the area, I was very early, so decided to have a late brkfst.  Since I was alone, didn't think I'd wait long for a table, I didn't.  But I felt somewhat ignored because I was alone, had to ask for coffee refills, tho the eggs benedict was good, the potatoes were so-so, the service was below par for me.  But would consider going back again to try the brioche french toast.

Reviews.Author: jon m.
Reviews.Content: Went to the Blu Jam Café for the first time this morning.  So-so service.  Nice vibe.  Really liked the morning hash.  I especially loved that they let me customize the dish to my liking.  Pancakes were good.  No complaints.  Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Carina G.
Reviews.Content: It's hard to make impressive pancakes, but this place has the BEST PANCAKES EVER.  I also had a taste of my friend's huevos rancheros which made me hate my finite stomach size.  Friendly service, fun location, great food - this place is definitely worth checking out, just know there will probably be a wait.

Reviews.Author: Ryan W.
Reviews.Content: Great food, service and a wonderful light blend house coffee. Tons of healthy options as well ass fatty delights. They never let the coffee run out of my cup.

Reviews.Author: Pam J.
Reviews.Content: This place is hands down my favorite place for brunch in LA.  If I based it on the food and coffee alone it would hands down be a 5 star review.  I usually get the Norwegian eggs benedict and substitute the potatoes for fruit.  The fruit is almost the best part.  It's all fresh and lots of variety... berries, kiwi, pineapple.  The twist on the eggs benedict is amazing.  Their vanilla latte usually comes with a cute design in it.  Overall, I highly recommend.  THe only reasons this place lost two stars was the massive wait you know there's going to be, especially on the weekend.  You have to get there at least half an hour before you actually want to eat.  The other is I've called a couple times ahead of coming and the people who answered the phones were pretty rude.  I've only ever had one rude waitress so it's not a major concern.  Just don't call ahead :)

Reviews.Author: Kam I.
Reviews.Content: Excellent place.  Stumbled into it with my gf last night and had a nice dinner there.  They serve cold plates, hot plates, and desert plates.  It's like Tapas, but proportionally larger.  I tried the beef goulash with roasted gnocchis, the grilled wild salmon, and the burrata (cold plate).  All were very good.  The salmon was well prepared served over a rice with a tinge of a spicy kick.  The beef goulash came with a tasty sauce, but the biggest treat in the dish were the pan roasted gnocchis.  The burrata came on a toasted bread with strawberries.  An excellent combination.  The beer and wine selection was quite vast.  I want to come back to explore their daytime menu.  This was an unexpected treat.

Reviews.Author: Gabe G.
Reviews.Content: I've been going here for a few years for brunch. The Eggwich is AMAZING and so are the lemon crepes. I've been in a few times for dinner now that they've started opening at night. The food is EVEN BETTER for dinner... and eating tapas style and sharing gives my friends and I all the chance to taste a little of everything. I highly recommend the ribs, the ceviche and the bufala mozzarella with fresh strawberries. GO HERE and have a kick-butt dinner. The wait stuff is friendly and it's one of the few places in town I know I can always get a well made espresso or latte. To top it all off... the owner, Kamil, is one of the nicest guys in town. He's great to his customers, staff and he's heavily involved in the neighborhood watch. All in all the place is great for food, staff, and service. I'll be coming here for years to come.

Reviews.Author: Connie A.
Reviews.Content: Tried the crispy french toast and it was very good.  My daughters had the veggie panini and the Kamil goulash over baked macaroni and they both loved it.  Very good coffee also.  Service was fast and friendly. Only setback was the dirty men's restroom. They probably were very busy before we came and didn't get a chance to clean up yet. Overall, food was great and will definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Author: Ann L.
Reviews.Content: Went with three others and shared the french toast, florentine benedict, and kamils breakfast. Felt a little adventurous getting Kamils breakfast... its like a breakfast pasta with macaroni, egg, cheese etc.. but it tasted really good! French toast was also very good, as well as the florentine benedict! The poached egg was perfect! It also came with potatoes that were nice and crispy, but overall the benedict was a little bland.

Reviews.Author: Roco M.
Reviews.Content: Excellent food, nice ambience and attentive service.  What else would you look for in a breakfast place? Great coffee and a diverse menu, all very well priced. Look forward to going back.

Reviews.Author: Lana G.
Reviews.Content: Went there today for lunch.  Nice location, I remember there was another little restro in it's place few years back which was very good and I was bummed when it went away.  Anyway, we sat outside, the waiter came pretty quick, took our drink order, brought us water.  Then it took him a while to bring drinks.  The menu looked great, we placed our order.  As much as we enjoyed sitting outside in this nice weather it took way too long to get our food! I ordered a steak salad and my friend ordered a breakfast dish and we waited for about 30 minutes during which the waiter never appeared to check on us.  After all that waiting the food came and my steak was rare! I wanted medium well.  So I sent it back.. guess what another 20 minutes went by and it came back, this time medium rare.  I didnt send it back again because at that point we've been there for an hour and my meter was running out. I didn't eat the steak but the salad was good. Too bad, probably would've tasted much better with the steak.  My friend's dish was way too spicy she said but not bad.  Overall, service wasn't good and food was ok.

Reviews.Author: Dan L.
Reviews.Content: We appreciated the Yelp recommendation this morning when we found this gem. The food, Sunday brunch, was exceptional even though the egg was cold. The textures, flavors, service all exceeded our expectations. We would love to return but live in Berkeley and rarely visit LA. The OJ was as fresh squeezed as it gets!

Reviews.Author: Javier T.
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast spot (and definitely popular with the hipster crowd, so try to beat the late morning breakfast crowd).  I had the breakfast macaroni and cheese, which was suprisingly rich.  Also tried my wife's omelette which which was on point.

Reviews.Author: Annie B.
Reviews.Content: SO GOOD. Get the french toast cooked in corn flakes it's bomb.com. Also the breakfast quesadilla was amazinggggg. Really long wait on the weekends, but there's plenty of places to walk around while you wait and the food is worth it! Friendly waiters, too!

Reviews.Author: David C.
Reviews.Content: I might have  ordered the wrong stuff here, there was this oriental tofu scramble thing here that sounded interesting. It turned out to be weird and sort of bad. That I could attribute to ordering something a bit too adventurous. However, my gf said they screwed up the pancakes. How do you screw up pancakes? She said it tasted like they put onions in, and that pancakes were topped with strawberries and bananas. I would almost like to try it again because the stuff that was being ordered by people around me looked good, but if I am in LA for brunch again, I think I could do better.

Reviews.Author: i k.
Reviews.Content: I am a huge fan of this place!  I have gone twice in two weeks.  The food is great (great menu for brunch) and the prices are right.  This place is my new brunch spot!  Toast (on 3rd) will not be seing me any time soon!

Reviews.Author: Clark L.
Reviews.Content: The eggwich is my favorite dish at any restaurant I've been to.  I crave it if it's been over a month without having it. I love this place and its Melrose atmosphere. Lots of girls wearing big sunglasses inside, I saw a trannie there once, mostly normal people there. I've taken people from out of town here on a couple of occasions and they've always really liked it.

Reviews.Author: Mo B.
Reviews.Content: I have nothing bad to say about this place!  Unlike most of the other brunch places I frequent, my food came out correct and hot and the service was fantastic.  Our server came over to check on us immediately after our food was served and everything was as we wanted.  You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Author: Emme F.
Reviews.Content: I wanted to do 4 1/2 stars, but it didn't let me. I love this place! Don't know how I can even begin to express my love for their breakfast foods. Everything that I've ever ordered has been great -- however, so that you don't think that I'm a crazed or blind fan -- I will say that I do not particularly care for their coffee or Chai, I'd rather order the over priced freshly squeezed OJ. Their wait staff is ok, their busboys are amazing, these men will do anything to keep you happy. Oh, yes, the food! Ok, their french toast is better than homemade good, the California Omelet is Ohhhh sooo delicious! The chocolate, banana, walnut crepes never disappoint. Parking is a pain, if you're lucky you can park in the adjacent residential streets. The out door tables are doggie friendly :) Haven't been there for lunch or dinner yet since I'm such a huge fan of their breakfast foods. My boyfriend usually gets their sandwiches and always devours them, so I'll take it as a good sign!

Reviews.Author: KAMAN C.
Reviews.Content: I was totally blown away by its dinner.... we went there last saturday night.  The beef goulash..... so tender.  We were two persons, and what's great is the portions of all the dishes are medium small so that we can try a variety of them... the beef goulash is a must, the tuna sashima roll and ceviche on some chips that you don't find them greasy was just DELISH!!!   Another one that we had was ahi tuna with a super smooth risotto.  What's important for me for dinner is that the food has to be not oily yet tasty since I have a very sensitive stomach, and the dinner that night was just GOOD.  Love the place, comfortable to lay back and have a nice meal.

Reviews.Author: Katerina F.
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of having dinner there last night and it was absolutely amazing!  It's one of my favorite brunch spots in LA, and now I can say it's one of my favorite dinner spots as well.The atmosphere is romantic/cozy with candlelit tables and French music playing.  Service is top notch, waiters are super friendly, knowledgeable and make you feel so welcome.  The dishes are smaller portions, so ordering several plates and sharing them are key, sort of tapas style.  We ordered the Shrimp Ceviche which was so fresh and tasty, on crisp tortilla chips with a bit of a kick.  Then we had the Wild Mushroom Risotto which was cooked to perfection and just melted in your mouth, along with the Pan Roasted Haricot Verts (thin French green beans) - which was seasoned with garlic and lime and just absolutely delicious.  Our final dish was the Beef Tenderloin in Red Wine Sauce and my boyfriend could not get enough of it, the meat was so tender and flavorful.  We didn't leave a drop of food left on any of our dishes, that's how good they all were!  To top off our dinner, we had a bottle of Italian Red Wine Montepulciano D'Abruzzo which was very reasonably priced, and a favorite - smooth, dry and full of flavor.   Dessert was delicious as well - chocolate cake and Brioche bites - mm mm!If you love brunch here, you are going to love dinnner here!!!  Must try! Thank you Chef Kamil !!

Reviews.Author: Lety P.
Reviews.Content: Besides this being the best breakfast in town this place is now my favorite dinner spot.  We had dinner here on Friday night.  Amazing amazing fine cuisine.  The ahi tuna paella is a must.  Delicious mac and cheese, supurb asparagas appetizer.  The service is excellent, big wine and beer selection.

Reviews.Author: Catherine H.
Reviews.Content: We used Yelp to find this b'fast location, thanks to all the previous reviewers.  HUGE portions, good variety of options on the menu. Fascinating crowd in the place. Stopped here for b'fast on our drive out of LA and on our way to Santa Barbara.  Worth the drive!

Reviews.Author: Tess K.
Reviews.Content: I've been enjoying breakfasts and lunches at Blu Jam Cafe for years.  Their omelets are delicious, and their pancakes and French toast are among the best in town.  (Did I mention the organic coffee drinks?  Yum.)  I've never had a bad meal there.  And it's got a great neighborhood feel to it .... The wait staff is always friendly, and the owner, Kamil, makes everyone feel welcomed.I tried Blu Jam for dinner last night and wasn't surprised to find that the food was delicious.  They have a good selection of wine and beer (at reasonable prices).  The service was excellent (our waiter was very knowledgeable and enthusiastic), and the mood is a bit more relaxing than during the day.  At dinner, the food is tapas style.  Two of us shared a delicious salad (the Riverdog farm greens  served with a large piece of crispy Chevre goat cheese on top) and two entrees, and we had just the right amount of food.   One dish consisted of two mounds of lemon-asparagus risotto, each toped with a jumbo scallop.  The  other was filet mignon (cooked to perfection in a chipolte-coffee reduction) and served in four pieces, each on a mound of blue cheese mashed potatoes. My only regret is that we had other plans and couldn't stay to sample the desserts.  The ones I've had at lunch have all been excellent, and these looked great, too.  Next time!

Reviews.Author: Jason Z.
Reviews.Content: Amazing food and great waitstaff. Oh yeah, and the clientele is HOT. Want to find a future Mrs. Whoeverthehellyouare? Go to Blu Jam and bring your A game. Seriously, I've never seen a bevy of beauties like the one assembled on a daily basis at this place. The only problem is every time I'm there I'm making a pig of myself because the food is so damn good. Oh and I'm engaged to be married. Which is good for you because, sorry ladies, I'm off the market.

Reviews.Author: Jack W.
Reviews.Content: I had dinner at the Blu Jam Cafe last night.  The food was incredible.  It was one of the best meals I have ever had.  Fantastic.

Reviews.Author: Echo L.
Reviews.Content: Great Blu Jam Benedict and ice vanilla latter. The waiters are nice but the waitresses are having attitude.

Reviews.Author: Justin K.
Reviews.Content: Best french toast I've ever had (crunchy french toast). The rest of their breakfast + brunch items are amazing too. Their dinners are also amazing. Sort of expensive for the size, but great quality and taste. Although all of their food is great, I'd recommend them more for breakfast or brunch.

Reviews.Author: David S.
Reviews.Content: If you like breakfast at the place, wait until you try dinner!

Reviews.Author: Chris H.
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to LA and a close friend that lives here recommended this place.  This place was amazing.  The service was outstanding and the food was so good.  The staff is friendly, quickly approaching me to get me seated.  My water glass was always full and the coffee was superb.  I ordered something off their breakfast menu and wasn't disappointed.  The bacon was perfectly cooked and egg dish was creative and tasty!  GO HERE TO EAT.  nuff said.

Reviews.Author: M B.
Reviews.Content: Went for dinner and really enjoyed it!  Each dish was delicious, amazing flavors and fresh ingredients.  Service was great, nice comfy atmosphere, and good glass of wine made it a hit all around.

Reviews.Author: Jenae K.
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing!! Try the salmon hash... it's so addicting, I dream about it sometimes!

Reviews.Author: R T.
Reviews.Content: The coffee tastes like dirty water. The "fresh" squeeze O.J has no pulp and taste like concentrate. The food was OK but not worth the worst part of this place... the arrogant horrible attitude of the staff. I would never go back to a place even IF they had amazing food, that made me feel so unwelcome and had such bad energy. They need to come down to earth! Blueberry Panckes dry and awful.

Reviews.Author: Connor J.
Reviews.Content: It's a very popular place.  I think the food is fine and the service is very friendly.  I wouldn't wait it the long lines you see but I would eat here if there is not wait.

Reviews.Author: Kecee M.
Reviews.Content: The food was great, the atmosphere was good, the price was decent, but the server was HORRRRRRRRIBLE! I will not say his name, for his sake. He did not smile once, seemed like we were an "inconvenient" for him, he asked us for our payment 4 times, even though no one was waiting and we were there for only 1 1/2 hour. And believe us, we know good service because my friends and I work at an upscale restaurant in West Hollywood. Lucky for him we are good people because we still gave him a 20% tip.

Reviews.Author: kimberly b.
Reviews.Content: DINNER, GO HERE FOR DINNER. the scallop carpaccio was unbelievable, the lamb chops were crispy on the outside and moist, tender, flavorful, the okra, the asparagus, EVERYTHING was just fantastic. My good friend, Marc found this gem and I am so grateful he turned me onto it!! The prices are RIDICULOUSLY fantastic, the quality of food surpasses expectations...beyond.

Reviews.Author: Mike C.
Reviews.Content: Blu Jam Rocks!We were in town for the weekend and did not want to dine at the hotel we were staying at (the London West Hollywood) so I found Blu Jam Cafe and sounded good.  So we headed out and gave it a try.  We got there early (before 830) but did note that the lines started getting long around 8:45 and on).  But it is worth the wait.   Ambiance is very nice (we sat outdoors) especially with the music they were playing - very nice and not too loud.  Now for the food.  Good menu.  We ended up ordering Simply Eggs (poached) with toast, the BluJam Benedict which is Poached eggs on a toasted English muffin with Black Forest Ham, crispy bacon, topped with hollandaise, and we had to try the Crunchy French Toast - Their Signature Dish which had rolled in crunchy corn flakes grilled to perfection, topped with fresh bananas and berries, served with a great tasting vanilla bean sauce.  First two dishes were very good.  Though the hollandaise sauce was a bit thick and overly cheesy.  I thought it was okay, the wife did not like it at all.  But the benedict was very good other wise.Now for their signature dish it was, awesome!  It was very, very good.  Worth ordering.  And just the right portion size, though we were stuffed eating the other items too. Oh well, we walked it off later anyways.  Check out Blu Jam Cafe.  Very good.

Reviews.Author: Bettina S.
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast (thanks to Yelp recommendation)!  Super casual, great service, and very tasty food.  The crunchy french toast is fantastic!  Must try!  Will definitely be back the next time we're in LA.

Reviews.Author: susan j.
Reviews.Content: Best veggie burger ever!  Really!  I've only had breakfast at BluJam and that's always delicious, but now I have something else to crave.  And everybody there is always so nice.  Now Kamil...you must bring back the gorgonzola eggs.  Do it!  Thank you for a delicious meal and something nice with which to toast your success!

Reviews.Author: Monica L.
Reviews.Content: You have to try the crunchy french toast, it's amazing! I will be back, thanks yelp and all who reviewed that brought us here.

Reviews.Author: christine p.
Reviews.Content: great service and delicious food... i highly recommend this cafe to anyone looking for a great breakfast/brunch/lunch.  loved their crunchy french toast and eggwich!

Reviews.Author: nils v.
Reviews.Content: was really looking forward to eating at Blu Jam, especially after seeing the line of hipsters waiting outside this Melrose eatery ....unfortunately, the food missed the mark a bit ...the blu jam benedict was just average - the hollandaise sauce was eggy and not in a good way ...the traditional canadian bacon is replaced with virginia ham and bacon - really?...the blueberry pancake, meanwhile, was vastly inferior to the like offering at BLD ...on the plus side, the service/wait staff is great and very attentive ...the chai latte is also a worth a try ...that said, I think BLD is a vastly superior choice for brunch

Reviews.Author: A L.
Reviews.Content: People in LA love seeing a crowd and will get in a line for anything, even mediocrity.  And that's exactly what this place uses as a marketing ploy; the suckers waiting outside draw more people in.  Sure the food is good, better than an iHop but not as gourmet or organic as a Tavern or Square One.  Instead, it seems as if the owner has directed his staff to tell everyone the wait is only 10 or 15 minutes when in reality the wait ends up being 1 hour minimum.  We arrived at 10 am and was told the wait would only be 20 minutes, so we hung it out.  45 minutes later, the host told us he had a table but we had to hold the baby on our laps.  If we WAITED, we could get a table with a chair for the babe, that we needed a table of 4 for the stroller.  15 minutes later, a table of FOUR grandmothers cleared out and when we got up, hoping the seating was ours, but we were told that that table was for a party of 5.  We left and ate an English breakfast at the Village Idiot which was just as good and has better ambience.  It's a shame because we do want to support businesses in the area but we'd rather drive to a place with immaculate customer service.  Blu Jam just doesn't have the chops.  Oh, and the whole time we were there, we had to hear the host tell others that the wait was only 15-20 minutes.

Reviews.Author: Diana T.
Reviews.Content: Definitely high end food for affordable prices.  The space is airy and the owner was definitely running around keeping things in order.  Our waitress was nice but really slow.  I couldn't decide whether to do breakfast (served ALL DAY) or lunch but chose to go the lunch route. I got the soup/whole wrap combo for $11--kahil's goulash soup was very tasty--chunks of tender pork, bits of ham, carrots, in a stew-like broth.  Very filling.  I got the Veggie wrap--spinach,sprouts,avocado,redpeppers,goat cheese with balsamic dressing.  Mm not so great---VERY raw/fresh tasting but kinda bland.  I ended up spreading the complimentary olive tampenade on it (Served with french bread).  My bf tried the soup1/2 sandwich combo $11.  His sweet red bell pepper soup was very creamy and soothing.  I loved his chicken sandwich--melted moz, chicken, pesto, on foccacia bread.  All in all in a wonderful meal with very tasty, interesting plates.

Reviews.Author: suey l.
Reviews.Content: suey's favorite breakfast place! munch munch rawr.

Reviews.Author: Diana A.
Reviews.Content: Ok, the fact this place is still getting 5 stars from me despite an insane wait shows how good the food is! My friends and I went there on a Sunday morning and were told the wait would be 15 minutes. There were 8 of us, so we were all thinking "yes! we came at the perfect time!" Long story short, we waited about an hour and a half to get seated. Apparently we could only fit in the VIP room, and the VIPs were not leaving, despite the busing and cleaning around them. So make a reservation if you're going in a big group at a busy time! Once we sat down, we were RAVENOUS. The waitress came to do her mid-meal check on how things were going: "Hey guys so how're--OH MY GOD!" Our plates were clean in less than 10 minutes. The food was amazing, and the menu had a great deal of variety for everyone at the table (meat lovers, veggies, etc). I had an open-faced egg sandwich that had incredible flavor. The wait staff was friendly, but I wish they had offered to seat us at two separate tables, or at least give us some dessert for free or something! An hour and a half wait is ridiculous no matter where you are! I look forward to going back with a much smaller group.

Reviews.Author: Randy S.
Reviews.Content: grub was closed by the time we got done cramming the hooptie full of free sidewalk shit, so we circled back and took a chance on brunch on melrose.  the menu featured numerous daring exploits into fancifully named combinations of eggs, roasted peppers, artichoke, avocado, asparagus, spinach, soft cheeses, and so forth, and it came with a thyme sprig, so fuckin' a.  they were decidedly competent, which makes it a find right there; so many melrose spots are all glossy wood and glass but the food is a shithole afterthought with burned eggs and waitstaff always facing some other corner.  we stealthed some bourbon from the ass pocket flask into the grapefruit juice cuz we thought there was no drinking before we realized they serve beer.  seriously, they just give you that shit for money.  we sat in the sun on the sidewalk and lots of people walked by, like all the melrose stick insect hoochies, and maybe the dude from black kids, but we couldn't tell because brad pitt was in the way all the time.

Reviews.Author: Meaghan K.
Reviews.Content: so great and the owner could not be more welcoming!

Reviews.Author: David L.
Reviews.Content: had bfast here on sunday and luckily they were able to accomodate a group of 7. we came a li'l early like at 10:45 but when we left there was quite a line of hungry guests. it's a cute spot but not that big. a few tables for outdoor seating but mebbe only 3 or 4 tables at most. i had an omelette with a pesto like sauce and spinache with potatoes. good but a li'l on the heavy side. the french toast is awesome but portion is kinda small. light and not too sweet. another had something called the power meal with chicken and eggs looked good and was friggin huge. the salmon benedict got bad reviews from my buddy and he barely ate one. overall good spot and decent size portions. get there early to make sure you don't wait too long and nice to take a stroll on melrose to burn some calories after you feel like keeling over and taking a nap.

Reviews.Author: Tracy Z.
Reviews.Content: just got back from having breakfast there and to say i was disappointed is honestly an understatement. i was sooooo looking forward to having the best breakfast in LA after reading all the reviews, sadly that was not our experience. all started out promising, we were seated quickly, immediately handed menu's and asked if wanted coffee, which was an obvious yes. after we were served our coffee we placed our orders. everything that came out of the kitchen looked amazing so we were really looking forward to ours. things came and went, people who placed orders after us somehow seemed to constantly get their meals before us, frustrating yes, but since we were constantly being plied with more coffee this wasn't really an issue - although i was really looking forward to my meal. our waiter seemed to notice that our food wasn't out (but he never came over) and after a few more minutes he came with our breakfasts. the first issue was my blueberry pancakes were not made with blueberries (they obviously realized the mistake so they threw a few on top). i was hungry and going to let this slide, but when i went to put butter on them they were cold. my husbands food looked amazing except for his potatoes, which were basically raw, unlike how he had requested them which was well done. our waiter never came over even though we requested him and instead the gentleman who had been plying me with coffee came over and we mentioned all this to him. he then promptly took our breakfasts off to be fixed. this is really where it all went wrong. first the waiter never during this whole time came over and second rather than make us new meals they just stuck my husbands eggs as well as my whole meal (minus the blueberries) under the warming lights while they crisped up his potatoes then just brought the food out again (this time no blueberries even on top). obviously this did not fix my issues and his main meal was no longer fresh. again we tried to get the waiters attention and could not, he just seemed to know there was still a problem and avoided our table. by the time we finally did get his attention my husband was halfway through his meal. he said he was sorry that he saw that my stuff was made wrong, but at this point i wasn't going to have them try again. my husband ate while i finished my coffee and water. the bill came and they only took off my meal - seeing as i had nothing to eat and my husbands meal had issues as well i feel they should've comped our entire meal. as we were walking out the manager said "sorry about your breakfast", but it was too little too late. bottom line i don't think i'll be headed there any time soon.
